Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Mark K
Reviews.Content: I love the orleans. The strip is nice, but for the value and gaming, Orleans cant be beat. Super knowledgeable staff, and great casino hosts. I love the table games, and they treat us right. We have been going there ( a small crew of coworkers) for the last 6 years and will keep on going back. Dont discount the orleans because of pricing or location. Very nice amenities. Super clean and big rooms. Excellent food (favorites are the sushi place and prime rib loft). The shuttle to the strip is sweet. Nice to get out and see things, but for the gaming dollars, the Orleans is where it is at. I also like the other boyd properties downtown. California is a favorite as well as the Fremont.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: C M
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the hotel makes us feel like home. All the employees are always pleansant when you talk to them and in answering any questions. The rooms are large and very roomy. Linda Colvin is great as a casino host always tending to your every need if possible.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star on Price!”
Reviews.Author: acvmuniz
Reviews.Content: First off, I believe this hotel is getting reviewed high because of how inexpensive it is, not the quality of the rooms. Our room had stained carpet, squeaky beds, bathroom door that would not lock and was outdated. Room rating would get only 3 stars, but I'm saving over $100 per night versus a strip hotel so that is the price you pay! We tried room service for breakfast and while the cost was considerably cheaper than strip hotels, so was the quality of the food. We wouldn't order room service again here. Like other reviewers stated previously, this hotel pretty much has all your entertainment on site. From many restaurants, movie theater, etc. That said, we only stayed here one night on our way to the Grand Canyon with our 3 and 7 year old's, it was adequate. Don't think I will stay here though when it is just my wife and I.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for any reason”
Reviews.Author: djvft50
Reviews.Content: If available, try to get a room on one of the upper floors. This place has it all, it's clean, nice, inexpensive food and table, lots of entertainment, and an easy free shuttle to the strip. Did I mention the price, superb value for what you get. I like to stay here when I'm on business because they actually have a parking lot that's within a mile of the rooms. No complaints at all. I even left a $2000 computer in my room after checking out, and it was under lock and key until I went back to pick it up. Wish it wasn't sold out this weekend, other wise I would be there.

Reviews.Title: “great for the price”
Reviews.Author: tankisapug
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times and I've found that for the price, it's very much worth it. Also, if you like gambling, this place is great for lower minimums on the table games and the service while you're playing is the best of anywhere I've been in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel casino off strip”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: the Orleans is a great value off strip casino hotel all you would want, massive casino floor, lots of restraunts inc TGI`s, bowling alley, cinema. Free shuttle to sister hotel Gold coast and the strip outside Bills Gamblin Hall. very friendly local atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bltietm
Reviews.Content: We attended the Rockabilly Weekender at the Orleans. Had a wonderful time!!!! The hotel is good. Clean, nice staff, with decent prices. Not over the top but well equipped. The Rockabilly was Awsome! Definately going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Need Updating”
Reviews.Author: TravelSamDallas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans April 1 to 5 in RM 1293. Booked hotel based on wanting to not stay on Strip and high Trip Advisor Ranking. I judge hotels by three criteria. 1) Quality of Product (Fail) Room was terrible. Bed was extremely uncomfortable, Sheets and towels were old and of poor quality,vshower was not great and TV channels were of poor quality and selection. $6 Resort Fee is a total rip off. All Mid scale hotels provide free local calls, internet and coffee in room. Charging $6 for local calls (people have cell phones), and internet is only free in the coffee bar not in room. If hotel charges resort fee please include free internet in room. To improve product at a minumum get new beds, Change shower heads and increase water pressure, add more TV channels and incude internet with resort fee. 2) Quality of Service (Great) Guest Service Agent at front dest was very friendly. House keeping was great and kept the room clean. Wait staff in Casino were great. I love to play craps and the casino staff at craps table were great. Lot of energy at craps table and had great fun. Most staff at hotel have worked at hotel for years and make the hotel a great place to hang out. I like to play craps off the strip and The Orleans fits in well for what I look for. 3) Value for Price Paid (Not so Great) I got a package deal, Air, Hotel and Car so the hotel tends to have a deep discounted rate. I would rate value high if I got a decent bed and a good night sleep, this is the basic for any hotel and The Orleans failed in this department. People are naive if they comment that the hotel is in a seedy part of town. This is Vagas, there is adult entertainement all over the city so if you want a family vacation go to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “You well be happy with this Hotel &Casino”
Reviews.Author: pmurdock2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Orleans in Las Vegas for 4 nights in March and every thing was great,the restauants was great .The housekeeping did a wonderful job in keeping room clean.Check in /out was easy,staff was friendly. We go to Las Vegas every Spring Break and we well stay at The Orleans next year.

Reviews.Title: “We came back to The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: AsianVista2
Reviews.Content: This is my second review for The Orleans. Because we had an enjoyable stay last year, we returned for Spring Break. We have 3 kids, and we appreciated the convenience of the movie theater, bowling alley, arcade, pool, restaurants and shuttle. Check-in/out was easy. Housekeeping did a wonderful job keeping our room fresh and clean during our stay. Ample spaces in the parking structure. The hotel is off-the-strip, but it didn't matter. The hotel offers free shuttle services and we never waited more than 10 minutes. Maybe that's luck on our part. If there's anything to complain about, it's the location of our room. We had a view of a wall. Oh well. We still enjoyed our time here. For this Vegas trip, we included a visit to the Pinball Hall of Fame and Ethel M's Chocolate Factory. The PHoF is fun if you're into classic arcade games. Ethel M's offers a self-guided tour and has a nice botanical cactus garden. There's also a candy shop on the premises. It's pricey, but the candy is good. Try the peanut brittle.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: RedDaisy007
Reviews.Content: Nothing too exciting about the rooms. We stayed for the Viva Las Vegas convention. Of most the place in Vegas to book, the value is pretty good, if you don't need a fancy room. We aren't fussy so it suited us well. The hotel itself is off the strip but their shuttle is pretty quick and taxis aren't too expensive. Lots of choices for food and services. The pool is pretty cool. The casino is pretty good with a fair number of new and old machines.

Reviews.Title: “My 'home' hotel when going to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Bob538
Reviews.Content: I always look to the Orleans first when I plan a trip to Vegas. I checked in on Saturday evening. The clerk did need me to assist her by providing my confirmation number. I think she was new and I had two reservations since I paid for one night and had a two nights comped. Room was fine - same as always. Clean and large. TV is not a flat screen, but that is not important to me. I just want to see the morning news and weather. The casino is great. VP machines pay better than the strip and the bartenders were attentive. Table games have lower limits and both the dealers and the players are friendly. For an off-strip casino it's always busy, but not so crowded that you can't find a place to play or eat or whatever. I had a nice dinner at Prime Rib loft where I used my food comp. The Coffee shop is just OK in my opinion. Fridays offers $6 apps after 9pm for a nice late night bite. Not 24 hrs but 2pm is late enough. I do rent a car to make getting around easier. I always get offers to come back, and the Orleans does not disappoint. I will be back in the fall.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place and service! I just love the New Orleans look.”
Reviews.Author: Sittinghen1
Reviews.Content: The service my family received was outstanding and very friendly staff. Room Service was great and the restaurants offered excellent selections. My stay was just not long enough and I look forward to my visit on May 11, 2012 weekend.

Reviews.Title: “We love staying here when visiting Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ladywolfd
Reviews.Content: We love staying at The Orleans when we go to Vegas. On our most recent stay, we had received a promotion for 2 free nights. Well, we booked right away. The check was hassle free and quick. The hotel is always clean, and the staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are always nice and are the same as the rooms that you can get on the strip for triple the amount. We have stayed at quite a few hotels in Vegas (including many on the strip), but seem to keep coming back to The Orleans. The pool and jacuzzi area are well maintained and always fun. We saw that they have a free shuttle to the strip, but we didn't use it, so I can't make a comment on that. They have a 70 lane bowling alley, which we've played at in the past with my nephews - was super fun. There are movie theaters, and other fun things for children to do if you have kids. We received a $25 dining credit (along with our free nights), which we used for the Sunday brunch. The brunch was ok - I have to admit that I've had better buffet brunches, but it's nice to eat where you are staying, especially on the day of departure. Check out was smooth - just did it right on the Menu button on our TV. Both hubby and I did pretty well on the tables (roulette and craps), and we actually took some money home - so all in all it was a pretty good trip. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans Review”
Reviews.Author: henry60270
Reviews.Content: We just love the Orleans. Even though it is a bit off the Strip it is a good place to stay. The food is great. The shows are terrific. The hockey games at the Arena (with all the great seats and the pricing) are something you just have to experience. The shuttle to the Strip is easy to use. The vast selection of video poker machines in my opinion is the best in Vegas. And best of all, the rooms are as good as any you will find in Vegas. Henry and Betsy

Reviews.Title: “Staff has no idea of what the hotel has to offer-training is a must”
Reviews.Author: PinkCat14
Reviews.Content: We had called several months in advance to buy tickets to a show. The woman who booked the reservations told us about the best seafood buffet in all of Vegas was right in the hotel. Since I am a big seafood lover, we knew we would go there before the show. What this woman failed to tell us was that it's only on Friday nights (which we found out the day of the show) and she was confirming our tickets for Saturday night! We had called the day of the show to see if reservations were required. The woman we spoke to this time told my husband there was no seafood restaurants in the hotel?!? When my husband mentioned the buffet, that seemed to ring a bell with her and then she told us that it was only on Friday nights. We then went to the website and found Big Al's Oyster Bar. I don't know if the woman knows that that would be consider a seafood restaurant!? When we finished with dinner we asked where the theater was. We were sent to the back of the hotel, the Arena where a hockey game was starting! We could not believe that each time we spoke to an employee, they had no clue as to what the hotel has to offer and they give you wrong information. How anything gets done correctly, is beyond me. When we finally found the theate on our own, the folks there were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Judithann
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for five nights the last week in March 2012. We got a great rate in conjunction with a slot tournament offer. The rooms were clean albeit a bit dated, which we also found the last times we stayed at Harrahs and Flamingo. We had a problem with our television which was resolved within 5 minutes of calling the desk. At that time the technician informed us that the hotel was going through a renovation and new flat screens were being installed. We always rent a car in Vegas so the off-strip location is not a problem, but the hotel provides free shuttle service to the strip. We ate at the buffet 3 times (two breakfasts and one dinner) and found it to be superior to others we have tried and the prices were less than others. They also have a TGIFridays, a 24-hour Cafe, and a food court featuring Sbarro, Fuddruckers, Subway, Baskin Robbins. There is also a movie theatre and bowling alley on site. We did take in a movie one afternoon, but did not use the bowling alley. We have stayed at several strip hotels and have found that most of them need updating also but continue to charge the big bucks. We were very comfortable at the Orleans and would not hesitate to stay there again. Incidentally, we did not find the area to be seedy. Adult entertainment places are everywhere in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: bluebaby33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel earlier in the week for my birthday. My H had stayed here a few years back for training and suggested I look into this hotel. I looked online and booked when I thought was cheapest but continued to check on line and called when any of the four nights I booked went lower in price. Each time I called the hotel was very accomodating and gave me the cheaper price. We arrived on saturday and pulled up to the side where check in is. Arrived a little late and called ahead to be sure they kept room, they said they keep rooms until 6am the next morning. Casino is quite large and receprion very nice with marble inlays. Check in quick. They give you a map with the key but easy enough after a walk through to know where everything is. The elevators are somewhat far from doors, and all entrances as far as I could tell, so if you have elderly with you this might be a long walk for them but many had walkers, and seem to do fine. The hotel signs you up for their slot memebership at check in but you have to go to B connected booth to get pin number. After I got my pin, I slid my card and it being my birhtday, a choice of five ballons came up for freebies I picked the blue balloon and got 1000 free points. Room was large. We had our 15 year old daughter and her friend. Two queen beds and large armoire. even with all the drawer space we all chose to live out of our suitcases. I had the chair in sitting area, H had couch, D had desk chair and DF had floor by bed...all had enough space. The casino had a lot of machines that I liked enough "old school" and many newbies. The Paradise fishing penny slots by the food court ended up being our favorite, very fun. We ate at the costa catina first night and while a little pricey was good mexican food. The girls had virgin margaritas so they liked it. They have a HH 3-5 except on mon. and tues. when it is closed, the hotel should have this place open evryday in my opinion, but with every meal they give you chips and beans and salsa, all were very good. Another thing this hotel has is a hotdog stand (only 2.00) in the middle of the casino, which I thought was a brillant idea for a midday snack. We had the daily 15 dollar food voucher and with the dollar off the buffet with our b connected card our breakfast buffet for four came to only 21.00, great deal and food was pretty good as far as buffets go. The pool area was nice too, the hot tub was huge and hot which helped monday when it was 65 degrees. We liked this hotel, having stayed on the strip all our other times coming to vegas the past 20 years, but we always have a rental car, so being off strip isnt a problem. We will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: gazm
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Orleans for the fith time and still can't fault the place. No it's not the Palazzo (which I also gave a try this trip) but it cannot be beaten for value. The rooms are excellent for the price. The dining choices are wide and varied with the Prime Rib Loft ( first time eating there) offering fantastic food at a very reasonable price. Throw in the seasonal specials with buckets of five beers for $8 dollars and who would want more. On the strip a single beer with tip is about $8. And to add icing to the cake the slots were good to us this year. Some people tend to be overly negative about it being off strip but it really is only a ten minute free bus ride or a $10-12 cab fare away and the room rates more than make up for that. Can't wait until my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, but dated and scary”
Reviews.Author: 5reided
Reviews.Content: I regret reading the great reviews before coming here; they fail to emphasize the bad neighborhood and dated facility. I give The Orleans 3 out of 5 because of its great value and lack of incidents or serious problems, but I would not stay here again unless low on funds. The hotel is surrounded by adult entertainment bars and stores, and the clientele is either cheap families or desperate, drunk gamblers. In-room wi-fi costs $12.99 extra AFTER the $6 resort fee, except in the lobby where a coffee shop offers internet for free. The rooms were relatively clean but all furniture is extremely dated.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a great price!”
Reviews.Author: katoota11
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights at the orleans.We loved it! Great place for families.It was very clean and everyone was nice! Loved the bowling alley! I liked that we weren't right on the strip..but still close to it! We will def stay here next year!

Reviews.Title: “Love this Place will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Jackie V
Reviews.Content: We have been here before and will be back again. Our two day stay was a portion of a business trip that was our leisure time. This was the mostly relaxing and enjoyable part of the trip by far. One thing I like about this place is that whether your have comped rooms or you pay, the service doesnt vary. We love the fact that is it off strip but you still get the Vegas feel. Restaurants are great, the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful and the casino is fair to all levels of gaming. My wife had a slight fear of table games and this was one place that I felt i could bring her, teach her a game and not feel pressured by others. The dealers picked up on this very quickly and helped me help her learn the game. There was never a feeling that the casino was tight and that they were just trying to re-coup their comps. One of the other excellent factors of this hotel is the security at the elevators. That is a great feeling to know someone is checking every person that walks by to ensure they are guests. We unfortunately had to stay elsewhere for the rest of the trip and wish we hadn't. If anything the other hotel made us realize how great the Orleans is, and next time we will deal with traffic driving to the strip rather than deal with poor service. Thanks Orleans for a great stay and we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: txbikerTexas
Reviews.Content: I read that this was a pretty good place to stay, and it lived up to it's many good reviews. The casino was large and had all the usual ways of seperating one from their cash, but it was FUN. The room I had was very clean and spacious. There was a great bar that served a wonderful free frozen margarita if you were playing video poker. There was actually a security station in front of the elevators. I had a rental car, so I considered this off strip location to be fantastic. This is one of the best places I have ever stayed in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Discounts, Freebies”
Reviews.Author: Ellenwood
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this because it was cheap but highly rated. Airfares had increased over two and a half times from what I paid last year. I was not expecting much (because of the price) but now I see why it is so highly rated, The Orleans, while a little dated, is an excellent value for what you pay. Check-in took less than five minutes. I was given a meal credit, discounts to the movie theater concession area, and discounts to most of the hotel restaurants. You must show a key to the security personnel to gain elevator access 24/7 (which I like). Most strip hotels only require this late night. The rooms are relatively large but dated. Being dated was not a problem because the bed was comfortable, the water pressure good, the room contained a safe, and housekeeping did an excellent job in keeping the room and public areas clean. The room also contained a coffee maker (very unusual for Vegas). Some of the pleasant surprises about the Orleans include 24/7 hour room service, most of the food restaurants open 24/7, an onsite package store, and a very well equipped fitness center (included in the daily fee). Most strip hotels charge much higher fees and the included fitness center is not eve a quarter of the size of the one at the Orleans. The Orleans has a 70 lane bowling alley as well as a 18 screen movie theater, the Orleans Arena as well as Orleans Showroom. Food at the French Market Buffet (family restaurant quality) provides a good value as well for what you get. The plentiful breakfast and lunch buffets are under $8 with the BConnected card. It is very easy to spend over $30 for breakfast at a strip hotel. The hotel is a good choice for visitors seeking a good value and not into clubbing.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WRBoiseTraveler
Reviews.Content: Second visit to Las Vegas and second stay at The Orleans. We love this hotel! It is smaller than most of the Strip hotels (we thought the crowds and the enormity of the hotels on the Strip were just too much). It offers everything that we need from a wonderful buffet (breakfast, lunch and dinner--much more reasonable than on the Strip) to several other restaurant choices, a good casino (though we always leave money!), bowling alley, movie theater, outdoor pool with ice cream bar in summer, and so on. We could spend all our time here and not be bored. Tuesdays are Senior Days with lots of extra freebies (like 2 for 1 buffet on Tuesdays for seniors), so be sure to sign up for their Player's Card. After our first stay, we received an offer for two free nights (which we used on this trip) and would not have had to stay any longer (although we did). We had a car but the hotel has a shuttle bus that makes trips to other casinos and also to the Strip on a regular basis all day (we used that last time and it was very handy). There is a security guard at the room elevators (like in many of the Strip hotels). After researching other hotels on the Strip, we decided The Orleans is the only hotel for us! Things not to miss: Fremont Street downtown at night, Jubilee show at Ballys, and if you are into dinner theater plays in a small venue, the one at Fitzgeralds "Marriage can be Murder." was a lot of laughs and food was good & plenty of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for personal getaway and conferences”
Reviews.Author: Lenthetraveler
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is located off the Strip and is a self-contained gem. It's plenty big enough, but not an overwhelming complex like some of the giant hotels on the Strip. Numerous excellent restaurants, fantastic pool setup and Sunday through Thursday room rates that will have you wondering how they do it. I've attended two major conferences here and plan to take personal vacation as well. You'll want to rent a car to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans: great value + inimitable atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: tmeltz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans early March for the umpteenth time. This hotel never fails to provide an excellent guest experience. Our room was cozy, comfortable, clean, and we slept well. Some amenities we enjoyed: Big Al's Oyster Bar serves delicious food, the Java coffee shop offers free internet, the action is lively at the bars and gaming areas. Have always had friendly customer service at this hotel. It's great staying off-strip with a free shuttle available when you need to hit the strip. What I like best about the Orleans is its boisterous, friendly atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, laid back atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Dawn J
Reviews.Content: For 20 plus years we stayed at the Stardust and were sad when it came down but Boyd Gaming offered us other options. We chose The Orleans and have found a relaxed atmosphere, friendly people and a good choice of restaurants. We always take several days and also go up and down the strip, so many hotels and casinos now are large and noisy, The Orleans has a more relaxed atmosphere and we have found everyone to be friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: treecorn
Reviews.Content: First time staying here and enjoyed the restaurants, kids tyme, rooms and service. I never felt like my kids didn't belong here unlike other places along the strip. The children enjoyed the kids tyme and the arcade. Our rooms were clean especially the bathroom but the carpet could use cleaning, there was several stains we noticed. Everything at the Orleans lived up to my expectation, wouldn't mind staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday in Las Vegas, part 2”
Reviews.Author: danbot94589
Reviews.Content: Almost always stay here, free 2 nights stay deals. Orleans is easy to get to and out of. Just 1 1/2 miles West of the Strip or a 5 minutes drive. Lots of parking, when there is no events. Nice to have a security guard at the elevators to ensure only guests enter. My room was on the 18th floor, get rooms on higher floors to avoid the long elevator wait at check out time during long weekends and holidays. King bed room, nice comfy, clean. Nothing fancy since I'm only there to sleep. TV needs to be updated - grainy picture. Why are hotel TVs volume set to loud when you turn them on? Rooms have a desk with chair and ethernet cable, lounge chair, sofa (so comfy I can sleep on it), coffee table. In room safe in the bathroom area and there's a sliding privacy door. Simple bathroom amenities, towels are fully stocked, there a small window at the end of the tub/shower you can open to help vent out the steam if you want. One problem is that the blackout drapes, right above the a/c heater vents, interfere with air flow. They should install a plastic guard of some kind to hold them back. Over all another nice quiet comfy stay at the Orleans. I'll be back there Labor Day week. Enjoy and Good Luck Playing!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaJohn1946
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Orleans a number of times and it gets more enjoyable with every visit

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need in a Vegas trip!”
Reviews.Author: Dave44535
Reviews.Content: First time staying here for the first weekend of March Madness. This hotel has it all, and without the craziness of the strip. First, if you like betting on the games, they open a huge ballroom for the NCAA tournament with huge tv's and betting booths. Great atmosphere with several hundred fans watching the games! The casino is more than adequate with tall ceilings and all the action you'd expect. The food is very reasonable for Vegas - several different chains rent space in the casino including TGI Fridays, Subway, and SBarro Pizza. If you want the strip, you can take the free shuttle with dropoffs at the Rio and Bally's. If you want to take a break from gambling, try the huge bowling ally or movie theater located right in the Orleans. Finally, the rooms are large and comfortable - among the best in Vegas, but also not as expensive as the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away during Cheer competitions!”
Reviews.Author: Jer29_11-14
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is an ok hotel, although the rooms could use a make-over. They were holding Cheer competitions that weekend so it was insanely crowded with families. We were there with our family so the craziness of the kids all over wasn't the problem, but just trying to get up to our room was a challenge as there was always a long line for the 4 elevators! And the valet service seemed to be very unorganized. This was not the first time they have hosted the competition so you would think they would have a better plan for dealing with the crowds by now. It is very kid-friendly with a bowling alley, arcade, pool (closed when we were there) and movie theater, but with all the hotels to choose from in Las Vegas, we would not go back to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time”
Reviews.Author: advicebylynn
Reviews.Content: The rooms are big but are older, dont expect fancy or new. There is a window in the bathroom. They have child care for kids--not free. You can set up a charge account for kids and limit how much they can spend at the snack bar. The kids LOVED it!!! They will ask for their shot record but you can fax it in later if you need to. They have free valet parking ( I didnt use it). It also has a movie theater, bowling alley and arcade (didnt use any of these). The kids enjoyed the outdoor pool. We received free coupons when we checked in (to use at hotel for food, child care, etc). We stayed for two nights but only received one set of coupons. I was told one per reservation. I was frustrated because if I would have booked tw seperate nights using two reservations I would have received two coupon books. This was disappointing. The hotel offers a free shuttle to the strip. Drinks are free when you are playing the machines---but the servers are slow to come around, especially in the non-smoking sections.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Dave H
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Orleans during Spring Break. Enjoyed the Poker and Keno Slots. They were multi-denominational which was GREAT!!! I hit 8 out of 9 on 4 card Keno for 16,000 nickels. That was a total of $800.00 to start out our trip. This was a nice surprise!!! My wife hit 2 Royal Flushes on nickel Dueces Wild for $200.00 each Royal within 30 minutes of each other!!! I have been to Vegas for 30 years and this has never happened to me. We had an excellent time at The Orleans!!! The wait staff was Excellent!!! The Service Staff was Excellent and Professional attitude and demeanor of the entire Orleans community was extremely professional, user friendly, and top rate!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth161
Reviews.Content: Very helpful & knowledgeable staff, starting with valet, thru checkout. Great hosts to provide help.. Extra large standard rooms then most hotels. Great Spa & Pool area. Big choice of restaurants and bars & entertainment. In quiet area just off strip & provided with shuttle service. Love this Hotel has become our Home.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price!”
Reviews.Author: akbecky
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Orleans three times and am planning a fourth in the near future. The hotel is off the strip, but there is a free shuttle that gets you there in no time. We have even walked back a couple times for the exercise. The rooms are spacious and clean. I really like that there is a window in the bathroom. The spa is very nice and worth the extra money. I had a great time gambling, bowling, swimming, sunning, and dining right there at the hotel. There is also a game room that was quite fun. There was a live band a couple of the nights and people were dancing and having a great time. The buffet at the Orleans is very affordable and delicious! We don't even consider paying the extra money to stay on the strip becasue this hotel has everything we need.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeaconBrodie276
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. It is located just off the strip and it has everything that you need. The staff are always friendly and helpful. The rooms are larger than most of the other hotels. The price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: kittenhearted
Reviews.Content: Stayed Twice. Don't fall for the $5 extra charge for a higher room, lower rooms are pretty much the same and I've stayed in both. Spa is awesome and I love the 4 Layer Facial. Bell Captians are great and helped me play a trip to the Grand Canyon that suited my handicap. No where else I'd stay. I actually found this hotel through Trip Advisor and was one of the few in Las Vegas that didn't have a bed bug problem.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected and no reason to leave here!”
Reviews.Author: Bigmike99
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel a friend recommended. It's definitely off the strip but close enough if you don't need to be on top of the action. Speaking of action there's plenty to do here including a huge bowling alley. The food is good, gambling good enough, and the rooms were nice and clean. The casino seemed a little smokey but what can you do. Overall it's a nice place and I would possibly stay again although I'd like to try a few other places. (I've stayed at harrahs and the nugget).

Reviews.Title: “Smoke filled Casino - disgusting”
Reviews.Author: blnaq
Reviews.Content: This is the worst, smoke filled casino in Las Vegas. It doesn't matter if you have a non smoking room, because when you return to your room, your clothes, your hair, your handbag, etc etc will be smoke filled. This casino is even worse than The Gold Coast (and I didn't think THAT was possible.). On a positive note, Al's Oyster Bar is AMAZING, hense the 2 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Never!!!!!!!!!!!!! dissapointed when I stay”
Reviews.Author: BRLRaymond_AB
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all!!! The registration is quick and painless. Arrived at 11 am and was able to check in right away(as always). Came for the nascar race was very pleased with the service to and from the track. The room was clean as always. Ask for some extra shower supplies late at night had them delivered to me within minutes.(NICE!!!!!!!!!!!!!) The staff is always eager to help and get you what you need. They even printed me off a map on how to get to Las Vegas Harley Davidson shop. (The main store on Eastern and Sahara) Had a good time in the casino the service was second to none. Again staff was friendly. We talked our server(FAYE) about our venture we were taking to the harley shop said that was cool. Suddenly she came back with the phone number to the place and quickest way to the shop. (NICE!!!!) Just can't beat that. Played lots of poker and the staff in the poker is friendlly and accomadatting. The dealers are great time. The new B connected players club was a great upgrade from the old one. Made lots of comps on food. The restraunts are good and well priced. The courtyard cafe has the best club house sandwich I have ever had!! A must have if you like clubhouses. All in all I have stayed here 8 times in the last 5 years. I have never been dissappointed. I will be back to Vegas somtime and this is where I will be staying. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “NICELY DECORATED PROPERTY”
Reviews.Author: hooglesnorpus
Reviews.Content: This nicely decorated New Orleans Themed property is a few blocks off the strip, but worth the extra walk. There is a statue/display of 3 tall alligators playing musical instruments by one of the exits, it is Very Cool. Take yer pic with it. :) The dealers were freindly and inviting. I did not eat or stay there so I cannot comment on that part of the property. My overall grade is a "B"

Reviews.Title: “Pay for internet twice! What a joke!”
Reviews.Author: kamillaUtah
Reviews.Content: We paid a MANDATORY $6 that said it was for free parking and internet only to find out that there was only one place in the hotel by the lobby you could use that internet. You couldn't use the internet in your room before paying another almost $15. I skype with my kids when I am away and don't want to do this in front of everyone in a cafe!! Interent should be free in the room, especially since you charge a mandatory $6 fee for it with your room. I will stay at a Best Western next time for the free internet so I don't feel like I am being ripped off!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: philip77901
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in the hotel and enjoyed it. Room was very clean, everything worked, the beds were extremely comfortable. Checkout time is 12 noon and we needed a place to store our luggage before leaving for the airport. We asked a manager if they had such a place and he said, "no but ill be glad to extend your stay an additional 3 hours to give you more time", that's good service.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: Scarlett A
Reviews.Content: Just want to let you know that this place really knows how to treat their visitors. Excellent, love staying here with husband. The staff is great and service is out of this world. I like the fact that everyone who works for the Orleans, has take charge abilities and actually gets things done. Very, very happy. Thank you again I mention this place to everyone to stay at the Orleans!!!!! They will be very happy.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans Casino”
Reviews.Author: Carl C
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting Las Vegas every year since 2001 and have always had a great time at the Orleans. The staff is always friendly and willing to take the extra time to resolve any questions we have had. We have visited other casinos while in Vegas but keep coming back here. The buffet is always great. The casino is kept clean, has good lighting with less smoke than most and nice music.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: ginny f
Reviews.Content: We're repeat clients. Love this property. The room rates are reasonable. Plenty of food options - from buffets, a food court. specialty coffee cafe, lounge, bars and restaurants. The staff is very friendly and courteous. Their room cleaning staff does a great job. And most importantly there is a wide variety of slots!

Reviews.Title: “Orleans Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas 2012”
Reviews.Author: RGilstrap
Reviews.Content: I was there for a conference with my job; hotel was off the strip $6.00 for a shuttle so that wasn't bad. Rooms were dirt cheap in my opinion; costs me and my wife $150 for 3 nights. Hotel staff was nice and we had no problems in that regard the entire trip. Had a large room but it smelled of some powerful deodorizer that didn't go away for a couple days. Room was large but kind of dated. No free wifi which sucked! Casino WAAAAAAY to much smoke! You would think today that places would recognize how unhealthy and unpopular smoke is in an environment. The smoke was my main complaint. Saw housekeeping everyday unfortunately they must have never seen us since no one ever came and cleaned our room the entire time! Wasn't a big deal; I just robbed towels from their cart in the hall. I liked the smallness of the casino, tons of slots, plenty of restaurants and all were good quality, had a food court, liquor store, large convenience store inside. This place has a 70 count 'em 70 lane bowling alley above the casino! That's huge! Plus they had a huge 18 theater cinema complex and an arena for stuff like soccer, sports, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not great for business conference”
Reviews.Author: Davep1212
Reviews.Content: Just came back from business conference at the Orleans. While the room were cheap, it reflected the overall experience. I guess I may be spoiled by the strip where I ended up spending most of my time via taxi back and forth. The air quality in the casino and rooms is very bad. Very smoky and poor ventilation. Showers were often cold. Thet do offer a free shuttle to the strip every half hour but the one time I used it, there were a couple of homeless people on the shuttle asking for money, not good! This place may be ok as a cheap solution for cheerleading competitions, etc. but not as a business conference.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as always”
Reviews.Author: JofromWales
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights last month. Checked in early on Friday morning, room available at 11am which was great! Very speedy check-in with no waiting in line. Allocated room 1023 which was a non-smoking king just as I requested. Room was comfy, clean and quiet. Old style tv but who really cares? Nice bathroom, coffee maker and small sitting area. Room looked exacly as shown on the website. Housekeeping good every day. Casino was great, plenty of slot machines and great drink service. Saw 5 movies in the theatre, cheap at $7. Ate in the cafe for breakfast, food tasty and servcie great. Also ate at TGI Fridays which was excellent. Great wings and ribs with speedy friendly service. Chowder and crab cakes at Big Als was good as usual but service a bit clueless. Also used Subway and the pizza place for a snack to take back to my room. Loved my stay at The Orleans and will surely be back for visit number 3! Jo

Reviews.Title: “A nice alternative to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: ShowMeVegas
Reviews.Content: Since we had a car anyway, we decided to split our long weekend trip between a Strip hotel and The Orleans. The property is much larger than I remembered and chocked full of ammenties such as bowling, movie theaters, a variety of restaurants, and entertainment. We checked in on a late Sunday afternoon with no wait and were kindly upgraded to a concierge room on the 20th floor. We spent maybe five minutes max during the reception process. While walking to the hotel elevators across the casino, we were met by the noticeably smokey atmosphere typical of older casinos with lower ceilings and aged ventilation systems. As an ex-smoker, the odor really doesn't bother me but both my wife and I noticed that our eyes became noticeably irritated after a few hours on the floor. A security guard is posted at a station near the elevators and while he didn't ask us for room keys that afternoon or during the day, he asked everyone to show their keys at night. We saw other security personnel on elevators and various floors so we felt safe and that any ruckus would be kept to a minimum if not eliminated entirely. We entered our king room and was greeted by a subdued but nicely appointed room with very high ceilings reminiscent of our experiences with older hotels in New Orleans. The door opened immediately to the bedroom area without the usual transition of the bathroom which was at the rear of the room instead. The furnishings in both the sleeping and small separate lounge area were in good repair and adequate proportionally to the size of the room. The bathroom/closet area was decently sized with a sliding wooden pocket door isolating the bathing and sleeping areas with another door separating the commode and tub/shower combo from the vanity area. A functional small window in the shower wall allowed light in as well as steam out when opened. I love this feature and enjoy it at other older properties like Bill's on the Strip and El Cortez downtown. The water pressure was excellent and the hot water was immediate and profuse with good drainage. A nice, large window provided a partial view of the Strip on the back wall of the lounge area, mounted above an old ventilation system, the controls of which were inoperative and replaced by a digital thermostat on the wall. A safe was oddly mounted to the base of one of two nightstands bedside instead of in the wall. An iron, board, hair dryer and coffeemaker were supplied though cheap, small styrofoam cups replaced mugs. Another nice ammenity is the complimentary shuttle connecting the Orleans and it's sister property, Gold Coast, to Bill's on the Strip. I believe the hotel states a 30 minute wait time but we never waited that long at any of the stops to catch the next shuttle. The drivers are very courteous, efficient and timely making the Strip easily accessible during a wider range of hours than many other properties. Even though the Orleans is off-strip, the shuttle relieves you of the need for a rental car. We would use the shuttle in conjunction with the excellent bus system to reach the Strip and Downtown areas, leaving our car at the hotel so that we could imbibe without the risk of driving. The Prime Rib Loft offers very good fare on par with similar restaurants elsewhere at a lesser cost. We found the buffet merely adequate with a variety of selections but only a few dishes better than average. We didn't try the food court but it is varied and convenient. A good coffee shop exists near the reception entrance. Checkout was quick and the valet personnel very prompt and friendly. A heated outside waiting area with benches was a nice touch on a brisk morning. No property is without it's negatives and the Orleans is no exception. Besides the hazy casino floor, there was a wealth of video poker machines though we found very few with good paytables. In fact, we preferred to take the shuttle to the Gold Coast property to play vp with much better odds. The bartenders were not particularly outgoing but were fairly efficient. The cocktail service on the floor was average to good depending on the hour but the form-fitting uniforms on these attractive ladies were outstanding. We didn't find the prices at the restaurants as attractive for an off-strip property but were reasonable for the most part. Again, we were a bit disappointed by the buffet even though we had player's club discounts as it seemed to have been above average on our last trip. We had the maid barge in on us unannounced while we were in bed at 8:30 am despite our having the Do Not Disturb sign hung outside the door. A simple knock first would have been appropriate. Further, the temperature control for the room was uneven despite the digital thermostat and the old wall unit was a little noisy. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay and would return again to the Orleans in the future. I would not hesitate in the least to recommend this property for those who want to escape the zoo that has become the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Coasta Cantina Very Good !”
Reviews.Author: latrice
Reviews.Content: Coasta Cantina !!Eat here., Beautiful Chile Rhellanos !! Nice Hotel and Casino, Great arena for a cheerleading competition. the food service at the comp in the arena is over priced, eat elsewhere. ! Good gambling at the orleans tho. i was looking to give a review for the Coasta Cantina but cannot find it on restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “WE STAY HERE EVERY YEAR!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheLifeguard
Reviews.Content: We feel SO smart when we stay here. Room rates other than Fri/Sat are incredible. Great food value on casino level. LARGE rooms. Terrific value. Friendly staff. Like home away from home for us and our families who gather here each year for NASCAR. This year we came 2 weeks early! Who needs to be on the strip! Last year I was here for 2 weeks and never went to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay once again.”
Reviews.Author: BEANZ83
Reviews.Content: This was my 5th Stay at the Orleans Hotel. It was excellent as normal. There was a big queue to check in but as there is so many staff on Reception it only took 2 minutes. Staff are all really friendly. Great location just two block from the strip. They have a free shuttle bus which operates every 30 mins and will drop you off in the middle of the strip where all the action is. Rooms are lovely and spacious. I can not recommend this hotel enough. Cant wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: hawnsteeldoc
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there many times. As in the past, we more or less enjoyed ourselves, partly because we're so familiar with the property. It's not a first rate property like what you might see on the strip, but the facilities are more than adequate, and we have come to rely on some of the amenities that aren't readily available at other properties without a premium cost attached. We used the two free nights coupon special and were really pleased that we do get as much as when we've paid the going rate to stay there. The staff seems quite professional , and we do enjoy the accessibility to the strip via their free shuttle service. We enjoy the options of several restaurants all located in house . We would plan to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Value above all”
Reviews.Author: jaH63
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times over my 30 years of coming to vegas, tried others, but always come back here. Ticks all the boxes except for Parking, the valets are rude & lazy, the self parking isn't the most convient, disabled spaces are not situated in the best locations. But if you don't have a car or the incling to stay onto the strip, you have it all in one venue, enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans experience”
Reviews.Author: Steven F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated my 70th birthday at the Orleans in Las Vegas this month (Feb). We met family and friends (who also stayed there) and had a grand time. The Orleans is first rate in value and amenities. We enjoy the atmosphere and the great dining. Steve

Reviews.Title: “Great Casino/Hotel/Food”
Reviews.Author: Flying_Far
Reviews.Content: I was extremely happy with my stay here this past weekend. The room was very clean and had a great view of the moutian landscape. The buffett is the best in Vegas for the money. The casino was modern and had great service and a wide asortment of table games and popular slots. Despight the fact that The Orleans is off the main Strip, The casino bus that goes down to the strip made it well worth it to stay here than at any other casino. I will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you have children”
Reviews.Author: Tricia316
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on Sunday night and checked right in. I had asked for a Strip view. We got to our room and saw NO Strip out the window from this 19th room view. Called down to the front desk and when I heard "If you would like to request a different room press 1" I became concerned. Do most people ask for a new room? When the front desk gal came on I explained we had asked for a higher floor AND a view of the Strip. She quickly found room 1004 for us. It did have a nice view of the Strip (with the valet parking deck roof AND Deja Vu Adult shop/bar in the view as well.....). This was the second from last room ALL THE WAY at the end of the hall AWAY from the elevator. If you have ever been on a cruise ship and took the elevator to your deck that was at the other end of your hallway, this is the same thing. I am five foot 2 and my husband is just shy of 6 feet. We counted the paces it took us from the bank of elevators to our room. For me it was about 155 steps, for him, 136. If you think this is a walkable distance for you then I highly recommend being as far away from the elevators as possible. The rooms are surrounded by concrete and are almost soundproof EXCEPT the door. You can hear people letting their doors slam (come on people, be courteous. You know the lock mechanism is making the door heavy, hold it until it closes, don't let it slam) and you can hear people in the hallways talking, and I am guessing the elevators dinging at all hours if you are close. If you want quiet get AWAY from the elevators and away from the possibility of people talking/walking past your room! Room was spacious, old tv, great pillows. Tipped the cleaning lady the first day with a $5 bill, she was in the room when we arrived back from shopping and I asked for 2 more pillows and more toiletries daily (we keep them in our house for guests and donate them for the homeless families who stay at our church) and I had TWO sets daily for the remaining nights of our trip! Our room had 2 queen beds and still plenty of room in the rest of the room. Our safe was in the bathroom and BOLTED to the top shelf over the hanging clothes area. Smoke in the casino is there, wish they had a better vent system. No fake perfume smell though which was a plus. We were there on Mardi Gras so we got to see the marching band parade around. Got some great tshirts from the dancing girls with the band and some Mardi Gras beads. It was fun. Played some slots but aren't really into gambling. Had our 7 year old daughter with us and she LOVED the Kids Tyme center. During the week it is $6.50 an hour. Great service, very nice staff, very safe. She had an excellent time each time we dropped her off so we could go to a movie or dinner alone. The breakfast buffet was fine. LONG lines on Tuesdays for breakfast/lunch because the over 50 crowd gets a buy one get one free meal.The line to get in was 45 minutes long at one point. We only ate there for breakfast and enjoyed it. Lots of choices. We ate at TGIFriday's, Baskin Robbins, Fuddruckers all same as at home. We ate at the Prime Rib Loft on our anniversary and dinner was lovely. They gave us a free dessert to share in honor of our anniversary. The last night we were at the Orleans (Thursday the 23rd) a huge crowd of cheerleaders and their parents arrived. The Orleans put up signs on each floor near the elevators (along with a security person on each floor) to try and keep these kids under control. It didn't really work. They were loud, standing in hallways chattering constantly at night, ect. Parents really need to control their kids and know where they are. Letting 10-12 year old girls roam around a casino resort is not a great idea. Took the shuttle to the Strip a few times. It was running about every 20 minutes. We bowled and saw some movies while here. Very nice features to have if you have kids or want something to do besides gamble or sit in smoky areas. My daughter and I did have to take allergy medicine daily to deal with the smoke we breathed in just passing through the casino. We booked through southwestvacations dot com and only had to pay the $6 resort fee daily, the upgrade to a higher level/Strip view was either included in our vacation package or we were given it free when we arrived. I did use the business center for 10 minutes daily for FREE since that internet was quick and included in the resort fee. Please feel free to send me a message if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Thomas F Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was adequate. We had a spacious king size room. I liked the layout of the room. We had to walk really far from the elevator to the room, and we weren't even at the end of the hall. The staff was friendly. The restaurants downstairs were convenient and the food was delish! I enjoyed my stay, but the main focus is the casino. The fitness and spa are way downstairs if you can find them. The tvs were not in proper working condition (old tvs and fuzzy picture and not many cable stations to watch)

Reviews.Title: “smoke a killer”
Reviews.Author: lynn h
Reviews.Content: we were at a polka fest for three days and the cigarette smoke fom walking through the casino to the dance floor which is the only way from your room was so bad it made my wife and several other people sick and she has not recovered two weeks later.we will not be back again and recomend that anyone with lung problems or allergies to smoke never go to this hotel..to bad so sad.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: JCfromOKC
Reviews.Content: A trip to Vegas wouldn't be the same without spending 3 or 4 nights at the Orleans. We just love the place. The rooms are very large, especially the bathroom. The restaurants are all great and reasonably priced and the food court is very good. We enjoy going to the movies and gambling in such a large casino. If you want a great room at a great price the Orleans is the place for you. The location is perfect for a home base if you have a car and If not there is a shuttle that runs back and forth to the strip. There is a good chance though you wouldn't even want to leave this wonderful hotel & casino!

Reviews.Title: “Family stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Mickey R
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an all-in-one family experience in Las Vegas, you can find it at the Orleans Hotel and Casino. Do you like to bowl?? Do you like the movies?? or perhaps your kids like video games. The Orleans has it all. We have always experienced good courteous service and the rooms are roomy and clean. Extra service is just a phone call away. You can find fast food at one of the various food court offerings, or a fine buffet or there are many fine dining places. Of course there are the slots and table games for the adults, There is also a shuttle that will take you to the Strip and other B-connected casinos. Make sure you sign up to be a b-connected member. There are perks for this. Enjoy your family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Best place off the strip to play and stay.”
Reviews.Author: RLeGodais
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is the best place to play, dine, get entertained, and stay off of the strip. Lots of slots and table action!

Reviews.Title: “We love THE ORLEANS”
Reviews.Author: Dennis S
Reviews.Content: We have been going to THE ORLEANS for years and love it. We like the tables and the slots. They have great slot turnaments. We love the Buffet, It has a large selection and very reasonable price. The rooms are very large and comfortable. It realy is a great Hotel/Casino.

Reviews.Title: “A, fun tournament”
Reviews.Author: Mildred W
Reviews.Content: Nice tournament because of the size. The staff was excellent and everything went very smooth. It would be nice to have a danish or roll and some fruit before the pull. It is difficult to get a breakfast so early if you have a 9:00 pull, especially if you stay up in the casino the night before late.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Terry H
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is the best hotel, gaming resort I have had the pleasure to stay at! Friendly Waitressess, bartenders reservations and bellhops i have ever dealt with. Discounts galor. Becoming a member of B-connected was the best thing we've ever done! Rooms were clean and maids were there if anything was needed. The arena was the best. on vacation and still we got to watch our favorite sport hockey! Thanks Orleans for everthing!

Reviews.Title: “THE ORLEANS HOTEL & CASINO HOME AWAY FROM HOME...”
Reviews.Author: MANUEL A
Reviews.Content: We have visited the Orleans since 1996 when the Stardust was imploded and the staff are great at the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: Yolanda G
Reviews.Content: Always have a wonderful time rates are awesome rewards are even better!! The restaurants are great we can`t go to Vegas and not eat at Al`s Oyster Bar. We always enjoy our time wether it be the movies ice cream or gaming. Gaming is also great the slots are loose and they constantly bring in new games. I highly recommend this casino wether you are traveling with your family or just adults !!

Reviews.Title: “They will make you feel like a winner.”
Reviews.Author: Thad J
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank every body at the Orleans for a good time I have been coming to vegas for 15 years and I love the orleans the food is how we say in Hawaii ONO. prime rib loft and big AL's oyster bar french market buffet the best.The rooms will make you feel like a king, best rate for B connected and the slots and table games DA BEST can't wait for October I am coming back for more fun.

Reviews.Title: “As always, a fantastic time at The Orleans.”
Reviews.Author: Steven S
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a wonderful Vegas experience with a less hectic pace, may I suggest The Orleans. It is off the strip, which I prefer. Parking is close and free. They run a shuttle to the strip every 15-20 minutes, which is also free. The hotel is modern,clean, and close proximity to the Casino and the parking structure. The Pool is very nice. More layed back than some of the other hotels. They have a movie theatre, Bowling Alley, and Arcade upstairs. Great if you have kids. There is an Arena next to the hotel that hosts everything from concerts to motorcycle races to hockey games.The Casino is perfectly layed out in a simple grid pattern so finding your way around is easy. The food varies from a slice of pizza at the food court, to upscale dining. I find the cocktail service second to none. And I play penny slots, which there are alot of. The building is very secure with a presence of security. I feel very safe in and around the hotel. The hotel prices are great. The Orleans has become my home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “the orleans.”
Reviews.Author: Brian A
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, great staff, nice clean rooms, very spacious, and alot of good resturants esspecially the frech buffet and all other restuarants. enjoyed it very much plenty of slots and other casino games i like the slot tournaments even if you don'twin still alot of fun. when i go back to las vegas i know i will stay at orleans hotel&casino you should too give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Richard S
Reviews.Content: Orleans is our favorite place to stay in Vegas. It's a little way off the strip but has a shuttle that takes you to other properties that are on the strip. Rooms are nice and beds are very comfortable. Restaurants are reasonable and compare to the high end hotels. Staff is very friendly and customer oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: jaba44
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at the Orleans. checkin/out fast & efficient. Rooms very clean and large, Food at the cafe ,Big Als, and the buffet very good and reasonably priced. As B-connected members of Boyd gaming, discounts were available at the buffet, amount of discount varied as to what level of cardholder you are. The fitness center here is one of the best we have seen with multiple cardio machines and pulley resistance weights as well as dumbells. The only thing missing was a barbell. Wish they had more handicap parking available as they were always full. One thing we did not like was the resort fee. As far as we are concerned these are a rip off for services that were once free. Include them in the charge for the room if you must charge for these services that way they do not appear offensive. Or better yet do what Caesars Corp has done and do away or hide them altogether.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic room, shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: Moose707
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I arrived late at night and upon check-in the lady said they had sold out of the room we had booked (a standard king) so they had upgraded us to a 1 bedroom suite for no additional cost. This was a very pleasant surprise and the room was beautiful. I think it had a total of 5 tvs including one in the bathroom. This review could have been 5 stars however the staff really let down this hotel. When we first pulled up the bellman was rude and condescending when my boyfriend asked if they had a cart we could use for the luggage. Not a great first impression. We were told the luggage would be up in the room in 15 minutes, it took closer to 40. When it did arrive (a different guy) he seemed miffed that we didn't tip him more than we did. We gave you a tip, accept it graciously and leave! Anyway, all in all, the room was great, we got a good night's sleep, they just need to train their staff to be more courteous and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans 2/8 - 2/11/12”
Reviews.Author: Fondy
Reviews.Content: Had not stayed at Orleans for a couple years, but received a comp offer so booked for February, 2012. As usual, the Orleans is a great off-strip casino resort. Check-in was a breeze, room was clean and comfortable, and the casino has a fun assortment of new and old machines. Really enjoyed trying out the "rapid roulette". Orleans is one of the best bargains in Vegas. They are still running the shuttle from Orleans to Bills (Strip) to Gold Coast so it's really not much of a problem being off-strip. Food options are plentiful and reasonable. The on-site liquor store is a great place to purchase "beverages" for the room as the prices are decent. One of the things I appreciate most is that Orleans has a security person checking room keys by the guest elevators. I often gamble while my husband is sleeping and I always feel safe returning to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Bob4Bob
Reviews.Content: Great value, comfortable stay. Free shuttle to strip makes makes hotel great for value and access to entertainment. Good food and entertainment on site. Tables are good slots are fair

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Secure Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn S
Reviews.Content: We are two women who stay at The Orleans hotel a few times a year. We have brought friends here and advised others to stay here as well. We love the large rooms with a coffee maker, in room safe, iron & ironing board., and a large bathroom The beds are fine and linens are fresh and changed as requested as this is a green hotel, which we really like. It's certainly not neccesary to change sheets every night, and towels are changed as needed also. The housekeeping staff are very efficient. We also love the fact that there are security guards at the desk of the elevators, and every guest must have a room key I.D. that you show as you enter. There has never been anyone wandering around the halls, which makes it very safe. The same goes for the casino, lots of staff and all are pleasant. The floor waitresses are very efficient, so don't forget to tip them well. We always rent a car from the airport as we go touring and shopping They have the best valet parking, which is very much appreciated when we come in late or in the summer when it's so hot as the car is in a covered parkade. Again, don't forget to tip well. There are excellent restaurants here with something for everyone, from Coasta Cantina (very good fish platter consisting of 3 varities of fresh fish, YUM, and $1margaritas) to T.G.I F,'s to the French Market Buffet, which has the best All You Can Eat crab on seafood Friday nights !!! And the price is sooooo reasonable.. And again, the wait staff are so busy but always pleasant and attentive!! This reataurant has very good bread pudding and awesome gelato for dessert. Try the raspberry and/or the mango. WOW. The Orleans has a free shuttle to the strip, or the Gold Coast., which is adjacent to The Palms and The Rio Hotels. Great value as it's free.. The pool in the summer is wonderful, free towels poolside, lounge chairs, shade for those that want it and a poolside bar with reasonable prices, not like some!. Again, secured so you need your card to enter, and it's right near the elevators so you don't need to go through the entire hotel to get to it. I think The Orleans has the best Rewards program so remember to sign up for the Be Connected as soon as you get here. Some very good perks as you accumulate points, so make certain to insert your card every time you play as points accumulate quickly and can be used at the Java Coffee shop for a great latte or at the buffet for dinner! And I can't forget to mention they have monthly slot tournaments with money prizes for the top 100 contensants, for the Be Connected members, Yippee. So much fun, we have entered a few times, and what a reception.. Thank You Orleans. And for the over 50 crowd on Tuesdays, you get 7x points, and as soon as you accumulate 50 points you get a chance to spin the wheel for bonus points, free slot dollars, movies, or free gifts. They are very good to seniors ( over 50) And oh yes, 15 minutes of free internet upstairs daily. And free Wi-Fi at The Java Spot all day.

Reviews.Title: “Our vegas comfort hotel”
Reviews.Author: azdisneyfan
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is off the strip but there is a convenient shuttle that will take you to and from the strip. Unfortunately the last bus is at 12:30 a.m. This is Vegas, shuttles should run at least till 2 especially if you are watching one of the shows elsewhere! The Orleans is consistent though as far as always having a clean and comfortable room, no hassle check in and check out, restaurants on property, and not so jam packed like other casinos. The rooms are a bit outdated but not old or falling apart. We have always had good luck when watching their live lounge acts which presents good music. Go early though because their just isn't enough seats. Everyone has always been friendly here and the rooms always affordable especially during the week. The shuttle drops you off kind of centrally on the strip (Bill's gambling hall which is across from Bally's). So you can walk either way to the other casino's. There inside Bill's is a kiosk called Tix4Tonight. You can purchase discount tickets for most shows for that day. Something to consider. I've done this every time we come and have watched different headlines to comedy/hypnosis shows without problems. Saved money. Tickets for shows will always be higher at the show's box office. The Orleans has a good size theater if you want to kill time during the day or run out of money. Their buffet isn't too bad for the price. Our experience is that we like the buffet at the Rio personally. If you are one who wants to experience the buffet options, buy the buffet of buffet. This will save you money for sure! Generally dinner and brunch on the weekend cost about $29.99. The buffet of buffets cost $44.99 and it is 24 hours for 8 different buffets. Time it to go around 11:00 for brunch then you can have dinner that night and another brunch that next day. It's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “great place near the strip”
Reviews.Author: gambler g
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is a large property with a great casino. The rooms are a bit dated, but clean, roomy and comfortable. We have had good luck at the casino. The staff is great. Food prices are a bit higher than sister property, Sams Town. But that may be because they are closer to the strip. (It's still a lot less expensive than strip restaurants). Comps are great so be sure to get a players card if you do any gambling. We have been to the Orleans several times and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “As everywhere, pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: LindaRat
Reviews.Content: Two married women who go to Vegas once a year for gal-time. We like live shows, slots, video poker, people watching, tons of walking, good food and lots of laughs. Chose to go from Sat-Wed to beat traffic, lineups and I mean really, $32.00 per night and $6.00 resort fee? I can't stay home for that. Pros: Stayed at over 10 hotels on the strip and nowhere have I had better service. While it's not in the tourist hub, we chose it specifically to be off the beaten path for a change and was not disappointed. Check-in took minutes and the desk is a stone's throw from the front door, as are the guest elevators. Elevator security is evident and while they never once checked my ID, their presence is obvious and appreciated. Guests get free shuttle (throw a $ into the bucket!) to the Strip and also to the Gold Coast Hotel (not recommended!). If it's busy, they want to see your ID to confirm you're a hotel guest. That's a good thing. Check in took minutes, desk is right through the front door, smiles from the staff and felt welcomed right away. Was given many freebies/promotions and we used them all. We don't care about glitzy rooms as we're hardly there. What I do care about is CLEAN and COMFORT. Beds were wonderful, service from the hotel operator was instant and while there's a bit of wear-and-tear, nothing made me gasp. Great shower pressure, loved the little window in the bathroom for fresh air and the maids cleaned the room beautifully. Nice touch of a coffee machine as most middle-of-the road rooms on the Strip are void of those. Guess they want you out of your room as fast as possible to start spending $ but frankly, a room without a coffee pot is enough reason for me not to stay there. Great casino with slots that let you keep playing. Video poker machines at the bars are very worn and could use a bath but still the best place to get a "real" drink while you gamble. Floor service was quick and the girls were friendly and attentive. Good piped music -- mostly oldies which suits us fine. Good atmosphere with people having fun. Read lots on here about people getting comp'd for rooms and food and we were no exception. However, this was because we asked to put our gaming points towards anything that was applicable. We spent over $1000 each on gambling and events, so I think comp'ing a $90.00 room and 6 daytime meals should be expected. Wonderful coffee and service in the Java bar with lots of seating for quiet time to enjoy newspaper in the morning. Gift shop stocked well. Movie theatre has great selection of movies and very reasonable prices and fantastic popcorn which a must. In a nutshell, everything about The Orleans was a 10. Except.... Cons: I would have rated this review Excellent if it wasn't for the food. We ate in every establishment except the Prime Rib place, which I heard was very good. The buffet: vegetables were brown and wilted throughout the salad bar and limited to low-end vegetables (no tomatoes?). Beef ribs were impossible to chew through and I mean impossible. Sausage at the breakfast section did not taste like meat, scrambled eggs were watery, hash browns greasy, pastries lacking flavour and seemed very bland. That's just a sample of about 25 things we tried. The Garden Cafe's food was a step up but really, that's not saying much. I had a beef dip and while the roast beef WAS cut off a roast, it was filled with peppercorns and the fat edging left on. Meat for beef dip should be shaved and void of fat. All the fries throughout Vegas seemed to be laden in salt and more salt. Doesn't anybody make real fresh-cut potatoes? Had Sliders at TGIF that are served with such flimsy buns, by the time they got to the table, the bread had disintegrated and it was all mush. And again, salt-laden fries. I would definitely return to the Hotel but would make different dining arrangements. Air cond: (Room on the 16th floor, far end of the hall). The machine is loud and runs intermittently all night long. You can turn it off but it's too hot without it. They do need to upgrade this. I want to be clear, the service throughout the entire establishment is top-notch so my negative comments would only be to the owners who may want to spend 4-5 days in their own establishment and eat all meals there to see what many people are talking about.

Reviews.Title: “Our Vegas home”
Reviews.Author: ERock09
Reviews.Content: We love The Orleans, we have no complaints. If you are looking for a comfortable property to call "home" on vacation, this is it. Clean, friendly service, very affordable, great cocktail waitress costumes.While their rooms could use some updating( from last year when we were there) they are clean and comfortable (who spends much time in their room while in Vegas anyway?) The pool is awesome, but not fancy or extreme like some on the strip locations, my advice is get there early to get a good spot, but don't dip into the pool until the sun has warmed it up some. Friendly dealers with decent bet amounts. affordable resort fee. the Japanese restaurant in the casino has great sushi! If you are not looking for the modern, expensive, luxurious Las Vegas hotel, then you will love The Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “I feel welcome at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: mnRaine
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times and I am always satisfied. The front desk clerks are very friendly and always know what they are doing. Two queens , desk, loveseat, chairs, flat screen tv, coffee pot , iron , board, combination safe. Spacious room and bathroom. Clean but some carpet stains and a broken sliding bathroom door. The door did work but it was a little crooked. Minimal neighbor or hall noise. The fitness room is excellent . About 6 tv's, stair climbers, several tredmills, elipticals and stationary bikes. Several arm machines and free weights. Free shuttle to the strip. They have a great casino floor and lots of dining choices. We checked out the movie theatre which had lots of movies to choose from. Paid about $37.00 on a weeknight for two adults.

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff and services”
Reviews.Author: Forestj
Reviews.Content: We always enjoy our stay here. We come to bowl and play V/P. Due to a cheer leading competition there were alot of kids and non gamblers. They added extra staff at peak hours so we never had to wait more that a couple minutes for an elevator, valet or to sit down to eat. The restaurant service was excellent. We were greeted and seated quickly and our orders promptly taken. Food was tasty and reasonably priced. Our server was friendly and attentive. We come here at least 2 times a year and will continue doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Happybikers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights in Jan 2012. He was entered in a craps tournament and our room was comped. The room was on the 17th floor, smoking, king bed. It had a flat screen tv and a view of the strip in the distance. The room was large and clean, maid service was excellent. The furniture and carpet were in very good condition. There is a one cup coffeemaker in the room (very convenient). We are always very comfortable when we stay here. The casino is large and a good variety of machines. We only ate at the coffee shop and it was good and the service was fast. We would not hesitate to stay here in the future. It is not a five star property - but if you want to have fun and have a clean comfortable room, this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “If bathrooms were updated it would be better”
Reviews.Author: GirlyBob33
Reviews.Content: I came here on a business trip, so the hotel was already booked for me. I've never been to Vegas before so I am glad it was taken care of for me by my company. Check in and out was very easy and quick. I ate breakfast the first day in the diner, and the breakfast was good and inexpensive. The next day I had breakfast at the coffee shop. I think I had a breakfast sandwich and a latte. That was also nice. Since I was there for work, my company catered box lunches on the 2nd day, and even though it was just a simple sandwich, chip and fruit box, it was still good and filling. The bathroom leaves a little something to be desired, so if they upgraded that, the room would have been better. My friend was also staying here in her own room and said that she got up in the middle of the night and she didn't have any water. I'm not sure what the deal was with that, but I didn't have any problems. If I were to come to Vegas for fun I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for anyone seeking good value”
Reviews.Author: maltasr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a city within a city. There are a myriad of things to occupy one's time if you are not particularly prone to leaving your money behind in the slots or at the crap tables (minimum bet - an unusually low $5.00).
