There is bowling, a full service movie theater with a good choice of up to date films, a free shuttle to and from the Strip, many food choices (even a 31 Flavors and a Friday's) as well as the usual buffet fare and a Business Center for those needing a computer, FAX service, or copying. The rooms are large and comfortable and there is little noise or commotion in the hallways during the night. There is most always a tournament of some variety going on so it's fun watching the participants trying to bring home that additional few hundred dollars. This hotel caters to the senior citizen crowd and goes out of its way to make them feel at home. For $45 a night (Sunday-Thursday) it's a terrific value in a secure and immaculately clean hotel. The only downside is the considerable distance to the major hotels on the Strip if one does not have his/her own car.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stay at The Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: toekneekay
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight in The Orleans. Check in was a breeze. Front desk honored all my requests with the room. The room was really nice size. In addition to the normal room amenities of a bed, tv, desk the room also had a seating area. Great value if your looking for a cheap place to stay off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “A good off strip choice popular with locals”
Reviews.Author: SecretAgentReview
Reviews.Content: This is a big casino hotel with plenty to do. Theres a bowling alley, movie theater, many restaurants. CASINO: Full of the usual and new slot machine, many tables and asian games. HOTEL: Nice blue collar type hotel. Pillows need upgrading but otherwise generally clean and comfortable. Usually a line to check in but it moves fairly quickly. They have the hated resort fee which is nonsense and should be illegal as its not advertised with the room price. If its mandatory it should be included with the advertised room price. If they felt good about the fee they proudly post it, not hide it in details,,, FOOD: Theres a TGI Fridays that has all the specials and promotions. The food court Fuddruckers, Subway, ice cream and sbarro is good.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Grace67
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Orleans many times before this last visit just before Christmas. As in the past we have no complaints whatsoever. One word could sum it up...easy. Easy to get to and out of, easy parking, easy to find a nosh at any hour. The rooms are big , comfortable and have a safe securely bolted to a night table. The bathroom is a bit odd because it has a sliding pocket door that might disturb some guests. And the wardrobe is a part of the set up but is large enough to be manageable. I really like the security check at the elevator bay and have nothing but praise for the housekeeping staff who supplied extra towels, pillows and shampoos with a smile. You have a writing desk for your laptop and a coffee maker that made my hot water for tea in a jiffy. I travel with my own supply of green tea and find it a terrific bonus. This time we did not have a small cooler but many guests have them in tow at check in. The Buffet at the Orleans is very good...plenty to choose from at the salad station and enough in the way of vegetable dishes to accomodate a struggling new vegetarian. I did have a taste of the crawfish ( still struggling ) and absolutely loved them. Plenty of dessert options are sugar-free. Oh happy day ! We love the decor at the Orleans, and the cocktail waitresses in Santa outfits that were charming and not merely seductive. There is an oyster bar that beckoned but we opted for Fudrucker's that actually served a breakfast...cheap and good. We were able to get to Bellagio to check out the Christmas display which was cute but fell short of Martha Stewarts' displays of years past. . Easy in and easy out of the parking and the moving sidewalk is a help when you have lots to carry. We have solved this problem by dropping all the luggage with me at the entrance near the check in desk to wait for my husband to park our rental car and check in. There are movie theatres as well and I believe a bowling alley. We were there just after a rodeo and enjoyed the cowboy element. The Orleans seems also to be a favorite with the locals and we saw many senior couples enjoying an evening out.The liquor store prices beat those at the Moapa reservation and once again, the staff were down-home friendly and knowledgeable. A definite thumbs-up for my money !

Reviews.Title: “Nice property off the strip.”
Reviews.Author: rlmko
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel offering more than just gambling. Enjoyed the bowling alley and movie theater. Room was nice and big and they even checked us in early in the morning. The view could have been better. We had a view of a wall. Basic TV channels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value because not on the strip”
Reviews.Author: FranCare
Reviews.Content: OK it does have the shhuttle which is great, every 30mins, but if you are out after 12.30 its going to cost $20 each Taxi. Great rooms, big comfy, great room service. Older crowd. Good safe hotel for this age group. Food - great choice, and a super wine retail shop. Perfect if you are not spending your time on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, wish it was just a bit closer to the strip”
Reviews.Author: Sarah F
Reviews.Content: It's an older property, but there are some great things about it compared to the strip. For starters, the food is much more reasonably priced here than the strip, so we ate here alot. The breakfast buffet held us to dinner nearly every day. The rooms are big, especially for the money. The staff were fairly good, no real complaints. The casino smelled a little more of smoke than most of the casinos, I've noticed the older properties seem to be that way. My biggest complaint was that it seemed like a hassle to go to the strip, if you have a rental car or drive to Vegas that won't be an issue. For the price, I really can't complain too much.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the cheerleading tournament!”
Reviews.Author: tdr3
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times over the years and for extended periods of time. Have always enjoyed our stay and interactions with staff. This has not changed. However near the end of January they have a 4 day cheer championship in the arena. During this period of time the hotel is over run with cheerleaders and their families. This means it is next to impossible to get an elevator, next to impossible to get a seat in the restaurant and the hallways are constantly noisy if you are looking to sleep in. In fairness the staff did their best to control things but many times were overwhelmed. I will definitely stay here again but will likely stay away from that tournament.

Reviews.Title: “Off Strip Jewel”
Reviews.Author: jltt
Reviews.Content: We try to stay here every time we come to Vegas. With our first stay here at $25 a night and I'll be the first to admit we booked because of the price and reviews we always come back. This trip we were comped 2 nights with a $10 dining credit. We are very low rollers so this came as a surprise. However when we checked in I asked for a strip view room as it was my birthday and the front desk was very accommodating. It was beautiful in the evening. Everything about the room was wonderful. It was very clean, I love the window in the shower, the beds were to die for and I love the fact they don't use dirty old bedspreads. The bathroom is big enough for 2 people to be getting ready at the same time too. The only disappointment I had was the buffet didn't open until 7 and we were there about 6:30. We did eat in the coffee shop and had a very nice breakfast before leaving. Everyone here was extremely nice and helpful. This is definitely always going to be a place we stay!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: highdesertbadger
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Orleans. The first went OK so I decided to return. Not so good this time. At our Monday check-in I was told that the King room I reserved was not available. But then they found one which I took but shouldn't have. It was on a lower floor with a view of the entrance/valet parking area just below our room. Noise was an issue some of the time. A bigger issue was that a convention of 2,000 little girls and families was starting in a few days. The hotel became mobbed with families with little ones in tow. This was not the "Vegas Casino" experience I had planned. It wasn't horrible but it did sour our stay. Otherwise the room was average. The air-conditioner was very noisy and the casino itself was way smokier than most others we visited. I don't believe I'll return here again. I also recommend that before booking a room in a Vegas hotel, check to see if any conventions/conferences are scheduled to take place during your stay. Otherwise you too may have to contend with several thousand screaming little girls running the hallways into the night.

Reviews.Title: “Really great value”
Reviews.Author: maui4dave
Reviews.Content: Orleans offers some of the best rooms for the money in all of vegas. Check in is one of the easiest and the rooms are right for the price. Lots of locals but a good place to escape the strip.Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “VISIT TO THE ORLEANS”
Reviews.Author: JIM O
Reviews.Content: Once again our trip to the orleans was one of the most enjoyable times in Vegas. Great employees, selection of table games, and video poker, good video poker. Always a refreshing break from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Richard R
Reviews.Content: The title and my review seem like a mixed message. Most of the time when I come to Las Vegas on business I stay at The Orleans. The fees for all of the hotels seem so out of control and confusing. I was placed in an upgraded room which was very nice. I dined at the Courtyard Cafe and was amazed at the speed my meal had arrived. I also dined at the Prime Rib Loft which was excellent. The hostestess at the buffet were very friendly and made me feel very welcome. I guess my disappointment came with dealing with the crowds, because of the cheer competion. The elevator situation was dealt with, but on my departing day there was a lot of trash and gum on the floor in the elavator.

Reviews.Title: “BEST VALUE”
Reviews.Author: sundayp
Reviews.Content: AS usual,our stay at the Orleans was wonderful. We stay often and are Never disappointed. The staff is friendly and helpful,especially housekeeping. They try to satisfy our every need. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hostess”
Reviews.Author: Robert W
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at the Stardust, and when there was no more Stardust, I followed my Hostess, Licette Rosa, to The Orleans. Licette is the best. She makes you feel special and always takes care of any problems you may have. I have introduced my 2 sons, and 4 other friends on theirs within the past couple years to Las Vegas. They love The Orleans, and will be lifers at The Orleans. I honestly can't find any fault with anything at all, but then again, I am easy and can't stand whinners. Easy quick check-in. Always good live music. Great Sportsbook. Well, I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities”
Reviews.Author: bhlister
Reviews.Content: Great facilities at The Orleans, we went because we were offered 2 nights free but we booked another 5 nights because it was such a nice place. Don't get me rong, it is not the strip but it has everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans experience”
Reviews.Author: Edward S
Reviews.Content: January 2012, We arrived at the Orleans Hotel & Casino and enjoyed 3 days of non-stop fun. The room was clean and had a terrific view including the LV Boulavard that lite up at sunset. The gambling tables are plentiful and inviting. The staff is greets you with a smile and is polite. We dined at the Prime Rib Loft and were treated like royality. The Prime Rib was fantastic! At TGIF, we had one dinner that included steak and lobster for only $14.99 each. The buffet is second to none and priced very cheap with players card discount. We saw a comedy show with Paula Poundstone that was enjoyable and very affordable as well. At the indoor movie theater, we watched the Mission Impossible movie (awesome!). The free band played at night was top notch and we enjoyed dancing to 70's and 80's music (was a blast). There is also a bowling alley inside which we didn't have time to enjoy. I would recommend this casino because everything you need is right there. I was greatful to have fun and not have to worry about driving home or anywhere else. Anyway, good luck! This one is a winner!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel/casino”
Reviews.Author: adam s
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Orleans Las Vegas, and I have to say it was an excellent choice to choose this perticular hotel/casino. The staff is great the food/buffets are excellent, casino dealers are friendly. Its a very clean environment and I recommend it highly to all visiting Las Vegas. Its a few miles away from the strip but I found it very convienent and fun to take the Orleans free comfortable shuttle ride to the strip. I can't wait to stay at the Orleans again on my next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Perservere For Guest Satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: Mycharly1
Reviews.Content: On December 22nd, We noticed a diminished "slot point" account balance of aprox. $330 on my wifes' club coast account. We notified the Club Coast staff and checked in weekly on the progress to recover my wifes' loss. She did not play the points (money) or use it for purchases. Annette & Tammy, of The Club, found the missing points, $330, last week, on the 11th of January. They backed through the computer system checking activity on my wifes' account and found points were "collected" and not added in - the IT guru was queried and found that a computer "glitch" held up the tabulation. Tammy found us playing at the usual "place" and informed us of the results, we are very pleased with the attentiveness always given at the O'rleans. It is our "home aways from home" for relaxation and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans--great value for a low price”
Reviews.Author: SOLANGE03
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love the Orleans. Rooms are spacious and clean. Hotel and casino staff are friendly and helpful. The restaurants are excellent and prices are good. it is also great having a shuttle to either the Gold Coast or the Strip. Check in was less than 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: d-dog_h-of-h
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is a solid hotel. Only waited 5 minutes to check-in. When we got to room it was missing towels. Called the front desk and within 5 minutes they were in my hands. Room is spacious and the bed is comfortable. Also has a safe and free coffeemaker. Housekeeeping is prompt and had no problems. Could never rate it a 5* since it has shown some wear, but the Orleans is always my second home since my DW and I go to Vegas 5X per year. Slots are OK for payouts and table limits are low. All in all the Orleans provides a great value for your $ in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you compromise”
Reviews.Author: SolivitaJim
Reviews.Content: Located only a short distance from the Las Vegas strip, the Orleans was both convenient and a bargain for the budget minded. We stayed there for three nights right up to Christmas day, and had a large room with King bed at a very good rate. Regardless what the hotel itself claimed, I would rate this hotel at about a two-and-half star level, clean but spartanly equipped - only provided with plastic cups and minimal amount of towels or amenities. Our room was at the end of the hall way on 18th floor, so we had a beautiful view of the night scenery of Las Vegas. The hotel staff was friendly, but the housekeeping at off hours were slow to response. We also liked the security policy for the hotel residents, i.e. positive key checks by a uniformed guard in the evenings before allowing guests to enter the elevator area leading to the rooms. This hotel catered to a poportionally large Asian population, and the casino's clientels consisted many local residents. This was one of the few casinos with music or dance shows offered by troupe from Hong Kong or Taiwan, attracting mostly Chinese speaking audiences. The in-casino buffet was inexpensive, but you got what you paid for - a below (Las Vegas) average offering for both breakfast or lunch. Internet access was kind of pricey, considering the number of hours most average Las Vegas visitors would stay in their room using the broadband. The access was sold in 24-hours blocks, and there was no other means to have wifi access within the hotel. All-in-all, the hotel room was comfortable and for what they rates were, it should be considered as “good value”.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans Again”
Reviews.Author: DonnaD52
Reviews.Content: Nice clean rooms. very pleasant staff. sometimes difficult to get a cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “Just average, even with renovation.”
Reviews.Author: mrsbootc
Reviews.Content: We gave this place a second try. We stayed at this hotel because the conference hubby was attending was held at their convention center. We've heard this to be a great place because it was renovated. We get to the front desk to be told they don't have king beds available even though we paid for our stay in full 2 months prior. I explained to desk clerk we paid for it, and read the notes, hubby is 6'7" and doesn't fit in a queen size bed. The clerk apologizes and won't budge until he talks to his mgr. They gave us a suite. For the price of the rooms, even the suite was just average. Even tho it had been renovated, the rooms are still crusty, old, dark and dingy. The sink drains were slow, the shower was missing caulking, even though it was winter, we still had to have the a/c on to be comfy. Never again will we stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Brian P
Reviews.Content: Love staying here. We do it every year for a baseball tournament, its convenient and easy to get to the strip with the shuttle. Perfect if you don't want to hassle the crowds on the strip. Pretty much everything right there within the hotel you don't need to go to the strip. Tables are relatively cheap too.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable accommodations for the money, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: CowboyKermit
Reviews.Content: We visited from Dec 17-23. We booked this initially through Expedia for an average rate of about $35 per night. It's about 5 minutes drive from the strip with lots of parking (requires a fair walk to rooms as most other large hotels on or off the Strip). There was a good selection of on site food choices including 4 fast food outlets. The French Market (buffet) was very good value for the money as well ($10 for lunch). You will probably get bored of eating there more than 3 times in a week though. The casino is quite smoky and it was all that much more annoying because we could only access free Internet from the lobby which is in the casino itself. The charge another $14 per day for in room Internet! Had we known this, we would likely not have stayed here as we use the Internet quite a bit. Security, appears good at first, but the guards at the guest elevator don't really impose themselves to check for valid guest ID. Most guests were average budget hotel types from what I could see. One of the main reasons we chose the Orleans was due to to rave reviews on Expedia. Not sure that is warranted.

Reviews.Title: “Want to get your $ worth in Vegas? Stay and have fun at The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Melenarey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans for the weekend and had a great time! What I appreciated the most were the choices available so we did not have to bother with the traffic on the strip. The hotel room was clean, spacious, pleasant and most important, comfortable. The Orleans has a nice selection of restaurants to meet your cravings and your pocketbook. We enjoyed the free entertainment, a fantastic 80s rock band with a good deal on beer buckets. The casino is family oriented so there's plenty for everyone to do; movies, bowling, swimming, arcade, shopping, and there's a wonderful kiddie sitting service that is fully stocked with all kinds of activities for the 3 to 12 year olds. I noticed the hotel and casino staff go out of their way to make you feel welcome and they provide service with a smile. I felt lucky before getting to the slots. My gambling bucks went a long way. All in all, it is a great place to have a weekend getaway where you get more for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place off strip”
Reviews.Author: Ted K
Reviews.Content: Orleans is very close to the strip without the strip rip off prices. Casino is very clean and friendly. Drinks are great. Has all the new games. Food is better than any strip places and is very reasonably priced. Do not overlook this place when you visit Vegas! You will enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Introduce friends to the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: larad427
Reviews.Content: I brought relatives to the Orleans in October 2011 and they enjoyed their stay. i brought friends in January 2012 and the Orleans did not disappoint them. They were impressed by the room quality, service, friendly staff, (and great buffet too). They were pleasantly surprised to see movie theaters and bowling alleys in the hotel and to find out they were provided with a free shuttle to the strip. I personally found the slot attendants, Brenda, Nellie and Debra Bride friendly, cordial, and very helpful. We all agreed we will definitely return again this year. . . I personally

Reviews.Title: “Casino is good, hotel is going downhill”
Reviews.Author: MnineM
Reviews.Content: Friday and Saturday, first week of Jan. 2012. The casino is good. Good mix of machines and tables. Staff and dealers were friendly. Cinema, sandwich shops, lounges, and bars by their locations and methods of operations are those extras that, for me, sets the Orleans as a place off The Strip where I want to go. The hotel no longer is a positive for me. Still, I like the room size and floor plan. but... Resort fee of $6 per person per day. The fee is for: (1) local and toll calls (yes, I know people who do not have mobile phones); (2) in room coffee; (3) access to the fitness center (but not steamroom, jacuzzi and changing room - that will be $25 extra); (4) use of the in room safe; (5) 10 minutes of Internet in the Business Center; (6) free Wi-Fi at the coffee shop; (7) free shuttle to the Strip; (8) free parking. Away from the coffee shop Internet is $12.99 per day. The coupon book has been replaced by 2 papers: Fudruckers cookie and Coke with a combo purchase; 15% off at Sabarro; Baskin Robbins $1 off medium or large frozen drink; Koji 10% discount Monday-Thursday; Java Vegas 10%%; Rocky Mountain Chocolate Factory buy 3 candy apples, get 1 free; TGIFriday buy 1 dessert get 1 free with purchase of 2 entrees; Subway 15% but not on $5 foot long; Courtyard Cafe or Big Als Oyster 10% off up to 2 people; Cinema 1 free small popcorn; Spa 10% off 50 minute massage but not on Friday, Saturday and holidays; Bowling 1 for 1 up to 3 games; Beauty Salon 15% but not on Sunday; Business Center 25% off if printing airline boarding pass, limited hours of availability; Barbershop $5 off; and Advantage car rental $5 off per day. The room was clean. Sheets were the softer feel and sparkling white. Bath towels had that over cooked in the dryer smell.Tile grout was clean. Hallway rug (5th floor) was worn out. There were noticeable "foot prints" at every door. In the room there were "foot prints" at the edge of the bed by the night stand, in front of the TV/drawers, and other places that get the most foot wear. Under the coffee table was a 1 foot by 6 inches red stain (wine maybe?). The gold plated fixtures were worn and scratched down to the underlying metal. In the crevices of the sink fixtures was a white build up (toothpaste or cleanser?). The room was clean but it reminded me of my younger days when I stayed at those 2nd and 3rd rate European hotels a few blocks back from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money”
Reviews.Author: cbl7
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is away from the strip, it makes up in other ways. They also have a free shuttle to Bill's on the strip which is right across from Bally's. I was in town for a convention and didn't check in until about 6pm. At the time of check in I was informed that I was upgraded to a one bedroom suite which was amazing: 4 tvs, living room, dining area, bar and king bedroom. The room was very clean. The customer service was great. We also dined at Al's in the hotel and it was great. I highly recommend it. I would recommend the Orleans for a great value. One more thing, the hotel has so many dining choices as well as other activities to do other than gambling.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE OF EXTRA COST”
Reviews.Author: Lamon C
Reviews.Content: The Orleans Hotel is a very nice hotel it has lots of amenties and children would enjoy staying here. We enjoyed our stay there and I would recommend it to a friend the The promblem all the extras fees 1. $6.00 a day resort fee 2.$12.99 a day internet fee(u can use the wireless internet service in the jave coffee house 3.$15.00 a day for the sauna and steamroom(the workout room is free) 4. if you have a vochure have them to expain exactly what it covers 5. cost to print boarding pass

Reviews.Title: “New Year stay at the Orleans Hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: Anthony U
Reviews.Content: It was a great pleasure to receive such an offer from the Casino. The cleanliness, the cares and the services of all the hosts, the buffet and most of all the slots and the table games; they all are awesome. I realy enjoyed my stay there and very soon I will be back for the slot tournament, may be on my birthday. Thanks for the stay at the Orleans, I'll be back soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans Hotel Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: lady123_12
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Clean rooms especially corner rooms. Lots of food to choose from. Movie theaters and Bowling. Outdoor pool area and inside spa s and exersize machinesA guard by the elevatorsw to screen guests going to rooms. A safe feeling. Live Poker. Slot tournaments monthly. Vans to go to their other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “My Experience @ THE ORLEANS”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiiankane
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay @ The Orleans, the staff was nice, the food was excellent, the rooms were good size, and the bed was very comfortable. I will surely stay @ the Orleans again & let all my friends know about the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Off Strip(but not too far) Hotel with Good Value”
Reviews.Author: NuttBoxer
Reviews.Content: Passed through before Christmas with my wife and daughters, and stayed here because they were the cheapest nice Vegas hotel(stayed on Thursday night). Got in around 8pm, found parking fairly close to the front desk. No line to check-in. The lady at the desk asked if we preferred a higher or lower floor so I said higher, and we were put in a room on floor right under the penthouse suites. Should've asked for a view facing the Strip(we got the south view). Still a nice touch. Room was not non-smoking, which we had specified in the reservation, but I probably should've re-confirmed with the front desk during the check-in. Room was very nice and clean, beds where comfortable. My older daughter wanted to see the strip, so we took the shuttle to Wild Bill's. Shuttle was only supposed to run every 45min according to the hotel brochure, but we never waited more than 15min. Forgot our room key, and security posted by the elevator said I either had to call up, or get a new card. Since my wife was asleep I went to the desk and was promptly issued another room card. A bit of a hassle, but worth it to know they have decent security. Called for more shampoo, and even though there was only one person on cleaning duty for the entire hotel, received the shampoo in 15min. Check-out next day was a breeze, would definitely recommend as nice hotel, and a bargain when compared to some of the prices on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “lower prices than hotels on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: dudleylr
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week over the new year and found the hotel spotlessly clean with very friendly staff. With the hotel somewhat off the strip the hotel shuttle bus is invalueable.It runs every 15 to 20minutes.Compared to the hotels on the strip prices for rooms,drinks,food,.and minimum stakes in the casino are quite a bit lower. One thing I would like to point out to all new visitors to Las Vegas is keep hold of your bags Ladies, my wife put her bag under the seat while queing for the buffet in the hotel and a lady tried to take it, lucky for us a couple of men stopped her. All, in all we had a fantastic time at The Orleans, it was our first time to America and we loved it, we will definitely come back and would recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jack S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Orleans many times. Always a great time, good food, bowling, music etc.. Everybody there is always friendly and helpful. We always bowl as it takes us away from the casino for awhile. This year we had 15 bowlers and had a great little tournament. The music at the bars are also reallly good. Can't wait for the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “A good value”
Reviews.Author: GEFisher
Reviews.Content: Just a few minutes off the Strip, The Orleans offers a great value. At $41 (35 +6) per day, we saved compared to even the least expensive hotels on the Strip. We made a cold call one afternoon and asked to see a room. Without hesitation the hostess setup a keycard for a 20 minute window so we could take a look. The rooms were spacious and the room we eventually stayed in had a large screen LCD (but analog feed) and a soft king bed. Another nice bonus is that the hotel offers an outdoor path from the parkade to the elevators for those who may want to avoid the casino. (As nonsmoking, non gamblers we appreciated this.) Although the low $6 resort fees do not include in room wireless, free wireless is available near the front registration, next to the Java Vegas. The perfumed scented "air freshener" was a bit overwhelming in the public areas and may have been more annoying than the smoke alone, but the air quality in our room was fine. The venting window in the tub/shower was nice - we left ours open to get fresh air and appreciated this.

Reviews.Title: “Our Vegas Home”
Reviews.Author: Lisa J
Reviews.Content: We originally stayed at the Orleans because of a convention several years ago. We liked it so much, we have stayed there ever since. The rooms are huge, and very comfortable. The service is excellent, we've always been treated very well, and we've never had an issue. We always have breakfast (and often have late night snacks) at the Courtyard Cafe -- I have serious cravings for my Jambalaya Omelette. It is off the Strip, but there is a free shuttle (runs until 12:30), and cab rides are fairly short. In-room internet is an extra charge, though. Overall, a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: jade_32f
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at The Orleans. It was the first time staying at an off-strip hotel so I was not sure what to expect. We valet parked and they were very prompt. We never had to wait more than 5 minutes for the car and this was New Years Weekend. Of course, the hotel and casino is not as large as the strip hotels but they have lots of gaming tables, slots and place to bet on games, races, etc. Our room was clean and large with a sitting area. We asked for more bedding and housekeeping brought it up in about 10 minutes. There was never any room service, etc. sitting in the hallways. We had a view of the strip on the 8th floor. There are several restaurants in the hotel, TGI Fridays, Frudruckers, a buffet, Prime Rib Loft (which I highly recommend) I did better on the slots there than any other casino. The smoke eaters are not as great as the on-strip casino's though. There is an 18 screen movie theatre which was really nice and comfortable. There is also a 70 lane bowling complex which we bowled 4 games. You can easily go to the strip with the free shuttle, however, we didn't use it. I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent value for money”
Reviews.Author: nibrahim
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night to save money on new years eve....all other hotels were $400++ that night, this one was about $120. The casino is huge, not sure about service though. Our view was great. This place is off the strip. If you rent a car, its really close. Overall, I was not disappointed. I don't think I could stay there for more than 1 or 2 nights though.

Reviews.Title: “Great off Strip place to stay”
Reviews.Author: milford44
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is a great place to stay in Vegas. Close to strip if you want to go there but just far enough away to make it much more convenient. Nice rooms and nice pool area. Nice food selections at the on site restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “FUN FUN FUN”
Reviews.Author: JoJoMagoo
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay there, but went on our last day as we had quite a few hours to kill before getting on the plane. After our experience at The Orleans, we will be staying there for at least a few nights next time we go to Vegas. It's for the 40+ crowed and it's awesome. You even get some discounts if your 55+. Cheese lounge acts, cheap drinks, great slots...but the BEST thing about this hotel is the FOOD. They have a food court that rocks - and it's not that type of food court that's all in one big "square" or "circle"...it's long, so it's like one big buffet to walk through and check out what you're in the mood for. It's affordable and delicious. AND then there's the restaurants. We didn't have time to go to any (and the Canal Street, unfortunately, was closed when we were there) but I looked at the menus and my saliva started working itself... YUM! There are 18 movie screens, so we saw and movie and then kept our ticket stub and went 10 pin bowling for free! Lots more to do, great for kids, too. Nice staff. Big thumbs up for affordable entertainment and descent food in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Loved just about everything”
Reviews.Author: pluto1075
Reviews.Content: If you can't afford the nicer Strip or don't want to be in middle of the action then this is definitely the place to stay. My last visit I stayed at Harrahs just to be on the strip and I hated it there. The Orleans is a really nice hotel. My biggest problem in Vegas is all the smoking (and I have smoked off and on throughout my life), and I felt like Harrahs was disgusting with smoke but I have to say unless I actually walked by someone smoking at The Orleans then I didn't really notice. They do pump in a perfume type smell which can be strong at times but I got used to it and it was better than smoke! The first few employees I encountered were less than pleasant but thankfully it didn't remain that way. Our room was HUGE. My biggest complain was the carpet in the room, it was disgusting!! What a shame too because the room was so nice but the rug definitely needed to be ripped up, there were large blackish stains all over it. But if you get beyond that the room was very nice beyond that. Everywhere else we encountered in the hotel had nice carpets so I'm not sure why our room was so atrocious. Another nice feature of the hotel is the shuttle that takes you the Strip. It ran about every 20 mins so it didn't feel like we waited for a long time, and it was a nice break from the cost of cabs. The food selection at the hotel was great and they also served Starbucks coffee, with free wi-fi at Java Vegas. The hotel also has a bowling alley, arcade and cinema. It was hard to leave the hotel! Overall we had a great experience at The Orleans. I would definitely choose this hotel over any of the older, cheaper ones on the Strip, it's not worth it. I do wish this was slightly closer to the Strip, but I guess you can't have everything!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value-Low Key Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Kind67
Reviews.Content: Hello, I stayed here over the Chrismas 2011 weekend for $37 a night--via Hotels.com--not including the mandatory $6 resort fee ($43 if you include the fee). The resort fee includes local phone calls, discounts to some of the on-site restaurants, use of the fitness center and perhaps a few other things I've forgotten about. This hotel is a mile west of the Strip on Tropicana Blvd. at Arville St. There is a free shuttle from the hotel to the Strip and the Gold Coast Hotel but it only runs from 9:30 a.m. to about 9:30 p.m. However there is a public transit bus on Tropicana Ave. (line # 201) that can take you from the strip to the hotel and vice versa in the early morning and until around 1:30 a.m. There is also a bus (line # 104you can take on Arville Rd. which, if going north, takes you to the Las Vegas's Chinatown neighborhood, the Springs Preserve attraction, and Meadows Mall. If going south on this line, you get to the South Strip Transfer Terminal where you can get helpful bus information. The room I had was on the 18th floor and had a great view of the West Las Vegas area. If you want a strip View room let them know at check in, but the West view is nice too where you could see the western mountains. The view was the best part of the room, though, which is fairly dated. The bathroom was okay. There is a 70 lane bowling property on the premises but it is very popular--it seemed nearly full when I visited in the evening hours. There are also movie theaters and a wide variety of restaurants to choose from. I had their regular breakfast buffet and it was an outstanding value for only $7.99. I had superb sweet potato pancakes, blintzes with blueberry topping, delicious chilaquiles with fresh-tasting guacamole, vegetarian beans, grilled vegetables, french toast, fruit, one of the best biscuits I've ever had in my life, and several pastries as well. The sweet potato pancake didn't look like much but it tasted scrumptious and seemed rather healthy. That was one of the two most enjoyable parts of my Las Vegas visit--the other being a visit to the Springs Preserve. I definitely recommend this hotel if you're searching for a value hotel but want a more relaxing atmosphere than you would get on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Off The Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexanTraveler77388
Reviews.Content: The Orleans hotel is 15 years old but still had nice size rooms that were well maintained. The bathroom had a sliding door - so if you are with someone who is a light sleeper, they will definitely wake up when you move the door for privacy in the bathroom. The staff was very friendly. My husband and I went to primarily gamble. We found the slots to be extremely tight and witness very few people winning. We dined at the buffet twice for breakfast and lunch. The breakfast was excellent with made to order omelets and a great wait staff. Lunch was okay and the desserts were not edible in either of our opinions. On the map, it appears The Orleans is in walking distance of the other casinos near the strip - IT IS NOT IN WALKING DISTANCE AND A CAR IS NEEDED TO GET TO OTHER CASINOS. While they do have a shuttle, it only goes to their other sister casino that is also off the strip and not near other casinos. I would recommend The Orleans if you have a vehicle and don't mind driving to other casinos.

Reviews.Title: “more than a casino”
Reviews.Author: woodman709
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to play and stay, a wide variety of good food at low prices, we used the 18 cinemas , we enjoyed the bar music.If you are not going just to gamble this has to be the best place to stay a friendly atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: NANA A
Reviews.Content: Our trip is usually as a couple, but this past trip was with family, including children. They too enjoyed their stay. We all enjoyed the Orleans for their food, food choices, the gaming selections. It has a lot to offer to adults and children. The Orleans have courteous and friendly staff from the valet to the front desk, to the bellman, the shoe shine and security, everyone! The Orleans atmosphere is very welcoming. We always return to Orleans, everytime! .

Reviews.Title: “Great time at The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: sonny15
Reviews.Content: We enjoy playing Video Poker. The Orleans has a great choice of games and fair pay tables. If you enjoy VP, then you need to give The Orleans a try. They also have good places to eat including the cafe and buffet. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Saved our vacation!”
Reviews.Author: easttxgirl
Reviews.Content: I only wish we had known about The Orleans the first week of our vacation. We moved to The Orleans after being in Vegas for a week at another hotel and casino. The Orleans was very clean, and I was looking for dust and dirt after we checked in. We loved the room, and I like the bathroom being at the back of the room, rather than as soon as you enter the room. The bed was just as comfortable as our bed at home. The restaurants were reasonably priced and the food was excellent. The casino was awsome and the payouts were great. All of the employees we encountered were knowledgable and friendly. Once we checked in, we didn't have to go outside the hotel for anything. They know what customer service is all about. We will stay at The Orleans from now on when we visit Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very festive atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: ATCTrixie
Reviews.Content: I live in LV but enjoy staying at the Orleans occasionally. It's a great atmosphere and Canal Street Restaurant is my favorite in town, believe it or not. The gaming isn't so great; pay tables are not comparable on video poker. Nevertheless, love The Orleans for price, food, and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money”
Reviews.Author: daddymac1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just what I expected. Very clean and comfortable. It is not perfect and you need a car to get conveniently to the strip and downtown. The hotel is a bit outdated and there were some stains in the carpet, but the room and bathroom are very large. The prices for room service is incredibly low for Las Vegas as they had bottles of wine for less than $20. There did not appear to be any restaurants within walking distance. I would definitely stay here again as this is my second visit and I think it is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: ChrisFabrycki
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Orleans several times and always found it to be clean, accommodating and a good value. The rooms are a good size and love the set up with the bathroom in the back of the room rather than just as you walk in. The bars and restaurants have good deals and I had never gone there without some sort of promotions for discounts. The shuttle to the strip is timely and quick. Would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: powdahsdad
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times in the past and recently on Christmas night and I must say it is always a good experience! This most recent time I was upgraded to a really nice suite with strip views on the 20th floor and i didn't even ask for it! i have had good times and won several times on the casino floor as far as i can tell they have pretty loose slots. I like all the food options as well as the things to keep the kids busy! Also the Orleans is home to the Las Vegas Wranglers Hockey Club they are always FUN games to go to!

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, lot's to do in one location”
Reviews.Author: coloradowoz
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days here at a convention. Lot's to do: Movie theatre, Hockey rink, decent restaurants, cheap rate on room. This place is a mile off the strip, location is not bad. The rooms are a little outdated (but it's Vegas, you don't spend much time there). I did have to have the iron replaced in the room (leaked like a river) and the bathroom sink would not drain. Both were taken care of quickly. You would think that the maids would see that the sink does not drain and would report it so that a customer doesn't have to. Not Ceasar's or Bellagio but it's a lot cheaper too.

Reviews.Title: “Return trip to the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: BigBlue01
Reviews.Content: Per my previous review, I last stayed at the Orleans in August 2011 for 16 days. Needing a break and as my wife has never been to Vegas we stayed there again this December. As usual the Orleans is a very busy place with 18 movie theaters, 70 bowling lanes, large hockey arena, many restaurants, etc.. Unknown to us the first week of our stay they were host to the American National Rodeo Championships and extra busy with most patrons being rodeo people. Definite improvements have been made since my last review. Carpets in halls, our room and more importantly the poker room were either new or very well cleaned. The weather was much cooler than anticipated and the heated pool closed on the weekend of the eleventh making the Jacuzzi unavailable. It was even too cool or cloudy to sit outside most days and traveling the strip needed "layers" of clothing as it was hot in the sun but very cold out of it. The registration staff were very busy and not up to par from previous trips. Having had to pay $20 per hour for internet use last time I purchased a small laptop and it paid for itself in the two weeks. Free wireless internet in the Java coffee shop was excellent and there was always space available to sit and normally charge your pc. Many hours were spent staying in touch, playing games when bored, etc.. The Courtyard Cafe was well organized and there was always room. The portions were much too big for either of us (Canadians) and probably geared to the american appetite. A major drawback is that it is right next to the sports betting area, open to all the smoke and noise, etc.. We found that if there was a crowd for a game (which seemed to be every evening) to request a seat in the right hand section as far away as possible. We thoroughly enjoyed TG Fridays as there was never a wait and it was all "glassed in". The food was good and reasonably priced with excellent service. Al's Oyster bar made great clam chowder. Room service was good and when you put the sign on your door in the am (probably after nine) and came back from breakfast the room was cleaned. As usual the buffet became routine after a few days and many times there was a line up waiting to enter. For the price you will not find anything better. Their Wednesday steak and scampi was great and a bargain. The service was very organized and efficient. Being from Ontario we are used to a "smoke free" environment. I doubt that you will find this anywhere in Vegas apart from your room, some closed in restaurants and outside? Having visited the casino / poker rooms in Venetian, Bellagio, etc., the hotels are not designed to provide this atmosphere in most areas. Even areas that indicate "no smoking" are full of smoke as they are open to the whole area. My wife and I both allergic to smoke suffered greatly. The Orleans is one of the worst due to large crowds and central location of all bars being part of the casino. The worst was the large one with big screen TV. Cigar smoke was overpowering. We visited both outlet malls (north and south) using the excellent strip bus service for $7 per 24 hours. Either the "express" or the Duce run efficiently and by choosing your stops you can change buses with the same pass. The south mall was modern, totally enclosed, contained many brand name stores and good bargains. The north (near Freemont) was very quaint, all outside (at 50f quite chilly) and not as many stores. There are many superb malls on the strip and you should not miss Planet Hollywood or Caesars Forum and the Venetian. Very expensive but amazing to see. My only real concern with the Orleans staff was that in August I booked an all inclusive package (flight and hotel). My main game is poker and they offer a "poker rate" for rooms. When I went to claim it the poker room approved but the front desk would not as they said I had not booked the hotel "separately" but through a package. This time in checking all web prices I found that I could save about $100 (through Expedia) over booking both separately but the "poker rate" would make up that difference and I would be ahead by about $50 so I booked separate flight and the room through the Orleans even mentioning the poker rate of 20% being deducted at the end of our stay. Early in our stay I approached a poker manager who called the front desk and said there might still be a problem. The day before leaving I again approached the poker manager to get his approval, when he called the front desk they once again declined. I then went to the front desk manager and explained the situation, that they had told me the rules, I had played the hours and booked the hotel separately and through their phone line, it was being refused. After looking at his computer, a lengthy argument he still refused giving me a song and dance that "I was already at their lowest rate for most days". It does annoy me that such a large hotel would stiff me for $100 after I followed the rules given to me by them. Nothing to do with the money, they set the standard and should follow it. The moral, if you have an option, book through the cheapest internet site that you can find for the package of flight and room. General comment, Vegas was much colder than expected for December so bring may layers of clothes at this time of year and until April or May. If you are at all sensitive to smoke Vegas is not the place to be. There are no real "no smoking" regulations and most areas that are supposed to be smoke free are open to the whole area and polluted. Casino's especially are very unsanitary. Both my wife and I came home with serious head, chest and throat infections. Waitresses take no care in keeping the drinking surface of any drink "clean" and normally put them down holding by the top with all five fingers. They serve a drink then take chips or money from customers and then serve the next drink spreading many germs. Hey, you go to Subway and they put on plastic gloves, their hands never touch your food so there is never any problem. I use hand sanitizer most often and after leaving any game or room but never thought about what was happening until I got sick after a few days. Casino chips are deadly for the spread of flue, colds, etc., as they are never cleaned and handled by many people. For those who have never been to Vegas another annoyance is the fact that it is so dry that your nose can end up bleeding winter and summer. Try over the counter nose sprays, a little vasaline in each nostril and running your head under a hot shower to breath in the moisture a couple of times per day. Enjoy but do some planning before going. Jim

Reviews.Title: “Makes you feel like you are at home.”
Reviews.Author: Karin H
Reviews.Content: We were made welcomed even before we walked in. Everyone was so friendly. We had very good meals at the Restaurants. The location is great to get around, not to far from an entrance to the I15. We would defenantly go back. The rooms are spacious and the bed comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Hit or miss.”
Reviews.Author: Gracebayclt
Reviews.Content: It's been years since I stayed at the Orleans as I prefer the strip. They have reasonable weekend prices and a very low $6 resort fee. I ran into a problem checking in because I didn't have the card I booked with online. I know this is needed, but I flew in from N.C. and was delayed almost 8 hours so I left the airport to fill up my car with gas. I left the card in my car. I informed the young lady while I was checking in and she said "they are very strict about this" yada yada yada. I ended up having to get my friend who was booked in another room to secure my room with her credit card which I felt was unnecessary. I did have my check book with me, I'd stayed there before, I just felt they had no flexibility. They don't take checks. She did waive the 6 resort fee, which was never the problem in the first place. The 15 a day food credit is convenient, I could not tell where they had deducted it when I checked out though, so we went 12 rounds about that. The free shuttle to the strip is nice, runs to midnight and puts you off at a sister property near the middle of the strip. I didn't use the spa this time but remember it being really nice, if I stay there again I will use it. They also have a bowling alley and movie theater on site, as well as 24 hour TGI Fridays and a Fuddruckers, which was pretty good, and a good Mexican restaurant we had one night. The king sized non smoking room was very nice with a flat screen, sitting area, and large bathroom. Also, single serve coffee in the room. Checking out was a pain in the neck, the woman who waited on me did not know what she was doing and did not waive the 6 fee as I told her the manager told me she would upon checking in, I spent about 30 minutes working with her to figure it out. My sister had a guy who checked her out in 1 minute. My friend unfortunately was serviced by the same service person I was and had a worse experience, we waited on her about 40 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Overall Experience”
Reviews.Author: Alexander M
Reviews.Content: The Orleans offers a great Las Vegas experience. It offers excellent value and a good family experience. The food is reasonably priced and is good quality. The staff were excellent. The rooms are good size, clean, and there is lots of parking. I have stayed here several times with the same opinion. I will visit here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dustycastetter
Reviews.Content: 3rd time staying there and always like. Everybody is so nice there from the front desk to the keno ladies they r all so sweet. We find the slots to be tight because we have never had any luck any of times we been there. We rented a car this time and it was well worth it for all the stuff we did. The shuttle is nice but we just did other stuff away from the strip and when you want to go downtown its better to just have a car. If you get a chance go to vegas4locals.com and they have auctions u can bid on and get for a cheap price on stuff. We got go cart tickets for about half price, CSI at mgm, Mike hammer tickets, The mob tour at tropicania, Mystery adventure tour and my favorite was jeff civillion at planet hollywood restraut at ceasers.All of this was about $180 total for all. Anyway we had our room comped and food comped so we got something out of the slots. Breakfast buffett was good. I went with the prime rib at court yard cafe and it was really good and the steak and eggs were good also, biscuts and gravy suck though.

Reviews.Title: “First time at The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Dick B
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at The Orleans. Everything was perfect. The coffee shop was excelent and so was the sports bar restaurant. You just have everythin that you need and don't have to leave for your whole stay. Very good selection of slots and we had fun playing even though we didn't win. We will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans Was Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: bspoff
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans for the Thankgiving basketball tournament. Convenient to stay at the same hotel as the arena, but that was the only perk. Rooms ok at best, casino smoky, restaurants average, poker room only had low stakes, reward comps were a joke. I would choose most of the hotels on the strip over this one. This hotel is more set up for older clientelle. Not a young, hip crowd like many other Vegas hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Visited the Orleans Casino”
Reviews.Author: greenridersfan
Reviews.Content: We had heard many goods things about this Hotel and Casino so we decided to take the shuttle from Bill's and check this place out for the atmosphere. We played in the casino (video poker) for about 3-4 hours on very little money and enjoyed ourselves very much. Cocktail service was good. The only complaint was the pumped in perfume but I got used to it after an hour. We had a late lunch at Fuddruckers which was good and reasonably priced. This is a locals casino and the clientele was older but we were able to play a long time on little money and having fun doing it. We will visit again and possibly stay there also.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Strip.....On the Money”
Reviews.Author: allan m
Reviews.Content: Great food..gaming(slots..horses and sports) and a relaxed.friendly atmosphere where " The answer is yes!! What's the question....Lots of points..promotions and other perks that the others just don't have.....Canal Street is first class..and the buffet's are the best in town ....It's our repeat favorite......

Reviews.Title: “December trip”
Reviews.Author: sarah h
Reviews.Content: The Orleans! Its a place you gotta visit. The staff are friendly, its a great place to meet up with friends. You can find cheap table games "We love craps" and the slot machines are fun to play here :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in the hotel at least...did not gamble”
Reviews.Author: occasionaltraveler66
Reviews.Content: What an excellent value for Vegas. We paid so little that I was concerned about what we'd find. But there was nothing cheap about the rooms, service, or "look" of the casino. Although I've never been to New Orleans, it kind of felt like a classy New Orleans. I noticed that the music played was country western. I thought, this is not New Orleans music. But we were in Vegas during some huge national rodeo thing. There were cowboy hats everywhere, so I'm guessing they were playing country western music for those attendees. The casino noise also wasn't as obnoxious as it can often get...the volume on the machines or something. There were smokers, and I hate smoke, but the air systems seemed pretty decent at sucking it up. I could not detect smoke in the hotel section. We were traveling as a couple with a mother-in-law. We booked under one name, so they upgraded us (free) to a two bedroom suite on the 21st floor! Now if you don't like your MIL maybe that would be bad, but the suite was very nice. All of the furnishings were very nice. There was a private bathroom for each bedroom. It had a huge wet bar area with a fridge, a living room with ample seating, and there were six flatscreen TVs in the three room suite. If you are traveling with a group, this would be the room to host the private party in. The bed was very comfortable, we slept well. We had dinner in the Courtyard Cafe. There was a distinct difference between the water/table folks and the waitresses. The water folks were on top of it, fast service. The waitress...not so much. The food though, once it arrived, was worth the wait. We had BBQ baby back ribs. We split the plate and we left full. The ribs were excellent, the cajun fries were v.g. and the steamed veggies were v.g, not a pile of mush. My MIL ordered a fruit plate. It was a warm muffin, cottage cheese and a HUGE plate of fresh fruit. We had a container of leftover fruit that we put in the fridge. It was definitely a place I'd eat at again. We were only making a pit stop on the way down to Lake Havasu City, so we didn't have time to partake of all the hotel has to offer. But I will definitely keep The Orleans on our radar for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Dorothy M
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vegas 2-3 times each year and always stay at The Orleans. Rooms are nice, gaming covers everything in terms of variety and denomination, but the best part is that the service everywhere is terrific! I've been courted by other properties and pay visits to them when I'm in town, but 'home' is The Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Local Hotel...Gambling...meh”
Reviews.Author: alwaysvegas
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Orleans several times over the last few years and it has certainly improved in the hotel sense...the rooms are VERY nice in the price range ($30/night or so depending on time of year). However, I have to consider the hotel from several perspectives... Rooms...The tower rooms are quite nice for the price and have nice marble counters, full-length mirrors, comfy bed, oversized pillows, and a very tasteful New Orleans-ish decor. Their "scam" (as I call it) resort fee is only $6 a day which is not too bad, considering what many of the Vegas hotels bilk their guests for. I just got back and this is the FIRST time ever that I received a Strip view and it was very nice and I did appreciate it. The registration desk employees have always been top-notch, friendly, and have always let me check in early (before 10am) if a room was available. I have to commend the hotel for their registration desk. I still had a tube-type TV, which had pretty bad resolution...I would've expected a flat-screen these days, but there were enough channels to keep me satisfied. I criticized the hotel previously for their simply horrible cocktail waitresses and keno staff who seemed to have a grudge against customers. I have seen *some* improvement. At least a few of the keno staff and cocktail waitresses were friendly to me, though it still wasn't on par with what I would expect from a service industry, especially in the locals market. Hello? I won $320 in keno can the keno cashier at LEAST say congratulations? I didn't tip her a thing because she was so smug about paying me. However, after observing many of the cocktail waitresses, I think their interactions are a bit better than before; however, I still saw several cocktail waitresses who never smiled and said "thank you" after a tip without even looking at customers. There was one standout waitress in the keno lounge whose name I didn't catch but she was a hit with everyone there. This was on 12/15 around 7pm. SHE knew how to be friendly and make people feel welcome As for gambling, and I am a video poker player...The Orleans has fallen off the radar in the last few years. In the 5 cent to 25 cent range, there are very few machines that tip the 99% return mark and most machines I observed were at the 94.7% payback range. Pretty horrible for a "locals casino"...I counted over THIRTY 100%+ payback machines at the Fiesta Henderson. The only grudge I have against the hotel rooms is that the doors close LOUDLY and I mean they SLAM. So if you are sensitive to noise, please consider somewhere else. I sleep with earplugs, but even in the afternoons when I was just watching TV it was SLAM, SLAM, SLAM every few minutes. Surely the hotel can do something about the damping on the doors? If you're a tourist then understand that this casino is geared towards locals and so you're going to find ALOT of smoke, perhaps alot of drinking, and maybe not the tourist trade you're accustomed to on the Strip. Unfortunately, you'll also find alot of local families who just let their children run wild and scream throughout the casino and restaurants. However, if you use a rental car (as I do), you'll find that the hotel is conveniently located to the Strip, airport, a quick hop-jump to downtown, and a bit longer drive to the Boulder/Henderson casinos. Would I stay here again? I think this was my last time. Due to their horrific video poker payback schedules, I think it's time to move on. I love the rooms, but I can simply stay in other hotels with MANY 100% payback video poker machines (Fiesta, Station Casinos) and not have to travel at all. I won't even get into the slot machines if you're a slot player. As with all the penny machines these days...they are dismal and volatile and, unless you get some sort of bonus round, your $20 is gone in less than five minutes. I play slots for about 1/2 hour when arrive and then I'm done. Maybe others can speak in more detail, but the machines here are terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Easy Access To Western Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: 41673Jewells539
Reviews.Content: Visited over Labor Day. Parking is plentiful. Pool is luxurious, jacuzzi is huge, kiddie pool, plenty of lawn chairs, shady spots are plentiful as well as sunspots, bar is nice with smoking area right there to watch games on flat screens. Plenty of slot machines, table games, poker tables, tournaments, racebook, and not jammed in, roomy between machines. Buffet is a bargain and most people know this as there is usually a line especially on Fri, Sat, and Sun. Plenty of other restaurants worth going to Friday's, Oyster Bar, etc. Rooms are larger than most hotels I've stayed in for a reasonable price. Make sure you get a B-Connected card just to get offers in case you come back. I love the place and am going back in March 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: AuntieB9573
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Orleans at least twice each year since it opened. Our trips are a combination of family visits and vacation. We find The Orleans to be an excellent value... clean rooms, speedy elevators, polite, friendly staff, outstanding food service both for variety and quality of meals. If you indulge in gaming at all, the Be Connected membership will lead to offers for very reasonably priced rooms on return trips. One on-site perk for hotel guests that insures that I will always return to The Orleans is the security afforded hotel guests. Orleans Security personnel are always on duty monitoring access to hotel elevators.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent inexpensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dogdrool
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have used this hotel for our last three visits to Las Vegas (last one March 2011) and have booked to go there again next March 2012. Our American friends are also attending next March and today phoned the hotel. It seems my friends mentioned we were members of the Orleans loyalty club. The hotel have, without prompting, emailed me today and have discounted the already low rate we had already booked saving us an extra $66 on an already low rate when compaired with hotel on the Strip. We have always found the hotel to be excellent value for money, well run and a fun place to stay. The rooms on each visit have been excellent. We go for the standard twin queen room. They are clean, large and well presented. On one occasion we had a problem with the plumbing which caused a few problems. When we commented on this we were promptly given two free buffet breakfasts. There are lots of good places to eat in the hotel and the buffet is very good value for money. The hotel is 1.5 miles from the Strip. We always hire a car as we like to travel about during the day. For those who do not have a car there is a regular free shuttle bus to the Strip or there are taxis available. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to minimise expenditure without going downmarket. Put simply it is a GEAT VALUE FOR MONEY HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: ajm1120
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days , comfortable room near elevator as requested, great having morning coffee no charge ,which was included in resort fee that also incuded access to computer in business office. Friendly staff and excellent value for meals in the restaurants .

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: IFlySolo
Reviews.Content: Always a great stay, The Orleans Hotel & Casino is a welcoming atmosphere for any traveler. Whether you journey from Los Angeles or from across the country, you will be welcomed warmly. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and the restaurants, from the coffee shop to the buffet, are attractively priced and provide great food. I choose The Orleans because it is my home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great value.”
Reviews.Author: liconj30
Reviews.Content: would recommend hotel to everyone. Nice people, clean rooms, great bloody marys.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel if it's your first time to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dragonflywhispers
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant hotel away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip. Excellent shuttle service...very handy food court...and our room was better than what we thought we would get...it even had a view of the Strip. The perfect hotel if it's your first visit to Vegas and you have children...it's a great way to ease yourself into the kaos and crazyiness. Oh, and the beds were so comfortable...best ever!... and I've stayed in alot of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans is our favorite!”
Reviews.Author: Shirl777
Reviews.Content: We recently had a fun-filled 4-day Christmas vacation with our two grown children at the Orleans. It's the very best because all the staff are so friendly. It's the best because of the size, the amenities, and the food is great. We've been to Vegas several times and tried other hotels/casinos, but we always come back to the Orleans as our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “LUV THE ORLEANS HOTEL AND CASINO <3!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lizette h
Reviews.Content: I love The Orleans I always stay there when i visit vegas good to take all the family!!

Reviews.Title: “Our Family Just Loved the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Chacha2u
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a family get together in Vegas during the month of November with family coming up from Utah, Colorado, Hawaii, San Diego and Dallas. We all had a fun-filled vacation, with the Orleans being the last hotel everyone came to meet up at to say our final goodbyes before heading back home. All 30 of us had a wonderful time there since we all have different tastes when it comes to gambling, food and just enjoying the amenities that this property had to offer. We didn't all eat together, with some doing TGIF, some enjoying the food court, Al's Oyster Bar or whatever fancied one's palate at the moment. Some took the time out between gambling to take in a movie or two during our stay, while others couldn't be pulled away from those table or slot machines at any cost. The rooms were more than adequate along with being spacious, clean and most of all comfortable, when it comes to the bedding. We were on the 11th floor and had a beautiful view when it came to looking out towards the city night lights. You can't beat the value for your money if you had to pay, but for us, these were comp rooms for all. One thing I've always enjoyed about the Orleans, is its spacious casino with the high ceilings and well thought out casino floor plan. You never feel like you're cramped in like you do in some smaller hotel casinos, and yet, its not overwhelming like those mega resorts where you just can't find each other or where you find yourself walking for days on end. The aisle for foot traffic is wide enough to accommodate their many patrons, and quite accessible & comfortable enough to maneuver around for those who may need to use a motorized chair which is also offered by the hotel for a reasonable price. Orleans employees are very friendly, courteous and professional, beginning with the valet, bell desk, front desk, table games, slot hosts and all the way up to the back of the house personnel such as the housekeeping staff. And now, for the main thing we came for, the gambling here....AWESOME! The variety and newness of slot machines were endless, along with the various table games that the Orleans offered, made this a hotel that we ALL enjoyed. Another important thing I need to mention here is not forgetting to pick up your Bconnected card which can be used at all Boyd's and Coast hotel casinos. You have to remember that this card is what helps you to earn comps, freebies and discounts where points can be used for dining too. I don't know if it was because we were coming to the end of our stay after being here from 11/11/11 and leaving 11/17/11 where many people had just finish dumping a lot of money into those machines, but I gotta say this, each one of us were very lucky on these machines, whether one played a poker machine, or one of those exotic penny machines, the Craps table, Pai Gow table or whatever it may be. We all at one point or another were happy with our winnings at the Orleans. Although this hotel is somewhat located about two minutes away from the strip, they do offer a shuttle to venture to its sister property the "Gold Coast Hotel & Casino" another nice hotel to stay at. The best thing I can say at this time is this entire trip ended with a lot of happy relatives going home with some big wide smiles and some winnings too! Again, we had a wonderful stay at the Orleans and guess what, we'll be back for Super Bowl 2012 and are looking forward to seeing all those friendly staff who have helped make our Vegas & "Orleans" experience such a memorable one! Happy Gambling!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good hotel, lots of fun, not overcrowded, good food.”
Reviews.Author: Fred H
Reviews.Content: This property is not as gaudey, overly done as the strip overpriced hotels and casinos. Its a decent, clean, modern, fairly priced perfect place to stay in Vegas. The food is better than average and is fairly priced. Become a club member and get specials (sometimes free rooms) and enjoy a fairly priced vacation or week-end. I have stayed there 3 different times and have no complaints about service or clean rooms. Their gym is good and machines all work. The cocktail service was abundunt and prompt.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Halatela
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at The Orleans consistently for the last year or so. I have to say that I completely enjoy this hotel, Rooms are clean and spacious, everything is pretty much onsite at the property. Kids Club, Movie theatre, bowling alley, able to get on a slot machine, there are plenty around, Restaurants in the hotel are decent. TGI Fridays, Coasta Cantina has a pretty decent early bird dinner, good prices, My last visit happened to be on Thanksgiving weekend, the hotel seemed busy with basketball tournaments going on in the arena. Very mixed crowd, but over all I could still sit at any slot machine I wanted to with no problem. Our room was recently upgraded, it actually had a flat screen tv. AC unit had a little rattle, but no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving Trip”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm T
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the orleans when in town .The rooms are clean,bathroom is quite large and the location is good for us to visit relatives.I like the atmosphere of the casino,we do not always win but enjoy the playing.We eat some meals here and the prices are not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun, Good hotel, Inconvenient location”
Reviews.Author: Chad1787
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orleans during a business conference in June. The King standard room was very well maintained and had recently been upgraded. The bathroom was rather small, but there was a couch/living area that was a nice addition to the room. The only complaint I had throughout the week-long stay was a plumbing problem in the sink that was there upon my arrival. It was taken care of promptly. The casino floor was always busy and energetic, and the wide variety of restaurants and buffets were great (TGI Fridays was awesome). The bowling center in the hotel is top-notch and is open 24 hours. Even the 10+ screen movie theater was first-class. My only complaint about the hotel at all is its location---being off strip, it was always a cab ride away from the main action of Las Vegas. I would have enjoyed being able to walk the strip from my hotel rather than grabbing a cab or a shuttle---which the hotel provided for free to its two other on-strip properties.

Reviews.Title: “Dated rooms with stained carpets, Older crowd, Nice Kids club”
Reviews.Author: DenverREO
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Orleans and our second visit to the Casino. The first visit was earlier in the year just to gamble while our kids were in the kids club which was nice to have some time as parents to ourselves.This most recent visit was during Thanksgiving week. We received 2 night free stay.... let's just say you get what you pay for. The carpet in our room had very large red and brown (basketball size) stains by the beds and in the open area. Made you think someone had gotten sick there. The AC unit in the wall just could never keep a comfortable temp. Either ran all night and froze you or did not run at all. The decor was older and dated. The beds were comfortable and sheets were clean. The gym was decent and cocktail staff is very much on their game. Shuttle to strip was easy and friendly so location was fine. The kids did enjoy the Kids Club and my husband and I enjoyed Big Al's Oyster bar. Nice staff and great Oyster Shooters. But Thanksgiving Buffet at French Market was $19? for lunch and was very average fare. Nothing to get excited about. I guess at the reg price of $8 I would have not complained but the mark up for the same bland food was a bummer. Mexican Restaurant.... stay away from the 99 cent margs. Just sugar and sugar. Blah! If you are looking for motel rate rooms, cheap fun filled with smoke around an older 55+ crowd then this is it. The rooms though REALLY need an overhaul. Im okay with dated but I am not okay with dirty. If you are looking for clean luxury rooms, high end restaurants and top quality food, younger lively crowd and hip atmosphere, and trendy bars and drinks this is not your stop.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: Justin_502
Reviews.Content: If you dont mind being a lil ways from the strip, its not a bad casino.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans...home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Nadine96782
Reviews.Content: The staff at Orleans is the best. They are very helpful and friendly. Everyone from front desk, to housekeeping, to food service personnel, security, valet, casino dealers and slot people made my trip very enjoyable. I travel to Vegas at least four times a year and I always stay at the Orleans. The rooms are big and the beds are soooo comfortable. I recommend this place to all my friends and family and they are never disappointed when they stay here. I come from Hawaii, and I know what true hospitality is and the Orleans exemplifies that same hospitality that we from the Aloha State come to appreciate. It's like my home away from home. Come, enjoy and see what I mean.

Reviews.Title: “Buffet”
Reviews.Author: topbrian42
Reviews.Content: We stopped in for the breakfast buffett, it was $6.99 with players card. Food was good. We would eat here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Comfortable and Squeaky Clean”
Reviews.Author: mommaKaty
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights, all comp'd at the Orleans :) The beds were comfortable, the rooms were sparkling clean and we had a wonderful time! I do not know why some persons complained of cigarette smoke in the rooms.There was NO trace of smoke on the side we were on, not in the elevators, not in the hallways, not in the rooms. We had a fantastic time. The entire casino was clean and safe. We will certainly go back again! The location is off the strip, but the shuttle takes you to the strip, so no worry. We had a rental car and parking was convenient in the garage and safe. All the casinos had free parking, which was a breeze to find a spot and go directly into each casino. You can even rent a car while at The Orleans, which is a PLUS!! We were able to go sightseeing to the Hoover Dam and the Grand Canyon and The Valley of Fire.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay off Strip!”
Reviews.Author: VegasSusie
