Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Orleans several times over the past 3 years and have always enjoyed it. We asked for a room with softer beds and ended up on the 21st floor in the Tower. The hallway has been renovated and the decor is very pleasing! The room, like all rooms at The Orleans, was very spacious, clean and the bed comfortable. The carpet, however, could use a re-do. The TV was a lovely large flat screen HD but unfortunately, was not hooked up properly or something. The screen was fuzzy and blurry as if the HD was not on. The box in the corner read Analog; obviously, I know little about these things. It is a shame to have a nice new TV in the room and not have it working. Sometimes we like to watch a movie in the room to take a break from the slots. This time, however, we took in a movie in the theater instead - always a nice diversion as well! They have a security person next to the elevators - they appreciate seeing your room card as you go by. Very nice to have them there. The check-in was prompt and friendly - at 11:30 a.m.! Very good service! Restaurants: We ate in the French Market Buffet for breakfast and it was very good indeed. With the Club Coast card, you can get a discount. Lots of good breakfast items and great selection. Courtyard Cafe: Hosts are very friendly, but the wait for our brekky was a tad long. They also serve Starbucks coffee now at the Internet Cafe in the front corner of the hotel up from the registration desk. I saved the BEST for last: The Prime Rib Loft: It is our favorite restaurant in Las Vegas! The best prime rib dinner you will ever have - nice salad to start, huge baked potato with all the trimmings and the prime rib --- it is to die for!! All for a great low price! Can't be beat! We have been to this restaurant at least 12 times, and never been disappointed. The servers and hosts are very personable and friendly, too. The casino is huge and we even had some good luck playing the slots! They constantly upgrade with the new machines, but keep some of the "classics" as well. A very friendly atmosphere. We think of The Orleans as our "home away from home" and always feel welcome there. Give it a try - you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “I'm sorry but not a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ann J
Reviews.Content: Well you get what you pay for. We had to stay here to get tickets to an event. After changing in the room we had to go stay somewhere else and come back to check out later. The room smelled like smoke for a non-smoking room. The hotel decor is very old and the halls and many parts of the hotel looked dirty. The bathroom was horrible with closet in bathroom (odd to me) and a loud sliding door. It is not in the safest location. The room was spacious and the casino was very large. The hotel had a movie theater and bowling alley but we did not do anything at the hotel after walking around to see our options. The food court was filty as well. We took pictures to share with family and friends not to stay here. I don't understand how this hotel was rated a 4. It is cheap and again, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, very clean”
Reviews.Author: happyandretiredkf318
Reviews.Content: We have been to Las Vegas at least 6 times and for the last 4 have stayed at The Orleans. It is definitely the best value in Vegas. The rooms are all suites and are immaculate. Housekeeping has kept this place at the top of my list for being the cleanest I have stayed in. The bedding and beds are top qualit. We don't gamble so the casino is not a large draw for us. Not being on the strip is not a problem because we always have a rental car. We love to go to all the casinos on the strip and just walk around and enjoy the beauty and take in some shows..

Reviews.Title: “Rooms Not Elegant but Clean and Doable”
Reviews.Author: onegadfly101
Reviews.Content: Usually like to stay a two hotels during a week stay in Las Vegas and The Orleans is one of them. My room was free do to past Casino Play, but I would call myself an average gambler. The room itself has all the amenities, and everything works. The TV is an older model and the carpeting is a bit shabby and needs to be replaced. Having said that, the room is doable, and that is what counts in Las Vegas. The Orleans itself has an average buffet, and also has a variety of restaurants to suit all budgets. Where the Orleans stands out, is the ease in obtaining complimentary meals while playing. The Orleans is off the strip and tries harder.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: jimjeno
Reviews.Content: This hotel is as good as many on the strip,The room was large and very clean with no trace of smoke,bathroom was the same. The dining was also very good with a variety to choose from. Although away from the strip, the regular free shuttle bus was always there. I would use this hotel again and would recommend it. GREAT VALUE.

Reviews.Title: “"1st choice stay in Las Vegas (Kid Friendly)"”
Reviews.Author: John U
Reviews.Content: The Orleans Hotel is one of the very best places you could possibly choose from in Las Vegas. It's location being just off the strip creates a very child friendly atmosphere. Whilst being a Casino it also has very family orientated areas like a bowling alley, cinema, arcade and pool. The Orleans is a vast amount of floor space containing many places for fun and joy. There is many food orportunities here like the wonderfull Buffet which contains a seafood section, pasta section, meat station, chinese station, salad bar, soup station and dessert section (make sure you leave room for the desserts there to DIE for)! The rooms are nothing special but very clean and fresh (but in Las Vegas your not really expecting a 5 star room). And finally the staff. The staff are very accommodating to all your needs. They are very helpfull and friendly. So please stay at the Las Vegas hotel "The Orleans" to have the most memorable time in the famous town LAS VEGAS!

Reviews.Title: “If you care about a budget-there is NOTHING better!”
Reviews.Author: mondella
Reviews.Content: I been everywhere man! In Vegas that is! Orleans treats me like family before, during and after the stay! I have stayed at less expensive hotels and more expensive but for the amenities and price, Orleans has the right attitude and they appreciate your business! They offer free nights for frequent guest and the variety of entertainment, food and fun gets me all tingly inside just thinking about it! Im going back in the first week of December 2011!

Reviews.Title: “Fun-fun-fun!!!”
Reviews.Author: USALOVETOTRAVEL2
Reviews.Content: This is the BEST location if you`re picking someone up at the airport-hop-skip and a jump away-but no bother:)We`ve enjoyed this hotel many times-why-you say??The rooms are awesome-very large-very clean-veryeverything you need.This hotel also has I believe 7 resturants-a bowling alley-a movie theater-very helpful staff.Oh did I mention the spetacular pool and spas outdoors??Our grandson loved it.There`s also a total spa with unbelievable showers-every anemity you could so desire-a steam room and massuses-the women one side the men the other.Great security also:)Of course an adult playground the casino:)Treat yourself next time you`re in Vegas-expierience The Orleans:)I marked couples-as it`s usually my husband and myself-but we`ve also taken our Grandchildren there-as there`s plenty of good entertainment for them also:)

Reviews.Title: “Only place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dana93551
Reviews.Content: This Hotel/Casino is a great place to stay! The rooms ave super spacious, clean, modern, and very comfortable. The food selection is great! Whether your looking for a romantic dinner, a casual dining dinner, a buffet, or a great food court; this place has it all! The staff at every level are courteous and friendly. The gaming is great, with a huge selection and many choices for everyone in your party. The entertainment is exciting too! Who doesnt love to dance and the groups they bring in, are fantastic! This Hotel/Casino has my five star rating, and its the only place I'll stay!

Reviews.Title: “After 8 visits we still LOVE the Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: 3chihuahuas
Reviews.Content: We’re pretty low rollers with hubby playing slots and video poker – I mostly play craps. The Orleans is very good to us, we feel really comfortable there – it’s home. About every 60 days hubby has two nights, anytime, comped and I have two nights comped, Sun-Thurs. They allow us to back-to-back the room. We drove to LV from SoCal for my birthday. We had quite a few things planned to do with not much gambling this trip. Tuesday, November 15 The Orleans is now charging $5.00 per night for a strip view room and since our room is free, we went ahead and took room 1936, strip view. Room 1936: https://picasaweb.google.com/115020347051893738999/OrleansRoom1936

Reviews.Title: “Great Option for Families”
Reviews.Author: JustaGuyWhoTravels
Reviews.Content: The Orleans Hotel & Casino is a great option for families. We spent two nights at the Orleans to attend a conference at the hotel. My wife and I had a room, and we had a second room for my mom. We brought our 10 month old son. On our previous visit to Las Vegas we stayed at the Hard Rock. The Orleans is much cleaner and family friendly. Best value for the money. Las Vegas, as a vacation spot, is not very family friendly. But some hotels do a decent job of catering to travelers with kids. There are many dining options at the Orleans. They have a great cafeteria that is great for families, because there is such a wide variety of food. The prices for foods and stuff at the gift shop is also reasonable. They have a movie theater, a casino Although very plain, the room was clean, spacious, and quiet. We enjoyed our stay, and would recommend the Orleans to anyone traveling to Las Vegas with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Trip I won that was beyond my every epectations!”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn B
Reviews.Content: From the time we got off the plane everyone at The Orleans made us fell like family. I da won an entry into a slot tournament and did not know what to expect.We had the most excellent service from the top down. we had great food, great rooms and great hospitality.All the staff went out of there way to make us feel special.Much to my husband's surprise I won eight place. It was a nice retirement gift for him.After working 40 years I was very happy he could enjoy my good fortune.We had not been to Vegas in over 20 years. going on this trip has made us want to go back and see all our new friends at The Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return to the Orleans!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dwirick
Reviews.Content: Wow, where do I begin? First off, I traveled with my family to Las Vegas October 18-24, 2011. As soon as we walked in, we were struck by how down-to-earth and helpful the front desk staff were. They were courteous and friendly. I would like to disagree with many who posted that the "smoky smell overpowered the casino," by stating that there was not a strong smoky presence, in fact, it was a lot less smoky than many strip hotels! The pool, although small, was very nice and clean. It was very nice, because there were not a lot of people,and it was extremely quiet. We enjoyed the variety of food selections, and appreciated that a meal did not cost an exorbitant amount of money. It was nice to be able to grab a quick bite or sit down for dinner. The cafe on the casino floor, was wonderful, because it was open 24 hours, affordable, and had a large menu. We went here for breakfast and lunch. We did not utilize the movie theater or the bowling alley, but we did view the bowling area, and it was very clean and updated. Next time, we will most likely use these services. Also, we loved the shuttle and where the shuttle took us on the strip. It is user friendly and convenient. Finally, the rooms were immaculate, the bed was comfortable, and the room was very large. We loved it. One complaint, and why I can't give this hotel a 5 rating--I had to pay $13/day fee for internet access in my room. It is ridiculous, unfounded, and I want an explanation as to how this money is funneled/applied. In the 21st century, the internet is commonplace, hotels should be able to provide this service free of charge. The fees need to stop! Fees aside, we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if you don't mind being way off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Cinderzz
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very clean and buffet is adequate (not as good as reviews would indicate - very standard buffet fare). Staff is helpful, checkin faster than lightning. If you want to save money, this is a good bet. The shuttle goes to the strip, near the mirage and Caesar's Palace. However, if you want to walk out of your room into the action, this is not the place. The strip is not close enough to walk unless you really want the exercise. If you are driving, of course, this is also a good bet. There is definitely value at this hotel, but the pizzazz of being on the strip is not there.

Reviews.Title: “OUR 5th STAY!”
Reviews.Author: Ed-Venture
Reviews.Content: Possibly the best all-around value in Las Vegas! Always clean, always as advertised, and always user-friendly! The more I check through the list of rooms vs. rates/location in Lost Wages, the more I appreciate the Orleans. HUGE room with 2 queens, a sitting area with couch, chair, desk, etc., and in-room coffee$27/night foir 2 people...plus only $5. more for a high-up room with a view of the strip. The restaurants are great and very reasonable. $8 for a fabulous all-you-can-eat buffet (with a player's card...which is free). Free shuttle to the Strip. Huge bowling center on-site...$2/game. What's not to like?

Reviews.Title: “First Time at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Tarakate
Reviews.Content: First time at the Orleans. he friendliest dealers in Vegas. Great hotel for the money. Free shuttle to the Strip every 15-20 minutes. Very clean throughout. Any help or questions we had was answered by a very friendly staff, excellent service, Only suggestion would be to extend the shuttle hours just a bit .Maybe to 1AM .Did notice a few people said the same after going to a late show .

Reviews.Title: “A value and a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: SouthernOhioNaillady
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Orleans the last two times we visited Las Vegas. The rooms are spacious,clean, and comfortable. Even though it is off strip it is very convenient to take advantage of the free shuttle service to the Gold Coast and to the strip. The restaurants and buffet are very good and you can't beat the prices! After signing up for the players' card we receive great offers for free rooms and slot play. Even though the hotel is a family friendly environment I did not see as many kids as I did on the strip. This was a good thing as I was concerned that there would be too many children and too much noise . Two years ago we spent 2 nights there and last year we spent 4. We will definitely stay there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for kids”
Reviews.Author: Rosalie G
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the rooms were larger than most. The hotel has an arcade, bowling alley and movie theatre, along with several kid friendly restaurants. If you are traveling with children, this is the hotel to stay at. The hotel also has a shuttle to the strip, making traveling much easier.....no strip traffic to deal with!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: drkatym
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels in Vegas. The last three years we've chosen the Orleans. Whoever designed the rooms should receive a medal. The rooms are clean, bright and every aspect has been thoughtfully placed. The beds are comfy, the bathrooms are clean and very well maintained. The pool is perfectly placed for the guests. I could not have mapped out a better plan!! Applause to the Manager!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay and win!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bonnie J
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Orleans since we had our Family reunion there in 2006. we have been getting the promotion and take advantage of them as often as we can . I love the place and the staff.My husband plays poker and me the slots sometimes I win sometimes I don't, but this time I won and had a wonderful time. Thank You Orleans we will be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Clean Place”
Reviews.Author: rikster45
Reviews.Content: We've been going here for years and we always have a clean room and just the layout is great! great places to eat,movie theatre,bowling,kids area, everything for a family believe it or not!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey R
Reviews.Content: I vacation 1 - 3 times per year in Las Vegas and the Orleans is my favorite place to stay. The staff is very accommodating and the rooms are large and very nice. I have found them to be very clean and quiet. I have stayed on the strip and downtown, and prefer the Orleans. They are unpretentious, and don't charge for every little thing, like some of the hotels on the strip. The restaurants are all very good, and the food court sure is nice when the late night munchies hits. The gaming is very fair and they have a large selection of table and slots. The video poker seemed to be paying off as expected. I really liked the nice pool. I recently had stayed at an expensive Hotel on the Strip, and could not even find a deck chair at the pool it was so crowded. The Orleans provides a Coffee Pot in the room, not like the expensive hotel, where I had to go down to the lobby to get an expensive coffee (what a pain). I have been happy with the level of comps provided by the Orleans. I believe this is the best value for the money I have found so far. They comp much better than the Stations for outsiders like me. It is a great location, very close to the strip and other stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Great comfortable place to stay with lots to do”
Reviews.Author: kathyc45140
Reviews.Content: We really like this casino and staying here is so convenient. There is a spa, exercise room, pool, movie theater, bowling alley, and a big event center. There is a large area for table games and plenty of slot machines. There is also a nice sports book. If you are hungry, there are a lot of options including a TGI Fridays and a food court with Fuddruckers, Subway, Baskin Robbins, and Sbarro. The buffet is always good. It doesn't have as many choices as the strip hotels, but doesn't cost as much either. When you need a break from gambling, go upstairs and catch a movie or a game of bowling. The hotel rooms are very nice, with both a desk and a couch and plenty of space.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money”
Reviews.Author: buddy0011
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Vegas and had a great time! Having stayed on the strip twice before we decided to try something different this time. If you are an earlybird and want to go to the strip this might not be the place for you as the shuttle doesn't start till 9:30am but it does run till 12:30am. Taxi to the strip is around $10. As for the rooms they are large and clean, we had a room looking out toward the strip. This was nice but the view looking toward the mountains is also nice. Try and get a high floor and somewhat close to the elevators as we had a room almost to the end of the hall, it was like walking a city block! If you like to play BJ they have $5 tables all day. The casino is large with many choices in slots, I really enjoyed the Jokers Heist machine it payed well mid afternoon don't play on it late just takes your money. They don't have alot of the newer machines but still enough to pick from. As for food, they have something for everybody. We ate at the cafe for breakfast, very reasonable pricing and good food, the buffet is alright the price is right but you get what you pay for, oh and make sure to charge to your room as we ended up having all our meals and resort fees comped. We are not high rollers so I was very surprised they comped us at all. The employees are very nice and helpful. Our safe was locked so I called down and they had someone there in 5 min. The smell is alittle over whelming as they pump in a strong vanilla like smell. If you are so inclined to taking children this place has alot for them to do. I think the next time we go we'll try their sister property the Gold Coast as there are a couple of other casino's close by, the Orleans has nothing in walking distance to them. Overall was very pleased with our experince at the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Unassuming gem in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: GatorRandy
Reviews.Content: We were searching for a hotel with a trusted children's program and discovered the Orleans. It is away from the Strip but they have a complimentary shuttle, that goes every 30 minutes, to the Strip. The day we went down to the Strip, we could not wait to get back to the hotel! The children's program is great fun and a real value. My niece loved it! The hotel is a bargain, neat and clean and very accommodating. Lots of low cost food choices including a food court with familiar chain restaurants. The casino is comfortable with an absence of the typical Vegas drunken revelers. All in all, just a wonderful place for a family visit to Vegas. I would recommend this property to anyone. Check out the incredible hot tub and pool. I could not have been more favorably impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: CherylKent
Reviews.Content: My third stay at this great hotel. Okay it doesn't have all the glitz and glamour of some of the strip hotels but for value it just cannot be beat. The rooms are large and comfortable – there were six of us and we had three rooms on the 13th floor. Two rooms had fantastic strip views and I mean fantastic – you could see from the Stratosphere to Mandalay Bay. The other room had lovely mountain views. The atmosphere of the place is friendly and there is a great selection of bars and restaurants together with a multi screen cinema and bowling alley. They had two bands in the lounge while we were there and both were brilliant. Special mention to the staff in the Courtyard Café who were really friendly and efficient and the food was hot, tasty and very reasonably priced. The staff at the Orleans are great but sadly this visit I found some of the croupiers to be somewhat frosty and unfriendly and on occasion bordering on rude to some of the players. This was not true of all – Shirley was lovely. The free shuttle to the heart of the strip is frequent and easy to use. All in all if you are looking for a good value place to stay I’m not sure that you could beat the Orleans

Reviews.Title: “Have a car while in Vegas? This could be one option”
Reviews.Author: anniespokescat
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean, large and comfortable. The lobby was busy. Ck in and out was quick and easy. No added hidden charges found on my bill. There is a $6.00 resort fee over room price plus taxes. The only thing was the outside of the windows were dirty and made it hard to take photos. There is a lot to photograph from the upper floors. Beautiful view of the strip 2 miles away. This is a common problem in all hotels in L.V. do to weather. The window cleaner business should do well there. The balconies are just eye candy not useable. There were a lot of places to eat and the casino was better then a lot of the off strip hotels. Patrons were dressed nice and were polite. Kids were abound early in the eve. but seemed well behaved as were the adults. Beware that it is a smokers haven. Non smokers, Sat. night is the worst, avoided it before 1 a.m.. Did not smell any "funny smoke" as I have at Strip Hotels. They have guards at the elevators to keep out non-hotel guests (hey singles patrons), not a party atmosphere a bit laid back . Lots of business people seem to stay there. Prices reasonable, food cheap like most of Vegas. Parking well, that is hit or miss 24 hrs. Go between the taxi entrance (strip side of building) and the pay parking (WHY???) garage, (that's always empty) to get to the overflow parking. The attached arena does not even seem to be there except on very big event nights. A good place to lay your head, but have a car to get anywhere or expensive cabs are the other option.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Dale G
Reviews.Content: After staying here for 2 nights here I honestly can say it is too good to be true.From the workers to the dining to the gaming everything was great. Its the best bargain in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain near "The Strip"”
Reviews.Author: Darlene B
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Orleans while visiting a friend in Las Vegas. The rates are great, the slots seemed pretty "loose"-allowing me to play a long time-and the hospitality is superb.The rooms are very clean, large and QUIET! I loved the fact that transportation to the airport is seamless and inexpensive.AND the location makes getting to and from the freeways a cinch.

Reviews.Title: “No Hassles at the Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: JoAnne2910
Reviews.Content: I just spent 3 days at the Orleans and had a great time! They have movie theatres, spa, and several other great amenities. I ate at The Loft Steakhouse and had a wonderful meal, which was not overpriced at all. The Courtyard Cafe provided great, inexpensive breakfasts. One of my favorite features about the Orleans is that it is off the strip, but not far from the strip. I prefer to stay away from the strip, so the Orleans provides great parking and a quick get away! They have lots of fun slots, too. Many different restaurants and eateries.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Acmeflower
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas many times, staying both on the strip and downtown. This trip, my husband found the Orleans. We ended up getting a 4 day package deal which included airfare and hotel. I was feeling a bit odd about being a mile off the strip and knew it would not be walking distance. I also was concerned that it would be a rundown dive. Boy was I surprised. It is off the strip on Tropicana, but it was fantastic. It is large, well maintained. No old cigarette smells. The staff were all friendly. We had absolutely no wait to check in. The room was large with a king bed, couch, desk, chair and flat screen TV. We did not have a view of anything other then the parking lot but I found out later that if you ask for a strip view, it can be arranged. The pool area was large with 2 pools and hot tub. Nice lounge chairs with plenty of space for personal privacy. An outdoor bar with fair prices. The casino was so much fun. They have every game possible and the cocktails waitresses were attentive. The crowd was mostly older folks. We are mid 50's and I felt like one of the youngest. This in no way took away from my fun. I would not recommend this for younger people because there really is no "nightclub" scene. Several great restaraunts, a movie theatre and a bowling alley are part of this complex. They even offer a free shuttle bus that goes to the strip every half hour from 9 am until 1230 am. It continues to make rounds between Bills Gambling hall on the strip (next to Bally's), The Gold coast (next to the Rio)-which was a fun stop and back to the Orleans. I would definitely stay here again. I really liked the fact that I could go to the strip and get all the noise and excitement and then return to the Orleans where the casino itself seemed quieter. There were always crowds of people but I think the machines make less "bing, bang, boom" noises. Anyway I had a great trip and did not get a headache from the noise. There is also free wifi in the lobby coffee shop, which I used often. Try this place, I am sure you will like it.

Reviews.Title: “I keep coming back!”
Reviews.Author: MrLorin
Reviews.Content: Just got back from another flawless stay at The Orleans. The room prices are good, and the rooms are clean and big. No problem finding a parking spot, even on the weekends. The staff has always been professional and friendly. Plus, I love the huge buffet. Have stayed at this hotel ten times now over the years. Join the "B Connected" rewards program, and receive fantastic offers by e-mail to this establishment and its sister properties.

Reviews.Title: “A true Vegas bargain”
Reviews.Author: naiswaku
Reviews.Content: The Orleans Casino is a great bargain all the time. This clean hotel always has wonderful prices. Although it is not offered on a lot of the web sites, including Orbitz, it is worth checking out. The hotels web site offers the best prices and is worth checking out. The staff is quite helpful, the rooms are clean and large and the choice of restaurants runs the gamut from fast food at the food court to great Chinese and Japenese food. It's not the newest hotel in Vegas but it nicely maintained.

Reviews.Title: “5 day gambling trip”
Reviews.Author: rphpcf
Reviews.Content: I've been coming to Vegas for over 30 years and I've watched the strip becoming very beautiful, but very poor in gambling value for the low stakes gambler. I started staying at the Orleans about 3 years ago because I feel I at least have a chance at winning. It's about 1 mile west of the strip on Tropicana. I play mainly video poker and blackjack and the odds are better here than at most places on the strip. My gambling level on the strip would never rate comps or the interest of a host offering me free rooms whenever I've asked for them. The rooms are larger than average with a separate sitting area and the all important coffee pot with coffee and fixins. The rooms are always clean and very comfortable. I've only seen flat screen tv's when I've gotten a room on the high floors, but it seems they are slowly converting more and more over. The multiple restaurants meet all of my needs, and I'm usually able to pay for most of my meals with points earned from gambling. I usually rent a car so I can get around, but the Orleans does have shuttles all day long to the Gold Coast and Bill's Gambling Hall on the center strip. The Orleans seems to cater more to the local gamblers, because they are always having give-a-ways and contests, but I'm always able to enter them as long as I'm there.

Reviews.Title: “Worth looking for”
Reviews.Author: 53449Stacy_L
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice place to stay in Las Vegas , try the Oleans. Good food , Very nice rooms- with good prices. Gamble there and next time they might give you 2 nights free. I go their 1 or 2 times a year. And i'm not a big gambler but they give me perks like I am. Big hotel that feels like home.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: lovininvegas
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is a very clean and comfortable casino/hotel. The variety of slots is amazing. The restaurants are affordable and very good as well as varied. I would recommend this hotel/casino highly.

Reviews.Title: “TR Day 1 - Orleans - First time there and I was pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: kknoles
Reviews.Content: My first trip report, be gentle Day 1 I went for a day (October 20th) by myself. My husband and some friends were meeting me the next day for the weekend (so more TR to come). Had a ruby card so I got the room for $30. The Orleans charges a 6 dollar resort fee which I didn't think was a big deal. I arrived at about 10:30am from Miami and a bit tired. I just wanted to put my things in the room and relax a bit. I thought there is no way they have the room ready that early, but faced a 2 minute wait to be given my keys within 5 minutes. It took longer to get to the room than check in for me. The room - the room is a basic hotel room. It is clean which is extremely important. I didn't see stains on the carpet but the hallways are worn and very peachy if that matters to you. It is a bed, a sofa and a TV and a bathroom. The bathroom had a tub/shower combo with basic amenities, again clean. I read on other reports about the closet in the bathroom. I was still surprised to see it. So weird to have your hanging closet in the bathroom, but I was there for 1 night and it didn't much matter to me. The bed wasn't a pillowy bed, but I did manage to be able to sleep. It was cold at night and I so wished there was a blanket on the bed (it only had a piece of blue fabric at the foot of the bed). I had gambled all day and was too tired to call down for one which would have easily fixed that situation. But hey for $30 bucks it was a definite deal! The service - I have to say with the exception of one even in the Coasta Cantina Restaurant (reason for 4 not 5 rating), I was really impressed with the personnel at the Orleans. They were down home friendly and made you feel welcome. The check in and check out, the slot attendants, the housekeeping staff, the security guards and the staff at Koji were so nice. It was my first time there so they took the time to tell me about their property and help me find things (it's a big casino). I thought that said a great deal of good about the staff as a whole and considering I was alone, that made a world of difference to me. Restaurants - I went to Koji for lunch and Coasta Cantina for dinner. Koji was great service and food. I had my favorite, a wonton noodle soup and it was one of the best I had. The staff were very nice. The Coasta Cantina had really good food. I had a peach margarita that was very tasty and this trio of dips with chips that was the best I ever had. You can get full just on that! But of course I ate more. I got the chicken burrito. It was really great. My only negative comment is the waitress, although attentive at the beginning, forgot about my food delivery. I sat there while others came after me, ate and left. The hostess was clueless even though I was practically in front of her. I finally flag another person down and said a burrito should not take that long. Of course they don't but the order was definitely lost or forgotten. She was handling so many big tables I think I was just lost in the shuffle. But if you like Mexican and Chinese these two restaurants were affordable and definitely do overs. I would go back! The gambling - I played some video poker and slots. Things weren't going well at the penny or dollar. These machines are a bit tight. Not one big win unfortunately. Palace Station - I decided after lunch to go to check out another Casino I have never been to, Palace Station. A $10 taxi. The minute I walked in, I wanted to turn around and walk out. I really didn't like the vibe in this Casino. The clientele were different from Orleans. Orleans seemed to have more laid back patrons, I liked that. The Palace Station felt like I had to hold my purse for dear life. I played about 20 minutes, couldn't stand it any more and jumped in a cab to the Palms. The Palms - boy was this a mistake. Just a comment. I went to about 10 casinos on this trip at least. The Palms is the only one that gave me drinks in a cheezy 4 oz plastic cup. NOT impressive. The machines were tighter than you can imagine. I was going to eat at the mexican restaurant here but they ignored me so I decided, that's it and went back to Orleans. Back at Orleans - I ate the great Mexican meal mentioned above and played a bit more. Then off to bed. In all the Orleans was friendly, good food at the two restaurants. Check in was friendly, slot attendants were really nice. Room was fine for $30 dollars. Had a good latte at the Java Vegas and off to the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: amawalkbw
Reviews.Content: We decided on the Orleans given the price was VERY reasonable and the reviews on Travel Advisor seemed to be more favorable overall. They were spot on. Hotel was very clean, and upbeat. We asked for a room on a higher floor overseeing the strip and the clerk said "sure, no problem...". They gave us a great spot on the 19th floor which had a nice view of the strip. There are plenty of places to eat inside but the French Buffet restaurant was a great deal for both breakfast and dinner so we hit that a few times (though I saw some good deals at TGI Friday's as well). Walking through the casino you did pick up a bit of smokiness which was not overpowering but was still there whenever you came through. I liked the that there were plenty of penny, nickel, and quarter slots and video games for my wife to learn how to play and only lose $10 over an hour or two. I liked that they had $5 roulette which I milked $100 for a good hour and walked away even. The bus to the strip was not so bad a wait either. We took that in one night and had no issue getting on coming or going (but we were there mid-week, so I'm not sure about the weekend) My only gripe like many others is terrible internet connectivity (and paying $10 for it !) Probably done on purpose to make you get out of your room and go gamble or eat downstairs. Nice place overall. Not super fancy but very nice enough place for $50/night to feel that you got your money's worth and then some.

Reviews.Title: “We were treated very well, almost like family”
Reviews.Author: Bernett
Reviews.Content: The hotel was all that I expected and more. The staff was wonderful to us.

Reviews.Title: “Not that good”
Reviews.Author: bigguy6
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in late Oct based on reviews on this site. Wished I hadn't. The rooms and the hall ways are in serious need of refurbeshment. The stains on the hall carpets are terrible. The buffett (once one of the best) is average at best. And most disappointing the casino is in rip off mode. I play blackjack and for an off the strip property the minimums are too high and all but a few table have funny rules (i.e. something they call "fun blackjack" which , amoung other thing only pays even money on a blackjack.Who this is fun for other than them is hard to say). I would guess based on this the pay out settins on the slots are equally uncustomer friendly. Apparently Vegas has been hurt especially by Indian casinos in California and Arizona. Thier responds has been to pospone maintenance and to set the games to a high house %. This will only drive away more of thier costumers.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans,,,Best hotel in Las Vegas for the average joe.”
Reviews.Author: Greg L
Reviews.Content: I can tell you I have been coming to vegas for 10 years and have found "The Orleans" to be the best hotel for my weekend stays. I have stayed at the big hotels "Belagio, MGM, Mandalay Bay" and can say I am never as satisfied as when I stay at The Orleans....The Valet service is the best among them all I never have to wait the 15 plus minutes (several times)while visiting friends who booked their stay at Mandalay Bay, and I tip well. The Orleans rooms are always clean and the maid service is so quick making your room. The Prime Rib Loft is very nice, intimate place to enjoy a meal with your special someone, and the wait staff is very pleasent as is the hotel and gaming staff. I go to The Orleans to relax and thats what they provide, a relaxing pleasant atmosphere.... Thanks again, Orleans...see you soon

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel~”
Reviews.Author: KarieJ
Reviews.Content: I really like the Orleans hotel. It is located several miles from the strip, and if I had come to experience Vegas night life, I don't think I would have liked that. There is a bus that will take you back and forth from the strip for $7 a day. However, I came for events taking place in the Orleans, and the hotel was like a small city, so I didn't leave the whole time I was there. The buffet was better than others I have experienced on the strip, and there are several other restaurants and a food court. There was one gift shop, which was very nice. When I checked in, I recieved coupons that saved money at most of the restaurants. There was a bowling alley and a movie theater, but I didn't use either one of those. I went to the Osmonds show in the Showroom, and both the show and the room were really nice. I didn't like having to pay a mandatory "resort" fee just for the pleasure of staying there (in addition to the room rate), but it was only $6 a night so not too bad. It did include free internet in the coffee shop, so that was a plus. The room was nicely decorated and clean. The only complaint I had with the cleanliness was there were hairs left over from previous guests in the bathroom. The room was a long walk down a very long hall... not bad for me, but might be something others need to take into consideration. I would stay again, but not if I wanted to be on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Another good visit”
Reviews.Author: JBBT
Reviews.Content: This is now our third stay at the Orleans. Still great value – we booked through an offer on the website & got a comp room one night out of the 5 we stayed as well as a great price for the other nights. Although I get e-mails for offers also check the website as this one did not come on the e-mails. I phoned to book and the lady who sorted out the booking was very helpful & patient to sort out the best deal she could for me. All the staff we have had dealings with, have always been really great. Ate in Prime Rib Loft again. Excellent value and really good Prime Rib. The buffet for breakfast is OK with a good choice. Burgers in Fuddruckers is a good experience for us from the UK- adding your own choice of salad, onions etc to the basic excellent burger. The staff here was great also. I decided to change my order having paid for it whilst waiting for the food. No problem it was changed without question & I got to keep a free drink that was with the original item at no charge. Rooms are still large & comfortable and good value. They are not state of the art but have all you need unless you must have a flat screen TV. The only down side on this trip was a long delay about 30 minutes one day for the shuttle bus to the strip. One bus came but not enough room so had to wait for the next. The other times it was about 10-15 minutes which was acceptable. We heard from another guest that the buses have been reduced to 2 from 3 but are still the same size, so at busy times that can be an issue. It would not stop us staying here again and look forward to our next stay when in Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans made believers out of us!!”
Reviews.Author: theMcEwens
Reviews.Content: My husband & I go to Las Vegas 3 times a year and have always stayed on The Strip. This year, since we were seeing The Osmonds at The Orleans, we decided to give this hotel a try. What a fantastic jewel it turned out to be! The Staff was always pleasant, the room excellent (Strip View), and such a relaxed atmosphere throughout the hotel! We were there for almost a week and do not have one complaint. What could we complain about....great food at reasonable prices, 18 theatre cinema, concert hall, 72 lane bowling alley and the biggest surprise of all.....a Hockey Arena!! Yes, we did attend a hockey game while we were there and had a great time. I almost forgot to mention that there is a shuttle that will take you to and from The Strip all day and up to 12:30 a.m. We never had to wait more than 10 minutes either way. The Orleans have made believers out of us and this will definitely be our hotel of choice whenever we visit Las Vegas in the future. Thank you...Thank you for such a positive visit and honestly can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “7th trip to the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: joncor18
Reviews.Content: October 24-28th This was our 7th year in a row staying at the Orleans. Unlike our other 6 visits that were perfect in every way, this trip did have an issue that came up. I will not specifically mention the problem that occurred on the casino floor because the matter was handled professionally & swiftly. What more can you ask for? Cheers to.... 1. "Dawn" the slot manager,.... for going way out of her way to treat customers with the greatest respect. For believing in us that there was an issue, and following through on taking care of the matter. 2. "Maggie" at Friday's Restaurant. She was a super nice, excellent waitress. Mag's, if you are wondering which customers we were ,,,, I was the one who ordered the vanilla bean cheesecake, and dipped it into my buffalo wing sauce. You also said you would try this combo if I dared. Did you yet? 3. Security guards at the elevators. So they sit there and look for you room key when you walk by..simple enough. However what is not noticed by most is how long some of these guards have been there. Loyalty deserves attention! Great Job!!! Jeers..... 1. The Fab Band in the Brendan’s Irish bar. We gave up our last night in Vegas to listen to this "Beatles" band. We got there early (7:30) to get good seats. The band starts at 8pm. Game 6 of the World Series was on the big screen behind the stage, and some guests were watching it while others were waiting for this band to start. Well it's now 8:30 and not one of the 5 members of this band felt it necessary to simply walk up to their mic and announce that they will start playing after the game is over (which turned out to be past 10pm). It was apparent the bar told the band to hold off until the game was over, but is it so hard to let the people in the bar who some gave a night up in Vegas to listen to you the plan of action? Being a total Beatles fan and musician the question may be "was it worth the wait?" Oh wait, this is an Orleans Hotel/Casino review. This band represented themselves and not the Orleans. I’ll save them for another review. Once again, another great stay at the Orleans, and we look forward next year!!!!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE BUT NOISY DOWNSTAIRS”
Reviews.Author: FUBSYWOMAN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Orleans for $51/night, which was great value for a large and beautiful room just off the strip -- which was where we wanted to be. It's a great value, but like most hotels in Vegas with a casino, it's an assault of noise when you enter, because the casino is right there. Even the restaurants are part of the casino noise, so we ordered room service for $2 each, and the quiet was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: cbo49r
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large and very nice for the price. Nothing fancy, but they are clean and comfortable. The bathrooms are dated and could be tight for two people who need to preen. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The buffets are extremely affordable, $7.99 for breakfast is a steal. Their oyster house was above average, and the late night cafe's $5.99 steak and eggs was very good. Ask for VIP seating at the comedy show, you get plush seats in the front row. Well worth the $12 to see up and coming comics. Make sure to get the "B-Connected Card". Its free, and you get $$ off everything you buy at the hotel. It was really nice to have a big movie theatre and bowling alley at the hotel. The gym was very nice; new ellipticals and treadmills and dumbells that went to 90lbs. The complimentary shuttle ran to Bills (across from Bellagio and Bally's) every 10-15 mins and was very nice. Negatives: Extremely smokey on the casino floor. Pillows in the rooms were not great. Overall, I'd stay again, but the volume of smoke on the floor really needs to be looked at by the folks at the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Less than satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: smittenkitten_20
Reviews.Content: I had to stay at the orleans for a friends wedding and found this hotel overwhelming in size. There were many choices for food. The maid service was less than desired. Our room was "cleaned" on a daily basis which was basically was the maids making the bed and that was it. There was garbage left on a daily basis whenever we came back to our room. We also found that housekeeping didn't respect the do not disturb rule and disturbed us. One day (we had the sign on our door)and house keeping knocked and we said no and they came in anyway. This isn't a bad hotel it just isn't somewhere id want tp stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money, shuttle service convenient”
Reviews.Author: JackSpade_79
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for over a week in the summer. I chose the Orleans because of the incredible rates when compared with other LV hotels. Even for an off-strip hotel, the rates were quite good. There is a complimentary shuttle bus that runs frequently (I never had to wait more than 15 minutes) and takes you to BIll's Gambling Hall which is right in the middle of the strip. This was very convenient as it went both ways. The rooms were fine if a bit worn out. The carpet was stained. No flat screen TV - just a standard color TV with cable. I also had a tough time keeping the room at the temperature I wanted. The fan and the heating system only seemed to work for a short time so at night it would get chilly until the heat kicked up. Washrooms were adequate. I have to say the room was quite spacious which was nice. Service was hit or miss. On the one hand, housekeeping was fantastic. My room would be made up within two hours of my leaving. I'd leave in the morning or early afternoon, get breakfast/coffee for a couple of hours and when I came back it was almost always serviced. If I called the office for help, I'd always get my questions answered in a polite and accurate way. A staff member who came up to check the heating issue mentioned earlier was very nice as well and did what he could. On the other hand, I also encountered an impolite, snappy blonde girl at the front desk who wasn't particularly helpful or professional when I inquired about extending my stay. Came back 10 minutes later especially to avoid her and got everything taken care of by another staff member. A couple of the bartenders and one guy at the Sportsbook here were crotchety and unpleasant. Though mainly the staff was okay. There is a food court with Subway, Sbarro, etc. which was good when you needed it and a very good sushi restaurant as well. For me, the best feature of this hotel was the free wi-fi at the Java Vegas cafe. It did cost $6.00 per night (part of your resort fee) but I enjoyed taking my laptop downstairs and surfing whenever I needed to check e-mail, browse etc. All things considered, I probably would stay at the Orleans again because of their great room rates, the free wi-fi at Java Vegas and the convenience of the shuttle bus service to the strip. A couple of isolated bad customer service incidents are probably unavoidable in Vegas these days (unfortunate but true) although these incidents and the somewhat worn out rooms keep the Orleans in the category of just a decent hotel with great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great lodging value, convenient parking, casino showing it's age.”
Reviews.Author: Beenel
Reviews.Content: Room and service were great, convenient parking made it easy to go elsewhere for entertainment. Not a one-stop resort, but great place to use as base. Casino ventilation needs upgrade,but room & hallways were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Off Strip Option PERFECT for families”
Reviews.Author: SecretAgentReview
Reviews.Content: Nice option for families; avoiding the nonsense of the strip, Has bowling and Movie theater (VERY Nice) Latest slots, lots of table games, VERY big on the Asian table games. If youve read any of my reviews you know I HATE "Resort Fees" which are added surcharges. Though its only 6.00 a day you do not really get anything for it- discount coupons of minimal value. Internet is still extra Rooms are fairly decent, usually at a very good price. If you have a car or want to cab it, the strip is close by. In fact im writing this from Caesars looking out the window at Orleans in distance. Many food outlets for all price points and 24 hour fast food: Subway, Sbarro, baskin robbins, Fudpuckers- offers exotic burgers and TGIF. With the movie theaters and pool kids will have a grand time while you gamble away their inheritance....... ;-) A decent property worth the visit

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel & not far from the strip”
Reviews.Author: lkmama
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at The Orleans and we were not disappointed. It's an easy drive to the strip--the exit/entrance to I-15 isn't far from the hotel. Our room (two queen beds) was large and comfortable. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: MK330
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on our Southwest trip. Got a really good rate by booking thru the hotel website directly (a ridiculously low rate of < $50/nt). The hotel/casino is off the strip, but we had a car, so it was not an issue for us. We ate at the Chinese restaurant downstairs the first night, and it was authentic enough for us (a bit pricey though, esp. since hotel is < 1 mile from Chinatown). The exterior of the hotel is really beautiful (namesake New Orleans theme). You do smell smoke as soon as you step inside the hotel, as the lobby is located right off the casino area. Once upstairs, we're fine. Our room was clean and huge with big bathroom (sink and bath/shower in separate rooms), sitting area (coffee table, sofa).

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: maryc82
Reviews.Content: The casino is showing it's age and could do with a make over to keep up with other casinos. overall if you have a car, as it is away from the strip, it is good value, as the rooms, although a little dated, are roomy and clean. The main downside of this hotel is the overpowering smell of the pumped in air freshener. Anyone with allergy or sinus problems would find it unbearable, as I did and had to gamble elsewhere. They should take a leaf out of the higher end hotels which don't use such strong smells.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Scandinavian54
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4-5 times, excellent choice for the price. Good size and very clean rooms, very good access by car off strip, very good parking easily available. Good pool area, nice bars and fast food options and restaurant, good variety.

Reviews.Title: “It grows on you”
Reviews.Author: mubwubba
Reviews.Content: The Orleans seems to embrace its class without apology; no 4 star poseur here. It's an off strip hotel favored by the locals. Let's say the crowd is the opposite of young and hip. But it is also not overly crowded, although people smoke almost everywhere and the ventilation system is definitely not on par with the big strip hotels. They have a food court with Fuddruckers, Subway, Sbarro, and Baskin-Robbins and a very well priced buffet (breakfast was better than dinner in my opinion). It definitely makes one appreciate their value compared to on-strip prices. They have a wine / liquor store with a good selection and reasonable prices on their wine. The rooms were clean, the king bed firm but surprisingly comfortable, and the furnishings were in good shape although everything was a bit dated. The hall rugs definitely need a cleaning. The pool area was nice but the main pool is only 4 feet deep and the staff seemed rather disinterested. No poolside service here; if you want a beverage you have to get one yourself at the bar. It's far enough off strip that you will want to use the free shuttle. It runs about every 30 minutes and drops you off near Caesar's Palace. But that's also part of the appeal. The Orleans is close, but not too close, to the chaos and noise of the strip. Overall the more relaxed unpretentious pace of the Orleans, bargain room rates with a reasonable $6 a day "resort fee" grew on us and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Still Good”
Reviews.Author: manute
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on my last visit 5 years ago.Was happy with the price and the size of the rooms so decided to come back,As others have said it is off the strip but they have a shuttle that runs every half hour back and forth from the strip.What i did find this time when returning from the strip in that there is only room for about 20 on the shuttle so iyou might have to wait for the next one.They have everything you need at the hotel.From a movie thater,bowling alley,liquor store and many good restaurants.I would go back again when I reurn.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Here”
Reviews.Author: TeamNacho
Reviews.Content: We stay here due to the great price and huge rooms. People are also very nice. Pool is great. Food is decent. Free shuttle to Bill's on the strip is GREAT. It caters to an older crowd (40's and up) so it's not super modern, but we love it!

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the 80's”
Reviews.Author: SalfromIL
Reviews.Content: The Good: - The friendliest dealers ever in my 60+ trips to Vegas - Great hotel for the money - Loose video poker machines compared to the Strip - Drink ladies are plentiful everywhere - Nice poker room with lots of low priced games - Free shuttle to the Strip every 15-20 minutes - Maid service is wonderful and very accomodating - Very clean throughout The Bad: - Only half the tables are open, so finding a spot to play BJ or Craps at night is very difficult - It's out of the way, so you have to take the shuttle or a cab to find an open table at night - Slot machines are tight - No big screen in the Sports Book. We had to watch the Sunday Night Football game on a 40" TV at a bar - The on premises restaurants we went to (see separate reviews) are mediocre at best - In October, the main pool is totally in shadows all afternoon. Everyone who wanted sun hung around the kiddy pool The 80's: - Yup, the decor and the rooms - 26" standard TV - Old furniture and carpet - The high limit slot room features really, really old slot machines. Why? Who knows It's was still a nice alternative. The crowd is definitely older and local. Would we try it again? Probably not, but that doesn't make it bad.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: robertoagra
Reviews.Content: the bedroom was really comfortable, even better then the bedrooms on Mirage witch is considered a excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: burooxtwo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Vegas and stayed at The Orleans Hotel and Casino. Was happy with the room - spacious and clean - comfortable bed (would've been better if there'd been a bar fridge), but overall great.It had a nice little courtyard with a pool, a good-sized casino and decent restaurants. (had lunch at the buffet once - good price/mediocre food) It was about an 8 min drive to the strip, so with a car, very convenient. All staff were great and it was in a safe-seeming area. Mostly small businesses. I did think it was chintzy that I was charged a $10 "handling" fee when I took receipt of a package while there - all they did was ask for ID and hand me a box. All in all, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: Can't thank The Orleans Hotel & Casino check-in and check-out counter staff enough for their expertise and professionalism while assisting us. Your floor staff and bell hop were on the ball and attended to our every need. Your housekeeping staff is unbelievable....very polite and professional making sure we had enough blankets, pillows, towels, coffee, and soap. All of your staff, and the amenities are very family friendly. I highly recommend the Orleans as a place for travelers to stay. The rooms are great, the staff are very polite and professional, they have plenty of places to dine and their room rates are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: HobieHansen
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a couple times over the past five years and have noticed it is starting to show a little ware and tear. The only reason I say that is because the first time I stayed there in 2007 I couldn't believe the bang for your buck because the place was in immaculate condition. On my most recent trip the carpets looked a little dingy and there were many nicks and scrapes throughout the hallways and rooms. The bedspreads and rooms were starting to get a little beat up as well. Nothing in the hotel was "dirty" just a little run down here or there. Everything in this hotel/casino is a bit cheaper than the strip. Bottles of water, cheap breakfast or lunch or those types of things. I stayed at the MGM as well and the restaurants are crazy expensive compared to the Orleans. If you are on a budget and don't mind staying in a 3-star, this place is right for you. Just don't expectly to completely "wow" yourself. It is massive, lots of solid places to eat, not gourmet but solid. The Poker room has some pretty competitive players so if you're a beginner you might want to go elsewhere. It might be a complete fluke but in my three times in Vegas over the past five years I've always had the best luck at the Orleans. I've got to the Strip and lost money on the slots only to come back to the Orleans and stay up all night to win my money back plus more! Several times.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: PCMA
Reviews.Content: We arrived at The Orleans on Sunday Oct. 9th and departed on Oct 14th. The check in was easy but our room was in the older tower and it showed . The furniture was outdated as was the TV. There was a large stain on the carpet near the door.The bath tub drain would not hold water. These I considered minor problems. The food in the buffet was varied and very good.We ate all our meals there except the last morning we ate at the cafe.The food was also very good but way too much for a normal person to eat. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful The pool area was keep clean and was very relaxing. This hotel is not for the younger party set as most people were the senior type and older locals. We rented a car right at the hotel (Advantage) which was very convenient. Over all we enjoyed our stay at The Orleans but next time would ask for a room in the newer tower.

Reviews.Title: “good place for a good stay”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaJohn1946
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay here and is the best we have found in Vegas. Away from strip but has free shuttle

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jerry40494
Reviews.Content: Hotel clean and spacious..4 star. cafe great for breakfast 4 star,dinner ok 2!/2 stars. TGIF great dinners 4 stars.. Mexican Cantina great menu food looked great but was luke warm 1 star. I wanted to send it back but the wife said don't start. I did mentioned it to the hostess she was very sorry. we did ok on the vedeo poker. Would we come back yes. The staff was 4 star at check in,restruants,and cocktail servers

Reviews.Title: “Wanted relatives to experience the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: larad427
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Orleans many times I wanted relatives to share the many experiences it has to offer. They were not disappointed, as the courtesy extended them at check-in and the room size and cleanliness. They also commented on the casino floor layout as easy to get around and the variety of slot machines. They also liked the French Market Buffet. Their experience will certainly make them a return guest. Everything they experienced is what I told them to expect and it is why I always return to the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeSam13
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Las Vegas, my wife and I stayed 5 nights at the Orleans, a choice largely influenced by the many favourable reviews on Trip Advisor. We were looking for a resort which offered a number of amenities on-site including a comfortable room, good entertainment, a nice pool area, good food, a "happy" environment for both hotel staff and guests and of course, a full-service "user friendly" casino. These and more, we found in spades at the Orleans! At our request. we were upgraded to a renovated room on the 30th floor with a lovely view of the strip lights and were provided with a small fridge at no cost. The only negative for us was the very loud in-room air conditioning unit. Good housekeeping left a clean room and was completed no later than early-afternoon on each day. The pool area was comfortable and while not overly-large, was surrounded by mature palm trees in a reasonably quiet location. We especially liked the free shuttle to the Strip, good restaurants (Big Al's), friendly cocktail waitresses, newer slot machines and generally, the positive and happy attitude of nearly all of the staff we encountered during our stay. We have recomended the Orleans to our friends and will not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lori T.”
Reviews.Author: Lori_T98
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at Orleans, we love it there and hope to stay there again on our next trip. You feel really safe knowing that Security personnel is right by the elevators before going up to the room, very clean rooms, comfortable beds, well lit hallways - love it! There are lots of things to see and do just in one hotel. Next trip we plan to try various eating places within the Orleans Hotel. Thanks again Orleans Hotel...see ya on our next trip. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: CHERYL S
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is the only place to stay when you go to Las Vegas. The rooms are very clean, the hallways down to your rooms are very well lite & you have to show your room key to security before you get on the elevator which is GREAT. The staff is very friendly & are very helpful when needed. The Orleans offers everything a person needs & the rates are right, the food is wonderful. Stay at the Orleans & you won't be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place”
Reviews.Author: cgen5568
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been going to Vegas for about 10 years now, we try to go at least 2 times a year. When we first started going we liked to stay right on the strip. My late friend had told us about the Orleans and said knowing us we would love it. She was right. Not only could I watch my sporting events but my husband could play his Keno and video poker at the bar like he enjoys. The staff couldn't have treated us any better and housekeeping did an excellent job. We never wanted for anything, our bartenders were quick with a drink and very nice to us. We rented a car this time to visit some properties as we are planning on moving out to Vegas in a few years. The Valet service was very quick and the staff very nice. It was extremely hot for the end of September beginning of October so it was nice to have our car parked in a shady spot. I can't wait to go back...even though my husband didn't win in the slot tournament =) This was our first time using the pool and we were pleasantly surprised by the pool area and staff...Nice job Olrleans!

Reviews.Title: “One Stop that has it All”
Reviews.Author: Alana O
Reviews.Content: My husband and I make The Orleans our 'one stop that has it all' place to stay when in town. We don't need to go anywhere else when staying at The Orleans with the many options available for dining (Big Al's our favorite), a movie theater, a bowling alley, arcade, free shuttle, live music and shows, and a giant casino floor where you are bound to find your favorite type of gaming pleasure. The rooms are spacious, clean, and comfortable. Hotel, security, and casino staff are nice and courteous. We always have a great time at The Orleans and love the vibe of this casino very fun and exciting. I would definately recommend staying at The Orleans to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “All You Ever Need In Vegas is at... The Orleans!!”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly L
Reviews.Content: Recently we stayed at The Orleans...This was the best "hidden secret" in Vegas! Located off the strip and away from the crowds..... You never need to leave the property, it's all at The Orleans! The Orleans offers Amazing Room Rates, (rooms are awesome, clean, spacious & comfortable beds). Everything you need is located on the property, great dinning, food court for a quick bite or try the amazing buffet and if you are there for a special occasion.. fine dinning is available too. A variety of entertainment, & casino is HUGE! The Orleans is part of B Connected... this is the greatest players program I have ever seen, online access, in casino access and great rewards to all players. The Staff at The Orleans could not have been more awesome... the valet, the housekeeping, the front desk.. the casino floor staff & Casino host .. every staff member we came in contact with was friendly, helpful and happy! If you are in doubt of where to stay and love Vegas... Book The Orleans one time to try and it will become your ONLY VEGAS STOP! Why you ask?? Because.... All you ever need in Vegas is at "The Orleans". Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “BEST VALUE IN VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: Saslady
Reviews.Content: For over 20 yrs., go to Vegas 5-6nites at least 4x a year. Stayed in most strip & downtown hotels. High ceilings/fabulous 8 region buffet ($1 off with free coast card). Get card and register email for promotions. Big rooms w/loveseat and easy chair. Don't like hokey colonial furniture but OK. Safe in room will hold laptop. Nice hot tub by pool around a sm. island. Great food and better food at their sister casino, the Gold Coast (free shuttle there and to strip....7min). Fast check in and fast elevators.Has movie theaters/senior days/bowling alleys/high ceilings. BAD: charge xtra $6 a day resort fee....it does get you INTO fitness club but does NOT allow you to use a locker OR take a shower without paying extra! Bad new too big pillows, two of the main lights unpluged and would need to move heavy furniture to plug them in.

Reviews.Title: “Great time as usual”
Reviews.Author: foxrun1717
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stay at the orleans twice a year....the place is always so consistantly good, its hard to believe....my advice is to visit when you can use the pool...what a bonus way to spend time in the heat and sun...the pool for the better part of the day is half sun and half shade...restaurants are very good and reasonable, the coffee shop could have better hours....always safe, secure and feels like home.....if you have a negative expierence don't sweat it, probably never happen again....and most all of the staff will want to correct it for you...so have a great time and enjoy....

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bob538
Reviews.Content: My annual trip to Las Vegas included a two night stay at the Orleans. This visit was comped and included a food credit too. After this trip I can say for certainty that the Orleans is my favorite hotel in Las Vegas. The hotel is big, clean and the rooms are very comfortable. The casino is large with a good variety of machines, and low table limits. I was there for NFL week two where I spent some time in the sports book and surrounding bars. While sitting at the bar watching the games, I played some video poker. The bartenders were quick and friendly and were not concerned with how fast or how much money I was playing. Hot dog cart in the sports book is a great find. I'm a fairly low roller playing $5 BJ and .25 video poker. They seem to appreciate my level of play enough to send me another comped room offer shortly after my return home. I will always consider the Orleans first for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Tournaments”
Reviews.Author: Irene M
Reviews.Content: My friends and family have been staying at the Orleans for years. I really enjoy the slot tournaments and have met some very nice people. The rooms are nice and spacious and the staff has always been very nice. It is so easy to take the shuttle if I want to go to the strip, but we usually stay around the hotel because there is so much to do - the bowling alley and the movies all there. I have always felt quite safe staying at the Orleans and would recommend to my friends. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Always a great time”
Reviews.Author: Kathy J
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Orleans. We love the rooms always clean and neat. The restaurants are excellent. really enjoy having a movie theater on the premises is nice. The casino is fairly loose and belonging to the players club gets comps, discounts and free play. Security is great you have to show your room key to get to the elevators

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Vegas (and Casino, too)”
Reviews.Author: ez5150pdg
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at The Orleans Casino and Hotel for many years and have NEVER had a bad experience. The hotel is maintained in excellent shape, with comfortable, spacious rooms. Any problems are instantly corrected....such as elevators that need repair or a leaky faucet. The casino is one of the best also. Since I play blackjack, I appreciate not having to double the minimum bet when playing two hands at once. There are not that many casinos that allow this. I have also enjoyed being invited to many FREE slot, blackjack, and craps tournaments...and I have even placed in the money in some of them. The staff bends over backwards to make it a fun time whenever I visit The Orleans. Covered parking is abundant and of course there is also covered valet parking. While it is not on the Strip, it is my favorite hotel/casino in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend The Orleans Hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: CADreaming45
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to the Orleans, but we returned every day while staying in a Las Vegas Timeshare. The Casino slot games were great, with machines that we hadn't seen in other Casinos. Parking, including handicapped, was ample and convenient. The decor, in the Casino, was both fun and fascinating. We especially enjoyed the dining at Al's Oyster Bar and the Orleans Buffet. Prices at the Buffet were very reasonable, compared to other large buffets, and the food were wonderful, especially the desserts. Since we did not stay at The Orleans, I can't comment on lodging or the pool, but we are looking forward to returning to The Orleans Casino in November.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Janet1123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the last week of September for several days and couldn't have been happier. We have stayed there at least 10 times over the years in both suites and regular rooms but this is the first time I stayed by myself. During the stay I was never worried about security and felt quite safe. The rooms are big and very clean and it's a short walk to the food court (take the shortcut outside), restaurants or buffet. Check-in is fast and easy and the staff couldn't be nicer. We stopped staying there for a few years because the staff was a little rude and the hotel got too big. But last year we decided to give it another chance and glad we did. Can't say anything bad about The Orleans, we love it!

Reviews.Title: “You Really Can't Ask for More”
Reviews.Author: scottiejd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in September (both three night stays). What a gem of a hotel. Great and efficient staff, excellent facilities, large and well equipped bedrooms etc. The restaurants/dining outlets we tried were all either above standard or expected standard (chain outlets for example), gift shop was well stocked, spa great, pool fabulous - I could go on! Sure it's not on the strip and some rooms have better views than others but that's hotels for you! If I return to Vegas I would not hesitate in staying at this hotel in the future. Thanks Orleans for two great stays!

Reviews.Title: “Why I LUV the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: gmcwalker
Reviews.Content: I have been going here for many years now. I enjoy the the great food, the large rooms, the pool and best of all the people who work here. Where ever I go in the property from the crazy NY manager of the Fuddruckers to the .99 cents frozen Margarita Cantina bartenders all I get is service and a great attitude. The same for the casino gaming staff. I have encountered small problems in the past the concerning the rooms, however a call to the front desk and I have always been taken care of or switched to another room asap. Even thought I am not a heavy gambler I feel that I am treated like one here. gmc

Reviews.Title: “Priced right, but nothing wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: Linda55555
Reviews.Content: Seems to be a lot of deals with the Orleans which makes it a good value. Rooms were reasonably clean, but carpet showed signs of wear and stains. It is a ways from the strip in a somewhat "seedy" area. They do have a shuttle that runs to the strip. The casino area is smells smokey. I was not very impressed, but again, the price was right. Did not eat in any of the restaurants, so cannot speak for the food.

Reviews.Title: “3 days on route to Flagstaff & 3 day stay prior to return home in the UK”
Reviews.Author: john s
Reviews.Content: Arrived late but was very taken by the quality and surroundings of this hotel/casino. The value was good & eating in the French Market within the hotel was very good value & quality. Staff were only too pleased to help at all times making our double stay perfect. Our first room on floor 11 was very good but our stay on our return in the west wing floor 5 was not as good, room was facing a wall. If we return we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Road Trip”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_Vix
Reviews.Content: This has been our 7 or 8th stay at the Orleans and it was as good as always. Rooms are large and clean; bath, shower, in-room safe and coffee machine. Beds are firm and made up every day. One slight irritation is that you can hear the hotel staff tapping on all the doors, saying "housekeeping" in the morning (they don't do it on your door if you've put on the "do not disturb" - but you can still hear them on everyone else's). Food, including the Courtyard Cafe and the Buffet, is very good value. The free shuttle bus to the Strip is also really handy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: cpldutch
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 1562 overlooking the pool area facing North I believe. The room was in decent shape. Some old red and black stains on the carpet, but the carpet was in good shape. Everything worked except the "free" safe, but that was replaced with a new one. Good size room with a full bath seperated by a sliding door. Tv in an armoire with 3 big drawers beneath. Lighting was fair to good. A/C worked quietly and did a great job. Bathtub with shower, toilet and a good sized sink area. There is a small opening window at the back of the tub area. Bath also has a phone in it. I said free safe because there is a resort fee of $5 a day that includes 10 minutes use of business center per day and some other stuff. Buffet was good. They have a 24 hour coffee shop with an excellent Rueben sandwich. A TGIF's, food court, Al's Oyster bar, steak house and a fancy upscale restaurant. Also a Costa Cantina serving Mexican fare Wednesday through Sunday. Good slot selection and reasonable table games It is off the strip on Tropicana Ave. And caters to locals and tourists. Has a few other bars and eateries, also. The rooms reflect similar properties like The gold Coast and Bills (on the Strip). All in all a nice place to stay and gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I need is Here !”
Reviews.Author: stevez49Milford_NH
Reviews.Content: Everything you may need is here, Excellent food choices, good variety of gaming choices, very good pool area, nice room. All the employees are friendly an try to help you. This is the perfect place!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1966beverly0
Reviews.Content: This is probably the 5th time we have stayed at the Orleans and we love it every time. We have stayed other places and always come back here.
