The rooms are large compared to hotels on the strip. Very clean, love the buffet, they have the best chocolate cake I have ever had anywhere. The rooms are extremely clean and well kept. Staff friendly and lots of amenities. It is off the strip but we always have a car. They do offer shuttle but we have never used that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Christine V
Reviews.Content: I spent three night at the Orleans. Check in was stress free, staff were most pleasant. My room was spacious and clean. The hotel is handy to the Decatur and Valley View buses which was very handy for me as I won't drive in the US when I'm by myself. This is my second stay at the Orleans and it definitely won't be my last.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Bill W
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here numerous times and have always had Great experiences.Great Staff. Great food choices. Clean,well kept rooms.We go to Vegas 3 times per year and always make this our Hotel of choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Casino!”
Reviews.Author: Davis K
Reviews.Content: My high school reunion was at The Orleans. Everybody was very accomadating and made the experience one that everybody attended will not forget. The rooms were very clean and the staff was very accomadating. I would definitely reccommend The Orleans to anybody who wants a great hotel and casino.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel,great location,better service and friendly staffing!”
Reviews.Author: Amalia I
Reviews.Content: I prepared to stay at the Orleans with my family because of safety,especially I have 14 yrs old son who loves to use there swimming pool.Not only for gambling,also we gets all the benefits...The Orleans only the place who treat you with respect!!!But most of all "I LOVE THE FOOD"

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location and even better rates!”
Reviews.Author: Don P
Reviews.Content: I was attending one of the many business conventions that take place in Las Vegas. I chose this hotel for it's location. Not right on the strip, but close enough plus only a very short drive to the hotel where the convention was taking place. As you walk in the smell of cigarette smoke is a bit of a shock to the system and after spending some time having a few drinks at the bars, trying your luck or simply walking around I guess you get used to it (I am not a smoker), but again in my experience that is the norm at most Las Vegas hotels/Casinos. Clean very large room with a king size bed, nice clean bathroom with a stunning view specially at night! Easy check in and check outs, nice swimming pool. Even though the room was located in the original building (not the new building) it was in good shape. Some pieces of furniture should probably be refinished or updated (ie. the gold colored headboard). I have stayed at better hotels in Vegas with better service and with less smoky/smelly casino, but paying almost 5 times more per night than I paid at The Orleans. With a rate of $45.00 per night and on top of that they threw in a $50.00 Match bet coupon and a credit of $25.00 towards drinks at the different bars you can't go wrong. Next time, probably next year, I will return with my wife, not on business but to really enjoy everything this hotel has to offer. One of the best values near the Vegas strip.

Reviews.Title: “Time for a renovation.. dated”
Reviews.Author: Danielle G
Reviews.Content: This was my 5th trip to Las Vegas, previously stayed at the Palms Place, Treasure Island and Red Rock. I knew this hotel was not going to be anything near the luxury or quality of Red Rock or TI.. but still they need to catch up with the times . For this particular trip , I was attending the Mr Olympia which the Orleans was the Host Hotel for this event. Here are my pros about the hotel- friendly and helpful staff, fast check in and we arrived at noon and was given our room early, drinks at the bars were affordable had a blast at the Alligator bar, the food was affordable, and I will say I did not have a bad meal while staying there, from Room service breakfasts to TGI Fridays ..to the 24 hour cafe .. food was very good and reasonably priced. The gift shop was chock full of snacks and drinks , and had a wide variety of souveniers and gifts . The rooms are quite large with plenty of counter space ( watch out for the large crystal grandma lamp on the night stand ... not only does it take up the entire table top space .. but it is nailed down too... classy huh ?) The fitness center is modern ( more modern than the hotel itself..) and well equipped with plenty of cardio machines, and even a stepmill.. and freeweights that go up to 50 lbs . I did not have time to swim in the pool, but from what I did see, the pool seemed to be mostly covered by the shade of the hotel building blocking the sun. .. and the lounge chairs looked like they had seen better days. OK.. here are the cons- the hotel is in dire need of an entire room renovation. The carpets were stained , and dusty, and even smelled musty. The wood paneled doors give off that seedy 70's roadside Adirondack motor lodge vibe. The bath tub was a disgrace. mildew and mold and in need of caulking. The gold plated bath fixtures all tarnished. We had a king room, and was only supplied with 2 flat pillows . The sheets were scratchy and the brass headboard totally tarnished. housekeeping only leaves 2 thin bath towels daily.. so one morning I showered and also used a towel to dry my hair,, and my husband was left to drip dry and blot himself with a dry hand towel. ( the next day we asked housekeeping for extra towels and they did leave 4 of them ) I don't watch much TV when I travel, but this hotel still has those big box television sets. Yet we found out that our friends who had a room on the 19th floor had a flat panel TV.. ( and a freshly tiled bathroom.. but the rest of their room was not updated at all..what gives ? ) My first night I slept in the bed and refused to use the blankets or sheets .. and laid a t shirt on the pillow before putting my head on it. I kept feeling imaginary little itchy bugs biting my body while laying in that bed. It drove me nuts.. by day 3 I managed to talk myself into roughing it and just sucked it up and used the blanket. I really hope the Mr Olympia convention chooses a more classy and up to date hotel for next year, because many of us attendee's like staying in the hub of things at the host hotel.. but not many of us are Orleans Caliber. on the other hand myself and the group of 10 we traveled with would stay if they renovated the place. Take a hint from the Tropicana, Orleans hotel .. have you seen that mega upgrade.. that place was a dive like the Orleans , but I tell you this, they surely have my business now after that overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans”
Reviews.Author: WanatahKurt
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Orleans not the Ritzy places on the strip but you do not have to pay an arm an the nice thing is d leg for drinks most were comped and i drink heinken and Becks which is premium The Prime Rib Loft is good for the price And coffee shop good service,the good thing is everything is right there not alot walking which is good in vegas all in all everything decent for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint locals casino”
Reviews.Author: MaryH82
Reviews.Content: When we travel to Las Vegas but want to get away from the rat race that is the Las Vegas Strip we choose to stay at The Orleans. The rooms are roomy and have lovely decor. The casino tends to be a bit smokey but for the value I can overlook that detail. The buffet is very good as is the TGIFridays which is within the hotel/casino. The outdoor pool area is spacious and comfortable. Something that I find a plus is the small coffee shop/cafe area located near the entrance doors near the valet drive. This area offers free WiFi (provided that the privilege is not abused).

Reviews.Title: “orleans stay”
Reviews.Author: jjones2Boston
Reviews.Content: just got back from a two-night stay at the orleans hotel.the room was nice and ask for and got one with flat screen tv.casino was lively and noticed some new machines.stayed at the orleans a dozen of times,i like it and they always send me comped nights. i tryed the oyster bar i thought the menue was limited,but tryed the jambalaya pasta and it was spicy,big and good.weds got off to late start was not feeling so good.went to the strip and took some photos of casinos and then went freemont street.i went into the new plaza its nice kinda dark inside,saw some young boy playing with a slot.so after went to mss and had the lunch buffet,good selection i would go back.took the dxs to townsquare and went to bon breads,got the white chocolate bartard bread its good will make another trip when i visit lasvegas.townsquare is very nice and quiet i like the layout of the stores and the restaraunts.went back to the strip and was in and out of casinos and then went back to my hotel for the evening.thurs got up and packed and out the room before 4am and saw dustin diamond talking with friends in the registration area,hes doing some shows at the orleans,it was neat to see him in real person,and of course packed my ipod so no pic of him.played some slots and won three-hundred dollars and left with less than that.got cab to airport and waited for flight back home. thats my trip and now that im home i will set my count down clock for six months.thanks any questions please ask.

Reviews.Title: “Decide what's important first”
Reviews.Author: ItReality
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms could use serious updating. It's not that they are dirty or that the furniture is worn, but rather the gold (rusted) fixtures in the bathroom and the gold (tarnished) headboard. The linen and carpet have seen better days too. The rooms are really BIG, and I LOVE the shower window. This hotel isn't full of glamour & glitz like the others on the strip, but it's comfortable. The restaurants are reasonably priced, good food, other than the "french market" SALAD bar. The pool was wonderful. What we've found so appealing about The Orleans is the $5.00(minimum bet) gaming tables in the casino. Most casinos directly on the strip have gone up to $10.00 to $15.00 minimum bet. The Orleans is nice, but not fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: inkchick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans Hotel for the 2011 Olympia as it was the host hotel. It was just my spouse and I . I called about a week ahead to request a King size bed with a Strip view and a fridge. They were all out of fridges when we got there Thursday but I kind of expected they might be as many of the competitors were staying at the hotel and had checked in the day before. (A fridge did appear in our room late Saturday and we were not charged for it). The hotel is easy to get to from the airport and the Strip. The Valets are quick and friendly but the self parking is easy to get in and out of as well. Room: The room was large and clean. As others have mentioned, the hallways are long and it can feel like you are walking forever to get to your room. While to hotel does have an older feel to it, it is charming, like you are in New Orleans. The couch in the room has seen better days but we just used it for suitcases anyway. The bed was very comfortable and they were quick to bring us more pillows and blankets when we asked. Hotel amenities: There are lots of options for dining. We ate at Fuddruckers, Sbarro(very good Stromboli!), TGI Fridays and the French Market Buffet a couple of times(Breakfast and the Friday seafood buffet). All were good, with friendly, helpful servers. The seafood buffet had lots of king and snow crab that were both replenished frequently. The wireless internet at the coffee shop extends out a far way so it can be used not just in the coffee shop. When searching for a network, use the Seattle’s Best one. Check in and out both were simple with no unexpected charges. We do like staying on the Strip when we go to Vegas but if we were going for a function that was being held at the Orleans Arena, we would for sure stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, Nice Room, but Loooong Hikes to Get Everywhere”
Reviews.Author: nativefl
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night here on our way out of Vegas after a lengthy trip to canyons around the region. Found a killer deal online on their site the day before - only $34 a night for a king room. It was crazy-spacious, with sitting area totally separate, terrific bed, with windows showcasing the strip (not that far away). Very quiet. My spouse was intrigued by the window in the shower that actually opened. Entire floors are non-smoking rooms. Staff were very nice and helpful as well. A security team in front of room elevators at casino gives a measure of security, at least lip-service to it. But the walk from the elevators to your room is longer than a football field - that's after walking from the self-park garage through the courtyard and then through the casino, another two field's length. (Moral of story: wear very comfy shoes and definitely have the bellman attend to your luggage). And it looks like a scene from The Shining - extremely long very bright hallways going four directions off the elevator (Don't forget your room number!) Close to the airport, we were there in record time the next morning. Cafe is good - with lots of offerings and it serves late. Coffee stand near the front door has good java. The Mardi Gras themed huge casino seems to be a locals favorite. Would definitely go back, but would ask for a room near the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: andyackland
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is off the strip but has a courtesy bus which runs every 15 mins or so. The rooms are spacious and clean and the hotel has many restaraunts.The breakfast buffet is great, sets you up for the day and the Prime rib loft is fantastic.\All in all its a great base to enjoy all the delights of Vegas at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans is our favorite Casino in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: tOmOt_11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (now in our 70's) have been visiting the Orleans for 10 to 12 years. Generally we stay there twice each year. We play only slots and a little keno. This past trip,September 4th to 7th, we played 25cent video poker quite a bit, and although neither of us got the Royal, we did witness 4 or 5 in the vicinity where we were playing. We have always found the casino clean and the staff very friendly. Our rooms have always been very comfortable, clean, and reasonable. The elevator service is quick, and security is good. This casino offers a very large number and variety of slot machines, 12 movie theaters, bowling alley, the Arena for special events, a very generous slot players club, very effecient valet parking in addition to large self parking lots (we've never experienced any vehicle damage of theft issues), and about 10 restaurants from fast food to a huge buffet to a couple very good upscale ones. This trip we met a couple friends there and had a great time, as usual !!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to have fun without leaving hotel”
Reviews.Author: suz3227
Reviews.Content: Great entertainment! If you enjoy dancing then this is the place. There is also a cinema with current movies. You don't have to leave all is here!

Reviews.Title: “Quality you expect”
Reviews.Author: Stigmeister
Reviews.Content: Why pay astronomical prices to stay on the strip? 5 minute away and a free shuttle bus is all you need. We have stayed there twice so far after years in the Gold Coast and love the place. The staff are always helpful, the rooms always cleaned very well, the choice of foods are more than adequate. We are back there again soon and can't wait. 72 lanes of bowling and a cinema with a load of auditoriums to boot. If money is no object then we would all stay at the Wynn but in the real world....you know the rest. If you are a Vegas Virgin or just sampling for a lnger stay, give the Orleans a try, you might be pleasantly surprised!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Neal B
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel primarily based on reviews I had read. They were very accurate. We found the rooms to be fairly dated, but spacious and clean. We received a free upgrade to a wide-screen TV. Every one of the staff that we had contact with was friendly, courteous, and very helpful. The food in the buffet was delicious and a varied menu. We ate there six times in four days! We only played the slots, and found them to be quite generous the first two days, Monday and Tuesday. By Wednesday afternoon, they seemed to tighten up, and we did poorly on them Wednesday evening and Thursday morning. My only mild complaint is the burrito in the snack bar near the hallway entrance to the rooms was terrible! Whoever heard of using rice as a filler in a burrito? The other complaint was that the computer keyboard and mouse in the business center was nasty! If you use those, be sure to take your own alcohol wipes.

Reviews.Title: “Good space but outdated”
Reviews.Author: True_review_for_U
Reviews.Content: I've been here at least 10 times the past year. This hotel/casino is old, but some personnel and machines are nice. In general, it has good space in the room. It's not the presidential suite of Wynn, but it got a good size, clean sheets, mini table and sofa, a set of desk and chair, and a 1980's old box tv. If you gamble, you can earn points to use towards dining, including the food court place. Only down side is it's so far away from the strip, you have to call ahead for a taxi. If time is no concern, they got shuttle bus to and from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Economical, Will stay at again”
Reviews.Author: fdrp84
Reviews.Content: Let's be straight, if you are looking to do Las Vegas on the strip, this isn't the place for you. But if you want a clean room, fair prices, good food, and don't want to spend much, The Orleans is a fine place to stay, along with the sister property, The Gold Coast. They are not located on the Strip, but thats OK. They have a free shuttle bus which will take you to the Strip (Bill's Gambling Hall) and The Gold Coast, which I have used many times. Rooms are always clean, Food at the place is good. The Orleans has the Arena next door, with a walkway between the two places, so if you are going to The Orleans Arena, you are right there. Usually the games have a lower minimum than the Strip properties also!

Reviews.Title: “For a small convention it's a good value”
Reviews.Author: TradeshowMagician
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a convention that was held on the property... For a small convention it's not bad... The "Strip" hotels are bigger, more polished, and more expensive... Rooms are comfortable and clean

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: menjude E
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I, as well as my husband and I, would rather spend all of our time at the Orleans than anywhere else. The rooms are so comfortable, clean, and the appearance is beautiful. I get to have my first cup of coffee in the room every morning, which is very important to me. They have good selections in the food court, and super restaurants to dine in. We have always been greeted by friendly and courteous staff, valet, and bell desk, etc. The pool is wonderful for the times we needed just to relax. Oh, and the movies, too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Price in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: adbrat
Reviews.Content: We really like staying here with & without the teenagers. The rooms are spacious & comfortable and most have a nice view. The service has always been very good. If we needed more towels or pillows, or if we needed directions somewhere. We stayed here the first time, about 8 years ago with our son's high school team. It was nice but a old. When we were told we were staying there the following year, I wasn't that excited. Well the rooms had been remodeled & it was a pleasure. They seem to be updating every year now. We stay here about 3-4 times a year. The dealers are very friendly & helpful. The restaurants are plentiful and you have many choices. We get deals constantly from the hotel. Their perks are great. We have at least 2 nights free every month. Needless to say we don't go that often but it's a great weekend get-away & inexpensive (except for gambling). The only drawback to the Orleans, that we see, is that it is off the strip. But since there is a shuttle that leave every 15-20 minutes, it has never been a big issue. There are quite a few hotels off the strip (Rio, Palms & a few others) and it is nice to have a quieter casino sometimes. The reason we like the Orleans when we have the kids with us, (ours 18 & 20 and the High School baseball team), is that the hotel has many things for them to do. There is a 70+ lane bowling alley, 16 movie theaters & an arcade. There is even a little kids area with bounce houses, etc. The pool area is large & had a poolside bar with friendly bartenders. We've never had to fight for chairs, even during Spring Break. Overall we prefer staying at the Orleans because of the service, staff & the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible for the price”
Reviews.Author: RK W
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at alot of hotels in Vegas and decided to give the Orleans a try. The good, room cost were reasonable, rooms were clean and smelled good. Beds were comfortable, large pool was heated and great for getting wet. Parking was ok. Food in the food court was excellent. The bad, big pool was closed second day there. Buffet food was poor. Gambling in all Boyd properties has very poor returns on the machines, and I have gambled in most hotels in Vegas. In summary, value is there if you use the facilities and dont want to visit the strip, and stay away from the machines.

Reviews.Title: “My Vegas Home-Away-From-Home”
Reviews.Author: SusanKLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Since someone recommended the Orleans to me many years ago, it has become my favorite place to stay in Vegas. Reasonable prices; clean, nice roomy rooms. Lots of things to do - movie theatre, bowling alley (haven't tried that), restaurants and fast food, Irish pub - now they even have a comedy club. Just spent four days there over Labor Day and had a wonderful time. Although I usually have my car so transportation isn't an issue, they do have a shuttle that will take you to and from the strip. I haven't tried the pool since I'm usually so busy with everything else!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: jay21212
Reviews.Content: All my research pointed to the Orleans as the place to go to play video poker so we went. There is a shuttle every half hour from Bills Gambling Hall which is right next to the Flamingo. There are 2 video poker bars right by the entrance. One was closed. We sat down at the other and were served immediately. One of out party hit 4 aces on the first deal. I actually had back to back 4 of a kinds. There are at leat 4 video poker bars in here. The service was good and the place was clean. It was not very busy but it was a Monday. This is definitely a good change from the strip for a few hours if you like loose slot machines and cold beer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mollylovesit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for a weekend getaway to Vegas and wanted to stay off the strip to cut down on costs and get away from the party scene. We chose the Orleans because they didn't have adult pool parties on the weekends. We would rather relax by the pool with little kids than listen to loud music and drunk people, so it was perfect. For the cost of the room (very cheap), the hotel had everything! 70 bowling lanes (almost all of which were taken up most of the time, surprisingly), a large pool with bar service and snack bar, a wading pool for small children, a nice big jacuzzi, a movie theater, and tons of other activities. Restaurants available are the French Market Buffet (we had the Sunday brunch, it was ok, but there are better options elsewhere), a Mexican food restaurant (with a to go option), a 24 hour cafe, TGI Fridays (24 hr), Fudruckers (24 hr), Sbarro, Rocky Mountain Chocolate Factory, Baskin Robbins, an Irish Pub, and probably more. When you check in they give you a book of coupons that you can use for your stay that are subsidized by the resort fee, like discounts on the restaurants, theater, drinks at the pool, and bowling, which was nice. We had a couple of drinks that were really good, including the Hurricane. The pool is huge, and was clean when we went. It didn't go below 5 feet, which was great. The rooms have really high ceilings and are very reminiscent of the French Quarter style (my husband and I honeymooned there), and were very nice. The bed was comfy, and the housekeeping staff came and delivered extra towels for us when we requested it. We will definitely stay again because you don't even need to leave your hotel! If you do, they have a free shuttle to the strip :)

Reviews.Title: “good hotel - would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Buttners
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it wasn't important for us to stay on the strip, and we knew we'd have a rental car. It had a really nice feel to it - big but not huge, with good service starting with check in. We chose to be upgraded to the tower (top floor) and it was really nice. The pool area was good, especially in the evenings, and the service in the restaurants was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Very Reasonable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: janet11120
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year and loved it. The rooms are very clean and the service was great. This place is off the strip, but they do offer transportation to the strip at no cost to you. They have several places to eat,so if you have picky eaters they don't have to settle for just one place to eat. We ate at the buffet and it was great. We loved this place and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but a bit of a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Keats1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orlean's Hotel in Las Vegas in the beginning of July. The hotel was sold to the Boyd Group a couple of years ago. Since then I've noticed some changes. The Ice Cream Parlor is gone, Terrible's fast food restaurant is gone and so are the coupon books. No coupons for free drinks like there used to be, no coupon for the Spa, Now the Spa costs guests $15.00. They're still charging a "Resort Fee" but now it's up to $6.00 per day per room. We really liked to stay at the Orlean's and since it changed hands, we feel that the management has tightened up and is not as guest friendly. The cocktail waitresses seem to be fewer and it takes them longer to get around to you. The amenities in the room were changed. There were fewer towels in the bathroom and I never did get the additional pillow I had called down for. The pool has cheaper thinner towels now and there was no drink waitress at the pool. The misters did not work anywhere and it was pretty hot out there. I'm going to look into the South Coast Hotel for my future stays. The original owner of the Orleans is the owner of that property and I believe that he'll be running it like he ran the Orlean's.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best values in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: OregonMs
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a lot (as well as most of the other Vegas properties) and I keep returning here. I never leave feeling ripped off. Nice rooms, nice variety of restaurants, functional spa, nice pool (too many local kids when school is not in session, nice folks to deal with. They treat their gamblers well. The downside would be that a car would be recommended, however they have a reliable shuttle to and from center strip. I have never had a problem with it. It's available to the public but if it gets too packed they give priority to guests with room keys.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay for price!”
Reviews.Author: VegasPhanatik
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Orleans after we received a great deal from our BConnected card. The rooms are quite large with a nice sitting area. What I didnt like is that our closet was connected to the bathroom and the bathroom didnt have a door blocking the toilet and shower area from the clothing. Also, the door that did block off the bathroom area, didnt have a lock, which I would have prefferred. We decided it would be better to just keep our clothing in the drawers rather than streaming them daily from the shower steam. Hotel employees were very friendly and helpful. The casino is nice sized. The buffet is average and with the BConnected card, you can receive a small discount. The bowling area is awesome! We went on a Thursday night and the lanes were wide open. Just remember to take your own socks because they charge $4 for a pair of socks. I always have a great time at The Orleans. If you prefer a slower paced hotel, then this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular time to remember”
Reviews.Author: Jeannett M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel. This was our very first time staying here. They have everything you want and need to do while in vegas. The only reason for going to the strips was to site see. Our room was spectacular. We originally had comp rooms. When we inquired about an upgrade with a jacuzzi, they were able to accomodate for a reasonable price. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best deal in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: bothsidesnow
Reviews.Content: My third time staying at the Orleans and it still gets top marks. This time I was allocated one of the 'refurbished' rooms, although quite honestly the only difference I noticed was a flat screen TV and a new sofa, everything else is pretty much the same. Which is absolutely fine by me. I've probably mentioned most of this in my previous Orleans reviews, but this is why I choose this over 250 other Vegas hotels - check in took 2 minutes (you can queue for 40 minutes in some Strip hotels), the staff are universally friendly and helpful, the restaurants are cheap, the atmosphere is relaxed, the drinks flow, the table limits are low, the shuttle to the Strip is fast and frequent, there is space around the pool area with plenty of loungers, rooms are large with coffee machine, safe and a little window that opens in the bathroom. The 18 screen cinema, 70 lane bowling alley, comedy club, showroom and arena ensure there is always plenty going on. For just $35 a night midweek it surely cannot be beaten for value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel filled with families and casino filled with locals. A busy busy place”
Reviews.Author: gy820
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy and quick but appears that we were lucky to check in during the early evening. The check in area was a madhouse the next day with long lines. The rooms were huge and spacious and pretty clean. There was a large stain on the carpet near the door but livable. Service - again check in was smooth. The only really notable problem came during our lunch in the hotel's coffee shop. Maybe half full. But....we waited for everything...to the point of having the hostess take our order as we prepared to walk out. then waited another 20 minutes for a ham and egg platter and a turkey wrap. Empty water glass and cold coffee close out the deal. Just terrible! Access- like many casinos, not very access friendly..need to walk a mile to get from parking lot to the room. Very incovenient. Security- love the 24hour security guard at the elevators. Overall - A decent place to stay. Quite far from the strip on Tropicana but seems to be popular with the locals. Seems like a sports venue with the on property arena too. Wish they would get to the 21st century and offer free wi-fi. A $13/day rate makes it hard to consider for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value---great staff--great stay!”
Reviews.Author: jandk819
Reviews.Content: Not anything to complain about here...room was very clean although could have used some updating. Staff was very accomodating throughout the hotel. BEST value in VEGAS--

Reviews.Title: “Another great trip”
Reviews.Author: Ducks
Reviews.Content: We really enjoy the Orleans Hotel... Had no problem with getting tunnelled this yr!!!...lol cab.$18.30 from airport + tip..Everything was just the same as we left it last year....lol......room was as requested but had to wait for it......Service was fast bringing up luggage and fridge that was compted because we had to wait so long for our room......We had a problem getting towels/soaps/coffee on the wk end (sat/sun) even though tip was taken...had to find some one to give us amenities which we normally dont have any problems with!!!!..some of us 4 had some small wins and some of us had none !!......it was really hot and we will not be returning in summer again ....lol.....( only went at that time because of flight price)...shuttle was not running as often but we still managed...buffett doesnt seem to be as good as previous yr but it was ok!....we were disappointed in the business center as we could not get our boarding passes done as internet service was down also 10mins is not much time! they used to give 15 mins and more if not busy...now they are on a timer......if lap tops taken there is free wifi but we dont want to drag computer on vacation with us....any way im sure we will be returning next yr. 7th time as it is nice not having to to fight the crowds on the strip all the time....Ducks

Reviews.Title: “HouseKeeping needs an attitude check-!”
Reviews.Author: lolipop23
Reviews.Content: Okay so i first walk-in the hotel And the smell of cigarettes overwhelme me! The room was ok clean . Okay the reason i am giving this hotel a 2 is because of housekeeping overall i cAlled them3 times in the nite my first Call was to get extra blankets. okay so i brewed cofee And i Put the condiment pack in. it tasted terrible. So i called up for extra cofee And little condiment packs like 15 .minutes later i wass tired And i forgot pillows i called And the lady said,Okay do you need anything else because we have already been there.And i was thinking i didnt pay 100 plus dollars for you to give me attitude . okay i let it go hoping the staff member would be nicer. boy was i wrong the guys knocked And i answered And said sorry all he said was here you go And walked away

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed - would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: FlyVegas
Reviews.Content: We have been to Las Vegas many many times and have always stayed on the Strip apart from a short stay at Sams Town 10 years ago. We had visited The Orleans via the Strip shuttle quite a few times in the past and liked the vibe there so decided that this year we would split our stay and have 6 nights here and then move on to the Strip for the other 6 nights. I shopped around for prices and took the Expedia offer which was a bargain. Check in was quick but the King Smoking room that I had requested was not available the first night so we had a King Non-Smoking on the 7th floor for that night. It was at the end of a very long corridor but we were very happy with the room. Good sized, coffee machine, flat screen TV, and very clean. The bed was extremely comfortable. There was a sliding door to the bathroom and the hanging space for clothes was in there too (very similar to the rooms at Bills). So far so good. The next day we were moved to a King Smoking room on the 17th floor, this time at the end of a not so long corridor. This room was even better - it seemed more spacious again and the bathroom was bigger too and there was a coffee machine and flat screen TV. Again the room was immaculate. There were only 2 pillows on the bed so I requested more and they arrived very quickly. I was extremely impressed when I got a call from housekeeping to make sure that we were happy with everything! Again the bed was very very comfortable. The daily maid service was very thorough and the room and bathroom were always spotless. The casino was great, plenty of machines, no smokey atmosphere, and everything looked bright and clean. There were always staff sweeping, wiping machines, cleaning ashtrays and removing empty glasses etc. We signed up for our Bconnected cards and earned lots of extra points by swiping the cards at one of the machines on 'senior' day. The overall points earned gave us comped meals and free points play on the slots. There are a variety of eating places but our favourite was the French Market Buffet for the buffet breakfast. I think this was 7.99 on a weekday but you got a $1 discount on production of the Bconnected card. The food there was really good and there was an vast choice. Tremendous value for money. We also used the Java coffee shop one day for a quick light breakfast but that cost as much, if not more than the buffet so only did it the once. We used the shuttle to travel onto the Strip and to the Gold Coast and also walked across the car park to visit McMullens pub one day. The weather was so so hot that was about as far as we could go because staying outside in that heat for more than 15 minutes was torture. We didn't use the pool but did have a walk around it and it looked really nice. All the staff that we met were very very nice and extremely helpful and we would definitely stay at The Orleans again.

Reviews.Title: “So much fun in one building”
Reviews.Author: yoshabetty
Reviews.Content: Our room looked out at the strip with the mountains as a backdrop, so beautiful, day and night. they kept our room sparkling and we never had to ask for a thing. The restauraunts were great and reasonable. They had a full service liquor store and a great gift shop in which to spend my winnings. The shuttle (airport) is a phone call away. There is also a shuttle to the strip. I was away from the congestion until I felt like being in it and then, what fun.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, clean, fun & friendly with lots to do!'”
Reviews.Author: becky j
Reviews.Content: We initially wanted to stay in an hotel on the strip, but friends of ours who had stayed in Vegas before told us that we would be seeing so much of the strip in the day that it would be nice to have a rest and stay off the strip. We booked this hotel because it was near enogh to the strip and a free shuttle bus was offered back and fore each day. We thoroughly enjoyed staying at this hotel which was clean, friendly and spacious with lots of bars, restaurants and entertainment. The room was very spacious and spotlessly clean, there was plenty of places to eat from nice restaurants to fast food bars. The pool area with jacuzzi and pool bar was fantastic and the spa and gym was lovely too. The casino offered low stake games such as min bet $5 on black jack. We would definately stay at this hotel again and could nt believe the value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, but be ready to walk a lot to get to them”
Reviews.Author: Elvin16
Reviews.Content: Like most hotels in Las Vegas, the Casino is the main attraction and almost every entrance get direct access to it. At The Orleans, the elevators of the hotel are very distant from the parking garage. Therefore if you have too many bags, plus a baby, plus all the baby stuff, etc., be ready to walk all the way to your room. This is fine if you are alone with a back pak only. If you are allergic to the cigarette smoke, try to send another person of your party to make the check in. The lobby is just by the casino and the smoke is everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Old, smoky locals casino in a state of disrepair”
Reviews.Author: barizzo
Reviews.Content: Opted for one night at The Orleans after cancelling from another hotel. Was looking for a bargain priced property and ended up wishing I had just gone to Motel 6. This place is really, really OLD. The room was on the 19th floor. The brass bed headboard railing was attached to the wall with string! Apparently that was to keep it from squeaking too much. If so, it didn't work. The furniture is circa 1970's. As was the TV, which you cannot see while sitting on the sofa. I was surprised the remote actually worked. The bathtub looked like something you would expect to find in a small town Best Western that had not been updated in thirty years. Towels were standard K-mart variety, rough to the touch. The noise up and down the hall and from adjoining rooms kept me from going to sleep until past 2 pm. It is not a sound-proofed building by any means. The casino itself is extremely smoky - worst in Vegas to the best of my knowledge. It's a place frequented by locals and out of towners who don't know any better. They do not have a neat selection of slots at all. It's almost as if they do not want to spend the money upgrading anything, even slots. Poker room was - interesting. Lots of locals who play very bad. But again, the smoke was everywhere. Even though the poker room itself is non-smoking, it drifts in and is so thick that you'd swear the entire poker room was smoking. Given the isolated location, you would think they would curtail all smoking in the corridors leading to the poker room - that would help a lot but it would tick off their regulars who love to "step outside" for a smoke, which to them means just across the rail. Really kind of lame. They should just call it a smoking poker room and get on with it and let everyone who wants to smoke at the table do so. They do have some good quality, good value places to eat on the property including Sbarro's, Basking Robbins, etc. There is a pub on property that is cool with a band that starts at 8pm. The buffet is not bad, but for breakfast it does not open until 8 am. Seriously. Maybe they don't know they're in Vegas?? They have a $6 resort fee which seems cheap enough until you realize that you don't get anything for it. Free wi-fi in the coffee shop area is very good but it costs a fortune in the room. Overall, I cannot give this property a score higher than a 2, which is the lowest rating I've given any property in Vegas to date. If you're familar with infamous "downtown" Vegas properties, then you'll appreciate it when I say this property IS a downtown property, located in the Southwest part of town (about 2 miles west of the Strip on Tropicana). If you're staying here for the dollar value, my advice is to spend a few extra bucks and get a hotel with a better experience. And if you're coming here for any other reason - WHY??

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Family atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: KathyfromChicago
Reviews.Content: My huband and I stayed at the Orleans at the end of June for our 16th wedding anniversary. We usually stay on the strip, but the prices were extremely high for the nights we stayed. My in-laws go to Vegas 5-6 times a year and always stay at the Orleans, so we thought we would give it a try. Room was older, but clean. When you showered there was a small window that you could look out and view the mountains. Nice touch. We noticed that the hotel had a lot of families with young children and seniors. We are in our forties, not too many people in our age range there. We didn't care for the buffet, and opted to eat at Friday''s and on the strip. We saw two shows while we were there, Garth Brooks and Love, both were outstanding! There is a free shuttle that will take you to the stirp every 20 - 30 minutes which we used a few times, but it only runs until midnight. Cab cost back to the hotel from the strip was approximately $15 with tip. The pool is very nice. There also is a movie theatre and bowling alley, however, we did not take advantage of either of these. This is a terrific hotel for families and/or travelers on a budget. Although we had a very nice stay, when we go back we will most likely stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another stay at the best value in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Terpsfan72
Reviews.Content: Has to be maybe my 10th stay at the Orleans while in Sin City, as I've said before this place has to be the best value in Vegas. What was new about this stay was it was the first time I stayed in one of their one bedroom suites. Got it at a great price right on the Orleans web site, so decided to try it out and very happy I did. Big HD TV's in both living room area and bedroom. Small tv's next to bathroom vanity and behind bar. Room had a full sized bar, with 3-4 stools, sink, frig. Also windows behind bar with a decent mountian view. In bedroom a huge king bed, a large closet, with a safe inside. A desk and chair next to bedroom windowns, also with a decent mountain view. A larger tub in these bathrooms than in normal guest rooms(would fit two people) with sliding doors instead of shower curtains. In the living room a nice leather sectional couch, coffee table and also have a dinning room table in between bar and living area. Of course the hotel and casino still has some of the better cheap eats in Vegas, with faves like Bug Al's Oyster Bar, Koji's Sushi and plenty of others. All in all was a very nice room and if I was able to book it at a good price again I'd stay in these rooms again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “No Disappointments!”
Reviews.Author: Larry G
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are retired and usually make a trip to Vegas at least once a year. For us, The Orleans has become a 'sure thing'. We just naturally check availability there first, as we know the accommodations will always be 'first rate', with no surprises and no disappointments. Every aspect delivers the service and courtesy that Vegas is known for (or used to be!). We highly recommend The Orleans to all our family and friends. Can't wait to go back! Larry and Linda Gray

Reviews.Title: “Our kind of place”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: Recently I was invited to play in a craps tournament at the Orleans and my wife and I flew in from Tennessee for three free nights and paid entry fee for the tournament. We were treated very well checking in and in all experiences we had during our mini vacation. The hotel and casino is very large but is more casual and friendly than many of the Las Vegas casinos. There are many very affordable restaurants on the property and everything is clean and well maintained. Our non smoking room was at the end of a long hall on one of the upper floors and there was very little noise from outside or by fellow travelers. While I didn't place in the tournament, we still had a wonderful time and we will definitely stay at the Orleans again!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: vhowery
Reviews.Content: This was a Great place to stay, the people were friendly, the room was roomy, and very clean. the pool was great, not too big but good. the restaurnts were good, Fudruckers, TGIF. the buffet was good and resonable price, clean. All in all it was very good, we'll stay there again. The shuttle was handy, right to the strip and to the gold coast, it went non stop, until 12:30 am. It was good.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best at The Orleans in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: OutofTownLocals
Reviews.Content: As a frequent guest of The Orleans Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas, I cannot emphasize how much my spouse and I enjoy our stay each and every time we are in Las Vegas. This is the only hotel for us. The rooms are spacious and the casino is large and inviting. Try it. You'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Another Awesome Vegas vacation”
Reviews.Author: Frank H
Reviews.Content: Once again we found ourselves with Great "comp'd" rooms at the Orleans. Upon check in my husband requirements of a "strip view" were immediately accommodated which included moving my sisters room so we could be next to each other. Bell service was fabulous with our numerous bags and multiple rooms. The rooms are very spacious for our family of four. Gambling felt like being at a friends house. Everyone was friendly and made winning (and even losing) fun! Food choices were great too. Our favorite thing about the Orleans is the Kid Time. We like to call it "Adult Time" because after a day of the pool and doing kid oriented things -- we check them in and know they will have a great time and be safe and we can then go and enjoy the Prime Rib loft and of course -- Gambling!

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans has it all!”
Reviews.Author: Flashgordon19
Reviews.Content: I used to always stay on the strip until I found The Orleans! This place has it all and only minutes from the strip with free shuttle service. Very reasonable, clean, great restaurants and always something new going on. And don't forget your B Connected card for gaming and bonuses!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull resort”
Reviews.Author: emmada
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in August. I love The Orleans because you have everything under one roof. You have a nice and clean swimming pool, Lots of restaurants. And a casino will all the new slots machines. The drink service is exceptionnal. I recommend that place to everybody. I live in Montreal, but The Orleans is my second home. Marie

Reviews.Title: “The only place you should stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: heavensearth
Reviews.Content: Large, clean rooms that don't smell like smoke. The staff is always friendly and helpful going above and beyond to accommodate your needs. Many great restaurants to choose from (especially the oyster bar!) and a free shuttle to the strip. You can't go wrong with the Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “close to the strip but away from the noise”
Reviews.Author: foodie24_10
Reviews.Content: this was a very nice hotel. It was a business trip and the company got a great rate. rooms were a bit dated but very clean. staff was very friendly. Not as glitzy as some on the strip but was only $39.00 per night. they run a shuttle to the strip every 1/2 hour or so, therfore no need to pay for taxi's. the restaurant on the main floor was very very good. would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A fine place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: MontanaTravler
Reviews.Content: Be sure to ask for a newly renovated room. Stayed here on a Friday and Saturday night in a nonsmoking room. When we first got in, the room smelled smoky just from the pervasive smoke smell from downstairs, but the smell cleared up as soon as we turned up the AC and opened the window (in the shower!). The guest room doors make a terrible bang up and down the hallway, which you can hear from inside the room, but we brought a white-noise machine and the bangs didn't bother us. Rooms are fairly large. In case it matters to you, the "closet" is a bar and rack in the bathroom, off to the side, with plenty of floor space separating it from the sink area. No free WiFi. Pool area not very good for Vegas--tons of rowdy kids in the pool, which was milky (with sunscreen, we hoped!).

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: irishgypsy88
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas 9 times and have stayed at the Orleans for the past 4 visits. I've brought both my younger brother and husband on different trips and stayed there alone. The rooms are spacious and clean, the bathroom is NOT the first thing you see when you walk in the door, and my husband and I loved the NOLA theme throughout. Through the years I have started to see the wear in the rooms, but it's negligible. The prices are low and the amenities are great. I haven't had a chance to try the pool yet (the last trip was in December...WAY too cold for swimming!), but am looking forward to it on a future visit. The casino is nice and spread out, not claustrophobic. If you have kids and are looking for something to entertain them, there is also a fully equipped bowling alley as well as a movie theatre on the second floor. The buffet (French Market) was awesome. Saw on the Travel Channel that they rate it as one of the best in town, and I have to agree...I've eaten meals there many times and the prices are attractive and the food is tasty! Your coupon book (you get upon check-in) offers a discount ticket, which made it all the better. This hotel is off the strip, so it doesn't have that crazy hustle and bustle of the other hotels, but it has everything they have, but a bit more relaxed. There is a theatre inside (saw a comedy show there) as well as a large arena (saw a concert there too) for other entertainment. All in all, I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Vegas that wants a place to get away from the strip after a long day of fun! You will need to rent a car, since cab rides aren't cheap and there is no monorail there. There may be a bus stop, although we just used a car.

Reviews.Title: “Everything but the Cocktail and Courtyard Cafe Staff”
Reviews.Author: alwaysvegas
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the Orleans in about a decade. I won't stay at any hotel that charges more than $10 a night for their complete scam 'resort fee' BS. All the Boyd properties only charge $5/night scam fee as far as I know. Really nice tower room overall with nice marble countertops and wood-framed oval full-length mirror. A few cigarette burns here and there, but perfectly clean overall. Check-in/out was fast and their front desk staff was exceptionally nice, especially when I had to return to my room after checking out because I forgot a charger. Bed was comfy and the A/C worked fine. Unfortunately, the same can't be said for the cocktail staff. Wow, they were so unfriendly I felt like I was burdening them with a cocktail order. Especially the cocktail and staff at the Keno lounge. No smiles and they barely say a word and say "thank you" for the tip while running away and not even looking at me. Really a nasty bunch there. Ate at Courtyard Cafe twice. Decent food/price. Extremely indifferent staff. They don't say "hello" when they took my order and never checked back after I'd received my food. Zero tip for them. One couple across from me were complaining because their waitress assumed they were done with their soup crackers and just walked up, grabbed the cracker tray and gave it to another couple without even asking. Wow...customer serviced isn't practiced at the Courtyard Cafe. Machines paid well after hunting down the full-pay video poker and I received a great offer via snail mail for some free nights with some relatively low play. I'll certainly be coming back but won't play Keno or eat at the Courtyard Cafe again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything One Needs in One Location”
Reviews.Author: ImaGogetter
Reviews.Content: I visit Vegas annually and each time I spend two or more nights here. Compared to other Vegas hotels it is very reasonably priced, has great ammenities and I love the pool. No matter what time I arrive, I'm always able to check-in right away, which is nice. There is a great selection of places to eat (buffet, TGIFridays, a food court and specialty restaurants), the B-Connected Players club is a very good one and the pool hours are better than most hotels. The rooms are fairly ordinary but large and clean. The staff is always helpful, friendly and accommodating. Join the players club and use your card at the B-Connected casinos, even if just playing pennies and nickels (which I do). There are always great promotions for rooms, food and free play on the website. Each trip, I get to stay for free 2 weekday nights and get a $10 food credit. This is definitely an insentive to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Bad + Info for ADA Travelers”
Reviews.Author: arniepalmerfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans because we were attending an award dinner for winemakers and knew we didn’t want to drive after dinner. The room rate was good, $69.00 on a Saturday night in August. When we made our reservations we asked for early check-in so we could have lunch and spend some time at the pool. We were there with another couple, who requested a standard room. I reserved an assessable room. When we arrived the assessable room was ready, but the other couple were told to come back in two hours or so. We decided to have a cocktail before lunch and stopped at the Alligator Bar where we were completely ignored for five minutes or longer. Finally a bartender came by and told us it would be a couple more minutes because they were having a shift change. Not very good scheduling, someone should always be available to serve the customers. After lunch the other couple went to get the keys to their room. When they got to the room they found nothing but a big mess, unmade bed, beer bottles all around. They went back down to the front desk and were told they would have to wait and come back later. We then went out to the pool to relax for a while. The other woman with our group hadn’t had much lunch and wanted a snack, which her husband ordered from the snack bar. There is no restaurant at the pool, just a snack bar and a small bar for cocktail service. The husband came back with a cheese quesadilla which cost $9.00; it was just cheese and a tortilla for that price. Wow. On the plus side, there are shaded areas near the pool to sit in. The pool itself was very cloudy and didn’t appear to be clean. No swimming for me in that water. We left the pool at 4:15 and our friends once again tried to get to their room. This time the keys didn’t work. They called the front desk and the clerk there said that she thought they had changed their room. Nope, they hadn’t changed the room, so one more trip to the front desk. Our friend asked for some kind of compensation for all of the trouble and after some discussion, he was given a $25.00 meal credit. Our room, the assessable room, was clean and roomy. In the bath there was no place to put toiletry items. There was only one pillow on either side of the bed, a lot of hotels are now putting in two or three per side and I like that. The bed was comfortable. The a/c was very efficient and the room was quiet. We slept well and the draperies kept it dark enough that we slept later than usual.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: smuse
Reviews.Content: The Orleans has all the things the wife i look for in hotels as well as location price entertainment food we love staying there and the service what more really

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding visit”
Reviews.Author: Joan G
Reviews.Content: Great room rates, great food, helpful dealers, we were very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great on many levels..except”
Reviews.Author: TravlinMan33
Reviews.Content: Recently attended a convention at the Orleans. My ONLY complaint was the $13 WiFi fee. These days there is really no excuse except "gouging" for WiFi fees at a hotel. Many other hotels offer it for free. Free WiFi is available at the Lobby Coffee shop however. I chose that rather than be gouged for the short while I would need Wifi in my room... BUT it would have been Nice!! ;) This was my only complaint as I said earlier. The price was very good and the room was clean. Staff was very great also . Staff always seemed happy as well which tells me a lot about hotel management. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel / Casino in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: realme38
Reviews.Content: The best staff! Friendly and Professional. The best Rooms! Clean and Beautiful. The best Casino! Fun and Exciting.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!!!”
Reviews.Author: cpower0346
Reviews.Content: The recent stay at the Orleans was a pleasure. We spent seven nights at the casino. The rooms are bright and airy and there is a great choice of restaurants. The casino was easy to get around and the personnel on the floor are very friendly and helpful. Brought relatives for the first time and they were equally happy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a weekend stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cinchgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband was working in California and we decided to meet in Las Vegas for a weekend and hitched a room with a group that was in town for a convention. Check in was quick and the hotel was huge. Made our long way to our room but was surprised to find the room was actully pretty nice. Our room was big had a nice sized bathroom and a good view of the strip. The room had a coffee pot but no fridge so we could not save our leftovers from our steak dinner which was kinda sucked but in Vegas you can always find another meal. The casio was busy but we still found plenty of games to entertain us so that was a plus. We ate the seafood buffet and it was ok not great. Went bowling at the bowling alley and could have really just stayed in the hotel the whole weekend. People were friendly and the hotel/casino area did not knock you over with smoke. Found this hotel to be a good value as long as you dont have to pay the premium price and can get a discount. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “I love the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Steelersfan36
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Orleans Hotel and Casino every time I am in Vegas, which is about four times a year. Although this hotel is off the strip it has a shuttle that takes you right to the center of the strip :) The Orleans has the best offers. I always get comp rooms and I don't even gamble that much. The comp rooms always come with a dining credit which is nice. My favorite game to play at the Orleans is Gold Fishin :) and the restaurants are really good. They also give you coupons for discounts off of all the things offered at the Orleans. They have a bowling alley that I'm pretty sure is open 24 hrs a day and a movie theater with 18 theaters. They also have an arcade outside the theater. If you want to have some adult time away from the kids they have a place to drop them off (kids tyme). The smoke smell is not to overwhelming at the Orleans because of the high ceilings, which is nice for us non smokers. Basically for an off strip hotel it is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lyle--Sportvictoria
Reviews.Content: Off the strip, LOTS of free parking, free valet parking. Big rooms for a Vegas hotel - lots of space. I think about 450sq feet for a normal room Not a big pool but quite nice. Not part of a big chain (run by Boyd Gaming), reasonably generous with the comps. LOTS of good food places in the casino, TGI Friday’s, Fuddruckers, Subway, Al's Oyster Bar, Courtyard Cafe (try the prime rib), a sushi place, Baskin Robbins and a few others. Movie theatres, bowling alley, show room, barber, arena that can be both dry or ice (home of the ECHL Wranglers). They also host a men’s NCAA Div 1 college playoff tourney each spring. Expensive WiFi in the rooms @ $12.99/day with no deals on a week's stay. There is a secondary signal you can get that gives you $9.95/day or $39.95 a week - this is not offered by the hotel. So the signal can be spotty sometimes depending on where your room is. Free WiFi at the coffee shop near the check in.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Times at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Susan S
Reviews.Content: We always enjoy staying at The Orleans. The rooms are very nice and include coffee pots, which aren't available at some hotels. The casino has lots of open space and a good mix of the latest slot and video poker machines. As for the restaurants...the Courtyard Cafe never disappoints and prices are reasonable...we celebrated a family birthday with dinner at the Prime Rib Loft...and while we didn't have time to fit in Canal Street, it's always been one of our favorites, as is the Chinese Restaurant. Haven't had a chance to tr try the Mexican eatery since it went through some changes. I have recommended The Orleans to many people and they've never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Time for an overhaul”
Reviews.Author: PHXroadwarrior
Reviews.Content: Stayed here four nights for a convention and got a very cheap group room rate but wow the rooms certainly are tired and ready for a re-do. The pictures on the website make it look far better than it is. Hallways have 1980's-era wallpaper and carpet like my grandmother's house and the rooms quite simply need a total refresh. Bathrooms are very dated with bad lighting, a creaky sliding door, poor ventilation, and an open clothes bar instead of an actual closet. I would never stat here again. Life is too short, and Vegas has way too many affordable amazing hotels to stay somewhere unsatisfactory like this.

Reviews.Title: “Touch of the Bayou in the Desert”
Reviews.Author: grggrr
Reviews.Content: Good choice of indepensive food outlets near the casino with live music at least on the weekend. All the usual table game and slots in the ccasino. The hotel has the longest hallways I have ever trudged. The property is some distance form The Strip

Reviews.Title: “Typical "off the strip" Hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: srarakawa
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is a nice place if you want to stay off the strip, but be close enough to take a very short cab ride. There are several "ok" little restaurants, but the Prime Rib Loft is definitely worth the visit, for the "carnivore crowd." The rooms and bathrooms are clean and the noise is not too bad. The beds feel like the mattresses are fairly new, and there were definitely no bedbugs! There are also free safes in the rooms. The televisions are a good size, but the WiFi is not free :o( Room service breakfast (had it twice) was better slightly better than usual, which is saying something for Vegas. The casino is typical, but not cramped and not too smokey. The worst thing is probably check-in/out. They are slow... When I am not staying downtown at "The Cal" (another average hotel, but they cater to Asians from Hawaii), I will stay at The Orleans until I find a suitable replacement.

Reviews.Title: “A very good value”
Reviews.Author: MrBigTraveler
Reviews.Content: An older property that is well kept up and very clean. A large casino and a very good variety of restaurants. It is resonably priced and offers some name brand shows as well. I have never had a bad stay. A better proximity to the strip then the downtown hotels. Better low limits on the table games as well. Even tho I don't understand taking kids to Vegas, if you have to, there are even things to keep them occupied (tho many of the restaurants are integrated into the gaming areas). The TV line up also stinks which means paying for movies or Nintendo but that's what you get for bringing kids to an adult venue. A bit of a walk to your car but what Vegas hotel doesn't have the same issue. The only negative was paid internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vegas for gambling, comfort and fun!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFran30
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at almost every hotel in Vegas and I keep going back to the Orleans. I feel really comfortable there, not out of place like I do in other hotels. The food is diverse and fantastic. I have not had a single bad meal there. The staff is friendly and courteous. and the gambling is great. I seem to always win there. I will continue to stay at the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “First Time-excellent!”
Reviews.Author: ncrjamie
Reviews.Content: Couple-mid 40's. First time here, and would definitely go again. Check in was a breeze, staff were extremely friendly, and I even won a bit (VP) Pool was very comfortable, did not feel overcrowded at all. Comps were very generous too! Hubby played a lot of BJ (and won playing single deck) and we got a couple free buffets from the table manager when we asked him (Thanks!). This place really knows how to treat their guests. Room was decent. Clean and roomy. Food was very good too. Buffet ribs rocked! Good for the money. Ate at Al's Oyster bar, very good. Friday's was average. Location was very good too. Walgreen's was a block up, and strip around the corner. Overall great time here, and would stay again in a heartbeat. Stayed 5 nights, cost around $34 bucks a night. Not too shabby I tell ya! Played racebook one day-cashiers/ticket employees very nice and it was comfortable. I even won a few races myself. We do not have children, and I was worried that this might be more for families, but honestly it was a mixed crowd and I felt very good staying there.

Reviews.Title: “The Locals know and now so do you!”
Reviews.Author: Pat R
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff that cares about your stay and play! Although not on the strip we find it an incredible advantage over other brands due to service and strategic to everything we want to do in Vegas. However we often never leave because we find all we want inside. Give it a try they will not disappoint. Pat and Rea Riley, regular customers for years from SoCal!

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Suzette721
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is Fantastic! It is a short cab ride from the airport. The people who work there are all very nice and helpful. The rooms are nice and big. They are also clean. They always treat us so good there that we always keep coming back and only stay at The Orleans,and we go to Vegas 3 to 4 times a year and always keep going back to The Orleans. They have a great movie theatre and bowling alley as well. Which is great if you want a break from the gaming floor. They also a very nice pool area. All of the restaurants @ The Orleans are wonderful great food and service. It is always so much fun I wish I could go more often. They also have some great shows booked @ The Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favourite Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: whirlpool75
Reviews.Content: This hotel & casino has it all !! Very friendly reasonable and clean...Large casino and poker room ..A treasure off the strip ..

Reviews.Title: “We've been here many times and we'll return again and again!”
Reviews.Author: HGH
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Las Vegas and once again we stayed at the Orleans. We have been staying there for at least the past 7 years now and I think they are doing a good job of keeping things up. Our room was typically well cared for and clean, with the safe in the room and all it is very convenient. We stayed on the 5th floor in the tower reached from the elevators closer to the pool. There were a couple of stains on the carpet, but no big deal. We really like to stay there because we often have our car with us- but we have used the shuttle and then the Deuce bus to navigate the strip when we've flown with little problem. We each find things we enjoy in the casino- my husband the lower stakes Texas Hold Em tables and I like their slots. I do miss some of the ones they seem to have fazed out over the past year- the Twilight Zone and Jaws seem to have left the planet! But they also have added new ones. Things I am learning not to take for granted: Check-in is usually very fast (less than 10-15 minutes) at any time of the day we have arrived. When we are in the bigger casinos on the strip there always seem to be backups at all hours of the day, with people sitting around on their luggage waiting. Security of having someone looking for room keys. The care they take with keeping the hallways up- we wandered around the Luxor because we were curious about it. No one looked for our key and we went all over the place. What a dismal place! The hallways were dismal, dark, in dire need of cleaning and paint, with pieces of the wall torn off at points- like one too many "hangover" type bachelor parties have occurred there or something. My one complaint: - we enjoy the buffet and it is very reasonably priced. We tend to get the same things over and over and so it is ok. But I think that it has become a bit boring and some of the dishes were not as hot as I would like. They could use a little more variety. However, huge plus in the buffet is a woman named "Pat" who is usually one of the people who serve you your drinks, etc... She is always very friendly and very much on top of refilling drinks, taking plates, etc.. She deserves a raise!!!

Reviews.Title: “AWAY FROM THE MADDENING CROWD”
Reviews.Author: caviteboyHockessin
Reviews.Content: It's a place that is not rawdy and you have your comfort zone,a place where you can meet the locals and feel safe.It' a place that makes you feel special.It's a place where you can have solace and yet have a view of the beautiful,colorful and busy strip.

Reviews.Title: “The Oleans Hotel has the best feeling from the minute you walk in.”
Reviews.Author: Kandiace P
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at The Oleans 3 times in the last year. Our visits have been for pleasure and softball and basketball tournaments. I've been impressed everytime I've stayed there. The staff is always courteous and willing to help. The rooms are clean and comfortable to say in. They have a variety of restaurants and food choices from sit down to a food court. They have a lot of choices for gambling. I love the penny slots. The Orleans is located right off the strip. It is very convenient. I think though what impressed me the most was being there during a major basketball tournament. The staff took control of the enormous amount of kids there for the tournaments. There were signs up stating how they needed to behave and what was expected. We had a lot of kids on the floor we were on and we had no issues at all with noise or kids that weren't behaving. Very well done! On future trips we will always stay at The Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely family friendly hotel; will return”
Reviews.Author: Lvsportsnut028
Reviews.Content: First, let me say I loved this hotel. It's not a new hotel but it was very comfortable and has everything you could ever want. Pros and Cons follow: Pros: - very large and comfortable rooms, - multi-screen movie theater on property, - 24-hour bowling alley on property, - arcade, - kid's play and child care area for very reasonable price, - lots of restaurants on property (TGI Fridays, Sbarro, French Market Buffet, Subway, Chocolate Factory, Baskin & Robbins, Mexican Food Restaurant (can't think of name), Oyster Bar), - adult pool and childrens pool, - entertainment on property (DL Hughley was there during my stay), - complimentary parking, - off strip but close (within 10 minutes), - very cooperative staff, - good value (inexpensive, $29 per night during week; $79 per night on weekend). Cons: - air conditioner rumbled a bit (but due to 100 degree weather, it was working very hard), - stain on carpet in one area (really not a big deal), - food wasn't the tastiest in a couple of the restaurants. I will definitely return to this hotel. There was really no need to leave the hotel if you didn't want to.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll definitely be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mel M
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't change a thing. Facilities are great and clean. Everyone is extremely friendly. We enjoy staying at The Orleans each and every time. We're planning a trip in November, 2011. Can't wait. See you soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: kooleagels
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel i have been before years ago and I had fun. Just went back to the hotel in July 2011 and had a ball. the pool was nice gambling was nice and so many places to eat at. This is definitely a family friendly hotel. It is very basic if you are looking for frills then this is not the hotel for you. We love and they gave us comp rooms so we are going back real soon. This is a great hotel and i recommend it to anyone that wants to stay in Las Vegas for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THE ORLEANS”
Reviews.Author: dynamite_deb
Reviews.Content: What a great stay!!!! I use to come to Vegas 4 or 5 times a year for work and have stayed at many nice hotel-casinos. I never considered The Orleans due to its location. My granddaughter's cheerleading squad was competing in the Nationals at the Orleans Arena so we booked a block of rooms here. It was awesome!!! Nice clean rooms, comfortable beds and (unusual in vegas) a coffee pot. Plenty of eating establishments. Great pool. My husband liked the Chocolate Shop. Spent too much time in the casino. LOL!! The Orleans is very kid friendly. Our cheerleading girls had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: slots4me2
Reviews.Content: I have been to The Orleans many times to gamble, but this is the first time I stayed there. Loved it from the moment we arrived til check-out. Casino was clean, room was clean, food was great. Plenty of slots to choose from (not too tight either). The Cafe serves so much food we learned to split a plate and still had plenty. If you tell them to split it, you get more than splitting it yourself. The Mexican restaurant has early bird specials that are great. Plus there's a shuttle to the Gold Coast and the Strip, so no added expense for taxi's. The room was great. Wonderful bed. Better than home! Pool area small but very clean and nice. Very relaxing. We're staying there again next year. Can't wait!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Vegas 14”
Reviews.Author: Karlie
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at The Orleans with my husband and some friends for the VLV Rockabilly Weekender. It was our first time in Vegas, so I've never stayed in one of the mega hotels on the Strip. Things I liked: - The price. I don't remember what we paid per night, but it totaled about $200 for all three nights. - The room was huge. The bed was huge. There was a phone in the bathroom. There was a bathtub - I LOVE having bathtubs while on a trip. - Free shuttle to the Strip. (It's not far, so a cab could be reasonable, too) - I didn't use the pool, but had a perfect view from my room. It looked really nice, spacious, with some chairs and grassy areas. Looked clean, too. - Bowling alley! - There is a convenience store type place with some souvenirs and giant cans of beer, and a liquor store. - Decent drink prices. - We didn't have a car, but there is a huge parking lot. Things I didn't like: - The main floor especially was incredibly smokey. I'm a non-smoker, and after about a day in the hotel my throat started to hurt pretty badly and feel kind of inflamed. We were walking around some other hotels on the Strip and they seemed WAY better ventilated - I could hardly notice the smoke in some of them. The Orleans should really try to improve on this somehow. It was disgusting. - The front desk person upon check-in: She was polite, but she didn't give us any information other than our room number. It would have been nice if she told us about the dining options, how to get to different places (pool, bowling alley, movie theatre, etc.), internet, etc. I'd never been to that hotel before, how was I supposed to know? - Cell reception in most areas of the hotel (for calls and texts) was terrible. Really inconvenient if you're meeting up with people, etc. - Some jerks down the hall from us decided to hang out with their door open when we were trying to sleep, talking really loudly. I was just kind of surprised at just how loud it sounded in our room. I mean, they were a few doors down and it sounded like they were standing on our bed. - $12.99 a day for spotty wi-fi. We ate at the Mexican restaurant a couple of times, which was pretty decent. I think sub-par Mexican in the SW USA is still better than "good" Mexican food in Northern Alberta. We decided to have breakfast at Fuddrucker's for about $8 each rather than getting the $14.99 buffet. I still can't get over how much butter they gave us for one slice of bread, but it was alright. The food court also had a Subway and Sbarro, and there were a couple of other restaurants we didn't try. I don't gamble, so I don't know if the selection of games and machines was good or not. I would have no problem staying at The Orleans if I were to go to Viva again, but if not I would probably opt to try out staying on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, as always..”
Reviews.Author: 4wards
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed only a couple of nights in July 2011, which were comped to us just by joining their players club. My husband and I don't really even gamble; we just like this hotel a lot. This year we were only there a couple nights and then drove to Utah. They gave us a room on the 21st floor, which we found to be very nice.
