It was clean, had a nice view, flat-screen t.v., etc. We only play the slots just a little bit and we love the atmosphere at this hotel over the other hotels in Vegas. We check out others but always return to The Orleans. The staff we found to be very friendly. We had asked for a small fridge to keep some medicine and the front desk clerk initially told us he was out but would add us to a short waiting list; however, within 10 minutes of us entering our room, there was a knock on the door and a friendly employee had a fridge for us. I don't have any complaints whatsever with The Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: keerle
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights July 28-Aug 1. There were 6 adults and 4 kids. The Orleans was great. There is a bowling alley, Theater, arcade and child care available. The 24 hr Sbarro,Fuddruckers and Subway was wonderful since we didn't get in until 11:30pm on Thursday night.

Reviews.Title: “Two great days”
Reviews.Author: donmil2010
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two wonderful days and nights here in February, 2011. WE had been in Tucson visiting relatives, and decided on a side trip. This is our fifth or sixth trip to the Orleans, but the first in February. We had so much fun, we didn't leave the hotel, until checking out. Tuesdays are senior days and the perks are great. I have already booked for October, 2011.

Reviews.Title: “A week without the husbands and kids”
Reviews.Author: jeffborst
Reviews.Content: My friend and I decided we needed to do something for just us without our husbands and kids. We could not have been happier at the Orleans. It had a nice pool and hot tub, one of the only 24 hour cafe's, shuttle to the strip, and did not smell like a lot of other casinos. It also has a bowling alley and movie theater,b ut we never made it up to them as we were too busy having fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great service, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jfactor79
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd visit back to this hotel in Las Vegas. The price was amazingly low and the service was great. Why spend so much more on a hotel on the strip when you can stay here, a short shuttle bus ride to the strip. I'd come back here in a heartbeat! Great friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Big, comfy rooms with decor inspired by a grandmother!”
Reviews.Author: Travelsavvy888
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is a comfortable hotel that does not have a modern feel, nor does it intend to. It's for people who want a big comfortable room instead of something small and upscale. It's a dated property but provides quality and affordable hotel experience. The buffet is a disappointment. Food is dry and uninspiring, and service is lacking. If you are staying at the hotel, do your 'all-you-can-eat' elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, slots not so great”
Reviews.Author: alklontz
Reviews.Content: We traveled here for a quick 4 day trip. My boyfriend nor I had been to Las Vegas before, and had been offered free a free room at the Orleans through Boyd gaming. The room itself was nice. We were assigned a room with two queen beds instead of a single king bed, like I'd requested, but oh well. The room itself was pretty good. I think the wall thermostat was in someways just a facade. The temperature could be turned down as low as 62, in our room at least, but still didn't feel any cooler than it did at 68 degrees. The room initially did have some odors of body odor and cigarette smoke. A few sprays of Febreeze every day helped out. The beds were comfortable. The bathroom door was quite heavy, so we weren't worried about sounds traveling (as some other reviews stated), but could be hard to move back and forth. The slots were extremely tight. We mainly played the penny slots, with some nickel and quarter slots interspersed. We weren't impressed with the slots. I saw a lot more choices for the different penny slots at other casinos on the Strip. The shuttle did run every 15 minutes and was very handy and greatly appreciated. We tried to eat at the buffet a couple of times, but got discouraged after standing in line for over 15 minutes and still not being at the register. A big hang-up with the buffet is that after you pay for your meals at the register, you then have to stand and wait to be seated, instead of seating yourself. We did eat at the TGIFriday's in the hotel and found the food to be on the same level as a TGIFriday outside a hotel, but our server was quite lacking in his customer service. We never saw a manager or had one come by to check on how our meals were. The Japanese place- the food was good but quite expensive, even for a sushi place. The lunch specials were well priced however. We ate at the Prime Rib Loft one evening. The service was pretty good and the food was alright. We got the tempura vegetables, which were quite good. The prime rib was pretty good as well. We ended up leaving without dessert due to a time contraint. Overall, we had an enjoyable stay, just weren't impressed with the slots or a couple of the food places.

Reviews.Title: “Good family hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: richbel
Reviews.Content: Great for families. Very busy hotel, staff are not hugely helpful and tend to do the bare minimum compared to other Vegas service we encountered. Lovely ladies at the Java Cafe - a must for Wifi and friendly morning faces. The kids loved the Arcade, Bowling alley, Movie theatres! Pool seemed a bit murky, so we tended to swim elsewhere. Good location off the strip but watch out for the free shuttle in as the last one leaves at 12:30pm and there is only one with about 40 seats NO standing allowed which means they only ever assume 40 people are going to catch the last shuttle back to the hotel which is crazy! Catch a taxi it is way easier and way more reliable. Tip for Bowling Alley...it is only $1.00 after midnight which was great, you need to pay for your shoe hireage though. Great time to go bowling though!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't give the feeling of being in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SusanneT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Orleans from July 28 - 31. We hadn't been to Vegas in 11 years and decided to go at the last minute as I had a granddaughter who was going to be in a cheerleading competition at the Orleans Arena. Check in was a breeze but nothing about the hotel or the casino made you feel like you were in Las Vegas. The rooms were large but only average accomodations. The first morning there, we were pleased with the prompness of the housekeeping staff to get our room cleaned as soon as we left for breakfast at about 9am. The next day was a different story; It was 4pm before we got any kind of maid service at all and I had to call housekeeping to get it cleaned and to get fresh linens. Nothing turns me off more than not having my room cleaned after spending most of the day gone and coming back to an unmade bed! The hotel did offer a good variety in restaurants and bars. Anything from seafood to steaks to hamburgers. There was even a TGI Friday's inside the hotel. Drink prices were reasonable at all of the bars but finding a bartender with a personality was rare if not any. It's nice to sit at the bar and chit chat with the bartender but that didn't happen anywhere in the whole hotel. The waitstaff was far and few between...I guess we weren't tipping enough. Gaming was OK if you stuck to penny machines. Stay away from quarters and dollar slots! They didn't hit at all. I expected to have the slots loosened since we weren't gambling on the strip. I'm not sure that I, as a travel agent, would recommend this hotel to anyone but people traveling with children. I recommend paying a little more and staying on the strip if you're making the trip out to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Overun with Basketball Players and Little Security Intervention”
Reviews.Author: Vegas022
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from the Orleans Hotel in Vegas. We stayed there last November and it was great so when we got a couple nights free offer we returned. Problem was there was a basketball competition going on during the time we were there and so there were tons of kids all over the Hotel, casino, elevators, etc... Signs were posted of do's and don'ts for the players which were ignored for the most part by the kids and by security. I'm talking everything from bouncing a basketball to loud yelling and screaming at each other throughout the entire property. I found out later there were kids staying at other Hotels as well. So you get the picture (the town was run over with basketball players and they were not on their best behavior). Another thing... we checked in around midnight so it had been a long day and when we got to our room it was a handicap room. We just kept it because we were told they were fully booked. The bed was literally on the floor and the shower was open with a shower curtain and no tub and therefore water was all over the floor after showering which was bad enough not to mention dangerous (and it was a handicap room) weird. We were not informed of the room at check in which I feel like we should have been.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I wanted: no hassle, no Strip noise, no problems...”
Reviews.Author: kttravel08
Reviews.Content: So last time I went to Las Vegas I stayed on the Strip. Noisy, frenetic etc. This time I wanted a resort type hotel with a bit of quiet. The Orleans fit the bill perfectly. Staff were very friendly, from the check in desk to the maids to the security chaps and so on. I arrived late on Sunday and checked in straight away. Received a set of coupons for onsite eateries and so on. My room was a double queen, I had asked not to be far from the elevator and this was the case. Whilst I visited there was a basketball meet of some kind (huge and polite teenage boys everywhere) and an athletics meet. Neither of these were any kind of problem. The Orleans seems to have a very clear and fair policy regarding the behaviour that is expected of attendees at these events and it all seemed good to me. I was on a non smoking floor and my room did indeed seem smoke free. The carpet had seen better days, but the room was clean and comfortable. The bed was heaven, and as I came down with a nasty cold on the plane to Las Vegas I spent way too much time in the bed - I really appreciated it's comfort! The TV was an old 'box' type but had enough channels to keep my busy whilst blowing my nose. Bathroom was well fitted out with a lovely shower plus iron and ironing board in the room, as well as a small hairdryer and nice toiletries. I ate at the TFI Fridays, the Fudruckers, the Sbarro and the Buffet. The first three all did exactly what you would expect from each of these outlets. Solid, reliable fare. The Buffet is cheap - $7.99 for breakfast, $8.99 for lunch (sign up for players club and get a $1 discount). The food is not special but it is hot, plentiful and solid. Nice range of cakes!! Because of being ill I did not take advantage of the pool or the cinema but the range of movies was excellent with lots of showings. Maid service was very good. I was not out of my room much yet every time I made it out for an hour or so, when I came back the room was done. Bless you ladies. The shuttle to the strip apparently tuns every 30 minutes, but I never waited more than about ten, if that. Very convenient and drops you right in the centre at Bill's. I also used shuttle transport to and from the airport - a bargain at $8.50 each way. I also used the taxis from outside the hotel - I never felt like I was being taken the long way round which is always helpful. Free internet at the coffee bar and also ten minutes per day in the business centre if you don't have your own laptop with you. All in all a successful stay and I would definitely stay at the Orleans again. The value was, quite frankly, impressive at $30 a night (plus $6 resort fee).

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at the Orleans several times”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaReadytogo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a number of different hotels over the years and now usually stay at the Orleans. Reasonably priced comfortable rooms. Reasonably priced food, which you cannot get on the Strip. A variety of food venues. Sometimes specials like steak and eggs in the Cafe. Easy parking, complete casino, family activities, shuttle to the Strip. I have not used the pool but it looks inviting. I grudgingly accept the prevalent "resort fee" because I regularly use the equipment in the exercise room.

Reviews.Title: “Atmosphere is Great! Overall great for families with kids”
Reviews.Author: amfun33
Reviews.Content: We love this place. Rooms are nice & clean. Roomy & comfy. This Hotel is great for families especially if you have kids. Has Arcade, Movie Theatre, Child play center & bowling alley. Good Food cafe & buffet at reasonable price. The Pool is great. They have one just for the lil ones to a big pool for the bigger kids. Great place just to hang out in Vegas. Oh yes the casino is good too with the variety of offerings. We take the shuttle to the other the Orleans family of hotels. Even takes you to the strip. Check in & check out was good. No problems. Valet was ok took a little while to take & deliver car but overall good. The staff was nice & friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the family”
Reviews.Author: MauiRain
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans for a family reunion in Vegas and it fit our needs well. With our 8 yr. old, it was important to have the bowling alley, arcade, and pool areas. The bowling alley was awesome! There was also a theater but we did not see any movies. The other impressive thing about the hotel was that there was a variety of eating choices available, with the food court type dining, as well as restaurants. Don't count on eating or keeping food in the room - there's no fridge or microwave. The room was decent and the decor nice. The biggest problem was the LOUD air conditioner which prevented me from having a good sleep the first night. Tip: turn the AC to auto. The other problem was that on the first night I had no hot water, and we had occasional plumbing issues, with the toilet nearly backing up and some backup while taking a shower one night. There's a free shuttle to the strip that is convenient, which worked well for us. Overall I've stayed at better hotels but this one suited our needs fine.

Reviews.Title: “back again to the orleans”
Reviews.Author: BKLYNLADY55
Reviews.Content: stayed at the orleans again 4th stay , again i applaude the staff, and security, special thanks to the security staff at the orleans, i had one of those great nights(lol) in las vegas and they made sure i reached my room safely, the orleans has great musical groups at (1) of their lounges, i mean great groups,they cater to all age groups, you can dance the night away or just relax and listen to great songs(out standing) the cocktail waitress are very nice ladies, courteous at all time, so please tip them they work hard to make your stay pleasant also. i cant say enough about the orleans, i love las vegas and the orleans has always fulfilled my expectations for fun and relaxation, the pool is great and you can always find a chair in the hot sun, or in the cool breeze from the palm trees. so when you consider vegas as your vacation spot try the orleans you wont be dissapointed. this hotel provides very clean rooms(with a lil sitting area quaint) there is a movie theatre, bowling alley, and the best restaurants you can eat at, reasonable priced. cant wait until i return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JimVette
Reviews.Content: Very reasonably priced. While the rooms are somewhat dated, they were clean and well maintained. The staff, to a person, were friendly and helpful. Restaurants are OK, but service and cleanliness in the restaurants is spotty.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay with OR without the family!!!”
Reviews.Author: born2bowl2
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at The Orleans and I was completely satisfied. The Orleans is very customer friendly unlike most of the Vegas mega resorts. *The staff was friendly and always willing to help. *The lobby was clean and inviting. *The rooms are clean & spacious but a little dated. *The pool was well maintained and roomy. Lounge chairs were plentiful but as another reviewer stated the buildings block the sun for a couple hours in the morning and a couple hours in the evening. *The casino is large with a wide variety of machines and table games. *The buffet was good but does not open until 8am for breakfast, which I feel is a bit late. *The food court is small but open 24 hours. There is a Baskin Robins, Fuddruckers, Subway and a Sbarro. *The TGI Fridays has good service and GREAT coffee!!! *The bowling alley is large and seems to run many daily specials. *The theater is huge running the most recent movies. It was clean and comfortable. *The shuttle to the strip & Gold Coast was clean and ran about every 20 minutes. The drivers were very nice and sociable. I recommend The Orleans to anyone that appreciates good service at a great price. I plan on returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: jog4lf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I met our son and daughter there for opening day of the Del Mar horse races, we are from San Diego. We stayed here for 4 nights, went bowling every morning, lied out by the pool and went swimming every day. We played in the sports book on opening day, bet on every race, you can even have your own TV, and cocktails are served whenever you are ready, we also enjoyed fresh beer steamed hot dogs! It was so much more enjoyable than actually being at the races.The lunch buffet was good, we did not care for the steak and scampi dinner buffet, the food court was excellent. We also enjoyed the movies and a comedy show. The slots were fun but would like to play a few newer machines. We will definitely do this again. Checking in was fast and easy. The rooms were great, clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “so-so”
Reviews.Author: matchwear
Reviews.Content: We went with our 14-yr old for Jr gold bowling. Nice bowling venue (tho' the Sunset Station was better hotel/bowling alley). strange to have bowling and video arcade while parents can drink and gamble in the same hotel. Kids walk thru the casino to get everywhere. Pool is family friendly. No free wifi unless u go to the Starbucks coffee shop in the lobby. Buffet was good but again the Sunset Station was better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for family and friends”
Reviews.Author: hoot72
Reviews.Content: The Orleans Hotel and Casino is great for family and friends. It is only a few minutes from the Strip via free shuttle. It has something for everyone - a bowling center, casino, spa, a movie theater as well as both fast food and seated dining restaurants. There is free valet parking. As were there for a wedding it was nice to have hairdryers, irons and ironing boards in the room. The staff was very pleasant and any extra services were prompt. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good Value....but”
Reviews.Author: Cashman777
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here at least a dozen times (probably more) over the last 15 years and we have considered it, on average, the best overall value in Las Vegas. On this particular trip, we were disappointed with a couple of things, but overall the Orleans is still a great place to stay. The hotel is off the strip but does offer a free shuttle every half hour. The Buffet offers plenty of choices at a good price, but be prepared for more children here than in other Vegas buffets. This hotel caters to the locals and families. The casino is large and the poker room is large, comfortable and busy. The rooms are very roomy and comfortable. They are generally reasonably clean but the room we had this trip had a very dirty carpet. It has reached the stage where shampooing won't help. It needs replacement. The recession has taken its toll on the cleanliness factor here. We stayed here specifically to see Yanni perform in concert and had made a package purchase in advance. Regrettably, we were given misinformation about the concert start time and ticket pick up. The confusion continued in the hotel itself. The concert was fantastic but the communication surrounding it were dismal. In general, we like the Orleans a lot, but they fell short in a couple of areas on this occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Always have a great time,I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: lenny56
Reviews.Content: I am not a big gambler,but at the Orleans I get treated great. Staff very freindly. I play in slot tournaments.Always meet nice people and I haven't ever had a bad experiance or witness any trouble there.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY FOR FAMILIES”
Reviews.Author: verda
Reviews.Content: Get their casino card as it will give you additional savings. Also there are senior days with additional discounts if you are 55 years old or older. The buffet is a great deal as it is not expensive and offers a lot of choices so everyone will feel satisfied. The rooms are good sized and the air conditioning works well. They are off the strip but offer free shuttles to the strip and you can connect to other Boyd properties with the shuttles. If you have time, take their shuttles to all their properties and get a tour of Las Vegas for free! Some of the drivers are really friendly and will give you information about Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK, but wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: steviemagid
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans. Hadn't been there is several years. Still looks the same. Rooms were ok---clean, quiet, cheap. Really felt that the casino was showing its age. Really bad air quality. Visited some of the newer casinos and what a difference. Ate at the Orleans buffet, nothing special. Would rather spend a little more money and get something modern, newer, and with a casino that you can actually breathe in. Why haven't they come up with smoke free casinos in LV? I certainly would stay there!

Reviews.Title: “First time here and I like it a lot.”
Reviews.Author: RL1956
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Orleans and before my trip I read the reviews on this site. Just about all were very good with one or two giving the hotel bad marks. Check-in was great. Eddie checked me and was super nice and accomodating. I requested a Strip view and it cost about $5 extra. I didn't care. The room is a nice size. Yeah there was a stain on the carpet but I wasn't planning on eating off the floor, I was okay with it. The shuttle to the Strip was great. I could have walked but it was 105 degrees and opted to be take a ride. There were a lot of teens there because of a basketball tournament; most of the hotels I went to had basketball players staying there so it was not just the Orleans. There were signs telling them how to behave and the players I saw in the elevator, hallways, restaurants, were acting on their best behaviour. Back to the room: the shower was good, nice pressure. All in all, it was clean which is a priority for me. Unlike the Riviera....horrible...and cockroaches. I would go back to the Orleans for sure. Oh, one more thing....the mattress on my bed was heavenly!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans has it all...”
Reviews.Author: azitizLacey_WA
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay. Great food. Great staff. The only place to stay in Vegas. Shuttle to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “May not be for everyone!”
Reviews.Author: JCfromOKC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just finished a five day stay at The Orleans. The Orleans would be a great place to stay if traveling with minor children, the grandparents or both. If you plan on spending your entire family trip at the Orleans it has everything for the young and the old. If you are between the ages of 21 and 60, The Orleans may not be the place for you! There were teenagers roaming the halls knocking on random doors then running away. They would also go down the hall turning the "Do Not Disturb" signs hanging on the doors over to read "Maid Service Requested". We found some of the geriatric crowd to be quite annoying too. Many of them were both pushy and rude in both the casino and especially in the "French Market Buffet" which I might add has average food. If you ignore the old people grabbing food with their hands and are able to actually get to a food station to get what you want you may like it. We also ate at "Big Al's Oyster Bar", the "Courtyard Cafe" and the food court, all were very good. We rented a car and was able to spend time at other casinos. The Boyd casinos in Las Vegas are outstanding and we especially enjoyed Main Street Station and Sam's Town, The Gold Coast was great too. All three would have been better choices for us that is unless we had been traveling with teenagers or the grandparents then like I said, the Orleans would be a great place to stay. My wife and I may stop in The Orleans again to gamble but wouldn't stay again unless the room was comped! Oh one other thing, I keep reading how The Orleans is smokey. Have these people ever been to a casino? We have been in dozens and The Orleans ranks right up there at the top. No problem with being smokey what so ever!

Reviews.Title: “Think twice”
Reviews.Author: guitarpsych
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the positive. They let us out of two day reservation one day early without charging for the second night. However, there were several reasons we had to leave early. If you are a smoker, this would be paradise, however, coming from relatively smoke free New York, everything smelled like smoke including our no-smoking room. Second, without sounding like a snob, we did not feel like we fit in with the crowd there. Not better or worse, just felt more comfortable at the MGM Grand, where we stayed the second night. no smoke smell. Not angry with The Orleans, just trying to balance the reviews on Tripadvisor that led us to book here.

Reviews.Title: “BE A LOCAL & GET REWARDED”
Reviews.Author: alexxsgrandma
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is great place to stay and play. The comps are generous. Tuesdays are fantastic. The buffet serves up good food at an excellent price.

Reviews.Title: “Very smokey”
Reviews.Author: KSandRB
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed here before and thought I would try it based on family recommendations. I understood it was off the strip and that really wasn't a problem since we drove from CA. The room was fine, the staff friendly and we enjoyed the pool. However the stench of the cigarette smoke was almost unbearable. I understand this is Las Vegas and people smoke, but this was way beyond anything I have experienced at any hotel before. Just going from our room to the parking lot left me with red, itchy eyes, a runny nose and a cough. This went on for the length of our stay which was three days. We certainly would have switched hotels the first day but we were trying to save money. Most people probably aren't as sensitive to smoke as I am and for those people this is a decent place to stay. But if you are like me, you will be miserable if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay but not on the "strip"”
Reviews.Author: BigBlue01
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is a very large complex containing a bowling alley, arena, liquor store, 18 movie theaters, convention center, Poker room (35 tables), and of course a very large Casino. It is located on its own and about a 15 minute shuttle ride to "Bills Gambling Hall" which is across from the Bellagio and next to Ballys on the "strip". The rates are very reasonable. While there participants in a very large nation wide beauty contest, a hockey tournament, a bowling tournament and martial arts training were encountered. It is a very family oriented place. Our stay of 16 days was great. Overall their staff were well informed and friendly. The buffet was excellent and very reasonably priced but did not open until 8 am and then a normal 20 minute wait in line to eat. There are also many other eateries and bars including Subway, TG Fridays, and an Oyster bar. It is located in a pleasant business area with Wallgreens, Dennys, Bank of America, and other convenience stores within a short walking distance (not sure about after dark). The hotel is clean but does need some restorations, carpets in our room on the 17th floor, the hallways and especially the Poker room were badly stained. The room was very quiet. The pool (really needed as the temperature varied between 105 and 110f) was very clean, not at all crowded and there was always an adequate supply of lounges and towels. The only drawback is that it is located between two 20 story buildings (at this time of year?) and the first ray of sun anywhere appeared at 9:30 am and it took until 10:30 for roughly 1/3 of the area to be in the sun. For those interested, the Poker room, while a little crowded, is very well run and holds both live and tournament games daily. The staff (especially Joe, really do run their butts off making sure tables are opened, players moved, etc., which is something we rarely see in Ontario. Use of the internet at their Business Center is expensive at $20 per hour plus you have to use very small lap top pc which was very hard to type on. Each room has an internet cable (if you bring yours) at a slightly reduced price. I believe Wi Fi was available at their coffee house. My only bad experience was waking up with a very large bite / lump on the inside of my leg. My buddy suggested it might be from a bed bug? After a quick internet search confirming the bite looked quite similar to one I approached the front desk for advice. Security was notified, my report filed, staff tore my bed apart and checked every inch for indication but did not find any evidence of infestation. We were offered an immediate room change but decided that it was not worth the effort (as nothing was found) unless another bite occurred. Later in the day I was called to talk to the front desk Manager who also confirmed that nothing had been found and offered compensation for my inconvenience. No further bites occurred and my conclusion was that it had happened while on the shuttle or in a movie theater the night before. Overall the hotel handled the matter very thoroughly and efficiently. I will return to the Orleans the next time I go to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel and casino”
Reviews.Author: tfuder
Reviews.Content: Liked: The selection of restaurants available on the property; There is a clear demarkation between the hotel and casino; The casino is large, but not bloated; The room prices were excellent when we stayed (late June 2011); The valet service was awesome! Disliked: Walking through the casino to get to the hotel; The 200 yard hike from the only bank of elevators on the 18th floor to our room (no joke); A tiny non-smoking area in the casino; Learning where to park for the hotel vs the casino; The $6 per night "fee" added to our bill for standard amenities, which didn't even include internet access from our room. Overall, it was a pleasurable stay. The room cleaning was very good, and we had an excellent room, high up with a great view of the Strip. Our safe was broken when we arrived, and it took 1.5 days to get it fixed (well, they replaced it), but the hotel service was excellent, beyond that. I liked that the property was just off-Strip, which made getting in and out that much easier, and the valets were fast and efficient, as was the front desk staff. The decor of the hotel is good, and not too loud, but it is still kind of smoky in there, even at the "non smoking" section. We never got to see the pool or pool area, but we heard it was pretty nice, as well.

Reviews.Title: “The best in 46 years!”
Reviews.Author: bhuff2
Reviews.Content: We thought The Orleans was our best experience! 46 yrs ago, we were in Vegas for our honeymoon and have stayed at many different casinos since. This time we liked the comfort, cleanliness, great service and all the great places to eat. The casino host was exceptional along with all the rest of the employees. It seems to be a place where you feel wanted, cared about and almost made to feel part of a family. As far as slots, many different machines to choose from making it fun to play. The table games are plentiful and we did not find one dealer we did not like. We hope to go back soon, we really loved the steak house and we are already planning what we will eat the next time. Plz do not hesitate to book here, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rcr001
Reviews.Content: If you're going to Las Vegas, there is no other place like the Orleans.This is the only place my wife and I stay at. Check in is no hassel. In and out in minutes. The workers are very polite will help in any way. The rooms are clean and very comfortable. The orleans offer a free shuttle to and from the strip.The dining is always excellent. At the Prime Rib loft, the best prime rib in Vegas, at great prices. The only place to stay in Vegas.The Orleans is Always player friendly like no other casino.They have the best restaurants, food court anywhere.You will never have to go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good value without the glitz”
Reviews.Author: StevoRC
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay here, but drove from another hotel just to check out the casino and amenities. The table gaming area is decent with many "lower than the strip" minimums as expected. Overall, the casino was large and roomy unlike the downtown casinos. If our luck at the tables were down, we would have gone to the theatres or bowling. We had dinner at the French Market Buffet and was pleased with the variety of selections at a great price. I would consider staying here on our next visit despite some of the negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: “We had the best time cant wait till next july”
Reviews.Author: vikkianastasio
Reviews.Content: My husband bowls in your tournament there,and my daughter and grandkids came along .had a very good time with the theater there went to movies then when we wanted gambling time ,theres a day care ,so put kids in for a couple hours went and gambled and we won some money.with the pools you have the kids had fun swimming and theres an outdoor bar so while kids are swimming theres refreshments .along with the variety of restaurants ,you can have your taste of many foods just cant wait till july comes around again because the orleans were headed for and everybody is so nice

Reviews.Title: “Love the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: reduic
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. Check-in was so quick we couldn't believe it. Arrived before noon and was in the room by 12:30. Checked in for the slot tournament and we were ready to go. The buffet was excellent but the highlight was having dinner in the Prime Rib Loft. The food was fantastic and the service superb. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Afforable clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: merappa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice and was pleased both times. You can get really inexpensive rates here compared to the strip. They have a shuttle bus that takes you back and forth to the strip in case you don't have a rental car. Large casino with lots of slot machine options that pay pretty decent. The pool is adequate to cool off during the day. My family especially likes the Mexican restaurant inside the hotel. Rooms are large and clean with comfortable beds. I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another good stay but some issues that need to be resolved”
Reviews.Author: CarribeanStudWinner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Orleans from July 13th to the 16th. We had stayed at Rio for our first three nights in Vegas, and around 11am I called The Orleans to see if I could check in early. To my delight they said yes, and just come on over. What a nice room I got when I got there! We had a top floor room with a huge flat screen TV, pillowtop mattress bed and beautiful view of the strip. The service was excellent, the food at the buffet and at Big Al's restaurant was good and the slots were pretty reasonable. Now for the issues that need to be resolved. It seems like The Orleans, one of the most family friendly properties in Vegas, has become a stomping ground for prostitutes. I know that they are prevelant in every place in Las Vegas, but I never had a problem in my previous visits to the Orleans until this one. I got stopped three seperate times by girls wanting to provide me with a "date". I was polite and said no, and left and there were no problems. But why in the world would working girls come to a family friendly resort instead of the strip? Also another issue to be resolved is the kids here have gotten a lot more prevelent in the casino areas. I have seen security stop parents having their kids over with them at a slot/video slot machine while they were playing. I know that the casinos are more flexible with kids being in public areas, but maybe this policy needs to be revisited before one of these casinos loses their gaming license over it. All in all, it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, off the strip, more laid back”
Reviews.Author: Travel4Fun31
Reviews.Content: Over all it was a good hotel. Nothing to rave about, but no major complaints. Checking in, even in high traffic times seemed to move quickly. elevators are split to accommodate floors 1-9 and 18-22, makes higher floors more appealing. Gift shop and wine shop have fair prices, ok selection. Pool is open until 9 pm, clean, kind of small. Rooms are ok, I was in an older model room, newer updated rooms have less New Orleans feel to them. Noisy in the rooms at night, you hear all the sounds in the hallway. Lots to do besides gambling bowling center, movie theater, spa, comedy club all on location, free internet in the coffee shop in the casino. Definitely draws an older, middle class crowd. Free shuttle to the strip by Bill's Gambling Hall is very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Another Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: DaveT555
Reviews.Content: This was or second stay at the Orleans and again we were very satisfied! Not much luck at the tables but the machines were looser than any other place we visited.We had many nice hits! We did visit the Orleans sister property,the Suncoast and it is a very nice property with a great breakfast buffet.Worth a visit! We will be staying at The Orleans again,and maybe the Suncoast. The valet is speedy but theirs always parking out front fairly close.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price, but not the Bellagio!”
Reviews.Author: Cadmapper
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights as a quick getaway. We thought we'd try something off the strip this time. The Orleans may seem a bit dated, and is certainly not as chic as some of the newer hotels, but you will find that your dollar goes pretty far. The staff was friendly and helpful, check-in was smooth, and our room was clean and spacious. The Orleans does offer a shuttle to the strip, but we chose to drive to the other hotels and casinos. Traffic and distance were not big issues. As part of our room package we were given one dinner buffet (very good) and one breakfast buffet (average). There are several restaurants on site, but we did not eat at any of them. The pool area was nice and well-kept. Since the clientele seemed to be mostly older couples and families with children, the pool area is not given over to the party scene that you might find at the Hard Rock, et al. This is a comfortable hotel that provides good value. It will never be mistaken for any of the newer and fancier (and way more expensive) hotels that you'd find on the strip. We were satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “"We loved it and we'll be back"”
Reviews.Author: ERJZLUV
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Orleans! Neat, clean, & staff very courteous. Convenient with shuttle service to & from the strip!

Reviews.Title: “orleans friendly”
Reviews.Author: mardon25
Reviews.Content: does anyone have a review of the pool area, cleanliness, sunny? shady ? i am going in sptt and want to know if the deck area is open and full of sunshine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: wen_c82
Reviews.Content: We go to Las Vegas a few times a year and Orleans is our choice. Grant you, it is not a 'fancy' hotel but a hotel that's clean and well managed with a good value for your money. Check in was fast and efficiency. We asked for extra pillow and it was delivered within 5 minutes. Staff are friendly. I love the fact the there is a small window in the bathroom to change air. The individual air conditioner could be loud sometimes. If it's too loud you may want to ask for another room. I have found the room was always clean and well maintained. There is free WIFI at the Java coffee shop (anywhere near there) and hotel lobby. If you need to print something you can go to their business office to use the computer. There is also a Shuttle bus that takes you to near the strip but as we drive to Las Vegas, have never used it. The buffet was ok, again, not super fancy, but have enough varieties to keep everyone happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to explore Vegas”
Reviews.Author: AlunSDavies
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Orleans 4 times over the last few years, and have always come away from there wanting to return. The free shuttle takes you to the heart of Las Vegas and operates from 9:00 till midnight and is only a few minutes away. Once again thank you Orleans can't wait to cross the pond to spend some more time in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “We continue to return every year”
Reviews.Author: Ruth0845
Reviews.Content: It's off the strip but the free shuttle runs on schedule every day. The hotel has a lot of on site extra's- theatre, bowling, spa & salon and a great variety of restaurants. There are shows and conventions for people of every age (Alice Cooper, Steven Wrigth, Grandma Lee) The staff always want to help and we have never had a problem there. It is good value.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel for a family trip”
Reviews.Author: rhonda2698
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to the Orleans and it lived up to our memories, even though it was more crowded than we've ever seen it on this trip. (Apparently there was a bowling tournament as well as softball or volleyball tournaments in the area and the place was completely booked). Besides the crowds that we hadn't ever run into before, everything was great. Check-in was smooth and quick. Our room (2 double beds) was clean and comfortable. The rooms are quiet and stocked with toiletries, coffeemaker, and coffee. The pool is very pretty and the hot tub is nice. Lots of lounge chairs (we were even able to get 4 of them together with the hotel this packed!) Poolside food delivery is fun and reasonably priced. The bowling alley wasn't available for open bowl this time because of the tournament but our teens still had a great time going to the movie theater (about $8 per ticket). The buffet is delicious and the service there is just okay, but you get a discount with a Rewards card and the buffet ends up only being like $7 or $8 for most meals. The other restaurants in the food court (Subway, Sbarros Pizza, Baskin Robbins...) are also reasonably priced. We got a giant delicious pizza from Sbarros for about $25. The little gift shop near the hotel area has lots of trinkets and necessities at a decent price, and you get a small discount with a Rewards card. There is free Internet available at the little coffee cafe in the lobby area, and we used it several times. The only non-family-friendly part of the Orleans is the outfits of the servers on the casino floor - pretty low cut in front and almost a thong in the back (most of them wear black tights which helps a little but it is still uncomfortable when you have to walk your teens through there to get to the movie, bowling alley, and arcade). The location is fine - about 10 minutes from the Strip which is just the way we like it - we've not ever enjoyed staying on the Strip. All in all, we've stayed at 4 hotels in Vegas (Golden Nugget, Paris, Bally's, and Orleans) and this is the place we call home. There is something for everyone to do and it is all very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “A Remarkable place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: JadesJewels
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by our stay at The Orleans Hotel and Casino. We will be returning with family and friends. The relaxed atmosphere of the property was much appreciated especially after returning from the hectic Strip. The service we received across the board was top notch! What a great staff! Our room was spacious and plush with a king-sized bed (super comfortable with classic linens), a nice seating area, desk area, large flat screen Tv and respectful amount of storage. We had a nice view of the Strip and a good, quiet air conditioner. It was very clean and had all of the extra amenities of a fine hotel waiting for us in our room. The bathroom was a generous size with high quality shower faucet that worked well. Yes, ladies - you will be able to get all of your haircare products out of your hair with ease. The food was very good at every restuarant we ate at on the property (which was all but two). For a smaller hotel, they offer a wide range of restuarants to please your tastes from fast food to fine dining. The themed bars' offerings were agreeable, suited our moods and diverse likings. I am not buffet person but even I had to admit that the breakfast buffet was excellent and reasonable priced! The pastries were divine and would outclass any French bakery. They offer their guests a free, air conditioned shuttle between their properties and the Strip about every half hour from 9:30 am to midnight. This is the best value in Las Vegas! The only negative thing I could possibly say is that there is smoking on the casino floor and at times the smell of smoke was strong.

Reviews.Title: “If your looking for "local" and "depressing" this is the place for you”
Reviews.Author: glavanich
Reviews.Content: Sub sub par pool, scantilly clad waitresses who i felt sorry for, bad location .. A lot of older people on budgets and or locals, far from the strip but there was a free shuttle to the strip. I would rather stay at Harrahs or Imperial than here and day of the week. People were also loud and easily heard throug the walls. Bathroom had NO fan, plus the clothing rack wad in there and not separated so if you wanted to hang your clothes they would get steamed everytime you took a shower. One more thing about the bathroom, there was no curtain and it was directly across the view from other rooms... Basically people could watch you shower depending on where their room was and how hard they looked. Food at this hotel was 3.5-4/10 max.

Reviews.Title: “"The place to stay"”
Reviews.Author: hotnmoval
Reviews.Content: I love the Orleans. When visiting Las Vegas, our family stays at the Orleans. We utilize the valet and bell services. They are great. Always greet you with a smile. As my father is on a walker, we sometimes rent a scooter. The Orleans has everything in its casino. The choice of restaurants is great. I have nieces who are not of legal age and the Orleans has food and entertainment for them also. There are so many choices in slots, nice keno area, and lots of table games. The rooms are very nice and clean. The personnel is nice and courteous. The Orleans also provides shuttle service to and from the strip every half hour. Very convenient. Once you stay at the Orleans, you will most definitely make plans to keep staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: alohagirl808
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans for 5 nights at the end of June/beginning of July. It was my Mom, my husband, myself, and my 6 year old son. We absolutely loved it here. I was nervous about staying here after reading some of the reviews but our stay was great. We had a rentacar so getting from the hotel to the other casinos and shopping was not a problem. The valet was close to the hotel tower and it was never a long wait to get your car. Room: We were in room 1856. It had a tv, 2 beds, a desk, a couch, a chair, and a small coffee-maker. The room must have been renovated recently because the furnishings looked new and so did the bathroom. There was plenty of room for all 4 of us. We loved that there was a thermostat in the room so that we could control our own temperature. Amenities: We loved that there was so many places to eat. We recommend you try the burgers at Fuddruckers. The dinner buffet was great too...it had many stations like Mexican, Italian, Seafood, Mongolian Wok, etc. and they also Gelato. My son would go to the Kids Tyme Kids club every night and he loved that place. Totally recommend it. Don't forget to bring the shot records or you won't be able to use it. My husband and son also used the arcade and movie theater and both were good. We didn't get a chance to use it but they do have a bowling alley too. Gaming: The casino area is huge. I didn't get to play any table games this time so I can't comment on that but I did play a lot of slots. I got some good playing time for my money. I even got a little lucky and my husband was really lucky. Most of the slots are the new video penny machines so if you like to play the old-style reel machines, you may have a hard time finding them. We loved the Orleans and would definitely stay here again especially when we have our son.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: pumpkin6987
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about The Orleans and their staff! We went to Vegas to get married and The Orleans just made our special trip so much better. They are friendly, you never have to leave the hotel for anything. You have everything you need right there! Best prices ever!

Reviews.Title: “Decent room for the price”
Reviews.Author: smalltimetraveler08
Reviews.Content: I booked this room based off of the price we received online and the rating it got on tripadvisor. It was an okay room, the price was good, we got a great deal and for as long as we were here it was perfect. We were traveling from Oregon to Louisiana and this was our first stop. The room needs a few updates, it was okay, the carpet was a little dirty and there were some miscellaneous stains on the bedding around the bottom. The lobby of the hotel was dirty and also needs some updating. The lady that checked us in was very rude, she had no personality what so ever and wanted nothing to do with idle chit chat, she seemed to be the only one that was that way, the other ladies chatted with the other guests and the lady that checked us out was very friendly. The swimming pool was nice but over crowded. I didn't like the fact that you had to pay for internet access and it was not cheap $12.99 for 24 hours is incredibly ridiculous! I do have to say that the casino was very clean, one of the cleanest and nicest I have ever seen, we unfortunately didn't have the opportunity to enjoy it as we were with our children and on a tight budget/time schedule. We ate at TGIF and the food was alright, we had to sit next to the kitchen which was not all that great and it was very overpriced for what we got. I think with some updating to the hotel and some weeding out of staff this could be a very nice place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Will be back again.”
Reviews.Author: helendc65
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, it was off the strip, which people had said was a pain, but there was a free bus every half an hour outside of the hotel. The room was lovely and big, the beds were comfortable and clean, pool area was great and a pool for everyone. We will definately be back. We had the buffet breakfast everyday in the French buffet restaurant and there was always lots to choose from both the hot and cold area's.

Reviews.Title: “Off the strip and it shows.”
Reviews.Author: Jweimer1
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean, the beds are hard and the casino is so-so. They do have a bowling alley which is a nice twist.

Reviews.Title: “Long distance call RIP OFF!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NoMoreOrleans
Reviews.Content: Whatever you do, DO NOT use the room phone to call long distance. $8.50 per 2-3 minutes call. They charge $7 connection fee plus AT&T rate each time when you make long distance call. A TOTAL RIP OFF!!! We'll definitely not going back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Eagledogmah
Reviews.Content: Excelent Casino, they trit you like VIP and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Our Vegas home away from home”
Reviews.Author: tamster34
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Orleans several times & our never disappointed. We had room 2098 which had a view of the Palms & Rio. It was at end of the hall so less neighbor noise. The only real noise complaint was the doors that slam. But I always bring earplugs on vacation & it wasn't an issue. Fine room, comfortable bed. Maid service was always prompt. I'm not a fan of the sliding bathroom door. It never seems very secure & even after 26 years of marriage, I like my bathroom privacy! We ate at the Courtyard Cafe (good breakfast & the quickest service we've ever hard there) & Coasta Cantina (yummy dinner). I discovered Yahtzee slots my 1st night & it was pretty good me. I kept going back to it but the magic never returned. I played quite a bit of video poker & hit 4 aces 1 time for a $200 boost. Also played lots of blackjack & Ultimate Texas Hold Em, mostly with winning sessions. Never had any trouble getting on a game until the day a bowling convention/league/tournament? came in & then it was pretty crazy. Cocktail service was very prompt on the table games, hardly every had to wait. I'm sure we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: vegasduoNorthants
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 nights last week .We thought the place felt so comfortable and friendly Very clean rooms .Yes its not as glitzy as the top strip hotels but as we have been to them .we wanted to give this place a try Will definately be back buffet and food court all good slots quite loose .They will never get any looser now .Only met one lady who checked us in who must have been having a bad day but overall everybody else was lovely.Cocktail waitresses came around quite a lot so that was good. lovely little older lady at players club booth explained all the promotions that was on to us .She was a credit to the hotel .shuttle to strip good .they did get busier later on at night though . Hope to be back very soon .

Reviews.Title: “Loved being off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Tarantula_boy
Reviews.Content: I had to write and echo all the positive reviews. We stayed here last September to be in the hotel where the Olyimpia was being held as this was our primary reason for going to Vegas. The hotel itself turned out to be a wonderful surprise. I had contacted the hotel ahead of time requesting a higher floor room with a strip view and a mini fridge. Both requests were granted and they even comped us the fridge. We ended up returning the fridge because we heard there was a waiting list for them and we didn't want one of the competitors to be without one so we could keep our beer and water cold :) We took the free shuttle to the strip for half a day and couldn't wait to get back to the Orleans. We were constantly accosted by people trying to sell us stuff like time shares; even in the lobby of several hotels. The pool was great, the fitness centre more than adequate, the staff was very accomodating, the choice of restaurants was fantastic and even though we lost several hundred dollars, I wouldn't say the games were tight. Everything you need on a vaction is here. It even has it's own liquor store, bowling alley and movie theatre. We are going back to the Orleans to watch the Olympia in September and will be staying here again. We'll spend 3 nights on Fremont Street first before moving to the Orleans and hope we enjoy the other Boyd property as well as we enjoyed this one.

Reviews.Title: “Good Accomodations & Service”
Reviews.Author: BatonRougeSMS
Reviews.Content: My Second visit to Vegas, and was very pleased with this hotel. The rooms are good sized, was on the 19th floor overlooking the mountains. Room service was very prompt and friendly. Many places to eat within the hotel, and the buffet was very good. Lovely pool area with plenty of recliners. Casino machines a bit tight, but par for the course. Only real complaint was with slow service from bar maids, and the wait time to get a drink. There was a problem with the elevators not working properly the day of checkout, a little inconvenient, but these things do happen. Overall, a great place to stay, friendly staff, good food and service, and economically feasible for those on a tight budget. Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jmtransport
Reviews.Content: From the time that you arrive you are greeted by friendly Valet people. The Bellhops are also very friendly. The staff is always quick and friendly at check in and does their best to accommodate our room needs, such as having rooms close to the elevators and also assist with room upgrades at check in. The amenities at the hotel are great. With the Theater, the Bowling Center, the wide variety and selection of restaurants you feel that you do not have to leave the hotel since they have everything there for comfort, food, and entertainment. We have stayed at The Orleans many times and have never had a negative experience with any of the hotel's staff members; they take care of their customers and hotel guests. The rooms are always clean and ready upon check in to the hotel you never have to wait for your room to be available. There is a wide variety of gaming options from slots to tables and many options on how much money you want to bet from penny slots to hundred dollar tables. We plan to stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “We always stay at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: LuckyOne18
Reviews.Content: We always stay at The Orleans because we feel so very comfortable there and always have so much fun in the Casino. We have found the hotel staff to be friendly and courteous. When we call for extra towels and pillows they are brought in a timely manner. We like staying off the Strip at The Orleans away from the hustle and bustle. There are so many slot machines to choose from on the Casino floor and the food is outstanding. The Buffet is always great and we particularly like Big Al's Oyster Bar. We always eat there no matter what. The "Pan Roast with Shrimp" is to die for! We also like the extra security at the elevators. It's nice to know a human being is there checking everyone's room key before they make their way upstairs to the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Finally flat screen tv's, now HD. Come on . . . its 1/2 way through 2011”
Reviews.Author: johnnyvegas12
Reviews.Content: Got a room on the top, 21st floor. View was of the West side of the strip. 50" Plasma tv with standard definition tv so the image was poor. The carpet, bedding and couch were new and upgraded from the regular rooms. The 20th and 21st floor are suites mainly, but they have some regular upgraded rooms as well. I was here on a weekend comp and they treated us with the upgrade. The only odd part was the ceilings. They are 12 or more feet high, so it's kind of a bowling alley feeling. Anyway, good cheap stay. This place is not for first timers to Vegas, or those who only come up once or twice a year. It's for veterans only. It's off strip, slow, but well appointed. it's not off strip luxurious like Red Rock or Green Valley Ranch but the casino is good sized, the people are friendly and everything is really cheap compared to the strip. Great for a quick getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay”
Reviews.Author: shiptrip
Reviews.Content: I go to Vegas about once a year and stay for 3-6 days. This time for 5 nights and 6 long days. We split our stay into three nights on strip and 2 off strip at the Orleans. I have seen everything on the strip but like visiting but if I really want to play slots and actually have a chance of winning, I go off strip. While I wasn't a big winner, I did see others raking it in. This hotel is a large inclusive hotel with several restaurants including a Japanese restaurant, a coffee shop, TGI Friday's Fuddruckers, Sbarro, Subway, Baskin Robbins, the French Market Buffet and probably one or two more. They have a large showroom and get some big names. Most recently Lily Tomlin was there last week. We went to theirsmaller comedy club and saw Grandma Lee from America's got talent. It was a fairly good show of about 75 minutes. "Grandma' has quite a potty mouth on her for a 77 year old! There was a very good band playing 70's and 80's rock hits called JukeBox Heroes from about 10-2:30 each night in their large bar with a dance floor. They even have a Cinemark and Bowling Alley on site so we did go the movie one afternoon. They have a kid's place and arcade so mom and dad can drop off the tikes and they can then gamble away the kids' college funds. Seriously, I would never bring kids to Vegas but apparently a million people seem to do it all the time so there are entertainment venues for them too. Our room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The room is a bit larger than some standard strip rooms and the bathroom is oddly shaped with a small counter, but I am used to large bathrooms so I am sure it probably adequate for most. They have an in-room safe and a standard box TV of about 25 or 27 inches. Air conditioning was plentiful for the 109 degree days we had and noise was not a problem like it can be for some strip hotels with all the sirens all night long. Prices for the rooms are reasonable. I was comped but could have gotten the room for about 25 a night for additional week nights and about 40 on weekends if booked well enough in advance. If you aren't too married to the strip, this hotel is a great option. Or split a longer stay and give this hotel a try. It's not the Bellagio or Wynn, and draws a pretty regular crowd and conventioneers but we enjoyed it and have stayed about 4 times here. At check in, I had about a two minute wait-very fast. The strip hotels had very long lines every time I went by a lobby on strip. Some probably had 30 minutes to an hour or more at lots of the big strip properties. I am not patient for standing in long lines if I have other options, so I tend to find places that won't have that problem. They now charge a 6.00 daily resort fee, up a dollar from last year. For this you get in room coffee, 10 minutes internet in the business center, free strip shuttle, free calls (like who needs this nowadays?) and maybe one or two other items of little consequence. Overall, I give it a Two Thumbs Up. If you have never been to Vegas, you can still stay here for much less and visit the strip. We rent a car and drive everywhere anyway. In the contemporary French Cajun style, laissez les bon temps rouler at The Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be happier...more than pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: conciergeonthego
Reviews.Content: First, let me say - The Orleans was not even on our list of "choice hotels" to stay in Vegas. After checking Trip Advisor - which I do religiously before traveling - I was shocked to see The Orleans rated WAY, WAY higher than the other "strip" hotels we were considering. How could this be? We don't know but IT WAS - EVERYTHING and MORE. Now, the rooms were spacious and super clean. The bathrooms - beautiful, clean and large. The fitness club wasn't huge but fully equipped, clean and inviting as was the pool area. The staff was - OUTSTANDING and the slots- somewhat loose. I was shocked that we saved a bundle staying here and the hotel did not disappoint. If you don't mind staying off the strip and you’re not looking to “see and be seen”- check this place out. Lots of locals go here - I have family that live in Vegas and they frequent this hotel. The buffet for breakfast was a steal at $7.95. There are several restaurants as well as a small 24hr food court - which was nice to have. For dinner - I prefer other hotels on the strip...but that's just me and that's the beauty of Vegas. Everything and anything is pretty much at your finger tips. If you want a great comfortable stay and feel like a local....this is your place. You won't be disappointed. BRAVO to the Orleans and their outstanding hospitality. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Us”
Reviews.Author: MnMsMemo
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in a room w/ two queen beds. We had a three year old who loved the pool and had a great time. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We parked our car and never had to use it during our stay. We used the shuttle to get to the strip... it seemed like it was a little faster than once every thirty minutes, but maybe our using it on a Wednesday and Thursday contributed to it being quicker. My biggest disappointment was having to have to pay 12.00 for 24 hours of internet use (per laptop). We would stay here again because the value was incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable accommodations off the strip”
Reviews.Author: dunsterrita
Reviews.Content: Great stay in Vegas - wanted to be off the strip but still close. Hotel/casino was busy but not overloaded with people. Rooms were clean, beds were very comfortable. Rooms come with a nice sitting area. A/C worked very well. Pool area is nice with plenty of shade seats. Many places to dine, would have stayed in and taken advantage of our hotel's amenities more if it wasn't for the fact that our friends were staying at Excalibur. Definitely a great option!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel off the strip”
Reviews.Author: LoveMauitoomuch
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel and casino. We stayed 3 nights in a non-smoking room. Big room with 2 queen beds but only 2 flat pillows on each bed. Great bathroom with window in shower, a nice touch. Air conditioner worked great in room. The safe in the room was easy to use. The parking was a hike to the rooms. They seem to make parking easy if you just want to go in the casino but a walk if you have a room there. Casino was nice. Had everything you need. A lot of places to eat. All different types of food. Movies theaters, bowling allies and even a place that will watch your kids for a couple of hours. If you don't care about being on the strip you really wouldn't even need to leave this place. Great swimming pool too.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it, and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: bulldog93
Reviews.Content: We are certainly not whales, just senior citizens who enjoy the more relaxed atmosphere of the Orleans Hotel and Casino. When we have been to the casinos on the strip, besides battling the traffic, we have always felt like the strip casinos are over our head. The Orleans is more down home, and besides, whether you win or lose, the money is the same color as it is on the strip. As far as the food is concerned, you have your choice of nice restaurants or fast food, neither of which cost an arm or a leg, and no matter who you are dealing with,housekeeping,dealers, parking valets, drink waitresses,or check-in clerks, they are always friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans - Best Deal and Atmosphere in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: dkenn22
Reviews.Content: Being from southern California and enjoying Las Vegas like I do, I have visited dozens and dozens of times over the past 10 years. I have stayed at probably 15-or-so casino/resorts. With this many trips, costs do add up so I am always looking for good value. A few years ago, I decided to try The Orleans and had such a great overall experience that it is about the only place I stay now. While I look for value, I want a clean room. Our room was impeccable, as was everywhere else in the hotel. My wife accompanies me on each trip. I'm the small-time gambler and she goes for the sun. The Orleans has everything you could want. My wife raves about how nice the pool area is and enjoys the gym and spa. I am a slots player and I think The Orleans has more slots than any casino in Vegas.... over 3000. I stayed there a couple of weeks ago for 4 days and I still don't think I saw a lot of the slots they have. Most all of the machines I played seemed to have very reasonable paybacks, meaning my gambling dollars stretched nicely. Beyond that, every staff member I spoke to was not only courteous, but seemed to go out of their way to make my stay really enjoyable. I was able to check in early and check out a little late. (I know this would vary, depending on how busy the hotel is). For example, when my wife and I first got to our room, there weren't enough hangers for the amount of clothes we brought. I walked down the hall and found a maid and asked her for a few extra hangers. In less than 5 minutes, someone knocked on our door with 20 extra hangers.... asking if there was anything else we needed. I know this is a "tiny" thing, but it is a perfect example of just how we were treated during our entire stay. The restaurants are excellent, the buffet was great, they even have a Fuddrucker's in their food court! I never do these posts and I know my review probably leaves as many questions as it provides answers. The bottom line is that if you have never stayed at The Orleans, do yourself a favor and book a stay there the next time you head to Vegas, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “fun time”
Reviews.Author: theusman
Reviews.Content: have fun and enjoy , food is good , differnt kinds .help is very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel just off the Strip - good for families”
Reviews.Author: KevandVal_1
Reviews.Content: I stay here every time with my kids. My Plus is that I absolutely LOVE their efficient Check-in and valet service. After 1 day - bell-hops I've seen before seem to remember my name! Kids love the Kids Tyme (sic) where they can play. My negatives are the small rooms - there is only a little coffee table - so no where to "sit around" as a family. There IS a DESK - which I love, as I bring my laptop. The food court choices are "ok", and we've eaten at the Japanese Restaurant (outstanding), the Coffee house (great), buffet - and TGI Fridays. We've never used the pool, but it seems a little small. The location of the hotel is GREAT - just off the strip. (we usually have relatives staying on the UGH! strip) - I love it because it avoids all the strip traffic. While it is a good hotel, I just can't rave about it because it all has seemed so "efficient" and not as "friendly" as some of the other properties (cept the valet service). Also - when there is an event in the arena - the Valet can fill up - so be prepared for a LENGTHLY wait if parking the car. There is one outstanding PLUS if you stay - I believe there is NO HOTEL AMMENITY FEE!

Reviews.Title: “A real bargain.”
Reviews.Author: overbid2002
Reviews.Content: We go to Las Vegas several times a year to see after some property. We watch the Orleans for internet ads to book our trips, so our stays are almost always less than $30 a night. The rooms are huge, quite comfortable, and the dining choices are good value. Convenient driving access and shuttle to the Strip. The Orleans Arena is attached to the hotel and has many events. Movie theaters, bowling alleys etc. are inside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Hotel, Great Casino, Great Bowling!!!”
Reviews.Author: MissK69
Reviews.Content: Wow, just wow! I work in the hotel industry and you can get a bed and a bath anywhere, come her for the GREAT SERVICE! The rooms are older but spacious and very clean! The Restaurants (Courtyard and Food Court Restaurants) were fantastic, the buffet was just ok. We came for a bowling tournament and the lanes are in great shape too. The bartender in the alley could use an attitude adjustment but the server was amazing! Thank you all and we will be back next year and every trip we plan to Las Vegas from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for a reason”
Reviews.Author: tk_az
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is a cheap stay and the whole place reflects it. Tiny rooms. Very outdated. Noisy. Rude dealers. Unwelcoming front desk. Tight slots. The highlight of my trip was the friendly servers. I'll likely stay again, but only because I lost so much that I'm sure to get offers for free nights. If you're looking to stay west of the strip for cheap, Rio's the better bet...

Reviews.Title: “OK and price friendly”
Reviews.Author: DAX66
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, it's not a place to write home about but is decent value for the rate paid. Quite dated and could do with some refurb but in general the rooms are good sized and the facilities are ok in relation to rates. For families with kids there is a large kids area within the hotel (at extra charge) which is very convenient and the kids loved it. In general the service was ok but quite impersonal which I have become accustomed to in Vegas due to the enormity of the hotels. I recall housekeeping was good and the room was well cleaned and tidied up. Can't say that I recommend it but also say that I can't say that I don't!

Reviews.Title: “great value for the meal”
Reviews.Author: 4kaykay
Reviews.Content: Ask the server for the daily specials. Great deal and the server we had was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service, and Great Employees”
Reviews.Author: barronrico
Reviews.Content: The Orleans staff was very helpful and accommadating. The friendly front desk and maintenance staff helped me program the TV so that I could use the inputs to hook up my playstation and DVD player. They also got me a new remote control for the TV when the old remote didn't work. The hotel has a great theater complex and bowling alley. The restaurants are great and you can get food 24hrs a day. I will definitely stay at the Orleans again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely LOVE this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie2626
Reviews.Content: The Orleans has it all! Easy to get to, plenty of parking, the rooms are spacious and clean, bowling & movie theaters, and most importantly, the service is incredible! They have many meal choices as well, both in restaurants and their Food Court. Large gaming area, and I never have trouble finding a spot to play. Will be back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Caddo72
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Las Vegas. Our hotel accommodations were part of a package that was put together for judges of the USA Barbeque Championship, so to save some cash, we took advantage of it. We could have not been more pleased with the hotel. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Our rooms were a quiet and comfortable haven from all the action around the hotel. I slept on one of the most comfortable beds of any hotel that I have visited and cleanliness was top notch! Free shuttles were provided to the strip, every thirty minutes (get in line early, especially on the late night return trips). In the three days we were there, we did not get to see all of what the hotel had to offer. Free wireless is available at the coffee shop, but not in the rooms. I believe internet was available for $13 a day in the room. The first night there we ate in the buffet were several ethnic food choices were available, including seafood. It was filling, but the taste was average every way except for the price ($$). I would recommend checking out the other restaurants in the hotel or even the fast food options that were available. I recommend a trip to Hash House a Go Go on the strip for a meal that will carry you through the day and finish the night at Pink's for a great hot dog! If we return to Vegas, The Orleans will be at the top of our list.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it - especially for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Loribelieves
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews, we thought "why not give it a try?" We have been to Las Vegas at least 10 times - each time a different hotel. This is the first time we tried off the strip. We arrived on a Tuesday @ 2:00 and our room was immediately available. The lobby was not smoky (a complaint from another reviewer) well maybe a tiny bit -- but it is a Las Vegas casino after all. Staff was friendly. Room looks exactly like the photos -- older style room but clean -- and smelled fine -- and I am a smell FREAK. We have moved more than once because of a smelly room. Bathroom was clean - tub was clean enough for a shower, but I wouldn't have taken a bath in the tub -- just cuz it looked old. Loved having a window that opened in the bathroom. The sheets on the bed were very thin (again, older -- but seemed clean). The pool is beautiful -- one of the reasons we wanted to stay there. LOTS of chairs even on busy days -- sun all day long -- although you could sit in the shade if you wanted. Cheap drinks ($4 for a whiskey/coke and $7 for a fancy punch type drink in a souvenier cup). They even had free water for people in a cooler type thing. You were able to bring in food/snacks to the pool without a hassle (untrue of many places we have stayed). Excellent food at the coffee shop. Not impressed with their buffet. Shuttle worked fine during the week, but weekends they need to enforce their system for hotel guests to get priority seating. The shuttle dropped you off right outside Bill's Gambling Hall - which is an easy access place. If you're a young person looking for the club life, this is definitely not your hotel, but if you're looking for a great value for the money, easy going hotel, this is a terrific place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: suz3227
Reviews.Content: Always enjoy our stay at "The Orleans". Everyone is friendly! Rewards are GREAT

Reviews.Title: “We Loved it and always go back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Annetteh75
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Orleans a couple times a year, It is a great time for friends and family. We do everything from bowling sweepstakes with our league to going with family and friends. Enjoy the theater, casino, restaraunts and pool. We have everything we need under 1 roof and the staff has always been friendly and accomodating. I recommend this Casino to All. Thank You Orleans, Annette Gironta

Reviews.Title: “WE loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: atlantic24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Orleans for a number of years and have always enjoyed our stay there. The staff is friendly and the variety of machines lets you play what you want. The food in the restaurants was always good and if you had any compaints the servers took care of any issues with a smile. I recommend you try staying here at least once and then you will come back, adeline winnipeg, mb.

Reviews.Title: “Great rates, clean rooms, good staff, great workout facility!”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaMarathongirl
Reviews.Content: Just got in and wanted to share for anyone questioning this place. The rate during the weekday is best around Vegas. Price does go up a lot on the weekend. This place is great if your looking to be off the strip but want the Vegas experience and or need a clean place to rest your head while you're passing through. The workout room is GREAT! best I've seen at a hotel. Comfy beds!! However, the in room air conditioner was a little loud so if you like extra quiet this is NOT the place. Heard other guests complain about the same problem but overall I think you'll be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great Rooms, TIGHT slots, Good food.”
Reviews.Author: idrawart
