Reviews.Content: I stayed in 2 rooms, got moved because some kiddies convention with teens arriving and shouting in halls at all hours kept waking me. That said I loved the stay. The room aside from the hall noise is quiet, no toilet flushing or headboard banging from other rooms. Big window for light and bathroom window that opens for fresh air. CLEAN, no bugs, no smears no stains that I saw. Big comfy bed with 3 pillows. NO GROSS bedspread!!! just a nice clean sheet and blanket. THANK YOU! Will deffinately stay here again. Free shuttle to the strip ever half hour, but we used our car. SLOTS are tighter then a knats butt on a lemon wedge, Did NOT like gaming there. They had some fun new slots that were looser, but I only saw one jackpot win in 3 days, vs. seeing 2 in Belagio and 4 in MGM when we were there for a few hours. Valet and front desk was pleasant. Food court and a few restaurants including TGIF. Crowd is nice, clean and pleasant unlike the crowd at Southpoint.

Reviews.Title: “Fun little City of its Own”
Reviews.Author: mommofive
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and everything we needed was right here in the "Orleans". MOvie theater, casino, food (lots of choices). Friendly staff, good security and the pool was big! Fun place!!! Even better was the room price and the strip was just a hop, skip and a jump away...

Reviews.Title: “There for IMX, loved the casion!”
Reviews.Author: LanderMagic
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the Orleans. The room was incredible! Must eat at the buffet when there, I can see why it gets such high ratings. Great food, lots of variety. We were there for the IMX magic convention. We were treated very well by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Go Back”
Reviews.Author: Phaidraigh
Reviews.Content: This place has all the amenities of a larger hotel on the strip. The last time we went to Las Vegas, we stayed at New York, New York (not a bad place). The room at The Orleans was larger with more amenities, and half the price. The shuttle to and from the center of the strip (and the sister hotel across the street from the Rio) is convenient, easy to use, and free. The casino was large and virtually every type of game you would want - I think, though I'm not much of a gambler. Restaurants were good, especially the breakfast. And, the staff was very helpful and friendly. My hat's off to the guy manning the guided tour booth. When I went to get a tour for 2 to the Grand Canyon, he steered me to the car rental agency, as opposed to the tour company, and saved me about $300.00. The only complaint was the room had a bit of a musty smell when we first checked in, but once the AC was on, it went away. We go to Las Vegas about once a year, and next time, it will be The Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, but the need to update some stuff”
Reviews.Author: lilreddakota
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed @ the Orleans just this past week. We had stayed here once before about seven to eight years ago. We choose this property do to reviews from others here on Trip Advisor, and what they had said about our other favorite Vegas property The Flamingo. We arrived on a Sunday, check in was a breeze and they had a King Bed room available for us. (we were told that all were booked for Sunday but we could change on Monday) Our room was nice, large by Vegas standards. We had a view of the Pool and their Arena area. TV set could be upgraded to a flat panel. I know this sounds trivial, who goes to Vegas to watch TV....I do. It was nice to have a coffee pot in the room, didn't have to get up and go purchase $5.00 coffee in the Casino. We did opt to rent a small refrigerator which we kept soda pop and water in, another nice plus. Restaurants, our first night we ate at their Chinese Restaurant which was nice, food was good. Most days we ate in the food court, Fuddruckers was good, just needs more space, their the busiest restaurant with the smallest area, Sabarro's was the least busy and they had twice the shop space that any other establishment. We also ate one night at TGIFridays which I can say for the price wasn't worth it and I can not suggest this establishment to any guest. Plus this takes up a majority of area of the Casino floor. Poor choice for the Orleans. We ate at the Buffet, which was at one time one of the best in Vegas, can't say that anymore. Food was over cooked and wait staff was terrible. We did go to the Java Cafe, purchased to Frappacino's which I was told by the Starbucks personal that they were Iced Mocha's. This is the only place in the Hotel that has free Wi/Fi. Lastly most properties have a new hidden fee, they're calling it a Resort Fee, bunch of crap. Half the stuff they charge for a normal person wouldn't need on vacation. At least the Orleans is only charging $6:00 a day were some a charging almost $20.00 a day. A nice little money maker for the hotels, Other than that I would return to The Orleans, and stay.

Reviews.Title: “Now, that's more like it”
Reviews.Author: luisistaz
Reviews.Content: Just got Back from my tripp to Vegas, I gave The Orleans one more chance, and boy did it pay off. The place is almost the same, some changes, for example instead of Seatles Best coffee, they have Starbucks, the food court is now complete. But the staff is much better, friendlier. I still found some of the staff from years ago, mostly the Best of the Best is still there. As an off strip place, they try to give you more for the buck, they make more of an effort. Overal, they have returned to what made them a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay off the strip with great rooms, wonderful staff and winning machines.”
Reviews.Author: Flutteringheart
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Orleans. The rooms are great with alot of space. They have movies, bowling, lots of restaurants and even a spa. I like The Orleans because of the location. It is away from from all the craziness of the strip. I will definitely be staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans has the ALL AROUND BEST atmosphere in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: LisaG39
Reviews.Content: I have not had one bad experience at the Orleans. Anyone who stays and plays at the Orleans will experience great fun, awesome staff, and feel very secure at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is the Motel 6 of Casino Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Denverbri69
Reviews.Content: If you find the accomodations of a Motel 6 fitting your travel style, then the Orleans is your kind of place. I felt that the rate of $75/night plus the resort fee, internet fee and all of the hotel taxes to be very pricy for this type of property. For the most part the stafff is very willing to help. More linens, no prob; toiletter backs up, no prob (happens all the time, I was told). Valet, bellmen and reception area folks all very accomodating. But the place is tired and shoddy. Sink the bathroom runs uncomfortably slow; like someone elses body parts are stuck in the drain and backing up in to the basin while brushing my teeth. The room service menu was large and very fairly priced and deliver quite quickly. the place does attract a very strange crowd. The food was mediocre in the oyster bar and very greasy and salty at the buffet. The dinner buffet for $14.95 is pricey for what you get. We had guests of the hotel coupons and we thought it was over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Want to stay where you are treated like a VIP by all the staff?”
Reviews.Author: BrinaChicago
Reviews.Content: My family and I stay at the Orleans twice a year and enjoy each and every visit. The rooms are great the casino has such a variety of restaurants, table and slot machines, but the best is the staff, each and everyone from the valet to the front desk, housekeeping down to the casino and all the staff there. They treat you like a special guest no matter who you are and bend over backwards to help.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel/casino with friendly staff, great location, and everything.”
Reviews.Author: johnanbern
Reviews.Content: This property is close to the Las Vegas strip. The swimming pool is quiet and areas for children to enjoy. A well stocked bar near the pool. The hotel rooms are all suites, very large, with smoking and non- smoking floors. Also, there is never noise that can be heard from the next room, hallway, or outside. Great security throughtout the property. The casino has a NEW ORLEANS look. High ceilings with all the non stop casino action you would expect. Most of the time a parking spot can be found in front of the casino without having to enter a remote parking garage. Also not far is a popular IN AN OUT BURGER restaurant popular in the west.

Reviews.Title: “We're "seasoned" Vegas travelers coming 2-3 times a year for the last decade.”
Reviews.Author: Vegastraveler91
Reviews.Content: Even though The Orleans is off the strip it is a fanstastic place to stay. We love the serivce we receive there, the rooms are top notch, and we find it very easy to navigate around the property. There is no shortage of places to eat that are reasonably priced. You don't have to pay $40 for fast food. The higher quality restaurants are great too having eaten at both the Canal Street and the The Prime Rib loft, both very good, but my personnal favorite is the Prime Rib Loft as the prime rib itself is some of the best I've ever had. The rooms we have had our ourstanding, we are always on the top floors and the views are great. I love the deep sunken tub and the updates that have been made on all the suites in the last few years (new tile, new beds, new furniture, flat screen TV's new carpet) Housekeeping is right on the ball for promptness and does so with a smile on their face and a friendly greeting towards guests. If you are a gambler there are many varieties and choices of video poker machines and table games. I'm not a slot player so am not up on those. Although the pool is not as glamorous as what you might find at a brand new strip hotel, it's relaxing, enjoyable and the cocktail service was perfect. I've used the excercise room and appreciated the machines available there also. For those that like to travel back and forth to the strip there is a shuttle that's available to The Orleans guests for no charge. I know the strip appeals to all, but if you are looking for a great stay without getting price gauged, check out The Orleans. We haven't been disappointed yet and I don't think you will :)

Reviews.Title: “Good space, good service and worth going off-strip for.”
Reviews.Author: pjpnightingale
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with the room, although the aircon was a bit noisy the facilities were good, the room was clean and the beds very comfortable. Staff were very helpful when I lost my camera, even looking back through the CCTV to find my cab company. Plenty of variety in food and drink to keep you going.

Reviews.Title: “I have to admit...I was Suprised...”
Reviews.Author: bluelava99
Reviews.Content: I was worried that this hotel may not have been the correct pick...but i got suprised....we arrived at the hotel (via rental car) you will want this if you stay here....check-in took all of 5 min....we were wisked up to our room on elevators with good speed where we awaited our fridge(be aware these are tiny fridges for $15/stay)...it arrived within 10 min....we requested two extra pillows...they arrived within 10 min....We had a king bed room on the ninth floor with a nice view if the strip,no smoky smell and all was clean (king bed, two side tables, coffee table, mini couch, sitting chair, six drawer dresser and work desk with chair)...roomy clean bath area with good H2O preassure, Good A/C that kept us cool at 65 degrees with no problem...The room was quite and we slept well...We did venture to some of the other floors and some did have an unpleasant odor...what it was...i dont know.....everyone was very nice and helpfull except for the girl at the bussiness center..she needs to be retraind in people skills...FYI: This hotel seems to cater more to the 35+ crowed...FYI2: If you have allergy to MSG I would use caution when eating the lunch or dinner buffet., if not then enjoy ..it looked great...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel/casino overall but..”
Reviews.Author: maryc82
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this off strip hotel. The rooms are clean and as mentioned before quite roomy and well maintained. The pool area is great, nice bar and large pool area with plenty of loungers in sun and shade areas. Now to the but..... The casino area has an overpowering smell of a far too strong air freshener, this was not as apparent on our last visit. The intensity of the aroma affected my sinuses so badly I was unable to go into the casino so had to eat and gamble elsewhere. Some casinos on the strip have also started to pump their properties with air freshener causing quite a problem to customers with sinus and allergy problems but I hope the Orleans resists from this fad in the future. The Stratosphere was the best casino for winning and did not cause uncontrollable sneezing! The Java coffee shop in the casino has free Internet.

Reviews.Title: “glorious gamblers getaway for a gift of a price”
Reviews.Author: londoner-in-exile
Reviews.Content: shuttle bus service is tiptop and very frequent. hotel facilities are great including food and drinks which are very cheap. best shows on strip-vinnie favorito-comedian at flamingo and Gladys knight at tropicana. The orleans has a beatles tribute band playing every thursday called the Fab,its a free show and they do a great long set-in brendans irish pub near the casino floor. Big Elvis is a free show at bills gambling hall on the strip, which is where the shuttle bus actually stops.

Reviews.Title: “Good bargain”
Reviews.Author: Aketaton76
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for the price I've paid (80 euros per night, double room). We were upgraded to a suite but needed two beds so stick with the standard room. Beds were good and queen size, Bathroom was a little bit old but clean,TV was old but I didn't even use it. The hotel structure looks old but gives you a taste of the Old Vegas maybe. The hotel is a little bit far from the Strip but there should be a shuttle to reach the Strip. The prices I've seen for restaurants inside the structure looked good but didn't try them. I was not charged for late check out :)

Reviews.Title: “Let the good times roll”
Reviews.Author: Lori12320
Reviews.Content: Each time I visit the Orleans Hotel and Casino I feel like a valued customer. The rooms, food and service are all excellent. It’s a great place to get away and relax or party hardy. Nowhere in Vegas will you find better value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Strip... but worth the time.”
Reviews.Author: MNCajun
Reviews.Content: Great value for the budget minded Vegas traveller. Comparatively speaking the rooms were more spacious than where we stayed on the Strip for half the price. Free shuttle to the Strip makes it all the more convenient to do the "tourist thing" but maintain your gaming budget. Many choices for dining, great themed atmosphere inside casino. Didn't have the feeling of being in another seen-one-seen-them-all casino.

Reviews.Title: “For the best in fun, food, and a great time stay at The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Kingrc
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Orleans was one of the best experience for my wife and me. The rooms are super, food is excellent and the best value in Vegas, (We have stayed at 4 others on the strip and close) We are looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Really?”
Reviews.Author: Rick J
Reviews.Content: whoever thinks highly of this hotel must have very low standards. I booked it for one night entrusting all the great reviews on tripadvisor and the star rating of this hotel. It did'nt take long for the dissappointment to set in. The location is off the strip, but in a shady part of town. I figured maybe it won't be so bad once I get inside....WRONG! Gloomy, smokey, claustrophobic and crowded casino. Check in was easy and quick, however the room looked like it was still stuck in the 70's. old tube tv, stained carpets and furniture, and the most uncomfortable bed I ever slept in. I'm so glad it was only for one night. Spend the extra $$ and stay somewhere decent. Even a motel 6 would have been better.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: coop61
Reviews.Content: The check in and out was fast, efficient and friendly. Rooms were nice and clean as always. Security is friendly and helpful. Playing environment is great very friendly, helpful and courteous. There are so many Food choices that there is no need to leave. You truly get more than your monies worth here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: monkey2009Cheshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after visiting the hotel the year before for viva las vegas, great location, great rooms, great brekfast value for money compared to the hotels on the strip. It also has a shuttle that takes you to the strip and coffee facilities in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable property”
Reviews.Author: hapts
Reviews.Content: Comfortable property with all the amenities you want and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Another fun time at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: lgenninger
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is a great Hotel/Casino. We prefer the Orleans when we want to enjoy the Vegas experience without the hustle and bustle of the strip. They have a great poker room for those of you who like to sit for a while, there are plenty of gaming tables with $5 minimums and of course a great selection of slot fun throughout the casino. If you bring the children, there is a great pool are, bowling and movie theaters playing the top billing movies. They offer shuttle service if you want to go the strip. Overall the Orleans is more than a Casino, it is a great way to spend your vacation or just to get away for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: tlbear2bb
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Orleans several times. Each time we have enjoyed our stay. The rooms are spacious. The casino has a variety of table games and video machines. Plenty of games, bowling and a movie theater for the younger kids. Various eateries for adults and kids to enjoy. We will continue to stay at The Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “My Vegas home”
Reviews.Author: jimfrommi
Reviews.Content: I enjoy everything about the Orleans. Check-in is a snap, room requests usually granted. Rooms are spacious and clean.The beds are more firm than I prefer, but that is the standard. Elevators are fast. The pool offers a variety of lounging areas. Dining options are many an varied. I prefer Video Poker and there is a wide variety. Table games can be a bit crowded, could have more $5 tables. Service in all areas is fast and pleasant. The shuttle service is very handy and prompt. The movie theatre and bowling alley are nice diversions. I can think of nothing that I consider a negative.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans Benefits”
Reviews.Author: JeffBransford
Reviews.Content: The Orleans was great! Very helpful staff; limo drivers, slot hosts, wait staff, all are great. The slot card program is excellent. Play and earn points, the more you play, the benefits really start to kick in-meals, rooms, spa, slot tournaments, shopping sprees. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Have fun at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: videopokerplayer
Reviews.Content: If anyone wants to have fun and love to play video poker, the Orleans casino is your place. The hotel has just about every versions of video poker to choose from and has every denomination from one penny to what ever you desire. The Orleans buffet was out of this world, don't have the time for sit in meal ? There are food courts for you from pizza to hamburger to sanwiches.... that fits your tastes. I highly recommand you all to try The Orleans Casino Hotel for your next vacation, I know it 's number one on my list.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans ROCKS!!!”
Reviews.Author: angelica70_2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed the weekend of the 15th of April 2011 and had the best time ever. The Orleans has the best promos than any other hotel. The hotel rooms are very spacious and clean. The bathroom has a window that actually opens to the outside so you get fresh outside air if you need it. The casino is awesome and has all of my favorite slots. And for those with young kids they have the best day care (Play Tyme) and very affordable. Not to mention the beautiful pool area. Over all The Orleans ROCKS!!! Angelica, San Diego, CA

Reviews.Title: “WISH I COULD HAVE STAYED LONGER!”
Reviews.Author: sonok
Reviews.Content: Except for the North wind that froze my buns and jewels during the Saturday golf tournament, you put on a first class gathering that I have not received from other casinos. Barney Kim is our local man that seems to have a great relationship with Orleans. Our Orleans host added the right touch. Look forward to the next gathering.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you love to reek of cigarettes!”
Reviews.Author: twilson140
Reviews.Content: Okay, so it's cheap and there's a shuttle to the strip - even though there's no shuttle to and from the airport. As soon as we walked in to check in - and finding the registration desk was a bit of a challenge - we were engulfed with the haze and stench of tobacco smoke. How pleasant! We were told we had been "upgraded" to a suite - which was quite spacious and if we had seen photos we would have thought it looked quite lovely - and I asked if it was a non-smoking room and was assured it was. My guess is the woman at the registration desk had no idea one way or the other. When we got to the room, the stench remained and we noted ashtrays (but they were clean as whistles!) with match books everywhere. Yes, it was no smoking as long as you didn't light up. This may be one of the worse places I've ever been to. I can't believe it ranks so highly on TripAdvisor - come on folks, you're undermining my trust of this site! If you're a smoker, I guess you'll love this place. If your a non-smoker - just walking in makes you a pack-a-day smoker! There ought to me cigarette health warnings on all the entrances to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great place”
Reviews.Author: panzer03
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not glamorous but provides a clean safe environment and great value. Room rates are low and restaurants very good and reasonable. You can park yourself and not bother with valets. The on site liquor store is priced as good as the local supermarkets. You can get any type of food in house. The breakfast at the courtyard are great.

Reviews.Title: “Great kidfriendly hotel off the strip”
Reviews.Author: ccm1319
Reviews.Content: My 10 year old son and myself stayed at The Orleans from Easter Sunday thru Friday @ 6 pm. Going to and from the strip was easy since they provide a free shuttle ranging from 30 to 60 mins intervals depending on time of day. We opted for 2 Queen beds which were truly comfortable. They have inhouse an 18 screen movie theater, 70 lane bowling alley and "Kids Tyme" (a service @ 6.50 - $7.50 per hr based on day of week). which has lots of fun things for kids up to age 12. My son enjoyed it and wanted to go there whenever he could! The room was always clean, amenities (coffee, shampoo, lotion etc) replenished daily. Food choices offer variety with reasonable prices. Java Vegas for breakfast or Fudruckers. 24 hours cafe has tasty food with ample portions. The coupons they give on check in offer discounts to onsite restaurants. Check in was pleasant. The only "downer" was a front desk personel (Melissa) who presented as "patronizing "when a request was made for an extended 1 hour (I had already paid for an extended 6 hours) past checkout time, since our flight did not leave until midnight. Even quoted me a rate of $125 for that night when the true rate was $75. Watch out for that! Following voicing concerns with supervisor; I was assured he would address it with the staff, payment was comped!. All in all I will stay again at The Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: Travlingal40
Reviews.Content: The pool-beautiful, and not crowded. The food-terrific. The amenities-Perfect for teenager traveling with us. The gift shop-The best we had seen in Vegas for unique items, not over priced. The cleanliness-Superb. The service-very good. The value for this older hotel was terrific. We paid on the first night, $45-then up each night thereafter. Decor a tad outdated, but the cleanliness and price with the comfort of the beds and room size makes up for this. Loved the amenities for my teenage daughter, she saw a movie, and could even bowl independantly. We felt very safe with the security gaurd in the hall. I would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: suep123
Reviews.Content: This was our 7th trip to Las Vegas and we have always stayed on the strip. A friend told us abouth the Orleans so we reluctantly gave it a try. We really enjoyed it. The casino wasn't smokey and the staff was very friendly. The rooms were large and the beds very comfortable. They have great coupon offers on Tuesdays for people 50 and over. A movie in one of the 18 theatres for only $4.00 and then a free game of bowling with your ticket stub in the 70 lane bowling alley. We enjoyed that so much that we bought an extra game for only $3.00 (don’t forget your socks). The nice thing about the Orleans is you don’t have to wait in long line ups for food or coffee (Starbucks). Plus we never had to wait long for the shuttle bus. At the end of the day, it was nice to get away from the busy strip. We will stay there again next year. P.S. If you go to the gun store there is a bus right out front that goes straight there for $2.00. We realized that after paying a cab $25.00

Reviews.Title: “Stay and Play”
Reviews.Author: mawdooms
Reviews.Content: Although I get rooms comped, I would still stay here. I like being off the strip and being away from the crowds, even though The Orleans can be quit busy. This visit the Rockabilly convention was at the Orleans and it was very neat seeing people dressed the way they were. I like staying here off the strip because I use back roads to get around town and never get bogged down in traffic.If you like hockey, the minor league team of the Phoenix Coyotes,Las Vegas Wranglers, play adjacent to the casino during hockey season. I like The Prime Rib Loft restaraunt at The Orleans, alot of prime rib for a decent price. Many slot machines, with many table games. Cocktail service on the floor above average. I feel very comfortable staying at this hotel compared to other casino hotels. Very spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money!!!”
Reviews.Author: richc78
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel for £22 a night! Amazing value for money! Massive rooms, no queues, no complaints! Was very impressed with this hotel, especially for the price, no it is not on the strip but free shuttle bus every half hr til 12.30am and an $11 taxi ride home!! No brainer! And in a world of LA/Vegas valet parking free parking a definite bonus!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: TracyCT
Reviews.Content: This was my third time staying at The Orleans. I love everything about this place. The Orleans is not as modern as the hotels on the strip, but it has a great atmoshere. It is decorated in a New Orleans theme. Lots to do, busy but not too crowded. Large casino and bar area. I put $6 in a slot machine and won $419. Lots of restaurants to chose from and all are reasonably priced. If you show your players card at the buffet you get $1 off and you get 10 percent off purchases at the gift shop. The buffet was very good. Also, when you register your player's card online you get lots of deals such as discounted and free rooms. Our room was large compared to most of the other hotels we have stayed at lately. We had a beautiful view of the strip. The rooms and whole hotel and casino are very clean. The bed was very comfortable. Six elevators make getting up to your room fast. Security guards check to make sure only registered guests use the pool and elevators. Do not expect a modern decor like you would find at the hotels on the strip. The rooms are simply decorated, but have good features like a large bathroom with a window, a large vanity, a coffee maker, a safe, a sitting area with a comfortable couch and chair. We had a king bed. I like the fact that there was no bed spread, just sheets and 2 blankets. There are no flat screen T.V.s yet, still the old style T.V.s. They worked just fine. Lots of parking if you have a car. If you don't have a car the free shuttles take you to the center of the strip (near the Flamingo) and to the Gold Coast which is next to the Rio and across from the Palms. The pool area is pretty, plenty of lounge chairs. You cannot beat the value and the atmosphere at the Orleans. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good vacation experience.”
Reviews.Author: destraub1
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at The Orleans Hotel & Casino for at least 10 years while traveling to Las Vegas. The food is always good where ever we eat at any restaurant there. We like the security, the excellent check-in and check-out lines and the over all hospitality that is given to us.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas family fun”
Reviews.Author: AsianVista2
Reviews.Content: We traveled with 3 kids under 8. My folks came with us too (they were able to watch the kids while the hubby and I invaded the strip in the evening). We booked two rooms and took advantage of the Terrific Tuesdays promo. Check-in was a breeze. I was the 6th person in line and waited only 10 minutes. In addition to gambling, The Orleans offer a bowling alley, movie theater, arcade and a variety of places to eat. There is Fuddruckers, Subway, Sbarro, Baskin Robbins and other good restaurants on the premises. Very convenient to have all these things when traveling with kids. Take advantage of the coupons you receive at check-in. The rooms were clean. Housekeeping did a wonderful job. It was nice to come back to our room looking as if we just checked in. Rooms do not have a mini fridge but I was able to get one. I recommend you request for a fridge if you want to store your drinks and snacks. The pool area is large. Three areas for almost every age group to hang out in. Nice pool towels are available. The Orleans is off the strip so we took advantage of the shuttle. We never had to wait more than 15 minutes for the shuttle. The kids enjoyed the ride when we took trips to the strip. If we return to Vegas, we wouldn't mind staying at The Orleans again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, high value, easy access.”
Reviews.Author: jbiundo1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Orleans quite frequently over the past several years and find it to be consistently clean, friendly, and confortable. The restaurants and other amenities (exercise room, for example) are quite nice. The majority of our gambling time is spent there as well.

Reviews.Title: “BUCKET LIST ADVENTURES”
Reviews.Author: kimotheclown
Reviews.Content: My friend is going to take a path of treatment for cancer. This by all means it is not a life ending treatment. By gosh, we just were going to have fun, fun, fun. No, we did not go "hog wild"; however, with lower rate tables we definitely got more bang for our buck. To sum it up, you have "3 wise guys" (sort of a biblical takeoff) that had a great time. Thank you so very much.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the value”
Reviews.Author: cdeast
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick and staff courteous and friendly. Room was clean and spacious. A great value for the money. Plain but comfortable and bath was an adequate size. Breakfast buffet had much to choose from including desserts and was reasonably priced at $6.95.(only $4.00 on senior day). Had no problems with their shuttle to and from the strip. The Friendly's Restaurant in the hotel has a good happy hour with friendly bartenders. We had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “We have stayed at the Orleans at least once or twice a year for the past 14 years and love it!”
Reviews.Author: jimbullard512
Reviews.Content: NIce hotel, close to the Strip, great restaurants with a variety of foods. Rooms have always been clean but not completely noise free if there are rambuncious patrons in the hallway. Room service has always been fast and reliable. Wide variety of gaming tables and machines. Overall an excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable First Stay In Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: justtheguy
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the Hotel was courteous and friendly. There is a convenient free shuttle bus that runs frequently to and from downtown Las Vegas. The room was clean and comfortable and the starff at the hotel casino restaraunts and shops were very courteous and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The slot tournments are a blast enjoy and relax If you win a plus if You don't it's still a plus”
Reviews.Author: deliciousev
Reviews.Content: The slot tournments are great and well needless to say the room I had was fab hope yours will be to have fun don't expect anything but great time weather your single or attached and even if with family it is a fun place to be doing absolutely nothing

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay at Orleans Hotel Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: rmalcom
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Orleans Hotel Las Vegas for the last three years and I'm very pleased with the Hotel and all it's employees. I love gambling at this hotel as I feel right at home. The dealers enter act with the players making the game more interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Trip to the Orleans Casinos”
Reviews.Author: kev2128
Reviews.Content: We always stay here on my moms birthday. This is our casino of choice due to it being off the strip and the great parking. The casino is just right, not to big like MGM where you get lost. They have a shuttle that goes to the strip from the orleans all day long until 12:30am which is great and its free! I usually just tip the shuttle driver a few bucks and this sure beats the taxi's if your trying to save some cash. The rooms were clean as always and everything in my room from the TV, shower pressure, lamps and phone worked with no problem. I feel safe here, security is very helpful in helping you find where you need to go or have any questions. They have a 24 hour burger, pizza and subway station which is great! I mostly a poker and slots player as they have a full poker room with tournaments $75 no limit buy-in. The restaurants, i like the Prime Loft and Big Al's Oyster Bar! If your an oyster fan this is the place as they make them in all sort of style and taste! Overall since we found this place we moved away from the strip due to just to much tourist and strip traffic going on, this is truly the best value in las vegas

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and relaxed.”
Reviews.Author: graingern
Reviews.Content: This ain't a posh hotel I found it very relaxed. Its about ten mins form the main strip but there is a free shuttle bus to and from the strip every 30 mins from 9am to 12 midnight. The price of this hotel is fairly decent too. There are plenty of slots tables card games etc to play. There is nice restaurants also. Checking in told about 15mins mins but there was a huge crowd in front of us. The front desk was staffed to capacity and you could see they were working flat out so you can't really complain there. Inside there is an 18 screen cinema which I thought was excellent both screens I went to were full size unlike the ones on the strip. There is also bowling available I didn't avail of this facility but there was a bowling competition on when we were there so it can't be that bad. The room was big, clean bed really comfortable and cleaned when we required it. the only bad thing about the room was there was a bit of an unpleasant smell coming from the sink plug hole but that could be easily fixed if you were bothered by it. This hotel is huge if you don't like walking get a room beside the lift. The hotel has valet parking and an airport shuttle bus ($18 for two) but unless there is a big crowd your better off getting a taxi ($13) but get they to take Tropicania ave as there have been some stories of taxi's going the long way round. Airport should only take you 15mins or so. All staff were friendly. Free wifi, power outlets and comfortable chairs at the coffee shop just inside the door.

Reviews.Title: “A decent place at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: RIKKASDAD
Reviews.Content: I'd never been to Las Vegas before, and only came now for a wedding. Arrived on a Thursday evening, left very early on Saturday morning. Room was clean and comfortable, and I loved the little window off the bathroom. Fairly large place, with plenty of elevators. Staff was competent and even friendly. Food choices were great, although I was underwhelmed by the breakfast buffet at the French Market--there was lots of lstations, but not really very many choices. Seemed to be plenty of free parking, and even though off the strip, seemed safe. Certainly some defered maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “A nice self-contained facility”
Reviews.Author: PortlandCB
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orleans on 3/31 and 4/1/11 while attending a seminar at the Gold Coast. Having read nothing but positive reviews, I figured it was a great idea for an off-strip place at the price. There really isn't anything negative to say about the place. It is a large facility with a casino designed to give the impression of the French Quarter and has a casino layout nearly identical to that of the Gold Coast, except slightly larger, and with more of a fleshed-out motif. The Orleans caters to both locals who like cheap games, and vacationing families who like to have some options for the kids (bowling, movie theaters, etc.) while still having plenty for parents. They also tend to bring in a lot of acts that don't have the same draw as Strip properties would like. Having said that, I'd take the Temptations over Celine Dion any day of the week!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: dllbll
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights (22nd to 30th March). Previously had stayed at Gold Coast (Jan 2008) but chose Orleans as pool area looked much bigger and better than G C - good choice 'cos weather was lovely and spent few mornings or afternoons chilling/relaxing in between the shows, gambling, drinking eating etc. The jacuzzi was huge and very hot. Our room , on 20th floor, was extremely clean when we arrived and remained that way throughout our stay. Had side view of the strip - Stratosphere Tower end. Room very quiet, bed very large and no noise whatsoever. Cleaner left new bottles of shampoo, conditioner, body wash etc every day. Loved the fact that we could have hot drinks in our room (I have to have my cuppa first thing in the morning!) Mainly ate from the buffet which we thought was great value for money . Also had few burgers at Fuddruckers - best burger I have ever eaten!! and could have loads of salad with it - excellent value. Shuttle bus to/from the strip was great and all the drivers were friendly and helpful - and we never waited more than 15 minutes. Great to be dropped off right at the heart of the strip so never too far to walk to most of the big name hotels. We didn't have to use a taxi at all so this gave us more money for gambling etc. We are not big gamblers but enjoyed playing the machines and we hardly ever had to wait long before we heard the familiar sound of 'cocktails' - the cocktail waitresses who served us were always very pleasant and quick in bringing us our drinks - fabulous! Everyone extremely helpful and pleasant and we really enjoyed our stay at Ther Orleans and will definitely stay there on our next visit. Away from The Orleans we did the' buffet of buffets' over the weekend and managed to fit in 3 champagne brunches (The Paris, Caesar's Palace and Flamingo) - excellent! -especially Caesar's. Saw 6 shows in the 8 days (Human Nature, Jersey Boys, Matsuri, Platters etc, Anthony Cools, Matt Goss). Enjoyed all the shows but in particular Anthony Cools was hilarious (bit raunchy but fabulous entertainment). Hope you enjoy your visit as much as we did!!

Reviews.Title: “One heck of a good time!”
Reviews.Author: gianthook
Reviews.Content: This trip to Nevada with my brother was broken into 3 parts. This was the first part: Three nights at The Orleans. My brother and I were able to check into our room by 9:30 that morning (after an almost 4 hour flight and about 3 hours of sleep the night before, that was a big plus)! We had a nice, spacious room with two queen beds. If one wanted, there would be no reason to leave The Orleans. We had good food, good gambling and even better action at the card tables. The other two parts of our trip weren't good at all with the card tables. In short, a great room, good food, good gambling and GREAT customer service! We will definitely choose The Orleans for our next Vegas vacation!

Reviews.Title: “it was great,plenty to do,food was the best.”
Reviews.Author: missy152
Reviews.Content: the pool experence was great also sun and shade for people who can not be in the sun. something for every age group.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay If You Are Not Looking For Opulence”
Reviews.Author: Bulls76
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an opulent or ultra luxurious place, then the Orleans Hotel is not for you. But, if you are looking for a quality, clean hotel with big rooms, plenty of decent eating options and don't want to empty your wallet, then there is no reason to stay anyplace else. This is, by no means, a small hotel. I believe that there are approximately 1,700 rooms. They have a large casino with several bars and restaurants scattered throughout the main floor. The hotel even has a bowling alley and a movie theatre. A shuttle runs about every twenty minutes until about midnight and drops you off right across the street from the Paris Hotel on the strip. It's about a 15 minute ride. For those of you who love the famous In N Out Burger, the only one located near the Las Vegas Strip is within walking distance (About a 1 mile walk) of the hotel. Whether you are in Las Vegas on business, or pleasure, this is a great place to stay. Save your money for dining, entertainment and everything else that Las Vegas has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: tipper24
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with my youngest daughter. Definitely the best bang for your buck. Room was big with a big bathroom and clean. Beds were very comfortable. The hotel has everything you need. Pool area is nice. The buffet is a great value and decent food. They have all kinds options for kids with the movie theatre, game room, and bowling alley. Everyone was super friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: 808rater
Reviews.Content: Returned to stay & play at The Orleans during a recent trip to Vegas. A great value considering price, location, dining options, room quality, service etc. You're just a 5 min. drive from the Strip (if renting a car), with shuttles running throughout the day. We received an upgraded room on the top floor complete with King size bed and 46" Flat Panel TV. Orleans is an excellent value with ammenities for the whole family including casino, theater and bowling alley. Casino was very clean with friendly (and helpful) dealers. Felt very safe with lots of security patrolling the casino and elevator access area. Good variety of dining options too. All in all, one of the best options if staying on the Strip is not a necessity for you?

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the money.”
Reviews.Author: thehilander69
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Orleans several times and find it to be an extremely great value. Although it is not on the Strip they have a shuttle that runs constantly or a taxi ride is about $10. I do most of my gaming at the casino and venture to the strip for shows, shopping and people watching. The suites are larger than a standard hotel room and include a sitting area and a nice bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome as usual!!!”
Reviews.Author: jamiemcb
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this hotel!!! The rooms are very big and very clean. Housekeeping is wonderful, friendly and courteous. Check in went smooth as usual. I got a room on the 12th floor with a strip view. Room was clean and spacious. Love every food place there. The costa cantina is so good. Great Mexican food and great drinks!!! Early bird specials are the bomb!!! The buffet for breakfast is great plus you can't beat the price. Courtyard cafe was also a good choice for breakfast. The food court has some good food as well. Subway, Sbarro, Fuddruckers and a 31 flavors ice cream shop. I was there from the 17-20th for bowling and March Madness. Yes they have a bowling center and also a movie theater, an arcade, and a kids Time childcare if you bring the kids. I will never stay anyplace else ever. Don't forget to join the players club. Great benefits!!! Thanks to The Orleans and their staff for another great stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'm living large”
Reviews.Author: bigdoggggg69
Reviews.Content: I must say that while I stayed at this location of Orleans Hotel and Casino, I was most impressed by the courtesy that was exonerated to me and my wife. The food and service was top line. I especially enjoyed the seafood buffet as well as the other restaurants at this location. But above all I was able to bring back some money from the gaming tables and slot machines. It is not often that I can say that my trip to your location will be one of my top locations. I have already expressed myself to my friends about the experience I had at your Casino. And I also plan to visit your Casino and Hotel in the very near future. I have visited lots of casinos and hotels and our rate this one as my best experience yet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Denster
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is perfect as a base for Vegas - we stayed here for 5 nights and then splashed out and stayed 3 nights in THE Hotel at Mandalay, after going to the Canyon - obviously the manadaly was far more luxurious - however the Orleans was brilliant and amazing vaue for money - I would recommend it as the ideal spot.....even though not on the strip. The room was fab - big huge double beds (two of them0 and very very clean - we requested a high floor and had a fab view of the strip - especially at night time, so this is a big benefit v staying on the strip itself. Value for money was exceptional - we payed about £35 per night - absolutley amazing. The shuttle running to the strip is ideal - it takes 10/15 minutes max and runs regulalrly, we never had to wait long for it and there were always seats - if you are put off staying at the Orleans due to the fact its not on the strip - dont be. The restaurants are fab, we ate at the breakfast buffet quite a few times and it is amazing value for money and excellent food - we did the breakfast buffet at Caesars Palace just for the experience - it too was wonderful and I would recommend it - but it is twice the price of the Orlenas one. The casino in the hotel is fabulous, and the drinks etc and betting thresholds are much lower than on the strip itself. We caught the shuttle to the strip and just walked and walked and walked - we went to all the main hotels, we also went to see Rita Rudner and saw the Lion King - if you like shopping, definitely go to the outlet malls - get a ticket for the bus on the strip - its $7 and lasts 24 hours - and just go north to the very last stop - you cant go wrong and the shops are amazing and so so cheap for designer lables!! Book the Orlenas you really wont be disappointed....

Reviews.Title: “Liked it better this time, PLUS room was comped!”
Reviews.Author: renosparksVP
Reviews.Content: Arrived Thursday 6:45am at McCarran Airport. Enterprise rent-a-car was great as usual, but very limited choices on full-sized cars. Stopped for another great breakfast at Blueberry Hill (big portions, great food and service--1505 E. Flamingo at E. Viking). The property: This is a medium sized, off-Strip hotel with lots of amenities. It caters to a mid-to-low roller, older crowd, and locals. It is kid-friendly, but we did not see a whole lot of kids like at Circus Circus and Excalibur. There is plenty of free parking, and an event arena on-site hosting sporting events and concerts. Therefore, it can get suddenly crowded in the parking garage, at bars and in the casino. Arrived Orleans at 9am—room not ready for early check in. Told to check back at about noon. Went to Trader Joe's Decatur, and returned at 10:30am. By then, check-in line had grown WAY long, and seems that rooms had been ready for a while (Moral: If you're tired and want your room ASAP, don't take for granted that rooms will be ready when desk person says they will be ready—stick around, and watch activity at front desk). Pool was open, but water was too cold to swim. The only people there were four shivering kids playing Marco Polo who quit after about five minutes. Hot tub and kiddie pool were fine. Coast Liquors (near TGIFs): Excellent and reasonably priced liquor and wine selection. Lots of nearly full pay video poker on multi-play machines (including at bars), and some truly full pay deuces near TGIFs. The usual assortment of Keno and slots. There is a non-smoking gaming area near Market Street Buffet (maybe others). The pit was VERY crowded during peak times, but I could find a seat at most tables before 8pm and after midnight. Lines for restaurants were not crazy long (even on weekends), but there were lines to be sure. Food was decent, but would recommend you skip the coffee shop and opt for the buffet. I like to find cheaper food in Vegas coffee shops, and the prices at the Orleans aren't as cheap as I would like. The buffet is a better deal, and the offerings at Big Al's and TGIFs are better quality for not much more money. Great bowling alley, multi-screen theater with all the latest movies, good arcade for the kids, and very good day care at Kid's Tyme (big indoor playground tunnel tube slides, arts and crafts, video games, snack bar, etc.). There are so many services, it's like they don't want you to leave for any reason--ever. Comp room: Rooms are fairly large, with sitting area near window. We got two-night and three-night offers from our last stay six months prior (played our normal amount--nothing special) and were pleased to get free nights (five total on two separate offers) and dining credits ($60 total). On that visit we were not particularly impressed with the service, especially in the cafe, or the room, but this time things seemed to go much more smoothly. The hotel was extra busy because the WAC basketball tournament was happening in the Orleans Arena, so maybe the level of staffing was boosted, and therefore service was better. Pleased with our first two nights, we left town for a road trip through Arizona and Utah, returning five days later to stay three more comp nights. Service was still very good although the WAC crowd had mostly left. Summary This is a really good property if you are not into the Strip scene craziness, and just want to have a no-hassle hangout with friends and family trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Will only stay at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: earthlady96825
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, workers extremely friendly and helpful...always a smile. Fine dining restaurants ...very reasonably priced. 4 Star service! 24/7 Coffee Shop...great food. Oyster Bar...YUM! One thing most important for me..Security. A security guard is posted on the main floor just before the elevators. Guests flash their room card, then proceed to elevators...think this is a must these days. Except for outside shopping trips, I actually found no reason to leave the hotel. Really don't care to gamble on the Strip, have too much fun at the Orleans. Cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sleepyhollow420
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Orleans on several different trips to Vegas and we have never had a complaint. It is off the strip, however the drive to the strip isn't too far; maybe one mile. My grandparents did experience some troubles; their room was next to the elevator which kept them up all night, so they brought the issue up to the hotel the next day and they changed their room without any incident. There is a convenient little cafe down stairs and a bowling alley upstairs, which is pretty cool. No frills, but a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans is a fantastic hotel to stay at”
Reviews.Author: hibill111
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at The Orleans for a number of years and it has always been a great place to stay. The service has always been great and the rooms are clean and very spacious. I like the location as I have done everyting on the strip that I want to. I usually never leave the hotel. The people here have always been very nice to me and helpful. The hotel has everyting I want to do. My five year old grandson loves comming here with me. He loves the play works where he can play with other kids, go bowling and to the moves. I appreicate the service I get here and it is a great value. I can think of nothing I don't like here. I would recommend The Orleans to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wnkk10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights last week. The night before they were full and we stayed at the Gold Coast. Not nearly as nice though the buffet was so much better. Had breakfast and lunch at the Gold Coast and the quality and choices were much better and it was cheaper. The Orleans buffet for breakfast has really gone downhill. That said as soon as we got to the Orleans we felt like we were home! We love this hotel. The rooms are very comfortable, beds are great! Didn't hear anyone next door and I know there were neighbors with all the basketball teams in town. The only noise we had was the wind howling through the door the first night, had a big wind storm. Took a newpaper and some towels and plugged the door and that pretty much stopped it. Took the shuttle to the strip and usually took a cab back from whereever we ended up. Rented a car at the front desk for a day and saw Red Rock Canyon (gorgeous) and Hoover Dam. The staff is very friendly. Check-in a breeze.The only complaint we had was at the tour desk asking about directions to Hoover Dam and the new bridge.. He wasn't very helpful and told us wrong. Got the impression he didn't want to be bothered. Besides those minor complaints we had a great time. Miguels Restaurant and Big Al's are delicious. Can't wait to come back! Don't hesitate to try this hotel! Having a movie theatre on site is great too!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Time: Showroom,Dinner,Gambling,Good Nights Sleep!”
Reviews.Author: FunForDoug
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay and play. The atmospere is great! The people and staff are all friendly here. I've been coming here for years and have enjoyed myself on every visit. The Showroom is great and always has a variety of shows. The Arena is also a great experience to see wonderful things; Globetrotters, Concerts, Ringling Brothers Circus, Etc. The food is awesome and economically price at all the restaurants. The Hotel is a great place to get away and relax. The rooms are compfortable and come with all the amenities needed to enjoy yourself; movies, coffee maker, wifi, and excellent service. I advise everyone to come and experience all The Orleans Casino has to offer. Live, Love, Laugh, enjoy and be happy!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful the staff & casino hosts very accomadating”
Reviews.Author: twintwo60
Reviews.Content: We have been staying in the Orleans for the last 10 years we are a large group of sometimes up to 40 people i recommend this hotel to anyone I know who is traveling to Vegas, The Staff is always very helpful and friendly Also you have a casino host by the name of Melanie Kim who always treats us women as if we were high rollers, I can't say enough nice things about her she always has time to either speak to us or answers our e-mails, we look forward to this trip every May

Reviews.Title: “Being there but not in there (the Strip)”
Reviews.Author: DannyRoman
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, easy access, that alows you to avoid the traffic and the closing of the Strip for New Year´s. The hotel is comfortable, lots of parking spaces, close to everything. The bathroom were huge. Inside the hotel you can find restaurants open 24/7. The reception staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun off the strip”
Reviews.Author: coco1961
Reviews.Content: I like the Orleans alot. The bartenders, wait staff, cashiers, front desk personnel etc, are always friendly and helpful. The casino is large enough that if you go to another part of the casino you feel like you are in another building all together. The room we had was roomy and very clean. There are several bars and restaurants located throughout with enough variety to please everyone. The free shuttle to the strip is a great alternative to cabs. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An Experience Well Worth Repeating”
Reviews.Author: MuskokaMadam
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd stay at the Orleans and I will be returning for a 4th time in May. While it is off the strip, it is only 10 minutes away via the free shuttle service offered. Between the restaurants, movie theatre, bowling alley and spa (not to mention the casino itself), the only time I had to leave the property was to go shopping or for a change of scene. The employees are courteous and go out of their way to be helpful. The Orleans truly feels like a home away from home. I highly recommend it to anyone visiting Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty to do under one roof - no cabs or rental car needed!”
Reviews.Author: VanInTexas
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in the world, and I travel ALOT. Great service, especially at the restaurants. The Bell Desk folks were a little curt on this visit, not the usual friendly service. Rooms are starting to look a little dated (the 'brass' fixtures need refinishing or replacing) and the beds were too soft. BUT.....MANY things to do besides gamble, but if gambling's your thing, there's plenty of it. LOVE the background music thru-out the hotel/casino. DON'T MISS the CANAL STREET Restaurant! Favorite restaurant in the world! VERY CLEAN rooms, casino.

Reviews.Title: “A nice experience”
Reviews.Author: grevo77
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. The Orleans is a great place to stay. One of the things that really impressed me was how clean the casino area, the elevators, the hallways and everything else was. Of course the rooms were perfect, too. Crystal clean and huge. Furniture were in perfect condition, too. The room was equipped with a coffee maker. Ask for a high floor room. I got a room on floor 15 and the view was awesome. One negative was that the rooms were designed in such a way that not much light comes into it. At least my room had this issue (it was facing North), so I had to keep the lights on even during the day . No problems with noise and the sleep quality was high. The hotel is a 30 min walk from MGM but they have a shuttle that runs every 30 min and takes you to the strip for free. Bottom line:This hotel provides you with luxurious amenities without emptying your wallet! If you care about your general health keep this place in your list.

Reviews.Title: “FUN FUN FUN FOR A 30th BIRTHDAY !!!”
Reviews.Author: NanaD92649
Reviews.Content: We booked 7 rooms, full of people ready to have their idea of fun. The Orleans provides just that. There's a movie theater, a bowling alley (HAD A BLAST), plenty of restaurant and bar choices (CAFE IS GREAT with fast service and good food), and, of course, the GAMBLING. Most everyone in our party won at some point in the weekend. Staff is very attentive, from the valet to the bellman and the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans is the complete Vegas Experience”
Reviews.Author: md403
Reviews.Content: When you get to the Orleans it has everything you need--- food was great from the buffet to the Prime Rib Loft and everything in between. Gambling was friendly, room service great and the staff on the whole was great. I have been going to Las Vegas for the past fifteen years and the last ten I have spent at the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans Best Bet for your Gambling Dollar”
Reviews.Author: Beerman107
Reviews.Content: Very Friendly and helpful staff. Everything you need at the Hotel and Casino, no need to go anyplace else. Very Good Food at a variety of dining places.

Reviews.Title: “Great mid sized resort without the huge megaresort price”
Reviews.Author: AngelFan1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last President's Day weekend and were impressed with everything about this hotel. Valet Parking and check in were a breeze. As we were taking our bags out of the car at the valet area, one of the workers said he could get us a bellhop if we needed one. I took him up on his offer since we had a few bags to carry. Within a minute, we had a bellhop at our car and he directed us to the check in desk. Went to the check in desk and the wife and I signed up for the Player's Club and got a ton of resort coupons. If you come here, do sign up because you can not only get discounts at the buffet and gift shop, but discounts on rooms for future visits too. And you can also save 5 cents a gallon of gas at any Rebel gas station. The room was nice and comfortable with a nice view of the Strip (thanks to the guy at check in for getting us a room with a cool view). The only qualms we had were a leaky faucet, which got fixed right away by maintenance, and finding someone's lip balm on the floor. Other than that, no complaints on the room front. Clean, comfortable and bigger than I expected. Our daughter loved the Kids Tyme area which is a good place to drop the little ones off while mom and dad go off and either play nickel video poker or have a nice dinner together. We did the former and they do have a good sized non smoking area. The casino was not as smoky as places like Circus Circus. In fact, the Ventilation in the whole casino was very good. Didn't feel overwhelmed by second hand smoke. The biggest complaint about the Kids Tyme area from our daughter was that she didn't get to spend enough time there thanks to mom and dad. They do have a lot of activities for the kids there from a huge chutes and ladders playground gym to video games and movies. The 24 hour bowling alley was also a hit as well. Lots of lanes and friendly service. We ate breakfast at the French Market Buffet. Good food and great prices. You could pay more but despite the low prices, they did not skimp on quality. Very good omelet station, awesome sweet potato pancakes and they had a killer biscuits and sausage gravy. Wife loved the cheese blintzes and our daughter loved the chocolate waffles. Breakfast burritos were a nice touch there too. When we go back, we will have to try lunch and dinner. Hear the crawfish and ribs are very good. We will definitely will be back to The Orleans again on our next visit. Will take advantage of the Strip shuttle, the movie theater and will let our daughter stay at Kids Tyme longer than 90 minutes. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Now if they would be a little more looser on the payouts on the 5 cent Deuces Wild video machines....;)

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Decent for the $$”
Reviews.Author: Invadersrock
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my daughters fastball team (14 year olds) and was surprised at how decent the rooms were. Stayed on the 12th floor and rooms are spacious and very clean. My parents stayed in the room next to us and forgot their laptop during checkout. Called the hotel when they got home and it was there! Hotel sent it by courier and all was well. We were happy with our stay, food was good, huge bowling alley ect... Heard from a friend this hotel pays out better than most. Down fall - too far from the strip or anywhere else, have to take $20.00 cab ride to the Mirage or shuttle to Bills and walk walk walk!

Reviews.Title: “Superb, as always!”
Reviews.Author: fikusaa
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth or fifth stay at The Orleans and I have yet to be let down. The rooms are huge and clean. The resort offers plenty of dinning options, including a food court, and all at great prices. The promos they run make it easy to get an amazing deal on rooms, food, and even gambling. Their buffet is very good and is one of the less expensive in all of Vegas (you get a little better food quality at some of the places on the Strip, but really the French Market Buffet cannot be beat for its price!). The 24 hour Courtyard Cafe is also a great value with great food. We love this hotel and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Super Bowl weekend”
Reviews.Author: TomSherman_TX
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed this hotel/casino. From the very friendly check-in to checkout 5 days later everything was perfect. The rooms were clean and spacious the casino area was clean and did not reek of cigarette smoke like most casinos do. Several really good eating choices. We watched the Super Bowl in Brendan's Pub, great crowd and friendly staff with free Bud giveaways, inexpensive good tasting hot dogs and beer with Jagermeister shots. The free shuttle to the strip is timely and very convenient. The only negative that I can think was the long walk to the parking garage but what the heck walking is good for you. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel room showing it's age”
Reviews.Author: sarge67
Reviews.Content: We had several plumbing problems-bathtub lever would not stay in the drain position so the shower water rose to above my ankles-toilet bowl floor bolts were loose- sink faucets were loose-bathroom did not have an exhaust fan-hot water came from both faucets so had to run cold water faucet for maybe 30 seconds or so till it actually delivered cold water. Otherwise, the room was comfortable and quiet. On the plus side, the rates are reasonable and the free shuttle bus to the strip is a nice bonus.

Reviews.Title: “My Stay at The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: sonny15
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Orleans was great. We enjoyed the great selection of video poker games to play. Good schedules and tables. We also enjoyed the movie theater as we were able to take a break and see a movie. There is really no reason to leave the property.,

Reviews.Title: “Super weekend over super bowl Sunday”
Reviews.Author: callahanha
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Orleans about 10 times before and I always enjoy myself. The atmosphere is much more relaxed compared to the strip and the service from check-in, cocktail waitresses, bartenders and dealers is always top notch. For $20 I saw a comedian, Nate Crosby, in the showroom on friday, another $22 for the hockey game in the Arena on Saturday, attended the Super bowl party in the lounge area on sunday. Great entertainment at excellent prices. I ate at the Mexican restaurant and it was very good and early bird specials for $8-10. The coffee shop was o.k. for a late night dinner and Al's Oyster bar was also a great deal for lunch under $15 (including tax and tip). I also recommend the $1.50 hot dogs at the sports book. they are large and steamed in beer. Excellent afternoon snack. For people who take pay schedules on video poker seriously, there are many 99%+ games available such as bonus poker, dueces wild and double double bonus available in all denominations. Table minimums for blackjack start at $5 until about 6pm when they go up to $10. I even got lucky and had a 6 hour run on Saturday morning. I did get a rental car, Budget is right across the street and Enterprise is 2 blocks away, but I also used the shuttle bus to the strip when I wanted to drink and it was always on time and rarely had to wait more than 15 minutes. I have stayed here before with my girlfriend who does not gamble but she enjoys the pool during the warmer months, the movie theaters and Prime Rib restaurant. The Orleans rooms are all pretty much the same no matter what tower you are in. They are on the larger side of a standard room measurement and have a seperate sitting area with couch and table and the bathrooms are large with a tub/shower combo. The matresses have all recently been replaced and I had no problem sleeping. The Orleans is not fancy like Bellagio or Wynn but most of the time rooms can be had for $40 on the website and with little play on the slot club card they send out offers for 2 free nights quite often.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: DonnaD52
Reviews.Content: Rooms very nice and clean. Friendly, professional and helpful staff. Restaurants all very good.

Reviews.Title: “best saturday/sunday brunch buffet in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: wanted2beralph
Reviews.Content: Had the best buffet in Vegas on Saturday morning (Seafood/Champagne brunch). Free shuttle to the strip was awesome. Hotel was nice and clean. Maribel from housekeeping was super friendly and kept our room clean and stocked with necessities. TGI Fridays had great food and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: LilliGanis
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd time to stay at Orleans.. Always friendly staff, good variety of restaurants, clean, rooms very nice and comfortable, convenient shuttle to the Strip, good place for entertainment.. I would highly recommend staying here..

Reviews.Title: “January mid Winter Get Away”
Reviews.Author: Aoa_dennis
Reviews.Content: Winter starter way to early for us this year and so the wife and I needed to get away to relax and to spent some quality time togther. We spent a couple of wonderful days at the Orleans hotel in Vegas. We had the greatest time there, the service was great, the employees from the check in desk to the security guard, the servers and the various restaurant staff all greeting us so pleasantly each time. The endless drinks, the food, the rooms we had the time of our lives and enjoyed every minute. Great place to stay...we'll definately be returning in the near future. Thank you...Dennis - Regina, SK

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, easy location, and lots of amenities”
Reviews.Author: DL9456
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. They seem to have more current slots, lots of table games, and the best poker room for live poker and tournaments. Plus, their food court and multiple restaurant options give you numerous dining choices. Plus, the buffet is one of the best around. Rooms are larger than the normal and offer a nice seating area, plus they are QUIET when you need it most! Love this hotel, staff has always been over-the-top accommodating and everything is easy to get to from here.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans Casino & Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tiles1297
Reviews.Content: Overall review for The Orleans was a success. From the time we arrived up to when we left the casino/hotel. I can not say any negative comments because we are very satisfied during our stay. Thank you very much.

Reviews.Title: “Fun”
Reviews.Author: Lovespokermachines
Reviews.Content: It seemed to me that everywhere I went in the hotel, everyone was pleasant and helpful it didn't matter the time or day. The rooms were clean and up to date the only thing I don't like about the roomsis the bathroom doors, they slide into the wall and sometimes can be difficult to ope and shut. There is a good slection of food. My husband and I are inour sixties and were pleased that security made you show your room key before you could go to the elevators. The Orleans is a large casino and had so many machines that in the three days we were there we didn't even cover them all. Really enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of fun and entertainment with all the comforts of home.”
Reviews.Author: BeatleB
Reviews.Content: All staff members were friendly and helpful from check-in to check-out. with several elevators down the security escorted us into the service elevators causing NO delay. The room was very clean and cozy. Food service was fast and the food was delightful. The atmosphere is always festive. I always enjoy meeting new people from around the country who also express their satisfaction with the accommodations. There is never any boredom with an extensive variety of slots and table games. With close access to the freeway and the strip, the hotel is the ideal location for my needs. To me it's the best bang for my buck and I will stay here every time I visit in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to gamble, dine, and just relax.”
Reviews.Author: Chang1999
Reviews.Content: This is a great place away from the Strip to gamble. The food is great. It offers many of the things I would need to spend my time in Vegas. It's the one casino I would prefer to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: kcmav
Reviews.Content: The Rooms were nice and clean. The food selection was great. And the slots played more then fair!

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans best place in Vegas to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Schafermomma
Reviews.Content: For the last five years, I have stayed at The Orleans everytime. It's minutes from the strip with a shuttle that runs every 30 minutes. The rooms, the people, the clientele, the restaurants, movie theaters, bowling alleys and casino games are the best around. There is one dealer their, David, who has been there ever since I have been going there and every year he recognizes me! That's service and people like working there too! Give it a try, if you like low key, unpretenious local and people, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: shardydmd
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Las Vegas 4 - 5 times a year for over the past 10 years. Normally I usually stay at another Casino in the Downtown area but I wanted a change of pace and tried the Orleans Hotel & Casino. I have stayed at other Casinos that have advertised that they are higher end, but everything about the Orleans was beyond what I expected. Rooms were clean, quiet and comfortable. The staff was friendly and many addressed me by name in little time. Plenty of dining options to choose from (good too!). Not to mention that the tables and machines were kind. Also, as a car guy, I have some hesitation about valet parking. Trust me, the Valet staff took exceptional care of my car. I had no indecision about handing them my keys. For my next trip, I know where I will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “As a Hawaii resident I would highly recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 808SHERYL
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I've actually stayed at The Orleans Hotel. I've gambled and have eaten here many times but staying here was just a wonderful experience. I also brought my two teenage kids and they can't wait to go back. They went bowling, watched movies, swam in the pool and ate at practically every restaurant..They especially loved Big Al's Oyster Bar and Koji. You must try the clams on a half shell, artichoke dip and the linguine with clam sauce at Big Al's. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The shower was great, The best part was that my room was comped. I guess that's why my boyfriend and I are going back next month.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: bekafina
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Orleans when we meet our friends in Vegas.. The hotel is very clean. The rooms are spacious and clean. The staff is also very wonderful. We love this hotel because it is loads of fun, the tables are reasonable and the hotel is priced to stay! We will never stay at another hotel in Vegas!! We LOVE the Orleans and all it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay and fantastic night's sleep.”
Reviews.Author: fippit
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the friendly staff and great experience I always have when I go to Vegas and stay at the Orleans. I've stayed at many hotels on the strip and while the Orleans may not be the fanciest or the most expensive, it IS the most fun to play at, the food is really good, and the beds are out of this world. It's always fresh and clean and everyone tries to make you happy. That's all I need for a really good trip. Oh, and if you're a regular to Vegas and going to the Orleans for the first time , ask for Sarah, she's a terrific casino host.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Valued Hotel and Casino. Very Kid friendly.”
Reviews.Author: missionviejomex
Reviews.Content: my rooms are usually comped here. i don't have anything to complain about. check in and out is always quick and easy. they have all the gambling games one needs. the table games are low as well. $5 single black jack, $5 roulette, and $5 craps. big enough without being too big that you get disoriented. buffett is good and reasonabley priced as is the resturants. you truly get a great place for a good price. if you want venetian, than pay venetian prices and stay there. if you want a clean place to stay, which is very kid friendly, stay at the Orleans. I go with family and 10 1/2 yr old son who loved the bowling, movies, kid tyme area, and arcades.

Reviews.Title: “Superior place to stay, see shows, gamble and enjoy the Orleans Arena!”
Reviews.Author: nobletoall
Reviews.Content: The service was outstanding, the room we stayed in was super clean, maid service was great and we had an excellent view. Security to get to our room by elevator was great! We took advantage of the three meals buffet for a super low price while we stayed. The food was good as usual and the staff and supervisors we very friendly. We visit the buffet every time we come to the Orleans Arena. Thanks for jobs well done and keep up the excellent work!!, Dr. Robby and Mrs. Gloria Frank

Reviews.Title: “Off the beatin path”
Reviews.Author: SGV
Reviews.Content: This place is just "ok",rooms are dated and badly need an update.Bathroom in my room had a toilet that ran all the time,a shower with weak water pressure that also had a VERY slow drain.It was clean but not worth the money. Casino was OK ,except for the sometimes "impossible" to find cocktail servers. Bars during football playoffs had some real loud,foul mouthed patrons that were out of control and I think at any other place would have been tossed out. Restaurants were average at best. If your on a budget it's cheap enough.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: sunni_6
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well off the strip but The Orleans have a shuttle bus every hour which can take you to the strip (10-15min).The rooms are enormous, the place is spotless, really clean. They change the towels every day. The Orleans has the best Casino, the best cinema, the gym is small but enough for some exercising .You can find a few restaurants as well,food excellent(you can have $8 buffer breakfast,lunch or dinner,delicious food,fresh drinks). On arrival you can find discount vouchers for the restaurant which are very useful. The swimming pool is reasonable size .You can do everything you want in this hotel and enjoy your holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place away from the strip but still close enough.”
Reviews.Author: karaokebaby
Reviews.Content: I really liked how professional the staff is at this hotel. The go out of their way to make it more personable. I like that you are away from the hussle and bussle of he strip. You only have to take a short drive to enjoy the strip if you want. There is ample parking, great food and loose slots. I will be back soon.
