Reviews.Title: “OUR HOME AWAY FROM HOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: MANNIE939
Reviews.Content: In the past for 24 years we visited The Stardust before it was imploded, we always felt the same way we feel about The Orleans (Home away from home) The BOYD GROUP has been very good to us and we appreciate it. My son had his wedding reception at the Stardust and my mother always enjoyed going there before she passed away. Your staff at The Orleans gives us the same feeling we got at The Stardust, of trying to give us the best time we can have during all of our visits. Thanks to Licette Rosa and Derek Ronzi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: larad427
Reviews.Content: The Orleans offers the best value in Vegas. It has an excellent staff that is friendly, efficient, and helpful. The Orleans also offers the best promotions for the guests and also has the best rewards for player club. Although ti lacks a shopping mall like the mega resorts, it still offers the amenities to satisfy the guests needs. The French Market Buffet also offers the quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans is the BEST...”
Reviews.Author: Paintsue
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked into the Orleans we felt very comfortable. The staff and service was impeccable!!! The rooms were wonderful and I got a great night's sleep in the bed. As far as the buffet went, the crablegs buffet on Wednesdays was fabulous!!!! The slots were loose and we had a great time. We love staying off the Strip and of course your shuttle service is the best!! We Will Be Back for Another Stay! Sue from Toledo, Ohio

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sando1125
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Orleans, were very impressed with the friendliness and comfort of this hotel. Plenty of places to eat, not as expensive as the strip. Also enjoyed the Casino. We are returning to the Orleans next month and taking some friends with us.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans has everything you need under one roof”
Reviews.Author: Shyman99324
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the orleans every time i go to las vegas, they have a great staff of people to help you when you need something. If you what to go to a movie they have them on the second floor of the casino, also a bowling alley. They have entertainment, concerts, comedy. they also have a arena out the back of the casino/hotel, they have many different events that they hold there during the year. They have many eating establishments there also, and a very good buffet.. Its very easy to get to from the strip or the airport, has a very big parking area to chose from and of course they have valet. The rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “It's always a great time at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: JoAnn94
Reviews.Content: Starting with the valet attendents, the reservation assistants, the security guards, we are always greeted with a smile and acknowledgement. It's good to have a security guard at the elevator and know that people cannot go to the rooms without belonging. The rooms are clean and if you need anything extra, a quick call and it's there. The people behind the tables have been friendly, slot attendants quick, beverage severers always available. We especially like dining at the Courtyard Cafe with their evening specials, but the buffet has equally good food. When we just want a snack to tide us over we go to the food court for a variety of food. It always has been a relaxing and fun time

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel/Casino in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Marlene
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Orleans for the last 3 or 4 years. Believe it or not a dealer from a casino on the Strip recommended it. The Staff is great. I go to Vegas twice a year and the dealers and pit bosses know me by my first name and are always willing to accommodate me for just about anything I need. The rooms are very nice and the housekeeping staff is probably the friendliest I've ever encountered. I have brought friends and family with me and they feel the same I do. They stay there when they are in town. Orleans I love you guys!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and "homey" feeling.”
Reviews.Author: spinpokerdave
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vegas at least twice a year. We always stay at the Orleans. It is a hidden gem. The value is great, support personnel is attentive, prime rib is delish and valet parking is a breeze. Love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: probinson2050
Reviews.Content: Going to the Orleans is like visiting a good friend. We are not "high rollers", yet I feel we get the "high roller" treatment. Everyone on staff is very helpful, and the rooms are clean and comfortable. They also offer a shuttle service that will take you to the strip if you dont want to drive. For the price you cant beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Fun - All you need is here”
Reviews.Author: KLStan
Reviews.Content: We always have fun when we visit the Orleans, this time we spent a couple nights. The rooms are comfortable & "roomy". Everything you may need or want to do is here - good food, entertainment, pleasant & helpful staff and the winning was easy! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans Hotel and Casino... one of the Best”
Reviews.Author: sammymd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to Las Vegas several times a year. We have stayed on the strip and off strip. We have been staying at the Orleans the last several years. They are constantly upgrading their hotel and casino. They have added restaurants to their Food court. Their buffet is a great deal, good food at a very reasonable price. They seem to always have some special going in the Mexican restaurant, and their Cafe has great late night deals.We have never had to wait more than 10 or 15 minutes on their shuttle to take us to the strip. They also have good security, I have always felt safe. The security guard always checks you key card on your way to your room. Once around midnight , there were kids running up and down the hall, playing games making a lot of noise. I called security and they were there within 10 minutes. The casino has all the new slots, and plenty of room to spread out. They have a lot of table games also. They consistanly run room specials. We travel a lot and a comfortable room and bed is important to us. Although the bedding is not at the top tier, I would say that it is average. I have a bad back, and don't have any problems sleeping on their beds. The maids do a great job, very clean. They do not have Wi-Fi in the room, but now that they have WI-Fi in Seatlle 's Best Coffee shop, I can check my email while I drink my coffee. We already have our next trip booked to the Orleans, I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Upper end strip quality for affordable prices”
Reviews.Author: RelaxedYo
Reviews.Content: On many trips to vegas I have passed by the Orleans and thought it was just another local dive casino. I was comletely wrong this is the nicest hotel I have stayed in out of all my trips. The hotel has tons of food options, there is no shopping, but they provide a free shuttle to the strip that drops you off across the street from Ceasars. I personally liked security checking my key when I went to my room as I have had the pleasure at other hotels of running into homeless in the halls.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay when you've got kids.”
Reviews.Author: jacksonlii714
Reviews.Content: Although its off of the vegas strip, this hotel is one that caters to families. We paid less then $75 a night over the weekend, and the hotel has movie theaters, an arcade for the kids and a bowling alley. Almost everything we needed to keep them away while my wife and I hit the machines. The buffet was cheap, but the food was average, typical for the cheap price. Coffee shop was good for late night meals, it was good and cheap, less then $5 bucks for steak and eggs. Their gourmet steakhouse, Canal street was a little disappointing though, for that kind of price the food should of tasted better, although service was great. Besides all that, the hotel offers a TGI Fridays, subway and fudruckers, an ice cream shop, and Seattles Best Coffee with wifi.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Misha031
Reviews.Content: The Orleans Hotel is a joke! I will never stay there again. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The service was terrible. They thought we was prostitutes everytime we enter the hotel. They asked for our Id and room keys. It was funny how they only asked the african american visitors. The beds was horrible! I think I need to see a chiropractor from the pain I experienced sleping there. It was like sleeping on the floor. My friend caught a rash on her back. When we got back home, we went to the doctor and found out it was bed bugs bites all over her. I complained to the hotel, they wanted to give me the run down excuses and didn't do a thing about it. They wanted to know what hospital, the name of the doctor, the medicine they put her on and so forth. So full of crap! I will never stay there again in my life. You might as well stay at the motel 6. It's the same quality of a hotel. TERRIBLE!!!!! I warn you, do not stay there. On top of it all, it's too far from everything. You will spend a fortune in taxi cabs...

Reviews.Title: “Totally Satisfied.....”
Reviews.Author: Oahugirl79
Reviews.Content: The friendliest staff, the most affordable rooms, and the best variety of restaurants! Also, the hotel is totally family oriented, where children will enjoy themselves, and adults will play until the wee hours of the night! We were totally satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: travler013
Reviews.Content: non-smoking smelled of smoke. room in bad shape!!! Was told I was comp for one of the nights, but checked bill and they charged us.

Reviews.Title: “Not on Las Vegas Blvd but worth the shuttle ride”
Reviews.Author: Kurtiemon
Reviews.Content: The Orleans has always been known for being the after hours hangout for the locals once they get off work (hotels, rstaurants, bars on Las Vegas Blvd). Until I arrived and my Casino Host gave us the grand tour, I didn't believe it. Well, now I do. Besides being the 2nd largest casino floor in Vegas, they have a 70 lane bowling alley, full movie theater, ampi theater and a hockey arena (minor league teams plans there). I was overwhelmed at first since the casino was massive but after one night, I got my bearings and got to know where the bars, restaurants and table games were. Positive: Casino floor, table games are $5 min., tons of slots, plenty of restarants to eat at, a shuttle service that runs every 20 - 30 minutes and drops off next to the Flamingo, kid friendsly (bowling alley, theater, arcade center. We ordered extra towels and thry arrived in less than 5 minutes, free fitness facility. Negatives: bed wasn't the most comfortable, off the strip (not convenient), decor is older than most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good deals, family friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Partymonster99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my boyfriends birthday and decided to invite some friends and their kids. Orleans was perfect for us since we took turns entertaining the kids at the movie theater and bowling alley. They were always entertained while we still had the chance to gamble a little downstairs in the casino. They also provide a shuttle to the strip which, if you're not familiar with the area, is very handy. The rooms was clean and spacious. A little dated and a renovation won't hurt but all the amenities of the hotel make up for the room. Depending on the price and offers, I would definitely come again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For Price”
Reviews.Author: sandyp1017
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans from December 25-27, 2010. I was pleasantly surprised at the hotel room. It was really nice and clean and the hotel staff was very friendly. Hotel was off the strip so you will need a car, but the hotel does offer a shuttle service to the strip and there are taxis outside to take you where you would like to go. The buffet is reasonable and other restaurants are well priced. You will definitely enjoy your stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “quite the surprise...”
Reviews.Author: UOT
Reviews.Content: My husband has been trying to get me to stay here for years...but I never wanted to be off the strip. Well, he signed up for a bowling tournament in July at the Orleans so I went along. I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel...it really has everything you need right there but if the strip is what you want--they have a free shuttle that goes to Bill's all day long. The rooms are very spacious and the beds are decent. The restaurants are good--love the sushi...cocktail service pretty good. We went back in November and stayed a long weekend. The only downfall that trip was breakfast on Sunday--service was not so great and the cash register froze during our transaction and it took them 20 minutes to figure out to do a duplicate receipt. We were in Vegas for the Rock-n-Roll marathon in December and stayed at Monte Carlo on the strip--after staying there I said I am never staying anywhere but the Orleans. Not the fanciest hotel but it has everything you need...even a coffee pot in the room!!

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving Trip & Stay was GREAT”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaTraveler49
Reviews.Content: Orleans staff was great, Check in clerk was really nice even though the first room he gave us said it had been cleaned and ready for guests and it wasn't but he fixed that real quick and got us another room and it was VERY NICE. really like the little bath windows that open so you can get some ventalation in room. Rooms are pretty big and beds were real comfortable. Casino had large selection of games to choose so we never got bored just make sure you use your players card and check with a casino host before you check out you may be able to get your room comped! based on your play. but even if you don't it is a better deal than most other hotels in area!

Reviews.Title: “Surprise off Strip !!!”
Reviews.Author: ereap
Reviews.Content: Was able to find this place a number of years ago and have not gone to any other hotel when staying in Las Vegas. It has some great Lounge shows, the rooms are large and clean, have used the gym and always find it very clean and not crowded at all. The pool is large although not open this last visit. Definitely will go back and stay !!

Reviews.Title: “had a great time”
Reviews.Author: lyberty101
Reviews.Content: If your not a gambler but enjoy doing other things going to a movie or bowling or just seeing a great live show this is the place to go.Like just hangin at the bar? there are always lots of nice people to strike up a conversation with. The rooms are comfortable and the service is great. My recumendation is to stay at the Orleans Mike Birky

Reviews.Title: “another great stay at the orleans”
Reviews.Author: newjerseymark67
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Las vegas for over ten years. I have stayed at the Flamigo, THE HOTEL at Mandolay Bay , The Rio and the Riviera. Not one of these hotels comes close to offering the value and experience that the Orleans has to offer. The staff is awesome. The food is great. The atmosphere does not even come close to any of these other casinos. I have and will continue to recommend the Orleans to any and all that ask me about coming to Las vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: JHawk845
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently took my elderly father on his first trip back to Las Vegas in 40 years so he could see our home team play in the Las Vegas Invitational Basketball Tournament. We stayed at the Orleans Hotel and Casino adjacent to the Orleans Arena where the tournament was held. We had a great time during our stay at the hotel - the rooms were spacious and clean, the hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating and the food and service at the restaurants were great. We had been concerned at the beginning of the trip as to the difficulty we'd encounter going back and forth to the tournament, as my father has limited mobility and required the use of a transport chair. We were very happy to find that navigating the hotel, casino and the arena was actually pretty easy, and we didn't have any problems at all. A mix-up with our tournament tickets (a media broadcasting crew took over the handicapped section where we were to view the games), was quickly resolved by the arena staff and we ended up with with a great view of the game on the opposite side of the arena. Overall, a great stay at the hotel, our team won the tournament and my dad had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Casino!!!”
Reviews.Author: db89
Reviews.Content: Great slot selection. Terrific personnel. Terrific location. All around excellent!!!!

Reviews.Title: “ALWAYS AN EXCELLENT STAY”
Reviews.Author: eocjim
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Orleans hotel casino 6 times. From check in to check out they have been an excellent place to stay. They have anything a guest could want from top name shows to spa service. The employes seem moer like family members since I have nevre met one that didn't have a smile and went out of their way to say hello. As a regular Vegas visitor for 20 years this is our new home. I will be there for the New Years celebration. I highly recommend the Orleans to all visitors.

Reviews.Title: “solid choice”
Reviews.Author: edc1954
Reviews.Content: There is nothing remarkable about this property, but it is a solid choice for someone who has a car, wants a safe and comfortable place to sleep, and is not interested in the "glitz" of the fancy strip hotels. If you are a serious poker player, Orleans has one of the best rooms in Vegas. There is always a Omaha Hi-Lo game, which is somewhat of a rarity. Omaha attracts loose players compared with Hold-Em, which I like. Even the local Omaha players are generally pretty loose. I didn't have time to play in the tournaments, but there are at least two every day. Video poker paybacks are good, not great. Craps and BJ seemed to always be available at $5 minimums. The sports book could use more comfortable seating for football. The buffet was average, but the coffee shop is one of the better ones I have been to. Fresh, well-prepared coffee shop fare at reasonable prices. I ate most of my other meals elsewhere. Overall, a very good value. I gather that there is a shuttle bus to the strip, but I would not recommend this destination unless you have a car. If you are flying in, you can typically find a rental car deal that will be not much more (possibly less) than you would spend on taxis during your trip, and it's so easy to get in and out of this place with a car that you will wish you had one. Then you can go anywhere in town, or to Red Rock, or Lake Mead, or wherever -- you will not be limited to a bus ride to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Room $ add $5 per day resort charge & $13 Internet”
Reviews.Author: soundasapound
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for, it's going to sound crazy but ask for a room near the elevators. Bad design on the hotel, those hallways can be brutally long if you are at the end of the corridor or even in the middle Would we stay again NO.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain hotel, just off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: cedric09
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to save a little cash to use elsewhere in Las Vegas, consider the Orleans Hotel and Casino. True, it is off of the Strip, but still offers all of the expected services at budget rates. If you shop around in advance, you can usually find discount rates online. One caution however, read the fine print in your reservation. The quoted room rate does not include many extras and there will be a $5 per day charge added to your bill for "facility" as you check out.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: szplx14
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting Las Vegas every 2 years since 1993 & never stayed at The Orleans Hotel & Casino. Friends recommended we try it. We did & were very happy we did! Wonderful beds, great maid service, friendly people throughout the entire hotel & casino and at the restaurants and coffee shop. Just #1 in every aspect. We went to a movie while there and were planning on bowling also in the huge bowling lanes but there was tournament upon our arrival & we ran out of time in the following week. The shuttle to The Strip was very convenient & operated frequently. We even walked the 1.7 miles to the strip on one occassion. Highly recommend The Orleans Hotel & Casino to everyone visiting Las Vegas. My wife & I are 57 years old &

Reviews.Title: “Very Familiar”
Reviews.Author: steeldoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed there Halloween weekend I enjoy it there. The facilities are getting a little dated , but it's all good. The heated sauna pool wasn't heated well. The steakhouse was a good value, but the quality of their food has fallen a bit in recent years . Some of the dice dealers are a bunch of crabby guys. BTW , what does that casino players' card actually dO?

Reviews.Title: “Smoky, but inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: CCphotographybug
Reviews.Content: It was fine, but nothing great. A bit too smoky for me and my husband, but that's to be expected in Vegas I suppose. The shuttle to the strip was decent, so no complaints there. If we were to do it again, we'd stay on the strip rather than saving the money staying further away.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was cozy and nice....”
Reviews.Author: Basia124
Reviews.Content: We got to The Orleans November 12 early at 12 noon, no problem checking in...I was very happy because I had bought this night for my American Airmiles.... The hotel was professional checking in, clean, nice, clean and friendly staff... I would of stayed there 1 more night.... it is good not to leave in the evening because the locals come and gamble at this place at night.... we had fun, ate at Fridays, and had coffee at the seattle Coffee place on the main floor... great experience,,,, would stay there again....

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: LSP51104
Reviews.Content: Stayed Sunday 11/7 thru Thursday 11/11 and have absolutely no complaints. The room was spacious and extremely clean. Bed was comfortable, although for a king sized bed there were only two pillows, we could have used two more. Large bathroom with a window in the shower that let in fresh air, very refreshing. TV channel selection is limited but as I reminded my boyfriend, we weren't in Vegas to watch TV. Security making us show our room key to get to our rooms was comforting. Elevator service was very fast; we've stayed in smaller hotels and waited a lot longer. The restaurant selection in the hotel was great. All were very reasonably priced and served huge portions. I often wished we would have had a small 'fridge in the room to bring home leftovers. The shuttle service to the strip was fantastic. They said it ran every 30 minutes. Not sure about that because our timing must have been perfect because we never waited more than 4 minutes. It drops off right at Bill's Gaming Hall, right in the center of the strip. All hotel staff is extremely friendly. From our quick under 3 minute check-in clerk to the shuttle drivers to security to housekeeping, everyone was smiling and willing to answer any questions we had. This was our second stay at the Orleans and I would never stay anywhere else in Vegas. And, the $40 night we paid was great!!!!

Reviews.Title: “STILL LOVE the ORLEANS!”
Reviews.Author: deandesperado
Reviews.Content: another great 4 nite stay at the ORLEANS. staff, food, customer service still great. room is starting to look a little dated, but clean. i still love the ORLEANS!!

Reviews.Title: “My first trip to Las Vegas and it was just okay.”
Reviews.Author: poonster1012
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Orleans Hotel & Casino. The beds weren't too soft and the size of the room and bathroom were fine and comfortable. I was a little disappointed that there was no mini refrigerator or a microwave and no cable TV. We have a 4 year old and the arcade was a great place to keep her entertained. She loved playing air hockey so that was a plus. She also liked the hotel swimming pool. We were disappointed with the hours of the business center. Since we were departing on Sunday, we wanted to print up our boarding passes on Saturday afternoon but the center closed at 2pm. We had to pay to use the kiosk and I thought that was expensive. I liked that the hotel wasn't located on the main strip. We had a rental car plus the hotel provides a shuttle to the other casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff - shame about the decor”
Reviews.Author: yorkiebearfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week, and all the staff were extremely helpful, but they really need to do something about updating the decor - very tired looking. I also think they need to do something about the smoky atmosphere. Coming from the UK, where smoking is now not permitted indoors, this was very uncomfortable. My room was very spacious, but there were two stains on the carpet, and the table lamp had a slit in it. I recommend the French Market Buffet - BEST scrambled eggs EVER!! TGI Fridays is good, and Seattle's Coffee Place, and Sbabo, and well, pretty much all the places that are available to eat at are great!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: jeep01
Reviews.Content: Absolutely horrible experience at this Hotel/Casino. The first room (non-smoking) reeked of cigarette smoke and some incredibly nasty fragrance trying to mask it. The second room had a broken bathroom sink. The valet service was extremely slow. They took 30 to 45 minutes to bring our bags to the room. The room service food selection is pathetic. Never, never, again. I'm checking out asap, and moving to a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great large room for free! Signed up for card and got 2 nites free!”
Reviews.Author: yaahoos
Reviews.Content: We had never been to the Orleans hotel , but since we rent a car anyway when we go , and we got a flyer for 2 FREE nights , we grabbed it. Check in was under a minute. It WAS FREE! Never cost us a cent. Room was great. Carpet was dated , but all other amenities were fine.Casino was also great. Food was excellent. Prices fair. Clean quick maid service to room . FREE shuttle to the strip and near RIO Casino every 30 minutes. |What more can one ask for? If we decide to stay off strip again , it will be the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “When I have a choice, I always stay here.”
Reviews.Author: RajRiversideDaysInn
Reviews.Content: Since I live in Southern California, I always drive to Las Vegas. My business has a function in the city every two years and I prefer to stay at the Orleans. It doesn;t cater to the high roller crowd, but neither does my business. The staff (including casino and restaurants) are great. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Security ample. I've stayed at least 5 times and have no complaints. Well, really only one. When my business is done at the other location and I return, I may have about 10 minutes before they close the pool. Since Vegas is 24/7 why not keep the pool open a little later?

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Recommended if you can live with staying off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Bensus
Reviews.Content: This is my second time here - first time was about 5 years ago. I like the place. It's big but you can self park and walk in to the hotel. The rooms are big - bathrooms are big - there is some wear on it (stains on carpet) but it's pretty nice for the price - we paid about $60 per night average over three nights including a weekend. They charge a $5 per day resort fee and the Internet is $13 per day (for each 24 hour period.) There is free wireless at a coffee place in the lobby and apparently some access in the business center - but it closes at 2 pm on Saturday and Sunday). There are also internet machine for access by the minute in the lobby area. We took a cab to the strip and it was all very easy and pleasant. Nice pool and some nice restaurants - the buffet is pretty nice at $15 and there are a lot of selections including sushi. Rooms are quiet - nice views and the bathrooms have a small window that opens for fresh air. This is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “A Taste of Mardi Gras”
Reviews.Author: nshugg
Reviews.Content: Location: You cannot walk to the strip but it's close and the hotel offers free shuttles. My husband and I stayed over the weekend and enjoyed this hotel. The name tips you off; there's the Alligator bar, huge Mardi Grad masked heads hanging from above, Large fake Alligators playing instruments (photo op LOL). The rooms are large and clean, We were in a two Queens room. There's a little alcove with a couch and chair. The couch is cute; like a sitting room in the South. Wallpaper with a little Orleans flair. I was constantly reminded of New Orleans which was good since it's one of my favorite cities. The bathroom has a sliding door to pull for privacy. There isn't a shower stall, it's bathtub with shower curtain but not a problem. Bathroom large enough for 2 people to move around in. The three meal a day dining was good. They have a TGI Fridays for lunch/dinner and Seattle's Best to get you going in the morning, and a good chocolate shop for your sweet tooth. Other nice restaurants also. The clientele is not the same as a Bellagio but were a range of ages who dressed pretty appropriately, not a wild t-shirt crowd. This is a comfortable crowd and a good casino and sports book. The pool is open also from 9am - 2pm. It doesn't get tons of sun at this time of year but I saw some families using it for their children. They have a good workout area with nice machines; treadmill, bikes, weights, etc. and free. They also have a spa for other services. The only gripe is their internet fee. $12.99 a day for one computer. Rip. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sa 10/2-Mon 10/4 Good location, quality”
Reviews.Author: tamster34
Reviews.Content: We were able to check in about 11:30am. The room was large with a seating area & comfortable bed & pillows. We didn't hear any noise from the hall or neighbors. We ate at the Courtyard Cafe twice (good food, decent prices but slow service) & the buffet once for lunch. Cocktail service at the table games was usually more than adequate. One time on Sunday night about 9pm, it took about 20 minutes before we saw our first CW. I never had a problem finding a seat at a $5 blackjack table. Good selection of video poker & slots. There's a shuttle to Gold Coast & Bill's Gambling Hall. This was our 3rd stay at the Orleans & would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: redwing3
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a very comfortable 4 nights. The room was clean and the beds comfortable. The staff were all friendly and accommodating and this property had everything we needed. The movie theatres were a nice touch as it was relaxing to be away from the casino activity for a while. It also has a very nice bowling alley but we ran out of time. The shuttle turn around was frequent and we never waited longer than 10 mins. We thought this hotel casino was excellent value and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great bang for your buck.”
Reviews.Author: bobbi01476
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans for nearly a week in September. We loved everything about it. Staff were friendly and obliging, and the room was spacious and light. Yes, it has CRT tv's - but who goes to Vegas to watch telly? The pool was clean and we never had a problem getting a lounger. We loved that you could go to the movies, or bowling as a change from the usual in Vegas. I would recommend the Orleans for anyone looking for a good quality stay for not much money off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Casino, A Few Blocks Off The Strip”
Reviews.Author: rogers222
Reviews.Content: Pros: huge modern rooms, large bathrooms, in a nice hotel. The casino is large and well-managed, there are several restaurants, pool, gym, parking. Everything you need. The prices are very moderate for such a nice hotel, because it's off the Strip. I didn't feel like I was being hustled at every turn, with fees and overpriced drinks and whatnot. Cons: If you want to graze from casino to casino along the Strip, you'd be better off closer in, or you'll have to take the Orleans hotel's shuttle bus. But if you're just in town for a day or two, you'll find plenty to keep you busy in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: lelici49
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights(on 15th floor with strip view) while visiting Vegas and the area. Check in was fast, as well as check out, staff very friendly, spacious clean rooms and we won our stay back at the slotmachines, what more could you ask for??!! If there's anything to complain about it would be the missing fridge in the rooms, and the ridiculous high rates for the internet. We were on a 30 day roadtrip and this was the first hotel which didn't have the above for free.....and this is Vegas with lots of technoligy; strange??!! Our rental car was very handy while visiting the strip where parking is free at every Casino. The Orleans would be my hotel again when visiting LV, for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “a Pleasent surprise”
Reviews.Author: lboogiemacalicious
Reviews.Content: I was happily surprised at this hotel.. It offers a decent room, mine had double queens that were fairly comfortable. The bath room was clean with enough towels for me and my suite mate. The television was very dated with limited channels. This hotel has a wonderful double pool with jacuzzi, The french market offers a nice buffet style meals for a reasonable price. the best thing i found is that the staff was nice and helpful... some of the other places i visited were either snotty or just not happy to be there.

Reviews.Title: “Another great trip to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: griffowitz
Reviews.Content: As always I came away from my stay at the Orleans Hotel / Casino with mixed emotions. How could I have let it slip away after working so hard to acquire a comfortable profit and why would I go anywhere else on my next trip. Although I did not stay exclusively at the Orleans for gambling purposes, I did a majority of my gambling dollars within the walls of its casino. I really like this hotel's rooms although it is showing its age somewhat. However, being approximately 550 sq. ft., the space allows one to move around without constantly saying "Excuse me" or bumping into something. There is also a courtesy safe in the room for personal use. The people are friendly from your arrival to the check-in desk--to the security at the elevators--to the casino itself--waitresses--pit crew--slot attendant, et al. It is off-strip--I like that for the noise level after hours and the crowded conditions on the strip; it is easily accessible to the strip via shuttle or car if one desires. The food is a good value for the dollar spent at the restaurants. The video poker has a much better return than found on the strip although I enjoy blackjack (3:2) and craps as well. The poker room provides good comps for the hourly player as well as interesting tournaments at a reasonable entry fee and positive structure for the player. If you have never tried the Orleans I would suggest you do so even if only to visit the casino. The player's club is very reasonable in rewards and on my five night trip, two nights were free via the rewards system (Friday & Saturday) as they offered 2 free (any) nights. The other nights were reasonably priced as well so it made the trip quite affordable. Also it is easy to turn your points earned through the player's club for credits on rooms / dining / etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Nice Casino with large rooms.”
Reviews.Author: TarHeelTaveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, traveling with another couple, for fun weekend in Vegas. Really enjoyed this hotel and the large rooms. Very quiet and comfortable. Casino was friendly and not loaded with slots - many tables to play on - crap tables were very helpful as well as the fellow gamblers. Oh yeah, the free shuttle takes you right down to main strip Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Kids friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: shirleyhung1
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel for us with young children. Although the hotel is not located on the main strip, it has all we need in one hotel. Our children love it. First, the hotel has a huge bowling center. It has 70 lanes, clean and never full. It opens late. We always play an hour or so after a dinner. Then there is a 18 screens movie theater. We usually choose our own favorite show and watch. Since we usually go to Vegas in summer. There are alots of good movie showing at that time. Then there is also a kid play area called Kids Tyme. It is a place where you can leave your child in a supervised environment. They have all those climbing things just like the Jump N. Jammin. They also have Wii, playstation, movie area, and coin free arcade for the kids. That place is for children 3 to 12 yrs old. You pay $6, or $7 per hour depending on weekday/weekend. Maximum stay is 5 hours each day. We usually drop the kids 1 or 2 hours, so I can grab a drink at the bar with my husband. So while the kids can have fun, we get to relax on our own. So, my kids love it alots. When they are happy, we are happy. Since my first visit to this hotel, they keep sending me free hotel stays ALL the times. But they only offer free for Sunday through Thursday. But we don't mind, cause we have so many vacation days to use. The room is acceptable clean, and the bed is pretty comfortable. The parking lot is big, although it is not a cover parking. My favorite restaurant, TGI Friday is also there. I recommend this hotel to most of my friends who have children. They also find this hotel very convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and facilities 5 minutes off the strip.”
Reviews.Author: GlenB062
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel with all the services that you would need on holidays. Customer service was excellent. Best value hotel in the 4 weeks we spent in USA.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice near the Strip”
Reviews.Author: gameguy99
Reviews.Content: This place has everything except bingo ( the usual plus movies & bowling ). Super close to the Strip. Nice rooms for the price. A superb poker room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: OcalaCharlie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value. Very comfortable and quiet. Rooms are very large as well as neat and clean. Hotel personnel are as good as one could possibly ask for. Very affordable dining from buffets to fine dining. Easy parking. Only negative is the hotel is off the strip. It does however, have a shuttle which runs until midnight. Could not ask for a better value. Will definitely stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Decent with Inconsistent Service”
Reviews.Author: renosparksVP
Reviews.Content: Rooms: Large-ish, with comfortable beds and a sitting area with small sofa; CRT TV with not a whole lot of channels; large bathroom has "closet" area to hang clothes (which actually helped get out the wrinkles from our shirts because of the steam from the shower!); Rooms numbered 02 - 44 even had Strip Views (in more ways than one because of the big "strip" club across the street--yikes!), and odd rooms would be Pool View rooms. The Orleans is illuminated from the parking lot by obnoxiously bright external lighting so if you like a dark room, either ask for something below floor 7, and/or bring clothes pins to hold the drapes shut. Due to the obnoxious lighting, viewing the Strip is not actually soothing or pleasant, so just avoid looking out the window at night... Other than that, we did like the rooms a lot. I especially liked that the bathrooms have a small window over the tub that lets in fresh air, and you can also use it to yell at people in the street below or fly paper airplanes. What's on-site: Casino (with so-so video poker games, and surly pit bosses), bars (with so-so video poker and mostly good, but a few rude slacker bartenders--one refused to comp my girl a premium vodka, but comped it for me no-questions-asked five minutes later--what a female-hater!), several good restaurants (we liked the coffee shop's Orleans Omlette, Koji's sushi and miso soup, and TGIF's steaks) and a pretty good buffet, a bowling center, an arcade, movie theaters, drop-in child care (bring shot records!), and of course the big Orleans Arena. What's Nearby: There is a 24-hour Walgreens two blocks west, and a Trader Joe's up on Decatur (try the "2-Buck Chuck" Charles Shaw cabernet and the $1.99 Pinot Grigio!), a Terrible Herbst Chevron/convenience store, as well as the on-ramp to I-15 nearby. Other services: Shuttle to Gold Coast and Strip; Pool; Spa; Fitness Room; good hotel security. This hotel is set up to cater to low rollers and keep them from venturing too far afield--that way what's lost in Vegas stays at the Orleans. I mean seriously, if you just want to gamble and get drunk, this is better than the Strip. Also, it is pretty kids-friendly, and our 9-year old had a good time at Kids Tyme, the arcade and the pool. Overall, this hotel/resort is a very good deal (at $40 per night) even though they charge that stupid $5 per day "RESORT FEE"--the bean-counting genius who thought that one up should be hung by his heels off a hotel balcony--it's just dishonest pocket picking! An example of not great treatment by Orleans staff (besides the bartender dissing my girl over the vodka mentioned above) was when I went to place a $12/12 bet on 6 and 8 in the craps pit. The pit boss said "Sir, this is a $10 minimum table," like I had just placed a roll of pennies on the pass line. I had $24 in my hand, and it was my first bet. Last time I took a math class, 12 > 10 if I recall correctly. Anyway, the point is, the Orleans caters to low rollers, but some employees don't seem to know that you don't MAKE a low roller FEEL like a low roller. Some of the employees don't seem to align with Sam Boyd's core philosophy on customer service.

Reviews.Title: “I did not get the chance to stay there as...”
Reviews.Author: Nicoledev
Reviews.Content: I did not get the chance to stay there as of yet. Working on that one. With the location being where it is off the Strip yet not to far from it is ideal. The food, games and entertainment is just right it's your one stop. The Orleans has it all to offer hands down....

Reviews.Title: “We were treated very well, you made us feel special, thank you.”
Reviews.Author: ella032
Reviews.Content: The people that seved us from the valet, bell service, floor servers, and restaurant servers were all very courteous and helpful. The food was very good. The room was very well apportioned and cared for nicely. We received special attention from "bell-service" when we asked for directions. Everyone was very helpful. You exceeded our expectations. Jim Ballard

Reviews.Title: “Quality comfortable Las Vegas stay”
Reviews.Author: penny89
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very clean and comfortable. They offer all ranges of dining with all be well worth the price. The gaming seems fair compared to some strip casinos. There is enough happening there to keep you on site and th shuttles allow you convenient access to the Strip. The pool is nice and the overall service is great from Valet through checki/out, food and wait staff. Very good bang for your buck

Reviews.Title: “Off The Strip but on the ball”
Reviews.Author: nocatnow
Reviews.Content: We chose the Orleans because it is not located on the hectic Vegas Strip, and was incredible value. In fact, at $40 Aus, (plus $5 US resort fee per room) we could afford to have a room each, which made a great break from the one of us who snores! And each room was enormous, with two king sized beds, generous sitting area and large bathroom. The locals love the Orleans, and we could see why. The gaming rooms are attractive, there is a food court with various fast food outlets as well as a few nice restaurants, and drinks are cheap. We used neither the pool nor the cinema, but they looked nice. A free shuttle bus takes guests to The Strip on a regular basis. We wandered around admiring the sights but were pleased to return to the peace of the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Not on the strip”
Reviews.Author: wolfium-x
Reviews.Content: Ticks all the boxes for a Las Vegas hotel except one -and its a big one - its not close to the strip. True there is a free shuttle bus to get you to / from the strip but its shared with the Gold Coast Hotel, which is the first stop, so you may have to wait for the next bus when it gets busy because the bus could be almost full by the time it. reaches the Orleans. On the plus side, the hotel has every thing else you could want from a hotel and more.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans Labor Day 2010”
Reviews.Author: flysrb
Reviews.Content: Hey Now! We stayed here 7 nights. The rooms are a bit dated, stained carpets,and it's a long walk to the self-park garage. The place was packed, there must have been a convention going on.. The location is great, easy drive from the car rental place ,the resort fee includes the fitness center which was nice. The pool area was lousy with kids, even in the hot tub! The buffet was ok.. we had the Friday night seafood thingy, only worth the 2 for 1 coupon price. Lots of Asian games in the pit, a fair amount of decent Video Poker. Tuesday is the over 50 day, so take advantage of that if you can. Boyd's is ok on the comps, but didn't offer us any comped rooms after a weks play. Next time we'll stay at Sam's Town on Boulder Hiway.. All in all, pretty cheap place to stay.Join the B-Connected Club online before hand, and they will give you a free night!

Reviews.Title: “First class accomadations/bargain prices”
Reviews.Author: JAGUAR1756
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to Vegas since 1973. Have stayed at hotels that have charged a lot more than the Orleans but did not offer as much. The rooms are spacious and clean. The pool and spa facilities are excellent. A wide range of eating options. All the staff that I encountered were helpful and polite. Since I always rent a car the location was not an issue. If someone can show me all these amenities for the $400.00 I spent for this room I would like to know where that hotel is. We shall return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: wandacraig3
Reviews.Content: Hotel and casino staff were friendly and helpful. Room was basic but very clean and spacious. Not one negative thing to say. Will def return!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: kattie40
Reviews.Content: The Orleans was pretty much as we had expected...... large rooms, very comfortable and quiet. The room was a little dated but clean and the rates very reasonable. The pool area was a good size and also clean with plenty of fresh towels for guests to use. The shuttle service was really good, arriving every half hour. All in all a good hotel which I would recommend for a family visit - we preferred being off-strip as we travelled with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Las Vegas just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: secc1
Reviews.Content: The Orleans Hotel and Casino gives you the maximum for your money. This hotel has large rooms that offer the amenities of most expensive hotels. You have a safe, coffee maker, and great room service. They offer a great gumbo bowl for a small price. The casino is as good as any on the strip. They have many restaurants and snack shops that are great. The hotel staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. The rooms have large comfortable beds and a sitting area complete with a sofa, chair, and coffee table. The location is just minutes form the Las Vegas Strip and they even offer a shuttle that runs every 30 minutes until 12:30 AM. What I liked least was that the television in the room did not get many channels, but who has time to watch tv. What I liked best was the friendliness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, large rooms, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: tv0612
Reviews.Content: Great value, large clean rooms, off the strip. Have a shuttle that will take you to the strip runs till midnight. Everything you need is here!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: jamiemcb
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing!!! the rooms are very big. the beds are so comfortable. the casino has every game that you are looking for. great selection of food. the staff is great. the maid service was wonderful. i have stayed here many times and i don't plan on staying anywhere else. i even met the owner Bill Boyd and he was very nice.i was also very lucky to have met my idol as i was growing up....Steve Garvey. they had a special party for invited guests and i was lucky enough to have a friend invite me. it made my whole weekend!!! the bowling center is a great place to have some fun. they have a giant movie theater as well. all in all this is a great place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “angry/ignorant cocktail waitress”
Reviews.Author: jamesfelonk
Reviews.Content: My wife,i,and sister-in-law spent much time&money gambling in this casino.The last day there,i ordered a drink while playing a slot.While the waitress went to fetch my drink,i burnt through $20 and stopped playing.Upon her return,she informed me that she would not bring a drink if i did not play.What's This? Since when do you have to gamble every minute you are in a casino? I don't know what her problem was,be it boy friend or that special time of the month and i don't care! All i know is she was rude and ignorant. This casino will never see me again! EVER!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place off the Strip, Can not wait to return again and again!!!”
Reviews.Author: soontobethere
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews and nothing came close to how we felt about our vacation at the Orleans. It was just amazing and after reading reviews about this place before we left, I must honestly say everything that I read that was negative, I found untrue. The staff were wonderful, security the best, the pools were extremly clean and well maintained. The beds were more than comfortable, clean, and the rooms were very spaceous. We asked for a room as high as we could in the tower and looking out over the Strip. It was no problem at all to ask. I sort of was wondering about staying on the 13th floor and it was lucky for us. We have stayed at nearly every place on the strip, and felt that the Orleans was as nice as any one of them. The shuttle was great because it took us to their sister hotel as well as Bills on the Strip. The shuttle is a bonus and I hope they never drop that from their agenda, because it brings people to and from the Strip. We had friends staying at the Mirage and Harrahs, and I know they said they would stay at the Orleans the next time they were in Las Vegas. The resturants located on site are all very very good. We went and saw a movie in the cinema , wanted to play a game of bowling, but just did not have the time left to do that. All in all it was just great. ABSOLUTELY No bedbugs, no dirty pool, no noisy kids like I had read in some of the reviews before we leftl Take my word for it please try this place or you are going to miss a wonderful vacation at a really great price!!! We wii be back SOON!

Reviews.Title: “Orleans Hotel & casino”
Reviews.Author: trixBuffalo
Reviews.Content: This time we stayed for 2 nights and the Orleans did not let us down. Rooms were very nice; pool was great. Looking forward to going back in February.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: ShellCArizona
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days with 37 family members. They went out of there way to make sure all of our request were met!!! From hotel staff, to restaurants to bowling. They were the best. I felt they were "truly" glad we were there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Top marks once again”
Reviews.Author: bothsidesnow
Reviews.Content: My second time staying at the Orleans and again a superb visit. Check in was very swift and ultra friendly, I asked for a room on a high floor overlooking The Strip - no problem at all. The rooms at the Orleans are a good size with a separate seating area and something practically unique in Vegas - a window in the bathroom that opens to let in...horror...fresh air!! Everybody appears to be super friendly, from the other guests you chat to in the lifts, to the cocktail waitresses, the room maids, the restaurant staff, it's just generally a happy and comfortable place to stay. Ate in several of the reasonably priced restaurants - the Courtyard Cafe can't be beaten for a cheap filling breakfast. They say the Shuttle to The Strip runs every half hour but in reality is more frequent than that, I never waited more than 10 minutes and I timed the journey - 7 minutes door to door. And it's so good to come back to the relative calm of The Orleans after a long day or evening battling the craziness of The Strip, staying that couple of blocks away just gives you a bit of a welcome distance from the bustle. The pool area is spacious with loads of towels and loungers and a lovely bubbly warm spa. There is of course a massive casino but with low minimum limits (good for a starter like me) but on top of this you have a multi screen movie cinema, bowling, free music in the evenings, free wifi in Seattle's Best, tons of welcome offers and all for $30 a night! I challenge you to find a better deal anywhere in this town!

Reviews.Title: “Experience The Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: JoAnne2910
Reviews.Content: I always have a great time at the Orleans. While it is not on the "Strip", it is not far. If you drive, they have plenty of parking, and it's easy to get anywhere in Las Vegas from The Orleans. You don't really have to leave The Orleans to have fun. They have concerts, a bowling alley, a movie theatre, a spa, pool, several restaurants, and plenty of casino games.

Reviews.Title: “Great food, gambling & entertainment”
Reviews.Author: airbrush101
Reviews.Content: I was comped 2-nites here in mid August. Had a non-smoking king room. They had $5, 3:2, double-deck BJ, which is almost impossible to find on the strip. I also enjoyed the many food options they had. And the lounge acts were good too. It was nice to "finally" stay at a casino that I enjoyed gambling & eating at!! I will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Rooms Shuttle to The Strip”
Reviews.Author: lanavictoria
Reviews.Content: Room was large and clean. Rarely did we hear anything from the hallway. Beware it is quite a treck from the covered parking (which is security patroled) to rooms. Some have mentioned on here that they had issues with the Security stopping them to show their room keys. I didn't have an issue with that as it a Public Casino. But all you have to do is talk to the guards, they are pretty good at remembering your face. You only need to do so once. Everybody was helpful and nice (with exception to the young lady who checked us in - perhaps she should find a nice desk job somewhere) but from the on floor security who allowed me to take a photo of the lit masks to the bartenders to the girls taking you rdrink order...top notch service. My daughter and I went to the onsite Movie Theater. The buffet is wonder. You must try the French pastries! The room was large and neat as a pin. Very clean. Each bathroom has a small frosted glass window in it - cute. Wi-Fi is available at the coffee shop downstairs otherwise there is a port in room. They also have a safe for those who need one. Room service is available though we did not use it. While the hotel is not on the Strip, they do provide a shuttle service every 15 min or so. We prefered to be slightly off The Strip due to stories about the noise but if you go to the South Side The Strip can easily be seen. Our view was of the pool and the mountains beyond. We will stay here again. The swimming pool closes early but also has a whirlpool oasis and cabana's.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value-Big Rooms”
Reviews.Author: scooterpie66
Reviews.Content: We decided we wanted to get away for a few days and found a room for three nights with tax included for under $100, what a deal! The Orleans does charge an extra $5/nt called a resort fee which seems like its Vegas' way of adding a tax to hotel stays. We had a nice, clean and big room on the ninth floor. We normally stay at non-smoking hotels so we thought for sure the smell of cigarette smoke would be everywhere but to our surprise the ventilation system did a nice job of filtering the air throughout the hotel. We ate at TGIF's, Fuddruckers and the cafe. We liked the variety of food available at the hotel, such as seafood, chinese, a steakhouse, Sbarros, Subway, and DQ. We went to a movie and bowled a few games, very nice and laid back atmosphere. The shuttle to the strip runs every half hour and drops you off at a sister hotel across from Ballys. We liked staying away from the strip but still close enough to take a shuttle and not worry about parking ( they have free parking including free valet) They have room service, we had breakfast brought to us one morning when we wanted to sleep in. The employees we visited with were very nice and seemed to enjoy working there. We will definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Kentucky_Guy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotel/casinos in Las Vegas and The Orleans is by far the best deal for the money. The buffets are very reasonably priced and good quality. Although the hotel is not on the Strip, I had no reason (on this trip) to go there.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, warm, inviting atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: JKLM829
Reviews.Content: The Orleans casino resort was a delight to stay at! This was my third time staying and it has been great with each stay. The people that work and play there are all friendly and make you feel welcome with your stay. The lounge entertainment was dynamic each night. The food was excellent also with many places to choose from. I personally like the 24 hour cafe that always have specials. Great place to stay off the strip!

Reviews.Title: “NOT FOR GAMBLERS”
Reviews.Author: manenbleu
Reviews.Content: The Orleans, over the years became a horrible place if one wants to play the machines. The Management, hungry for profits and big numbers and bonuses, made sure that the machines are thighter than news from North Korea! Enjoy the food at the orleans. But DO NOT PLAY THE MACHINES!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “You're Kidding, Right? Nope!”
Reviews.Author: s2kreno
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation online and freaked when i got my confirmation email. I called, sure that I had misinterpreted the email and just looking for reassurance. But the email was true! I had requested a non-smoking room because I have horrible cig allergies, but the confirmation stated that not only do they refuse to guaranty me the room I reserve, but they charge me the first night's rate immediately and if I get there and there are no suitable (non-smoking) rooms then they keep my money! Even though I would have to go elsewhere. That, combined with the extra resort fee for coffee (that I don't drink) and local calls ( I make with my cell phone -- why not just add it to the room rate if it's mandatory even if you don't use any of the resort features?!), the charge for wireless internet even when you are already paying a resort fee, and some folks' reviews that said the rooms had bed bugs and cigarette burns made me cancel. There has to be a decent hotel where they don't work you over and treat you like an idiot.

Reviews.Title: “An exciting and enjoyable atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: 71kenolady
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at numberous hotel/casinos in Las Vegas for many years. When the Startdust was closed, our Executive Hostess was transferred to The Orleans. Initially, my spouse and I did not think that we would like it because of the location. Boy were we wrong! The Orleans is one of the best hotel/casinos we have stayed at. It is very large with a lot of games to play. The food is excellent and the staff are there when you need assistance. I would recommend staying at The Orleans any time that you go to Las Vegas. It is not far from anywhere that you would want to see/visit. Getting there is easy access up Tropicana Ave. If I have family that want to meet in Las Vegas, all of us would definitely stay at The Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed every minute of our stay at "The Orleans".”
Reviews.Author: Geneho
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were welcomed by the parking attendant. When we checked in the clerk was gracious and professional. The room was clean and cool... The food at the buffett was great. The slot attendants were very kind and gracious.. The ENTIRE experience was very positive and worth a return trip!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The most congenial place in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: PagosaSpringsDave
Reviews.Content: What else can I say? The entire staff at the Orleans is superb, from the front desk, dining, security, to the tables. The Orleans is my home away from home. Large enough to feel spacious, but small enough you can get to know the people there. The rooms have always been clean and well maintained. Will I be back? Without a doubt. D. Dehtan

Reviews.Title: “I was relaxed and having fun at the Orleans Hotel Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Rainy927
Reviews.Content: Anytime I want to relax and have some fun, I always think about the Orleans Hotel. It is close to my home and if I want to drink while I enjoy, I am able to enjoy staying there so that I don't have to drink and drive. I occassionally go just to enjoy a meal too. The food and service is well worth the visit! Thank you Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for and a little more”
Reviews.Author: doggiedaddie
Reviews.Content: My overall stay at The Orleans was pleasant. The room looked just like the virtual tour expcept for the dirty carpet! Large stains one 10 inches across and a 2 inch cigarette burn. The sliding bathroom door located in the sitting area where people can hear you go. There is no closet. All of your clothes hang in the bathroom, with the bathroom spray and humidity from the shower. The bath room has a little window that opens and lets light in at night wich is kind of cool. By the way the bathroom door opens kind of loud so if your spouse, or partner is a light sleeper they wake right up. Otherwise there are plenty of places to eat, the liquor store prices are even better that many stores on the outside! The people are pleasant the price was $23.00 a night you can't beat that. Great 24 hr. room service and a great free live band.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: shovel_kzoo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times, I love the size of their average rooms, they are conveinent to the rest of Vegas wether you use their shuttle or the local bus system. This trip was different, met my daughter here who isn't to familiar with Vegas, then on my second day I collasped in their buffet, as my daughter got in the ambulance their security gave her their card and told her to call when she needed a ride. They shuttled her back and forth and brought me back also (it was a problem I had before but now I know what's causing it) We had to cancell our flights and extend our stay, no problem The Orleans took care of it, no charge. My daughter told the driver she was glad this didn't happen on the strip he said no problem just call us you're our guest. I have always liked Boyd Casinos (I have one 90 miles from me in Indiana) their people have always been nice. I will be back and I will stay at The Orleans, I'm booked at their Indiana property for Labor Day!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, Cheap Price”
Reviews.Author: smlovejoy7180
Reviews.Content: I was told to stay here by my parents and by reading other reviews online. The rooms are definately cheap and nice for the amount that you pay to stay. There are lots of things to do at the hotel itself since they have several places to eat, a movie theater, and a bowling alley. However, if you have never been to Vegas, you may want to find a room on the strip to stay at. There is a free shuttle to take from 9 am to 12:30 am however, I found myself out past 12:30 am wondering how I would get back to my room at the Orleans. Overall, a nice place cool to stay at just plan your night out well to make sure you can take advantage of the free shuttle!

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST CASINO IN VEGAS!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Leticiagh
Reviews.Content: Best family oriented casino in Vegas !!!! A lot to do for everybody in your family from adults to toddlers. The food court is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun and Comfort at the Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: joy084
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Orleans many times over the past few years and I've never been disappointed. The employees are friendly, helpful people. I like that the security guards check for room keys before allowing anyone to ride the elevator. Free coffee in the room daily and lately, no resort fees. The hotel offers all gaming and amenities, such as a spa, which is nice, a good choice of restaurants and entertainment. It's a comfortable stay at reasonable rates. It's also not too noisy. Free shuttle is available for easy access to the strip and the Gold Coast.

Reviews.Title: “we will be back soon”
Reviews.Author: lmrp
Reviews.Content: Booking the room was simple . Early check in was no problem. The room was clean ,ac was simple, pool was conveniently located , plenty of space with a very friendly staff. I wish I would've booked that room for 2 nights instead of 1. Food was great lots of choices. Great activities for kids. It was a great stay and I do plan on staying there more often

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: musiclovingmom
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Orleans. We paid only $29.00 per night plus the $5 resort fee. A great value. The rooms are quite large, with a love seat and a desk area, and include in-room coffee, a free safe, and generous toiletries. The halls were very quiet, and I never felt as if I was disturbed by noise while in my room. The pool area is conveniently and privately located, not like at the strip hotels I have stayed at, where you have to walk past casino or shopping areas to get to the pool. Our room was always cleaned in a timely manner. The shuttle service worked out quite well for us also. We did take a cab a few times. It is about a $10 cab fare from the strip. I would not hesitate to stay here again. In fact, I would love to turn around and head back right now.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: redfreakUA
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at the Orleans and I can stay I'll likely come back. The price can't be beat and the free shuttle to the strip gives you easy access to all the excitement but a more laid back place to relax. The pool area is spacious with plenty of lounge chairs and I thought it was a great place to lay back and read my book. The hotel has many amenities with a bowling alley, movie theater, small video arcade, and kids club. The rooms are spacious and clean. I would recommend this to any of my friends trying to do Vegas on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Ahh...the pool, the view, the location!”
Reviews.Author: crileyteach
Reviews.Content: I love staying here! I have stayed here at least 6 times. Now that they have updated the rooms in the tower, its just as luxurious as some of the 5 star hotels. The beds are all new, pillow top mattress, wonderful view of the city, large room, nice TVs. If you get an older "garden view" room they are not updated, but nice if you like to be close to the pool & gaming area. Nice tropical theme. Good customer service & you can not beat the location if you want to be on the "strip." We love that it is not a "kiddie" themed casino & do not see a bunch of kids running around! That is the LAST thing you want to see when vacationing in LV. (sorry to you parents who DO take your kids..I have 3 of my own children & 2 grandchildren I LOVE children! LV is just the last place in the world I would ever take them!!! The smoke & sex is oozing in all casinos)

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans is laid back Vegas”
Reviews.Author: teacher1278
Reviews.Content: Of all the properties I've stayed at in Las Vegas, The Orleans is my favorite. The rooms are large and clean. If your tired of the hustle and bustle of the strip, and the expense, The Orleans has a very laid back feel. It's pool is great and they have some excellent restaurants. And if you're a gambler, their casino is excellent with a variety of wage levels. A great place for a family.

Reviews.Title: “You get the biggest bang for the bucks at the Orleans Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: Oahugirl79
Reviews.Content: The best hotel and casino to stay and play! Excellent service from the valet to the housekeeping staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel ,nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Moodi_Ali
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is one of the good hotels to stay in when you are in Vegas with tight budget ,the hotel is big and has many restaurants and other facilities. price for value is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Celebrated a fun 40th Wedding Aniversary at a great hotel/casino with excellent aminities and a wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: celtgold
Reviews.Content: This was acutually our third stay at the Orleans, but this time it was extra special for us as we were celebrating our 40th Wedding Anniversary. Our rooms have always been clean and comfortable, maintained by an excellent housekeeping service. From the Reservationist, to the Bell Service, to the Casino Workers, to the Security Officers, and all those in between, the staff was great and always friendly. We only ate at four of the on site resturants ( I beleive there are about 10) and the service and quality of the food was fantastic. The Orleans has a theater, a cinema multi-plex ( all movies were new releases and we saw two while we were there), a bowling alley, a large arcade, and a Hocky Ice Rink. The casino had a variety of betting games (our favorite are the slot machines) and we had pretty good amount of game play for our money. Whether you stay at The Oreans or just visit you should sign up for the B Connected Club Program, I think they have one of the best comp programs going (we have received free rooms, meals, game play, and a number of discounts). We have recommeded The Orleans to our friends and family. We look forward to our next stay at The Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “always a good time”
Reviews.Author: jhw317
Reviews.Content: We used to go to Barbary Coast because they had Paigow and it wasn't very big so we could find each other. When Boyd sold the Barbary, we started going to the Orleans. The food is good. We usually go to the Courtyard Cafe and Don Miguels but once in a while we go to the buffet, which is better than most. We play Paigow, Blackjack, Video Poker and Omaha in the poker room. We really have a good time. We used to take a day or two and go down the strip. But because the Orleans has everything we want, we now just stay there to gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for families”
Reviews.Author: marathonman262
Reviews.Content: we stayed here with my 8 and 11 y.o., two different times in july and august. i was looking for kid-friendly hotel. so after reading good reviews, we deceided to stay here.there were so many people with kids, i didn't feel bad bringing kids which i was worried about. the hotel has bowling alley, movie theater and even play area where you can drop off your kids so you can go gamble :) for a fee until 11pm or so. only thing i didn't like about this place was it was far from the strip. the air's not too bad like someone mentioned. it's really a nice place, i would stay here again.. let me add, they have a great poker room, rake was only $3 max.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Forwarder
Reviews.Content: It's won't be competing with the new Cosmopolitan, but then you aren't going to be paying the same price either. It has everything you need, Casino, Pool, a good selection of Restaurants, Bars, and important to me, clean, quite, spacious rooms. This was my first time to stay at The Orleans, I stayed here only one night as I was in Las Vegas on business. It is Off the Strip but that was what I wanted as my meeting were also off the Strip and close by. The Internet connection in the room was fast (but not free). The Casino is smokier then the Strip Casinos, and the gambling crowd averaged a little older. Restaurant prices were very reasonable, half of what you would pay at a hotel on the Strip. I will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “An alright stay.”
Reviews.Author: Travellersato
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Is pretty far from the main strip about a 7 min drive. Service was really bad, they tried to charge us for a movie we never saw. The casino isn't very nice. But was a very cheep hotel to stay. We paid $35 a night. Very spacious rooms. Pretty nice view. But I mostly likely wouldn't go back even for $35 because it isn't walking distance from the main strip, an the service is pretty bad, and the casino is pretty sad.

Reviews.Title: “Big thumbs down on The Orleans Hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: WilsonFamilyTucson
Reviews.Content: We went by the reviews on here in deciding to stay at the Orleans and were pumped to get to the hotel. Cons: 1) Terrible air quality inside the casino and eating areas. Our youngest had almost immediate allergy symptoms once inside the lobby. 2) Severely dated rooms with worn carpet and run down bath area. 3) Loud air conditioning. 4) The hotel was the major lowlight of our stay in Vegas. Pros: 1) Cheap but it isn't worth the experience. 2) Somewhat kid friendly. 3) Decent selection of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ATourist6
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in Las Vegas! The overall value for the money can not be beaten anywhere in Las Vegas. The room was comfortable, sparkly clean and well organized. Guest service from staff is first rate. For me, it is always a big advantage to have so many reasonably priced dining choices on site, plus I like having the movie theater on site. Lots of locals come to gamble here and there isn't such a frantic tourist feel to the place. Shuttle is convenient for those of us who don't want to spend all our vacation $$ on taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family”
Reviews.Author: C0usinEddie
Reviews.Content: I took my Mom who is 76 and she loved The Orleans. Its a great, safe feeling place where they make you feel at home. This was my 5th stay here and i have never had a problem or a concern. It's nice to have a full liquor store right in the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain hotel spends where it matters”
Reviews.Author: MystiAnne
Reviews.Content: I was actually afraid to stay here -- the weekday prices were so low, I expected trouble. However, this hotel was great value for the money. Pros: Competent, friendly staff from checkin through dining rooms to maids. Low price let me upgrade to HUGE room for regular room price. Very safe -- clientele included a lot of families and retirees. Slightly off the strip, so no loud nightclub noise, but close enough to get there quickly. Lots of bargain offers--$10 off my food every day. Resort fee of $5 covers what most folks charge $20+ for--good gym. Cons: View of the DejaVu strip club from my side of the hotel, rest of neighborhood somewhat rundown. Smell of cigarette smoke pervasive everywhere but 2nd floor (conference rooms). When I upgraded they forgot to put me on a non-smoking floor. Extra charge for internet was too expensive ($12 or so dollars a day?) Never did get my promised $5 of free slot play, tried once to find out what happened, then gave up.

Reviews.Title: “very great casino for everyone very friendly great food”
Reviews.Author: joshjr1
Reviews.Content: very nice sportsbook and racetrack and the best is a very nice pokerroom very well ran

Reviews.Title: “Worth more than you pay for!!”
Reviews.Author: localdudeCO
Reviews.Content: The Orleans was the host hotel for our family reunion this year, the first reunion ever and it could not have been in a better place. At $33 a night, you might think the worst, but it was way worth it and more! The furnishings in the room were a little dated, but who goes to Vegas to stay in their room?? The room was very spacious and very clean. The pool was BEAUTIFUL!! And it wasn't too far from the strip. We have a large family and we don't like to spend more than we need to. If you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel but want to stay in a shady motel, the Orleans hotel is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: canadagrl77
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay so we could catch a very early flight. We weren't there to gamble, but just to sleep for a night. The staff was friendly, the room was comfortable, clean and quiet, and for $35/night, we couldn't beat the price. The French Market buffet in the hotel was extremely good and reasonable for $16/pp, and we enjoyed a couple of games in the bowling alley as well. The only disappointment was that the Wifi service was $12 per day - no thank you! It was a budget hotel perfect for our needs and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “You will love the Orleans after your first visit”
Reviews.Author: HusbandO
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Orleans a few times, and it is always pleasant. We are planning a family gathering at the end of july and we're staying at the ORLEANS.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay everyo ne was very nice”
Reviews.Author: wilma102
Reviews.Content: Nothing every thing was very nice, the people were nice the hote l was very clean the rooms were very clean and nice.I will stay stay here again , I also enjoed going to the movie and on my next visit I would like go bowling.

Reviews.Title: “More Than An Inexpensive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BBALLAGENT
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my stay at the "Orleans". This was my second visit to this hotel, my first being around the same time last year. I must say that this property is VERY NICE. Service is very good, and the hotel its self is a great "DEAL" for the money. The room was very comfy and spacious. I first heard of this hotel last year, and seeing all the reviews that were posted here on tripadvisor i decided to give it a try and its was exactly what the reviews say...BIG rooms, spacious, clean, and friendly. My family was even impressed with this property, you do not have to be on the strip to have a NICE hotel/room. Thanks to all the travelers that wrote helpful reviews for other travels like myself who took your opinions, and reviews and gave this hotel a "SHOT" it was well worth it. The food court is conveinent and food was always HOT. Ate at Kojio and the food was excellent, must go-back to try BIG AL'S oyster bar got a great recommention from a hotel guest who had just eaten there, but i arrived 10mins after they had closed. Also a must is the Prime Rib Loft.

Reviews.Title: “Great value...Great Hotel....Great Service”
Reviews.Author: yramoz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are extremely busy the first part of the summer volunteering with our local Little League Baseball and coaching our 4 children. We needed a mini vacation to get away from it all. The Orleans was so refreshing and the friendly service was much appreciated.
