When checking in, I signed up for the members card and received discount coupons for restaurants, drinks, and so much more! They definitely came in handy for us as we were on a budget. Rooms were clean and beds were comfy. We loved the pool and relaxed there for about a half a day! Caught a movie at the theatre in the hotel and was impresed with the reasonable prices on drinks and food thruought the entire hotel! Only gambled at the Orleans, didn't win big, but didn't lose anything either. Will definately go back and stay here not only for the great room rates but for everything they offer. I would recommend this hotel to everyone visiting Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Something for Just About Everyone”
Reviews.Author: Shotlady
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Orleans. Attentive, friendly and timely service from the time I drove up to valet parking through the check in process and arrival into my room with my luggage arriving within minutes of placing my call to the bell desk. Room was just fine and quite spacious. Ask for a stripview on a high floor. Very beautiful at night. Comes with a small coffee maker and in room safe for valuables. Great casino. Many restaurants with options galore. Pool area was not too bad. Loungers available even later in the morning unlike many popular strip hotels. Many families stay here so there are a good number of kids at the pool. Lots of non gaming activities available at this property. Would not hestitate to return again and recommend to those seeking a moderate priced hotel/casino property.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Happy-Travelers1
Reviews.Content: We had a car so we did not need to stay on the strip. I found this hotel on Trip Advisors and saw that it was well rated. Gave it a chance and it was the best choice for us. My husband loves to play poker and they had the largest poker room I had ever seen in any Hotel in Vegas. The rooms were great, good furnitures, bedding, bathrooms. We came for a convention at the Sands Expo but at night we ate at the buffet which was good and not expensive. Great oysters at the seafood restaurant separate from the buffet. They have a movie complex if you do not want to play in the Casino and a bowling alley too. No long lines a check-in, I loved that. We plan on staying again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Value, comfort, safety, and the friendliest staff in Las Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: DebVentura
Reviews.Content: From making reservations to the friendly greeting at the check-in desk, to the world-class smiles of Mr. Charles at the shoe-care station (a trip to the Orleans is worth it just for his smile!), to walking into a clean, well-maintained room....well, you just know your stay at the Orleans is going to be special. And it IS special. A wide range of choices for meals - all very reasonably priced. The Spa where you're never hurried and relaxing is encouraged, especially after being so well pampered by a skillfully rendered massage. If one wishes to travel over to the Strip, it's just a short hop by cab or the free shuttle provided by the Orleans. Getting to and from the airport is a breeze (none of that Strip traffic thank goodness!). Oh yes, the gaming! With a wide choice of your favorites (Sports Book, slots, card games), why would you want to go anywhere else? And there's always a tournament going on somewhere in the casino....And no matter how serious the players appear to be, there's always the sound of laughter and people having a good time...but of course, it IS called "playing", it's supposed to be fun! On a more serious note, as a woman who often travels alone to Las Vegas, and who has stayed at other LV hotels (in the past), I highly recommend the Orleans for it's attention to the safety and security of its guests. Overall, if you're looking for value and comfort at a reasonable price, the Orleans is the place to go in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “All inclusive and caters to families”
Reviews.Author: shiptrip
Reviews.Content: This was a second hotel jump in our 5 night trip. I had stayed here before and been here several times before and we had 2 of 3 nights comped so it was a no-brainer. The hotel was as I remembered it but the floors in the rooms were dirty/stained and could use an update. These rooms look almost the same as the rooms at Bill's Gambling Hall and must have been built by the same builder. Bathrooms are almost identical all the way down to the stained glass opening window above the bathtub. The room has a standard TV and could use a flatscreen. There is a safe bolted to a board in the bathroom.The closet area is also in the bathroom. Our beds were very clean and comfortable. We stayed on the 13th floor, (something you often will not find in a casino hotel), but since we aren't superstitious, it didn't bother us. WE were asked if floor thirteen would be okay and we said sure. Our first night there, we left to see O over at Bellagio and it was great. The next night, we decided to partake of their movie theatre and went to see a late show and get away from the casino for a while. That casino can get smokey at times and my eyes paid the price for it. I had to see an opthamologist the Monday after we returned as my glands in one eye had swollen into a painful lump. That is what 5 nights in the desert and smoke can do. I suppose it is allergies, bacteria, smoke, lack of humidity which I am used to and other things. My eyes never take Vegas well, though I do love it. If you play video poker, there are tons of machines in varying games and denominations for you to play here. The table games were mostly full all the time. Drink service was fairly consistent though once a girl took my order and never returned. I gave up on her after 45 minutes and a new waitress had taken her place. They have plenty of eating venues so that you won't have to leave unless you just want to. One thing that aggravated me is that while waiting in the French Market Buffet, there were two people ahead of us and the line was about 15 minutes wait. Well 2 people came up to the ones in front of us and jumped the line, then 3 more, then 2 more then baby stollers and moms and more! I started to get mad. Folks should go to the end of the line rather than take a dozen people cutting just because you saw someone you knew in line. Bad form and bad manners. Folks go to the end! It is rude to the 40 of us you are cutting in front of! This casino seems to cater to middle america and lots of working class folks and locals. I saw a number of "gansta looking guys" walking the floor with the arm swinging behind the back and the one leg saunter and the face that looked like they were one sneeze away from plugging some people. I guess what I am saying is that there were even a few seedy looking folks there. It did not bother me, but was just an observation. You don't see as much of that in the hotels like Wynn or Bellagio. The clientele is different here especially on the weekends compared to the expensive strip hotels. Nevertheless, if they send me comps, I will continue to come. Just wish they had a way to filter the smoke a little better.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: icon5
Reviews.Content: The orleans is a nice hotel -nothing glamorous but very decent. The room are nice and quiet (very roomy) with all the amenaties needed included a coffee maker. The only down side is that you dont feel like you are in vegas because you are not on the strip. Restaurants are good - not much more you could ask for. Gaming is very good as the slots and tables are generous. Drinks are also the cheapest you will find anywhere- $1.25 for a bud is hard to beat! If you want to gamble and drink this is the place - if you want the glamous try The Venetian with the price to go with it. Been to Vegas about 15 times and if gambling is your game this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Cracking hotel I would recommend to everybody”
Reviews.Author: mijan
Reviews.Content: With this being our fifth return visit to the Orleans I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else. The rooms are a great size and very comfortable. The breakfast buffet is to die for.....its delicious. The staff are first class be they cleaners or casino or registration operatives. The pool area is large and there are always sunbeds availabe. The hotel is so comfortable it feels like home.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: sararoberts86
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Orleans in January 2009 - Fantastic value for money we paid around $100 in total for 4 nights stay. Although it is not on the strip it is not a problem as there is a regular shuttle bus service (free) which makes it well worth the money you save from not staying on the strip. Casino was fine, swimming pool and outdoor are not open as it was out of season. The rooms were lovely and the bed was enormous - the only complaint we had was there was a problem with sewage from the room next door coming up through our sink leavign an awful smell in the room. We complained about this and an engineer came up to fix the problem, however the same hting happened the next day. We would have then asked for a change of room however we were leaving that day. All in all very good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Will not be going back”
Reviews.Author: mcmillankris
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for two nights along with another couple and were very disappointed with the hotel. Having recently stayed at a sister hotel and being very happy, I thought that this hotel would be just as nice. Our rooms were horrible. The beds were uncomfortably hard, the carpet felt icky, the couch inside the room looked like it had never seen a cleaning and was probably dated back to the early 90s. The bathtub was actually the worst and was just old. Our rooms needed a good remodeling. We definitely won't be going back there which is too bad because we do like to gamble there.

Reviews.Title: “Family loved the pool and kids place, could have done without smoky casino”
Reviews.Author: BluegrassJayhawk
Reviews.Content: We met family from the other side of the country at the Orleans when we were there on our way to the Grand Canyon. We loved the pool. There is a big main pool, a small kids pool, and a big hot tub. There is also a kids arcade and a kids play area (supervised, pay by the hour). If you are sensitive to smoke, you are probably best to avoid all casino hotels, you will usually have to walk through the casino, where smoking is inevitably allowed, to get to the elevators for your rooms. The Orleans was no different. There are "non smoking" areas of the casino, but you still can smell the smoke, since it is all one open space. But the Orleans is a good price, and off the Strip, so you don't have to deal with all the madness, but there is a free shuttle whenever you want to go over and be park of the hubub.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Quality”
Reviews.Author: RetiredTravelerToo
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I stayed at the Orleans for four days this month to celebrate my birthday. Our suite type hotel room was roomy and clean. We loved having all the amenities: movie theatre, bowling alley, showroom and stadium within the hotel. The complimentary shuttle to the strip was an added convenience and it was quick and efficient. It drops off and picks up at Bill's Gamling Hall in the middle of the strip. It was a short walk to the Palazzo to see the New Jersey Boys Show, which was absolutely marvelous. Our dinner at the Prime Rib Loft restaurant on the Orleans premises was excellent. The French Market Buffet is okay, typical buffet type food and affordable. The line at the buffet can be long, but it moves quickly. Resist the temptation to go to the other cafe because of its shorter line. (The food is terrible.) The pool area is small, but very pleasant. I had a massage at the spa and was very pleased with it as well. We enjoyed the Orleans Hotel very much and will go back again. The only down side to our stay was that we didn't win much on the slots, neither did anyone else that we talked to; we had much better luck at the Venetian. The comedy acts in the Orleans Showroom, Tom Papa and Bill Burr were a riot.

Reviews.Title: “Remember the Stardust, then you'll enjoy the Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: RoyalFlush2010
Reviews.Content: When the Stardust closed I needed to find another hotel and casino that made you feel like you were in Vegas. A place that had the ammenities, the variety, the friendly atmosphere and everything else you could want at a reasonable price. That is the Orleans! So what if it is not right on the strip, who cares. If they don't have what you are looking for they have a shuttle to take you to the crowded strip where panhandlers force themselves upon you, non-english speaking people force pornography into your hands as you walk down the strip. You don't have that here! I have always been greeted by friendly people no matter what part of the casino or hotel I am using. The hotel staff, the cocktail waitress, the restaurants, everywhere you feel welcome. The rewards program is great too. You don't have to be a high roller to be recognized as a special guest. Everyone can earn rewards and comps for their gambling. I have found a home when I am in Vegas and I will continue to come back time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “the Orleans is the best value in las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Pharaohbet
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is by far the best value in Vegas. The rooms are mini-suites with a couch, comfortable barrel chair and a coffee table, in addition to a desk with internet access and a coffee pot. the bathroom is big enough for suitcases and dressing area. the restaurants here are top notch! The Prime Rib Loft is our favorite restuarant in Vegas. The Buffet and TGI Fridays, and Fuddruckers!! What more could you ask for!!

Reviews.Title: “TOO MANY KIDS”
Reviews.Author: BJCM
Reviews.Content: We were VERY DISAPPOINTED with The Orleans. Casino had too many kids running around and we couldn't enjoy ourselves, because of it!! WE WON'T GO TO THE ORLEANS AGAIN AND FOR SURE WON'T RECOMMEND IT TO OUR FRIENDS. The Hotel and Casino should be an enjoyment for adults, NOT KIDS :(

Reviews.Title: “Good Value! Too many kids though...”
Reviews.Author: mushroom79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans for 3 nights in June. Our stay was paid for by my husband's company, so I can't really comment on the price, but our friend did stay Friday night for only $39 or so...can't beat that. We come to Vegas twice a year or so, and alternate staying on strip vs. off strip. Staying off strip is great...cheaper limits, cheaper drinks, food etc....but it also means more kids! I mean, it's ridiculous really, the amount of people who take children to an adult playground. It wasn't just here either, we noticed it everywhere on the strip too. I mean, people are stumbling around wasted at 2 am, and there is a 3 year old in line with his father at the ATM. But anyway.... Hotel: Very clean and modest overall. Check-in was quick and the casino level is easy to navigate. Rooms were clean. You can tell they have tried to give the rooms modern updates (granite countertops, nice beds!), but it also had a dated feel (bathtub, TV, carpet). Bed was super comfy and the halls were quiet. Casino: Low limits. Had trouble finding a lot of double deck blackjack though, as I don't like to play single. Tables always seems crowded too and my husband complained about a dealer at one point, but he may have just been in a bad mood b/c he's just lost hehe. Overall, friendly bartenders and drink service was good. Played most of my blackjack at Carnival Court...that's where it's at. Restaurants/Food: Worst part of my stay. Granted, I did not eat at the nicer ones (Prime Rib Loft, the steakhouse), but we did eat at the Courtyard Cafe, the food court and Big Al's Oyster Bar. The breakfast in Courtyard was the best meal I had here, very good. However, I made the mistake of grabbing Sbarro's on the go...gross! Big Al's was the worst though. First we ordered a po boy, but they were out of the fish we wanted, so they gave us shrimp. It tasted freezer burnt and the bread was stale and generic. I took one bite and spit it out. Nightlife: Non-existent. The Irish Pub had some entertainment...cheesy dueling guitar players. OK for the first night since we were tired from a 5 hr flight, went to the strip the rest of the time. Pool: Excellent! Again, except for the millions of children, not bad! The cabanas are only $50 Sun-Thurs, and $75 Fri-Sat. so we had one on one day. No pool service though which struck me as odd. Even most off strips have servers that come around, esp. at the cabanas, but it was no big deal...bar was nearby. Never had a problem finding a chair either. Spa/Fitness: Not bad. Spa was average but clean. Cheap too. We prefer to indulge a time or two and spend the $40 facility fee at Caeser's or Canyon Ranch though. Overall, The Orleans is not a bad off strip hotel to stay. Great prices, clean rooms, free shuttle (although we took cabs), and friendly service. Just be prepared to deal with lots of families and crappy food selection.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: minipin420
Reviews.Content: Stayed last week for 6 days, large clean rooms, nice swimming pool, lots of different places to eat. Very nice place for a family vacation, lots of things for kids of all ages. My 12&13 year old had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: bunnie43
Reviews.Content: We have made the Orleans our home away from home for a few years now. The price couldn't be better, the rooms are large, and the shuttle takes you to the strip for a visit, but we always do our gambling back at the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: jmullins762
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd or 4th time staying at the Orleans! I always appreciate staying here. In fact I have only stayed in one other hotel in Vegas, and that would could not compare to the Orleans. The staff that I interacted with were all friendly, they went out of their way to take care of the several requests I had for additional items in my room. The check-in was efficient and fast, as well as check out. The rooms are well appointed and I recommend a room with the window facing west, since if you are in the room at sunset, the view of the sun setting over the mountains is fantastic! I have a friend that lives in Las Vegas/Henderson and so I actually am one of the few people that does not come to Las Vegas to gamble. The casino floor was always busy however and is well laid out. I enjoy the Seattle's Best Coffee store in the lobby (near the valet entrance on the east, next to the bell stand). In addition to great coffee drinks, the have a variety of baked goods, and in the seating area, you can access the internet wirelessly. It is a great place to connect online if you do not want to pay the $12.99 for 24 hours of access in your room. The rooms are quiet, and I would recommend an upper floor room. The French Market Buffet is reasonably priced andt their is a wide variety of other restaurant choices. I would advise signing up online to receive their special promotions newsletter. I received a rate of $26.99 a night plus $10 food credit per day $5 in slot play (which I didn't use). Online room rates are usually around $35 a night (with a deposit of one nights stay) and have a 72-hour cancellation policy unlike many places who require advance payment of the entire amount, which is non-refundable if you need to cancel.. This makes for another plus for the Orleans. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice off strip Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler16340
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Orleans and any casino off the strip. We were satisfied with our accommodations although the air conditioning unit seemed to cycle off & on all night. The restaurants were very good in both quality and service. Our only real complaint was the lack of cocktail servers on the gaming floor. The bed in our room was surprising comfortable although we didn't log to many hours on it. We had a good time at the Orleans and I would recommend it to any traveler looking for a break from the madness of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: aussiereviewer2010
Reviews.Content: stayed 4 nights in june 2010. great value hotel off the strip - made for quiet evenings. Free shuttle bus will take you to the strip every half hour or so. The buffet restaurant was good value and there are regular poker games in the casino. Very comfy bed and well-appointed room. Resented having to pay $13 for internet per day though.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel mostly..”
Reviews.Author: redblueyes
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Orleans so I hesitate to write anything negative but I did have one issue I will get to shortly. First of all the room is large and clean and the beds were very comfy. The bathroom was large and had a nice tall shower with good water pressure and decent counter space. The casino had almost all of the slots I had wanted to try and things were nicely laid out (not too hard to get around). I didn't do the buffets or restaurants, just a slice at Sbarro my first night checking in. The cocktail waitresses were mostly available when my glass was empty (had to wait too long once) but overall nice service. The only complaint I had was with sink water. I doubt this is normal (I did a ton a research beforehand and did not see this mentioned) but for my experience the water just plain stunk. Bad. Made it hard to brush your teeth and wash your face. The first night (3 am) I lost sink water all together but it was back on by morning, but it still smelled unfortunately. Had I been staying longer I would have complained for a new room but this was a short trip of 2 nights. I would still recommend the hotel because I am sure this is not normal, something was obviously wrong. I would stay here again, and I am comfortable recommending the hotel. You will have a great time at Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel with many activities”
Reviews.Author: bashfulguy21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and had so many things to help families with kids from daycare, to movie theaters, to even bowling. Awesome hotel and can not wait to return in 4th of July weekend.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value, huge rooms, clean, comfy beds, free shuttle to strip”
Reviews.Author: SubwayRider82
Reviews.Content: great comfy place to stay if you want to save money while visiting las vegas and don't have accommodation already included in your travel package. this is not on the strip, but they have a convenient free shuttle that runs every half hour or so that drops you off very centrally on the strip (bills gambling hall). the rooms at the Orleans are very clean and HUGE!! they have granite washroom counters and nice showers/tubs. Good comfy beds. I had flown into Las Vegas as my starting point to a week long grand canyon road trip. I stayed my first night and my last night of my trip at this hotel. On my last night, they were out of regular hotel rooms so they upgraded me to a 1BR suite for free. They have several restaurants including a cafe/family style restaurant that is open 24/7 offering graveyard specials from midnight to 6am. I had steak and eggs for $3.99! lots of penny slots that are loose enough for you to keep playing for several hours or let you win something, if you are not too greedy and know when to walk away. I liked the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “All you need”
Reviews.Author: vegasteve
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orleans hotel & casino from june 7 - 10 the second leg of a 7 day stay in which my first four days were at The Flamingo. I have stayed and written reviews for previous stays and I am compelled to write another review. I checked in at 9 am and was told the room would be available in 20 minutes and it was . I received a 20th floor queen room and it was spacious and comfortable as all the rooms seem to be at this hotel. Now I know the location is a negative for a lot of people but let me give you some friendly advice. The hotel provides a free shuttle service to and from the strip as well as the gold coast casino, the trip in total takes barely 5 minutes and the shuttle runs about every 20 minutes starting at 9 am till sometime around midnight. The prices of food and services on the strip have almost completely turned me off staying on the strip. The average buffet prices on the strip are 13.99 breakfast 15.99 lunch and 20.99 dinner compared to the Orleans 6.99 breakfast 7.99 lunch and 11.99 dinner and if you show your club coast card to the restaurant you recieve a dollar off their already amazing prices. They also have other restaurants such as fridays which has an all day happy hour and 1/2 price appetizers, 2 large draft and an order of wings cost me 12 dollars, amazing value. Big al's oyster bar has some amazing new orleans fare, I tried the gumbo and it was delicious and it was enough for 2 people. Now lets not forget the staff and dealers. Another big thing for me is friendly staff that help make my wins as well as my losses feeling like I enjoyed myself. In particular "THE CRAPS CREW" , Pit boss martin and dealers manuel , jon , joe , david and the others whose names I don't remember are top notch and made every second of my time on the table enjoyable and the low limits which start at five dollars help extend your gambling budget. I really can't say enough about this place, I was intrigued the first time I went there and and my expectations have been blown away by the service , value and overall enjoyment of this place . I am a platinum card holder at harrahs properties and I mean it when I say the only place i'll stay in vegas going forward is The Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “So much fun!”
Reviews.Author: azchica19
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our quick vacation to Vegas. We traveled with our two young children, 4 years and 5 months. We loved the hotel. The room was big enough for the queen beds, my daughters pack and play and still plenty of room to hang out and walk around. The casino was a blast and drinks we WAY cheaper than staying on the strip. We loved the food court for quick, cheap meals and snacks and the Prime Rib loft was GREAT! Amazing food and the manager sat us over looking the casino so my oldest could watch all the lights and people! Not only that, the dinner was cheap. Two meals (including the huge "Beefeater", an appetizer, and a bottle of wine) for 68 bucks! The pool was a hit with the kids and the kiddie pool was great because I could sit with the baby in the shade and still let my oldest go swimming. The staff and guest were incredibly nice and I hardly had to deal with the crazy 21 year olds with yard long drinks around their necks (Hey, I did it too at one point but with kids those same people I used to be were slightly annoying) Still close enough to the strip to take the kids sight seeing and do some eating and the shows at night. Also relativity close to the Fremont Street Experience. My only complaint is there was hardly any tv stations, but that was no big deal! We will diffidently be staying at The Orleans again. We had a ball and if you stay, try the Irish Pub across the street, McMillan's! It's great.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: MrsChanda08
Reviews.Content: Overall the stay was "just Ok". If you don't have a lot of money & would like to enjoy Vegas I would recommend this location. This hotel is NOT on the strip but has a bus that comes every 45mins. If the bus is full you have to wait for the next one. Again you get what you pay for. When you 1st walk in the lobby the smoke is over powering. The rooms are in desperate need of an upgrade. There is no closet-just a space in the bathroom to put your clothing. The fixtures-sink, toliet, bed,-other furniture is all old & needs an upgrade. There is no cable maybe 3 or 4 channels on the television & the pool closes at 7. Upside is all the restuarants were good & the food court is open 24hours.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: phyllisjax
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been going to Las Vegas once or twice a year for twenty years. Last October, we stayed at the Orleans for the first time and it was great!!! We stayed there again in May. The rooms are very clean and large and have a sitting area with a sofa, chair and coffee table. The beds are comfortable. We had a great view of the large pool area. The casino has lots and lots of slot machines and all the newest games. Lots of places to eat....just take your pick. One night we went to TGIF and had the steak and lobster for $13.99. The buffet was delicious....good selection of items and reasonable price. We don't like the hectic pace of the strip, and will always return to the Orleans when in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Just like Vegas USED to be!”
Reviews.Author: starchild101
Reviews.Content: This place is great, reminds us of when Vegas wasn't so over built, back when you can get a drink for under 5 bucks (AND actually get a drink if you are gambling) and get some great food at resonable prices. Rooms are very large and roomey WITH A COFFEE POT!! (many strip properties have removed coffee pots so everyone in the entire resort can stumble down to the coffee shop and wait in line for a cup of joe). Pool is very nice, without overbearingly loud music being blasted overhead, there is music but at a respectable level. Gambling is decent, staff was great, shuttle bus is quick to get you to and from the strip. Being off the strip is this place's biggest downfall, but the bus is quick, and if you cab it to New York, New York it is only 10 bucks. Night life had bands always playing and plenty of bars with respectable prices. Only suggestion we had was to have some wait stafff at the pool area (not a biggie). The strip has sadly becoming a monster, over built, charging riduculous amounts of cash for a drink, and at night on the strip you feel like you are entering a war zone with music blasting at maximum levels that is coming at you in every direction (don't get me wrong, I love loud music, just not everyone turning their volume up to 10 to the point where is all is just a blurred, distorted mess -o- music). Bottom line, you will not be disapointed if your looking for a little old school vegas (and I am not talking that old maybe 1995) where you can get a drink for playing, have good service, and gamble in a trendy casino. However if you crave blasting music from every which way at night, paying 10 bucks for a drink and obnoxious pool parties then you will probabally be dissapointed and want to stay elsewhere. Great place, can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “pure enjoyment”
Reviews.Author: slothound
Reviews.Content: dealers and other staff very friendly and most helpful-- beautiful and comfortable rooms-- best chowder in all of Vegas. only one suggestion -- you should consider the feasibility of a small satellite bingo facility on site connected with your other properties... you would then have it all...

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Las Vegas location”
Reviews.Author: carolwen
Reviews.Content: We always rent a car, so being off the Strip is a plus location. Parking is easy and ample and close to rooms and casino. Poker room is large and friendly. Other casino games are the same as all the others. Pool area is very nice and not over crowded. Exercise room is tops. Plenty of uncrowded outside area to take a morning walk. Intimate showroom with "Air Supply, Smothers Brothers" type performers. Wireless available in coffee shop, but sadly $13 per day in rooms. 10 minutes free in businesss area and they will get your boarding pass. If you want to stay in one hotel and not do much running around except for cabs, you might stay on the strip, but we like west of the Strip with access via Flamingo or Tropicana. Easy access to airport via Decatur and 215. We seldom stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “IT IS NOT LIKE NEW ORLEANS !”
Reviews.Author: Jim010
Reviews.Content: The Orleans has very little in common with New Orleans. However, it is a good Las Vegas area hotel. Real New Orleans style food is not there, and the Mardi Gras Bar never even heard of a mint julep ! However the service is generally frendly although somewhat slow. The food is good, but somewhat expensive. The hotel seems to have a lack of Las Vegas style live entertainment, and no music like in New Olreans. This faciality is totally centered around its main event- the Casino. We had a good time at the Orleans, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “For value and great time stay here now”
Reviews.Author: iloveartist
Reviews.Content: My wife and I love staying here because we were able to stay 4 nights comp simply by joining the Players Club and being on their mailing list. Two nites at the start of our trip at the end of May followed by two nites comp at the beginning of June on the end of our 9 nite stay in LV. Orleans also has a Senior Tuesday which is 2 for 1 lunch buffet and $4 movie for two before 4pm. you only have to be age 50 to be qualified. It would help to have a car because you are about mile and half away from the strip. Ask for the remodeled section of the hotel. The furnishings including the bedding are in better shape, first time I found out from the many trips before. My wife loved their pools, it's not a scene like on the strip with their club concepts to hang out. The Orleans is the mecca for the slow/low roller with plenty of penny slots to shake a stick at. They have a popular card room with the locals--didn't get a chance to play because they had a tournament. The only bad thing was their Courtyard Cafe. It made me sick when I ordered their steak and eggs one morning so I confined my dining to the buffet and Subway sandwiches instead. At the sportsbook, the dollar hot dog lady is there late in the afternoon till early evenings then she is gone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Large Rooms Good Food”
Reviews.Author: BettyK
Reviews.Content: We Stayed there for four days for what it would cost to stay ONE night in a hotel on Las Vegas strip. Our room was huge with two queen size beds, sofa coffee table side chair a desk and chair, full bath with tub and shower, a separate dressing area. The coffee shop and buffet were also reasonable and had speicals for different days and time of the day you could eat, like it if you are a night owl or early riser you can get four great selections for breakfast for 3.99 and you can't eat it all it was so much food!! True you need to rent a car to get around but Las Vegas is not a difficuilt place to drive as all the major streets run north south and EAST WEST. parking at all the hotels on the strip are easy to get to so to see or do any thing gamble sight see or go to a show on the stip is no problem, the drive is very short in distance no big deal to get there. also this hotel was extra CLEAN every where.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mduncan36
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Orleans because it was reputed to be the best deal. I found this to be pretty much the case during my visit. There was a line for check-in at arrival on a Sunday afternoon but it moved very quickly. The room was clean and very comfortable with a good bed. Had a late night meal at TGI Fridays in the hotel with no complaints. One member of our party complained that there was a lot of noise from the room next to his but I never had a problem. They surprise you with a five dollar "resort fee" at check in but the overall price was so low - forty bucks - and there's coffee in the room, that I didn't mind. That sort of thing happens all over Las Vegas so no point in making a big deal out of it. Staff everywhere was very courteous and helpful. The down side is that you are a couple miles off the strip but its a straight shot up Tropicana blvd. I don't gamble but the casino looked big enough to me and seemed to be full of folks having a good time. The weather was bad so there was nobody in the pool area but it was big and looked pretty nice. Overall it ain't the Mirage but for the price its a very good deal in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, but could use some freshening up”
Reviews.Author: BigSee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Orleans for 2 nights the weekend of May 21. We didn't mind that it was off The Strip at all -- it was nice to experience the glamour and insanity and then retreat to someplace somewhat quieter. We're in our 40's so it was nice getting away from the hedonistic bachelor/bachelorette party crowd. I don't think any casino in Vegas (or Vegas itself, frankly) can be considered "family friendly", but if you were clueless enough to take your kids there, The Orleans would be a pretty decent bet, especially since they have a bowling alley and a multiplex cinema on-site. Why anyone would take their children to Las Vegas is beyond me, but there were plenty of them there, let me tell you! The Orleans was very clean and had a very courteous staff. One kudos I have to give to Las Vegas in general is that the service industry is very in-tune with customer service. Everyone, everywhere is very helpful no matter how you are dressed. I didn't gamble a cent and I was still treated like a special person wherever I went. The Orleans pool was very nice -- low-key, but large and sheltered. I enjoyed it a great deal. The fitness center was small but very clean and nice. We at at the buffet and it was a good all-around meal at a great price -- not anything spectacular like what we experienced at The Wynn, but great value and nothing tasted bad. It's rather strangely laid-out though -- pancakes are next to crawdads which are next to tacos which are next to eggs benedict. Doesn't really matter I guess, but I had a laugh about what a jumble it was. Rooms were clean and the bed was very comfortable. Our room faced the Strip which was nice, but you also have a commanding view of the strip club next door. Water pressure in the bathrooms was excellent and hot water was almost instantaneous. Downsides? The door to the room opens directly into the sleeping area -- anyone walking by can see right onto your bed if you open the door. I prefer the bed to be set back and not viewable by the general public. As a result, you are also quite a bit closer to noisy people in the hall. Bring earplugs for people coming back late at night or little Billy running down the halls and screaming at his sister. The rooms were spacious, clean, well-maintained and comfortable, but at least on the 13th floor (yes, I was surprised to see that there are buildings that actually have a 13th floor -- I suppose in Vegas they don't want you to be lucky though) they needed upgrading. The furniture in blond oak, quite late 80's/early 90's, and they still have tube TV's. The bathroom was very spartan and the fixtures were a bit dated. I don't know, when I stayed at Luxor years ago they had granite everything and it made me feel like I was having an experience. The Orleans is like your grandmother's 1992 condo. I'd stay there again. I'd recommend people to go to Vegas Sun-Thurs -- you get a LOT more for your money that way.

Reviews.Title: “Nice change from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Cdot78
Reviews.Content: The Orleans offered a nice break from staying on the Strip. The hotel was very clean and the staff were very friendly. I felt safe going up to my room by myself with the security guards checking for room keys all day (not just a night like other hotels.) The casino had a great selection of slots and the cocktail waitresses were always around! Shuttle to the strip was very convenient and saved us money on cabs and we got to meet other people! Loved the selection of places to eat (must get a Fudruckers burger!) and would've taken in the bowling and movie theatre if our trip was longer. Would be a great place to stay if taking part in a concert or event at the hotel or the attached arena. Pool was clean and not too busy and very easy to get to from the room. Room was clean and fairly spacious. Beds were comfy enough and maid services was prompt. I missed being on the strip when it was later at night and shuttle stopped running and we had to pay for a cab to get back to the hotel but I did appreciate the quieter surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “We Love the Atmosphere of this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4wards
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week from May 5-12th. We have stayed here a few other times and this time was no different; we were again very pleased with our stay overall. We asked for and received a "mountain view" room on the 19th floor, so this room was not one of the rooms to undergo a remodel as far as flat screen t.v., etc. While our room was not ritzy it fits our taste. The only couple of minor things was that the t-paper tolder needed to be reattached to the wall better as one of the screws must have been stripped (we did not complain so I won't fault them for not fixing it), the other thing was that on the couple of nights where the wind was unrelenting it created a whistling type of noise which at times was very annoying when trying to sleep. We solved the problem on the 2nd night by putting a bath towel along the bottom of the door. But, all in all, the service was good, the room was nice, we love the casino atmosphere a lot, even though we don't go to vegas specifically to gamble; we like to use it as a base and go visit Mt. Charleston, Red Rock, Valley of Fire, etc. The housekeeping staff was very efficient. Most everyone employed by the hotel who we would pass in the halls would speak to us first with a smile. You can't beat the rate of around $28 a night with the Club Card. The addition of the Subway, Sbarro's, etc., came in quite handy for several meals. While we did not go to see a movie, they allowed my husband entry to buy us a bag of popcorn which we then took back to our room to sit and enjoy the sunset with, while sipping margaritas. I know this hotel would not fit everyone's need, but it certainly does ours. The distance from the strip doesn't ever bother us as we rent a car every time we go. It is less congested around this hotel because of it so we were able to take morning walks without having to drive to the strip everytime we wanted to.

Reviews.Title: “A Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jaba44
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights and really enjoyed this property. Great variety of restaurants all that we used we found very good. I really enjoyed the Louisiana gumbo at Al's Oyster Bar. Great staff at these facilities. Pool was comfortable and not too crowded. Played Blackjack and slots and had good drink service. Shuttle is a plus for those with no vehicle. Rooms were clean and very well kept. We have stayed at other Boyd properties in Las Vegas and found that their standards are high and practiced at all properties. Good entertainment at a variety of venues in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Met my cleanliness standard.”
Reviews.Author: Enjoy_LIfe_N_Travel
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at The Orleans. The room was nice, smoke-free, and clean. The pool was great also. Lovely atmosphere throughout the entire hotel & casino. The resort fee was also reasonable. $5.00 a day is really not bad considering what other places charge. Just be prepared to add it to your per-day room price. I also found the location to be good for me. It's not in the middle of the busy downtown area, but not too far outside either. I had a lovely view from the window in my room. I will be staying here again. The only thing I would improve upon is the in-room internet. There is a daily fee for this. Free wi-fi is available downstairs in the coffee-shop though.

Reviews.Title: “The most reasonable and customer friendly Casino in Las Vagas,Nevada.”
Reviews.Author: theoldrookie
Reviews.Content: The casino staff goes out of its way to make your stay as comfortable as they can beginning with very reasonable room rates. The rooms are very clean and inexpensive in comparison with other casinos. The Orleans seems to be out of the way from the strip but they do provid a schuttle service that runs every half hour to the strip and there sister casino the Gold Coast, the shuttle runs until 12:00 mid-night. The buffet is second to none in variety, service, and quality of food. There are incentives for the senior citizens on half priced meals on special days of the week. Entertainment is offered from stage shows to a swinning pool that has all you need to enjoy yourself. There is also an excerise room and Sauna available for guests. As i stated earlier this is the most reasonable and customer friendy Casino in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: dmac273
Reviews.Content: Every time we come to Vegas we stay at The Orleans. Our stays are a week at a time 2 to 3 times a year. We find the hotel very comfortable. It's like home away from home. There is a large selection of restaurants offering a great variety of great food. The rooms are large and clean. The Orleans is located west of the strip which is away from the noise of the strip. There is a shuttle that can take us down to the strip any time we feel the urge. If you are looking for a great place to stay with a variety of activities at a very reasonable rate, check out The Orleans you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Local Casino; Friendly, Relaxing and Very Good Choice of Food.”
Reviews.Author: regulargirl_10
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in LV at various hotels. I now prefer to stay at a "local" spot. The Orleans is just what I am looking for. Certainly big enough to compete with strip hotels; however, it offers so much more on a "personal" level. It is off the strip but provides easy access and has shuttle service to the strip. I would highly recommend it. Linda M. Leicester, MA

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: eocjim
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4/18-19. We had such a great time that we stayed an additional night. This was our first stay at the Orleans. The room was much larger than we expected and the sitting area was really nice. We used room service twice and they were guick and the orders were complete. Our room had an excellent view of the strip and was pretty at night. We will stay there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “One stop entertainment center!”
Reviews.Author: bikersings
Reviews.Content: We have been going to the Orleans for three years now, 2-3 times per year. We usually get comped rooms as we are members of the players club. What is great about the Orleans is that it has just about anything you need to have a great time and never leave the property: Movie theatres, Bowling, Archade, Gambling, Choices of restaurants plus Seattle's Best Coffee, Spa (wonderful massage!), and pool. the rooms are spacious, always clean and nicely decorated. the staff are always friendly and greet you as they pass. we have never had less than a good time at the Orleans....and sometimes we even win money!

Reviews.Title: “Good vacation”
Reviews.Author: valueking
Reviews.Content: When I have stayed here I have got reasonable room rates but I didn't like the hidden resort fees. The rooms have always been clean and I like the large room size. I like the buffet and think it is a good value. I didn't think the reservations desk people were all that friendly. It is a long walk from the parking area to your room. The resort is a ways from the strip and I actually liked that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value/ fun casino”
Reviews.Author: marieparn
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is a blue collar hotel, No real frills just alot of goings on! The Casino was clean and I found all of the staff to be extremely friendly! The restaurants were good, especially the buffet, we ate a great breakfast every morning for around $7.00. The rooms were very clean and the beds were very comfortable, the rooms were a little out dated but again very clean. I enjoyed staying off the strip, there was still alot to do at our hotel but we rented a car and drove to the strip (5mins tops) and spent time at those casinos during the day and returned to play at Orleans later at night.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay...”
Reviews.Author: sillythetourist
Reviews.Content: The hotel offered a clean room, decent sized, but i payed nearly $140 for one nights accommodation at the hotel, and it was completely not worth that price, the other night was much cheaper and more of a fair price to pay. The lady who checked us in was the most unfriendly hotel staff i have ever experienced, she was just generally rude, asked directions, and pointed lazily in the direction and walked away mid sentence, just made us feel as though you were another number to be quickly dealt with. The whole entrance to the hotel smelt pretty bad, poorly disguised cigarette smell, but every casino in vegas smelt like this, not good for allergy sufferers. This place is a bargain if your paying the weekday price, but the price payed for a weekend stay i found unjustified.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: budgie01
Reviews.Content: Rooms were spacious, clean and tidy. Only thing was the shower was partly blocked and by the end of the shower it was like a mini bath. For the price it was perfect. The shuttle was great too which we used many times. Sometimes we caught a cab back to the hotel which cost around $10 - $14 depending on where we were on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!! Will Be Back!!”
Reviews.Author: donna_5500
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights arriving on April 18th and it was great and unbelievably reasonable!! The rooms were clean, spacious and quiet. The beds were very comfortable and there is a safe in the room. The pool area was excellent, not too busy and there gym was pretty decent as well. We didn't do alot of gambling but what we did do was mostly in The Orleans; drinks seem to come frequently. Found that their Casino was spacious and not too crowded. You may be off the strip but their free Shuttle ran about every 20 minutes that took up to the strip and there was no problems. We went to see"Love" by Cirque Du Soleil, would r:ecommend but get tickets from Mirage other sites seem to be expensive and Mirage have some under $100.00 but those are limited, we paid 108.00. We went to the 9:30pm show and was able to get the free shuttle back to The Orleans no problem. Definately will stay at The Orleans again!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: lilytap
Reviews.Content: 3rd visit to Vegas. previously stayed at MGM but were recommended Orleans by couple who were on our last return flight. We were more than pleased with our first room. Yes!! (We were supposed to stay 10 nights but unfortunately were returning day after the great volcano and therefore ended up staying a further 6 nights so we were pretty Vegased out by the time we finally left!!!!) However, staff were very friendly when we returned to see if they had a room free and even though our second room wasn't as great as our first it was fine. We were pleased that rooms are very large and have everything you need. I had read that the safe was free standing but in both rooms they were bolted down. A security guard is by the lifts and at night you have to show a room key to go up in the lifts. Seemed far more security minded than MGM. The buffet was cheap but good. I couldn't fault it and it compared well to the MGM but cost half the price. Transport to the strip was easy on the shuttle and we never waited long. It runs till 12.30 but easy to get a bus back after this time. The bus stop is outside the hotel that also gets you down to the strip by MGM. A petrol station is on the corner for cheap cigarettes (Brits) and a bank of America is a short walk away. (Casino cashiers pointed this out to us, when stranded, so we could draw some cash on the old credit card). We loved the variety of slot machines and seemed to win more often than when in the larger strip casinos. People were very normal who were playing. No silly screaming that we always heard in the MGM! We never waited long for drinks. The players card gave us a dollar off per person at each meal. The points we collected were worth one dollar per 1000 points and this was taken off our room bill. They did charge $5 extra per night room charge but considering how cheap rooms are it wasn't a problem. My husband made use of the gym which he liked. you get 10 mins computer time free then $5 for each extra 15 mins. Great for keeping in touch. The pool area was adequate and not far from the lifts (unlike MGM where you have to walk for 10 mins to get there). We were more than happy with this hotel and obviously saved alot of money compared to staying in a strip hotel. If you are snobbish and like the glitz of the posh hotels then this place is not for you, but if you are normal,enjoy a comfy room, friendly staff and playing slots or at tables then the Orleans is perfect! P.S if the lovely couple read this then can I thank them for the kind offer of lending us £100 if we needed it. They had only met us on the shuttle bus but proved there are still some decent people in the world. I hope everyone who got stuck (however lovely Vegas is) managed to get home.

Reviews.Title: “My Las Vegas home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Andrea2354
Reviews.Content: This was my fifth visit to the Orleans. My group of friends and I first stayed here in 2002. We were first attracted by the low price, but the quality and service have kept us coming back. We all agreed this trip that walking through the door, upon arrival, was like coming home. We have always like the Courtyard at breakfast. It's a fine place to gather in the morning to plan the day. This trip, I also found Fuddrucker's to be a pleasant alternative. Their breakfast sandwich is incredible. The table area at The Mardi Gras Bar was our gathering place this year. We have also had many fine gatherings at Brendan's Irish Pub. A trip to the Orleans would not be complete without a visit to The Prime Rib Loft. Once again, this year, they did not disappoint. Located off the strip, The Orleans is a little more laid back but easily accessable to the glitz and glitter via the shuttle bus which runs every 30 minutes. I can't wait to go again!

Reviews.Title: “VLV 13”
Reviews.Author: FrankeDeath13
Reviews.Content: Pricey!!! for what it was could have been more affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive Staff and service”
Reviews.Author: MNJude
Reviews.Content: The Casino had a wonderful Atmosphere with Staff very attentive to our needs. would definately stay visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay! Save a Ton of Money!”
Reviews.Author: MilfordBarbarians
Reviews.Content: At $40 night, Mon-Fri, can't beat it! Fri night stay was $125 but still beats the rest of the hotels. So what if it's a mile of the Strip. Take the free hotel shuttle or take your car and park free in any of the hotels on the Strip and walk. Rooms were clean. Came in on Sunday and left for Grand Canyon on Mon. Came back on Tues. Had a problem with room, floor still wet from shampooing. Hotel quickly changed us to another room. Restaurants in hotel were great and also inexpensive. Problem with parking on weekends. Parking lot fills up quickly after 5pm. During week, not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: HANDY2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans for twin sons 21th B-day. We had a great time, the hotel was great , the beds are sooooo comfortable that it was hard to get out of them. The pool area was great, loved to get some sun and enjoyed being able to watch the Masters outside in the sunshine. The restaurants and buffet are great values and the food was excellent. Enjoyed watching Twins opening day baseball on the big screen by the bar. Very friendly staff at the tables and sports book(as far as that goes all around) and enjoyed playing at the Orleans. The shuttle is a great way to get to the strip. We have stayed at the Orleans before and we will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, as usual!”
Reviews.Author: VegasSusie
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th stay at the Orleans since 2008. We like the casino, the friendly staff, the restaurants are good and very reasonably priced, and we also like the less-hectic, off-strip atmosphere. We usually take in a move in the 16-movie theater. Our favorite place to eat is the Prime Rib Loft - best prime rib ever - and, even if we want to go to the strip, it is a 10-minute ride on the shuttle to center strip (Bill's Gamblin' Hall and Casino) The Orleans' rooms are very spacious and clean. We always stay at the Orleans when we come to Vegas. It is our home away from home in Vegas. Can't wait for the next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: scottandjean
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Orleans more that we anticipated. My husband had a conference there and we wanted to stay in the same hotel for his convenience. We have previously stayed on The Strip many times, including Mandalay Bay, NYNY, Luxor, Bellagio, Paris, Bally's, Stratosphere and The Wynn. We were a little wary of staying at the Orleans but were pleasantly surprised. We rented a car and found the location very convenient for an off-strip hotel. We were lucky enough to get an Executive Suite which was extremely large. The rooms were very clean and the housekeeping staff was very unobtrusive. I did try to reach the housekeeping desk a couple of time but got no answer. Since my issue was minor (extra towels), I shrugged it off. I liked having a small window to open since the weather was so pleasant while we were there. The bar area and refrigerator were wonderful to have as was all the storage in the rooms. The TV's were wonderful but I would have liked better to have the option of having Hi Def. The bed was very comfortable. The pool area was fine for this time of year, but I would imagine it would be crowded in warmer weather.

Reviews.Title: “The feel of Vegas without the headaches of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: GwenP
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Orleans for two nights last June. We had been traveling around the area visiting Bryce, Zion and the Grand Canyon before flying out of Vegas. We choose the hotel because of the price, the location (we had heard that the strip is a zoo - which it is), the reviews and because it seemed "child friendly". We paid something like $75 per night. For that price, we didn't know what to expect. What a pleasant surprise! The hotel/casino has all the fun and feel of Vegas without the headaches of being on the strip. It is clean and festive with the Mardi Gra atmophere. The employees were friendly and helpful througout our stay. Our room was HUGE and in perfect order. We had a room with two beds and a nice sitting area (love seat, coffee table, single chair, plus some lamps. The bathroom was also nice size. In fact, my husband and I joked that we could put a cot in it and use it as another bedroom. One of their best features is their beautiful pool. We're not big pool people, but we literally had to drag ourselves away from the pool to go to dinner. It was so relaxing. Along with the main pool, they have what is almost a child's pool (it's only about a foot and a half deep), and one of the nicest hot tubs I've ever seen. Theirs is shaped like a doughnut. There is an island of trees, flowers and shrubs in the center surrounded by a large ring of warm water to sit and relax in. Consequently, even if others are in the tub, it's very private and peaceful. I'm guessing that if people sat side-by-side, you could fit about one hundred people in it - so it's not some small hot tub. We had heard that they have movie theaters and bowling alleys in the hotel, though didn't try them out. Another really nice feature is the free shuttle service that drops you off on the Strip in front of the Bellagio Hotel - a great location! There is no need to drive once at the hotel. In regard to parking, they offer free valet parking (you just pay for the tipping) or a huge self-park parking lot. Should we visit Las Vegas again, we'll be staying at the Orleans for sure. It's the best deal in town! Suggestion: Try to avoid getting a room that faces the pool. When we were there, we heard some complain about the noise of a pool party that took place a couple nights before we arrived. I don't know if they still have the pool parties or not, but at the time of our visit, they held them every weekend.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans is the most enjoyable, accommodating place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: blessing4589
Reviews.Content: The rooms are always clean, comfortable and conveniently arranged. The quality and variety of food options, is excellent and reasonable. The staff is very approachable, helpful, and friendly, regardless of your level of play. The Orleans is situated off the strip in a more "relaxed" atmosphere, and yet it's very accessible to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value, service and friendlyness.”
Reviews.Author: leonardk2
Reviews.Content: One of those local secrets that many overlook because it's "not on the strip". Do yourself a favor and take a look at The Orleans. Clean spacious rooms, friendly staff, dealers and good eating options. Easy access off the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Good bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: fumasgreg
Reviews.Content: Very good for the price. Rooms were spacious and nice. Overall, the property was very clean and friendly staffed. There are good eating possibilities all throughout the property. There is a TGI fridays that is always half off with good drink specials and cheap burgers etc. There is a mexican restaurant called Don Miguels that has $1 margaritas from like 3-5 pm. $2 pabst cans throughout the casino also. The best deal there is the free shuttle to the HEART of the strip and to the Gold Coast, near the Rio and to the Palms. The hotel room fee per night is very low also at like $5. Take advantage of the coupon booklet they give you upon checkin. Buy one get one free: drink, bowling and numerous percentage off coupons. And something I failed to do until the last morning was to check out a vegas magazine the room provides for you. It had good deals and coupons of different vegas attractions. The breakfast buffet was only 6.95 with many many items to eat. It has lots of omelet stations.

Reviews.Title: “"Orleans" : Not the Southern Hospitality I Expected”
Reviews.Author: fiveseven
Reviews.Content: 11 April 2010 I have twice visited the Orleans, in Las Vegas, Nevada On the first trip, I felt the need to write a letter of complaint. The administration responded and I decided to give the hotel/casino another chance. It is this second incident that convinces me that fellow travelers may be more receptive to my opinions than Orleans' management. ... On the last occasion, the roof --figuratively speaking-- collapsed. Spanish and Latino staff are usually polite; for example, I stayed at a nearby hotel. There my Latino maid was extremely considerate, as was the Spanish bell man. At the Orleans, by comparison, the total opposite seems to be the rule. At the Orleans, I experienced rudeness that can, in all honesty, be called nastiness.. Most recently, I was playing Black Jack at the Orleans" casino. (Knock on wood: I have never lost money at the Orleans.) Management sent in a Spanish woman. She dealt cards to my table. The woman seemed angry at virtually everyone at the table; a young Spanish gentleman being the one, possible, exception. Several guest left the table. I left the casino. My wife is a linguist and consults with Asian travel agencies. She points out that foreign born travelers do express concerns about treatment in the United States, but she has had little or no experience with incidents involving foreign born staff verbally abusing American patrons.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break in Vegas for kids IS possible!”
Reviews.Author: amrstack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Orleans April 5-8 and were travelling with our 9 year old daughter. The wide variety of entertainment geared for families made it possible for all of us to have a great time. Hotel staff and restaurant staff was friendly. Rooms were surprisingly quiet. Only major complaints I had were about the buffet (floor was dirty and there were crab leg shells on the booth and salt all over the table,and we were there for breakfast so there was no excuse for the restaurant to be dirty) and getting "ripped off" at TGI Fridays (but that was most likely the waiter -easily solved dilemma by deducting up charges from his tip.) Overall I'd stay here again and would definately recommend it to anyone looking for an economical Vegas family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Racer59
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans for the 3rd straight year. Love it there. Rooms are larger than the average hotel room and can't beat the price - free comps. The casino was busy as usual, but the hotel towers were fairly quiet which is the way I like it. When I want to sleep, I can sleep there. There are plenty of restaurants and things to do like bowling or seeing a movie. You really don't need to leave the property. Of course, I go for the casino and spend a good amount of time gambling. Lost on the slots, but won at Blackjack this year. I like the Orleans so much that I bought stock in the company. Plan on staying again next year, and so on.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: stevez49
Reviews.Content: What A great hotel !! Clean, spacious and great food. Orleans has everything you need. A beautiful and large pool area. Good variety of food options with an excellent buffett for the budget minded. Large variety of gambling machines and table games. Movie theaters and areas for the kids. What is their not to like about this place! Also a special thanks to Tina the cocktail server who made sure my drink was full.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, cozy, great ambiance and not too far from the strip!”
Reviews.Author: JDMBloo24
Reviews.Content: I love The Orleans. It's by the one of the hotels I stay at regularly when I'm in Vegas. For one thing, it's not too far from the strip. Personally, the strip gets way too crowded. I feel like I can't gamble in peace. The people are really friendly at The Orleans. I can't say that I haven't had a bad experience there, and I hope not to experience such a thing. The rooms are pretty spacious. Not crazy enough like a Bellagio suite, but enough to make you feel extremely comfortable. One bed or two, you have a love seat and whatnot with a coffee table near the window. If there's something else you'd want to do other than gamble, like I said, The Orleans isn't too far from the strip. Also, inside the property are a bowling alley and movie theater. They have all the new movies that come out, and should I dare mention Student discount for those of you who are college students?! Their restaurants have decent food for the price. Steak and Eggs graveyard shift, for the win! All in all, a wonderful experience at The Orleans. Will continue to go back as long as I'm satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: luvvegas1198
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Orleans in Las Vegas. The rooms are clean and big. Now they have coffee pots in the room. The grounds are clean and nice. Easy self parking. Love the casino. The pool area is great. The staff is helpful. Its always less expensive than the strip. We have stayed on the strip in various hotels but like the price at the Orleans better. They run a shuttle to the strip for those who want to use it. For value and fun its a winner in our book

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Eagledogmah
Reviews.Content: Keep up the good jobe so far very good Excelent Managment Very helpful staff all around and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: charlieydrums
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans for the first round of March Madness. Had a fantastic time. The hotel went all out for the tournament...upstairs in the Mardi Gras Ballroom....7 huge 8' x 12" screens, plus 24 large screen HD TV's and live betting, $1 hot dogs and free beer when making bets ($2 otherwise). Couldn't beat the price...$29 a night and we got $15 in food credit and $15 free play on machines. Food in buffet and Courtyard Cafe was good and inexpensive. Took shuttle to/from The Strip...it was very convenient, fast and easy. We stay at Orleans 3-4 times a year and have never been disappointed. One tip...ask for room overlooking pool...they are quieter than rooms not overlooking the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want in a Hotel @ the Orleans!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hrdwrknmom
Reviews.Content: 1st time coming to Las Vegas but I travel & stay in hotels often. I am very selective & only choose quality hotels. 1st off the Orleans had the best customer service I have experienced in years! This hotel is huge- resort size. The prices were very affordable, the rooms were clean and decently sized with a view of the strip. We lost our camera at 1 of the restaurants & the staff & security offered to review the surveillance tapes to ensure no one stole it & to see if they could find it. Fortunately it was not stolen & we found that it had fallen into my wheelchair. The hotel was handicap accessible and everyone was so accomodating. There is lots to do @ the hotel and many restaurant choices (dine in or fast food) also a great buffet for a great price. The hotel is very peaceful in the room and not alot of noise. It is located just off the strip, and has a free shuttle service that runs from early morning to late at night. I will recommend this hotel to all my friends and family, & if I am ever in Vegas again- The Orleans is where I will be. THE MANAGER OF THIS HOTEL IS TO BE APPLAUDED & MUST HAVE YEARS OF EXPERIENCE IN RUNNING A PRISTINE ESTABLISHMENT!!! the Orleans is the Best!!! We feel like we got more than our money's worth!

Reviews.Title: “Superior Hotel”
Reviews.Author: happyoxnard
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at The Orleans many times and have recommend the hotel to family members and friends. In all the times we have stayed at The Orleans, never have we have any trouble, always clean, friendly and service is great and slot machines returns are very good. I have taken my older grandchildren ages 19 years and 20 years and they love to eat there, especially at the cafe and buffet. My granddaughter will be 21 this March 29th and my daughter and husband will be taking her to Vegas and she expecially told her parents she wants to go to The Orleans to eat. We are very happy with the hotel and plan another visit to Vegas in August for my 49th anniversary and plan to stay at The Orleans. I have stayed at three other hotels when The Orleans has been booked but they do not compare to The Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans is a slice of Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: ladyonfire
Reviews.Content: My two best friends and I stayed at the lovely Orleans for 4 nights and 3 days, and honestly, we needed a spatula to pry our butts out of the hotel to go wander the strip, we were having too much fun. I had seen photos of the room courtesy of TripAdvisor, and my friends and I were excited just by those, but when we first walked in to our room, our eyes popped out of our heads! We barely stretched our pockets to pay for the basic room, and ended up getting something bordering on a suite! It was so spacious and comfortable! The overstuffed chair, the couch, and those sinfully comfortable beds were to die for! The linens were clean, smelled quite nice, the bathroom was SPOTLESS (which is really a shocking find in most hotels these days), and there was enough room for the three of us to go about our business without getting in each others' way! The staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. That includes the maintenance people, the desk people, and the maids! Man, the maids were SO friendly, and again, is something rare to find in a hotel. Service was prompt, room service was timely, delicious, and the price was more than reasonable. The many restaurants in the hotel were amazing, the movie theater was cozy and comfy, and come on, you can't beat a 24 hour bowling alley! The Casino was fun too, though we didn't spend too much time in there. The various bars in the hotel were awesome, with a brilliant set of bartenders (The Mardi Gras bar was the best!), and the piano bar had an amazing band playing, and they even were kind enough to talk to our group of friends after finishing up their set at 3 a.m. It was the whipped cream topping on an incredible vacation. I've been raving about it since I returned home, and will definitely stay there again the next time I go to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Vegas !!!”
Reviews.Author: glassmanOklahoma
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay! Lots going on but very quiet in rooms. Off-strip is great. The locals like to gamble here because they find he odds to be better. We enjoy it because the gambling is good and the food is great. The Prime Rib Loft serves an excellent meal at a very reasonable price. The Buffet is very good and also priced well. For those excursions to the strip The Orleans provides free shuttle service to the middle of the strip giving you easy access to all the hotels on the strip. We have stayed here many time over the years and will continue to do so. The people at the hotel always treat you as family. Thanks Orleans!!!

Reviews.Title: “good time at the ORLEANS”
Reviews.Author: condors
Reviews.Content: spent 3 days there food was great has good arena enjoyed 3 games of ice hockey & lots of good slots

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans--Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: DorothyofOz78
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay in the Orleans but went there for the gambling , a day away from the Vegas Strip. What an enjoyable time we had there. The casino was very spacious and has slots,roulette, craps etc . The staff was very friendly and hospitable. There are plenty of restaurants inside and you can choose from a hot dog to buffet to TGIF's and so on. We can't wait to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Always something new to see in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Roosevelt25
Reviews.Content: Have been coming to Las Vegas for 20 years staying in a variety of hotels.The past 8 years at the Orleans have been consistantly good. Rooms reasonable,clean and decent sized. A variety of restaurant choices with great buffet. Showroom offers big name entertainers at affordable prices. Located just off the strip, a free shuttle service starts early in the day and runs until midnight makeing it easy to visit the strip and sister hotels. Lastly the Orleans has some of the best slots and frequent pay outs, so much so that it is a favorite of local residents. I plan on visiting here again

Reviews.Title: “Off the strip quiet and peaseful has everything you need...”
Reviews.Author: lmonte2000chev
Reviews.Content: Has shuttle service good food and resturants free parking....

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans is great!”
Reviews.Author: azitizLacey_WA
Reviews.Content: All you could want - great rooms, great staff, good food - and plenty of it! Had a great time - have had a great time everytime we visit Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Orleans, our favorite in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: vegasforfun_10
Reviews.Content: We only had one free afternoon this trip and chose to spend it at Orleans. My wife & I have recommended Orleans to everyone who wants to know where to have a good time, great service from a staff that genuinely makes you feel at home and better than average video poker, our favorite game choice. We hope to stay at Orleans our next trip !

Reviews.Title: “Best place Best Value”
Reviews.Author: chowd1
Reviews.Content: You have to eat at the Prime Rib Loft, exquisite, TGI Fridays is also good . They also have a great pool

Reviews.Title: “We had a GREAT time at The Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: Paulden
Reviews.Content: My wife and I met friends from another state at The Orleans during the end of Feb. 2010 for 4 nights. The friendly atmosphere at The Orleans made us feel very comfortable to sit and talk while playing at the machines or after eating at one of the restaurants. The rooms were exceptionally clean, quiet, and comfortable. We enjoyed eating at Fridays, Courtyard Cafe, Don Miguel's and yes the French Market Buffet. The service was friendly and timely and we thought the quality of food was excellent and the prices very reasonable. Thanks to all the wonderful people you have working at The Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: sundancin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a national cheer competiton. The hotel was busy and had lots of cheerleaders staying here. I didn't mind it. I thought the rooms were clean and roomy. We had one of their workers on our floor every night, I guess to make sure no one got out of control. I felt like the staff were always nice and considerate of all. I didn't mind the short drive to the strip. I liked having many restaurants to choose from at any time of the day/night. We went to the buffet for breakfast one morning and it was a typical buffet. We had good service, good prices and pretty good food. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans is Great for staying and playing”
Reviews.Author: verda
Reviews.Content: off the strip with lots of action for gambling and events. lots of locals and visitors with everyone appearing excited and happy. my money lasts longer here and the comps from their membership card can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “We have a new favorite place to stay in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Coop64
Reviews.Content: We received a special offer for two free nights at The Orleans through our player's club. We decided to take advantage of it, and we are certainly happy we did! After a rather crummy 3 days at the 4 Queens (see my other review) we moved to The Orleans. The checkout was fast, the desk clerk was quite friendly despite being very busy at the time. The room was great ! Very much like the rooms at The Golden Nugget, except much larger. The view of the strip was fabulous, almost like a post card. Room was clean, the hallways were clean, the elevators were clean. There was only one downside to our short stay at The Orleans. There was a cheerleading competition at the Orleans Arena. Far too many teen/pre-teen girls were running up and down the hallways, playing around on the elevators, etc.... Worse than the cheerleaders themselves were their adult (?) chaperons. We will definitely stay here on our next trip to Vegas. Thanks Orleans !

Reviews.Title: “Great stay again”
Reviews.Author: bigbirdbc
Reviews.Content: Everything was really good, the service, the food, the accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: simone12345
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights and had an enjoyable time. They did not charge for my kids like most of the other hotels which was a plus. The room was clean and comfortable. I stayed on the 10th floor and it was very quiet. I did not smell any smoke in the hallway or in the room at any time. The breakfast and dinner buffets were good and reasonably priced. The only negative was that the air conditioning unit was a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: sdcauley
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is a great value with great service. Friendly dealers, clean rooms, good player's club.

Reviews.Title: “Off strip... price and ambience reflect it.”
Reviews.Author: mobycat
