Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Orleans - but a long stay. 2 1/2 weeks. The rooms are good sized rooms. The bed is comfortable. Nothing extraordinary, but not horrible. The bathroom - the shower was nice - good pressure, good amount of water. Though there is a window right there with no real way of blocking it. If you are near the elevators, there's a chance someone in another room could *possibly* see inside your shower while you are there. The television... only one word could describe it - suck. There are only about 5 or 6 real channels to choose from (all the rest are hotel channels). But let's face it... nobody is in Las Vegas to hang out in the rooms...and the casinos don't want you in your room, anyway. If you smoke, the Orleans is your kind of place. I understand that smoking is allowed in all of the casinos, but the Orleans seems to be quite a bit more smoky than any of the strip hotels. That alone keeps me from making this a "recommend." The Fuddruckers is 24 hours. They and Sbarro (and maybe Subway?) provide room service. As far as I could tell, there are no decent restaurants in the neighborhood, so the casino restaurants are really the only choices. There is a free shuttle that will take you to Bill's Gambling Hall on the strip or the Gold Coast near the Rio and Palms. During parts of the day (think around 5pm) it fills up fast. It's quite common for people to be denied boarding because the shuttle is full. A cab ride will cost about $11 (including tip) one way to the Tropicana. A cab ride down to Fremont is about $25 (including tip). If you want to spend your time here in a cheaper hotel but still be on the Strip, I'd recommend the Circus Circus. Very comparable hotels.

Reviews.Title: “chillin by myself”
Reviews.Author: NaomiM4
Reviews.Content: loved it nice view bathroom was the bomb too many slot machines cnt decide which one to play cnt wait for round 2

Reviews.Title: “Ok for kids but not very comfortable...”
Reviews.Author: lozaman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights for our daughter's cheer tournament. First the pros- you can't beat the price for what is essentially a mini-suite on a weekend in Vegas. The rooms are larger than average and have a small living room area as well as a spacious bathroom/shower with safe, all for under $100 per night. The place is ideal for kids with a movie theater, bowling alley, arcade and cool play zone that serves as a babysitter while you gamble. Room service was fast and adequate and there are multiple restaurants and fast food locations to eat on the premises. Now the cons- like most of the older Vegas hotels this one is incredibly smoky. If this doesn't bother you, great, but it made my wife and I feel sickly and congested all weekend, and all of our clothes now smell like smoke. And if you like sleeping, stay elsewhere. The walls were thin and the doors even thinner. We generally went to bed around midnight and wanted to wake around 7am. However you can hear every opening/closing door down the long corridor as well as people's voices, which occured at 2am, 3am, 6am, etc. The beds were horribly uncomfortable and the pillows super thin. We basically tossed and turned for 3 nights while being woken up by random noises several times each night. This was exacerbated by the fact that it was a cheer competition with hundereds of little girls running down the halls and playing "doorbell ditch" at all hours (at least on our floor). On a regular non-kid event weekend with some earplugs and your own pillow, you might be OK. Parking was also very tough and one night I found not a single space available despite it being a HUGE lot. Valet was 20 cars deep so not the best alternative either. If you want a cheap, uncomfortable, kid-friendly place off the strip, stay here. If you want some comfort, ventilated air, and to be closer to the real action (fancy hotels, nightclubs, people watching), pony up some money and stay at one of the finer establishments on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: trixBuffalo
Reviews.Content: Our first visit with friends was great - we are all looking forward to going back. We did not stay but plan to in the future

Reviews.Title: “Always a good experience”
Reviews.Author: snotravel
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Orleans several times and always had a great experience. Good sized, comfortable rooms. One of the better buffets in Vegas for the price, can eat all day for $21 right now. Excellent English pub in the casino and a 24 hr. TGIF is a plus. Upstairs you have a bowling alley, large theater, and a play area and an arcade for the kids. The only negatives I can think of is It's off the strip, but not a big deal if you have a rental car and casino gets a little smoky. Those are really minor things though, I can't say enough good things about this place. Even times when I stay at another hotel, I find myself coming back to the Orleans just to play in their casino and take advantage of the many great deals they have. I've stayed at several nice hotels on the strip, but overall you can't beat the Orleans for value.

Reviews.Title: “Highest Quality Hotel/Casino Resort”
Reviews.Author: TiffanyAmber
Reviews.Content: At The Orleans Hotel/Casino Las Vegas, we received excellent service from valet to check-in, housekeeping, restaurants and cocktail waitresses. Beautiful suites with wet bar, dining table and all the necessary toiletries. We enjoyed the theaters(there's 18 to choose from), awesome 70 bowling lanes, great restaurants has great value, include TGI Friday's, Fuddruckkers, Subway, Baskin Robbins Ice Cream, Sbarro Pizza, French Market Buffet and several other fine choice restauarants we will dine at next visit. Beautiful pool area for this summer. Huge Arena always has an event. Best of all The Orleans Hotel/Casino is Safe, Clean, Friendly Employees. Many fun, exciting games to play and everyone wins a little something.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeighaJ
Reviews.Content: This was a fabulous place to stay. The room was huge, the staff was really nice, and it made for a really enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: LavonneVoigt
Reviews.Content: Good place, with decent prices. Not extravagant, but comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “vaction time”
Reviews.Author: Dawn11990
Reviews.Content: i love the orleans their very clean an the people who work there are very nice the rooms are big an comfy

Reviews.Title: “My first visit to The Orleans Hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: MaritzaCox
Reviews.Content: We had a GREAT time at The Orleans. GREAT service, price, food, rooms, entertainment!

Reviews.Title: “Cheerleaders everywhere!!!”
Reviews.Author: Freedom59
Reviews.Content: Let me say that I have stayed several times over the past few years at the Orleans, and was always happy with the hotel. However, this stay was a disaster. For both days, Jan. 29 and 30, the hotel was overrun with young girls for a cheerleading competition. You couldn't get an elevator, the restaurants had huge lineups, and generally the kids had the run of the place...literally running in the hallways, well after midnight, with no help from hotel security to put a stop to it. It seems the Orleans now often caters to large groups of children, who take precedence over the other hotel guests. We go to Las Vegas for an adult vacation, not to have the experience of a Disneyland hotel. We won't be going back, and wouldn't recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest I saw there!”
Reviews.Author: BrittFree
Reviews.Content: Rooms were nice, grounds were clean, staff helpful. The casino was pretty cool, bars were adequate (bartenders could have been a bit more attentive/friendly), and excellent food choices available! Best parts: Theater, Bowling Alley, Arcade, and (almost) 24-hour buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: BeaArW
Reviews.Content: I really didn't like this hotel. Then, I really didn't like Vegas much either. To my mind the only good thing about The Orleans was the kids club, where my son chose to hang out with other kids. I was a little concerned about the lack of natural daylight, but he had fun and wanted to go there each day for an hour or two. I found the service non-existent after the quite efficient check-in. We had maid service on only one of our three days there (one day because we said don't bother, as we were already home after a day out and didn't want to have to leave the room again); and when I called reception to enquire whether I'd get a prompt about the next $11.99 24 hour period for wifi internet starting (because there was no answer on the tech support line), was greeted by an incredulous tone saying "I don't think so! It's up to you to record what time you start and know when it finishes". This was probably adding insult to injury really, as I was pretty disgusted at being charged for wifi in the first place - it's been free everywhere else we've stayed in the states. And to extend that logic, if I select and pay for an in-room movie, will it just keep playing more movies unless I press stop?? The casino smelt of horrible sickly sweet cleaning product and stale cigarette smoke. To give credit where it's due though, the rooms were nice. And the mexican restaurant was okay too. In hindsight, I would rather have stayed at somewhere like the Flamingo, which looked nice (except for the lack of a kids club which gives the Orleans some kudos). I'm unlikely to ever go back to Vegas anyway, so this is really a hindsight, and a not a next time, comment.

Reviews.Title: “This place has it all.”
Reviews.Author: southpaw0831
Reviews.Content: After spending alot of time in the casino's on the strip I ventured to the Orleans looking to change my luck. Upon my arrival I noticed immediately this casino was different. It was clean, modern looking and had several eating establishments on the lower level. I liked everything about this place. The staff was very friendly, food was reasonably priced. The slots seemed loose as for a change I left with more than I walked in with. I'll definitely be back. Dave, Michigan

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great value.”
Reviews.Author: thehilander69
Reviews.Content: The Orleans, although off-strip, is conveniently located near the strip and they provide an hourly shuttle if needed. For the price it's a great value, they have an excellent buffet and 24 hour diner, the rooms are all suites and provide plenty of space, service has always been excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good fun and good food”
Reviews.Author: mphillNortheast_OK
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas every January for ten days. We have two timeshares...one at the GrandView and one at Polo Towers. We generally stay at the GrandView. We enjoyed our time at The Orleans. We subscribe to the Las Vegas Advisor and used our coupon for one free buffet meal when purchasing one from the coupon book we get with the subscription. Food was good as usual as well as the service. We played some of the slots and won more there than all the other casinos we visited for the ten days we were in Vegas. Self parking out front is very easy and close to the building but we have used valet and they have great service. We always tip the valet person five bucks...no less. The Orleans has lots of machines, a large table game area, good sized sports book. There's a variety of restaurants including a TGI Fridays. We ate there last year and it is as good as the rest of the locations. This particular one is now open 24 hours. Although we have never stayed in the hotel, I understand they have very nice rooms. We have attended some shows there in the past and the box office personnel were always very helpful and courteous. I would recommend this Casino to anyone visiting or staying in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “its big busy but slightly out of town (off the strip)”
Reviews.Author: hope0710
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel....clean....very spacious...plenty inside as with all hotel/casinos.......good restaurants - and free shuttle to the strip which runs regularly - only downfall is it off the main strip.......I had no problem with shuttle service but in the heat of las vegas I can imagine this must be hot hot hot sometimes...

Reviews.Title: “Be treated like a king at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: kcavy5
Reviews.Content: Great staff, good slots, great restaurants, great bowling facility,located away from the hustle and bustle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place!”
Reviews.Author: dwstick
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is, bar none, the best bang-for-your-buck hotel casino in Vegas! Nice clean rooms, great food selection, great gaming, you name it. And all at reasonable rates. There certainly are more posh hotels and restaurant in town, but this place is made for people who live within a budget. The only drawback I found was that the ventilation system in the casino could be improved; the casino can be quite smoky at times.

Reviews.Title: “Super stay 1/25/10 – 1/29/10 plus we WON!”
Reviews.Author: 3chihuahuas
Reviews.Content: In December 09 we both signed up for B Connected players cards at Main Street Station. That’s Boyd Gaming – they have Main Street Station, the Fremont, The California, Sam’s Town, the Orleans, the Gold Coast and Suncoast. Once home, I signed both cards up for on-line access and we each received 2 comped nights at the Orleans in January. We did not even gamble on the cards, so that was a pretty nice comp. We had to take advantage of this. We back to backed the rooms – 4 nights – Jan 25th – Jan 29th. We drive from the LA area so we got to the Orleans at 4:00 pm. We had never even set foot in the Orleans before, so everything about it was new for us. Valet parked. Opened the door and a faint coconut smell greets you. Not overpowering. No line at check-in. I asked for a room on the 20th or 21st floor with a strip view. I knew from the TA Las Vegas forum, rooms on those two floors had been updated with flat panel TVs. The 20th floor was available, but not with a strip view, however a lower floor strip view room was. I asked the girl behind the desk which room she would choose. She said the 20th. We had room 2093 with a south view. The room is definitely larger than a standard hotel room. They do have an odd shape as the bathroom is at the back of the room. We had a king size bed. Quite comfortable with soft sheets. The room also has a desk w/ mirror & chair, sofa & chair, coffee table & end table, large safe, one cup coffee maker, full length mirror, 42 inch flat panel TV, large window, A/C –heat thermostat control (rather than just an on-off). The bathroom is two rooms. A single sink with enough counter space and open closet with shelf. Iron & ironing board. Then the toilet and tub/shower. There is a window that opens above the tub. We could see Mandalay Bay, Luxor and Excalibur from it. The only thing I did not like about the room, was the dresser. It was very small. One small drawer and two shelves. I used the shelf above the hanger rod in the bathroom for most of our clothes. The room was spotless and in excellent shape. You could tell the carpet had been freshly shampooed. Our room had 10 foot ceilings. It made the room feel even more spacious. We were very pleased with the room! Room photos: http://picasaweb.google.com/3ChihuahuasMama/OrleansRoom2093# The casino is pretty festive and fun. The chandeliers have huge Mardi Gras theme lighted masks. The casino floor is large and spread out. I did not think it was smoky (I just quit smoking on Halloween Day 09). I’ve been told this is a “locals” casino. We felt right at home. Most of the customers are older. Young gamblers will fit right in, but this is not a party scene place. Go to the Palms for that. Video poker and the slots were good to us – between the two of us, we won $3,300.00. Got home with $2,600.00 Who needs all the noise, traffic and walking and expensive rooms on the Strip when you can get everything in one convienient, inexpensive place. We can hardly wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay and play”
Reviews.Author: notron11
Reviews.Content: free shuttle bus to the strip and to the gold coast. nice rooms . many different choices of food even if you never leave the casino. all staff friendly. i will look to stay here on my next trip to vegas. not stingy with comps.

Reviews.Title: “SOMETHING DIFFERENT”
Reviews.Author: kathbritton
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Monte Carlo in Las Vegas and after 5 days we decided we needed to go somewhere a bit different from the hotels on the strip, where better than The Orleans, this hotel is like going back in time, There is some form of entertainment for everyone, we had 4 games of ten pin bowling on their 70 lane bowling alley and later went to see a movie in one of their movie theatres, plenty of eateries for all tastes, they even have a restaurant upstairs which is away from all the noise of the slot machines, all though this hotel is away from the strip (5min taxi ride - $12.00) it has more character and good old fashioned charm than any of the hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place that could use some updating”
Reviews.Author: iamathew
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans because everyone in our group was. We had not stayed there before. The casino is very fun and there is a nice selection and variety of places to eat. Love that there are multiple food places open 24 hours a day so that you can choose to go in and sit down, or grab something to take up to your room no matter what time of day it is. The valet service is quick and easy. Really didn't like that the business center is only open until 2 pm on weekends. The people who work there are all pretty friendly. We got to Vegas early in the day and they were happy to let us check in early. The rooms are spacious, but pretty outdated. When we checked in and asked if we could get a nice room, we were told we were up high with a view of the pool. We were up high with an ugly view of the parking lot. The toilet ran and the sink was slow. The AC went on and off all night and was super loud. The televisions are super old and the channel selection is really limited. This isn't a fancy hotel, but it is reasonably priced and has most everything a person would need for a stay in Las Vegas. I would recommend it for people who are looking for a casual place to stay that is off the strip. We often stay at the South Point hotel and there are great things about both. South Point has much nicer rooms, but is missing a lot of the convenient food choices that the Orleans has. I'm going to note that I would recommend this hotel because it was fine, but it would not be my first choice of places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong if you're on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: Hman5
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1/7-1/10 for C.E.S. with my Bro-in-law. Combination business/fun trip. Booked directly through the Hotel because I didn't want any run around if I had problems booking with Priceline or other. (I have had issues before with hotels not deliveriing the right room or fudging on something else when I got the rooms through Priceline.) Besides it wasn't any cheaper going thru a broker. At check-in they first set us up with a pool view 7th fl. I asked for a high room away from the elevator/ice machine (noise) strip view. They didn't have any strip view available but they put us on the 19th fl mountain view away from the elevator. Room 1925. I was pleased with the size of the room, clean carpet, decent bedding. The heater/ac was a litle noisey but seems like most are. (at least it didn't rattle or vibrate) Didn't really like how the shower/toilet/sink/closet were all in the same side room but not enough to complain. It's too bad you can't pick your neighbors, ended up with rude door/drawer slammers the 2nd and 3rd nite. (Not the Orleans fault.) Plenty of $5 tables, craps and 21 are what we played. Also played a bit of 5 cent video poker. All the dealers and pit bosses were friendly even when we were winning. The band they had in the free entertainment area was fun and seemed to please all the guest watching. I sat at the bar the last nite for 4 hrs playing video poker listening to the band, drinking for free and broke even by the time I left. They have a liquor store across from Fridays that had really good prices for alcohol (discount with a players card) and reasonably priced cigars. Bought a 750 bottle of Skyy for under $11. Only thing I didn't like at this Hotel was the Cafe restaurant . We went down for breakfast about 10am. No line, got seated in a reasonable amount of time. Waited 5 min and someone asked us if we wanted something to drink, yes water. Another 5 minutes the water arrived and I asked if we could place our order, no someone else will take your order. 2 min later a hispanic women comes by and drops 2 napkins on the table and then drops the forks, knives and spoons in a pile - plop! Then just turns and walks away. NICE! Then the water came. Few minutes later the waitress came, very polite and took our order. They had a steak and eggs special for $7.99, we both ordered it. 10 minutes later the food arrived and it looked great. But, it didn't taste so great, the hash browns were undercooked on the bottom side and the steak tasted at best like bland liver. So disappointing, it looked so good and we were so hungry. Even a bath in A-1 didn't help. The eggs were fine, scrambled and not over cooked. Never saw the waitress again. Grabbed a burger late one nite after drinking and gambling at Fuddruckers that was really good. Did an oyster shooter at the Oyster bar that was ok. It was a Belvedere shooter, I thought it would have some kind of spice or seasoning but it was just a nice sized shot of Vodka with a raw oyster dropped into it. Next time I'll order the vodka with cranberry and get the oyster shooter the traditional way. If they had that on the menu, I didn't see it. Also saw a movie (Avatar 3-D), while we were there. Nice big typical movie house in the Hotel. Deja Vu is across the street and if you show your room key they'll let you in for free but I'd skip it and find another venue. The entertainment wasn't really on par with what Vegas has to offer. Great trip - Wish we'd taken more time to gamble. Broke even!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, food, games, rooms...”
Reviews.Author: Pepsmom
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Orleans. Always stayed on the strip. Decided to try something quieter. Orleans is the place! Rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. The price is amazing for rooms and food. We ate at the Prime Rib Loft and it was delicious. The service in every area was wonderful. Check in a breeze and should you decide to go to the strip for a visit the shuttle is so convinient but we were always so glad to get back to the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome family entertainment”
Reviews.Author: chingonguy
Reviews.Content: Took the family down two weeks ago and had a great time. Lots of fun things for the kids and lots of exciting things for the adults. My new vegas family spot!!

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway”
Reviews.Author: teddybearutah
Reviews.Content: The orleans offers great gambling options great resturant selections easy access to the orleans arena shuttle bus to the strip. We stay here every time we come to las vegas it is so much fun to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: spudly911
Reviews.Content: We had to go to Utah unexpectedly due to a family death. We have stayed at the Orleans before and always enjoyed the hospitality there. Having no plans to be in Vegas we decided to stop and get a room there. Due to previous stays They were able to comp us a room in short notice. The food at the Prime Rib Loft and Canal Street were excellent. After dealing with the tragic loss, it was very nice to be able to relax for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “I love staying at The Orleans because it is home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: monijvegas
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at The Orleans Christmas night because we went to Vegas to get married. I had a comp for a free night because every time I go to Vegas I stay there. It is such a friendly and helpful hotel. I definitely recommend The Orleans and will definitely be staying there again the next time I visit Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service + Great Price = Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nuggetini
Reviews.Content: 1st time I stayed at the Orleans and was pleasantly surprised. The service is unmatched. Great people working there and very helpful. They also have a shuttle that runs from the hotel to the strip and back FREE of Charge, now how can you beat that. Taxi alone is $10 each way so you can $20 roundtrip. The food was reasonable priced and quite tasty. The poker room is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: VAtraveler20151
Reviews.Content: Family travel to Las Vegas... stretching dollars in order to splurge at the shows... The Orleans provided a great value for the dollar and would definitely stay there again... not fancy but had everything we needed: clean and spacious room, movie theater, several good restaurants, quick valet service, easy access to I-15. A great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip!”
Reviews.Author: AuntieMArizona
Reviews.Content: We love the Orleans Hotel and Casino and go there frequently. We have never been disappointed with our stay. My husband and I both play video poker and you can always find your favorite games to play. The slot club is great and so are their promotions. We have always enjoyed the restaurants and have never been dissatisfied. The hotel rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. We are already planning our next visit. We would highly recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “We always come back to the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Foxes323
Reviews.Content: Whenever we have gone to Vegas, we make sure that our stay includes the Orleans. Whether it is our "home" hotel or if we are with friends staying elsewhere, we always go to the Orleans as a first choice Casino. The staff has always been very helpful and you can't beat the value and price. We have sampled all the restaurants (Love the Prime Rib Loft!). For us, Vegas will always include the Orleans - So many other casinos just don't have the atmosphere, availability of slot games that we like and the comfortable, spacious feel of a great casino. So many things to do inside with activities other than the gaming area - Theatres, Special Events and bowling too and more. Easy access via shuttle to the strip and other Boyd properties makes your stay worry free. We know we will always come "home" to the Orleans !

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: DuffManOhYea
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean and very quiet. You will hear NO noise from neighbors. You will hear only a rare noise from the hallway because the 40 pound door blocks most of the noise. Room is spacious and has a sofa, desk, coffee table, bureau, and metal frame head board. Yes, its not the Venetian. If you want marble bathroom walls and terrazzo flooring and sunken living rooms then pay three times as much for the Venetian. If you want a clean quiet room near the action at a bargain price then Orleans may work for you. Orleans offers a free shuttle to and from the strip (dropped at the corner of Bills, Bally's and the Bellagio) that runs every half hour. So if you want to bum around the strip and then be able to get away from it you can retire to your off strip room. I read some complaints about slow check-in, but we arrived at the back end of a shuttle from the airport and the line was 25 people long and we were still checked in within 10 minutes. Hotel gift shop is overpriced. If you forgot something there is a Walgreens at the intersection of Decauter and Tropicana (one block southwest of the property). As for the casino floor - we found it as spacious and comfortable as any strip hotel, great bowling alley, movie theater, and arcade. Wireless internet at a convenient cafe. Poker room is great. We enjoyed being away from the noise and fast pace of the strip hotels. Orleans is more relaxed and laid back. Convenient free parking near the main entrance. Orleans buffet offers a great deal: for about $20 you can eat all day. You can enter and leave the buffet as many times as you wish, can cut to the front of the line, and get priority seating. The food is on par with more expensive hotels and the selection is amazing. Knocks: the knocks against the Orleans are the same knocks as any other Vegas hotel. No free in-room internet, television channel selection is not great, and obviously there is no free continental breakfast. But you didn't go to Vegas to hole up in your room and the hotel wants to you downstairs gambling and not watching TV -- so get over it. Overall, given the price we paid I had low expectations - but were pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ron57nie
Reviews.Content: The Orleans was a nice hotel but not one of our favorites. We stayed there 3 nights and the price was fantastic, the room was ok, clean but no fitted sheets which i really dislike as they always seem to wander on us. Very limited channels and no refer nor microwave. The Casino was incredibly smokey and we couldn't stay there , we ended up playing on the strip where the ventalation was better. We were there from Dec 24-27 and there was no feel of Christmas, the majority of the cliental seemed to be Oriental so that may have something to do with it. We ate at the coffee shop and TGIF as the apps were half price. food was standard fare but not bad in price. I would stay there again but prefer the sister Gold Coast property as the ventaltion seemed better there.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: chroy
Reviews.Content: Overall, the stay was great! The rooms are very well setup with comfortable beds and nice linens. We were on the 18th floor and no hint of cigarette smoke. The staff were great! and room service was reasonably priced and very tasty. The staff were very down to earth, friendly with the most beautiful cocktail waitresses in Vegas! On the down side, The TV was outdated with limited channels and fuzzy reception. I didn't care much for the casino. It had limited table gaming and seemed to cater more to the slot players. The comps are extremely minimal for gambling and geared strictly to locals who play there alot.

Reviews.Title: “THE VERY BEST BANG FOR YOUR BUCK”
Reviews.Author: Rickg26Phoenix
Reviews.Content: If you need to Watch your money. This is the Very Best Place in Las Vegas. I have stayed here 4 different times now. Each time we stay it has always been a great stay. Only draw back I had with the place, needs more handicap parking space. The rooms, are the Best. The bed is Far better then my own. The room very big, very clean. Really Top notch. The food is out of site. So good. Be carefull not to eat to much, it's that good. I have had all 3 meals there. Just great. So many things to do while there. Gaming great machines. Didn't take all my money. Even walk away with money. Over all I think it has been the best place I have stayed for the Money.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly Bathrooms & dirty carpets”
Reviews.Author: sarathy1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans for 5 nights (Dec 28 2009 - Jan 1 2010). The hotel staff were courteous but I was disappointed with the way our hotel room was maintained. We booked a non smoking room but the room smelled of cigarette smoke. The bathrooms were smelly. The less said the better about the smoke in the casino. We ended up with a scratchy throat and when we visited other casinos this was not the issue. We are definitely not coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised and great value”
Reviews.Author: adrianlperalta13
Reviews.Content: The Orleans was a great place to stay, the only con is that it is a ways from the strip, other than that the service was great and many options to eat. Friendly staff is always a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and play”
Reviews.Author: TiresWinRaces
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orleans in March 2008 with a group of friends. The Orleans is an above average off-strip resort with all the amenities you could think of, except proximity to the strip. If you appreciate value, the Orleans delivers. They have a great game of double-deck pitch blackjack with good rules (double after split, resplit aces) and pay 3:2 on blackjack. The minimums are sometimes $5 at slow times, and no more than $10 even at peak times. They seemed to have a $5 craps table open whenever I walked past. Cocktail service is very good, and the girls are dressed in skimpy outfits! Yeah baby! I don't care to spend a bunch of money on food, especially when there with my buddies, and the Orleans was perfect in this regard. They have several low priced restaurants. I had a burger at Terrible Mikes and it was fantastic. They have Subway (perfect for a late night meal after enjoying those free cocktails all night). Best of all is a discount liquor store right in the casino that is at least 20% cheaper than off strip liquor stores. The rooms are more than adequate. The rooms were clean, though when we checked in on a busy weekend, we were given a smoking room even though we requested non-smoking. They sprayed something in the room that helped, but the smell was noticable again in the morning. Tip - I take a small bottle of fabreeze to Vegas, wherever I stay. Helps mask the smokey smell on your clothes and you can spray it in the room to freshen it up. The worst part about the Orleans is the distance to the strip, especially if you are there to party. Getting a bunch of guys together to grab 2 or more taxis just to go over to the strip is a pain. They do have shuttle service to Bill's Gamblin Hall on the strip for free, but it is slow because you go to Gold Coast on the way. If you are primarily there to gamble, relax, and get the best bang for your buck, you can't beat the Orleans. But if you are there to party and experience Vegas, a strip hotel will do better for you... you can't beat a strip hotel and being able to just walk out of your hotel and go from casino to casino.

Reviews.Title: “The most exciting entertainment in Las Vegas for the value.”
Reviews.Author: thewilliamsmd
Reviews.Content: The Orleans offers an exciting oray of fun and entertainment that leaves you without time to tour the strip. You have everything at your finger tips at the Orleans and you forget that the rest of Vegas is out there. If I could give you on tip on the trip to Vegas plan at least 2 weeks to enjoy a peaceful get away without the time running out on you. We had so much fun that we wish it had been for more than 4 days.

Reviews.Title: “Always have a grate time at "The Orleans"”
Reviews.Author: Oldman669
Reviews.Content: beat casino i have been very quiet and clean hotel rooms are very nice maid service is always on time never late. desk people are very help even if you have questions needing answers to. bus service to the strip is great. if your here in the fall check for the midnight hockey at "the orleans" the best i have ever had. need to get your players card (CLUB COAST) due to the fact that you get a better price break for LIQUOR compared to any liquor store on the strip and off the strip

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: pm2006
Reviews.Content: I was afraid of some of the reviews mentioning the smell of sewage in the rooms but so many reviews had positive things to say that I decided to try it anyway. The price was unbeatable so I booked 2 rooms. The rooms were very large. Plenty of room for 4 but we stayed with 2 in each room and there was NO smell. We stayed on the 2nd floor. Everyone was friendly and answered all our questilons with no problem. The gambling hall is huge. We went to see a movie but didn't use the bowling alley There is free internet at the coffee shop and you can sometimes pick up your internet in the room if it's a plug in and you turn off the wireless. There tend to be VERY long lines at peak times for the buffet but there are mjany other options for food. It takes about 5 to 10 minutes to get to the strip by shuttle bus which runs regularly.

Reviews.Title: “plush rooms and lovely pool”
Reviews.Author: soobee_vancouver
Reviews.Content: We booked a two-night stay at the Orleans, based on the reviews of the hotel we read on Trip Advisor. We weren't disappointed! The Orleans is every bit as good as the reviews say. We booked online and got a steal of a deal for a mid-week stay. Our king room was enormous, with a small sitting area by the window, and the bathroom was huge. The room was spotless, bed was incredibly comfy, with a white duvet and good pillows, and the decor was actually pretty nice. Nice lighting too. I've stayed in Marriot and Westin hotels in other cities that didn't have as nice a room as this one! We had a really nice view as well of the mountains west of Vegas. The pool was great; lots of palm trees and green surrounding an enormous main pool, with a smaller warm pool and a pool-sized hot tub tucked away at the back. Lots of chairs as well. We liked it so much we booked a second two-night stay! Only two drawbacks to the hotel: 1) there's a $5 per day "resort fee" per room, which apparently covers coffee, fitness center, pool. It doesn't include free wi-fi in the room (there is free wi-fi in the lobby, or you can pay for wi-fi in the room). As far as resort fees go, seems that quite a few of the Vegas hotels are now charging them, and they're anywhere up to $15 per day! In comparison, $5 isn't that much, but it's bit annoying to be paying for things that other hotels don't charge for. 2) The hotel isn't on the strip, it's a good mile or so away. There's a shuttle that goes every 40 minutes or so, or if you have a car, it's a quick drive and there's lots of free parking at the big hotels on the strip. Location wasn't a big issue for us, as we weren't in Vegas to gamble much; during the day, we were out hiking and biking in nearby Red Rock canyon, and at the hotel we were happy relaxing around the pool and hanging out in the Orleans casino.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Shanzman
Reviews.Content: For the money you get treated to a nice room, and an overall nice hotel casino experience. They have a free shuttle to the strip, so don't worry, its easy to get there.

Reviews.Title: “The most greatest atmospere that you would ever enjoy and thepersonnel is alsome.”
Reviews.Author: spankytennessee
Reviews.Content: This was the most exciting experince for me to be in vegas for the first time in my life.The personal was alsome and the people that you met was very,very nice. the food was great and the rooms.The casnio and the hotel was very beautiful and guys I'LL BE BACK NEXT YEAR WHEN MY VACTION STARTS THEY WILL HAVE TO GET A LONGROPE TO BRING ME BACK TO NASHVILLE. SEE YOU SOON.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for not being on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: dleo84
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice. The room was good. Although most of the time in Vegas was spent outside of the room, it was nice. The hotel is located close to the freeway, and close enough to the Strip. They have an arcade, a bowling alley, a movie theathre and even a daycare. The service was good, but there was an issue with an attitude from one of the bell desk staff that was very rude to me and my party for no apparent reason. Even though the bell desk was very busy, I understood this and waited. When I tried to make a joke with the guy, he gave me the attitude as if he was the one that had been standing around waiting for 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: foodfirst
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights there. Clean room, good rates, friendly employees, great food (we ate at the buffet except for one meal), fun gambling, good live music. I was in the slot tournament. Very well run. Excellent meal and entertainment the last night. Will go back as often as possible. The location is off the strip, but we actually prefer that.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: bobbilly209
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend at the Orleans Hotel and Casino. Check in staff was very efficient, courteous, and professional. The room was spacious and clean. The casino is vast and sapcious, with the dealers very friendly and funny. The wait staff was always there and you never had to wait long for a drink. The place has a wide variety of excellent restaraunts with good selection of food. There is a cinema complex with 18 theatres and a 24 hour bowling alley. The arena is right next door and I attended a fast paced, action filled professional hockey game. Every seat in the arena is a good one. Its a great place for singles, couples and families with plenty to do. If you want to venture over to the Vegas strip, the Orleans provides a shuttle bus every 15 minutes to take you there at no cost.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans is the perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: smithwis
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vegas at least 3-4 times a year and for the last few years always stay at The Orleans. If we have the teenagers with us there is plenty for them to do with movies and bowling and if it is just the two of us even better. Big Al's Oyster Bar is the best restaurant in Vegas. The rooms are always clean and well arranged and the service staff is always friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans Once Again Had a Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: airguy
Reviews.Content: Once again, I had a wonderful stay at the Orleans. The check-in was fast and smooth, the young lady had a very nice smile and pleasant personality and assigned me to a spacious room with an incredible view of the Strip. The room was nicely decorated, clean, and quiet. I had a most relaxing stay. All of the employees were friendly. I appreciate all of the eating options and the fitness center. While the pool area was open, I only went out there for a very brief dip in the hot tub, due to the temperature. While I had a car, I appreciated the shuttle service that was offered to the Strip. I left feeling rejuvenated, even if my wallet was a little lighter!

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans is the most comfortable and affordable Hotel/Casino.”
Reviews.Author: lovininvegas
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy visiting the Orleans when vacationing in Vegas. The restaurants and casino are my favorites.

Reviews.Title: “I come back to the Orleans again and again because its fabulous !”
Reviews.Author: michegal14
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Orleans for the very first time a number of years ago, and because of my great experience I always come back ! The rooms are always clean and kept that way. The restaurants always have great food, service and prices. The gaming has always been exceiting and everyone has always treated me with a smile. I love the shuttle that can also take us to The Strip if we want to see downtown. I always tell my friends and family about The Orleans because its such a wonderful establishment and the prices can fit just about anyones budget. I continue to come back to The Orleans because everything about it is fabulous! I highly recommend The Orleans to everyone !

Reviews.Title: “The Best Casino in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Leticiagh
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is the best casino for families and those who enjoy a relaxed and a care free atmosphere. My family and I stayed there and each family member from the teenagers to the adults had their own fun. The teenagers had their own night out which consisted of bowling, movies and arcade this is especially important because most casinos only direct their attention to adult oriented activities, while The Orleans has family oriented activities that can be done under one roof. This way I know the kids are save. Also for those families who have little one they have the best Day Care center in Vegas. My sister always use the day care center when she visits The Orleans. Love this place !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans is my home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: IFlySolo
Reviews.Content: Courtesy, friendliness, respect, efficiency--these are the descriptors for a fine hotel called the Orleans. Its allure is its people and its attention to detail. The casino is gambler-friendly and the rooms are a treat for visitors from across the U.S.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas 09”
Reviews.Author: CauleneL
Reviews.Content: We always stay here. Very nice atmosphere and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at The Orleans Hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: JenniferS10
Reviews.Content: Off the strip cheap fun! The rooms are nice and there is a huge variety of places to eat. Fun atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans Not the Stardust but...........”
Reviews.Author: redlegmich
Reviews.Content: We really enjoy the Orleans, a lot of the people and our host are from the great old Stardust. The only complaint we have is with the players club. It is geared to the local market and makes no provisions to obtain a higher tier rating for out-of-towners. It's very difficult (and expensive) to become high ranking.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay at The Orleans very much!”
Reviews.Author: gmapam1
Reviews.Content: The Orleans has a lot of very nice and helpful employees. The rooms and restaurants are also very nice. We will be staying there again on our future trips to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Value, Wonderful Staff, Great Decor, Slots Pay Off, A Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: JazzCruise
Reviews.Content: We loved loved loved the Orleans! Staff is cheerful and professional. Large, comfortable, nicely decorated room with a fabulous view of the strip. Mardi Gras decor of the hotel is charming and fun. Slots pay much better than many casinos. Great jazz band in the pub with many local musicians sitting in. Appreciated the daily ten minute internet access. Hotel and room were very clean and casino was not too smoke filled. Two minor complaints: 1. coffee maker in room is a one cup deal so if you like coffee bring your own coffee maker & coffee & 2. shuttle to the strip had one very sour driver who on numerous occasions would not even acknowledge a friendly hello. Shuttle service IS excellent, drops you in the Bellagio/Bally's area. We actually appreciated the fact that the Orleans was off strip, the energy is far less frenetic than on the strip. All in all the Orleans is a fantastic bargain and when we return we will not stay any where else!

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Hotel in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Outoftownlocal
Reviews.Content: The Orleans Hotel & Casino is the best place to stay in all of Las Vegas. I have been vacationing in Las Vegas for 21 years and have stayed at many different hotels, but only began to stay at the Orleans during the last 2 years. I discovered that being off the strip is a good thing and enjoying your stay in a hotel is most important. I love gambling at the Orleans and very seldom have the desire to gamble elsewhere. Give the hotel a try, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: redbirdlefty46
Reviews.Content: The value at the Orleans is the best in Las Vegas. The gaming is tops and the people are great. You can spend a lot more on the strip and get less.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: KimG1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and secure. The staff was very helpful and there was lots to do as a family, on site. The selection of cafes and resturants was excellent, and the shuttle to the strip was on time and clean

Reviews.Title: “an amazing value”
Reviews.Author: HaitiNorthDakota
Reviews.Content: I compared around to find a hotel that met my needs. I wanted child care center on site, coffee maker in room, cheap buffet. I found those at Orleans plus much more. The rooms were adorable; cute deco and nice to have sitting area with sofa. Check in and out was fast and easy. Fun specials after midnight in coffee shop like steak & eggs for $4. One did we did the all day wrist band for $21 at buffet and the best selling point on that is that you jump ahead of everyone standing in lines to be seated right away. Shuttle to and from the strip worked nicely for us.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, but has a few tradeoffs”
Reviews.Author: Goldwing521
Reviews.Content: Our stay totaled three nights. The first one we payed for at roughly $35 for a king NS room. The next two nights were comp'd as part of a limited-time offer promotional package. So the room costs were quite low. The room was very large. The king bed was very firm and somewhat noisy. We did not have many problems with noise from rooms around us. TV channel selection is extremely poor; they definitely do not want you spending your time in the rooms. There is no wireless network coverage in the rooms themselves. There is free wireless in the coffee shop in the Casino area. There is cabled network available in the rooms, but it cost about $13 per 24 hour period. Several restaurants inside the hotel to choose from. We ate twice (breakfast and dinner) at the French Market buffet, which was very good. This hotel is about a half mile or so from the strip; I wouldn't plan on walking there. There is free outdoor parking available, but it can be quite a walk from the parking lot to the room elevators. Had spotty service from various staff. All were friendly, but sometimes slow to respond (bellboy) or otherwise just not helpful in resolving some issues (registration). Very nice fitness center with well-maintained equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Still a Good Value”
Reviews.Author: sammymd
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been staying at the Orleans for a number of years. They have recently replaced all of their carpet in the casino area, they continue to remodel and expand. This is a very clean, well run casino. Housekeeping has always been excellent. The buffet, and other restaurants are always very good, and a lot cheaper than on the strip. We were disappointed that their shuttle no longer drops off at Bill's, but now goes to Tropicana. As with all casino's, the main casino area's allow smoking. It is well ventilated, and doesn't bother me, unless I'm sitting right next to someone. Good variety of slots, and table games. I would highly reccomend the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay for family and friends.”
Reviews.Author: annette50LasVegas
Reviews.Content: The Orleans hotel and casino is an excellent place to stay even with children. The room is very spacious, beds are very comfortable, very clean and the service is excellent. We surely be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected for the price”
Reviews.Author: kickie10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans for an evening, and were not really impressed, especially with the bed. It was one of the most uncomfortable hotel beds we'd ever had, might as well have slept on the floor! The Orleans is also over a mile from the strip, not something we were aware of when we booked it. There were closer, better, cheaper rooms on the strip itself. The New Orleans theme is mainly on the outside of the hotel, once inside, it's pretty much a standard hotel, which was disapointing. There are a couple of things that make it not completely terrible, the room was large & clean, and if we'd wanted to see a movie, they have their own theater. But I wouldn't go back mainly because of the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: Walleye9
Reviews.Content: The Orleans has it all! We enjoy staying at the Orleans for their great staff and accommodations. No need to run all over Las Vegas as the gaming is fun and has great variety. Great selection of restaurants and the Orleans staff is always friendly and accommodating. We won't stay anywhere else but the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressive Orleans Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HCTKBT
Reviews.Content: This is one hotel in Las Vegas to stay away from . It's off the Strip, but that's no reason to provide a low level of comfort, cleanliness and service. I am not really a gambler so cannot comment on the Casino but the word seedy comes to mind. The most disturbing feature of the Casino was the payday check cashing desk with a long lineup and people in line who clearly could not afford to lose their weekly paycheck! I had the overall feeling that the room I had was not all that clean. The carpets were certainly not clean while the room seemed to be falling into disrepair. I would never stay there again, nor would I recommend that anyone stay there give the much more appealing options on the Strip that aren't necessarily that much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: DSchmidtNekoosa_Wi
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth time we've stayed there over the last 5 years and have found the hotel the best value for the price. The rooms are clean as is the hotel itsself. Check-in and check-out when smoothly and we encountered no problems with billing or our reservations. If your looking for luxury stay at one of the high price hotels on the strip as this hotel is not the Palms, Rio, Ventian, etc. and doesn't pretend to be. But for the price I don't think one can find a better hotel. Yes, it's off the strip but one also doesn't have to put up with the rush and crowds that wonder into the other casinos on the strip. Let's just say it gives you that small town feeling in a big city. The price is great as we got two nights comp and only paid $42.00 a night for the other two nights, granted it was Sunday thru Thursday but I couldn't find a hotel on the strip offering comparable pricing. Every year we say we're going to try another hotel on the strip but we keep coming back to the Orleans because of the price, service and cleanliness of the rooms. The rooms are not the fancy luxury rooms you find on the strip but who spends alot of time in the room except to sleep. I can guarantee you if the rooms were not clean we'd be staying somewhere else. The pool is nothing fancy but serves the purpose. We did find the casino area more smoky this time than our previous visits for whatever reason. We only ate at Fridays, the Courtyard cafe and the Market buffet at which the food and service was fine for the price, but I'm not a great fan on buffets. After many years I've come to the conclusion it's not one casino or the other that pays better but the slot machine you happen to be on as I've won on some of the slots and lost on others, it all comes down to luck. They have cut back on staff as I didn't see the cocktail girls come around as often as before while playing the slots. If you stay during the weekdays they also have limited live entertainment but we took the shuttle down to the strip and went to some of the other expensive hotels to watch the lounge shows. Like I said before if your looking for a luxury hotel and every amenity stay in one of the expensive strip hotels but if your looking for a clean, inexpensive, and friendly hotel the Orleans will fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: lanavictoria
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is just off the strip. The staff is mostly a friendly one. The Check-in was a bit cold by the little girl at the counter , she looked bored and un-interested in us as a paying guest and she delt with us in like fashion. This would have been a great op for The Orleans to shine. At this time we should have been told where everything was and the rules (including the 5.00 per day resort fee) The in-room cost of internet (which is 12.99 per day) however you can acess it at Seattle'ss Best for free. She should also have told us that the security guard at the elevators would check our right to be in the hotel portion of the casino. I Knew about this only from Trip Advisor. But I would rather have them check it. The only time we were checked was at shift change, otherwise we were free to come and go - you just need to say hello to security on your way too and from so that they will remember you. The Orleans has a shuttle that will take you to the strip. It runs from 9am to 12:30 am and picks up about every 10 min. If you prefer a cab: cost from the MGM Grand to the hotel was only 6.50 (remember to tip) The French market buffet is amazing and fairly inexpensive. You can buy a wristband for all three meals for the cost of dinner and lunch. If you don't go for any other reason - go for the desserts. Those are worth the cost alone. All the staff on the floor were very helpfull. from the maids to the food court to the cocktail waitresses on the floor. I would highly recommend The Orleans. The decor alone is different from the rest of the casino - and fun. Rooms are very clean and exactly as pictured. No bait and switch going on here. Coffe pot is actually a single serve pod brewed into a cup. Safe didn't have any instructions (again check-in should have explained) Beds clean and comfortable. Very little noise could be heard by near-by quest rooms. Some of the rooms have great views of the strip. Parking is on an open muli-level structure, Walking to room with 5 bags was a bit of a pain but they do have a valet. Very secure and is patrolled. Pool area is pretty but closes at 6pm. Hot tub is circular and has a nest of palm trees in the center. Cabana's are available and the lifeguards are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: mckc2420
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas is in general FAST, we find The Orleans a much needed relaxing property. The Orleans has all the amenities of any of the large resorts, but with a homey touch. The Prime Rib at the "Rib Loft" is to die for, and at an extremely reasonable price. I highly recomend The Orleans, but to be selfish would prefer to keep it my secret get away.

Reviews.Title: “Getting run down”
Reviews.Author: Nathug_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Orleans from November 4-8, 2009. The hotel is getting pretty run down for the price. The room was clean and comfortable except for the air conditioning. The room would not get cold enough for us at night (only down to around 70) and the air conditioning unit ran all night and was very loud. I think there are better buys elsewere.

Reviews.Title: “another POSITIVE for the ORLEANS”
Reviews.Author: deandesperado
Reviews.Content: Once again, great stay at the ORLEANS. service great, drinks great, staff friendly and helpful. brunch on sunday has improved imo, my meal at the oyster bar was part very good and part ok. love the chowder, crap salad was blah. i will continue to stay at the ORLEANS. I would only suggest after reading other reviews is to have a vehicle or stay on the STRIP if u are a VEGAS first timer.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans offers the best service and the best value to their customers.”
Reviews.Author: Donna51119
Reviews.Content: The people at the Orleans are all very friendly, courteous and helpful with anything you need. Our stay was very comfortable and we had a great time too.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Clear Of This Dump”
Reviews.Author: peaches321
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a dump. My husband and I decided last minute that we wanted to go to Vegas on a Friday night, The hotel is in an awful part of town, with strip clubs and sleazy sex stores. The smell of sewage, as you drive into the location will blow you away. We thought this would be an affordable clean place due to the reviews on Tripadvisor. When we entered the hotel room I was totally disappointed. The room is dark, the bed and the pillows are hard and uncomfortable. The shower was clogged, and the water came up to mid leg. The sink was clogged as well and the safe didin't work. If you are on a tight budget and don't care about the room, the sleezy location, and the clientele this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “We've visited Las Vegas many times and the Orleans has become our favourite place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Vancouver_BCCinnamon
Reviews.Content: We enjoy the Orleans because it is located off the strip away from the excessive crowds. We love to walk during the day and we can do so without being jostled by hundreds of people. When we do want to visit the strip we can use the Orleans free shuttle. We like the food at the Orleans and during our recent visit of ten days we ate at another casino only once. The Orleans has great slots and a variety of video poker machines which are our favourites. Our room was spacious and comfortable and the service staff always manged to have it made up before our return from breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “I had the time of my life and staff couldn't have been more friendly or helpful!”
Reviews.Author: BrinaChicago
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Orleans ever since Stardust left. I love it. The staff are the best, so friendly and helpful. This was the best trip ever. Hit Royal, 4 Aces and 4 Wild 2's not the same day of course, but this trip. They have such a variety of slots, video poker and tables. My whole extended family had a blast, and the security man new us all by the end of the trip. He could tell us who was up in the rooms or down in the casino. They are the BEST!!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD TIMES...GOOD TIMES!”
Reviews.Author: Vegasbeauty
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas to celebrate my birthday late October. The Orleans is my favorite hotel. Check in/out took 5 minutes. The staff is friendly and the waitressess are always making sure you have a drink. The maids were awesome (tip your maids). The rooms are HUGE and you get a coffee maker! Love the window in the bathroom. The Orleans is off the strip which is a nice change from the "craziness" of the strip. The Orleans has a shuttle that runs frequently that will take you to their sister property (Gold Coast) and the strip. I had so much fun at the Orleans and the tables were VERY good to me for my birthday! I can't comment on the food because we mainly hit the 24 food court (which was good). I can't wait to return in June. Orleans ROCKS!

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans has everything”
Reviews.Author: M0mS
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Orleans many times and have never been disappointed. You won't find a better value in Las Vegas and we had stayed many places before deciding the Orleans is tops. We love the in-room coffee and how accommodating the housekeeping staff is to make sure we have coffee, towels, or what ever we need. The valet staff has always been quick and helpful and if you want to see real value go to the Courtyard Cafe. Where else can you get a midnight breakfast of steak, eggs, hashbrowns, and toast for $3.99? They are open 24 hours with inexpensive great meals. The buffet has all you want and more, and if you are looking for upscale dining, they have that too. The Orleans is one great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: wen_c82
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many different 'stars' hotels in Las Vegas, from downtown to the strip. Orleans has become our ‘go to’ hotel in Las Vegas. The staff is friendly and efficient, room is good size and well-maintained. We never had to call for service before until this recent trip. After we got into our room we noticed that the smoke alarm was beeping and a light bulb was out. Then we needed extra blankets. All these issues were handled within less than 10 minutes. We appreciated the prompt response. I guess the only down side is the air cond/heating unit. It could be a bit noisy. You can get free WIFI at Seattle best coffee. We always drive to Las Vegas so don’t mind the off strip location. It seems everyone drives in Vegas anyway. There is a shuttle bus to the strip if you don’t have a car.

Reviews.Title: “October Getaway”
Reviews.Author: dunerNebraska
Reviews.Content: We escaped to a favorite vacation spot in October and as usual stayed at the Orleans in Las Vegas. The Orleans can always be counted upon for a good time, good food and fune atmosphere to enjoy. The rooms are always clean and the staff friendly and receptive to your needs. Staying at the Orleans has become part of a tradition when visiting Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the size of the room”
Reviews.Author: soccerboyzmom
Reviews.Content: The room at the Orleans is freshly remodeled and big enough to be called a Suite. The maid staff is efficient and maintains a cleanly room. The price is wonderful for what you get. It is far enough from the stip to avoid traffic and has a shuttle that drops you in the middle of the strip and runs every half hour. You can also get a taxi from the hotel which are plentiful. I loved my stay and am going back again since you can earn reward points.

Reviews.Title: “TOP PLACE WITH KIDS OFF STRIP”
Reviews.Author: Topbloke68
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights off strip due to holidaying with the kids 12,10,7. We paid $36 per night and a bit more on Friday. Had to have two rooms as occupancy max. is 4 people. Still at this price who cares. The rooms are decked out in New Orleans fashion and are very clean and quite spacious. About a mile off the strip, but hotel has free shuttle bus. It can be a little hard to get on the shuttle with a party of five The pool area is awesome and includes a bar, plenty of restaurants in the casino, bowling lanes and cinema. Casino stinks of smoke, but they all do. The rooms did not smell of smoke at all! Highly recommended for families - not as big as other casinos on strip

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideNev
Reviews.Content: This is our third year in a row at the Orleans and the experience has always been very enjoyable. The value was as good as it gets. Bud lights for $2 for most of our stay & the wine at TGIF was half price on Monday & Tuesday. We were there for 8 nights and we came back to the Orleans for our night meals every night. The resturants were all excellent quality, particulary The Loft & TGIF. Shuttle to the strip this year went to the Tropicana, which was a bit of a pain, but before we left we were told that it was changing back to Bill's Gambling Hall which is more central. Can't wait to get back as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Try this place!”
Reviews.Author: vegas94Missouri
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans for a single night on a seven night stay in Vegas. We are Vegas regulars (3 to 5 time annually) and usually stay at the Golden Nugget. We had a night comped to us at the Orleans so we spent our second night there. We were very impressed with the quality of this property. The rooms are large with a great view. The entire hotel is very clean and well kept. The food offering onsite is very good. The movie theatre and bowling alley are also nice touches. The casino has a great vibe to it. After many trips downtown, we are considering making the Orleans our new home base when in town. Give it a try, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “"Relaxing & enjoying Las Vegas via the Orleans Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Geneho
Reviews.Content: This past June my wife and I decided to celebrate our 50th wedding anniversary in Las Vegas. We chose the Orleans Hotel because of the entertainment at the show room and the pleasurable experience with previous visits. We were really surprised when we received a telephone call from Anthony Taeubel VP&GM of the Orleans. Mr. Taeubel just called our home to congratulate us on "50 years of marriage". We enjoyed our visit in June and this past October. In our opinion the Orleans Hotel provides a friendly and courteous atmosphere with good food, clean rooms and excellent service. Needless to say we will be sure to make repeat visits to the Orleans.....

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladymdragon
Reviews.Content: Orleans is great if you have kids, there are lots of activities. They have a a really nice Pool and Spa. Parking is easily accessible. The Buffet is really reasonable in price and the food is good.

Reviews.Title: “This is a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TopekaDucky
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 1 or 2PM on a Saturday and had no wait, and the desk clerk was attentive to my request for a room away from the noise of ice machines and elevators. I even told her we were more concerned about quiet than a view, but our room faced toward the strip and was really nice at night. I like the little window in the shower (just like the sister property, Gold Coast), and the room was like a suite with a nice couch and table for us to sit and read the paper...also a coffee maker in the room. We requested a King/Non-smoking and did receive our request...and the room was clean and in good condition. The casino is large, and we usually eat once each trip since they have a 2 for 1 at the buffet, but we also received several coupons at check-in to use on their property. We always have a rental car, but there is also shuttle service to the Gold Coast (and I think the strip) for those without cars.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Oregonjt
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Orleans. The price was the best we could find for a large property. The check in and check out was fast and easy. We were really impressed with the size of the room. Everything was clean. I don't think you could find a better view than what we had on the 18th floor looking at the entire strip. The food choices were very good. We enjoyed going the the Orleans Arena to check out the Las Vegas Wranglers Hockey game. Very nice arena and it's right at the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “beat value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Harmony1961
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans for 6 nights. While it may not have all the flair of some of the Hotels and Casino's on the strip, our stay there was fantastic. It was very clean, the food was great, the staff was friendly, and it has the best pool area, even better than those on the strip. There is a free shuttle to the strip which is only 7 min away. There is a huge bowling alley, movie theater, gym, spa. I would stay there again if I am ever in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “take this place if you go to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ltagne
Reviews.Content: This place is definatelly the best value for money we've had. If you arrive Sunday through Thursday and book or prolong directly at the reception, they charge you only 35 USD + tax (whic is only 4,2). What a great deal! So for 40 USD incl. tax pr. night you get a big room, big bathroom, all clean, money box, TV (with around 20 channels) and many things to do. And many of the rooms have a view to the mountains - ours did as well. No breakfast is included in the price, but for 8,10 USD incl. tax you get a full buffet. Or else, you can take All-you-can-eat for a day for around 24 usd incl. tax, but our experience shows that if you got a full breakfast (they serve it until 10.30, where it changes to lunch buffet) you won't need lunch at all:) The place also had a couple of other restaurants, and only in 1 of them the staff was friendly and smily. They also offer fast food stations, if you're up for that, but it's not cheap compared to the buffet, where it's a lot of choice. The place is not near the strip, but they have a free shuttle that runs every 20 min to the center of the Strip. It takes max 10min, and I wouldn't pay 50 USD more just to stay closer to that. It really went easy with the shuttle. The casino is huge, both smoking and non-smoking areas available. They have movies and bowling, which we haven't tried. Very nice pool, actually 3 of them - regular OK big, childrens pool and a warm spa pool, really nice, not small at all. Free parking. Internet is only free at the coffee shop. Otherwise they charge you 12 USD pr. day. The only minus was that the waiters at the buffet (breakfast/lunch and dinner acailable) DO NOT smile. As if they don't have a good day every day:) We stayed there for 4 nights (although only planned 1 from the beginning), so we can compare. Definatelly great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: FearlessFitz
Reviews.Content: I've made the Orleans a base of operations for annual trips since they opened in 1996. The staff is the friendliest in all of Las Vegas, and the rooms are quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value...”
Reviews.Author: hellraiser01951
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas and we booked this hotel from their web site. Got and excellent deal for the time of the year. big room,friendly room attendants. They have 3 pools,about 9 restaurants,most are for fast food or buffet. The nice restaurants (2) are very good for service and food.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Food, Good Time”
Reviews.Author: smilinice
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well worth the value for what you get. Rooms are a good size and bathroom area is generous and well maintained. Locals come to this hotel for the buffet so you know if the locals flock here there is a reason. There is a shuttle that takes you to the Gold Coast or Tropicana Hotel. Love the 18 screen Century Theatre in the hotel as well as the bowling alley. Lots for families to do here. Only complaint is that the casino smells of cigarette smoke. Good size swimming pool and deck area. It looks like the pool has been remodelled recently.

Reviews.Title: “Best steak in town, lowest prices for suites in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: elle0077
Reviews.Content: I have stayed and seen many rooms and hotels during my various Vegas excursions, but The Orleans is always a favorite. The rooms are cheap and clean compared to the others in their price range and are all "mini suites" with a nice sitting area. We randomly went to Canal Street, a restaurant inside the hotel and were served the best steak we have ever had in Vegas and the prices again are very reasonable. (We also dined at Brand Steakhouse on the strip and found Canal Street to be much better.) Other favorite places to eat: Mesa Grill, Earl of Sandwich, TGI Fridays.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & quiet place, good for kids”
Reviews.Author: curlcat2009
Reviews.Content: Spacious room with coffee pot, free shuttle bus to strip. Maybe not a good choice for people like to stay in strip.

Reviews.Title: “good for your money”
Reviews.Author: Kiinani
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in May with myself, my husband and two adult daughters in their early twenties. Shared a room - which was very spacious - more than enough for the four of us. Enjoyed the buffet downstairs using the buy one get one free and paid only $5 for a great lunch! This hotel is off the Strip and not downtown so we rented a car to get around. The hotel offered free parking - just a warning the parking lot was enormous and it took us several days to figure out where was the best place to park.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic inexpensive fun”
Reviews.Author: Hooterman
Reviews.Content: Second time to stay, although this time had to have handicap room. It was great, clean, the beds comfortable and the handicap bathroom was a bonus! Love the slots (won big), buffet was okay, but for the price outstanding compared to other buffets on the strip. Overall, pleasant staff, clean comfortable rooms, great casino and didn't break the bank. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place”
Reviews.Author: biscuitboogie
Reviews.Content: No complaints. Beds good (and bouncy, LOL), roomy and clean. We had our own car, so location was not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great casino hotel”
Reviews.Author: robinwest
Reviews.Content: rooms are large, comfortable and clean. no more dirty bedspreads, they now have crisp white bedcovers and they change them everyday. very quiet. ask for a room near the elevator, the halls are very long.

Reviews.Title: “honeymoon trip to vegas”
Reviews.Author: jaminsmonster
Reviews.Content: rooms were nice & spacious, everything you need under one roof! Movie theater, bowling alley, shows, buffet, steak house, starbucks, subway, etc! They had shuttle running all the time which we took down to the strip. Loved the pool & hot tub

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: almagutten
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in September 2009. No complains at all.Clean and comfortable room and friendly staff. Used the pool every day and also tried the food at French Market Buffet and Don Miguels and they all were really nice.

Reviews.Title: “A great off-strip value.”
Reviews.Author: vwaldoguy
Reviews.Content: While celebrating my wife's 40th birthday, we decided to stay off-strip at the Orleans Hotel. The hotel was great, very clean, the room was very nice, and overall, it was a great value over staying at a higher-priced location on the Strip. We did get a renovated non-smoking room on the 13th floor, which had a nice view of the north Strip. Room was awesome, very comfortable, and better than our own bedroom at home. The room had a king bed, a couch, a chair, great bathroom, no complaints at all. The hotel offers a shuttle to the strip, actually there are 2 busses that make a loop to the Tropicana, the Gold Coast, and the Orleans, and they follow each other about 20 minutes apart. Got a breakfast buffet every morning for $5.49 (with a club card discount), how can you beat that? There is a $5/day resort fee, but that covers use of an in-room safe (loved it), in-room coffee (used it every day), 10 minutes of Internet access in the business center and use of the fitness center. I knew it going in, no big deal. The slots seemed very tight though, and we had no luck on the tables, but that's not the hotel's fault. Overall, don't really have anything negative to say, would definitely recommend this to a friend, and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Attention Walmart Shoppers, this place is a good deal”
Reviews.Author: ElGuapo49
Reviews.Content: I have stated at the Orleans Hotel and Casino at least 60 times in the last 5 years. I stay here not because I like it, I do not, but it is a good value. This is a large hotel and casino with a big gaming floor, multiple restaurants, room service, pool, gym, business center, gift shop, bowling alley, etc. It is, "off strip" meaning not in the center of the Vegas action. You get a better deal here on rooms but if you get bored with it you can't enjoy the option of walking to the next hotel like you could on strip. Walking to the main Vegas attractions is not practical, too far for many, goes though some not so nice areas, Vegas is hot in the summer and cold and windy in the winter, so you need a cab. The hotel and casino are ajacent to the Arena so very convienient if you want to see a particular show or event there.The personality of the clients in the hotel can vary significantly depending on if there is motorcycle racing, rodeo, basketball, or concert going on at the arena. The rooms are spacious with work desk and in room coffee. The maids seem to do a organized job of cleaning. All that said, THIS PLACE IS TACKY! Being a "value" hotel it attracts the Walmart group. If you want to impress your girlfriend go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more”
Reviews.Author: ltcjdc
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is truly a budget hotel off the strip. I expected more after reading positive reviews in Trip Advisor. The bargain side of the Orleans is balanced by the inconvenience of taking the shuttle to the strip whenever you want to be in the middle of the action. There's not much at the Orleans. The restaurants are okay, but not exceptional. None are a real value except the buffet. The gambling is not loose. I won nothing on the video poker or slots, but did win when I went to Harrah's and the Troipicana. The Orleans needs to make something, like payouts, exceptional to attract customers.
