Also, there are no shows during the week. You still have to go to the strip for entertainment. Kids have things to do if they like the pool, the bowling alley, and arcades. I would stay away from this bargain and instead look for a bargain on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Very dirty”
Reviews.Author: cole123LasVegas
Reviews.Content: The hallways and rooms had a terrible sewage smell during our family's 4 day visit. In our room there was someone else's shavings left in the sink when we checked in and when I went to dry my face with a towel, I noticed on the inside of it, there were make up stains all over it. When housekeeping cleaned our room (if that's what they call it) they didn't empty our trash. They closed the pool area at 6:30 pm on a Saturday night for a private party ( which I might add did not even use the pool). All guests pay alot of money including a $5.00 a day resort fee which is for the workout room, the pool, and other services and It's crap that paying guests can't even use the pool at a time that they obviously had a high volume of guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great and Decent Hotel if on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: laurah1888
Reviews.Content: Here is a 25 year old and 27 year old Married couple's review from Scotland, UK :) This is our second time at The Orleans (both times stayed in September) and as usual a very pleasant stay. Loved it! The rooms are big, always kept very clean and maid service is done daily and are friendly. The hotel rooms are a little dated however at £29 per night (dependant on time of year) who can complain. The hotel has everything you need, 11 restuarants, bowling alley, cinema, arcade, good gambling tables and 3 pools to name but a few. The pool area is good, has everything you need inlcuding big pool, baby pool and jacuzzi and the drinks are reasonably priced, throughout the hotel also. Food good, although due to the large portions and the heat we tended to only eat two meals a day if that. We also noticed the new carpets throughout the casino area, more staff at check in and the casino is not as smokey, Staff were always helpful and friendly. The only downside is the location. Last year and up until the 14th september this year(luckily as we left a few days later) the free courtesy bus has changed. It used to drop you off at Bills across from the Bellagio where all the action is and was very frequent, every 10 minutes or so as there was a few of them and the bus journey took 5 minutes. However after the 14th September this year the bus now drops you off at the Tropicana and picks you up less frequent, every half hour or so and takes alot longer, half hour or so dependant on traffic (which in vegas is busy busy 24/7). There is an upside as the Tropicana is right next to MGM, NewYork NewYork, Monte Carlo and a short walking distance to Mandalay Bay and Luxor. We done all that in one day and night. In my opinion though your better of at the Bellagio, Paris, Caesars, Flamingo, Planet Hollywood, Mirage, Treasure Island etc end. The strip is only 4 or so miles long however with traffic, lights and roadworks going on itll take you an hour and a half to get from the Mandalay Bay to Freemont Experience. Same as last year, we tended to get the free bus to the Bellagio area and back and a taxi to the top end of the strip (south end, Mandalay Bay etc) which cost roughly $12. There is sooo much to do in Vegas and have stayed here twice for 2 weeks both times and have still never seen everything. What we did do is 3 shows and loads of shopping. Mystere @ Treasure Island is a must!!! It was brilliant. Also went to see K.A @ MGM which was still good but not worth the money in my opinion and went to see Steve Wyrick @ Planet Hollywood. He was good and quite funny. All in all great value for money and cant complain really. As always loved our stay and would return to The Orleans although think we might try the strip next time however would come back!

Reviews.Title: “what a great stay”
Reviews.Author: ytownwolf
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great. Room was clean, spacious and nicely decorated. The staff was very friendly. The food at the Prime Loft and Canal Street Cafe was outstanding. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: topher91
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed a couple nights at the Orleans after receiving an online offer that included a number of extras with our stay. We were skeptical but we decided to give it a chance after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. Let me tell you - this is one hidden gem! This is a fantastic hotel with a clean atmosphere, tons of things to do, and at a price that can't be beat! The hotel features a newly renovated front casino exterior, but the actual hotel (usually not pictured) is older and dated. The rooms are a great size and include everything you need. The bed and room decor are quite modern and tastful. The television was a standard CRT tube but we didn't watch any. The hotels are almost the size of some suites, featuring a full bathroom, 2 beds, television stand, dresser, and night table. The rooms also have a nice sitting area with a loveseat and coffee table and chair, which is a nice touch and gives you an idea of room size. The hotel features a number of reasonably priced franchise restaurants, including Subway, Sbarro, Fuddruckers and Seattles Best Coffee Shops, amongst others. The Subway and Fuddruckers open 24 hours a day, which is nice for a late night snack. There is also a buffet for $7.99, which features a large selection of average buffet foods. There was nothing spectacular but also nothing that I disliked at the buffet. Other restaurants include TGI Fridays, the Prime Rib Loft, Big Al's Oyster bar, and Courtyard Cafe. A lot of selection for a relatively unknown hotel! I have a couple of complaints about the hotel: When we arrived we were met by a front desk clerk who was relatively cold and unfriendly. I find that this is an immediate turn-off, especially because they are the first face you see. Secondly, there is no free internet in the rooms. As I've written before, this bothers me because its a feature that so many other hotels offer at no cost. The hotel does offer free internet at Seattles Best, which was nice because I was able to enjoy a decent coffee and do my work online in a good setting. Overall, I was very happy with this hotel and would stay again. I wouldn't stay for more than $50/night because there are other options that are nicer for that price right on the strip, but on a sale or promotion I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying...especially if you're on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: imani_28
Reviews.Content: I'm gonna make it simple: Pros: - Price - Very large and clean rooms with sitting area - Full-length mirror (definitely comes in handy when going out) - Movie theater and bowling alley on property - Very fairly priced buffet with pretty good food - Free shuttle to the strip that left very frequently - The pool area was a bit dull but clean and we never had a problem getting chairs. Cons: - Closet is in the bathroom (not sure why that made sense to somebody) - Poor water pressure in shower - Casino full of smokers (even in nonsmoking section!) so we couldn't gamble there. - The fact that the shuttle ends at 12AM (seems late but isn't late enough in Vegas) - The $5 resort fee per night for the fitness center, etc. is ridiculous since we didn't use it. Overall, it is definitely a hotel worth staying in and would go back in a heartbeat if the price stays low. Can't beat the price and it isn't too far from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “not so good!”
Reviews.Author: macoswife
Reviews.Content: The hotel it self was clean. The room was a little out dated, but you get what you pay for. The beds were comfortable and the service was fine. The bad part about this hotel was the people that hang out here. Very drunk and scary people at night. I'm not talking partiers either I'm talking drunk and creepy! There were times where I had to get up and leave just to get away from some of them. I difantly will never stay here again, sorry!! I'm going back to green Valley, first class all the way!

Reviews.Title: “So much fun”
Reviews.Author: Vanghus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans and had a great time. There was so much to do in and around the hotel. The pub across the street was fantastic. The location was great because we could drive down a side road and avoid all the trafic on the strip whenever we went there. We pretty much entertained ourselves for 4 days straight just at the Orleans there was lots to do and unpretentious. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: larryducati
Reviews.Content: I was staying in Vegas on business for the week. Enjoyed the spacious and quiet room. Individual A/C control is very precise. Small work desk, comfortable bed, safe to put my paperwork in, all very nice. 24 hour food or entertainment downstairs. Ate at Big Al's Oyster Bar downstairs. It had just been renovated and the food was outstanding. Ordered the gumbo and instead of spooning some out of a pre-made batch, the chef hand selects shrimp, chicken, sausage, vegetables, spices, and sauce and cooks your own serving in a small stainless pot. The pot is one of maybe 10 in a row that is used to cook each individual order as is comes in. They are all lined up in a row right at the bar. Fun to watch as each dish is prepared to order right in front of you. Best gumbo I have ever eaten. Worked on it for 20 minutes then had to ask for a to go box so not to waste a bite. Fabulous, and not too expensive. I always have to watch my expenses on the road, and I wish every place I stay was as good as the week spent here.

Reviews.Title: “Average Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RogerVegas
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is a good choice for budget travelers. This was a weekend get away. Check-in was smooth and my request for a King non-smoking was honored. I was able to check in on a Sunday at 2pm. The room is a nice size. It is clean but nothing special. I did notice my bedding had several rips in it. The only problem with the room layout is that the bathroom is by the window at the rear of the room so your bed is close to the door -- and you can hear all the noises of the hallway from screaming kids to drunks slamming doors. We ate at the Prim Rib Loft and it was good for the price of $14. Service was SLOW , SLOW, SLOW. I would rate this as average for Prime Rib but for the price and all that comes with it, not bad. The casino bars only had some ladies of the evening sitting at them and it was hard to get the bartender to serve a second round. That is how we ended up at TGI Fridays. Go there for drinks. Good prices, fast service and friendly bartenders. The casino bartenders could learn not chat up the cocktail waitress and serve the paying guests. We used the pool for one day and a cabana was only $50 -- offering bottled water, TV, fridge and a place out of the sun. However, I was promissed the large cabana and ended up the one the size of a closet that two people could bearly sit in. The pool manager was not friendly, nice or courtous. She said, "Oh well" to me about the cabana and I even had spoken to her the day prior confirmed a larger cabana. Only food service is from Fudruckers and no cocktail service. You have to make it up to the bar yourserlf. The pool is not meant for swimming at 3ft deep but nice a for a dip and a great hot tub. Ordered room service for breakfast and the meal looked like it was taken off the buffett. Not expesive but quality left something to be said. They do not do an auto grad on the bill which is a nice surprise. Oversall this is an anverage clean hotel/casino. If you are looking for simple and clean away from the strip here you go!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: larjan
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to the Orleans and it was even better then the first.... Room was excellent and service from the front desk to any of the many restaurants was wonderful. It is well worth staying off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Jazz77
Reviews.Content: Colleagues and I attended a work conference here two years ago. The rooms were quiet and comfortable. We had a great time because the hotel offered everything a Vegas traveler would need. From the conference room to the hotels workout facility and pool to restaurants it has everything one would need. The hotel even offers a free shuttle to the strip just minutes away so having a car isn't even necessary. It's located on Tropicana and one mile west of Las Vegas Blvd. So, if your looking for value and a nice place to stay, I would highly recommend "The Orleans." It's even family friendly since it has movies and a bowling alley.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort/Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SHIP5182
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans Aug. 17-20. This was our first time at this location and we highly recommend this property. We had a standard King room on the 10th floor looking out at the strip for a great view. The room seemed fresh and updated with good housekeeping service and comfortable bed. We like the pool area, it is large and well maintained and not over crowded. The best part for us was that the pool is open untill 9:00 at night, we like to go swimming at night, most Las Vegas hotel pools close early. Free shuttle service takes you to Bills right at mid strip and pics up at the same location, very handy so we did not rent a car this trip. For food we ate at the breakfast buffet twice and was very good both times with large selection and very good fresh fruit choices all for about $6.00 each. I wanted to try the Prime Rib Loft but it it closed on Wednesday, so we ate at the Cafe/Coffee shop and was very good for the price. Overall this property is a great value, but too far to walk to the strip in the summer heat, but close enough to the strip with the free shuttle. If you don't have to stay on the strip I highly reccomend the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “A Reasonable Price to Pay”
Reviews.Author: StomWiltshire_UK
Reviews.Content: The Orleans offers very good rates and, for that, you get a reasonable room and reasonable service. It's certainly not the best hotel I've ever stayed in but it provides value for money. Also, because it is off The Strip it is quiet. During our stay, we weren't disturbed by other guests making a noise. The room we had overlooked The Strip, so that was another positive. The regular shuttle service which runs between The Orleans and The Strip means getting around is straightforward; the longest we had to wait for a bus was ten minutes. My one gripe about the room is that if we opened our bathroom window, there was a strong smell of cigarette smoke. We were on a non-smoking (high) floor and although I realise in Vegas you have to put up with smokers in the casinos, I don't want to share their habit in my hotel room! Some other reviews have referred to an unpleasant smell and this was noticeable on occasions - but it wasn't horrendous. The gym at the hotel is adequate - nothing outstanding but it has the basics. The pool area is clean and reasonably equipped - the music is intrusive but there's music everywhere in Vegas and I'm sure some people love this. We didn't have cause to complain about anything so we didn't have a huge amount contact with any employees during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Annual trip changing to semi-annual!!!”
Reviews.Author: akpghfan
Reviews.Content: We love The Orleans. We go every March to watch our Alaska Aces play the Wranglers with a big group from Anchorage. We always have a great time and never any complaints. The food, the pool, the gaming, the rooms, the HOCKEY... all are excellent. So now we are going Labor Day weekend for a quick getaway. Couda stayed anywhere but the Club Coast card sold us!!! It is a life-long tradition if I have any say in the matter!

Reviews.Title: “Orleans was a winner!”
Reviews.Author: Senor6
Reviews.Content: We needed a room for a few days prior to dropping of son at UNLV. Had stayed here many a times in recent years and this time did not disappoint. Room was clean and the little sitting area was a nice spot for a relaxing cocktail while watching Sportscenter. The pool area was busy, but not impossible to find an empty chair. Had used the fitness area on recent trips and this time I was miffed to hear that there is now a $10 service charge to use the locker rooms, jacuzzi and steam room. Did some gambling in the sportsbook and played some craps ($5 min.) and each time the empoyees were professional and friendly. Finally, didn't have to leave to get a nice meal at Al's oyster bar and the Garden cafe. Nice coupon which saved us a few bucks on breakfast one morning. Orleans is not the fanciest place in Vegas, but it continues to provide good value and a comfortable room away from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Sick of the strip? Try the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Jajeebee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans in Jan '09, while there were several conventions in town. Rates everywhere were ridiculous, but we got a good rate at the Orleans. I personally am over the "strip" (too much construction, high priced mediocre restaurants, high gambling limits, just overhyped in general). The Orleasn was just what I was looking for. a good mix of locals and down-to earth tourists, no flashy wanna-be high rollers or anything. There is a huge bowling alley if you like to bowl, open 24 hours. Restaurants are OK, but I would go else where if you want high end food. The salon is decent, gave me a great haircut for cheap. Didn't go to the pool, it was too cold out, but it looked nice. The shuttle to the strip is a nice option, rare to have a free shuttle in Las Vegas. Seamless (strip club) is right accross the street and turns into a night club around 3 or 4 AM. Seamless is a great club, nice girls, plenty of them, cozy and intimate. Just hit up the bell desk for some free passes. The rooms were large and clean, had a nice little corner lounge with couch and cofffee table. The casino bars are all great, very nice bartenders that will give you free drinks if you chat it up with them. Hookers seem to hang around the bars around midnight and they provide a certain level of visual goof-type entertainment (without giving them any money). If you aren't with your family (and why would you be in Vegas), and are sick of the strip, try the Orleans. It revived my love for Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Madmonk53
Reviews.Content: Wow what can I say, Been to Vegas several times but first in The Orleans. Very good service from the minute we arrived till we left. The room was clean and large with sitting area. The buffet was superb as were all the places we found to eat, TGI Fridays Etc. All day buffet ticket for $21, cant ask better than that. The casino can be a bit busy at the weekend but well worth a vist. Freshest casino I have been in. Although its a fair wee bit from the strip you dont feel to far away thanks to the shuttle bus that runs every 30 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Economical, Good for a little gambling”
Reviews.Author: Zog13
Reviews.Content: I spent a long weekend (Thurs-Sun) at the Orleans for a high school class reunion. The room was economically priced (especially compared to hotels on the Strip) and large. There are good selection of restuarants in the hotel. Nothing fancy, except maybe the steak house (but I didn't go there). The gambling is very well priced with $5 min bet Blackjack tables available most of the time. If you are willing to go without the opulent luxury of the Strip, but desire economical gambling this hotel is worth a look. It has an OK fitness center, and OK pool area. Nothing fancy.

Reviews.Title: “It is what is says it is”
Reviews.Author: gatordoc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a few days in August, in one of the newer renovated rooms. The room was not fancy but clean and reasonably new-looking. Nice selection of restaurants and we had a nice dinner at Al's Oyster Bar. The oysters were good and they even had clams on the half-shell! Chowder was good, but too thick, as is now the trend everywhere. Casino wasn't kind to me, but so it goes. We had our own car so distance from the strip wasn't really an issue for us, but it would be a bit of hike if you wanted to walk. Like other reviews, I wasn't happy with paying for internet access and the TV channel selection was far too limited. I had trouble finding a news station to see what was going on in the "real" world. I was also not pleased after having paid for my stay on-line via hotels.com, I was hit with a $5/day "resort fee". ????? All in all, fine for a place to set up camp for a while, not up to the level of the finer newer hotels, but okay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “This place is the BEST”
Reviews.Author: lethal77
Reviews.Content: There isn't anything bad you can say about this place. Check in staff, amazing, rooms, amazing, buffet, amazing, slots, paying, cocktail waitresses, always there. This is the best place to stay in Vegas, I have stayed at others, but always come back to The Orleans. The rooms with a Strip view are great and everytime we have asked for one at check in, we've got one, this time we were on the 19th floor. Rooms are big and VERY clean. The staff are helpful if you are to require additional things. The buffet is great, we tried at least 8 buffets in the time we are in Vegas, and The Orleans was the best. Great selection, nice and quiet and cheap. Plus you don't have to walk far to return to your room. Perfect. The slots pay out here and the Cocktail staff are always around and very quick to bring back your drinks. It is a great place. We got cheap rates via their website and are already planning my return trip in March next year. You must stay at The Orleans, it's off The Strip about a 3 minutes drive to corner where MGM, New York New York is. I hear it's a $10 cab ride to the Strip, but we had our own car. The parking is great close to the entrance and the Vallet is also good and quick. Great big pool which is pretty quiet, it's a great place to relax and unwind before hitting Vegas. I would recommend this to anyone going to Vegas, Best hotel in Vegas in my mind.

Reviews.Title: “Off-strip Orleans Outdoes”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustcrazy2
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to The Orleans (first one was 4 years ago) and our stay was for 4 nights. Check- in went smoothly. Had a choice between a renovated room without a good view vs. the older room with a great view. Opted for the newer room because how much time would you spend looking out your window? The differences were very noticeable. The newer rooms have the TV in an armoire vs. on top of the dresser drawers. The old large oval mirror which reminded me of the Snow White mirror is now replaced with a large rectangular one. The unique bathroom sliding door looks newer than the one we had 4 years ago. The bed is no longer covered with bedspreads—it has been updated to the way most hotels make their beds now—without a full bedspread. The first night, we noticed that the drain was very slow once you start the shower. Since it wasn’t an emergency and it was very late when we showered, I waited until morning to report it. Amazingly, maintenance came and cleared it within 10 minutes. I expect this quick service from a 5 star hotel, but not from a 3 star. I expected it to be fixed by the time we returned to the room. Kudos to them. Unfortunately, slots weren’t kind to me here although there is a good variety of them. Tables turned out better. Courtyard Café food was very reasonable and if you don’t want to indulge in lots of food, the café’s portion sizes are more than adequate. Appetizer portions can serve as lunch, especially the quesadilla. Shuttle to the strip was very convenient and we never had to wait very long. For the price, Orleans can’t be beat by what it offers.

Reviews.Title: “A Foul Experience Partially Redeemed”
Reviews.Author: AnotherHappyCamper
Reviews.Content: Recently I wrote a review of this hotel and casino (see "Great Tidal Wave of Sewage Stink"). My reflections on my experience there remain unchanged, and I never got a satisfactory explanation of why the place smelled so bad. (In fact, the information given to me by the vice president and general manager and the operations manager contradicts what they or other hotel officials told the Nevada State Department of Environmental Protection. But whatever) I'm just adding this note to report that the operations manager refunded about half of what I paid to stay at the hotel for five nights in July, bringing my per-night cost to just under $45. She was very nice on the phone and in a subsequent e-mail, so it's only fair to amend the record to show that at least one person at the Orleans Hotel and Casino is trying to do the right thing.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans does not reserve room types-only a room!”
Reviews.Author: butterfly4mom
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is a nice enough hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean. My problem came with check-in. We had been on an extended vacation through seven states, and decided to stay a night in Vegas. I called two days prior to make a reservation. My reservation was made directly with the hotel, and confirmed. I wanted 2 queens because our son was with us. Upon check-in I was told that I had a king in smoking. I said no I had a confirmed reservation for 2 queens non smoking. I was told that the Orleans does not guarantee a room type only a room. I told the clerk that I did indeed have a confirmed reservation and was told that the person made a mistake. They only reserve a room, not a type of room. This is ridiculous--I asked for a supervisor---also extremely rude--was told the same thing. Finally, after going round and round she finally found a room. I was told that I was displacing someone else. The first clerk had told me that it was first come first served on rooms. However, it was 3:30 and all rooms were gone??? The supervisor told me that I made reservations only two days prior and basically too bad.....She finally found a room. Interestingly it was the farthest room that one could possible get from the elevator. By the way, no one was in the rooms near us at all. Apparently they were not booked up. It seems to me when Vegas has lost money due to the economy, the hotels would want to make you happy. Not the Orleans. The supervisor and the clerk as well as the waitresses all seemed sad, mad, and generally unhappy. BEWARE! IF YOU STAY HERE YOU ARE ROLLING THE DICE AS TO WHAT TYPE OF ROOM YOU ARE GOING TO GET. REMEMBER--THE ORLEANS DOES NOT RESERVE ROOM TYPES ONLY ROOMS! Also, the hotel charges $12.99 for the internet for 24 hours????

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in Vegas for Families”
Reviews.Author: CarletonAlumnus
Reviews.Content: I hadn't been to Vegas in 15 years and never with kids. I relied heavily on TA forums and reviews so here is my contribution. First, our approach to the trip was to take a few days as a family, trying to balance kid-fun with some nightlife for mom and dad, all on the cheap. In retrospect, the correct hotel choice was key. After eliminating the Excalibur and Circus Circus, I ultimately decided between the MGM and the Orleans. The Orleans was a fraction of the cost ($150 for 4 nights!) plus the bowling alley, movie theater and free shuttle to the strip. These features and the good reviews here were the reason I chose it. I was never disappointed and neither was my wife nor my kids 15, 11, and 9. The only criticism I have is that I had reserved a non-smoking room many weeks in advance but upon arrival I was told there were none available. In fact, there was none available for days. Walking up to the room I was certain the smell would be overwhelming and certain to make us all nauseated. The reality was that the room had a slight odor that the kids didnt even notice. We left a small bathroom window open for the first day and that cleared the slight odor. The room was perfectly fine for 5; clean and comfortable. The only issue was that the sliding door to the bathroom sometimes had a loud, shrill squeek when moved. The kids were not impressed with the TV offering, no kid channels at all, TBS was the only one they somewhat liked. For food, we think we made out very well. The buffet breakfast is $6.50 per person but the 5 of us ate for less than $28 because children 7 and under pay a little less and we signed-up for the casino Club Card which got us discounts for EVERYTHING in the casino. The breakfast was a real deal because we went at 10:15 or so every day and the buffet changes to lunch between 10:30 and 10:45. So we had lots of options and the kids loved it. The food was quite good, but tending to be high carb, high fat. The brunch covered one of our two meals for the day. For the kids' dinner we took advantage of the Sbarro and Subway in the Orleans. $16 for 3 foot longs or $14 for a large pizza, using hotel coupons. We only used a cab once, when we came from the airport ($20). We frequently took the free shuttle that drops you at Bills and never had to wait more than 15 minutes, even when we couldn't make it onto the first bus (they seat 24 and no one is allowed to stand). One problem with the shuttle is that if you want to go to either end of the strip, you have a LONG walk, about 45 minutes from Bills to the MGM/NYNY/Excalibur. Probably longer to the Stratosphere. With a little planning, you can take advantage of the city bus system which runs very frequently and long hours. $4 gets an adult a 24 hour pass, $2 for kids. We took the bus back to the airport, transferring to the 109A at Maryland Parkway. We also went to the Pinball Hall of Fame which would have been a $30 cab ride each way. Using the casino's Club Card we got $10 in slot money, a free game of bowling, and free popcorn at the movie theater. I had a lot of trouble using the free internet at Seattle's Best until another patron told me to temporarily remove the firewall on my laptop. No problem connecting after that. We did check out the MGM which has the advantage of being on the strip. It also took 15 minutes to walk from the entrance to the pool (the same time it takes for the shuttle from the Orleans to the strip). From a room it would have been about 10 minutes but you have to go through half the casino. The MGM is also at the end of the strip so walking from an MGM room to the mid-strip Mirage, for example, would easily take 50 minutes. The Oreans is host to a lot of high school sports tournaments so it was FULL of kids. The fact that it is kid-friendly fits nicely with the fact that it is off-strip. Lots of people question bringing kids to Vegas and if you stay on the strip, its easy to see why. The Orleans is not like the strip and with all the affordable amenities, it really is the best place in Vegas for families. And, no, there was never a sewage smell.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Value - Comfy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Pool4ever
Reviews.Content: Travelled from the UK and we stayed at the Orleans Hotel for 14 nights and enjoyed it immensely. The room (on the 3rd floor) overlooked the pool and was spacious and comfortable. Cleaned each morning to a high standard. The buffet in the morning and evenings were excellent, with plenty of choice. Only problem was waiting for toast, as you had to queue with the people waiting for omelettes (no major problem). We only gambled on the slots, but there was plenty of choice and very roomy. Free shuttle to the strip and the Gold Coast every 10 minutes. This is the 2nd time we have stayed here, and have stayed a many hotels on the Strip, but will definitely stay here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: pgbowl
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. The facility was great, it is a great place for kids with an arcade, 70 lane bowling alley, many places to eat. The price of the food is a bit on the higher side, but not really more than other hotels. Big casino if you like to gamble. They have a lot of table games, but had over half of them closed most of the time, even though some games were filled. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for entertaining young children”
Reviews.Author: kmcwr
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time staying at The Orleans Hotel with my extended family including 5 kids under the age of seven. They had a ball. The food choices were great. We bowled with all the kids, went to the arcade, played in the kids pool, and even let them go to the secure "kids only" play area while we went to gamble. There is a movie theater, and the circus was in the building. What more can you ask for. The buffet was also great. We also received coupons upon arriving and used most of them for food and entertaining. Another plus, we did not have to pay for parking

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: marcodreamer
Reviews.Content: Yearly trip to Vegas. We have stayed many places (strip, boulder, downtown). This is by far our favorite place to stay! CHECK-IN - Early check-in no problem. Was offered a room on the 5th floor, asked for higher floor, given room on the 19th floor with a view of the strip! ROOM - Fantastic as always! Clean, spacious and well equipped. Only problem was bathroom door was broken and wouldn't shut completely. Not really a problem since it was just me and my DH. FOOD - Big Al's Oyster Bar: Always our first stop for clam chowder and bread. Never fails to please! Buffet: Ate here for breakfast. Had 2/1, so very inexpensive. Normal buffet food. Good value! CASINO - our favorite! Atmosphere that we enjoy. Good cocktail service almost always. Decent video poker. Pretty good offers for return visits with medium play. We will continue to return as long as things remain as they are. Especially with the return room offers!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: prrios
Reviews.Content: First time staying at The Orleans. I've stayed at several other hotels on the strip and downtown. Stayed here with our two daughters. So many things for the kids to do with the arcade, theater, bowling alley, kids tyme, and pool. Easy drive to the strip and I-15. Shuttle to strip is very convenient. We had two rooms, one across from the other, which were very large and very nice. We did have a sink stop up on us which was immediately fixed by two friendly maintanence staff. We ate at the buffet and the cafe and I can't say enough good things about the food we had. The only thing I would change next time is request that my rooms be closer to the elevator. The Orleans main hallway is the longest I've encountered in Vegas and our walk from the elevator to our rooms was VERY long. Can't Wait to Stay Again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed out time there”
Reviews.Author: marriedinvegas09
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas and we wanted to have money to spend on gambling, shows, food and all of the other stuff so I choose this hotel based on the price. I am glad I did. The room had a nice view of the mountains and everyone in the hotel was very friendly. We were able to catch the free shuttle to go to the strip every day. The Sushi bar they have in the hotel is fantistic. On Tuesday the buffet offered a two for one special. On Most days we would eat breakfast at the buffet and not have to eat again until that night. We had a great time there and we will stay there again when we make it back to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/Casino-Lots To Offer!”
Reviews.Author: DaveT555
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at The Orleans after 4 nights at Ballys(Love Ballys).Having done the strip for years,it was nice to stay off strip,and I certainly feel I made the right decision.Rental car is key in Vegas,don't think i'll walk the strip day after day again! They want your money at the off strip casinos and treat you right,all the machines you want,great food choices and on the ball waitresses.You really do get more 4 your money! Had 1 decent hit on machines on the strip,3 nice hits at The Orleans in 2 days. Room was nice,nothing special but nice and clean.Great view of the strip! Pool area very nice,but quiet,great for familes.Buffet very good for lunch,good for breakfast. I like splitting the trip up and will continue to stay on and off strip.Will be back to The Orleans and Ballys!

Reviews.Title: “Off strip”
Reviews.Author: Thierry_Swiss
Reviews.Content: Out of the strip and bit old style but large room and nice buffet. It's also near the airport and if you don't care stay in the strip it's nice there. If you become member you can get discount on the buffet!

Reviews.Title: “Orleans is the best Value in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SEIdahoThomas
Reviews.Content: You know when you're in Vegas I just don't think it gets any better than the Orleans. Now don't get me wrong - this is not a hotel at the uber-level of Wynn, Bellagio, or Mandalay Bay. It's not even on the strip. But the value one gets when staying here (assuming you are not the type who gets full room comp at a high end property) is unsurpassed. The rates for this room are often dirt cheap, with 40-ish bucks the normal mid-week discounted rate - I have had rooms here as low as 29 / night (without players club offers - I have had free nights with offers too.) But this isn't a dive. A locals joint, sure, but probably one of the nicest anywhere. This hotel casino complex is nice and large. It is colorful and has a great vibe. The scary mardi gras heads over the pit are a hoot. This is what Vegas is about! The rooms are pretty nice, kind of basic, though the bathrooms are kind of funny with a weird sliding door. The casino is large, (was at one time the largest in vegas - don't know that that is still true though) and has good restaurants, a large movie theatre, and an entertainment arena. The pool is respectable - much better than the one over at sister property Gold Coast (which is also a decent similar property, but not as nice or large as the Orleans). Prices are surprisingly reasonable for goods within the hotel complex (including a small liquor store, full complement, with low prices). You are I should also mention next door (go out the door on the west side) to the finest Irish bar in Vegas (McMullans). But the O comps some good beverages if youre even looking at a machine - who else among the lower rollers comps Newcastle? Gambling conditions are above-average (but used to be better a couple of years ago). A large and professional poker room in the back serves a notorious shark tank of locals. Serves them unwary newbies I should say. A car helps (easy in and out with parking here despite it's relatively large size), but if you don't have one it's OK because they run a free shuttle to the strip. Not to the airport (almost no casino hotel does that in Vegas for regular people). The hotel lobby is on the smaller side for Vegas, and is really an area just on the side of the main casino - but check in is almost always quick. Locals tip: with a car, try heading North and West for some of the best ethnic restaurant choices out there rather than the overpriced albeit fancy strip. Try going north a few blocks then turn left on Spring Mountain or Sahara or Desert Inn.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans is Inconsistent & Becoming Run Down”
Reviews.Author: daposton222
Reviews.Content: This place can be inconsistent. I reviewed this hotel/casino in April and now find that it has gone way downhill. Over the past decade we have probably spent 15 to 20 nights in this hotel. Our most recent visit was one of our only disappointments with this place. Valets: Don’t’ care about their jobs or doing them well. Not once were we greeted in a friendly fashion, and upon check in were not offered a bellman, I had to get one myself. What upset me about that is that I told the valet who was going to park our car that we needed one, he advised it’d be around “8 to 10 minutes,” then I observed two empty carts heading from the valet area back into the hotel. It was obvious he said nothing to the bell desk, and if I hadn’t flagged one down myself, I wouldn’t have got one. And we’re not cheap about it, I tip $10 when they get the bags from the trunk and another $10 when delivered to the room. After that first day, I just self-parked. Why waste time or money on people who don’t want to really provide any sort of customer service? Rooms/Front Desk: When I booked on line I reserved two rooms, one a king non smoking and another with two queens non smoking. On arrival around 2:30 p.m. (check-in is 3,) we were advised that there were no more king non smoking rooms. In a hotel of 1800 plus rooms, in a city where you know they hold rooms for their high rollers, to not give the customer what was reserved is absurd. The next day they moved us, but that whole process was ridiculously inconvenient. The rooms are becomming run down. Knobs missing from furniture, lights didn’t work, towel bars missing, and backed up, smelly sinks in each of the two rooms we occupied. The queen beds are VERY mushy, king bed was much firmer. It really sucks that they’ve let this place go. The rooms are pretty good sized, but that’s the only really nice thing I can still say. Cleanliness: Again, it seems their staff has lost the desire to work, or perhaps it is one of those "It's not my job" syndromes. Example: for two days, there was gum, yes, used gum, stuck onto the down button of the elevator on the 15th floor. When we left, it still had residue on that button. You cannot tell me that they didn't have many of their housekeeping & maintenanace staff walk by or use that every day--I saw them, but they ignored the problem. It is that kind of lack of care on a small thing that indicates how they react, or not, to issues that arise. Fitness Center: Nice, most machines work fine, but wife found the bicycles to be uncomfortable based on a way laid back seat position. I used the stair climber & it worked fine. Gambling: Everything was very tight. The only place we won was playing the five dollar slots, for two pulls, and the second we won we cashed out. Food: Buffet: excellent value in the morning only. Lunch and dinner are NOT worth what they charged. The food at breakfast was the only spread that was fresh looking or tasting. Dinner and lunch were awful; we had breakfast four days in a row, dinner and lunch once each. Fuddrucker’s hamburgers: They serve some unique offerings, such as buffalo, salmon and ostrich. The latter really is good if you’ve not tried it. The only gripe is that the condiment and soft drink area is very small and gets very crowded around dinner time. Room Service: Very fast, had a delicous club sandwich delivered in around 20 minutes, prepared exactly as ordered. Pool: Yuck! Cloudy and highly chlorinated. Too much used beer left in the pool. Nasty! We only swam in there once. Overall: They’ve got some work to do. The place needs better maintenance, and some TLC rather than duct tape and wire. It really is a shame, since the Orleans used to be one of our favorite hotels. I still recommend the place, but, with the above warnings in place.

Reviews.Title: “Great with Kids!!”
Reviews.Author: diceguy68
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to satisfy kids in Vegas while you do your own thing (without having to consider the aging Circus Circus) this is the place!! We stayed for 5 days, my 8-year old daughter couldn't get enough of the Kids Tyme day care!! I was worried she would get bored after one night, but she couldn't wait to go back every night!! The place is secured, there's all kinds of things for them to do, with a small snack bar, you can authorize a budget for them to eat when they get hungry. There's a big crawl gym with slides, playstations, Nintento Wii stations, all kinds of fun stuff. We also enjoyed the bowling alley, they can put up bumpers so younger kids won't get discouraged by gutter balls. We didn't have time for the 18-plex movie center, but I heard it was spacious. Best of all, the Ringling Brothers/Barnum and Bailey Circus happened to come to the Orleans Arena that weekend, so I got FRONT ROW seats with my daughter!! She had the time of her life!! We didn't even have to take her to the Circus Circus Adventuredome at all during the trip, she had so much fun where we stayed. She even made friends at the Kids Tyme center, they were all crying when the kids had to leave each other! I enjoyed the craps tables, the dealers and boxpersons were nice and friendly, not grouchy like some of the old Stardust dealers. Also, there were several tables open, all with $5 minimums all day/night!! Hard to find on strip or near the strip. Also, the cocktail waitresses were all hot!! Every single one of them, with sexy outfits. Good job of hiring!! The casino floor is a little on the smoky side, so young kids may have to get used to it. My daughter used an air freshener to cover her mouth/nose, but she got used to it. The Budget rentacar site was a bit of a challenge to get to, although it was across the street, I couldn't even jaywalk because of the traffic. Parking is convenient, even in the covered structure. Driving to the strip doesn't take too long. The room was really nice, clean, and large. Our family of 4 was very comfortable. Bathrooms were very well kept. Advice: We made sure to get a room close to the elevator, because the building is in a "t" shape, with very long hallways. It was a really enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “All I could have asked for, except the strip prices”
Reviews.Author: gbarne
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have stayed off strip for a Vegas visit.I was very impressed by my stay at this property.I had a car so getting to the strip was no issue. Valet parking was very efficent at check in as well the rest of the process.We were in our 19th floor room in 15 minutes from driving up.The room was spacious and spotless, much larger than a standard room on the strip.We tried the cafe and the buffet for breakfast and it was fine. We visited the pool three times during our M-Th. visit and it was never crowded and fairly quiet. I did notice tobacco odor on our hallway, but not in our room.We even caught a early afternoon movie at their complex upstairs. We'll be back on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “DID THE JOB WE WANTED”
Reviews.Author: vin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the weekend of the Hatten fight. Did not have any tickets and could not get hold of any. Were we lucky or not!!!!!. We picked the Orleans because we have stayed there years ago, so knew what to expect. and the deal was $219 with $100 of credit. We thought it was a good deal and it proved to be so. Front desk no line, dealt with quickly and courtiously. In any big hotel always ask for high room, no connecting doors got 19th floor with a view towards the strip.Room and bathroom a little dated (which we knew) but clean and tidy. All staff we came across were pleasant and helpful. Minus. Was the dinner buffet, they seemed to have cut back on things. Plus. Got it out of our credit. Also the friday night jazz by the pool seems to have gone. Overall a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised! Will be going back!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyLover29
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by stating that I was less than excited when my husband said we would be staying here for a portion of our Vegas trip. He bowled in the USBC. That was the main purpose of our trip but we also stayed at Mandalay Bay as he wanted to take me to the Lion King show and we got a great package. Well knowing that we were starting off at the Orleans seemed less than delightful considering we would be going to the MB later that week. I didn't expect that I would like the Orleans as much as I did. We paid $39 a night for the room. Check in was very efficient. We were given some really good coupons for the eateries there when we checked in. The room itself was very good sized. The bed was comfortable and the room very clean. They also have a safe in the room as well. I can be extremely picky when it comes to hotel rooms. I was pleased. There are plenty of amenities at the casino and resort. THere is a fuddruckers, Sbarro, TGI Fridays, Buffett (very good with a wide selection and clean!), Prime Rib Restaurant, and a Rocky Mountain Chocolate Store. If you like Chocolate Covered Strawberries you have to try them there!! Amazing and right by the elevator before you go to your room. The views from the hotel are amazing too. We had a view of the mountains and the nice pool area. My husband plays the Dice, blackjack etc. I like to watch him but here I found plenty of games that suited me as well. In addition it is easy to navigate around the casino and the atmosphere is very relaxed. All of the staffers both in the hotel and casino seemed very friendly. We rented a car so my husband drove us where ever we needed to go. However there is a shuttle right in front of the hotel that will take you right to the strip. It seemed like a 5 minute drive to the strip. And let me say that you park right in front of the hotel. No huge parking garages to navigate. They also had valet parking that we did not utilize here because the parking was so easy. All in all I enjoyed our stay at the Orleans. When we go back we are planning on staying here again. It is a huge value for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good for Internet Use and Beware of Resort Fee”
Reviews.Author: ctex99
Reviews.Content: Good points - Room is large, clean, and bed is comfortable. Reasonable base price. Bad points - $12.99 a day for Internet use in your room. That charge is criminal. They claim to have FREE Internet use at the Seattle Best Coffee Shop. Been here a week and unable to use FREE Internet. They might allow maybe 2 users, all else they deny an IP address. I have to go to a coffee shop out in the city for Internet Access. They also tack on a hidden $5 resort fee per day. I am considering writing the Federal Trade Commission. This is deceptive advertising. This resort fee is for Free unlimited local calls and for providing coffee in your room. I don't believe I can opt out of this charge. I search for hotels based on rates, location, and amenities, and then I get hit with a hidden fee. One other item is it seems like it is a 3 mile walk from the elevator to my room. I'm in fairly good shape but it is a long walk at the end of the day. Also, I am on the 3rd floor on the front of the building so I hear delivery trucks in the morning. Otherwise it is a quiet room. The Internet issue will prevent me from staying here again. Keep in mind it is not on the strip but I had a car and that was OK for me.

Reviews.Title: “overall nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tammyrwoods
Reviews.Content: I would stay there again rooms were nice, beds were comfortable.But there valet service and room service was terrible. The valet guys were very rude. Its not as nice as some of the hotels on strip . But for the money it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Large Room, $29, can't beat it”
Reviews.Author: Albuquerque_NMGeezer
Reviews.Content: Room was large, well kept, large bath with a nice view of the strip. Location was mixed, not on strip but parking was easier than if it was. The shuttle buses ran regularly. We thought Big Al's Oyster bar was great (including the halibut, salmon & oysters). All of the staff were friendly & helpful except the surly cashiers at the buffet at breakfast but the staff in the buffet made up for it. We occupied ourselves for for days without ever looking at the table between shows, Red Rock Canyon & eating.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms make up for the average service and terrible location.”
Reviews.Author: lyf
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Vegas and in hindsight I would have splurged and stayed at one of the iconic hotels located on the Strip but if you are looking for good value, no-frills accommodation at $40 a night then The Orleans is an okay option. We caught the shuttle that ran on a regular timetable we never had to wait longer then 15 minutes and the shuttle drivers were friendly and a pleasure to tip. Pros: Great king sized comfortable bed and cheap dining options with lots of choices. Cons: Location (at least a 15 minute bus ride to/from the strip so you felt "trapped" at the hotel and isolated from the action, below average service (we encountered a rude and abrupt Manager at the front desk), you were surrounded by tasteless decoration, casino had a cheap ambiance. My advice is to spend the extra money and go stay at one of the better hotels at Las Vegas. It's a worthwhile investment.

Reviews.Title: “Still great value”
Reviews.Author: gazm
Reviews.Content: My second time at the Orleans and despite reading some reviews claiming it had gone downhill I was equally as satisfied as last year. The rooms are as clean and good value as ever and the dining options are good enough . Throw in a bowling alley and cinema along with drinks half the price of strip hotels as well as a casino with reasonably loose slots and you have the picture. I would recommend it to anyone who didn't feel the need to live on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “not that great anymore (late review)”
Reviews.Author: kori
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 2 nights just before Christmas 2008. Our room was in the original tower and everything in it was original. The room is still very large and the strip view is still outstanding. The carpet was a disgrace, big spots everywhere. Not a carpet you want to walk barefoot. The furniture is old and,like the sofa, very worn.Even though the price they charged was extremely low, I don't think I would stay there again. Maybe the newer towers are better?

Reviews.Title: “SUPER HOTEL and $5.00 Pai Gow”
Reviews.Author: justtobeme2
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first time staying at The Orleans. I chose The Orleans based on the reviews here and boy were they right on the money. The rooms are really nice and large with a couch, chair and coffee table sitting area. Perfect to place the computer. The bathroom is large (phone by toilet). The carpet was fresh and I felt OK walking on it in my socks. One thing I really liked is you get clean bed spreads every time because the way it's decorated the bedspread is a decorative large sheet (looks nice sounds tacky). Coffee pot with coffee is nice touch and every room has free in room safe that YOU set the passcode everytime you lock the safe. Free valet parking 24hours. The restaurants were nice. The buffet is nice (not "gourmet" or "fine dining") but it's good. On a scale of one to 10 I give it a 8.Get the B1G1 coupons it's so worth it. Don miguel's fajitas are awesome, many B1G1 coupons. The Courtyard Cafe has 2 egg, has brown, 3 large saugsage (or bacon) and 2 big slices of sourdough toast for 3.99 right now and a late nite steak and egg special that was around 6 or 7, I can't remember exactly. You can spend 4 hours in the casino and not come out smelling like smoke, YIPPPEEEE (I hate cigarette smoke)!! You can smell smoke occassionally but it doesn't hang in the air, nor is it "smokey". I guess high ceilings and good ventilaiton system. Pool is nice, large hot tub with big palm tree in the middle was really nice. After a certain time at nite security requires a room key to be presented in order to get on the elevators to the room. There was good security appearance. Five dollar Paigow poker (during the week we were there) during the day (2 tables) until about 8pm and if you were at the table at that time you got "grandfathered in" so you could continue betting 5.00 all nite if you wanted, which is what I did when I was losing (but I won). Maid service was good. Staff was nice and pleasant. Make sure you hang the do not distrub sign on your door at night or the maid will wake you up every morning at 8am doing a room check. Unless you really have/want to stay on the strip (you can see the NYNY from the Orleans) I can't fathom staying anywhere else from now on. Just a suggestion, ask for a view of the pool. We didn't ask for that and it would have been nice but we could see parts of the strip from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place great value”
Reviews.Author: jblue15
Reviews.Content: We thought for the price this hotel would not be very nice, but we were pleasantly surprised! It was really nice, clean, friendly, and just an overall great experience. The rooms on the 21st floor are great. We liked it so much we went back a few nights later for a repeat. :) The value was incredible. We also enjoyed the pool and movie theater. We had our 13 month old with us, and it was easy to push him around in his stroller, and the place felt safe and clean. We will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice large room off the strip for unbelieveably low price”
Reviews.Author: rwethereyet850
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times before - always appreciate being removed from the Strip. Located on West Tropicana and I always slide through In-and-Out Burger on the way to the hotel. Usually avoid the tables and walk upstairs and catch a movie in the on-site theater. Ventilation system could use some refresh but you smell more like ozone than smoke after walking through the floor area. Room was very clean and spacious. Current pricing really unbelievable (NS 2Q Suite for $34 + $5 resort fee a night!). I paid $100 more the next night to stay closer to the airport - next time I think I'll stay here longer, get up earlier to make my flight, and save the extra $100 I paid to stay at the Doubletree!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: Chrote
Reviews.Content: I love it here! I've been here roughly 6 times with my Mom on girl's trips, and its great everytime! It ISN'T like the strip, so if thats what you're hoping for, it won't give you what you want! But, it's a great place to stay, everyone is friendly, it's generally clean, and not overly crowded! Love the shuttle to get to the strip, so I still get to experience the nightlife, and hustle and bustle aspect of vegas!

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans is slipping...... Definitely not the hidden gem anymore.”
Reviews.Author: Huskerpower1
Reviews.Content: The Orleans used to be an awesome place just 3-4 years ago, but now it is seriously slipping in my opinion. The deals they offer us are still too good to pass up but now I'll seriously consider somewhere else to stay for our annual getaways. Seems like there is something negative that grabs our attention everytime we stay there now. Last year the buffet didn't seem as tasty at times and the desk staff seemed a little less friendlier. This year a little more of the same, but to make matters worse we had to switch rooms as soon as we got there because of an AWFUL (and I mean AWFUL) stench coming from the room they gave us. It smelled like raw sewage and my wife almost lost her lunch as soon as we opened the door. The front desk guy that 'helped' us had told me that the highest floor he could give me was the 13th floor (ominous beginning) and that he could only face us North and not directly facing the strip (east). There went his tip. Anyway I decided to ask another guy at the desk to switch our rooms and he was a lot more helpful. He actually put us on the 19th floor AND facing the strip. Now why couldn't "Twinkletoes" do that for me? Anyway............ When we got to our new room it was o.k. but we could still smell the sewage in the drain when we used the bathroom sink. We found out later from the nice front desk guy that they were doing some "pumping out sewage" work and that's about the only explanation we got. We decided to just grin and bear it for the next 3 days since the smell didn't come out to the main room, but I still think that was unacceptable. If I was picky at all, we would have been moving again, but I guess at $35 a night, I decided to heck with it since we were up high and facing the Strip. (Great view at night!) There are still good things about the Orleans beside the price of rooms. The main buffet place still can be very good and filling at times and Fridays, Subway, and other little spots offer a good variety of stuff to eat or munch on. The little gym they have is always clean, though sometimes the machines are occupied and you have to use the machines you had no intention of using.... :-) This is still a decent place overall, but one of the reviewers hit it on the head when they said it was "hit or miss" now.... It never used to be that unpredictable. I'm sure the newer people still look at the price and the positives and will rate this place as "great". But unfortunately I can't do that anymore...... Would love to because this place has a soft spot in my heart, but they are not paying attention to the details anymore and may soon lose this long time customer......

Reviews.Title: “If you have any doubts with orleans, read on..”
Reviews.Author: bullmarket76
Reviews.Content: If you are reading this, I bet you have doubts about this hotel, I was once like you. I was first reluctant to book a week stay at orleans, but I did and all I can say was it was well worth it! First off, The Good... The check in/out was very fast, I tried to switch room cause I was too near the elevator and the staff was very nice enough to move me to another room no questions asked, The shuttle to the strip didn't take long during weekdays, and it's almost always half full but on weekends it could be terrible. The Shuttle guy was kind enough to drop me off at goldcoast (one of their casinos) as a favor. The rooms are very big and clean and nice. They provide shampoos, conditioner, lotion, soap and mouthwash. Coffee and tea are available too. The towels are always ready when we get back to our room. The Safe is bolted down and is big enough to accomodate my laptop and other stuff. The wait on the elevator was really, really short as if the elevator didn't left the floor. The cleaning lady was very accomodating too although she speaks in broken english, you can really see that she tries very hard to help us with directions. (if you ever stay there please leave some tips on the bed for the staff, they will appreciate it!), The surrounding area of the resort is pretty good, there is a Walgreen store, a supermarket, car rentals (hertz and budget - go with hertz is so much cheaper), and adult store, a strip bar, and a gas station. They have some band playing on the casino but they are kinda repetitive coz the same band played the whole week. They charge you for room internet service but you can go downstair near the seattle's best shop for a complimentary internet access. Just bring your laptop and connect to their wi-fi. Parking is huge and FREE! Now the bad... The lobby has a very strong scent, like they really shampooed their carpet with a weird smelling detergent, I had a bad experience with the waiters in one of their 24 hour cafe called " courtyard cafe) Nobody was taking my order, after I drew attention to 3 or 4 waiters, I stormed out of the cafe out of frustration. The hotel rooms toilet has no lock. There's not much selection of food late at night. I believe they only have subway, sbarro, fuddrucker, TGIF and that courtyard cafe. Overall, I am very pleased with this hotel. If you are under budget and are looking for a great place to stay this is it. If you have some questions you can mail me at bullmarket76@yahoo.com and I will try my best to answer your questions.

Reviews.Title: “Off-Strip Gem”
Reviews.Author: isles_123
Reviews.Content: 4-night , two room stay in Mid-May 2009. We arrived mid-afternoon and we checked into both rooms within 5 minutes. The front desk clerk accomodated my request for rooms on a specific floor with a view and provided a refridgerator for medication at no charge. I could not ask for a smoother check-in process. The rooms at the Orleans are some of the largest standard rooms you will find in Las Vegas. Our rooms were extremely clean upon check-in, and housekeeping did a great job during our stay. The Orleans leaves very little to be desired: great Video Poker bars, low minimum table games, lounges to watch your favorite sports, excellent food options for all budgets and very helpful, kind staff all around. There is a fairly large pool, although this is not a hotel that offers a great "pool scene"...definately geared towards relaxation rather than parties. On-site bowling alley, movie theater and food court. For those not familiar with Las Vegas, this hotel is located ~1 mile off-Strip and is considered more of a local casino rather than a tourist destination when compared to the larger, on-Strip properties. A rental car is helpful if you plan to stay at the Orleans and visit other areas of Las Vegas. The hotel runs a free shuttle to/from the Strip and the Gold Coast (a sister property just to the north) from 9:30 am to midnight, daily. This is a great money-saving alternative to a cab ride. Hotel guests get priority. FYI: The Orleans charges a $5 per room, per night Resort Fee, that includes 10 minutes of Internet access in the business center, among other things.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: SallyAldridge
Reviews.Content: On our 14th trip to Vegas, we decided to stay off Strip for a change. The Orleans was a great choice. Check in easy, room very nice. Eating choices at this hotel are fantastic. OK, there was a large queue for the 2 for 1 buffet night, but it did not take long. Feeding 2 of us for $15 and change was great. So great, that we were given a 2 for 1 coupon by a kind lady exiting the buffet, and decided to use it on the steak buffet the next day. No complaints there, steak was excellent. We also ate at the Courtyard cafe every day for breakfast, on speciall at £3.99 - couldn't beat it. Used the free bus to the strip every day - except for the weekend when we hired a car . Stayed 7 nights and probably next time would split time between Orleans and Strip. Kinda missed the action just a little bit. Definately would come back to this hotel, they are trying real hard.

Reviews.Title: “The Price is Right”
Reviews.Author: canuckk
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - no problems whatsoever. Great prices on food and drinks. Shows were good. Love the convenience of the movie theatres and the arena. Will definitely stay here again. Loved it much better than the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Has This Place Changed!”
Reviews.Author: flybynite5
Reviews.Content: So has the Staff.I haven't been back for 10 years.Was staying at Eastside Cannery(It was fine & then i dropped into the Orleans.This is,I believe,the largest of the Boyd Properties,nearly 2000 rooms.Since I had a car &avoid the Strip,location was no big deal.Played some slots & came away with a profit! .So,I went to the Host office & was told that if I moved from my current hotel,I would get all RF comped( for noobs-all room & food charges comped).Also was comped tickets for the Four Tops Show in the Showroom-top ticket-$77 each.Rooms were large with a sitting room area ,separate bath & sink areas.Security located at elevators to rooms 24/7/365.They have shuttle but I didn't use it.Didn't have to. Each day filled with numerous promos & activities.Won $100 in free slot play on their wheelspin & converted that into $500.Only BEWARE!Buffet is OK but ,lines very long for specialty nights.Go early or late.Numerous graveyard specials in coffee shop also.Gourmet room is Canal Street-Food & Service were like the Old Vegas.Quite reasonable but a bit more than at EC.Rooms very quiet,NO Rowdies & this was on a Fight weekend!Kids can stay at their kid's area while parents hit the slots,all well supervised. I must say that their GM has done a helluva job in turning this place around 180 dgrs.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Hotel I Will Stay At In Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina L
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Orleans everytime i have visited Vegas. I've been there 3 times since August 08. The hotel is huge, with lots to do. Lots of casinos, bars, restaurants, a bowling alley, cinema and pool. The rooms are huge and very clean, all for a decent price. We booked our room through Travelocity. The staff are always very helpful and the valet service is amazing!! Will definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what she used to be”
Reviews.Author: pulledclear
Reviews.Content: I been visiting vegas once or twice a year for over 20 years. I know the city backwards and forwards and I must say that it has changed a great deal in that time unfortunately not for the better. The orleans opened in the mid 90 s in the coast family of properties. It was my favorite place to stay and by all acounts a " hidden gem ". Since boyd gaming took over this property several years ago it has gone down hill. It is still an O k value but it used to be amazing. now Its very hit or miss. The cut backs are obvious wether its a result of the economy or poor management after my last 2 stays i will not be back.There are far better values with much better service to waste your time with this now mediocre establishment and let me give you my reasons. 1. Valet was once the fastest and best in vegas now horrible at best, and i mean every time 20 min wait min no excuse. and im a great tipper which makes it doubley hard to swallow. 2. service and i mean all service wether it be front desk drink girls or restaraunts etc. mediorcre at best. 3. The gambling staff attitudes are the worst. used to be very friendly now they are inexcusably poor. 4. food from the buffet to the cafe in all eaterys there used to be excellent not just good but great . now the only one that i would recomend is big als oyster bar the food there is still fabulous but the wait staff is exceptionally poor. if you eat there sit at the counter. Food is dynamite.The buffet used to be considered the best value in vegas. now all you see there are hoards of nasty locals feeding their grose kids digusting food for a cheap price. 5. Thats what most of their clientel has become the local dregs hanging about with their kids. Apparantly the orleans is so desperate for business this is acceptable by them. Now im not picky by any stretch but I believe if your going to do something you should give it your best effort. Wether that be running a casino or just acting civil in any social situation that involves a large mix of peolple. The current management and staff have obviously lowered their standards to the great new amway mentality. This hotel was once a great value but is now just a cheap place to stay. Dont get me wrong its definitely not the wost place to stay and it may appeal to you. However for me I have found better values elsewhere that provide exceptional service. the 2 places I would recomend are South Point or the golden nugget. If price is not an issue try mandallay bay( great property). Dont be fooled by places like Bellaio or the Wynn or the biggest joke cesears. Nothing more than people trying to pad their egos with money and trust me ive stayed at every kind of propety in vegas low to high. Once again if you need a cheap place to stay you could do worse than the orleans even if you spent more money. But dont expect much from this place its nowhere near what it used to be and its reputation far exceeds its current managements and employees ability.

Reviews.Title: “The hidden value gem of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Terpsfan72
Reviews.Content: I love the Orleans in Vegas. Sure it's not the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in in Vegas, others like The Luxor or Mandalay Bay or even The Golden Nugget (maybe my favorite hotel in Vegas) are nicer with better places to eat but you can't beat the price at The Orleans, lets put it this way...three nights for 89.00 dollars total! Thats right you read it right. The also have a movie house, bowling alley and some pretty decent places to eat like Big Al's Oyseter Bar and Koji Sushi bar. Have also recently added a small food court. This hotel is really family friendly. I don't have any kids but if I did I'd stay at The Orleans all the time...movies, bowling, cheap eats without all the drunk tourists running around. The Orleans starr is almost always very helpful. The rooms are really decent size for prices that drop as low as $28 a night, I'd say about 450 sq ft. I've had some minor problems like a safe not working, or maybe the phone acting up but they are usually right on the ball with fixing any problems you bring to their attention. I highly recommend this hotel to friends all the time, I sing the praises of the orleans to anyone who asks about my frequent trips to Las Vegas. Has a pretty kick butt pool area too for a hotel so cheap. I'm telling you you can't beat it for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place if you don't want to stay on the strip”
Reviews.Author: arizonakat
Reviews.Content: I love staying at the Orleans while in Las Vegas for work (not play). It is a convenient location for most of the town. I like the fact that I don't have to fight "Strip" traffic to get in and out of it. The room price is usually very economical during the work week. These days price is important for business travel! Please note - they do charge a $5 resort fee on top of the price of the room per day. If you are looking for a lot of night life then this hotel isn't for you. But if you want a clean, quiet, well priced room (away from the casino part) then this is it. The sushi restaurant is awesome! Very casual and the food is excellent. They have a nice selection of beer and sake. The coffee shop is also very handy when you are running out the door to your first meeting of the day. The rooms are a nice size and very clean. I find the beds to be very comfortable as well. The internet in the room is not free but you can use the business center if you want to check email or print something out. I am not a big gambler but I do like to play the penny slots while in Vegas. There are lots of slot/game options for the "low roller" gambler like me. On the strip there aren't many places with penny slots so the variety is fun. Overall, for the price it is is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL TIME”
Reviews.Author: trocar60
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our yearly trip to Vegas. We chose THE ORLEANS for several reasons, but price and value were the main reasons. Check in was a breeze. We arrived in around 9 p.m. and were in our room by 9:15. We requested (and got) the first room nearest the elevator. We were on the 9th floor. The rooms were very comfortable, and roomy. Bathroom was small, but nothing to really complain about. Bed was very comfortable (we like hard, firm mattresses). Hardly ever watched television, so I cant comment on that. Casino is so easy to get around in. There was never a large crowd, you coul play almost any machine you wanted. We even won a little (wife hit a $600 jackpot on a .5 machine, and I hit a keno machine for a thousand!) Orleans buffet is very nice, with a lot of different stations. We had 2/1 coupons for 2 days. The coffee shop is very reasonable, and the food is great. Service could not have been any better. The wait staff is superb, and so friendly. Shuttle to the strip is quick and easy.....only about a 10 minute ride. Pool was nicer than I expected. No frills, but very nice. We even went to a movie (matinee) and had a great time. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. If this is your first trip to Vegas, and want to experience the Strip...dont stay here because it is a bit off the beaten path, but otherwise.....You will LOVE the ORLEANS !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than I anticipated!”
Reviews.Author: Kelwel8
Reviews.Content: I'm just not a Vegas person. So when I had to attend a conference there last week, I booked a room at the Orleans. It was clean, smoke-free, and the A/C didn't freeze us out. The pools were great and the shuttle to the strip was very helpful. Uaually a smoke free room means the filter is dirty ans still smells of smoke no matter what. The beds were comfy and my only little complaint would be there was not a mini refrigerator in the room to keep water cold. Otherwise it was fab. Oh and, at the conference lunch, they served a Ginger Mousse dessert- TO DIE FOR!!! Still dreaming about it...............

Reviews.Title: “360 degree difference from 2 years ago”
Reviews.Author: kilikina1
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at The Orleans - two years I had a great time, loved the buffet - tolerated the off strip location because of value and general friendliness of staff. This time around my stay was the exact opposite. Staff was, for the most part, disinterested or untrained, blatant errors in billing that would not be corrected UNLESS I pursued the matter, French Market buffet was either edible or inedible - total difference from 2 years ago. Even the coffee maker ( I guess you could call it that) was a sorry excuse. The worst part - Billing errors - went through a lot of time and energy getting it straight.

Reviews.Title: “Great find thanks to tripadvisor!”
Reviews.Author: PapaGrammie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orleans last week after a trip to the Grand Canyon. I found a great deal on the hotel website ($115.00 + tax for 2 nights) as well as good reviews here. The room was not only large with a king bed, large bathroom, & nice furniture but was also clean and quiet on the 11th floor. We were very impressed, as it had sounded too good to be true! We did have a problem with the room safe not working and needing to be completely replaced the first morning. right as we were going out for breakfast. ($5.00 per day mandatory "resort fee" covers this and other stuff so use the safe but check it when you get there to make sure it's working BEFORE you are going out the door ) After over an hour of waiting I was getting irritable and HUNGRY. We finally went down to the front desk and the manager kindly offered to buy us breakfast after ensuring that in the meanwhile the safe issue would be resolved by the time we finished, and it was. Fabulous breakfast the Courtyard Cafe, hotel also has a Subway, Sbarro, Fuddruckers, and more in the foodcourt (cheap eats), also a $7.99 buffet that was good for our next breakfast. There were a couple of other restaurants in the hotel too. Also important to know: In & Out Burger is not too far away either- yeay! Obviously we aren't big on "fine dining" because we didn't bring attire for it. You can find that at Orleans too, plus at any hotel on the strip- the large hotels each have several of those. The giant bowling alley looked like fun, had an 18 (?) screen movie theater and pool that we didnt even take time to go see for lack of time, and it closed early which we thought odd. The casino wasn't nearly as crowded as on the strip but we didn't go to LV to gamble anyway so I can't comment on the gaming. Parking at the hotel was free and you could park any place you wanted to, valet service also available. Shuttle was OK for getting to the strip but it's a loooong hike back down there to the one & only stop if you've walked any distance. I was completely wiped out and was getting blisters from my sandles so do yourself a favor and wear tennies in Vegas. You'll do ALOTof walking....you're a tourist anyway and you'll never see those people again so who cares! (at least it won't be black socks & sandals! ;) If you choose to drive to the strip, parking at the casinos on the strip is a pain and there's road construction going on too. Each staff person we dealt with at Orleans was very pleasant and when we passed employees in the hallways, etc- they greeted us which we thought was really nice.
