Not much of that any place these days! We'd definately stay here again if we came back to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but lacking in location”
Reviews.Author: allmod
Reviews.Content: Rooms are better than average and kept very clean. Would have been nice to have a fridge in room to keep water cold, but not a big deal. One of the lamps didn't work. The bathrooms are very nice and you have a room safe and iron & ironing board. I heard this casino has the loosest slots, but I didn't experience that at all. Pool area is adequate, not as good as some other casino/hotels like MGM, Mandalay Bay, Flamingo, etc. but it did the trick when overly hot. Pool closes daily at 7:00 PM. Hotel also has a 10 Pin Bowling Center with some 70 alleys and a multiplex movie theater. Room prices are overall a good value, but the Orleans is by itself away from everything. This can be either good or bad depending on what floats your boat. When you go to Las Vegas (at least for the 1st time) you want to be on the Strip. Orleans is off the Strip and it's about a $10 cab ride to and from or you can use the complimentary shuttle which leaves every 30 minutes (but the shuttle doesn't run 24 hours). Although the Orleans was a decent hotel/casino and a value, we found staying off strip to be an inconvenience and we probably wouldn't do it again.

Reviews.Title: “What a room!! ( And hotel)”
Reviews.Author: charliec6061
Reviews.Content: I have just come back frm a road trip round the USA with my husband & stayed in the Orleans for 3 nights. It was the best hotel on my trip. As it was our 1st wedding anniversary, we were given a room upgrade to an executive suite for a extra $75 a night, and it was definatly worth it!! We ended up on the 20th floor ( hotel goes uo to 21 floors) with a complete view of the strip from both bedroom & lounge rooms, yes, we had a lounge too, which included the biggest t.v ever, a 6 seater glass dining table, and our own bar!! ( had to buy own achol) The room had 4 t.vs, & a huge tub. It was the largest room I have ever stayed in. The hotel itself is about 1.5 miles away from the main strip, it offers a free shuttle in, but to be honest, we stayed in our hotel most of the time as the casino was a lot more relaxed than in the centre, as it did not have tourists in & out all the time, there were 9 restaurants, & 1 swimming pool. The frnch market buffet was always very popular, you pay 1 price & then eat all you want, it was set up with sections with different food from different countries, Mexican, Chinese , american etc, well worth thr money. Overall, this hotel was excellent, I would definatly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A genuine gem”
Reviews.Author: randinc
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is a mid sized hotel/casino about a mile west of the strip. Valet parking is prompt and efficient. Checkin also. The rooms are large and offer a small sitting area adjacent to the bedroom. Everything is neat and clean. Maid service is very good. Beds and linens great. Restaurants good and reasonably priced. The buffet is generic but good. Tried the Canal Street this time, (steak house) Very good food and service. Prices can't be beat, we've stayed at the Orleans a number of times and never paid over $40 a night. They always seem to have a promotion of some sort. Worth a little searching! They will meet any travel website price. I'm going to Las Vegas again in a couple of weeks and am already looking to book the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: Darby55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a 9 days there this past November. Summers are crazy for us so this was our get away together. This is the second time we have stayed at The Orleans. Love the location. Easy access to anywhere we went yet not in the middle of everthing. We had everything we needed. Great places to eat, in house entertainment was great. Rooms were clean, comfortable and if we needed anything, like an extra pillow, it was always right there, but we didn't have to ask for much because it was already taken care of. Love the valet and bell staff. They take great care of you. Everyone makes you feel right at home. It has become our first choice to stay in Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: TracyCT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located off the Strip. It is a few blocks behind NYNY and offers very affordable rates. We only paid $34 a night, plus they gave us coupons for restaurants, bowling, slots. This was our second time staying here and we loved this hotel/casino. The Orleans is huge and the atmosphere is lively . The hotel has 21 floors and the rooms are clean and spacious. The beds are very comfortable. We had a great view of the Strip off in the distance. There is a free shuttle to the Strip, but we did not use it because we rented a car. There are many restaurants in the Orleans. The buffet is huge and reasonablely priced $8.99 for breakfast, $9.99 for lunch, and $13.99 for dinner. We priced the dinner buffets on the strip and some were as high as $29.99. The casino is huge, there is an arena for shows, a large bowling alley, a gym, a spa, a business center with 10 minutes of free internet per stay. and a movie theater. The pool area is pretty, but I don't think the pool is heated. If you are looking for an elegant hotel then the Orleans is not for you, but if you want an affordable lively, clean hotel/casino the Orleans is a great choice. One negative thing that I did notice was that the smoke in the Orlean's casino was more noticable than in other casinos such as the Palms, TI, and Mirage, but even still I would not hestiate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: luisistaz
Reviews.Content: After a nightmare of a stay at Primm I was glad to be at The Orleans. Our Bowling league has held our finals there ever since they opened, and I've stayed here for the last seven years. Well when they changed ownership, service changed , from a very friendly and very service oriented staff to a mediocre and more corporate minded one, still the place is a good one. Rooms are large, clean, but are starting to show their age, the food is good, specialy at Prime Rib Loft and Cannal Street, the buffet is tipical, good price tough, The courtyard café used to feature great graveyard specials, and great food, specialy at breakfast, much better than at the buffet, sadly, no more specials, service was marginal at best and the food was not as good. Overall it seems the once great value that it was is turning into "you get what you pay for", I hope not, but I see now why the original owner ( Mr. Gaugahn ) opted out and got his own place, still, with all that said it's still not a bar place, I'm probably nostalgic and miss the frinely staff that used to work here.

Reviews.Title: “very happy with our stay at The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: travelgalbcBurnaby
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 night stay at The Orleans. We were very happy with everything about this hotel. The rooms were very large with nice beds and linens. The food was very good at the Courtyard Cafe. The buffet was excellent and reasonable. The shuttle service to and from the strip was great, we never waited longer than 10 minutes at the most. It was great to stay off the strip, we don't regret that decision at all. We are looking forward to our next visit and would highly recommend The Orleans to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed here 5 times so far and will continue to stay here”
Reviews.Author: GoWazzu
Reviews.Content: There were no unpleasant surprises this time. They took out my favorite greasy hamburger stand (Terrible Mikes) but have added Fuddruckers, Sbarro, Subway and Baskin and Robbins in a food court. Special pricing was $30/night and even picked up some free buffet coupons which meant the price of the room around $10 per night. The transportation is sort of a pain with the full vans but if you want a car, there is a rental outfit across the street which is cheaper than renting out at the airport. Be sure and have some chowder and the buffet has theme nights which are very good. The buffet is as good as anything on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth It”
Reviews.Author: northdakotahermit
Reviews.Content: I just spent 5 nights at the Orleans and found nothing lacking. Friendly staff all the way around. Now for a tip for those staying at the Orleans that have a car. Park in the ramp on the west side of the property. When entering the casino from the ramp take the outside path which will lead you to the elavators and easy access to the registration desk. If driving to the strip the best way is to follow the street on the westside of the property to Harmon. Turn left and go to Decatur and then turn right. Follow Decatur to Twain and turn right. Follow Twain all the way to you come to Industrial. Turn left and go under the freeway and come to the stoplight. Turn right on Frank Sinatra and then a left on Jay Sarno. This will bring you to Caesars Palace's parking ramp. Reverse the process to get back to the Orleans. Simple way to avoid traffic.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Gem off the Las Vegas strip”
Reviews.Author: cec001
Reviews.Content: We were a bit skeptical about the Orleans as we had not heard very much about it in all our years traveling to Vegas. We have stayed at virtually all of the big name hotels on the strip over the years including the Hilton just off the strip, and were looking forward to a change. We were not disappointed to say the least! The room was every bit as good as any we have had over the years, and the household staff was great. Make sure you leave a tip daily for the household staff; best money you will spend! Because we were with our daughter and family who stayed at a different hotel, we did not eat at the Orleans but are told the buffet is first class. Looking for a change; try the Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “would stay again”
Reviews.Author: NewportWelshlady
Reviews.Content: We have just returned "25th march". After having the best holiday yet. the orleans cannot be beaten for value.Checking in was easy and very quick. receptionist being very friendly and helpful.Bedrooms are huge,with a settee and easy chair..Plenty of choice as to eating...Bars were very busy as it was the college basketball championships..But no problem in getting served..Those who have written BAD reviews about this hotel must have extremely high standards and nothing would satisfy them..We are fussy about any accomodation that we book and was a bit worried after reading some of the reviews about staying here but we worried for nothing. We would definately stay here again.The shuttle bus runs every 15mins to the strip and only takes about 5mins..Bottles of bud was only $1 50cents and a bucket of 5 bottles was $6 25cents..Talking to a lady on plane home she was paying $10 a bottle in the hotel she had stayed in..So it paid big time to stay off the strip..and would definately fly with northwest airlines again..alltogether a fantastic holiday from start to finish..can't wait to go back..

Reviews.Title: “Been there before, Came back, and will return again.”
Reviews.Author: nanniedearest
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans 2 yrs ago and was very satisfied. This time I was by myself and knew the Hotel was safe for me to stay alone for 4 days.. Security guards by the Elevators were friendly and helpful. The room was large, clean & comfortable. Asked to be put by elevators, and was. The free shuttle to the strip took about 15 minutes. One day walked one way and the next night walked the other way to see and play at all the "Big" hotels. Saw a very recent movie and received free popcorn, up stairs at the 16 movie Theatres. The Market place buffet was well worth the price, Some good fast food restaurants and received coupons, also. The "Slots" were friendly, they paid off enough to be able to play for a while on their money. My fault I put it all back. Shuttle service to and from the airport was convient and effecient .Of course the price of the room ($32- $42) was a great bargen . Once at the Orleans, it is not necessary to leave the Hotel . They have everything to make your stay a wonderful vacation. I will definatly be back again. The only drawback was... It was not warm enough to use the pool, but , there was no snow in Vegas, thank god. s

Reviews.Title: “love the orleans”
Reviews.Author: jamiemcb
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the orleans from march 18th to the 22nd. we asked for a higher floor room with a strip view and got one out of the two, even though he told me no problem. we were on the 19th floor with a view of the mountains, which was nice, but would of preferred a strip view. the rooms are very good size. we had a king bed which was pretty comfy. there is a couch and a chair by the window. the t.v. is a regular t.v. with basic channels. house keeping did a very good job on the room. very clean. it was pretty quite. didn't hear much of anything. check in was very fast. checking out was even faster. we ate at t.g.i.fridays. it was very good. we also had breakfast at the courtyard cafe, which is open 24 hours. the buffet is o.k. for the price. the food court is a little over priced but convienent. over all we had a very good stay at the orleans and are looking forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel 1 mile off the strip”
Reviews.Author: KateSW
Reviews.Content: If you have been to Las Vegas before and done the strip crawl then this is the place to stay this time- very nice roomy rooms and loads to do at the Casino- movie theatre, bowling, internet access in the business center. It is a bit of a walk from the parking area unless you use the valet parking which is located along the right side of the building. Check in was fine and they even were able to give us a free breakfast buffet when we did not find it in our welcome folder. Sign up for the frequent gamblers club and they give you 5 bucks to gamble with as well as Mardis Gras beads. Use the card when you go to the restaurants to get a buck off. My favorite place was the Mexican restaurant from 3-5 pm- margaritas for a buck and half price appetizers! Just have an early dinner and gamble the night away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not such a convenient location...”
Reviews.Author: nawahine21
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Las Vegas and the Orleans was a nice place to stay. First, what I did not enjoy was the fact it was off the strip, therefore not a good location for any first-time Las Vegas visitor. I would have enjoyed to stay someone on the Strip to walk around and sightsee or Downtown (as do many fellow Hawaii travelers). The taxi ride cost about $15 to the Strip area. =( What I liked about this hotel was their superior room service/customer service. The room service was very affordable, easily available, and speedy. Also when we requested a refrigerator (for a cost of $15 per day extra...) It was immediately brought to our room. It was also nice to have a window in the bathroom if you want some fresh air. The rooms and hallways are rather dated-looking and the lobby/casino area had a sweet perfume-like smell. Since this was my first trip to Vegas, I am not sure if this is the norm..... The buffet was okay, I wasn't quite impressed, but I can't complain since it was part of our hotel deal where meals are paid for. They have a TGI Fridays in the hotel which I enjoyed and they also had an asian restaurant there which was okay, nothing fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Orleans!!!”
Reviews.Author: YWGJetsTraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were meeting family in Vegas for a fun filled NASCAR weekend. We were all travelling on a tight budget, and the rates at the Orleans couldn't be beat by ANYONE in Vegas that weekend. The rooms are spacious and well kept. Nice little seating area with a sofa and chair. The bathroom was huge, and the tub/shower was plenty big enough. The room staff were fantastic. We would go get a bite to eat, be back in half an hour and the rooms were done. Great job!!! The hotel offers free valet parking, so why self-park and end up on the other side of the property. The valet service was quick and conveinent (and free). The other nice thing about the Orleans is that it is a "locals" casino, so the payouts are alot better than those on the Strip. We are planning to come to next years race, and we'll be back at the Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Rooms for LOW LOW Price”
Reviews.Author: FamilyAdventureAgent
Reviews.Content: For under $50, VERY nice, VERY comfortable. Best sleep that we've ever had at that price! Easy parking, not too far to walk to rooms, including the casino. Bed was just right, not too hard, not too soft. Comfy pillows. Towels not too thin. Roomy bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in the Hotel Registration Personal”
Reviews.Author: goodworth
Reviews.Content: Dana Downs and Stephanie both neighter would help me as I requested comps for dining (buffett) or in any way as I booked my reservations way in advance paying much more than the going rate when I checked in. Those two ladies (and one or both were supervisiors) did not seem to care that I had this complaint. Also they gave me the last room at the end of the longest hall in Las Vegas. (atleast it seemed). Being the hotel was not filled- that was not necessary, but rather punishment. The room was nice- it just was a long walk to get to it. Most of the other Hotel employees were very pleasent, but I learned to avoid this hotel was not a customer friendly place that wanted repeat business. After 4 days I went to the Excalibur where I recieved 3 breakfast buffett coupons right when I checked in, and it was less money! The Four Queens also was very good to me as it was the last of five Hotels I stayed at in January. The Circus Circus was better than the Orleans. So - they won't get my business as I go to the C.E.S. show every year in January. I hope you visit the Hotel but don't expect anything extra or extended kindness. By the way. I told them I was going to review this hotel and ask for there names. They seemed proud to give them out. Imagine that?

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Price But We Were Run Over By 600+ Children and Will Not Be Back”
Reviews.Author: DoxieMomof2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five night stay the The Orleans. Our first two nights were great. The rooms are large and the beds are comfortable. Lot's of restaurants and things to do on site making it really not necessary to go to other casinos. Initially our only complaint was the long length of the hallways in the hotel; most rooms are a long walk from the elevator. In addition, when you get off of the elevator there are no signs directing you to the appropriate room numbers. There are signs, but not right as you exit the elevator. We found ourselves getting off the elevator and going one way, then another until we found the sign that included our room number. Very confusing! The buffet food is just okay, nothing to write home about. On day two we received a memo in our room stating JAMZ was holding their national cheerleading competition at The Orleans Arena. In speaking with one of the parents, there were over 600 cheerleaders staying at the hotel for the competition. I am guessing the age of the cheerleaders were from five to thirteen. We have three children who are young adults so we are familiar with being around children. However, when we plan a vacation all year and go to Las Vegas, we do not expect Las Vegas to be like Disneyland! Children were yelling and running up and down the hallways. The walkways through the casino were packed with children, many of them without chaperones. When booking our vacation direclty with The Orleans, no one ever told us there would be 600 children staying there at the same time. When I mentioned this to the front desk clerk upon check out his response to me was, "They have the same rights as you do." Yes, but at the time of booking no one ever told me there were going to be so many children at the hotel. Perhaps The Orleans knew if they told people there was going to be so many children staying at the hotel at the same time, we'd book our stay elsewhere??? When I told him we would not be back, his response to me as, "I am sorry you feel that way, but that is fine." In these difficult economic time I guess The Orleans has plenty of business to go around and doesn't need our business. We are in Las Vegas generally 1-2 times per year and we will NOT return to The Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Checking in the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: moca1274
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at they Orleans for Christmas. It was my father's first time in Las Vegas and we were excited for him. We arrived at the hotel at about noon. We attempted to check in knowing that the hotel may not have our rooms ready, but thought " who knows maybe". The rooms were not available yet, we were told that they would be ready in an hour. Bellhops kept our luggage and off we went to have lunch at the hotel resturant. We took our time (1 1/2 hours later) went back to check in. Rooms were still not ready. The front desk said one more hour. They were very rude with attitude. We sat on the couches. Let me just tell you my mom(65years), dad (66), uncle (75), aunt (70), my sister, brother-in law, niece 3 years old, and needing her nap!, and my husband and my self. My dad's first trip was becoming a nightmare without a bed to have the nightmare in!! Finally after waiting four hours we were able to check in. To avoid this whole problem the front desk just needed to say that the rooms wouldn't be ready until 4 and we could have gone out enjoy the sights. The rooms were were clean and bed was average. The bathroom and sitting area were nice and roomy. The movie theatre and bowling alley were great to have. TGIF and the buffet were good . We were going to leave on Friday but our flight was cancelled and Unfortunetly the Orleans could not accommadate us one more night. They told us that WE had to call from an in-house phone to reserve a room at the Gold coast. The Cold Coast was a whole other problem. Overall the Orleans is a nice place to stay , we stayed three other times in the past with no problem, just don't go early to check in.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific inexpensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: nonny2tnj
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel in 2004, 2005 and 2007 and have only had a couple problems, both with our first stay. We had terrible hot water problems that never did better though they sent up someone fairly quickly to try and fix it and we had a lamp that wouldn't work, which they fixed pronto. We had noise that first year because they were expanding the hotel and we were right up from that, but it couldn't really be helped and as we had a strip view we stayed put instead of asking for a different room. The hotel has very spacious rooms like mini suites, they now have safes, which they didn't our first two visits, clean linen, bathrooms and nice hygiene ammenities. It is about 2.5 miles from the strip, has a ton of eating places of every $ amount, a great area upstairs with a bowling alley, very small arcade and an ok movie theater. One of the nice things about this hotel is it caters to locals so the pool area isn't full of people wanting to be seen with their bikinis or buff bodies but just regular folks wanting to enjoy the pool, which is huge and lovely. You don't have to wrangle for chairs like at the strip hotels, they have a great place to get drinks and you can sit and people watch to your hearts content. I would highly recommend this for the older generation that doesn't want to have to deal with the half naked, drunks that seem to litter the strip hotel pools. All in all, we are planning our next trip and will more than likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas 09”
Reviews.Author: Mo76
Reviews.Content: Vegas 09 I had never stayed off Strip, but friends were staying at the Orleans. Deals in Vegas were great. 25 a night (1/13-1/16/09) and a $20 slot or table comp and $20 in food comp. Some machines were down at that time due to the installation of a new casino rug.They worked very quickly and finished each section by the end of each day. I did try Fudrucker's at the food court and thought the Strawberry shakes were OK, not as good as Foxwoods, but they were actually a little cheaper, chicken Caesar salad was a little more in price and also was smaller that out East. (Possibly because it was a FOOD court not a regular eat in resturant) I think the casino and rooms were great (Winter Special) SWA had a 50% off flight deal. The only dislike was that the shuttle to the Strip and other Coast Casinos didn't start until 9:30 AM. I also stayed one night at Bills Casino, rates were not as good as they were when it was the Barbary Coast,(the service was excellent as usual) but it was central and gave me the opportunity to do a lot of walking and checking out the new look in Vegas. Weather was great, and the Bellagio had their newest theme "Chinese New Year "at the Conservatory. The Gellato was also great , the strip in general was very quiet M-T and picked up on Thursday PM. I will try to include Pix from my phone at a later time, I need to figure out how to get them off the phone.

Reviews.Title: “not so good anymore”
Reviews.Author: enjoyitnow09
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home from Las Vegas.Still a great place to visit .Bette Midler show is a must. We stayed at the orleans where we have stayed a few times before and enjoyed it. BUT it is not the place it used to be. They were replacing the carpet in the casino area. I personally think they should have started replacing the pillows in the rooms first. They are tiny and very thin. The rooms are getting run down. We had water come up into the hand basin when we used the shower. We will stay at south point next time as it is newer and cleaner. We prefer not to stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room With a View of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Melody3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel over the 2008-2009 New Year for 8 nights and was thrilled at how nice it was! It was everything that I had wanted out of a hotel. The room was big and clean, had a nice comfy king-size bed in a non-smoking room, and a gorgeous view of the entire strip (from Stratosphere to Mandalay Bay)! Service at both check-in/out and by the maintenance staff was friendly. The fitness facilities are really nice and are included in your stay. Too bad it was too cold to use the beautiful pool! The free shuttle to/from the middle of the strip was convenient and only took about 10-15 minutes. Best of all, my stay averaged about $50 CAD/night with taxes including my stay over New Year's Eve and Day, even after paying for the $5/night resort fee. (I had the Winter Sale special which included $20 Free Play and $20 Free Food Credit.) "Funbook" coupons for $10 match play and other miscellaneous things are given during check-in. Freebies in the room include a shower cap, toiletry kit (emery board, q-tips, cotton pads, sewing kit), shampoo, conditioner, and body lotion. The $5/night resort fee includes 10 minutes at the Business Centre daily, coffee/tea, unlimited local and toll-free calls, and fitness facilities/pool. For those of you concerned about past reviews that the safe is not bolted down, I think the Orleans has addressed this problem. The safe that was in my hotel room was bolted down so it was secure - I checked. New Coast Club Members get $5 Free Play when they sign up. Members get $1 off any of the affiliated buffets when they present their Coast Club Card. Members also get 7000 pts the month of their birthday, which is equivalent to $7 cash or $10 food credit. I just celebrated my birthday in December, so not only did I get the Winter Sale $20 Free Play and $20 Food Credit, I got another $5 in Free Play for being a new Coast Club Member and $10 food credit for my birthday! That was a total of $25 Free Play and $30 Food Credit! It's nice to be comped :) FYI - I won about $22 playing the slots using the Free Play! The lunch buffet at the French Market Buffet wasn't the greatest and I would probably only give it 2.5-3 stars out of 5, but the Champagne Brunch on New Year's Day was better and I give that 3.5 stars out of 5. The Main Street Station Hotel Buffet on Tuesday T-Bone Steak Night (4.5 stars out of 5) is so much better than the French Market Buffet, yet is also owned by Boyd Casinos, so I'm not sure why the food isn't better at the French Market Buffet. They should cross-train the chefs and that would make this hotel even more awesome than it already is! The cafe has an all day special of a double cheeseburger with fries for $3.99 that is pretty good (3.5-4 stars). The spaghetti with meatballs and garlic bread graveyard special for $3.99 is not bad either (3.5 stars). I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to my friends/family. It was not only a big room with a beautiful view, but a great hotel with an unbeatable price and good location close to the strip with free shuttles. Couldn't ask for a better hotel! I've stayed at the Paris twice before (once in a VIP suite with my family, and once in a regular room) and at Imperial Palace in a regular room in the past. I would say the Orleans was a much better experience overall (with the exception of the Paris VIP suite), since the amenities at the Orleans actually surpassed that of the Paris and the Imperial Palace. Paris and Imperial Palace cost more, did not include the gym or Business Centre, and their rooms and beds weren't as nice either. Sorry, I don't remember if they included coffee/tea or phone. Thanks to the Orleans for making this a perfect getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, not far from the strip”
Reviews.Author: DOS_54
Reviews.Content: My buddies and I go to Vegas every march to enjoy the NCAA basketball tournament and we always stay at the Orleans. The hotel is much cheaper than most hotels on the strip and it is not that far from there at all. They offer a free shuttle to and from the strip, so no need to spend all your money on cab fare. The setup they have for the basketball tournament is the best; a large ball room with big screen TVs all around, food and drink stands and a couple places for you to place your bets; no need to leave the room for anything. There are also all kinds of restaurants in the hotel that are reasonably priced (there is something for everybody). I would definitely recommend the Orleans, especially during March Madness.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: island6irl82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Orleans for the Christmas holiday, and have to say that this hotel is pretty nice. I had my doubts about staying there but all in all our stay was one of the best vactations we ever had. Check-in was quick and easy, the staff were pretty helpful and friendly, the room was decent, and their food was pretty good as well (especially Don Miguel's). As far as the room goes everything was pretty decent. The only thing I didn't like from the room was the bed spread. They don't use blankets so it took awhile to get use (thankfully the heater work nicely so it was warm enough were you don't need a blanket). We would definitely come back to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Still The Best Value in Las Vegas - But Becoming Less Each Trip”
Reviews.Author: pittston
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at The Orleans for our fifth visit there between December 24 and 27 2008. The Orleans continues today to be the best value in Las Vegas - but the new owners have made some policy changes that are angering their guests and will soon drop the Orleans out of the "Best Value" level into a "Sub Standard" value. For example, they continue to have the largest rooms (925 SQ FT) with 2 queen beds in each for the least amount of money ($35 per night average) but beware what you sign and initial at registration. We were charged a mandatory extra $15 per stay per room for the safe which we did not use and for the shampoo that they say is special. I argued to no avail as they already had my signature and a copy of my charge card. The television service in the rooms has also changed. There are fewer regular channels available to make room for more pay pre view channels. The hotel "has" improved the exhaust system to rid the gaming area of cigarette smoke but the food at The French Market Buffet was absolutely horrible this trip. I hate saying that because I love buffets and The French Market was always one of my favorites. It is easy to see that the quality of food products has deteriorated. For example, the meats at the carving stations have a lot more fat content, the seafood is smaller portions with more bread coating to make it look larger, the deserts are less than grocery store quality, the restaurant was only 2/3 filled but service to clean tables was slow leaving guests in line longer than usual. These issues will likely send me back to a resort on the strip for our next trip. Why should I continue to pay extra for a rental car for the off strip Orleans Hotel if the food is so bad I have to go somewhere else to eat meals and the extra expense at check out is nothing short of extortion? Forget taking their shuttle to the strip because it is slow and the lines are very long. Taxi service is as expensive as a rental car so we always rent which allows us to come and go as we please.

Reviews.Title: “Buffet awful, other Orleans problems”
Reviews.Author: lightyear
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Orleans Hotel & Casinho 12/20-22/08, having stayed there 5-6 times over the past five years. Service, rooms, buffet and restaurants were always good, and the low prices made it a great bargain, but no longer. The Hotel & Casino (and others owned by the sme chain)were sold last year : Coast Casinos sold to Boyd Gaming.. Differences now: The front desk registration staff is less xperienced, less capable: We had reerved and prepaid our room, two queen beds non -smoking. they offered us one king bed on a smoking floor. It was only after much time and seeing the hotel manager that they put us in the room we had originally reserved. The Buffet, previously excellent, was awful: meats tough, fish tough and overdone, many dishes tasteless. The Buffet manager on duty (dinner)recognized our frustratin and refunded the charges, and we went elsewhere. We selected the Orleans partly because of its great buffet and its convenience, which now does not apply. I later talked to the chef who told me that kitchen personnel had not changed, and could not discuss why the food had deteriorated. I discussed this with some other guests I met there who been there before, and also told me they were disappointed in the food. Casino personnel were courteous and helpful. the Orlens has added some other food alternatives: Fuddruckers Hamburgers, Sbarro pizza,but we preferred regular meals. Hotel room (14th floor)was clean, no problems. We had firneds in the hotel who were staying on the 6th floor, and their room was different: carpet frayed, paint flaking, furniture bad.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MM983
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights in mid December because a friend was in a tournament. The room was large and in great condition. Security was stationed by the elevators and you had to show your room card to proceed, so the hotel area was always safe. The hotel has a nice feel to it and there are lots of things to do like visit the bowling alley or see a movie. The Alligator Bar had good service and they were quick to replace my empty beer bottles. I spent a little time at the tables and found I had better luck on the strip. The Orleans uses automatic card shufflers, which I am not a fan of. While this hotel and casino are off the strip, the shuttle had excellent service to Bill's Gambling Hall & Saloon and Gold Coast. The shuttle ran every 15 minutes from 10:30am until midnight; only a few times it was almost full. If you get tired of The Orleans and the strip, get off at Gold Coast and check out the Palms across the street. There is really nothing within walking distance of the hotel except a strip club which is directly across the street. Thus, I would advise not walking around, especially at night. The hotel grounds are safe, but it is kind of located in an area where the streets aren't lit too well. Overall great value. If you're on a budget and don't mind having to come back from the strip before midnight, The Orleans would be a outstanding choice.

Reviews.Title: “Still a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: countdown2vegas49
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans December 15th and 16th under their Winter Special promotion; two nights at $25 each with a food voucher for $20 and $20 free slot or table play. I was in Vegas at the time and had my husband reserve this offer same day over the internet. Checked in at around 1 p.m. with no wait. In addition to the food voucher and slot play they also gave me a coupon sheet at check in with bogo free drinks and bowling, $10 matchplay, and free appetizer and cocktail (for up to four people) with entree purchase at Courtyard Cafe. I requested a non-smoking king, but they were out so I received a NS double on the 4th floor overlooking the pool. This was my 4th or 5th time staying but the lowest floor I've been on. After checking in we went down to use the hot tub in the spa/fitness center and were told "the hot tub is closed for renovation". I was very disappointed with this news; using the indoor hot tub was one of the main reasons I wanted to stay here and the renovation was not listed on their web site. We were also told the outdoor pool and jacuzzi are closed for the season. The only other problem I had was the water in the sink did kind of smell as others have stated. One day I came back to my room and there was a bunch of black residue in the sink, so I knew it had to have backed up some. I ate in the courtyard cafe using the free apetizer/cocktail coupon. For a prime rib dinner with jumbo shrimp cocktail and soda the total with tax was only $12.88. The prime rib was thick cut and everything else was good too. The coupon would have been an even better deal if traveling with others as it was good for up to 4 people. I also ate at the French Market Buffet for breakfast. Their buffet has really cut back on the variety of foods available for breakfast and only served the basics, along with fruit, cereal and danishes. They do still have the omelet/egg station, but there used to be a lot more choices. Overall, the Orleans is still a great choice. They usually have good rates and big, clean rooms. I would stay there again and would also recommend the place to friends on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Grey75t
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a hang out for locals which is fine and for a salesman is off the strip and easy to get around. They have great restaurants to eat. The best thing about it is the price for what you get. I would say a family could stay here and have fun with extra trips to the strip. They have bowling all through the night, movie theatre, and I actually never even saw the pool. Again it was a greta stay for the price. Last time I stayed it was $40 and now in December they are charging $25.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: highxms
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great. Just minutes from the strip. Rooms were very cheap, big, clean, and comfortable. The staff was friendly. We will stay here again. We have stayed in some of the hotels on the strip and this is a much better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: travelbyme
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed in the Orleans simply because the quality of the hotel has gone down. I have stayed here 4 times but this was the worse and i will never go back to stay again. Actually checkin was a breeze they were nice and quick, the bedroom was normal but older style with a door that had a hard time opening and other doors down the hall all seem to slam instead of closing and shutting quietly. The housekeeping did a great job of cleaning. The rooms are just old, old beds, old decor, old faucets, old everything, the pillows are filled with sand or something hard and gave me a sore neck. Its just old, the slot machines are okay, the waitress are the best, the buffet is horrible and the coffee shop is okay. It appears to me that the hotel needs some sort of overhaul, don't stay here if you don't have too.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad, a bit worn, friendly staff except front desk who are evil”
Reviews.Author: orangekitty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few nights and overall found it just okay with the cons canceling out the pros. The rooms are definitely worn and need refurbishment. Carpet was sticky, wallpaper peeling off, and my bathroom's toilet was unscrewed and so rocked when you sat on it. Half the elevator button lights never illuminated when you pressed them. Looks like things neglected here over the years and the hotel has no desire to fix them. Staff in the hotel was friendly EXCEPT the front desk staff. They were the most unfriendly, rude, and incompetent people I've ever dealt with in the hospitality trade. To say they hate their jobs, hate Boyd casinos, and think of customers as painful things to deal with is an understatement. If Boyd group wants to know why they are losing so much money I would say start right here and fire everyone at the front desk. They would openly talk about how stupid the past customer in line was, how they weren't going to accomodate your requests, and how their casino sucked so they didn't care if we went elsewhere. I have no idea how anyone can remain employed treating people like this. Fortunately, everyone else in the hotel was friendly. This included security and the dining facility's staff. We loved the food options at the Orleans as it was affordable, good quality, and never any long waits. Casino itself was a bit on the smokey side with low ceilings but manageable. We didn't mind being a few miles off the strip since we had a rental vehicle. The commute was not long in any way at all.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice”
Reviews.Author: J0-chan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in September of 2007 for two nights and were pleasantly surprised by how spacious the room was. The room was basically a suite with a King bed, a sitting area, a large bathroom and a nice view of the strip. We've paid more for places on the strip that weren't as nice. We think the Orleans breakfast buffet is the best in Vegas and have gone there for breakfast when we've stayed at other hotels, so it was very convenient to roll out of bed and get a great breakfast right downstairs this time. We're not really gamblers, but we enjoyed playing the nickle slots and were happy with the food at TGIFridays and the Courtyard Cafe. The casino was smokey, but it seems they all are, so we just tried to stay out of the really smokey areas if we could. I was impressed by their large bowling alley, but didn't have time to go bowling on this particular trip. We plan on staying at The Orleans again in a few weeks when we go to Vegas during the week of Christmas and the value is unbeatable. I'm really looking forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “would stay again.....at a discounted room price”
Reviews.Author: dianenjnj
Reviews.Content: stayed at the orleans on nov 3, 5, 6...spent the 4th at the 4 queens. we received an offer for a $29 night stay mon-thurs and for the price really could not complain. yes, there is a sewer gas smell in the room...perhaps it was because we were on the 2nd floor that made it worse. however, it was really strong the first day and dissipated for the rest of the stay...i would suggest requesting a higher floor. beds were comfortable, a little harder than we are used to, but ok, pillows were on the flat side...request more. we had a blanket between the "duvet" cover and were quite comfortable. check in was great, as always. we did check in at 10:30 am and were given our room right away....this is a huge plus. rented a scooter for husband and it was at the bell desk. no instruction was given....he was a terror on wheels! sorry for mowing down a contingent of chinese guests on the way out of the elevator! we ate at the courtyard restaurant and as always food was excellent, portions huge and price cheap...i love this place. ate also at the buffet for breakfast. was good. we were lucky and got there at 7:30am...HUGE lineup when we were leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice 'Stay”
Reviews.Author: hawnsteeldoc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have enjoyed the Orleans at least once a year for the last seven years. We have always found it to be a good value given the location, accomodations, restaurants, and other amenities. In our years there , we have had no major problem. I am writing because we just returned from the Halloween weekend and would like to mention a couple of things. First, one night we were woken up at 3 a.m. to the sound of what sounded like a loud buzzing, an almost electric vibrating sound. it seemed to be originating near the door. I inspected the area and found that it was actually air currents passing between the door and the jam. The weather stripping in that area was vibrating due to the high winds that were passing through the hall. We endured that situation through the night, not wanting to bother the maintenance people so late. Next morning I called the front desk to inquire about it, and they actually were not of much help. They told me that it happens to a lot of rooms when the outside winds start to kick it up currents are drawn through the elevator shafts up to the floors, causing the doors to vibrate?... Anyway, they told me to stuff some towels under the door to keep the winds from coming through. I don't know if it helped because the winds died down the next day. Secondly, think this hotel strives to provide everything that the average visitor might need on location so that they don't have to go any place else.. ,Restaurants, spa, theatres, bowling alley, arcade, gym, pool, etc. I think their goal is to keep you on site so you don't go and gamble at another hotel. None of these facilities are top rated, just adequate. That's just the way it is given the cost of things , and the fact that they really can't specialize in any one thing...It's okay, most travelers aren't going to need the higher end stuff, Lots of hotels don't have half of the stuff that the Orleans has. If we want first class stuff, I guess we book the Bellagio , Wynn, or the Venetian..... ka-ching $$$$ So I guess I'm saying that we'd go back unless we find a better value someplace else... I hope that helps.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: kimshi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orleans Hotel & Casino for 2 nights. The location is off the strip, but it is only a couple of miles off the strip. The room was clean and furnished and the view was pretty nice (we stayed on the 11th floor). I was surprised that the bathroom was roomy and clean, however there was no lock on the sliding door. The only thing I was not too fond of was the $5 service charge per night even though we did not make any phone calls or use the coffee machine. The pool was big, but it was shallow and closed early. I would recommend staying here if you are on a budget and want to get away from traffic and chaotic check-ins.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: Tree_and_Me
Reviews.Content: Very nice room for the price. Casino itself was great, with good air quality compared to other smaller casinos. Very comfortable there. Had cheap and good food at the mexican restaurant in casino. Great happy hour prices. Shuttle was convenient, but very busy at times. Can't always count on getting on, and may have to wait for next one. Less than 10 minute taxi ride to strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice large rooms but don't eat here”
Reviews.Author: Laura1956
Reviews.Content: First time staying off the strip in Vegas. Didn't feel isolated because we had a rental car but we did a lot of driving to other casinos because we got bored w/Orleans casino. Hotel room was large, comfortable and easy to access. Bad bathroom design. Sliding bathroom door did not close w/o locking. Toilet and shower/tub combo were in one section of bathroom w/o a door. Other section had sink and closet. Restaurant service was terrible at all 4 restaurants we went to, including the buffet, Fridays, coffee shop and Prime Loft.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money! Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: stripey2000
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 7 night stay at The Orleans Hotel & Casino. We are in our mid 30’s and have travelled quite a lot, including Las Vegas 3 years previously when we stayed at the Luxor. Here are my thoughts… We arrived at around 7pm on a Thursday evening and the check in queue was short and the line was quick. I tried the $20 trick (where you slip a $20 bill under your credit card as you pass it to the clerk for ID) and asked if there were any non smoking, high floor, recently remodelled rooms available with a good view of the strip. The clerk saw the 20, grew a big smile, took it like lightning, quickly glanced from side to side, and said that she would be sure she could find us something which we would be very happy with! Success! The room was fabulous, very big and spacious and exactly as I asked for with a great view of the whole strip (in the distance). First thing we noticed about the room was that there was absolutely no evidence of smoking. There was no stale smoke smell which was perfect, and the general cleanliness of the whole room was absolutely spot on. There were only about 7 coat hangers in the hanging area (sectioned off next to the bathroom) so I called housekeeping and asked for 10 more which were brought to our room within 15 minutes. Heading down to the casino for the first time was quite overwhelming as it’s a huge place. We wandered around to get our bearings, had a few drinks, and played loads of slots for a few hours. However, every time we sat down at a machine and touched the metal part we were getting a static shock. After about 50 of these I was getting really p*ssed off and decided to change my shoes thinking it may have been a footwear related problem. Nope, still getting them! Aaaaargh! This was to be the pain of our holiday – static shocks almost everywhere at every machine, in every casino! The only place where I didn’t get them so bad was in the Palazzo casino. Does anyone else get this? Or is it just my wife an I?! Anyway back to the review…We ate at Don Miguel’s restaurant on our first night which was pretty good. Usual standard Mexican food but the salsa (which came with the complimentary tortilla chips) was just the best tasting we ate anywhere in Vegas! There are a number of other restaurants and food places in the hotel but as we ate out most of the time, we only managed to try the Orleans French Market Buffet and Subway. The breakfast buffet was easily the best value for money that we found anywhere, and the quality was good. We ate breakfast most days here, apart from once at Planet Hollywood, where we found that the price difference was huge but the difference in quality and selection was only minimal. Stick with The Orleans buffet for breakfast and you wont go far wrong! Also, if you sign up for the Club Coast players card you will receive $5 worth of free slot play and a $1 discount per person each visit at the buffet, making it the best value breakfast eats available. Also with your Coast Card you get a 10% discount at the hotel shops including the gift shop. Back to the room again: the furniture wasn’t worn (as some reviewers have stated) and the yellow/gold patterned carpet looked quite new with only a few minor stains here and there. The artwork on the walls was good and colourful and there were lights and lamps everywhere! The seating area close to the big window was nice and we had a full size French style couch (finished with wood detailing) and an armchair to relax in. The large air conditioning unit worked great but woke us up during our first night as it’s quite noisy. Not being able to find an off switch anywhere, we called maintenance who came first thing the next morning. The guy told us to change the control panel setting to “economy” and this would switch the system off until you change the setting again to auto, slow or full. Problem solved! Some people on here have expressed disappointment with the walls being thin but I’m glad to say that we didn’t experience any problems with noise at all – not one bit! Once the door was closed we didn’t hear a peep from the next room either side nor from the corridor during the whole time we were there. A couple of things which my wife asked me to mention was that there is a small patterned window in the bathroom high above the end of the bathtub which you could open wide and let in some fresh air which was nice. Also she liked the fact that the cups in the bathroom were quality plastic cups which were single use (disposable) and sealed, so nobody had used them before. A coffee maker in the room with a range of different coffees and disposable Styrofoam cups was also a bonus. The distance to the room from the casino was easy and made a nice change - when we stayed at the Luxor previously it was about a 20 minute hike to the room from the casino which got really annoying after a few days. I’m glad to say The Orleans was completely the opposite. One reviewer on here mentioned that it was hard to find their room each time due to lack of directional signage. Again, we did not have this problem – there were more than enough directional signs and even a floor plan guide posted on the wall close to the elevators. Another thing, which a previous reviewer mentioned, was about getting dressed up for dinner. I must admit, I did experience what they said in that if you do dress up in your best stuff and look smart, then you will feel a little out of place sometimes in here. This is because most people at The Orleans wear casual stuff like shorts and t-shirt throughout their whole stay including on an evening. The pool was ok, but didn’t find it was anything to write home about. There were plenty of loungers and free towels available for guests to collect as you enter the pool area. 2 pools, one shallow kiddies pool and a larger main pool. The problem with this area is that the big hotel towers block the sun so there is only sun on the main pool itself for about an hour per day, no good for sun worshippers! This issue may have been increased because we were visiting in October when the sun is lower in the sky, I’m not sure. Another thing which was a little annoying was the plant area for the giant air conditioning chiller units which service the hotel was right next to the pool terrace, so you could hear a permanent constant noisy “hummmmmmmmm” throughout the whole area. Certainly not very relaxing when you want to chill out at the pool. Back inside the hotel’s hulking cavern of a casino, there were 5 separate bars (all very much the same) dotted around the casino floor, with the biggest one being in the middle next to the sports book with a small comfy seating area with tables to one side to enjoy a drink. The best thing about staying at The Orleans was that everything inside was very well priced. The bars all offered bottled beers for $1.50 and spirits with a mixer for $3.50. This is a world apart from buying drinks at some casino bars on the strip where you would easily pay at least $8 per drink. There was also a small cabaret lounge where there were live acts on nightly, mostly a band playing with a singer. An additional bar was located at Brendan’s Irish Pub which was over in one corner close to the buffet. Disappointingly it lacked theme and seemed just the same as every other bar in the casino. You could tell it was a kind of half hearted attempt at an Irish pub with a little wood panelling here and there but it was just a bit boring. Worse still, they killed it by having Karaoke on all the time which just drives people out! Never saw more than a few people in there. If you want to visit a real Irish pub, just next to the hotel across from the shuttle bus pick up point, is McMullen’s Irish Pub. We visited there and enjoyed some drinks in a lovely atmosphere and very authentic décor, just like in Ireland itself! The shuttle service to and from the strip was very convenient and was a great way to save money on paying inflated taxi fares. On the couple of occasions when we were unable to catch the last shuttle back from the strip at 12.30am, our taxi fare was around $14 inc a $2 tip. The shuttle was never full and ran every 15 minutes during the day and a little less often on an evening (probably about once every 20 mins). It was a quick service and the bus drivers sure know how to put their foot down and get you there quickly! The only small issue we had with this service was that it didn’t actually start until 9.30am. So some days when we wanted to be up and out early to the strip, we had to get a cab. Overall, yes The Orleans is predominantly a locals hotel and there are not a great deal of tourists here, but it’s a very, very affordable alternative to the sometimes extremely expensive strip hotels. It’s a great place to stay and I’m sure people would find it just as nice and if not better than a lot of the places on the strip. I mean, look at The Tropicana for instance – this place is the pits, it’s on it’s knees and is beyond refurbishment! The Orleans is ten times better, and way cheaper too! If you are looking for a hotel with loads of facilities, big clean rooms, a good theme, well priced food and drink, a huge casino with a wide choice of gaming, and a price which will not break the bank – then I’m sure you wont go far wrong with staying here. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great as Usual”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel2vegas
Reviews.Content: My son and I were at The Orleans Hotel from Oct. 8th -13th, 2008, and as always, we had a very enjoyable stay. I find it hard to believe that anyone would be dissatisfied with The Orleans. I have stayed at this hotel at least six times over the past several years, it's my favorite hotel in Vegas. The rooms are large, housekeeping is excellent, personnel are pleasant, restaurants are good, rooms are reasonable, video poker machines are generous, entertainment is great, and getting around the city is very easy with their free shuttle to the Strip. The only negative I can say is the area around Tropicana Avenue where this hotel is located seems to be going down, and I would not feel completely safe walking alone in the area. But, most of our time was spent inside the hotel or touring the Strip. Also, I went over to their sister hotel, The Gold Coast, and played bingo (transportation was provided free by the hotel shuttle). I find the reviewer's comments on an earlier post regarding bed bugs absolutely unbelievable compared to my experiences at The Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: DonTonyOntario
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week.. Over the past 30 years have stayed at a wide variety of Hotels on the strip. We stayed here on recommendation of a family member. Price was less than half of what we would have paid on the strip. Hotel room was on the 8th floor and had view of the pool. Room was quiet, clean and bathroom was always clean and well supplied. We had rented a car and trips back and forth to the strip and to see some shows was a breeze. (There is a shuttle back and forth to the strip) Good selection of restaurants with good food and at good prices. Yes, the hotel is a little older and off the strip but it is hard to beat for value. Check in/out was quick and we found all staff very friendly and accomodating. It does not meet the standards of the Wyn or the Bellagio but for the price paid for a comfortable room it is extremely good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: JBBT
Reviews.Content: Definitely would stay there again if in Las Vegas and have already recommended to a friend. Had not stayed there before, always stayed on the Strip. Decided to give it a try having seen TripAdvisor reports. Very glad we did. After the initial getting to know the place – we were used to staying in slightly smaller places, the experience was very good. All the staff we had dealings with were exceptionally helpful and friendly without being over the top. The room was large and very comfortable, the air conditioning worked very well – not too noisy and the bed was very comfortable. The pool was lovely – nice surroundings and plenty of room to swim. When we were there it was not over crowded. We ate in the Prime Rib Loft and really enjoyed the meal. One of the best in the holiday and not expensive. Also ate in TGI Fridays and that was good as well. Did not try the other places there to eat. The Shuttle Bus to the strip worked well – the longest we waited was about 10 minutes either way and it drops you off diagonally opposite Bellagios, so very convenient. Self parking is a bit of a walk but once you know where you are going it is acceptable and there is a moving walk-way going to the parking lot. The worst thing was parking to check in as the spaces are very limited. As there were two of us it was OK as I checked in and my partner waited in the car for a space. There is a time limit I think 15 minutes to the spaces so one soon becomes available. The room was good value mid week but we had to be there on the weekend as well, when they had an event in the Arena so rooms were not as reasonable – but still compared well with other venues.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargin”
Reviews.Author: Cheesegrump
Reviews.Content: We decided to try the "off strip'" Orleans and we quite pleased with our stay. The shuttle drops off right across from the Bellagio and seemed fairly regular. The pool is large and there is a kiddy pool and large jaccuzi as well. Our room was LARGE and nicely appointed. We tried the lunch buffet and it was good. The casino isn't so large you get lost and there was a band playing both nights of our stay. We stayed midweek for $80 with the second night free.......great deal!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, good meeting, fun hotel.”
Reviews.Author: stubbs1970
Reviews.Content: I have no idea where the negative reviews of this property are coming from. We held a week long meeting here, and all attendees that expressed an opinion were very happy with the venue. Rooms were very nice. As the meeting organizer, I got bumped to a suite, which was incredible. My coworkers had standard rooms, but also were pleased. Good variety of dining options. Food service for the meeting was outstanding, and we tried a wide variety of offerings for continental breakfasts, lunches, and one group dinner. The sales, banquets, and business center staff were all very helpful and accommodating. Front desk staff was not very accommodating, at all. We had a relatively small group compared to the number of rooms in the hotel - so, although sales and banquets treated us as an important customer, the front desk treated us more as an annoyance to their day because of the special meetings rate under which they had to book us. For organizing meetings, be sure that any special deals or concessions are in writing. Communication among the departments of the hotel is not great, and memories of phone conversations are very short. We did have a few problems that way. Overall, we were happy with our meeting here. Be sure attendees understand, though, that this hotel is not in the middle of the Strip. If they expect to be in the center of things, there may be some disappointments. Only real complaint is that, while the rates for everything were overall very good, there were phantom charges and extras that we did not have any reason to expect. Even with those extra charges, though, the place was still a relative bargain for Las Vegas. They could easily have increased rates, overall, and eliminated the extras - we would have been happier dealing with the staff, and the hotel would not have lost out on the revenue. Overall, we would go back for a meeting. We do intend to go back for a vacation. The casino is very nice, and the published internet rates are attractive, even if we cannot put together a package to include the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre on a good dat”
Reviews.Author: bocanewlywed
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are locals and were going to see a show at the Orleans Arena, and found a rate of $65/night, so we decided to spend the night there. I am just speaking to the potential people who are thinking about staying here, but are expecting something that hilton or marriott offers. The carpet had stains. The room itself was large enough, the bathroom was average. They obviously didn't change the roll of toilet paper in the bathroom prior to our arrival. I definitely wouldn't stay there again. I was expecting more, after reading about the rooms at Suncoast. This hotel is not on par with Suncoast though. My main dislike for the place is trying to search for the entrance near the actual hotel check in. Good luck finding it. We parked in the parking garage of the casino after searching for a while. No signs. Like I said, comparing this place to a normal major brand hotel, it just doesn't compete.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Casino”
Reviews.Author: Mike V
Reviews.Content: We did everything at the Orleans. We ate, drank, gambled, bowled, saw a movie, and I got my hair cut. Everything was satisfactory and I got to hang out with people who are like me--casual. I am just not comfortable at the Wynn or Bellaggio--they're too fancy for me--give me the Orleans any day. The slots were pretty tight, but so were those at the other dozen or so casinos we checked out. That's when I start rolling dice--and did quite well. The rates were fair, the room was comfortable, and the staff was pleasant. I liked the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “No MGM Grand”
Reviews.Author: alriht4u
Reviews.Content: We have used this place for a convention for the past 4 years or so, The rooms are hard to find as no signs are anywhere if one walks down about 5-6 different sections. Check in is always slow. Check out is to be avoided so check out on your TV. This is basically a locals hangout, and; some are downright addicted to gambling. The staff has gone downhlll in the past two years. Their are still some helpful types though. Unless you get out of this place you feel capured. It is no where near the main strip. Yes they have a shuttle to their other BYD casinos. A cab to NYNY or the MGM Grand is about 15 bucks/20 with tip. The Orleans seafood is good, but; most restuarants here are chains like Fridays. If you are a burger, pizza , are a Fridays fan, or like a great prime rib this is your place. The Casino switched to a three tier players card system like Harrahs. Dump 2-3K or gamble about 5K in 4 days and you can cash in 13 bucks or play 25 bucks worth of credits. I hate the comps here. However, the price is right for those on a budget. The rooms are clean, have a coffee maker, plus an iron and a safe. The AC will freeze you out. You could dump this place and 5-10 like it inside the MGM Grand and the MGM Grand would still be less walking. The problem is no signs are posted to find the rooms/elevators from any of the cutoffs and back places. You have to recall where the main cashier and table games are to find the rooms. The restrooms are a long walk from most slots and table games. I have won here. A 12,700 plus jackpot in 06 and have lost some, too. I see why the locals come here. They know to come at 3-5 AM. Take note of that time down.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Richard320
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice on two consecutive Sundays at the beginning and end of a longer trip. Check-in was easy and fast, room was clean and large, bed was very comfortable and it was CHEAP. Room excellent, buffet better than average, location a bit poor - no other casinos within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “don't gamble”
Reviews.Author: foxrun1717
Reviews.Content: great place to stay and eat, clean large rooms, good food for reasonable prices, but "WARNING"....do not,,,repeat.,,,do not gamble on the slots or video poker......these machines are set sooooo tight, they make the airport machines seem loose, i recommend you stay and eat there, but do yourself a favor take the shuttle or go elsewhere to play machines, we found the downtown machines good.......good luck....

Reviews.Title: “Not too good”
Reviews.Author: niperjak
Reviews.Content: For the money the Orleans is good value and you would pay a lot more in the UK to stay in lesser hotels. There are downsides to this place though. Vegas is a glitzy and Glamorous town, get dressed up to go to the Orleans eateries or casino and you will feel very out of place. The market buffet is very down market, miserable waiters, drab decor, bad odour, greedy americans piling their plates high with all sorts. The cleanliness of the rooms has declined over recent times, having your wardrobe open plan in the bathroom is not nice either. The carpets in the casino are now filthy and give the casino a very bad odour. I visited the Hilton during my stay and noticed how nice the brass and glass was kept on the entrance doors, the Orleans entrance doors are very dirty and unkempt. If you are on a tight budget go for it but otherwise note that this hotel is very much on the decline

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Excellent for the Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: nameisalreadytaken
Reviews.Content: Eight blocks off the strip but plenty of glitz. Spacious and very clean room had all the features, from hair dryer to phone in bathroom - all at 1/7 the price of the fancier strip hotel where my conference was held. Adequate pools but not fancy nor extended hours. Friendly and helpful staff at security stations by hotel elevators. Only hotel ever stayed at with brass bathroom fixtures! (Probably a mistake as they do show a bit how much care brass fixtures really require, but not at all grungy.) Parked in front rather than in suggested ramp and found several free drink coupons on car. Sign up for free Coast Club card even if not a gambler for discounts at onsite restaurants etc - and it includes a few free spins of the slots. Buffet food okay if very carefully selected, but suggest their other (popularly priced) restaurants instead - or wonderful neighborhood tavern directly across street: McMullans, with real Irish food and music and sometimes even stepdancing. Cons: limited number of TV channels; $5 daily 'resort' fee added on to posted or negotiated rates (includes free local and 800 calls). A neighbor complained of an odor similar to hair salon strongest near elevators (13th floor) and very faint in some rooms, but did not bother us and do not know of its permanence.

Reviews.Title: “Good !”
Reviews.Author: braun-global
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Large rooms, with separate couch area in the rooms. Had one looking to the las vegas strip. Great view !!!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: kobejack
Reviews.Content: This hotel in our opinion was great. The rooms were nice, good sized, and bathrooms were large for hotel standards. Everyone from the dealers, to waiters, to desk clerks were very friendly. The only negative I could say is that the two restaurants we tried were not the best, but o.k. Loved the 99 cent margarita's at the mexican restaraunt. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting something off the strip but with easy transportation to and from.

Reviews.Title: “always a great experience”
Reviews.Author: misspipsy
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel twice a year every year for a trade show. It's close to the Strip. The rooms are big. All the staff very nice and helpful. Great restaurants. Everything the Strip hotels offer but more reasonable and more down to earth. Such a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: landsbelt
Reviews.Content: I was traveling for business, overnight. The Orleans was Great! Early check-in was not a problem, the rooms are big, with a nice desk/working area and an updated bathroom. I was very pleased with the quality of the room!! The hotel is large and has several options for food, bar and entertainment! It's close to the airport and easy to reach without even getting on the freeway! I would stay here again, just down the street from NY,NY and other big resorts. The price is unbeatable, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “What a Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: tab00007
Reviews.Content: We Arrived late Saturday evening so we wanted an inexpensive hotel due to the late late check in. Every hotel on the Strip was pricey that night. We found a good deal at the Orleans. I went in not expecting much. I was very surprised. It is off the strip but no big deal. As i checked in I had mentioned to the front desk it was our first time in Vegas, and they gave us a SUITE for the price of our delux room. We could not believe the size of our room it was amazing. The hotel was wonderful I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great as usual”
Reviews.Author: ttonetom
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is as it always is, comfortable, predictable, and economical. ( I even tried the 20 dollar trick this time and they handed it back!). We ended up in newer room on the 20th floor and it was better than normal. Clean and a great view. The slots and video poker seem tighter but thats probably a relection of the economy.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great value!”
Reviews.Author: pokeymom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans from 25-29 August -- this was my 6th stay at this hotel in 3 years and all I can say is that it's STILL a great value! Paid only $31/night for a room in the new tower (9th floor) with two queen beds -- and for some reason I was not charged the $5 resort fee, but who's complaining??? Also, had to request a refrigerator for my niece's medicine and there was no charge for that either. Staff was pleasant enough but I was disappointed to learn that they've done away with the coupon books! Pillows are still pretty wimpy, but I requested two extra and they helped out "somewhat". Pool was wonderful, as usual, and my husband and I still agree that the Orleans pool is one of the best in Vegas -- no frills but clean and always with a chair available! Slots were tight, but there seemed to be a good crowd in the casino anyhow. Oh, didn't take the shuttle, but it looks like they finally put up a rope to help que the line .... that should make some folks happy. Highly recommend the Irish Pub next door -- the Tuesday night Trivia (8pm) is a family favorite. Will be back to the Orleans again at Thanksgiving --- hard to stay away!

Reviews.Title: “No need for the strip Will stay here from now on”
Reviews.Author: papabear53
Reviews.Content: August 25th through the 29th, Booked air through Southwest Airlines and rooms through Expedia $40.00 per room Monday through Friday, after many hours of trip advisor research we settled on the Orleans. We travel to vegas at least once a year and have made a pact that we would stay at a diffrent reasonable place each year. Starting ten years ago we started at the now gone West Word Ho, Circus Circus, The Frontier, Star Dust, Imperial Palace, Tropicana, MGM, Riviera, and last year the Mirage. But I must say none of the other places we've stayed have anything on the Orleans. From the time we arrived everthing was great. Check-in was a breeze bell hops maids, everyone was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are bigger and roomier than any we've stayed at on the strip,clean and well maintained. House keeping was prompt with requests. The casino floor is huge this our reason for visiting Vegas is to Gamble, Eat and Drink, nothing else. So we were happy with the casino floor plenty of slots as well as tables with limits to accomadate us low rollers. Reastaurants were all good and plentiful ate at the buffets a couple of times as well as the 24 hour court yard cafe, wonderful breakfast as well as great late night gamblers specials. Also ate at the Rib Loft best piece of Prime Rib I've ever had my wife and sister in-law had the T-bone just as good, great service. Overall we had a great stay, never made it out to the pool but it looked very nice and roomy. The coffee and the girls at the Seattles Best coffee were just super by the second day they knew me by my first name and what I needed, great staff. Overall my wife and I have considered going back and just staying at the Orlean the entire time. Walking the strip is getting harder and harder, strip casinos don't seem to need your money and cater less and less to folks like us. Saw more slot winners at the orleans in one day than two days wondering the strip. Although I must say that we did go down town as we do every year and had a great time for the day, Did great at Binons and also had the best lobster tails at Robertas in the Cortez.. All in all The Orleans is now our favorite place and we will be returning every chance we get. I hope this helps in picking a Hotel/Casino to stay at

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: Oscar827
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans because we played in a slot tournament. We stayed from Aug 24th to the 29th. we received 3 free nights and paid $30 for the extra night. We had a great stay. We also played in a couple other tournaments their in the last couple years. We go to Vegas 3 to 4 times a year. Each time we have stayed at the Orleans it has been a pleasant experience. This time the room was very clean and had no problems. The rooms are good size but not fancy and old but clean. the people we came contact with we very friendly with the exception of couple at one of the bars. Check-in was easy and we got to the hotel around 5:00 in the afternoon. Check-out was also no problem. We ate this at the buffet once and it was reasonable and was one dollar off with your care the food was fine. Cost 7.75 with the card i think. We mainly ate at the Courtyard Cafe. I think it is the best place at the Orleans. Good T-bone special plenty of food. In fact it was plenty of food for 2 people. Good beverage service when you are playing especially in certain sections. Very friendly. As far as the gambling goes we broke close to even playing slots. Played some craps and blackjack and did okay from time to time. Played on the 5 dollar tables. The shuttle service to the strip has always been good and on time and has not been a problem. The pool area is okay not elegant. it was not overly populated. It does have alot of sun in the morning. That was okay with with me. If you have never been to Vegas before I would reccomend the strip, but if you have been to the strip as many time as we have a casino is a casino. The only difference is the elegance. We have always held our own with the gambling at the Orleans and that is why we stayed there. Plus we have been able to get some good deals. Give it a try if you have not stayed there before.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: KansasKukana
Reviews.Content: My husband and I like to stay at The Orleans because it's not surrounded by other hotels. We arrived at a very popular check-in time, but the line moved fairly quick and the employees were friendly and courteous.
