There are plenty of places to eat in the hotel, so you don't have to travel elsewhere, if you don't want to. If you aren't in the mood for gambling, you can go bowling or watch a movie. The rooms are pretty basic, and my biggest complaint would be the flat pillows. But the room rate was very good, so we were still very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Tiff2345
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orleans for four days this week while attending a convention that was located in the hotel. I stayed there only so I would not have to travel each day to the convention but it turned out that my stay was wonderful and I will stay there again. This was only my second trip to Vegas and my first hotel stay (in downtown Vegas), while it wasn't a complete nightmare, left much to be desired. The Orleans hotel was clean, my room was very neat and clean and comfortable. The breakfast buffet at the French Quarter was GREAT. Our lunches and dinners were held in the banquet room and the food was great and the staff was very attentive. All of the hotel staff was friendly and very accomodating. There is also free computer and internet access available for hotel guests for 10 minutes each day. The only complaint that I have is that during some of our classes there was smoking outside of the rooms because there were some games located there. I am not a smoker and hate to smell smoke...I could tolerate the smell while walking through the casino to get to the conference center and figure it is to be expected but it really was noticable while in the classrooms. Overall I enjoyed my stay and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “One of our regular places”
Reviews.Author: dianedennis55
Reviews.Content: I get brochures from The Orleans because I have stayed there previously and often get buy one night, get one free coupons in the mail. It is a little dated, off the strip, strange bathroom door, but I win at this place so I don't mind the little things. The pool is huge, the off-strip location makes it easier to park if you rent a car during your trip. There is a shuttle going to the strip and Gold Coast Casino (near Rio). Wasn't crazy about their buffet. Go to Sam's Town for that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent off-strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: maynard7
Reviews.Content: This is my new favorite reasonably-priced hotel in Vegas. Of course it isn't as nice as Bellagio, but my room was very nice and less than $50 per night. The room was very large and even had a sofa, chair and coffee table. The mattress was very comfortable, but it had one of those moisture-resistant mattress pads. I had to remove it because it made me sweat. There's a coffee maker in the room, an in-room safe and an ironing board. The bathroom was large and nice as well, and there was even a phone next to the toilet. They do charge a $5 per day per room "resort fee" which is silly (why don't they just charge $5 more on the room rate?). The fee includes phone calls, 10 minutes daily of internet use in the business ceneter, and use of the fitness center. The fitness center looks brand new and has new Nautilus equipment, plus many types of cardio equipment. There's also showers, steam room, etc. Maybe I was just lucky, but my room was very quiet, and I barely heard any noise from other guests. There's a big parking garage in the back which is a bit far from the rooms, but valet parking is free if you don't mind somebody else driving your car. It's about a mile or so from the strip, but they have a free shuttle. If you've never been to Vegas before, you'll probably want to be on the strip for all the action, but veterans would be very happy here.

Reviews.Title: “We were pleased :_)”
Reviews.Author: livelaughlove987
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned early this morning from our very first trip to Vegas, and I chose to stay here because it was away from the noisy strip. I did extensive research on what hotel we would stay at once we actually went, and the Orleans was it. We checked in with very little wait, and was assigned our room. Entering the room we were pleased at the size and there was no cigarette smell at all:_) the room(standard) was clean and just a tad bit dated. However it was functional with a pretty nice size bathroom that was really roomy. Although we are NOT gamblers in any way, we still enjoyed some of the other things Vegas had to offer. We took the hoover dam mini tour and we were blow away. We also did the madam tasaud's exhibit at the Venetian.....what a waste of $ just my personal opinion. Being that we are from N.Y. and there is a 3 hour time change we didn;t get to do all that was on our "to do list" We did see a magic show, the siren show at T.I. and other small attractions on the strip. And we visited just about every hotel on the strip and ooh and Aaah at the shops. (LOL) In conclusion, my thoughts of visiting Vegas for the first time is to be totally prepared to bring your most comfortable footwear. Be prepared to be chase down by pushy time share folks all over the strip who promise to get you into a show for free. (don't fall for it) and taking a cab will cost you a grip with cabbies who claim "mam....I know a shorter way to get there" a bunch of bull!!!! it cost me $30.00 to go to circus circus to visit. Will we be back???? that's a very big maybe. I realize by taking the monorail will save you the agony of painful blisters on your feet when walking to the strip in 108 degree weather:_( all in all we enjoyed our selves. I just wished i could stay up past 9:00 Remember....this hotel is very clean, and so affordable with a reliable shuttle service that will take guest to and from the strip every half hour. Give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay as usual”
Reviews.Author: TJMICKEY
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 9 night stay at The Orleans. We have stayed there many many times and have always been very happy there. We were there on an offer from them for $29 per night for Sun - Thurs and $90 for Fri & Sat. At check-in we asked to upsell to a one-bedroom suite for our stay. The additional charge to do this was $25 per night for the week nights and $50 per night for Fri & Sat. The suites were recently redone and are beautiful. New carpeting, new furniture, 2 huge wall hung plasma tvs. One in the living room and one in the bedroom. There were 2 additional tvs as well. One over the bar area and one on the bathroom vanity. The very large bar area has 4 bar stools and a refrigerator that housekeeping stocks daily with bottled water. We have been very satisfied with all the restaurants at the Orleans. Our favorite is the Prime Rib Loft. EXCELLENT meat and great attentive service. We did notice an occasional sulfur smell in our hallway on the 21st floor but the odor never came into our suite so we weren't really bothered by it. The Orleans is such a great value in Vegas that we can't imagine staying anywhere else. We're looking forward to our next stay in 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: barbrx
Reviews.Content: This is our third trip to Las Vegas. We stayed previously at NYNY and at the HGVC at the Flamingo and this by far was our best trip. You really don't have to leave the hotel for any entertainment since it's pretty much a resort in itself. We used the lovely pool area every day. It was quite relaxing and some areas were shaded until around noon. More umbrellas should be available but otherwise very well maintained and clean. We heard the casino was smokey, but really not more than any of the others on the strip. Harrahs is the worst for smoke. We only visited the strip twice the whole week since we were doing pretty well on our own casino slots. Don Miguel's is a great place to go for happy hour which is 12 til 5 every day with half price appetizers and $.99 margaritas. The breakfast and dinner buffets are excellent and very inexpensive. Our room was a non-smoking room, large and very clean. Having a liquor store on the premises was a pleasant surprise and very reasonable. We used free shuttle to the strip which seemed to arive about every 15 minutes which is extremely convenient. The driver was very friendly as were all the employees of the Orleans. I'm already looking at staying there again in the near future. Thanks to everyone for a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible beds, won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: wired2theworld
Reviews.Content: I am stunned at the positive reviews on this hotel. Our experience was not so good and it wasn't because of any specific thing that happened just a general overall unfavorable experience. Check in took a long time and when we arrived at our room it was open and still being cleaned. We were in a non-smoking room but could smell cigarette smoke coming in when we turned the AC off. The beds were horrible-uncomfortable, low quality sheets with a plastic liner underneath which crinkled every time we rolled over. The mattress sagged and the pillows were hard foam (3 on a king sized bed). Neither my husband, nor I, nor my mother (in another room) slept well. Soundproofing in the rooms is non-existent. I found the room decor tacky. The rooms do not have refrigerators or mini-bars. There was a long wait for the elevators every time. Out of the 6 elevators for each side it seemed like only two were working at any given time. We were on the 15th floor and every time we tried to go down to the lobby, the elevators were packed, we stopped at every floor and there were more people waiting to get on. It became a running joke among guests on the elevator ('how many floors will we stop at this time?"). We decided to stay there because everyone else for a family event was staying there. The only positive thing I can say is that the room size was decent. We paid $125 per night. Next time I will spend a little more for something much better.

Reviews.Title: “Another Good Stay at The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: CalItalian
Reviews.Content: Great check-in. We were first in line. Had our room requests filled without a problem. Rooms are still nice and very clean. Had no problem parking in their garage on the first floor even on busy dates like July 4 and 5. The carpet in the hall outside the room did show a few stains. Have not seen that before. On July 4 and 5, although the hotel was nearly but not completely sold out, the elevators were quite crowded and sometimes you needed to wait for one. One time I had to wait for the 5th elevator. Ice machine was also out one day. No more coupon book at check-in. I asked and they have discontinued them. Buffet was great. Lines moved fast even on July 4 and 5. If you sign up (first time) for the players club (Club Coast), they will give you a coupon for a FREE breakfast or lunch buffet. You can instantly use it. Stayed 7/1-7/5. Paid $23.40 per night the first 3 nights and $61 on Friday, July 4 plus got a $50 gas card from Expedia. Would stay again. One week prior I stayed at the South Point Hotel which is newer and nicer rooms but a little further from the main strip vs. The Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel/casino”
Reviews.Author: Morrand
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas (for the first time) for a business trip, and had this hotel strongly recommended since the shuttle for the business I was visiting stopped here. Rates were very good, and the room was quite well furnished for the price. Bathrooms and linens were clean and the room was well lit. I didn't have a great view out my window, but the windows were nice and clean and I can't complain about that. Air conditioning worked well. The restaurants on-site were good. Service was friendly but slow at the on-site steakhouse, but dinner there was very good and made up for the wait. The hotel's credit card machines were down during my stay, so they were having some trouble processing charges and check-in was a bit slow. Check-out went much faster. I used the hotel's bell service to hold my bags for the last day of the trip and they did a fine and friendly job of it. This may not be the fanciest or the snazziest hotel in Vegas, but it is perfectly fine for the price and I would happily go back.

Reviews.Title: “A nice alternative to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: ellejaytrips
Reviews.Content: On our recent trip to Vegas to visit family, we stayed at the Orleans for 4 days, then drove to Zion National Park for a few days, and returned to the Orleans since we were flying out of Vegas the next morning. This hotel was half way between our family's home and the Strip, so it was a decent location. The prices were less than on the Strip, especially during the weeknights. We never did use the shuttle to the Strip. The rooms are large, as were the pool and hot tub. The landscaping was nicely done for a "value" hotel. The only thing we didn't like about the room was the bathroom. There is no door between the tub/toilet and sink, so although the bathroom was very large and included closet space and room for luggage, it was not very private. One evening, a siren went off at about 2am. I believe it was on another floor but it was very loud and we heard it in our room. A recorded message kept broadcasting that the cause of the alarm was unknown. This went on for over an hour. My husband finally went down to the lobby to ask security about this. An unfriendly guard informed him that nothing was wrong and told everybody to go back to their rooms. Not very comforting! On the way back to the room, he ran into another guard who did tell him that the problem was a water pipe burst on another floor. I don't know why the alarm kept continuing, or why the guard at the lobby could not provide more information, but this put a damper on our stay. There are several restaurants here. We tried the Prime Rib Loft, which I found to be very good and reasonably priced. There is also a video game room, movie theatre and bowling alley on the premises, making this an ideal place for families.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: 1LuckyTexan
Reviews.Content: We had 3 rooms total for our little family reunion. The only complaint was a minor smell from the bathroom sink in one room. (they have an odd drain plug arrangemnet - dunno if that affects anything). Check in and check out was very smooth. Shuttle bus was quite convenient. Everyone that worked there was helpful with any question we had. I also liked having a choice for valet vs self-park. I would definitely return and recommend to others. Carl

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel 4 1/2”
Reviews.Author: jinxie1300
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Beds were decent, pillows are just as atrocious as everybody warns so if you can bring your own or ask for more. I asked for more at about 5pm on the first night and they arrived about 20min later. Shower was huge and bath tub was huge. I had a bath since it was bigger than my tub at home. The housekeeping was wonderful and replenished the toiletries every day. Rooms were huge and the couch was very comfortable too. Had a decent view of the Rio and Palms and the window in the hall had a full view of the Strip. Cafe food very good, had breakfast there nearly every day. Terrible Mikes had really good greasy burger and awesome fries. The buffet was ok and for free it was elevated to good. I wouldn't pass this hotel up. Traveling with a group of six and had three rooms. They accidentally issued one of us a king room and they were able to switch it out just fine and keep our party all on the same floor. Pool...eh, only goes to three feet but since I'm not the biggest pool person it was tolerable. Lots of kids, but the pool was big enough it didn't seem crowded. Also fyi very, very good lemon drops. I had one the first night and I couldn't order any other drink as I was gambling. Came out about $40 ahead and did the best on the poker machines near the stage. What else to say? The liqour store prices couldn't be beat. I bought a bottle of Smirnoff that would have cost me 5.00 more here in Utah and the wine selection was very nice. The pillows were my only complaint. (Parking was a little far off from the rooms but compared to other hotels it wasn't that bad) I would go back if I weren't still testing out the other hotels...it was only my second trip to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven for Horse-Players”
Reviews.Author: SamiGalaxy
Reviews.Content: If you love playing the horses in Vegas (and don't mind being away from the strip), you've found HEAVEN!! A nice-sized RACE BOOK with romantically-old (non-electronic) boards that brings back memories of 1980's race books .. .. But, each seat has a new monitor .. .. BEST OF ALL >> Every single channel covering the races can be seen DIRECTLY IN YOUR ROOM!! HOW SWEET IS THAT??!! No other Hotel in 'Vegas will dedicate around 10 of their T V channels to what is being shown downstairs in the Race Book .. .. So for those you want some peace during their races, or just want to do something in yoru room and not miss their race, here is the place to stay .. .. And, their TURF CLUB card seems pretty easy to rack up points the more you play .. .. ORLEANS is dedicated to locals so the machines are 'looser' and the food is cheaper .. .. BUFFETS are okay but the FACILITY is just fine for a stay .. .. 70 LANES OF BOWLING upstairs! 16 BIG MOVIE SCREENS upstairs! Saw Wall-E on opening night ! And, if you're missing the strip, they have a SHUTTLE to the Old Barbary Coast from 9:30A-Midnight .. .. Perfect for a ride home after a show .. ..

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: gubosson
Reviews.Content: We ended up only staying one night. The hotel smelled like smoke really really bad. Just checking in was a nightmare with all the smoke, now I understand Vegas is smoky...but this was the worst casino floor by far. Poor ventilation. Also the shower/tub are on the outside by the balcony so you feel like you are hanging off the side of the building when you shower. A window in the shower opens and our ledge below that had nasty lighters and cig butts thrown out there. Went to breakfast and the lady at the buffet rudely informed us we had better hurry we had 8 minutes to eat breakfast and that was it PERIOD. Hated it will NEVER go back to this hotel. VERY FAR OFF THE STRIP. Good view of strip clubs if that is what you like to look at.

Reviews.Title: “Great as usual!”
Reviews.Author: davisms53
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Orleans, and I think we enjoyed it much more than the first time. My wife and I arrived at the hotel at about 0830 in the morning, and had no problem checking in. As a matter of fact we received an excellent room on the 20th floor with a great view. (Did I mention we only paid $30 dollars a night?). Maid service was great, the Courtyard Cafe was delicious for breakfast every day, there were always chairs at the pool to relax in the sun, and all of the staff we encountered were very helpful. The band in the lounge, Mocca, played every night, and was a great time. We even got to meet a former member of The Temptations who was there watching also... We had a car rental this year which I highly recommend since this hotel is off the strip, but from what I remember the shuttle last year was very prompt, and hardly ever had a line... Thanks again Orleans Casino for a wonderful stay, and we can't wait to come back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Half the price--twice the value!”
Reviews.Author: fredsbabe
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before, and this year we chose to stay here for a 1-nt. stay before driving to Utah. Although we reserved a standard room for $70, we were put in a beautiful executive suite with a strip view. The buffet is great and costs about half of what you would pay on the Strip. The cafe gives you a ton of food at a great price, and there's also a TGI Fridays & Subway, besides the nicer restaurants. There's a multi-screen movie theater & bowling alleys. If you like to hang out at the pool, the sun doesn't hit the pool area until around Noon in May (because of the way the towers are situated). In the fall, you don't get much sun at all--that's the only downside. We've stayed at many places on the Strip, but we're definitely coming back here from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay !!”
Reviews.Author: respuelk
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, spacious and didn't smell of smoke. It had a coffee maker, iron/ironing board, blow dryer and a safe. Breakfast buffet was good, the lunch buffet was bad. Did not try dinner buffet. Cafe was okay. Great gambling with a super VP selection. Nice poker room and most of the waitresses were HOT !!!!!! Nice pool area. Can't beat the price and it is a short shuttle ride to the strip or the Rio/Palms area. The only negative is that it is not within walking distance of any other casino, but the shuttles are plenty and a cab ride is not expensive from the strip. I'll never stay on the strip again. It's either downtown or the Orleans for me.

Reviews.Title: “Still the Best deal”
Reviews.Author: colonialmist
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans after trying Sam's Town. Sam's Town is good, but The Orleans was better (They are both Boyd Gaming properties). Their Buffet was better, It was much easier to get to the Strip, the pool was much larger and they had more slots and tables. I only regret that there were very few $5 blackjack tables (usually one or two) and they seemed to have phased out all the $3 tables.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in vegas for dining and gambling”
Reviews.Author: no1teacher_us
Reviews.Content: I was there last summer and I didn't want to leave! The hotel itseelf is immaculate. The staff is extremely courteous. Great perks. Upon checking in, you are given a coupon book with lots of goodies. I had never tried wine and was given a bottle with my dinner at their buffet. Everytime I go there, I visit their buffet. Best food ever. The coupon book also gives free drinks, souvenirs, free play, and more. The physical layout of the gambling areas are excellent to move around in, and the theme makes you feel like you really are in New Orleans. I would definite return to this Hotel and Casino: Wait, I have returned for the past 5 or 6 years and plan on visiting it again this November. I am from El Paso and when I win the Texas lottery I will spend lots of time there!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, friendly, quick to get around.”
Reviews.Author: acebarrett
Reviews.Content: I knew from previous reviews that this is not a high end resort. However, having stayed at the 2 other resorts before, both big and high end...I really enjoyed this resort. Its not the kind of room you walk into and say "this is the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at" but it's clean, comfortable, beds are new and supportive, not hard. The restroom is a little strange, with the closet by the sink and a really heavy slidding wood door. The little window in the shower was neat. My room mate was a smoker so I could open it up and send the smoke out and it was nice to let the sun and fresh air in while having a shower. The front desk staff, buffett staff, cashiers & housekeeping are all super nice. I had a 2nd floor room facing the pool. It was quick and easy to get to the casino, shuttle & food. the shuttle came often and most of the drivers were fun and funny. The slots were loose at night, very tight during the day (for me anyway). The casino was busy during tournaments & weekends, but the rest of the time I could get the machines I wanted. I am a super low roller and have a budget of $100 per day. I ended up spending $300 on penny slots & walked away with $400 over all, so up $100 there. The pool area was nice, lots of shady places under the palm trees, but too many kids in the pool for me. The service at the pool bar was unfriendly, so I tipped accordingly. The buffet. I personally like quality over quantity so this buffet was a little lacking for me. The roast was typically overcooked and grisly & the choices were limited to tacos, overcooked pasta, pizza & overcooked corn on the cob. However, the salad bar was fresh and good, lots of fruit available and the dessert bar was great. Stay away from the eggs benedict, not good. The convenience store was open 24 hours and has everything you may need including advil, gum, soda & snacks. Since it only take 2 minutes to get there from your room it truly is convenient. The liquor store is fantastic, great prices and 10% or 20% off with your club card. No need to go off resort to get your liquor or beer. We got a free breakfast/lunch buffet coupon for signing up for the club card. TGI Fridays was over priced for mediocre food. When we checked out the "Resort Fee" that everyone complains about didnt exist & we were not charged the $15 per day for our fridge, Saving us $100 on that alone. The Business Services room was great, I went daily for my free 10 minutes of internet, never had to wait and the staff there were great. I have been back for 2 weeks and I have already received promotionals for $99 for 3 nights plus entry into the slot tournaments, so my low roller status actually means something to them. Overall I was very impressed with this resort. It's not high end, but its comfortable, relaxed and fun. Not the place to party or for the younger drinkin crowd. However happy hour 99 cent drinks is always fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great First Time Experience!”
Reviews.Author: katinla90717
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the Orleans. We usually stay on the strip but decided to stay off the beaten path and we had a great time! Rooms were very nice for the price and the service was outstanding. We ate at the sushi and chinese restaurant which was very very good! We are planning to stay again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: SOLANGE03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Orleans for three nights...it is our third time at this resort. We paid $30 per night for the first two nights, and $70 for Friday night, which is quite a deal in Vegas. Our room was on the 19th floor and the only way to describe the room is pristine it was so clean. We ate breakfast in the cafe each morning and were pleasantly surprised to pay $3.95 per person for eggs, hash browns, bacon, sausase and toast. We also had dinner in one of the other restaurants, cannot remember the name, but the food was great and more than enough to eat. Staff was always friendly and check-in took less than five minutes. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. There is a movie theater, bowling alley, Kids Quest, arcade, etc. If fact, you never have to leave it if you don't want to.

Reviews.Title: “Just got back”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaAC
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Orleans about 3-4 times a year. We always have a nice, relaxing time there. We enjoy the large, ample rooms, tasty, quality food at the various restuarants, beautiful pool area, the nice beds, and the amenities there. We're not really into gambling, so we look more to the resort quailties. Boyd gaming is putting money into the hotel. We always notice something new. This trip all the towels and glassware were new. We've never experienced problems with bed bugs. We travel quite a bit, so we know to check everywhere we stay right away. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Smell Throughout the Hotel Drove Me Away After 3 Hours”
Reviews.Author: SammyKitty
Reviews.Content: we had booked tickets to see a comedy show at the Orleans, so we decided to stay the night, too. i was skeptical about staying off the strip, but the reviews on this site were so positive. from the moment i walked into the Hotel from the Casino, i could smell an intense horrible fragrance. it must be to mask all the cigarette smoke that a previous poster had mentioned. it was present in our nonsmoking room. we could not open the window, except for the tiny bathroom one. i was so exhausted that we ended up taking a nap, and i hoped the smell would fade with time, but it didn't. we went out by the pool, and good lord, i could smell it there, too. the darn exhaust was blowing the same stink outside. from there, we called the Luxor, and luckily secured a nice clean odor-free room. when we checked out, and asked for the manager, they said it would be a 45 minute wait as he was on a break. we just could not wait, but i did tell the desk clerk why we were checking out after 3 hours. in retrospect, i should have left sooner, but i was so darn tired and looking forward to a nap, plus, i thought the smell would go away. we did return in the evening for a comedy show we had already booked. luckily, the auditorium did not have the smell. i would never stay here again, nor would i recommend it to someone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place that had everything”
Reviews.Author: mermaid1970
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the Orleans and have already booked another stay for August. This place was exceptionally clean and the service was great. There are many places in the casino to eat and on any budget. They offer a free shuttle service every 20 minutes to the strip and the drivers are nice and prompt. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a clean, comfortable place to stay, away from the crowds on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Never Stay on the Strip Again!”
Reviews.Author: See_The_USA_2007
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Vegas. I learned that staying on the Strip is overrated and too expensive. The Orleans has a shuttle service to the Strip every 20 minutes, plus, the hotel itself has a huge casino, numerous restaurants, and a couple of bars. We even saw a movie there and I got my hair cut by the man that used to cut Frank Sinatra's hair! He has a picture to prove it. Anyway, the rooms were clean and comfortable with a pamaramic view of the Strip. I recommend this hotel to everyone who is tired of getting ripped off by the fancy over-priced hotels. I used the $300 I saved on the hotel to fund my entertainment, and you should too. Atlanta, GA

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for except the BED BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: niqr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband and another couple for the Viva Las Vegas 11th Rockabilly Weekend held every first week of April. When we arrived the check-in was smooth except, that they asked for the actual credit card that was used to make the reservation??? The room was in a non-smoking floor, but it smelled really bad like a mix between humidity and sewage. We called the front desk, but there weren’t any other rooms available. The 2nd night when we woke up we had a horrible rash in the legs and forearms, JUST TO FIND OUT the beds had bedbugs. We complained about it but nothing was done. The 3rd night the toilet was over flooding we called maintenance and they came right away. The main floor had a really bad smoke smell; the restaurant food was pretty decent. The complementary transportation from the hotel to Vegas Strip and vice versa was good and we didn’t had to wait a long time for it to arrive. We used the TV check-out system and it was fast and accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lizhar
Reviews.Content: Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. Have stayed in Mandalay Bay,Paris,Monte Carlo, and have got to say, this hotel is every bit as good. We had a great time, room was spotless, could not fault the maid service. Buffet was very good. Great Swimming Pool. Used the shuttle bus and never had to wait more than a couple of minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but be careful about the price!”
Reviews.Author: lehmak
Reviews.Content: We thought we were receiving a great price, but when we went to check in, we realized that they didn't give us the special we thought we were getting. According to them, there was no special and we would need proof in order for them to give it to us at those rates. Because it was an online ad we had seen, and we weren't able to go back in time and view an ad that had expired, we were out of luck. We were charged a higher rate. I also had asked for the best view possible since it was our 25th anniversary and was told it would be a pool view. We were on the 19th floor, way too high to even view the pool- or much else. WE did, however, have a great view of the parking lot. The hotel itself was fine. It is very clean and neat. The casino, which you must walk through, is VERY smokey, which was a problem for my 14 yr. old son. The food was good in the two restaurants that we ate in. The pool area was nice, but it filled up pretty quickly. It was in the shade until around 11:30 or so, but was then fine. You could rent a float device but it wasn't cheap- $10.00. On the other hand, it is a good idea because the lawn chairs were difficult to get. Other then the problem with the price, it was a nice, clean hotel which we would go back to. The movie theater was handy!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed There Smelled That.”
Reviews.Author: kz1300a1
Reviews.Content: Yes, its not a horrible place but there are probably nicer places to stay in Vegas. There are nonsmoking and smoking floors and my floor was a non smoking floor but, there was evidence that smoking occurs anyway. The room I had was nice and roomy with internet access for around 11.00 per 24 hours. There was a small coffee pot too. I found the staff to be really friendly which is actually a contrast to my previous Las Vegas trips. Since I was there for a convention and not the Casino I can comment on the convention facilities which were nice but, missing adequate outlets for laptops. I also, used the workout room and saw the spa facilities which were really surprisingly nice. The pool looked nice too. On the downside the hotel overall was a bit smelly (mostly cigarette smoke) but, it is afterall a casino but maybe they could afford some ventallation. At the time I booked the price was about 70 dollars per night. There is a 5.00 per day resort fee which I am not sure I understand yet. The food at the hotel was fair and edible as hotel food goes. This hotel is off the main strip and they do have shuttles to get you to the strip. A taxi trip to and from the airport will cost you around $20.00. I probably would not stay at this hotel again unless it was for a convention or maybe I was on a tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay”
Reviews.Author: lalotp
Reviews.Content: The Orleans Casino is a Casino with rooms and that is about it. Got a deal on their website where the rooms were $50 a night. Rooms are outdated, there is a FEE of $13 for internet + they add $5.00 a night for a RESORT FEE?! Our beds only had the minimum of sheets and blanket but NO COMFORTER?! At least the housekeeping staff were very courteous. We were staying only a couple of days. The rooms are outdated.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans was ok. But a good price.”
Reviews.Author: 1979CJ5
Reviews.Content: Went to The Orleans for 3 nights Apr 29-May 2, 2008. There was a group of 12 of us, and we needed to purchase an extra room upon arrival to fit all of us. The price they quoted at the desk was $150.00 more than the price I saw online, so I used their computer to book it at a cheaper rate through Expedia. ($176.00 total for 3 nights). Check-in was awful, the computer system was not working, and they kept telling us that nobody could check in until it was fixed...finally, several hours later, they began to use the old fashioned way (paperwork) to check people in... I understand that these things happen, but it was a huge inconvenience. The hotel and casino itself were very nice, it was active, but not too busy. We were all comfortable in our rooms, once we got them. The rooms were clean and well sized. There are several restaurants onsite, and we were happy with our meals at each. There is a shuttle bus that drives you to the main strip every half hour or so. That was nice, it saved a cab fare. Overall, the stay was nice, but the inital check-in left me with a bad taste. I would recommend the Orleans as a slightly cheaper alternative to other resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Warning Don't Stay Here!! Very Bad!!”
Reviews.Author: ohio216
Reviews.Content: Warning do not stay here!! This place is a dump! the first night went up to room 1105 sewage was overflowing from sink! Black smelly gross it was bad!! I called front desk right away they really did not know what to do. I told them i want to change rooms. so finally they did. They moved me to room 1218 now this is a non smoking floor this was fine i don't smoke. When I got up there, right in front of my door looked to be 4 homeless people smoking. They where putting their ashes out in little plastic cups with water in them. this was so gross. I got into my room called security nothing was done this went on all night long.they were in and out of their room smoking and talking right outside my door!! I did not feel safe in that place at all!! i called the front desk again they said they were sorry and that was that. I come to vegas 6 times a year and have stayed at a lot of different places. I have never wrote a review but this time i had to just let people know how bad this place is. I know it is cheap but even for free I would not stay here ever again. Please when you come to vegas stay at a better place!! its your money and you are here to have a good time in a clean and safe enviroment.

Reviews.Title: “It's Gotten Worse Since Boyd Bought It!”
Reviews.Author: speerlaw
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Orleans. Vegas in general has lost its luster, since it has gotten so expensive to go there in general. (MGM MIrage just reported a 30% DECREASE in profit for the first quarter of 2008 - duh - people are fed up). Anyway, The Orleans is slipping in our opinion. Before Boyd bought it, it seemed that the hotel was more service oriented. The first night that we stayed this trip, we discovered that there was NO COMFORTER on our bed. We were informed by the management that this is "now standard procedure" at the Orleans. Wow. Service at the Prime Rib Loft was terrible, and it used to be superb. The housekeeping was very good, and they agree with the customer that the place is "going to pot." Anyway, the trip was OK, but I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. The Orleans has gotten "too big for their britches."

Reviews.Title: “Good for Vegas first-timers”
Reviews.Author: nevadagambler
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas numerous times, but this was my first and last stay at The Orleans. Immediately upon entering the hotel lobby, the smell of cigarette smoke was overwhelming. My eyes started burning and tearing up after just a few minutes. Check in was quick-about 5 minutes. I requested a quiet room and was accomodated. I proceeded to my room on the 19th floor (out of 21 floors). The hallway carpet was grossly stained. However, I was pleased because the cigarette smell subsided once I entered the elevator. The room was adequate- a good size for Las Vegas. It had a loveseat and 2 chairs. Thank goodness the bathroom has a small window that opens for fresh air. Without that, I would have checked out after the first night. There was a small coffeemaker and a safe. The tub was larger than normal. I ordered room service on my second day there. Big mistake! I routinely order room service at most hotels I stay at and this was by far the WORST. The chicken smelled bad. I took a few bites and it tasted as if it had been sitting in a warmer for 3 days. I soon got a stomachache and decided to only eat the baked potato and dump out the rest. I got the feeling they don't serve much room service. Some good things about the Orleans. Every staff person I came across-with the exception of the poker room-was pleasant and friendly. There is a free shuttle that runs every half hour to the strip and drops off across the street from Caesar's. This is a very good thing because when I took a cab from the strip -Mirage- I paid $15 before tip. The cab fare from the airport was $21. If you are renting a car it is fine to be off the strip. The food at the Orleans was cheap, but you get what you pay for. The spa is a nice addition. It has a sauna and jacuzzi. Also, internet access is free for 10 minutes daily. This allows you to print your boarding passes for your flight home. The hotel also has a movie theater and childcare center as well as bowling alley. I would only recommend this hotel for traveler's on a tight budget, who have never been to Vegas before and don't mind cigarette smoke. I definetely would not stay here with children.

Reviews.Title: “Good off-strip hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: saturn0022
Reviews.Content: If you’re looking for an off-strip option to the Las Vegas experience, The Orleans is a good choice. I’ve been going to Vegas for years and have always stayed on a strip property. However, I’ve grown tired of trying to find tables with less than $15 minimums (especially on busy days/weekends), so on the suggestion of a family member, I decided to stay off-strip this time and after looking at reviews here and doing my own research, I chose The Orleans. It was a good choice and I just completed my second stay there in a month. The Orleans is located on Tropicana Blvd., about 2.5 miles west of the intersection of Tropicana and Las Vegas Blvd where the New York New York and MGM are located. It is NOT within walking distance of these locations, especially in summer. The Orleans offers a shuttle service that operates every 20-30 minutes and takes you from the Orleans to the Strip – it drops you off outside of Bill’s Casino on the strip when is across the street from Caeasar’s Palace. Anyway, I would recommend forgoing the shuttle. I was there in March and April and while it was not hot during those visits, I could see in the summer where waiting for the shuttle out in the heat (with no shelter to cover the sun) would be less than pleasurable. I took the shuttle once and it was OK – full, but I’m more of an instant gratification type of guy and didn’t like having to wait about a ½ hour each time (even though those timeframes are clearly posted by the hotel – so not their fault at all). It’s just so much easier to grab a cab and pay the $10 - $12 fare (includes tip) to the strip. Then do the same on the way back. But, the shuttle is a nice, clean option for those who do not want to use a cab. Check-in on both trips was very easy. Only a slight wait the first time and there was no wait this last time (Tuesdsay, April 22). On my first Orleans stay in March, however, I did notice a couple of times while gambling that there were quite long lines at check-in, but they seemed to be moving. Greeted with a smile and asking my room preferences both times. Both times they assigned me to a room exactly as I asked, including a high room, away from elevators. Rooms were clean, though basic and somewhat dated. But I wouldn’t expect more for the outstanding rates offered at the Orleans. This past stay, my rate was $49/night for 3 nights. I received a room with two queen beds, a small sofa, a chair and a desk chair, a desk with a chair and an armoir that held a 25” standard TV (not plasma or LCD) and room for most of your clothes. The bathroom is a little different. A sliding wood door is what separates the bathroom from the rest of the room and takes a little getting used to, but is otherwise functional. The bathroom set-up is very basic (like the room itself) but contains everything you need. The only thing that I would suggest to the Orleans regarding their bathrooms is to supply a soap dish to hold the used soap. It just feels very Motel 6ish when you have to put your used soap directly on the sink because there’s nothing else there to put it on… The water pressure in the shower was always fine and water temperature from very cold to scalding hot was always available. The shower even has a small window that opens slightly. Back to the living area – the beds are very standard, basic beds – which means either quite hard or quite soft. The comforters are dated (ugly, actually) and I strip them off the bed anyway before sitting on the bed for a number of reasons I’ll let you figure out. The pillows provided are totally insufficient and very uncomfortable. They are very small, routinely flat you receive two of these on a queen bed and three on a king size bed. You will want to call housekeeping and have them bring you at least two more. The carpet is garish (a yellow, red pattern), but seemed clean. All in all, if you are one to simply use the room as a place to sleep after a long day of gambling, eating and drinking, it’s just fine. If you’re looking for a little luxury because you spend most of your time in the room watching TV or reading, then you would probably want to stay somewhere else. For me, it’s perfect. The issue of the in-room safe: yes, they provide an in-room safe large enough to hold my laptop and several other items. The bad news – it is not secured to anything. It sits atop a shelf in the open closet area of the bathroom. I did use it, however, to hold my valuables since I had no other choice. It is a little disconcerting, though, to think that someone could simply walk up and rip the safe’s cord of the wall and walk off with it if they were so inclined. They really should bold those down to the shelves. Also, wireless internet connections are available in the rooms and the cost is $12.99 per 24 hours of use. The signal was strong and the connection was fast. Both times, my rooms were very quiet. I rarely heard neighbors and the noise from outside was minimal. The hallway carpets could use a good deep cleaning – stains were evident along the yellow edges of the carpeting in the hallways. Elevators were never a problem. Never had to wait long for one and they were never so crowded that it was uncomfortable. Good mix of all age groups represented at the Orleans. 20s and up. Very few kids. Music in the background on the casino floor is always ‘80s top 40 type of music – doesn’t stray much from that genre though. The place, for me, where the Orleans really shines is its’ customer service and casino area. Every employee I ran across greeted me with a “hello” and a smile. There is a security guard stationed near the elevators and they all had a smile and a “thank you” for showing your room card. Most of the dealers, bartenders, and cocktail waitresses are very friendly as well. The hotel has a really good restaurant selection (seven or eight of them) and I’ve eaten at all but a couple. I will alert you, first, however about the buffet. Each night is a “special” night and Wednesday nights is prime rib night. I might well have been the worst prime rib I’ve ever had. Very overcooked, tough and colorless. The remaining selections were merely average. Price was $15 and for the $15 you can get a much better meal somewhere else in the casino. In fact the prime rib at the Prime Rib loft was very good. I enjoyed the shrimp cocktail and Boston clam chowder at Big Al’s Oyster Bar and had a lunch special at Koji’s which was average. I ate many meals at their “diner” style restaurant called the Courtyard Café. Good selection at very reasonable prices and always good sized portions and quite good. Service at all restaurants was always very friendly and quick. No complaints at all with restaurant service there. There’s also a TGI Fridays inside when has it’s traditional menu. All in all, I will stay here again. It’s the best of both worlds for me. I avoid the crowds and noise of the strip, yet I’m close enough that a $10 cab ride gets me over to the strip (which I did a couple of times) if I want that vibe and energy (and other gambling options) and all at room rates that are generally excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Odor... A Real Stinker - and Don't Drink the Water”
Reviews.Author: BabaluTheGood
Reviews.Content: My hubby & I got married at this hotel 10 years ago and had a great time. Went back last week with several family members and had the worst hotel experience in my life, bar none. Our first room was fine when we checked in (around 10:30 am). There was a note in the room saying that the water would be shut off from midnight to 6 am. Before returning to our room (around 11 pm) I requested some bottled water, since the water would be shut down. I was told I'd have to pay for it. I could hardly believe it. It did not end there. We finally got the water and when we got to our room and opened the door, we were almost blown back into the hallway by the sewer smell. The air was thick and the sink was full of sewer backwash. The staff at the Orleans refused to give us a new room. They sent someone from engineering who stuffed the sink full of chemicals, so now we had a room that was full of sewer and chemical smell. It was definitely not fit for human habitation. The people who came into our room all agreed that they would not stay there, but would any of them help us get a new room? NO! After more than an hour of back and forth between supervisors we finally got a new room (an ADA equipped room). Apparently, that was all they had open on a Wednesday night. Needless to say, this room was better than the last, but the smell coming from the sink was still bad. I was afraid to say anything, for fear that they'd come put in all those chemicals again. That was even worse than the sewer smell. So we kept the bathroom window open and made sure the bathroom door was always shut. It helped. We had 4 rooms booked there and 2 were real stinkers. The other 2 weren't bad. But one problem that we all had was from drinking the water (or possibly the ice). Out of 8 people in our group, 6 got sick. I got seriously ill. We are all convinced that it is the sewer/water problem at the hotel. The sad fact is that the staff at the Orleans plays dumb about all of this. I have since searched and found other complaints regarding this, so I know it's not the first time they've ever heard about it. I also contacted the Clark County Dept. of Environmental Health who inspected and said that it was a violation to shut the water down without notifying them. The supervisor at the Orleans told the DEH that it was done on an "emergency" basis and that's why no notification was given, However, we checked in at 10 am and found the note then, so they had time. I'm sorry to see what was such a fun place become so dilapidated and run down in a short 10 years...

Reviews.Title: “1st choice for value”
Reviews.Author: LauraJHodson
Reviews.Content: Ok so I was wavering between the 4 and 5 rating and decided-what's not to love about this quirky, fun hotel with all the amenities and service you could need? We got a code and paid $30 a night and for the money I couldn't fault the place- great pool area, good gaming, lots of food options for half the strip price, comfortable rooms- I'm pleased to report no bed bugs even though I have the most sensitive of skins, courteous staff and a positively 'Big Easy' atmosphere. The staff at the TGI Friday are the best you'll care to meet (they train the staff at 7 other Fridays in the area) and would recommend the apple mojitos for $5. We've stayed at many hotels in the world and on this trip our next stops were Signature and MGM grand suites but I would have happily stopped here for much longer. If you can get a good rate and enjoy a slightly off strip experience then this is the place for you! Also go to the $250,000 game show at the Hilton- we nearly died with laughing! You can get half price tickets from Tix4Tonight.

Reviews.Title: “Rockabilly Weekender”
Reviews.Author: CherryDoll73
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room for the Viva Las Vegas Rockabilly Weekender. The event was held at one of their partner hotels, the Gold Coast. We chose the Orleans because of the discount rates for the event and they offered a free shuttle. The shuttle is a great way to travel to the strip and the Gold Coast. I personally think that they should extend the time the shuttle is in service. The last pickup is 12:30am but they should change it to at least 2am. Midnight is when things are really happening in Vegas. The room that they put us in was so far away and we had to walk forever. The last thing I wanted to do after walking all over the strip is walk a mile through the casino and another mile to our room. Make sure that they put you in a room close to the elevators. The room was open and not cramped but the smell of smoke was overwhelming. We were in a non smoking room but the stale scent of cigarettes filled the room. It must be due to poor air circulation in older casinos. The only thing that helped was the fresh air from the small bathroom window. We kept it open the entire time. We did order room service one evening at about 2am. It was affordable, quick and very good. The pool area was nice. It had a bar. The hot tub was large and had waterfalls. There a palm tree in the center. The only problem is that children flock to the hot tub. There was a sign posted for children under 12 not to use the hot tub. Nobody from the hotel was there to enforce it. I got several mouths full of hot tub water from inconsiderate youth. If you are on a budget then this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LEONANorwalk_Oh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Orleans last week. The room was large with a nice setting area. The bathroom was big, with good lighting. We even had an instant coffee pot. The room was clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The only thing I would say is if you are pillow sensitive, bring your own. The pillows were terrible. Also the doors have and automatic closure on them and they slam. The pool area was great, as was the casino and all of the food. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Casnio....BAD hotel”
Reviews.Author: washington23
Reviews.Content: To make this short and sweet...if you care about a clean, bug free hotel stay...dont stay here. First room we had we found 2 LARGE beetles running across the floor. Complained and they downgraded us to a lower floor level...this was find because we jsut wanted a clean room. Both my husband and I woke up the next morning with bug bites all over our arms and legs...suprise suprise...the reviews about bed bugs on here are correct. Another reviewer on here complained about the water...he is correct to...the sink water smells like fried eggs. Bed sheets were OLD and mattress uncomfortable. I have never complained about a hotel before, but I though this was worth complaing about because I would not want anyone else to go through that. I thought we would save some money by booking at the orleans...bad idea. The people that work in the casino are GREAT and the 24 hour dinner. But the hotel was HORRIBLE.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good”
Reviews.Author: serialmonkey
Reviews.Content: Had a conference here in April and was very happy with this off-strip hotel. Good food, decent drinks and a free shuttle bus into the strip whenever you need it. Rooms were large with good housekeeping and friendly staff. For the price, can't complain !

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: vegbet
Reviews.Content: Nature of visit: Stayed at the Orleans to play in their poker tournaments, which run three times daily. Talked to the poker room manager, the tournament struture is great and for the price 80 bucks, gives you a good gamble. Remember, most tournaments are nothing more than a turkey shoot. The blinds goes up so fast and the rounds are so short, you have to play any two card and hope for the best. NOT AT THE ORLEANS. The blind struture at the Orleans is excellent with 30 min rounds, that gives you a lot a lot of play. Poker skills will pay off here. Room: The room was neat and very clean. Not huge, but who comes to Vegas and spends their time in the room. Service. I had to call security twice. Each time they were up to my room within 10 mins (I messed up the safe in the room and needed it opened). The Strip: Nice free shuttle service to the strip. Why pay more, for less? When you stay at the Orleans, you can be at the strip in 5 min's - free. The food: They have a sub-way that is open 24/hours and a lot of other places to eat. All the food was good. I will stay at the Orleans again and recommend it to anyone. The poker room is everything I read it would be (all good stuff). The staff friendly, the rooms clean and the food good and reasonable. I'm looking forward to my next trip in June. See you at the tables.......

Reviews.Title: “As Always - A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: finnie2
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel many times and find the spacious rooms to be clean and very quiet. The pool area is large and well landscaped and the hot tub open year round. As mentioned in a previous review, there were a number of kids and sports teams during our stay, but it was March, Spring Break and it was this way all over the city so we were prepared for it. We definitely will return.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: jglo67
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd time staying at the Orleans, it is a great place to stay, after a long day walking the beautiful strip it's nice to go back to this adorable hotel and gamble, eat and drink and then go right upstairs and relax, trust me it's worth it... J.C.-CHICAGO

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Stay !!”
Reviews.Author: meetcho
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my 14 year old son and husband from March 17 to the 20th ,2008. Weather was hot ! in the 80s and we had a great room comfy and clean. So quiet too ! Perfect off the strip hotel and we all can't wait to go back. NOT crowded at all. The line ups for the buffet in the morning were short if you arrived before 10am. Food was good and plentiful. $7 a person. Good value. Pool was great. One toddler pool, one longish one and a huge circular hot tub...beautiful. On our last day we came up from the pool and we had no water in our room. We called and they explained they had an emergency and the water in our entire tower was out for about 2 hours. My husband quickly called down to the Spa/Fitness Centre and they said we could use the facilities no problem !! It is part of the resort $5 a day fee you pay ! Make use of it folks !! Gorgeous facility ! Besides the huge shower stalls it had a sauna and a huge whirlpool with nobody in it ! Free use of the toiletries and they had ice cold water in the fridge !! Anyway, we came back to our room and still had no water. My husband called the manager and left a voice mail about his concerns since we were on our way out to a formal dinner and still couldn't use the water. The next day when we checked out the manager had credited our account with one free night stay !!! We thought that was acceptable since it was a hassle going to the spa to shower ! ( even if it was a nice spa ! ) We also rented a car from Budget which was conveniently located accross the street. The hotel gets a better rate for you, so go through the Bell Desk . Took my son to Gameworks which is an awesome arcade on the strip next to MGM. Paid $35 for a day pass. HE DID NOT WANT TO LEAVE EVEN AFTER 5 HOURS. So we took him back after dinner for a few more hours. Great games for all ages. When we did take a cab from the hotel to the strip we payed about $10 mid day. We also took a cab back to the airport and it cost around $17 . That was early in the am. and no traffic of course. All in all it was great and we would recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Roeina
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Orleans, in a standard room - two double beds....have stayed there before, and find the Coast Hotels in Nevada to be okay for the money. However this time I was very disappointed...The room needs a bit of an update. The bedspreads are really old and what is up with the smell in the bathroom sink.? I had to stop it up I could actually smell it in the room sitting up in bed....horrible smell - you could even smell sewerage walking to the elevator. Is there a problem with the pipes? and I was told one rate and charged another for friday and sat eve's. I had to fight to get $50.00 taken off my bill.....I was asked for my confirmation number...went crazy looking for it...and then when I called back and spoke to a supervisor was told that she could not do anything? That I needed the paper work??? what paper work??? my confirmation sent to me via email from them didn't show a price, just a number....I was very upset. Told her I had spent a lot of money in the casino gambling and she could look up my points on my players card!!! She called back 5 min. later to say that she spoke to a hostess and they would delete $50.00 and taxes...we'll see if that really has happened as soon as I check my credit card on here...On top of all of the above, I see we really picked a bad time to go to Vegas, since it was spring break and our hotel was hosting the Cheerleaders competition in there arena...Oh my !! I have never in my life seen so many kids in a casino in Las Vegas. This is why I do not stay at Circus Circus....of course I am not blaming the Orleans for that, but they really should not allow children to sit up against a wall and play with there toys while mom and dad are gambling at a slot machine....I was really surprized at all the kids standing around in the casino, and I am talking gangs of teens...our floor had an alarm system broken into and the police were there, and glass shattered so the housekeeper had to go up and vacuum at midnight one evening....and all of their doors were decorated with their names and the schools they were representing....I felt like I was in a dorm... With these experiences, I do not think I will stay at the Orleans again....Mostly my advice to you all is to check what is going on in the arena there and if you have a bad sence of smell then the room won't bother you....

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JDS1024
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Orleans from March 17th to the 21st for the first time. Though I was there for business this time I did get to have a little bit of fun. Check in was very quick and access to the elevators to get up to the rooms was very convenient. The room was huge and perfect! Maid service was great everyday and the couple times I had to call to the front desk the employees were very helpful and nice. I told my husband when we go back to Vegas for vacation we are staying here! The buffet had great food at a great price for breakfast and dinner and Don Miguel's has happy hour from noon to 5pm with $.99 margaritas and 1/2 priced appetizers. Perfect! The pool though on the small side was clean and quiet. I did not end up gambling at all so I can't comment on the dealers or bar tenders. I really liked that this casino/hotel wasn't enormous and overwhelming taking forever to get where I needed to go. The fact that there is a free shuttle to the strip was very convenient as well. If you drive in or have a rental the parking is quick and close...I didn't even need to use the valet service! Loved the atmosphere and would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms and Staff”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiLuv2travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights. The room was simple, but more than adequate - 2 queen sized beds and the love seat and chair area were great. There was enough room for 2 adults and 2 (active) children to not get into each other's space too much over 7 days. The staff was great - from the bell desk to the housekeepers, everyone was more than friendly and accomodating. The Kids Tyme child care was awesome - our children asked to go, as there was more than enough for them to do for a couple of hours and they made some new friends. You pay $7/hr ($6/hr for houseguests) per child, and they have VERY reasonably priced food the children can order (with their parents' prior consent) - all in all a better experience then taking them to the arcades or Adventuredome. I would recommend the hotel for its rooms; however the casino was less than generous to us and they often had machines down (the entire one and only Megabucks carousel was down for quite a bit of the day) and the craps tables were cold each time we checked, so we ended up gambling much less than we planned to. You need to drive to all other casinos, so, being that we were for the most part arranging our gambling time around our children's bed time (switching off, going downstairs one at a time), we were for the most part held hostage to the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Big and Clean Room, Poor Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Oldjayhawk
Reviews.Content: My family of 3 stayed at this hotel for several days in March 2008. We drove to the hotel on Sunday at about 4 PM. It was easy to get to from the airport. Unfortunately, there was no designated spaces for hotel guests to unload their luggage in front of the hotel. The valet guy told me that we could park by the curb at a spot across 5 lanes of cars from the hotel front entrance, and unload our stuff, but we had to give him our car key (in a sense, valet parking) unless at least one of us stayed with the car during our registering. I did not want to pay for valet parking just for registering and unloading our luggage, so I parked at the spot he pointed out, went inside the hotel myself to register while my wife and my son stayed in the car. As soon as I entered the hotel, I smelled cigarette, which was stronger than I expected, because the registration counter is on the fringe of the casino area so that the smoke generated by smoking gamblers was distributed all through the ground floor. The cigarette smell was barely tolerable. Las Vegas appeared to be the cigarette smoking capital of the U.S. because every where I went on the ground floor of each of the Las Vegas hotels and the areas outside the Las Vegas hotels, I ran into people smoking. I had to wait only 5 minutes for my turn to register inside the hotel. The woman who checked me in was friendly. AFter I had gotten my computer card room keys, I returned to our car, unloaded the luggage and told my wife and son to wait by our luggage outside the hotel. I then drove to park in the parking lot of the Orleans Arena next door to the hotel. I walked for about 8 minutes back to the front entrance of the hotel to meet my wife and son, and proceeded to our room with our luggage. Both my wife and my son commented how strong the cigarette smell was in the "lobby" of the hotel. The elevators to the rooms were located about 5 minutes walk from the hotel front entrance, on the fringe of the casino. Thus, the Orleans Hotel is not as bad as the large hotels on the strip in terms of the distance from the hotel entrance to the elevators to go up to the guest rooms. After getting off the elevator, it was quite a walk to our room because our room was near the end of a very long hallway. One thing I noticed was that there was no cigarette smell in the hallway and in our room, as if the living quarters and the ground floor casino were in two separate buildings served by two separate air conditioning systems. When we walked from the elevator to our room, I saw that the carpet lining the hallway had obvious stains in a number of areas showing that the carpet really need to be replaced. But we were happy with the cleaniness of our room. We were given a strip-view non-smoking standard room with 2 queen size beds. The room was very big. Having stayed at a number of hotels in both coasts, I would rate this room to be the biggest standard hotel room we have stayed at. The view of the strip also was nice. However, the brass collar of the lamp next to the window was broken. I informed housekeeping of the problem and they said they would send an engineer to fix it. We went out for dinner. We did not eat at the hotel that night. But several people we knew ate at the buffet restaurant at the hotel that night and told us that the food was not very good. When we got back to our room that evening, I saw that the engineer had put a paper tape around the broken brass collar of the lamp to hold it up. If I were the engineer, I would have replaced the lamp or at least fixed it with an insulating plastic tape. Being very tired, I did not complain to housekeeping about the quality of the repair, figuring that we were just staying for several days. I merely told my son to not touch the lamp. My wife took her shower and told me that the bath tub did not drain water very well. Because we were too tired to call houskeeping, we went to bed. The beds and pillows were average in terms of comfort, but the bed sheets were too small for queen size beds. The air conditioner was rather noisy. But we got used to it quite soon and fell asleep without any trouble. The next morning, I took the shower and found that the water rose to about half an inch above the bath tub drain during the shower so that there was a pool of water where my feet were. The water was hot enough and the water pressure was quite good. After the shower, I called down to housekeeping complaining about the water drainage problem and they said they would send an engineer to fix it. I put $3 in an envelope marked "House Keeper" next to the TV and we left for sight seeing. When we returned that evening, the bath tub drainage problem had not been fixed. In addition, the housekeeper did not replace the plastic water cups and the paper coffee cups that we had used. I called housekeeping complaining about the water drainage problem again and told them to send an engineer the next day to fix the problem. The second morning, I once again left $3 for the house keeper and went out for sight seeings. When we returned, the drainage pproblem stayed the same and the water cups and coffee cups were not replenished. I called housekeeping complaining about the drainage problem again. The person who took my call recognized my voice and said that she would write a big note for the engineer about it. I requested that she sent the engineer the following day to fix the problem. We went downstairs to meet up with 4 people we knew for dinner at the Prime Rib Loft (sort of on the second floor of the hotel) without any reservation at about 7:30 pm. Because the Prime Rib Loft was connected to the casino without any wall, I noticed that the cigarette smell in the Prime Rib Loft was stronger than that in the casino. It might be because cigarette smoke rose in the air so that the smoke was more concentrated in the loft than in the casino downstairs. The hostess told us that there was no open table for 7 at that time and we would have to wait till 8:45 pm for the next table. With the cigarette smell being as strong as it was, we did not want to dine there. Instead, we went to Canal Street downstairs. Canal Street was a restaurant inside the hotel at the fringe of the casino area. Because Canal Street was connected to the casino with a closed door, the cigarette smell inside Canal Street was much lighter than that in the casino area or the registration area. We had prime ribs and sea bass, which were very good. The service also was good. The third morning, I did not leave any money for the house keeper because I was not happy with the house keeper's repeated failure to replenish the cups in our room. We went out for sight seeing again. When we returned later that afternoon, I found that the drainage problem stayed the same. The situation was worse than the last two days in that not only did the house keeper not replenish the cups, she also did not leave us with a fresh roll of bathroom tissue. Because I did not notice the lack of bathroom tissue until the fourth morning, I called housekeeping and told the staff only about the unfixed drainage problem and the lack of water cups. She offered to send an engineer up right away. But I told her to not bother because we were checking out the next day anyway. I told her that if I were to do my job the way the hotel engineers did theirs, I would have been fired long time ago. She also wondered how their engineers do their jobs. I told her I needed water cups. She said she would send someone to bring us new water cups. When we returned to our room after dinner, we saw a stack of about 10 precious, plastic water cups in our room. Finally, at least one of my complaints resulted in a resolution of a housekeeping problem. But before my stay at the Orleans Hotel, I did not know that plastic water cups could be that precious. When I got up the fourth morning at about 7:30 AM, I noticed that the house keeper did not leave us any fresh roll of bathroom tissue. My patience was running out, I called housekeeping and demanded that someone bring us bathroom tissue. She said someone would bring us the tissue shortly. But it was not until about 8:10 AM before a woman brought us two rolls of bathroom tissue. At 8:17 AM, somebody knocked at our door. I recognized that it was a house keeper because every morning at about that time in the past several days, a house keeper (not the same one every morning) had knocked at our door. I could not figure out why the house keepers wanted to wake hotel guests up so early every morning. May be they were too anxious to get the rooms clean early so that they could go home early. But with patience running out concerning housekeeping of the Orleans Hotel, I opened the door and asked the house keeper what she wanted. She did not dare to tell me that she wanted to clean my room at that moment. She also did not apologize either. She just walked away and knocked at the door of the room next to us. I poke my head out in the hallway, raised my voice at her and said: "It is only 8:17 AM, for god sake!" She looked at my direction with an facial expression that told me that she most likely did not understand what I was saying. To not waste time, I closed my door, took my shower and packed for our trip home. The check out went smoothly. I only had to wait 3 minutes for my turn at the check out counter. In my opinion, the Orleans Hotel definitely has housekeeping problems. But if all you want is a hotel at a low rate, and you are willing to put up with the housekeeping problems, I think the Orleans would work for your stay at Las Vegas. Its room size and low rate could not be beated by any strip hotel. Our room was cleaner than some rooms we stayed at in some 3-star hotels across the country.

Reviews.Title: “Everything the strip has at 1/2 off”
Reviews.Author: td507
Reviews.Content: I booked my room directly with the hotel from an email I had received from Clubcoast. The bed was king size and very comfortable, the heat and air conditioning are controlled by a thermostat that you set for the desired temperature. I had a room overlooking the pool, it was spacious and quiet. I paid $30 for 1 night on Easter Sunday. The casino has everything that all of the Strip hotels have. The property has several different restaurants, I did not dine here so I will not comment on the food. Friendly staff and the rooms were clean and in good working order.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Stay”
Reviews.Author: racingqueen
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 7 night stay at the Orleans and have thoroughly enjoyed it. This was our first time in Vegas. Check-in was very quick, I asked for a high floor with a strip view and was very fortunate to be placed in a huge room on the 15th floor with fab views of the strip especially at night. The room had 2 queen beds which were very comfy and a 2 seater sofa, chair and coffee table. The bathroom was very spacious, had a shower over the bath and was very powerful. The standard of cleanliness was exceptional. The towels were large and fluffy and the complimentary toiletries were of a good standard. The room was very quiet and we never heard other guests. TIP-Always place the "Do not disturb" sign on your door otherwise the maids knock you up at 7am to clean the room!. The shuttle bus was great, very frequent and drops off at the side of Bills gambling hall which is about the middle of the strip. We never waited more than 10 mins . The facilities in the hotel were more than adequate. The $5 daily resort fee (per room) includes 30 mins internet access (in the business centre nr reception) however I ewas on much longer somedays and no one ever said or charged me anything! and free use of the gym, and free local telephone calls. The choice of eating places within the hotel are good. We ate at the Courtyard Cafe and it was very good. We only played the slots as we dont have a clue about gambling! The cocktail waitresses were much more frequent in taking orders in the casino in the Orleans than any other casino we visited. The pool area is really well kept and a lovely relaxing environment, and provides free towels. Only residents can enter the pool area. Security guards are always sat by the lifts and no one can get up to the guest rooms without showing their key card. There is a great shop within the hotel where you can purchase toiletries, gifts, and snacks as well as alcohol at terrific prices. A chilled bottle of decent rose wine was only $4 ! On the morning of check-out (which is 12.00) we left our luggage with the bell boys and ate lunch in the hotel before stepping outside to take a cab back to the airport, there are always cabs waiting. We absolutely loved the Orleans and saved approx £200 by not staying at a strip hotel. It was nice to get away from the noise and hustle and bustle of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans - Big rooms and good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: g_0010662
Reviews.Content: Please note this review is based on June 2007 so details are not so good. This was my 2nd time staying at the Orleans and I must say it was extremely good value for money. I stayed for 6 nights ($40 per night). I asked for a complimentary upgrade using the $20 tip but it didnt work as she said the rooms were fully booked but I should try again tomorrow. She gave me back my $20. I didnt bother trying again because the room I booked was good enough anyway. However I did manage to get the $5 per day resort waivered.... result! The room was quite big - 450 sq ft. It was cleaned regular and I have no complaints whatsoever. I was not able to hear a thing from outside while in room so walls were quite thick. The buffet was good and definitely better than Paris hotel! The minimums for casino tables were low which made it enjoyable. The cocktail waitress were pretty than most strip hotels and also quick service. The pools were average... nothing special. The hotel being off strip is not a problem as there is a free shuttle service to the strip which runs every 15 to 30 mins and is usually on time. I would definitely recommend this hotel if on a tight budget or if you want to try a hotel off strip. I stayed in Ballys for 4 nights after Orleans and I must say Orleans is much better! My next stay would be at Venetian this summer so I am expecting big things :)

Reviews.Title: “A good value”
Reviews.Author: Baldy2000
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a good value. It is a bit warn in some places but the rooms are clean and the staff is attentive. I would stay there again in the future. It is slightly off the strip and it costs about $10 - $20 each way for a cab to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite for our yearly trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Shawna00
Reviews.Content: Ok everyone should try one of the BIg Strip hotels to get them out of your system. But if you go to Vegas frequently stay here! Off of the strip but u can get there easily. Rooms are basic, but clean and comfy. Room service is yummy! The spa and workout room are pretty good. I've had several massages at The Orleans and they were ok, but it's hard to find a good masseuse. The eating establishemnts are good at THe Orleans. I don't use any of the other hotel amentites.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price!!”
Reviews.Author: annetteboo
