Reviews.Content: I don't understand all the people complaining about this hotel. It is a cheap hotel that is close to the strip. You cannot expect the Mandalay Bay. I've stayed at the Riviera and the Flamingo and they are similar. The rooms are large and yes they do need updating, but everything was clean. There were two beds. The first one by the door was by far not as comfortable as the second bed, which was wonderful. The A/C is loud but not any louder than any other hotel at this price range. I loved it because it gave me white noise to sleep to. YOU ARE IN A CITY.. stop complaining that you can't sleep in total silence. The shuttle was always timely and we never had a problem with it being too full. It is super convenient. It drops you off right by cesars palace. The Courtyard Cafe in the hotel has THE BEST sticky bun french toast i've every had. (well i've actually never seen that before so it's actually the first i've ever had) It was fantastic. There was one problem, the hot water was out for about 20 minutes at about 11pm on Tuesday. I called the front desk and they said they were fixing a leak and it would be back on in 20 min. Which it was promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Maggs30
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved the Orleans. The value cannot be touched by any of the strip properties. We had a rental car so navigating the 2 mile trip to LVBLVD was not really an issue. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. Housekeeping was excellent. Parking was plentiful. The standard rooms were huge. The hotel was exceptionally clean. The only negatives we found were: 1. The French Market Buffet is mediocre at best. 2. The rooms could be soundproofed a little bit better. All in all though a great off-strip property.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, couldn't beat the price.”
Reviews.Author: ultracheapsk8
Reviews.Content: We had to find a place to stay cheap in a hurry and we booked thru i4vegas.com and we got rooms for $33 Thurs and $54 Fri and Sat nite. I asked for a fridge to hold my medicine, and they were prompt and friendly. They had a $5 resort fee for entrance to the spa and fitness center that we did not use. This fee also covered local phone calls and coffee maker and computer useage in the business center. They said you got 30 mins of free computer use, but DH went waaaayyyy over that time and they didn't say anything. The room itself was nice and clean, and my DD was wearing white socks and they were still pretty white after her walking around the room. Yes, the bed was a bit hard, but clean. We had a n/s king, with a desk and a sofa and an another chair with a nice coffee table. Bathroom had nice goodies. Shampoo, soap, conditioner, lotion, shower gel AND mouthwash. Shower cap too! The safe was in the bathroom and it was plenty big and secure for our electronics. We had a nice view of the strip. Although, I would try to get a room a bit further from the elevator, because we had some drunken fight going on around 4:45 am - ugh. Housekeeping didn't quite understand when we said we only needed shampoo and a few towels, she kept trying to make up the room. If you sign up for their club card, you get a coupon for a free breakfast or lunch buffet. The breakfast buffet was pretty average, powered scrambled eggs, and an busy omlette station. I was impressed with the sweet potato pancakes. Parking was a bit difficult, but I attribute that to a large convention and valet wasn't bad. I would say this is a hotel that is good for someone who is in Vegas with wheels. The shuttle drops you off at Bill's (formerly Barnaby Coast) across from Caesars. The wait for food at TGIF was a bit much. Apparently they had a brand new menu and was still learning how to cook it. Never got a chance to try the slots. The line to check in was pretty good when we checked in, but when we were going to check out late Sat afternoon, the line was long. Apparently, they have a bowling center and a child care center that guests can use. Our DD was too young, must be 2.5 and potty trained, but it may be helpful for others. I called a service from the Concierge from another property and was quoted $45 an hour, 4 hr min. For the price, I feel like we got an excellent deal and I wouldn't mind staying at the Orleans again.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for an off Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bob538
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Orleans in the past I knew that it was a nice property with large clean rooms and a pleasant casino. Check in was smooth and I recieved a room on the 10th floor with a strip view. Clean room, good climate control, and a safe that was bolted down. I had read in previous reviews that the safes were not secured. This has been addressed. The gaming is not quite the same as it was prior to Boyd taking over, but the tables were busy, and I enjoyed the VP at the bar with good bartender service. I rent a car, which is recommended if your stay off strip. It allows much more flexibility than the shuttle to the strip can provide. I ate late night at the coffee shop and the service was quick and pleasant. I also ate at Don Miguels for the 1/2 price appetizers. Service there was not as nice, but the food was good. I've had a good experience having dinner there in the past. Overall the Orleans is a good choice if you want an off strip hotel that is not too flashy like Rio or Palms, but not a dump like Terribles.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: ScubaJanet
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth time to Vegas. We have stayed at Bellagio, Mirage and Stratosphere in the past. We spend very little time in our room, but the room was what we want in a hotel room - clean, roomy, good safe, coffee maker, iron, etc. The rest of the time we go to whatever hotel we want to gamble or go see shows in. The price you pay to take a taxi to where you want to go from the Orleans added to the the large amount of money you save when booking this room still comes out much cheaper then staying on the strip. You can still spend your time on the strip in those hotels during the day and not pay the huge room fee for staying there. The Orleans does have a free shuttle, but we did not try it. We arrived late on a Thursday night and had to wait about 10 minutes to check-in. The room we had pre-booked (King nonsmoking) was not available, but they gave us the offer to switch to 2 queens n/s with a better view. That was fine. The room had a safe plenty big (laptop fit inside). They have a business office where you can use a computer (charge per minute and to print). We just wanted to print our boarding passes and after we used the business office, I noticed a machine you could use (for a fee) just for boarding passes and check-in just off the main casino on the way to the elevators. It was a busy weekend (Nascar) but we could always find room at a table game (even the $5 minimum black jack). The hotel had a live band each night. They did cover music (70s, 80s, 90s, current) and it was very good. The 24 hour courtyard cafe was excellent for breakfast and either no line or a short one when we went. Don Miguels had 99 cent margaritas and half price appetizers from 2-6. This was a great deal. The appetizers are very good and big enough for a meal. We spent a total of $12 and got 2 margaritas, nachos and queisedas. The sports book is nice enough. We had planned to go to another hotel if we wanted a nicer one, but it met our needs. You have to pay $2 for the Daily Racing Form, but if you turn it back in when you are done, you get your $2 back. Check out was easy and we never had to wait in line to catch a taxi. We didn't swim in the pool (still a little early in the season), but we went out to look at the area and sit in a chair and it seemed like a nice pool area. Our room was cleaned promptly each day. The toilet, shower and bathroom mirror and sink area is all one, so it kind of stinks if someone is going to the bathroom, you can't really be in there doing your hair/make-up or whatever. It also used a sliding door to the bathroom area which wasn't the greatest. The shower was nice and hot and lots of water which is always important! For the price we paid, we were very satisfied with the Orleans. Next time we go to Vegas, if we get a good price, we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just to little to far out”
Reviews.Author: nickwhite26
Reviews.Content: I thought i'd book this hotel to try and save a few pounds, but it backfired slightly First of all as far as the hotel goes its ok. Its a huge complex and completely (as the majority of hotels in LV). Its clean and the room service prices are reasonable. The casino is like every other casino in LV Here's where we went wrong. The hotel is around 40 minutes walk from the strip, but in the summer heat its not easy and we could only manage it oncep- it slike walking next to a motorway the whole way! Its around $10 for a taxi to the strip- a journey that we did twice on some days. I think this hotel is slightly cheaper than the strip hotels, however it was a fasle economy I would give this hotel 75/100 for cleanliness, location and staff friendliness

Reviews.Title: “Very Roomy and quiet”
Reviews.Author: 99_harley_rider
Reviews.Content: I stayed there when I came to Vegas for the Las Vegas Bikefest motorcycle rally. The room was large and the hotel was very quiet. My only complaint is that I asked for a smoking room with a king sized bed and when I arrived all they could provide was a non smoking with two queen sized beds. It is a couple of miles off the strip which I liked because I had a rented Harley and wanted easy access to and from parking plus somewhere I could keep an eye on the bike. The staff was pleasant and friendly with housekeeping speaking to you whenever they saw you in the hallway. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: buzzard6
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed everything about this hotel. The rooms were spacious, the housekeeping was prompt, the food was good and the staff was courteous. The check-in was listed at 3pm but they let me check in at 9am. I paid about 50 dollars a night but it seems like the rates are going to go up later so you better check-in soon. Their was some kids in the hotel but they were mostly in the buffet area. The only lows were that the beds were a little hard and the place was smokey some. I would love to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Still one of the best values”
Reviews.Author: Hotel-Reviewer-UK-US
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is one of the best choices in the valley for good quality accommodations, amenities and service at competitive price, but does require a car since it is a couple of miles from Las Vegas Boulevard (though there is a free shuttle service to the centre of LVB). Parking is plentiful and does not involve long walks to the hotel towers. Dining choices are many and varied, all of reasonable standard although unremarkable. The Prime Rib Loft is a good value mid-range offering. With 2500+ rooms off the tourist path, there are deals to be had although the hotel is popular with regular visitors. If available for <$80 you have a bargain, but off season and away from major conventions it can go as low as $35 direct or (undisclosed) even less with consolidators. Regular rooms are 500sqft with writing desk, separate seating area with easy chair, three seat couch and marble table, plenty of storage, conventional TV in armoire setting, king or two queen size (very comfortable) beds, bathroom with hanging storage, granite counter tops, separate toilet and shower, sliding door to main room. Only a couple of criticisms : Pillows are particularly poor. Air conditioning is stand alone under the window and noisy - no problem in winter but can be troublesome otherwise. Some may find the New Orleans theme a little cheesy, but in the context of Las Vegas it is far from offensive. Interestingly and not in common with other Boyd properties, the soundproofing in the hotel towers at the Orleans is exceptional. Highly recommended for budget conscious travellers who expect good, reliable full service hotel standards.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: Lemon1
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend at The Orleans in Las Vegas. It was the first time we stayed off the Strip and it was very nice. The room was large, with a king-sized bed and an area with a sofa and an easy chair. The bathroom had plenty of space and nice toiletries, and was kept very clean. We tried the cafe and the Rib Loft and both had excellent food. The price on a weekend was a lot less expensive than anything you'd find on the Strip. I had to call housekeeping for a clean blanket and they were very prompt in bringing us a clean one and very apologetic about the dirty blanket. I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “February Good Time”
Reviews.Author: Dutchess29
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Orleans on Wednesday February 13. Check in was fast and friendly. We were on the 19th floor. Room very nice and clean. We have stayed at the Orleans our last five trips to Vegas, so that tells you how we feel about the place. We used to be down town people (Golden Nugget) but decided to give the Orleans a try. We have not been down town in two years. Wednesday was very windy and it was loud on the 19th floor but the wind finally calmed. The remote was not working called room service and they had a new remote to our room within 10 minutes. We ate at five of the eating establishments - no compliants. We will stay again at the Orleans, we are planning our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Las Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pdsunlvr
Reviews.Content: We took a Valentine trip to Las Vegas and stayed at The Orleans. We were very satisfied with this hotel. The rooms are very spacious and include a sofa and chair. The bed and pillows were comfortable.The most important thing was that it was VERY CLEAN and the staff quite efficient. Check in and check out was very easy and quick. There is a Mexican restaurant on the casino floor. From 2-6 pm appetizers are half price and margaritas are 99 cents. Where else can you get a quesadilla for $3.50, plus it was very tasty!!! All in all, our stay at the Orleans was very enjoyable and we'll go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Hated The Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: SNManuel
Reviews.Content: I just returned back from a stay at The Orleans. We had a cheer competition over the course of 5 days. There were a lot of teenagers and children there for the competition on top of the already numberous amounts of children vacationing there with their families. The first day we got to The Orleans, we arrived at 6:30 in the morning. We couldn't check in until later that morning, 10 a.m., so the front desk had us turn our luggae into the bell hop holding room and the bags would be delivered to our rooms once we were able to get into our rooms. The bad vibes came instantly after that. All the luggage in our group were put into designated rooms, but everyone had to scramble on their own to get their suitcase. Someone in our group had a bag that was lost and when she asked the bell hops they were rude and said they had to wait another hour before looking for her bag! The smell of the hotel was herrendous! It smelled of stale cigerette smoke and the sewer! The sewage smell was coming from all angles! The bathroom sink and the water smelled like it was coming straight from the septic system! And not too mention the hallways and all public spaces smelled llike a sewer! There was a bunch of people in our group that cought a bug. Hotel staff claims it wasn't food, so it had to have been something in the air conditioning. Someone in our group reported that there was a burning smell that came out of the outlets on the wall. It was reported twice and only once was the problem looked at. And, the best one yet, children aren't allowed to stand close to the poker machines and slots. But, the escalator that goes up to the arcade and movie theatre was 15 ft. away from the machines! Families would wait at the bottom of the escalators for other people and security made them move else where to for the rest of their party! The service there sucked, housekeeping didn't do a good job at making sure enough towels were left in the room and the front desk people moved so slow it was impossible to get any information!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: highdesertbadger
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 2 nights at the Orleans and I have no complaints. Check-in was quick. The room was large. I was alone but had two beds, a couch and a chair. The bathroom was also a good size. The room included a free safe and internet access for a price. Parking was not that big of an issue since it was a slow time and the lots were never that full. The hotel has plenty of eating options and a free shuttle to the strip if you don't have a car. I paid $60 per night and felt I got a good value for my $. I'd return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Value”
Reviews.Author: Isa0
Reviews.Content: Nice property, a little old now but very good value for the price. The room are big and nice. The only drawback were a weird smell from the bathroom sink and the heating system that are very noisy (but you don't need it in summer ;). They have a shuttle that goes to the strip and it is very convenient if you don't want to drive at night. Unfortunately, it is often full.

Reviews.Title: “Ew! Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: piperboo1
Reviews.Content: We were booked at this hotel for a company meeting. When we arrived, the casino and registration desk looked ok, but just not like the strip hotels that are much nicer. The second night of our stay, I woke up to find a bed bug on my shoulder. I immediately went back to the bed to find two more. I contacted the hotel desk - it seemed like they probably got this all the time because they didn't really react to my problem. They did move me to another room (which I had to stay because my entire company was there). I felt like I had things crawling on me the rest of my stay. The bathrooms were kind of dingy - the sink was in the room with the shower so two people really couldn't get ready at once. There was mold growing on the ceiling next to the bathroom door (I assume because people keep the door shut while taking a shower). The bathroom door wouldn't lock either. Overall NOT impressed. Moved to NY NY the next day (on our own time) and had a MUCH better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms Beautiful Decor...”
Reviews.Author: islandctv
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at The Orleans for 5 nights, being this was our first trip to Vegas we wanted see more of the strip and spent alot of time/money on waiting for the shuttle or via taxi. I have nothing bad to say about The Orleans. You can go Bowling, movies, spa, sauna, & plenty of dining choices without leaving the hotel. Excellent Hotel!!! Just would stay closer to the strip next trip....

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: SDPadreFan
Reviews.Content: Great hotel off the strip. Plenty of parking fairly close to the hotel (no long walks). We were only there for one night but are actually returning again next week (business trip). Rooms are very large with either a king bed or 2 queens. Rooms also have a separate sitting area with sofa, chair, & coffee table. Our room was on the third floor facing the strip so we had a decent view. Floors above the 5th or 6th floor would probably be even better. Beds are comfortable, pillows are small so we asked for a couple of extra ones (no problem). One minor problem is that our room had the standard "straight" shower curtain rod instead of the newer curved ones. Did not use internet access in the room but it appeared to be the wired type and overpriced in my opinion. Had dinner in the buffet and it was good. We will probably skip it this next trip and just go out to a local's restaurant for dinner. It's good, it just tends to cause you to overeat. Did not gamble on this very short trip but the casino seemed nice. Did not use the spa, fitness center, or pool area this trip. We have previously stayed at the Sun Coast Hotel in Vegas which is another sister property located in Summerlin (@ 8 miles from the strip). Both are great properties.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans: Great Value, but maybe not on New Years Eve.”
Reviews.Author: ROvegasCK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Orleans for 4 nights beginning on New Years Eve. This is a great location for the price. It is not right on the strip, but they provide a shuttle to the Strip every half-hour until 12:30 am. However, NOT ON NEW YEARS EVE. Vegas blocks off the strip for a giant street party on New Years Eve so the last shuttle is about 5:30 pm. If you stay at The Orleans on New Years Eve you need to plan on leaving the property early for the Strip. After about 6 pm a taxi cannot even get you close. Also, it is almost impossible to get a taxi after the fireworks. The Orleans has many excellent places to eat at a budget price. The rooms are large and the staff is very responsive. We had a problem with the sink and called for maintenance. They showed up almost immediately to fix it. I did not like the Poker Room, however, because they clearly cater to a large group of regular players. In their tournaments they rake off a portion of the entry fee to pay a $100,000 prize to the best poker player of the season. Unless you play there 3 or 4 times a week for several months you will not qualify for this award. I will stay there again, but not on New Years Eve.

Reviews.Title: “Fallen by the Wayside”
Reviews.Author: AP_JCA
Reviews.Content: First of all at check-in I was informed that there will be an additional charge of $5.00 a day for services that I hadn't plan to use. Second, the heating unit in our room was busted and kept us up all night. After complaining the following morning, a maintenance crew came and replaced the unit. However, during the middle of the second night that unit went out also. Early that morning, a crew was sent to replace the unit along with the thermostat. The problem was finally corrected and we were finally able to get some sleep. The hotel however, never offered a room change or voucher for a meal or anything. Thirdly, we attempted to utilize the wifi service which was a joke. Why? We were only able to get about 20 mins. of usage at a time before we were kicked off and had to reboot. After day two, we called for assistance and was told that the problem would be rectify. Guess what? It wasn't but we were still charge $11.99. The food quality has really diminished. I stayed here about three years ago and came home bragging about the buffet. I was very disappointed with what I ate this visit (breakfast and lunch). However, one thing hadn't changed. I was still unable to win anything gambling (table and slot). Lastly, the morning of my departure on the way to breakfast near the elevator, the cleaning crew was scrubbing the carpet where someone had defecated. Talk about a messy trip! I was told that the hotel was under new ownership and I really saw a difference. We will definitely NOT stay again.

Reviews.Title: “It was disheartening!”
Reviews.Author: BlankChicago
Reviews.Content: We had our family reunion at the Orleans a few years ago and it was an experience and stay that most of our relatives; reflect back on and remember what a wonderful reunion we had that year in Las Vegas to this very day. A couple of weeks ago has shown what a couple of years of neglect will do for what was once a three, if not four star hotel, at a remarkably reasonable price hotel on the southern end of the famous Las Vegas strip. We stayed from Monday, Christmas Eve through Monday, New Years Eve and the experience was something out of a vacation from hell skit. Upon check in on Christmas Eve, we had the pleasure of trying to sleep in a room who’s HVAC system would rival a semi-tractor trailer’s Thermo-King unit! It was a disaster! No longer able to stand the noise any longer, a trip was made to the front desk at 6:30am. No, no offer was made to move us to another room, but they “would send someone from engineering” up to the room to look at the matter at hand. We spent the entire Christmas morning with the maintenance staff while we witnessed an “HVAC unit and thermostat” exchange. It was well after 1:00pm when we finally had our room back to ourselves. It may have been 2:00pm when the room finally warmed and our hearing returned. Yes, that unit was that loud the previous night! The “New Unit” was a bit quieter that the unit that was swapped-out, but not by much. Well, this reprieve last for one day. And then there was the Wireless Internet for $12 a day. Just be prepared to get about 5 minutes of normal usage out of it before you will spend hours of not getting a signal, or if you do, losing it consistently. Our record had to show about fifty to seventy times of logging onto the server on a daily basis. All of these attempts in the name of finding a sporting event that was not listed in the local directory. Want to check your emails? Forget about it! Just check them when you return home, on a SECURE server! It was Thursday morning now and we placed another call to the front desk because the HVAC system was extremely loud and noisy. We were again, privy to not only one, but two separate maintenance crews that morning. We finally had a “normal” HVAC system for Friday, Saturday and Sunday. Too bad we checked out Monday morning…………… While Checking out Monday morning, we were never asked if any of our issues were resolved to our satisfaction. We were not compensated for the $48 wireless charge which only gave more than 20 minutes of continuous uninterrupted service on Saturday between 4am and 6am. The rest of the wireless experience was an embarrassment to the Boyd’s Gaming chain! We were not offered any discount for housing some of the hotels staff for two mornings, while addressing a problem that no guest should ever have to. We are shocked and very disappointed by our treatment and the condition of the Orleans in this day and time. I don’t if we will witness an implosion of it from our local newscast anytime soon, but that was the LAST TIME we will set foot in that place again ever! We come to Las Vegas 3 times a year. We know a lot of people who know we visit that often for so many years now. When they ask, they will be told to avoid the Orleans at all cost unless you’re just looking for place to flop-out for the time you will spend in Vegas to party. And party hard! By that last and closing statement, and this is not a lie, someone turned to hallway outside of our room into a toilet. Yes, the number two was in the entire “lounge seating area” right outside of our door! Do the hotel security cams in the hallways really work?

Reviews.Title: “Nice Off Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OwahooEd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very good family-friendly option if you don't mind staying off the Las Vegas Strip. The rooms are clean and spacious. Various dining facilities include a decent buffet, japanese/chinese, TGIF, Subway, various bars, and an all-night diner. On-site, there is a bowling alley, movie theaters, kiddie play area, video arcade, spa, and, of course, the casino to pass the time. Did not use but from our room the pool area looks really nice with a large jacuzzi and even kiddie pool. You could spend a whole day just on the property if you wanted. They do have a shuttle to the Strip (Bill's Gambling Hall stop) which we did not use. Some negatives: The key cards required a few attempts before the door opened. Family-friendly to a point - it's still Las Vegas and the casino air is smokey as most are. One odd thing re: our bathroom : It had a sliding pocket door that did not lock and you had to open a small window in near the bathtub for ventilation. Not a huge issue for us, just odd.

Reviews.Title: “Great Christmas bargain”
Reviews.Author: ItalophileBoston
Reviews.Content: Off the strip bargain. And easy shuttle to the strip. We had a huge room with two double beds for $56!! The hotel is clean, quiet (once you leave the casino) and comfortable. View of the mountains. The hotel is connected with a Casino, but also has a nice exercise room and spa, a large movie theater, bowling alley, arena and several stages and show spaces. We went to a great New Year's eve brunch at the Mardi Gras room.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: TheBigKahoona
Reviews.Content: We had a good time at The Orleans. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The buffet was good. Don't care much for the $5 daily resort fee, especially when we did not use any of the amenities associated with it. Nice large casino. Everything is laid out well. Lots of room. All things considered well worth the very reasonable rooms rates. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: petunia1
Reviews.Content: This was the second time my family and I chose The Orleans for our Vegas vacation and we were not sorry. The rooms and bathrooms are large and attractive enough. Housekeeping is good. They must have replaced the beds because they were much more comfortable than I remembered them being. This is a very family friendly place with MANY decent well-priced restaurants, bowling alleys, movie theaters, a childcare center, an arcade, and a very large, friendly casino. No, there is not an extremely high level of service but when my son got sick at 2:00 AM and I called housekeeping to change the linens, two women were there within 5 minutes of my call. This is not an upscale place but it is very nice. For this price you cannot expect the Ritz but the Orleans certainly delivers a lot. The pool area looked very nice but it was too cold during our visit to use it. I do think that it is advisable to have a car in Vegas if you want to see the sights on your own and especially if you are staying in a property off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Families Welcomed”
Reviews.Author: Mamabear33
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is fabulous! You don't need to leave the hotel if all you want to do is gamble, eat and keep the kids entertained. It's about a 5 minute drive to the strip during the high traffic hours but at other times it takes about 2min. There is also a shuttle that leaves every thirty minutes that will drop you off and pick you up pretty much in the center of the strip. But yes it's great for kids and adults. The only downfall is all the smoke in the gambling areas but hey it's Vegas and thats what you'll experience in most of the hotels there.

Reviews.Title: “You Can Beat the Odds at The Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: ivorianqueen
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my second annual trip to The Orleans and for those who are "fiscally-conscious" enough to stay off The Strip and use your money for gambling, this is the place to stay. Let me start with the bad stuff. Only 18 of our 50 states are totally smoke-free and I live in one of them. I can't take the smoke at The Orleans but that's a personal issue and the only negative thing I have to say about The Orleans. The good stuff. 1. Our room rate was under $40 a night. I understand this is a special rate offered between Thanksgiving and Christmas which is the slowest time of the year in Vegas. Call the hotel they will tell you about it 2. The Orleans offers one-stop vacationing under one roof. 3. There is an 18 screen movie theater with the latest releases. We saw I Am Legend which was released December 14, 2007. 4 There is a bowling alley-I don't bowl, can't vouch for this 5. There is a Chinese restaurant with the best won-ton soup (get the big bowl size) and a happy hour where the appetizers are reduced by 50%. 6. There is a day-care for your children and an arcade-can't vouch for these I didn't use them. 7. The elevators are fast I never waited more than 45 seconds for an elevator. I was on floors 1-9 8. Decent view in rooms numbered 01-45, even numbers only, For instance room 638 and 606. You get the mountains and a view of the strip, although there is a parking lot right below. 9. VERY LOOSE SLOTS!! This place is frequented by "the locals" and I now understand why. The Orleans was running local television advertisements promoting the "loosening of their penny slot machines." It's true; the people I was with were winning in the hundreds of dollars on penny slots!!! 10. There are several different restaurants in this entertainment complex;: there is a buffet, a prime rib loft, Al's Oyster Bar, which features these big bowls of seafood dishes; I recommend the Gumbo and the Seafood Cobb Salad, TGIFridays, Ice cream, hot dogs/hamburgers, tand the Courtyard Cafe with the best link sausages. 11. This hotel is not for the "shee-shee- boo boo"crowd, but The Orleans is not a flea bag either. Standard Room size 450 square feet!!! This is with a King-size or two queen-size beds. 12. Housekeeping did a good job. I never ran out of soap or towels. 13. The gift shop is open 24hours a day. They have gifts and goodies to sell. 14. Express check out is available and can be completed via the telelvision screen. 15. There is a free daily shuttle that takes you to and from the strip should you just have to go there. It runs about every 20 minutes. Make sure you get the shuttle going to The Orleans, check with the driver before boarding. 16. There is a $5 per day resort fee that covers all local and toll-free calls made from the room. The use of the internet and free printing in the business center. I was even given colored paper upon which to print! 24-hour access to the fitness center, and the use of the coffee maker in the room. 17. This place is safe for single women, that would be me. 18. Pool and jacuzzi are outdoors and open year-round. Okay I"ll stop now. I can't say enough about The Orleans. Going here is the perfect Christmas/Hanukah/Kwanzaa gift. I recommend The Orleans for families, seniors, college kids, the fiscally conscious, chick-trips and singles.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price”
Reviews.Author: luv_vegas14
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans for six nights. Since we have stayed there before we used a mailer from the hotel and received our first two nights free and the other 4 nights were at a casino rate of $28. When booking your trip to Vegas really watch the room rates and if possible plan your stay when the rates are low. Great rates and the promos that we received in the mail had no strings attached. We have stayed at this hotel a few times and always have had fast check in, check out, clean rooms, and wonderful service by all staff. We prefer to stay off the strip because it is soooo busy now that the Orleans Hotel is a get away from the craziness of the strip. They now have safes in the rooms which is nice and always love the elevator security staff. Enjoyed the hot tub and the restaurants. Shuttle bus was always reliable and only a 5-10 ride to the strip. Bottom line is save on hotel money and use it for other entertainment at vegas...whether it be for gambling or shows. The rooms are spacious and clean. Not as glittery as maybe the Wynn but unless you plan on spending all your $ and time in your room I would recommend to stay at the Orleans. The casino machines were very generous this time and we were able to play on Vegas $. For the average traveller to Vegas I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you get the right package price, this CAN'T be beat!”
Reviews.Author: califbob
Reviews.Content: The Orleans...a couple of miles west of the Strip...sitting all by its lonesome. But look again! You get one heck of a deal in the price and they throw in so much. I stayed there a couple of years ago and wanted to stay on the Strip. Higher prices made me look at the Orleans again and I'm glad I did. Last summer, I stayed here mid-week for about $ 54 a night. The reception is big hotel Las Vegas style...efficient, polite and not exceptionally friendly. The lines are too long, so they have to keep moving you through the cordoned area to check you in or check you out. So you have to understand that. The rooms are GREAT! I got a higher floor this last time with higher ceilings. The room decor is unbelievable for the price...normally, you would get a Travelodge for this price. The door handles shaped like alligators are hilarious, but once inside, it's a seriously comfortable room. A few times, I decided to snooze on the bed to get my energy and wound up sleeping a little longer, it was THAT comfortable. One weird thing about the room shape: generally, bathrooms are at the entrance to a rectangular shaped hotel room. Here, bathrooms are on the outside wall, adjacent to a sitting area. That's fine...it just means your bed won't be near a window. Different, but not offensive. They charge a nominal "resort fee" and kick in the local calls AND use of the health club, which is pretty darn nice. Many other Strip hotels charge $ 10 to $ 15 to use the health club/spa, and that's without any services such as massages and therapies. Disadvantages are few. Obviously, it's off the Strip, so you will have to have a car or rely on cabs. I always rent a car so I walk through this mammoth property to the parking lot or parking structure and go where I want to go. The biggest disadvantage was the food that I got to sample: in my pack of coupons was a reasonably priced dinner buffet which I patronized one night. It was very poor. Oh yes, there was food in abundance, but the quality of the dishes was absolutely dismal. Bleh! The expensive buffets at the Strip hotels are much much better and worth the additional charge. Overall, this is typically an excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and God Value”
Reviews.Author: DazW
Reviews.Content: Stayed here several times and always find the hotel great value, only paid $35 for most nights during my stay, The rooms are large and comfortable. The buffet at the hotel is pretty good and although not on the strip - the free bus from the hotel only takes a short time. Would stay there again. Only negative I can think of is that the casino, can seem a liitle smokey.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: chelb33
Reviews.Content: Booked a group of 42 people to stay in the Orleans thru group reservations. Got 22 rooms and were some snags checking in. Check in process would have went quickly if the person whom recorded our reservation would have put the information in correctly. Out of the 22 rooms, 3 of them were still occupied upon entrance and the hotel staff quickly changed rooms for our guests and comped them a buffet. Rooms were nice, big and clean. Housekeeping was excellent. I personally was on the 5th floor and found the hallways and wait area outside the elevator to be very well kept. I did notice many of our group was on the 2nd floor (a smoking floor) and the halls to have soiled carpets. Used the spa on the second day and it was very lovely except for the people working on the drain in the womens shower area. The spa desk person failed to mention that a man was back there and me and my three guests put on a little unitentional show for them. You would have thought someone would have informed us that he was back there. When I complained the second maintance person told the front spa person that she should have cancelled all the treatments for the day. The desk person said it was to late and that we would have to change in a treatment room. Being that the spa has limited hours...shouldn't they have done this work during the night? The maintance man told us they knew the day before of the problems with the drains and that someone should have had them in there during the night. Oh well, massage was great and just went to my room to take a shower afterwards. The area was impressive and would most likely use it again upon return....if there are no maintance workers hiding in the shower. Kudos to the woman at the Spa desk...she was sooo very friendly and apologized for the trouble. Her friendly manner kept us from demanding any comps for our inconvience. Ate at TGIF and the buffet. Not bad...not great. Was really wanting to eat at Canal Street like we had on our last visit but the staff was rather rude when we arrived at 9:30 to try and eat. They said they were closing and acted put out if they had to seat us. Closing time is 10pm (early in my opinion for vegas standards) We chose to eat at TGIF. Drink service for games was actually pretty poor in some areas, but once one finally came around and served you and you tipped well...they came back quickly. Found the casino to be clean and a fun atmosphere. Not overly smokey like some casinos on the strip. The security at the hotel elevators was nice. Used the shuttle to the strip a few times and it was quick and efficient. Very friendly drivers!! Front desk staff was very nice and helpful..even with the above mentioned snags...they went out of their way to help. Business center had an employee that doesn't seem to like her job. Very curt and short with people. Not rude....just not inviting like we found with the rest of The Orleans employees. All in all...a good, inexpensive stay at the Orleans. We liked staying off the strip and it was easy to get to it if we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: CPow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Orleans for four nights (midweek). Through Priceline we paid $35 per night - which was a great value. The hotel is very, very nice & the staff was friendly and helpful. The room was HUGE & very nicely layed out. We enjoyed the fact that the hotel was not on the strip (less traffic), but near enough to be handy. If we were of a mind to return to Vegas, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: utah100
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and comfortable with a sitting area with couch and chair where we could relax after a long day with a drink. The elevators were very quick and we found the restraunts had good food at an afordable price. We like the buffet as well as the Rio and at half the price. We had drinks delievered regularly while playing the slots. We found everything at the higher level of 3 star hotels we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value but some irks”
Reviews.Author: FellowLeo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 days the weekend after Thanksgiving. The room were large and clean and quite nice but several things irked me to keep this from being a 4 or 5 rating. I had a Deluxe Two Queens Non-Smoking room but was assigned the room at the very end of the wing, making it quite a hike to the elevator and the ice machine. The room door's auto closer must not be adjusted right because it took quite an amount of force to get the door open. The brass bathroom fixtures were showing their age with tarnish and mineral stains. The shelves over the closet area of the bathroom had chipped laminate. The safe is not bolted to any structure and so is free to be moved. During the next to last night of our stay, the air conditioner had some kind of failure and made a very loud noise when it turned on. I did not bother to call hotel staff on it cause the night time temperatures in Vegas made the air conditioner unnecessary. One of the electrical outlets was not properly mounted to the wall and so moved around when you plugged and unplugged something from it. Only the malfunctioning air conditioner was above an annoyance because it actually woke me from my sleep a few times. The Orleans is a good value for the quality of the rooms, but it does have a few maintenance issues to address.

Reviews.Title: “even better second time around”
Reviews.Author: NeilBelfastN/Ireland
Reviews.Content: Second time at the Orleans , even took some friends, everyone was impressed. from the great rooms ,which are large enough to be called suites in some other casinos, to the great choice of restaurants and activities. we bowled , gambled , ate and went to the movies all without leaving the hotel. the shuttle ran on time and was handy . This time we ate at the chinese restaurant , which was fantastic, and the tgi fridays , which was excellent (especially the margaritas). A taxi from the strip cost about $7 and the only reason we went to the strip was for a comedy show at the tropicana. I will keep visiting the Orleans when I visit Las Vegas because it is great value , while being a treat to all the senses .

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Service”
Reviews.Author: NY11373
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on a Sunday at $30.00 including tax. You can't go wrong there. There is $5.00 resort fee, but even this is petty for the price. That includes local phone calls (who uses a hotel phone these days anyway) and the business center, which I did use. The hotel is west of the strip, nothing really there, but they have a shuttle to the strip or you can drive. All the casinos have free parking. Check in was very quick and they gave me a large, beautiful non-smoking room facing the strip. The room was very clean, which many amenities, such as soaps, lotions, etc. There is a safe in the room also. I got myself a casino card and got a free lunch buffet, which was very good. I am not a big gambler, so I don't think I will use it to get comps, which come at $1.00 for each thousand points. The casino was quite big, but stunk from smoke. If you want to save money and don't have to be on the strip, then the Orleans will work for you

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice casino”
Reviews.Author: Fishgirl1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Orleans as part of a 7 night stay in Vegas (coming from New Zealand we wanted to experience so stayed Downtown, off-strip and on the strip). The Orleans was an excellent choice. Nice sized room, security for rooms at night, good casino and nice food choices (loved the clam chowder in Als Oyster Bar - the buffet was only okay). Think the resort fee is a farce but I was still happy with the deal and we would definitely return. Shuttle was a bit of a problem on one occassion - half the people waiting could not fit on and had to wait. We hired a car and visited Valley of Fire and the other off-strip casinos so we didn't need to use the shuttle on the second day thankfully.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in town”
Reviews.Author: Amelda178
Reviews.Content: I don't travel without checking out Trip Advisor. This time we were looking for a inexpensive hotel and a nice one too. The Orleans is definately a winner! The rooms were large and beautiful. The pool and spa were relaxing. The gaming was awesome! No problems getting to the strip, there is a free shuttle from the Orleans to the Barbary Coast. If you want to go to Palms or Rio, the shuttle takes you to the Gold Coast also.. just walk across the street. So the fact that the Orleans is off the stip DOES NOT MATTER! The Orleans ROCKS!!! I won over $100.00 on the penny slots too... Have stayed here 2 times, and anytime we come to Vegas, we will be staying here... I LOVE THE ORLEANS!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the price I paid”
Reviews.Author: TJ-USA
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night on a stop over to another destination. However, I would have stayed longer and would more than likely return. For the record, I generally don't book top notch accomodations. I generally look for a place thats clean, decent, respectable and safe. This was all of them. I would much rather spend on other things than a room you spend little time in. This is a full service place with a couple of places to eat, coffee shop, fitness center, outdoor pool and an adjacent arena where you can catch big name shows. The casino is about the largest I've ever seen. Booked it on Hotwire in which you indicate a location and they pick it for you. I paid $42 plus the $5 resort fee. However, even at $47 it was a great deal. Room was clean and very big for a standard room. Twice as large as most other hotel rooms I have stayed in. Casino is huge and the hotel is large. They have a free shuttle to the strip which takes about 10 minutes so its totally worth it. I would have stayed longer if it was possible. Far exceeded my expectations considering Hotwire picked it and I really went into it blindly. Also, its close to the airport and the rental car pick up/drop off. If you are looking for low key value, this is it. If you are looking for more of a resort experience, this may not be for you.

Reviews.Title: “We have always liked this place, however.........”
Reviews.Author: PinkSoxusa
Reviews.Content: we agree with 'ploughman8' that the hotel should just increase their rate by $5/night rather than try to schmooze guests into thinking they are paying for extras. The in-room coffee consists of two 6 oz individual servings of coffee. How many guests are going to be satisfied with that?? One other amenity the 'resort fee' covers is the fitness center. This is something for which I would not willingly pay extra. I do not visit Vegas to spend time on a treadmill. I can't even recall what the third insignificant item is covered by the resort fee. Orleans isn't the only hotel that tacks on a 'resort fee'. Sunset Station also does this. It leaves some guests feeling they've been slightly ripped off. If they would just increase the price by 5/night, people likely wouldn't give it a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Price was right”
Reviews.Author: sd101
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a Mon-Weds. Room was $35.00 a night. Check in was less then 5 minutes. Room was clean. There was a $5.00 "resort" fee which covered local calls and a few other minor things. The "resort tax" was posted in at least 2-3 places near the check-in so it wasnt a surprise. Off strip location on Tropicana, during the week traffic was crazy, and the mile or so drive to the strip between 4-7 pm frequently took 20 mins or so barring no accidents. I would not use any of the gas stations/restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel for safety reasons but the hotel property itself appeared safe and quiet. I had no contact with hotel staff other then checking in. Overall if I could get the room for under 50.00-60.00 a night I would surely stay there again. I would recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Charges $5 a day resort fee. Be aware.”
Reviews.Author: ploughman8
Reviews.Content: Booked the Orleans through a Travelocity special at $25/night for a couple of not-so-busy weeknights in November. It was a pretty good deal overall, though soured somewhat by the hotel charging a $5 a day RESORT FEE for all rooms. This supposedly covers in-room coffee, use of the fitness center and a couple of other minor things, none of which I used. Travelocity did not disclose this fee specifically, but I'm sure they've got some blanket disclaimer saying it's a possibility (as Priceline does). While I realize that it might still be a decent deal at $30+ taxes, this kind of practice by places like the Orleans really deserves pushback from travelers. Otherwise the hidden add-ons will only become more numerous (remember "energy surcharges?"), more costly, and will reach the point where rate quotes over systems like Travelocity become so irrelevant to what you really pay that they're just a form of bait-and-switch. It's also patently unfair to other hotels in Travelocity that play it straight and DON'T charge hidden fees like resort fees, as their offerings should get better play because of a cheaper all-in price but don't. This encourages the more-honest operators to lower their standards and adopt others' bad practices "to be competitive." That's how these things fester. If the Orleans really needs the extra money, then it belongs in the base rate. As for the hotel, the rooms are basically OK even though some are far from the elevator bank. The casino used to be one of the best places in town to play Pai Gow poker, but they've upped the table minimums to $10 and I didn't see any $5 tables anymore. If you have your own rental car and can get a rock-bottom rate they might be worth considering (just be warned with the resort fee). However, if you're flying in and don't have a car and are there when rates are higher, it may well not be the best value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value off the strip”
Reviews.Author: onegaucho
Reviews.Content: If you can book early enough, you can get rates below $65 during the week. It's a few blocks east of the 15 but it's relatively simple to get back, and they provide a shuttle too. "Chinatown" is only a few blocks north of the hotel so that's a plus too if you're looking for plenty of asian restaurants (good and cheap too!) nearby. Service at the hotel is friendly and prompt. Dealers are friendly too - it's pretty cozy as the table floor space isn't that expansive. If I can't find a relatively cheap room on the strip next time, I wouldn't hesistate to return.

Reviews.Title: “We like The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Wally54
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at The Orleans a number of times and we have always enjoyed our stays. The Orleans is roughly one-half mile off of the Las Vegas Strip and the pace is a little slower and we like that. The rooms at the Orleans are immense. The price is a bargain; we paid $35 a night for a Monday and Tuesday in November. The rooms aren't as glitzy as those on "The Strip" but we're okay with that. The casino has all of the games and services of the bigger casino and usually has smaller table stakes. The facility has nine restaurants, a movie theater and bowling. When we tired of gambling we went bowling and had a great time. If you want to go to the strip you can take the hotel's shuttle - it leaves every half hour. We like the fact that you can easily drive to and from The Orleans without the craziness of The Strip.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Beds In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BrEyes77
Reviews.Content: We are locals and we decided that we wanted to stay at the Orleans just for a getaway. The rates were really low; but it definitely was not worth it. Our sheets were stained (blood) and the bed was horrible. It would have been perfect for Fred Flintstone because it was literally as hard as a rock. Even though we'd already paid for the night, we decided to pack it up and go home. The room, in general, is decent; but if you're looking for comfort, do not stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Orleans - if you don't want to be on the Strip. . .”
Reviews.Author: Travity
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day stay at The Orleans - November 8 - 12, 2007. The Orleans is a great hotel, large, clean, comfortable rooms, great prices, nice casino, friendly staff, quick valet parking, decent food, easy to find, BUT it is not The Strip or Downtown. I had a car, so it wasn't difficult to get around, but personally, I like staying where the action is, so The Orleans was just an okay experience. The price was right - my mom was comped the rooms, so you can't beat that, but honestly, I would rather have stayed Downtown at The Four Queens for a cheap price. I love the hustle and bustle of Vegas. That is Vegas to me. Going to the Orleans is like going to a casino in a non-Las Vegas city - you don't feel like you are in Vegas. At least I did not. So, that's the scoop. If you like to be in the middle of it all, The Orleans is not for you. If you don't mind being within a shuttle drive away from The Strip, then by all means, The Orleans cannot be beat!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Travelaunt58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans in November of 2007 for the first time. Our check-in was very fast - we didn't have to wait at all. (Compared to an airport type line and wait at Luxor for a smaller room at a higher price.) This hotel had nicely decorated, spacious, clean rooms. Our room had a small leak near the faucet, but the maid noticed it and had it fixed without us complaining to anyone. The bathroom had a window that actually opened for fresh air. The room was quiet. The casino was large with plenty of machines and table games at better minimum prices than on the Strip. The restaurants and bars were reasonably priced compared to places on the Strip, and the food quality was very good. Our prime rib dinner at the Orleans was as good as any dinner we've had on the Strip. My only complaint was that the wine list could have been better. We had breakfast in the cafe - the croissant breakfast sandwich was more than we could eat, and so was the Hot Fudge Sundae at Kate's. All the restaurant personnel were very friendly and accomodating. This is not a super plush hotel, but it is pleasant and has a comfortable feel and I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “stayed”
Reviews.Author: maff
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel in october 2007 and had a few problems 1.safe in room was not working rang reception to fix said they would but never did. 2.no lock on bathroom door. good things. 1.girls coming round with drinks was fast. 2.juzzazi was hot. 4.bed was nice stay was ok

Reviews.Title: “Built For the Working Man.”
Reviews.Author: Sciencetravel
Reviews.Content: I love movies, I love bowling and I love minor league hocky. We were able to do all that on our three day stay there. The rooms were probably the largest I have ever been in. In spite of its size it was a price the average joe and jane could afford. The check in was quick. The check out was effortless. The maids were happy to give us extra towles. The only negative was that it was not wifi ready.

Reviews.Title: “First Time In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: CowtownPennyslots
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Orleans. Came to Vegas to see Jimmy Buffett. Booked the Orleans after reading reviews here. Overall our stay was above average. Check in took two minutes at 9:00pm on a Friday night. We needed a cot for the first night and it was delivered to the room in about five minutes. The room was clean even by my wife's standards! We thought it could have been the most quiet hotel room we have ever stayed in. Bed was not the most comfortable however. Used the pool and gym a couple times. Not to sunny in the pool area at this time of year. The casino was fine, no more smoke than any of the others, was maybe even a little less crowded than some others we visited. If you want to smell smoke try Circus Circus!! Used the shuttle many times, never had more than a ten minute wait. Found it to be a fun way to get to the strip. Was a $10 cab ride to the MGM the night of the concert. Also took a cab to Fremont Street that was about $20. Only negative was poor service in the Oyster Bar one night. We actually had to leave before our order ever came. Would not hesitate to stay here again if were ever back in town.

Reviews.Title: “Ambivalent”
Reviews.Author: Midwestern traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights. Check-in was efficient; free and convenient parking; the room is very nice, better than expected. We had 2 queen beds, quite comfortable, and a sitting area with loveseat and chair. The bathroom was also spacious. In addition to the regular toiletries, there was a little goody bag with free samples. The negatives: not much to do in the area around the hotel -- you need to drive or take a cab unless you plan on staying put at the Orleans. We took the free shuttle to the strip which worked out great for us, but the line for the shuttle was longer than the number of people who fit in the bus, so the people behind us probably had to wait quite awhile. The casino was SO smoky, that was the worst part. They did have a $5 minimum blackjack table, so that was good. Our favorite find was the happy hour at the mexican restaurant which had 99 cent margaritas and half-price appetizers. I booked this hotel after reading so many good reviews on this forum, it was OK but I would't give it 5 stars. Overall, I'd probably rather spend a little more and stay on the strip for the convenience of having a lot to do within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “ok, better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: achristie
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a decent hotel. Carpet in room stained, furniture is very dated. Tried 2 restaurants at this hotel, both very good. Biggest negative, casion is full of cigarette smoke. If you have transportation, this is an OK choice, but there are better hotels available.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans is GREAT!!”
Reviews.Author: Vlite
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from our stay at the Orleans in Las Vegas and it was more than I expected. Location is convenient to the strip & airport. The hotel is very nice with large rooms (except the closet is in the vanity part of the bathroom),and really equipped with everything that you need on a vacation (pool, spa, barber & beauty shops family entertainment etc.), and is an extremely good bargin for anyone on a budget. A person could spend their whole vacation in this hotel because there is always something to do and the buffets and restaurants are great! Check in was very fast and the hotel staff were very nice and helpful with any questions that I had. Even though there was a lot going on at the hotel and in the area with the recent disaster of the fire in CA. the Orleans was great. The only draw back was the traffic and guess parking,but that is expected in Vegas.I will certainly be staying there on my next trip to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “liked it”
Reviews.Author: dideri
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for 3 days on our trip from Santa Barbara to Sedona. I liked it because of the price, of course:) The location wasn't that bad at all, it took us only 5-10 minutes to get to the strip by car (driving ourselves). We got a really nice room with the strip view, and it was something at night:) The only thing i didn't like was the noise I could sometimes hear from the corridor at night (people walking, doors closing shut etc) as normally in most hotels bathrooms're located either to the right or to the left from the entrance (depending on the lay out of the room) but here, the bathroom was basicly near the window, and thus our bed was next to the wall neighboring to the corridor and I guess because of that the sound insolation was not the best:(

Reviews.Title: “Eat and stay here at your own risk”
Reviews.Author: MrsBeautyQueen
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel and this will be the last! my husband contracted a serious case of food poisoning at this hotel ( we know this was where he contracted it as he had not eaten anywhere else that day) while we were staying at the hotel for a pageant that I was competing in. I needed to obtain medical assistance for him and the front desk was not very helpful with this and basically made me contact hotel security on my own to arrange for EMS for transportation to the hospital. The cheap room rate we had turned into a fortune spent between the hospital bills after the insurance paid their portion ( he required multiple IVs due to severe dehydration), a hotel room for an extra night, $200 fees to change our airline tickets, and a trip to the store for change of clothes since we had not planned to stay an extra day. I did insist on having our room comped for the one night which the risk manager did agree to do however I had requested he investigate the food poisoning incident and follow up with a week later which he failed to do. Customer service at this hotel stinks! I would rather stay at a nicer hotel closer to the strip for a little extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Dayjur
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 14 nights at the Orleans, commencing on 7th October. Having read the favourable reviews on this site, I had little hesitation in picking The Orleans. Check in was so easy it was unbelieveable. Similarly, check out was trouble-free. The hotel itself is getting a little dated but don't be put off by that, as it is kept spotlessly clean. The ladies are busy cleaning from an early hour. The restaurants, particularly the Courtyard Cafe, are excellent value for money and we certainly did not need to seek sustenance away from the hotel. I have to agree with one other writer about the pool being in shade. However, with it being October and the sun lower in the sky, it is inevitable that the sun will not appear above the hotel building until later in the day. We found a nice corner and had the sun from 10:00 a.m. Not a big deal for me as I am not a sun worshipper and just enjoy a couple of hours' reading by the pool. The room, containing two queen size beds, was very spacious and we had an unhindered view of The Strip. We had the usual implements such as hair dryer, ironing board, coffee maker, etc. and it was a very good set up. The shuttle service to The Strip was a bit hit and miss at times but you can't really quibble when it costs nothing. We took the occasional taxi at busy periods or if we had shopping to carry. In conclusion, The Orleans certainly lived up to my expectations and I would commend it to anyone as being excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Tagster
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. We stayed for 5 nights. Asked for a room on a high floor with a view of the strip and that is what we got. Check in was simple and also got a fridge for $15 for whole stay. Room was large and clean with two queen size beds and large bathroom. Asked for extra pillows and these turned up within 10 mins. Casino - not too crowded and I didn't find that smokey Exercise room - up to date equipment Spa - Looked lovely Cinema - Excellent so nice to be able to wander back from film to room Security - Always asked to show key in evening before getting lift which was good Food - Had the breakfast buffet most mornings, it did get busy around 9 but they seated people quickly, loads of choice - almost too much. Eat at Mexican one night as well that was one of the nicest meals of the holiday Bowling Alley - Looked good, didn't use it Bars - Quite busy, barman not that attentive to customers Shuttle bus - Only used once but excellent way of getting to the strip The only real complaints I would have about this hotel were: 1) Noticed being charged $15 night for fridge, phoned and queried, she said would sort but didn't so had to go to desk and sort. $15/ngt is correct but after being told $15 for whole stay I insisted on this and they agreed 2) The location of the pool - At no stage during the day does the whole of the pool get the sun. There is plenty of space to sun bathe but pool itself is in shade for most of day Location wise about 1.5miles to the strip. Walked it one night but along a busy road so not that nice a walk. For the money I thought it was excellent and I would recommend it to others. It is away from the busy strip which I think is a nice thing.

Reviews.Title: “No Worries At Orleans”
Reviews.Author: gram4020
Reviews.Content: I've just spent a week here with 2 work colleagues. I previously stayed for 5 days with my girlfriend in April. I noticed that The Orleans had gone down from #6 to #16 in T.A. ratings. This plus the fact that I'd read criticisms of penny pinching by the hotel, concerned me. I need not have worried. Although it's true that they don't give out the funbooks at check in anymore, everything else is exactly the same. Although the books were a nice touch, it would never stop me from staying somewhere that I liked. The check in guy was very courteous and gave us 2 rooms across from each other. On arrival at the rooms, I & my friends were delighted with the cleanliness of them. This continued throughout the week. In fact I saw someone polishing the thin wooden strip that goes all the way down the hallways! The housekeeping staff seem to take a pride in their work & were very friendly. This has not always been the case when I've stayed on the Strip. It is some way from the strip. Too far to walk. However there is a free shuttle. It only holds about 18 people, so does fill up quickly. We just used taxis. They cost about $10 to MGM. Not bad at all. As for the restaurants, we found the buffet to be good value, although the food was not exceptional. The Courtyard Cafe served very nice breakfasts. And the dinner we had at the Prime Rib Loft was very good & surprisingly cheap. We used the cinema. Movies were about $10 per show. I'm not sure about the U.S., but compared to UK prices that's cheap. Drink service was fine. The waitresses were fast and appreciative of a tip. I found all the staff that I met to be extremely friendly and helpful. To me that is what makes this hotel such a pleasure to stay at. Maybe as a Brit I don't expect too much in the way of customer service, as our service over here is appalling. After spending an evening on the bustling Strip, it was such a pleasure coming back to the Orleans for a drink and last gamble. It has a nice relaxed and laid back atmosphere I would definitely recommend The Orleans 100% and I will definitely stay there on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but oh so much smoke!”
Reviews.Author: AZspaLady
Reviews.Content: I'm not a fan of Las Vegas but went on business, decided to make it into a weekend of fun (?) with my husband. We stayed at the Orleans because of the pool and high ratings from this web site. We found the room (626) to be in good repair, truly smoke-free and quiet. Bed was comfortable. Furniture in the sitting room area needed cleaning. Maid-service was attentive and quick to deliver extra pillows we requested by leaving a voice message - 10 minutes later they were delivered. TV reception was marginal, but I guess they don't really want you to sit in your room watching TV. We noticed the gaming channels (horseracing, etc.) came in crystal clear. Had late lunch one day at the Courtyard Cafe. Prime rib sandwich was decent, nothing special. Service was slow. Smoke permeated the air, there was no escape in the open-air environment. I noticed lines (LONG) on Sunday to most all the restaurants and even the quick-take-out places. Beware of remodeling - Gift shop closed for remodeling while we were there - open one night, presto it was closed for the next 2 weeks. Courtyard Cafe is open but several walls hidden under blue tarps. Poker room is also under renovation and looks to be about half the space of normal - tables were jammed together in a small area. The biggest mistake we made is flying in and not renting a car. We could have driven and parked in the lot (ample space and FREE). There is a Budget Rent A Car right across the street on Tropicana, would have been an easy rental location. Think we paid about $15 for the cab ride from airport to hotel. Free shuttle leaves something to be desired. Yes, it's free, but it does not appear to run on any predictable schedule. Makes the first stop at Gold Coast (another Boyd Gaming location), and then we sat for literally 10 minutes while the drivers changed shifts. Drop-off at the strip at another Boyd location across from Caesar's Place. We tried to take the shuttle back but finally gave up waiting (lines) and took a cab back - another $15 ride. Pool area is nice, it was rather deserted when we were there. The sun does not hit the pool until noon and the water was quite cool. The hot tub was warmish. Not being gamblers, we were looking for things to do. Watched a first-run movie at the on-site theatre (Cinemark). Walked across the street to a Irish pub. Had a smoke-free lunch across the street at Panda Express. Visited the attached Arena for the K-9 police competition. We were ready for the weekend to end. When will someone have the smarts to open a NON-smoking casino? This place is like the rest I have visited. Smoke fills the air and there is no escape. How people think this is a proper environment for families, I will never understand. Anyway, if you love LV and all that it offers, are willing to put up with a bit of a remote location and are highly smoke-tolerant, you will probably love the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: i_m_good
Reviews.Content: I loved the Orleans! We originally chose the Orleans because we got a great price. If you don't mind staying off strip the location is good, easy to get to the strip by taxi. The room was sooo clean, and everything was nice and new. The bathrooms are great because they have windows in them that open. The pool was nice. The spa was great! I had a massage, it was one of the best I've had! (The masseuse was named Craig). The casino had great gaming, and we had a couple of meals at Big Al's oyster bar. The clam chowder is the best! The Orleans has lots of ammenities (bowling alley, movie theatre), it was a great value for the money. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OMG ! lol 4 Orleans”
Reviews.Author: loseapoint
Reviews.Content: OK -its my granddaughter that's into textspeak but you will really want to 'laugh out loud' if you stay at the Orleans. Everything about the place is good - the staff were all cheerful and helpful, the room was clean, comfortable and roomy. We ate breakfast and dinner in the Buffet - what excellent value! But that is true of everything here. OK - so its not on the strip but (a) it runs a shuttle to the strip and (b) we had a car anyway! I don't think you could find better value in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal going!”
Reviews.Author: sterlingbaby
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Orleans September 30 and October 8 just as a layover on a business trip. The room was booked by my boss because it was inexpensive and I only needed a bed for a night. I wasn't sure what I was in for. Check-in and check-out were easy. My rooms, both nights, were the best rooms I have stayed in while in Vegas. Spotless! My bed and pillows were great. The shower - clean and great water pressure.The only minus would be the towels are not fluffy but very adequate. In-room coffee was available which you don't see very often. I am a trip director and come to Vegas often to work. Many hotels on the strip are so loud, it is hard to get any sleep. I don't know if I was just lucky, but both nights I was there, I didn't have noisy hallways, sirens, or traffic noise. The Orleans is an older hotel but it is in great shape! This hotel is not on the strip but shuttles are available. I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay again in a minute! For the money, this is the best place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Waltnkimsnuggle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here at the Orleans last summer for our anniversary and had a terrific time. The check-in was wonderful, they even gave us a better deal than we had expected! The room was very spacious and clean and amenities were plentiful. We rented a car to get to the Strip and branch out, but they offer a shuttle to the Strip. We liked that is was close enough to not be a drive, but far enough away from the noise and crowds. We will totally stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Less desirable now”
Reviews.Author: nurse02818
Reviews.Content: Until this trip would not have considered any place else . The new ownership -Boyds Gaming - is nickel and diming the guests . There is a $5. a day automatic charge for the spa and in-room coffee . If you never use these , you are subsidizing those who do . We noticed that the smoke odor was more pervasive than it used to be . ? cutting back on changing air filters . We anticipate find ing another place for our next Las Vegas visit . The good - Neil Sedaka performed while we were there -wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasTravel
Reviews.Content: The customer service was very poor at check in and at check out. We will stay at another property next time. We will stay with properties that appreciate the customers.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Hummingbird27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans 4th of July week and had a great time even though the temperature was around the 116 to 117 degree range. I went with my daughter and 7 year old granddaughter. My granddaughter loved the children's pool and when we wanted to do some gambling (must stay on the hotel grounds), we took her to the Kid Tyme child care. She loved it. If you bring your kids to the Orleans, there is plenty of entertainment for them, e.g. movie theater, arcade and a bowling alley. We loved the room and loved the bathroom window. The bath and dressing area was very spacious, and I loved the sofa in the room. If I wanted to read or watch some television, I didn't have to sit on the bed to do it. Security was excellent. I accidentally left $500 in cash in the dressing area that was very visible to anyone that would have come into the room and I did not realize it until we had gone to another hotel on the strip and had to drive back to the Orleans. When I went into my room, I knew Housekeeping had been there because my room had been cleaned, and the $500 was right where I left it! Thank you Orleans!! We loved the hotel and are planning a return trip. I almost forgot -- my daughter won $500 playing a slot game at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bessie67
Reviews.Content: I have issues with everything!!! Lets start with that. I have been to Vegas four times this year and have never had a more enjoyable experiance.The orleans was clean, the people friendly. the food was wonderful. gambling was great. The only problem with the hotel....... I collect shot glasses from were I stay... they did not have a great selection so I bought a mask instead.

Reviews.Title: “Super place great comps”
Reviews.Author: turkie725
Reviews.Content: i was invited to the disco nites slot tournament in july. we have never done one of these before and we had free airfare so 3 free hotel nites, free food and i won $150 in the tournament !!! this is our second time at the orleans and we have nothing but great things to say about it. we were there in may 2007 and had a great time and a super time this time again!! we used the pool in may - wonderful!! the buffet is good, terrible mikes is way more food than one person can eat (we split our meal this time), good wait staff ( and we play pennies), love that the security guys check hotel keys to get up to rooms - also, they were fun to talk too and always friendly!!!! the rooms are great, love the small window in bathroom. my hubby smokes and the ventilation is not too bad, plus the size of these rooms is incredible!! all in all we will continue to stay at orleans. we have never used the shuttle downtown but hear it is a no brainer so next time we will venture out, this stay was too short!!! oh yea, and the slots are loose and the comps goooooooddddd!! go have fun at the orleans

Reviews.Title: “Quality and value”
Reviews.Author: Shaca18
Reviews.Content: We booked the Orleans after reading the reviews and I must say, they were right on the money. The cab ride to the Hotel made us concerned that we had made a mistake being so far from the strip but when we entered the Orleans and then our room, all doubt dissapeared. The room was great, the Restaurants excellent and the staff very helpful. Try the Chinese Restaurant, fabulous food and great value. The free shuttle to the strip took 5 minutes and we never had to wait more than 10 minutes for one. One of the drivers (Eugene) was so much fun and played great music on every trip. The shuttle was just as quick as the cab and was free, although a small tip for the driver is advisable. We were so glad we booked the Orleans as we got the best of both worlds. Easy acsess to the strip without paying the exhorbitant prices of the Strip Hotels and being amongst the crazies. We would certainly stay here again, top quality and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: TexasLexus
