Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 days and nights at The Orleans. We were looking for something new as we'd been regulars at a strip hotel for over 14 years. The Orleans was certainly a nice surprise. The food was great in every restaurant that we tried, The Prime Rib Loft, Canal Street and Al's Oyster bar. The cafe was a good way for us to start each day. Lunch at Terrible Mikes and the Sushi bar were both super. The service was excellent on all counts. Room service was good and quick. All the restaurants were reasonably priced too. Actually they were cheap by Las Vegas standards. We found friendly employees throughout the casino. Usually a sign that the employees like their jobs and it showed. Security at the elevator doors was nice. We arrived on an early flight and the front desk allowed us an early check in at 9:15AM. That was a nice gesture but they put us on the 2nd floor with a view of the delivery docks below. It was a little noisy in the mornings during delivery time. We assumed that issuing these rooms to early check in was the only way they could fill them? Being able to check in 5 hours early made it worth while it to us. We've been to Las Vegas more than 100 times and we've seen the lights plenty of times over the years so we had no problem with the view. The casino host offered to move us but we declined. We were guaranteed a nicer room with a view next trip out. The rooms were large and clean. The carpets looked new, the furniture was well kept and looked fairly new. Big bathroom with a safe up on a shelf. We hopped a cab and ventured to the strip. We were let off at The Excalibur and the fare was only $7 plus tip. There is a free shuttle bus to the strip that runs on a regular schedule if you should choose. We come to Vegas to gamble, eat and see shows. We like to be around people like ourselves that come to Vegas to have fun. The Orleans casino was full of them. Friendly dealers made it all that much nicer. There were even plenty of $5 BJ tables which my wife liked. Most of the BJ games were 2 deck pitch. There was only a few 6-5 single decks (which we would never play) and some 6 deck shoes. Keno was available throughout the casino and in our room on Ch.11. The six crap tables were the long tables which I prefer. The sports book was crowded on Sat. and Sun. but well organized which made the long lines move very fast. The Orleans has a nice arena (saw George Carlin Sat.) and they get some great entertainment. In our estimation, The Orleans would be geared towards the 35 and up crowd. If you're looking for a Caesars Palace type hotel, this is not the place for you. But, if you want a good bang for your buck, then you'll stop looking after you've stayed here one time. All in all, we have found a great place to stay for a long time to come. We'll be back again and again. L&L from Ft. Worth

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel with 2 star price”
Reviews.Author: BlondeMomma
Reviews.Content: This hotel and casino is tastefully decorated and gives you the feeling of New Orleans. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable. There are a variety of restaraunts to choose from onsite and the pool area is also very nice. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Tip on parking - valet is FREE - all you have to do is tip. The recommended tip is anywhere betwee $2-$10...much worth the tip as opposed to walking thru the parking lot. Also, the food at the Buffet is just like going to the Rio which is double the price. It is basically a prepaid food court. The Courtyard Cafe also has good food. You should really check out the $11 16oz tbone steak meal. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: vodice
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nights at the Orleans before our road trip around California for £30 a night. Check in was quick and painless. Was also pleasently surprised to find that we had 2 free buffet meals included on the website printout. Only noticed this as I handed it over to the recepiontist and had to ask for them. This alone was worth about $30. You also get a free voucher book with lots of coupons for things such as free drinks and discounted food. The room was large, comfortable and clean, although we where at the end of a huge corridor. At least this meant that we weren't disturbed by other guests passing the room at night. The hotel was vast and had a 70 lane bowling ally as well as a multiscreen cinema and many food outlets. The pool area looked lovely but unfortunatly we didn't have enough time to use it. The hotel is a couple of miles from the strip but we just drove our hire car to one of the strip hotels every day. Overall a great hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: debk707
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great and we have never experienced such incredible service. The long check in line went extremely fast. (10 - 15 minutes.) We stay the night before at Whisky’s Pete's in Primm and the same long line took 2 hours. Valet service was extremely helpful. The room was very clean and had 2 huge beds and a couch. With the weather being 100 outside, we dine there for lunch and Dinner.The Buffet was very good for the low price. This place had a movie theaters and bowling alley for the Kids. They advertised a shuttle to the strip, but they was no shuttle so we ended up in a $15.00 taxi) one way) I would definitely stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: mfinn
Reviews.Content: My husband and father-in-law both received a $99 offer for three nights hotel accommodations and an entry to a slot tournament. We checked in on Sept. 3rd. First of all, the property is fairly large and the area where you park to check in is a little crazy, so it might work out better for someone to drop off the person checking in and circle back around and pick the person up. Watch out for the valet attendants because they will not allow you to park temporarily. My husband dropped my FIL and me off and we went in the front door to check in. The line was only four deep and there were quite a few front desk clerks working, so it didn't take that long to actually talk with someone. The man that helped us was from India or a middle eastern country, so we had a little trouble understanding him. He was not friendly at all, so our first impression of The Orleans was not the greatest. This was our first time staying at this hotel. The clerk didn't give us much information other than they put a $100 hold on your credit card for incidentals at check-in. We had room 1399, a non-smoking king bed at the very end of the hall (we asked for rooms close to the elevator for my MIL). The room was nicely furnished with a very spacious bathroom. There are neat etched windows in the shower. They do let in a lot of light at night, which is good for a night light, but bad if you like the room dark. You just need to close the sliding door at night, but, remember it's closed as you stumble to the bathroom in the middle of the night! The bed was comfortable, even though the foam mattress was in need of replacement (see photos). The bathroom does not have a exhaust fan, so the room got a little humid after a shower. There was a hair dryer, ironing board and iron. The a/c worked well. The room appeared to be really clean. I really liked the decor and the wrought iron window design. The whole place really reminded me of The French Quarter in New Orleans, so they did a good job of replicating it. One thing we were not told about upon check-in, and we only found out when we pulled up our charges on the television, was they charge a daily resort fee. The website said they charge a $10 fee to use the workout facility and pool, so my husband didn't use it while we were there for the tournament, only to find out on the last day that we were charged the fee anyway. This was very upsetting since the front desk clerk didn't mention it, nor was it printed on the offer card we received for the tournament. The tournament was very well run. They provided soft drinks, water and coffee for the participants. They stayed on schedule for the day. It would be nice if the tournament were two days instead of one since we were there for three nights. We dined for breakfast at the buffet while we were there using a buy-one, get-one free coupon from the American Casino Guide. I would not recommend the breakfast buffet. We had eaten there once before and the quality seems to have gone down hill since then. We checked out on the television, so that was very easy. Parking is a problem at this place since you must walk a long way to and from your room. My MIL has a pace maker and heart problems and it was really hard for her. We will definitely stay at this hotel again if they offer us another special room rate. The location is great if you have a car. It isn't within walking distance of the Strip, unless you're in really good shape. I wouldn't recommend walking at night. Please let me know if you have any questions. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great clean hotel, LOVED it!!”
Reviews.Author: zxert
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 days for our anniversary the last week of August. Based on some of the lesser reviews, I must say the hotel exceeded our expectations. Our room on the 13th floor over looking the strip was spotless! The carpet and bed comforter looked like they were new. I'm picky about clean and this hotel had nothing to complain about. Looked clean, smelled clean, was clean. The staff was very nice, from the maids to security. The one security officer rode around on his bike and assisted us in finding our rental car the day we left. By the way there was ample security in and out of the hotel. The hotel is just off the strip and looks less worn than some of the strip hotels. If you don't have a car, there are shuttles to almost everywhere. We got an excellent deal that included a rental car from Funjet Vacations booked online. We rented a Harley for a day. There is a Harley rental facility two blocks from the hotel (Eagle Rider) that is cheaper much cheaper than the others (Las Vegas HD). They also give a discount to Police, Fireman, EMS. The pool is very large and you will have no problems getting a chair. Our room was VERY quiet. I heard a complaint about the noise at night at places like New York, NewYork, which matches what I read on this site. Just depends on what you like. The casino area had excellent ventilation and I did not notice that smoke was a problem as I saw in other reviews. If you want to buy liquor or beer for your room (no fridge) don't waist your time and money leaving the hotel. The in-hotel liquor store was cheaper than any other store we found even off strip. We absolutely intend to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: trangieo
Reviews.Content: My Husband and i stayed at the Orleans from Sept 4-11. Check in was very quick at 5:30 p.m. We ordered a non smoking King handicap accessible w/ a roll in shower. Got everything but the King bed, which was fine because the two queens ended to work out better. The room was plenty big and clean(they even steamed clean the floor one day). We were on the 14th floor and it was not smoky at all. The elevators were very fast, our wait was less than 10 seconds every time. Ordered Room service every morning and all was great with the food. Got a free USA today w/ the breakfast. Ate at Koji, thought their sushi was not very good. We liked the Courtyard Cafe, great prices and everything came out really fast (unless you came when there was a long line) The chinese food was very good. Katie's Korner had great ice cream. The burger at TGIF Friday's was okay. The pool and spa was nice, only wished the spa was hotter. The greatest asset to this hotel was the shuttle. Very nice drivers and the shuttle came around every 15 mins. The only time we had to wait longer than 10 mins. was on a very busy Friday at the strip. The drop off site is very close(Bill's Gambling Hall); it was a 5 minute walk to Cesar, Paris, Planet Hollywood, Bellagio, Bally's. We walked all the way to IP, Mirage, and Treasure Island and that only took 20 mins. Also, the Shuttle is wheelchair accessible! :) Huge tip: if you are trying to get to MGM, New York New York, and the like, take the CAT #201 bus off of the front of the hotel (Tropicana Ave.) Took us 5 mins and only cost $1.25 per person. Note: there is a $5 resort fee per day, and our stay for one week was about $600, not bad considering we came during the huge game between UNLV and Wisconsin, and the MTV Music awards. Played a lot of poker there and it was a great room, a little smoky because it was open to the casino, but the managers were accommodating, some of the dealers had come problems (poor english, some dealing problems). This hotel really is the Big Easy. Overall: Friendly, Clean, and great prices!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price, nice and clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wingkie
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at Orleans for the labor day weekend while all the hotels on the strip were expensive, we tried Orleans for the first time. It was $90 for friday and $160 for sat, not bad at all. After reading all the reviews from here saying this is a nice hotel, I still didn't expect too much but I was surprised how roomy, clean and nice the room was. We stayed on 20th floor, the hallway and carpet on 20th and 21st are different from the rest of the floor, it is contemporary and nice. I like Orleans, really a nice alternative for off strip hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pleased to return to this great Hotel/Casino”
Reviews.Author: Machman
Reviews.Content: Over the past five years, I have stayed at several hotels in Vegas. Among them, Harrah’s, Stratosphere, Casino Royal, The Hilton, The Fitzgerald, a Hampton Inn, a Condo, and even a motel once when we got bumped from a flight. As you can see, it has been a variety, from nicer to whatever was available. Some of these I have stayed at several times, with inconsistent results in my experience. Not so with The Orleans. I have yet to have a bad experience there, and this stay was no exception. I now travel to Vegas 5 or 6 times a year, and The Orleans has earned it place as my first choice when I start looking for a place to stay. They offer great promotions, that when taken advantage of make the rooms some of the most affordable I have come across. The rooms are spacious, clean, and well laid out. I like that the bathroom is in the far corner of the room for example, not right there as you walk into the room like most hotel rooms, which always seems so crowded and awkward to me. In addition, the bathroom is such the sink/vanity area is separated by a wall from the toilet and shower/tub. This makes it so much easier for one person to shave etc, while the other is taking a shower etc, without having to be right next to them. In addition, the room even has a sitting area, which I must admit I rarely use at all. Let's be honest, we do not go to Vegas to hang out in the room. That being said, I still want a room that I feel comfortable in. The Orleans certainly offers that. They also offer room safes at no cost, although on this last stay, for some odd reason the safe was not bolted down. While that may not be "safe", it might still look odd if someone were walking down the hall toting a safe. I do hope that in the not too distant future, they switch to those wonderful foam type mattresses that others are going to, as my back could use it. While The Orleans is not right on the strip, it is very close. It is very close the The Rio as well. The Orleans tries to offer a lot of variety in an effort to give you a reason to stay there. Large casino, theater, bowling, several restaurants, poker room, most everything you could want. They do have bars, but no hot spot night club, but again those are only minutes away. I really enjoy The Orleans. While no one is perfect, they make an effort to maintain the property, which is more than I can say for several others that seem to be in a constant state of decay. They respond quickly to housekeeping requests etc.

Reviews.Title: “Extemely dissappointed with unwilling service managers”
Reviews.Author: hopfolks
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at The Orleans, we were excited by the ambiance and scenery in the hotel. When we checked in, we were given 2 complimentary drinks at the bar. Initially we were very excited about our trip we went to the room to unpack. After going through our materials, we noticed that we hadn't received all the perks that we thought we were going to receive. I called down to the front desk area, and explained that we didn't get our coupon booklets. We were then informed that the hotel was out of coupon books. Initially I understood that untimely things can happen, so I asked if I could somehow get the discounted coupon items honored without having the actual coupon. I was told no, it was not something they could do. I then asked, what could be done. I was then told there is nothing that could be done. I then asked if there was someone available to could do something to accommodate us. The woman then stated that she was the Director of Hotel Operations. I then stated, then if anyone could resolve the situation I would be her. She then explained that the 2 complimentary drink coupons were given to accommodate us. I thanked the lady, and informed her that we chose to stay off the strip at The Orleans Hotel because of good comments I had heard. I explained that staying off the strip is not nearly as convenient as we would like, but the good comments plus the perks sealed the deal. The next evening we were walking through the hotel, and noticed that some of the visitors had coupon books. I called down to the front desk area, and was informed that if we come down to the front desk, they would give us a coupon book. I was very shocked that after I expressed my disappointment with not receiving a booklet, they didn't automatically send me one when they received them. We wanted to take advantage of the activities without having to leave the hotel (movies + bowling). The Tropicana had the same exact hotel rate as The Orleans, but we chose them anyway. In my mind, there are some things merchants shouldn't run out of, but if they do they should be better prepared to accommodate their guests. We are not high maintenance travelers. All we wanted to do was take advantage of the discounted bowling and movie opportunities that were in the coupon book. We were saddened when we didn't get a coupon book upon check-in, but we were extremely disappointed the the service managers/ director was not willing to help us out at all. I know millions of people visit Vegas, and I'm sure it doesn't make any difference, but we will not stay in The Orleans ever again. Since The Orleans is comparable to other hotels on the strip, we will definitely stay at another hotel for our next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For The Money”
Reviews.Author: PAHealthy-Traveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for six nights. We had always heard that it was a good value so we decided to try it this trip. We always rent a car so we like to stay away from the crowded strip. The rooms are large, the beds comfortable and there is a large bathroom area. I was surprised that there was not a water-saver shower head, but we enjoyed the powerful stream of water and the hot water never ran out. (We didn't abuse that.) There is a little window that can be opened to let the steam out. They have the most up-to-date safe we have seen and there is no extra charge to use it. There is also no extra charge to use the very nice fitness center. I think that is smart business. You see the spa as you make your way to the fitness room and maybe you will decide to make use of that too. The pool area is also very nice. The buffet is a good value. We have eaten at most of the buffets in town. Some have more upscale food for a more upscale price, but this one is very good for the price. The gift shop has a very nice selection. We even went to a movie in the theater on the premises. The only small complaints we had were that the pocket door on the bathroom did not slide smoothly and the room is not too soundproof, but we wear ear plugs so did not mind the noisy kids and drunks in the hallway. It is Las Vegas, after all, so one would expect that. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So cheap - but good!”
Reviews.Author: ninabean
Reviews.Content: Our last 3 nights in Vegas were spent at The Orleans and a t a price of $32 per night I was a little concerned about what we would get. I should have trusted my trip advisor friends. It was great value! We had 2 x great sized rooms with view of Vegas from floor 19. The pool was lovely if a bit shaded in the morning. The buffet was adequate for breakfast and the cafe was good. We rented a car so the distance from the strip was not a problem. The service was average only with the front desk or bell hop being unable to help us out on a few occasions, but hey it was cheap! I gambled for the first time in my life a t blackjack and lost, but I had fun anyway. This hotel is highly recommended for value for money.

Reviews.Title: “inexpensive but far from strip”
Reviews.Author: Bouldermeg
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I stayed here for 2 nights, Aug 22-24, partly because of the high rating on TripAdvisor. We wanted an inexpensive trip, and this is a good value for the money. The room was large (room 1804, 18th floor with nice view of the Strip), but the air conditioning was very noisy, and there was paint peeling in several places in the bathroom. What bothered us the most though was the distance from the Strip -- even with The Orleans shuttle service, we ended up taking a taxi back each evening (too tired to make our way back to the Bill's Gambling Hall pickup location!). I think the next time we arrange an inexpensive trip we will try the Las Vegas Hilton, because of its location on the monorail (and we love Quark's Bar!). The highlight of our Orleans trip was seeing George Carlin perform -- I didn't even know he was performing until the day we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly,clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: minnie m
Reviews.Content: We only spent one nite at this hotel ,but found the staff friendly and helpful. the room was very spacious,clean, lots of marble in the bathroom. We will definately stay here again. We ate at the buffet on Steak nite. The food was excellent with many choices of tasty well prepared selections.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed staying here”
Reviews.Author: snickersnicker
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week to attend the Oracle conference which was being held at the Mandalay Bay. My rental car pick up/drop off was right across the street. It was an easy drive to the conference (no strip traffic)!! The hotel room was very nice and clean. We had a nice view. The casino was fun and not too stingy! Easy check-in/out. Loved the buffet. Took advantage of the shuttle to the gold coast and the strip...nice! I'd recommend this hotel highly to those looking for a really nice experience without all the hassles of being on the strip. Also the bus line runs right out front if you wanted to take advantage of public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice off the strip”
Reviews.Author: drjeff1968
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is a good value and nice enough. The room was very large. The casino seemed kind of dead, but I didn't spend much time there. It's a little inconvenient being off the strip, but there is a free shuttle that runs to the Flamingo. Over all, if you're looking for a bargain the Orleans is a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a few nights”
Reviews.Author: room4me
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 years ago so we knew what to expect....the large parking garage, smoke filled casino, etc. I don't remember the room cleanliness being an issue or the beds being so hard and uncomfortable but they were last week. The size of the room is large enough for a small family and the service is fine, all staff are very nice. The carpet had many dark stains, mostly between the beds (?vomit perhaps) and the bedding is stained and older, 2 flat pillows on each bed (and a limit of 2 additional flat pillows if you ask) but I would still return if they had a show that I wanted to see, as it is convenient and inexpensive. Also, I did see new blankets and bedspreads in plastic wrap in the hallways, so at least it is being addressed. The bathroom was clean, as was the living area except the coffee table had a sticky smear (maple syrup, I think) I wiped it off easily with a damp cloth. Air conditioning worked very well, cooled the entire room and bathroom. We enjoyed the pool area, clean with a nice bar area.

Reviews.Title: “A good family choice.”
Reviews.Author: bcreilly
Reviews.Content: We brought our family to Vegas for my first visit in 30 years, and we had a great time here. I was first in line to check-in on a Saturday evening and we checked-out via the TV to avoid waiting in any lines. The room itself was large and had a comfortable sofa and chair by the window. The large bathroom included the sink area so it was difficult for more than one person to get ready at a time. The pool area (hot tub and kiddie pool included) was great for the family, although it closed relatively early (8:00). The kids also enjoyed the arcade. Families were fairly plentiful. Security was always there and checked room keys in the evenings. It is a large hotel so parking was a good walk during the weekend part of our stay. The cable TV options were rather limited - the kids missed the Disney channel, but I know that they want you down in the casino instead. No problems finding a $5 blackjack seat any of the 3 nights there. A mini fridge in the room would have been nice, but overall, a great value for the price, just a short drive from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: snow557
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Orleans Hotel several times for both business and pleasure. Always a good experience. Great rooms, great price. Alot to do within the hotel, movies, bowling, casino and great pool area. A shuttle to the strip if you don't drive. Team this with good customer service and it's a winner. You can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: ladyeaglekeeper
Reviews.Content: We've been to Vegas before so being on the strip was not a necessity making the Orleans a perfect spot for us. We had our own car so being off the strip was not a problem. We did use the shuttle one evening, it was a pleasant experience. Didn't have to wait longer than 5 minutes for it. I like being away from the constructon that seems to constentaly be happening on the strip. The staff was nice, very helpufll when booking the room. Once we arrived, there was a long line to check in, but i moved very quickly, i'd say no more than 7-8 minutes. Our room was very spacious and clean. A bit tacky, but hey we're in Vegas right? Room service was good, but a bit pricy. The bed was VERY VERY FIRM, I did not like that one bit. But the spa downstaris worked out all our sore muscles from the bed. The buffet let a bit to be desired. Service was iffy, one day it was great the next it was lacking. The food is what I'd call "typical" buffet food, lots to choose from, but all lacking flavor. We only ate there a couple times. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here Stay At The Days Inn Better Service”
Reviews.Author: newbraunsmacs
Reviews.Content: Horrible customer service ***STAY AT THE DAYS INN DOWN THE STREET BETTER SERVICE AND JUST AS COST EFFECTIVE**** they let $1,000.00 worth of fresh leis overnighted from Hawaii sit in their bell desk room instead of putting them in a refrigerator even after we asked several times and were told by the desk manager she would do it personally, these were for our 10th Wedding Anniversary Vow Renewal with friends and family coming in from Colorado and Canada. Their reservation system cant check in more than one room at a time if you are using the same credit card, then they check you into extra rooms and authorize even more we had four rooms, they authorized five rooms and then wanted to reauthorized again when we checked out which put $5000.00 of authorizations on our credit card. Their bell desk only helps if you ask, even when their standing there doing nothing. Housekeeping does not clean anything they only replace towels and made the beds did not clean anything never replaced the ice bucket bag nor the soap. Shuttle never runs like it is suppose to so you have to wait 40 minutes+ before you can get on a shuttle to the strip or the coast casino, RENT A CAR if you stay there. WIFI IN THE ROOM IS $11.99 PER 24 HOURS PER LAPTOP NOT EVEN FREE OR YOU CAN DRAG YOURSELF TO THE BUSINESS CENTER FOR A FREE ½ HOUR EACH DAY Loved the restaurants we got better service from the Subway employees than the hotel employees! Coffee shop people are very rude all the time. Late night bartenders and cocktail waitress are the nicest out of the bunch.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise, nice cheap place”
Reviews.Author: johnnyvegas12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Fri and Sat Night 8/3 and 8/4. Check in was fast. It is not the strip, it is still Vegas. I would not recommend for first time visitors to Vegas. They MUST stay on the strip. Came up on a $45 weekend room rate emailed to players, and someone posted it on LVtalk.com. The rooms are clean and big. The food is reasonable, and good. The casino is fun, small, but fun. They have low limit tables, and lots of machines. The staff are very friendly. The maids do not speak English and neither do a lot of the hotel guests. Because the price is so cheap, you get a mixed bag. The pool is ok, no sun until noon. Pool side bar service is slow, but the bar is good, and cheap. $6 for a blended margarita, $2 for beers! The Terrible Mike's liquor store inside is great too!

Reviews.Title: “For the budget conscious”
Reviews.Author: Canadianknowitall
Reviews.Content: As I had just come from a stay at the Mirage and was going onto a stay at Ceasar's Palace,the only good thing I can say about the room was that it was large and it was clean. The bad was the bed of stone,the bathroom with the plugged drain and the overall shabby worn look of it all. The Casino however is a lot of fun where you get a lot more bang for your gambling buck and with some great restaurants at much better prices than on the Strip. The Orleans as a place to stay is a property for the budget conscious,the low rollers and for families. If you are a gambler and not on a comp as I was, do not pay more than $40.00 a night here,as a room here is not worth more. One major quibble I had was that I found the amount of children and young teenagers hanging around the hallway elevators on my floor disconcerting. They were bored with nothing to do so they "hung" together while their (presumably) parents were gambling.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: 5voyageurs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Orleans in July. We had a better price because we were there during the week and not the week end. The room was spacious, the bathroom looked very good. It was super clean. This is not a Super 8 or a Days inn. It's so much better. Great pool and spa and a heated pool for the kids. It was luxury for us after travelling across the United State with our 3 children. All this for 60$/ night. I would have stay at the hotel longer but we kinda got tired of Vegas, so we left for the Grand Canyon. Only thing is that we had couples of ants in the bathroom. Don't put any food or juice in the trash of the bathroom and I guess they won't come.

Reviews.Title: “Everything under 1 roof!”
Reviews.Author: mangorose
Reviews.Content: This was about our 7 stay at the Hotel over the years, we have stayed at about one third of them in the past 30 years. The rooms are large and clean. The casino is large and has every game you would want, great poker room and sports book. The best food and prices you will find in Town, they can't be beat. This Hotel is set up to keep you there, not much reason to leave, unless you have booked a show at another Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: mouldon
Reviews.Content: Some folks don't like being ths far from the strip, but I think it is an asset, especially since the Orleans provides their own shuttle to the middle of the strip every twenty minutes or so. You can go to the strip everyday if you want, but why bother, given the expenses of everything on the strip. Everything at the Orleans was top notch. The rooms are clean and huge, albeit not super fancy. The service is friendly and the food, especially at the buffet and the 24 hour coffee shop. is very reasonable and delicious. You can stay here for half the price of the strip, have all the casino fun you find at the strip and not have to hassle with all of the traffic. We will go back to the Orleans every time we go to Vegas. Check it out. Dave and Julie M. St. Louis MO

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: ilovevegasbaby
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at The Orleans. We love to stay here. The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. The casino is large and gives you plenty to choose from in the way of gambling. They also provide a lot of food choices. The cocktail service is also pretty good (some places in the casino are not that great). We were on an invited offer this time, so I went to the invited quest line since the other line was very long. There was a gentleman checking OUT in this line and he wanted certain items taken off of his bill. It took a long time to help him. The other line moved much faster. They had about 7 clerks helping the other line. The closest desk clerk should have seen what was happening and should have started calling over the invited quest line. The person behind me was so upset. They were former Stardust guests and were invited to come to the Orleans based on their play at the Stardust. She made the comment that The Orleans was not starting off for her very well. There was also an older lady that came up and asked me if she could step in front of me when it was my turn because the check in clerks had given her the wrong key for the second time. This poor woman looked so exhausted. I felt sorry for her. When I got to the counter the clerk appologized for the wait. I could tell it wasn't her fault and told her so. She sped me through check in and had me on my way. I received a very bad view (the other two views we have had were of the mountains - this over looked the roof of the casino) and a double bed (was supposed to be king). The view wasn't such a big thing, but I did miss the king bed. I didn't want to stand in line again, so we kept it. This did not ruin my stay by any means, but didn't sit well with me. I know I could have changed it, but after waiting so long the first time I didn't care to go back down. From my experience and listening to others in line, the Orleans needs to improve their check in service. I also do not like their $5.00 resort fee charge. I don't like to drink coffee from those small coffee makers. Isn't that good and is not worth $5.00. Charge more for the room if you need to do so, but don't tack on dumb fees. Because of the Vegas heat, we took advantage of the pool this time. While their pool isn't the prettiest Vegas pool, it is nice. It is large which is nice since there were a lot of children there. It gave them lots of room. If you have to go to the restroom you have to go all the way back in the casino. I don't remember having to do that before. There looked like there was some construction going on right by the doors to the pool, so this may have been where the bathroom was before (or will it will be after they are done). Running all the way back into the casino in your suit is not convenient. We ate at Al's Oyster Bar this time because we had a dining credit. The food was good, but the staff seemed to be irritated. Not just one of them, all of them. One of the cooks got into an argument with a customer right in front of us. Then later one of the waiters got into an argument with two of the cooks which ended up getting another waiter involved. I will say the casino seemed much tighter this time than it has in the past years. New ownership? Who knows. Will I stay at the Orleans again? Probably. It is still a great value. We spent more time at the Gold Coast than we have in the past. I would like to give them a try next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: SouthwestJunky
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at The Orleans, and the experience was fantastic. I've traveled to Vegas every year for the last 10 years, with only the last 2 years staying off strip. In my experience at the Orleans, the rooms are more spacious, the AC within the rooms is dramatically better than at the Luxor and other strip hotels, plus the rooms are quiet. The Hotel staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Registration didn't involve a long wait (30 minutes or more at the strip hotels, but only 5 minutes at the Orleans). The housekeeping staff actually spoke English and would go out of their way to say hello when we saw them each day (even asking how our visit has been). The Bell Desk was also helpful regarding transportation arrangements I was making for a day trip out of town during our stay (suggesting the most efficient as well as most inexpensive means to travel). The dining isnt' as good though. The hotel buffet leaves something to be desired, and the other restaurant selections are fairly ordinary. Plus I don't care for hotels adding daily fees to the bills for unknown services ($5 in the case of the Orleans). It seems to be a gimmick to charge a higher rate without actually raising their rates, and that is quite deceitful in my opinion. The dining and the unknown $5 daily fee are the only things preventing an Excellent rating.

Reviews.Title: “great value ,good for all ages”
Reviews.Author: michaelvegas
Reviews.Content: stayed at the hotel july 8 to july 12. got a great rate special thru trip res..com unbelievable total for 4 nites cost $116.52 do the math. rented intermediate car thru payless auto rental ,4days again only cost $115.76. so what that its off the strip, the car was always there when needed and was a snap getting to the other hotels on and off the strip. valet parked all the time and for the few xtra dollars, didn't have to walk in the hot sun. hotel room was clean and quite large vs other hotels.the pool is more than adequate and the slots are ok as well as the wide choice of limits at the tables.didn't care for the food at the hotel,but choices at the other hotels were my choice, espcially the 19.99 breakfast buffet at Wynn's hotel is to die for. absolutely the best. a must try . do your homework and you will find a bargain at orleans. granted this particular week is somewhat quiet , the reason for such bargains. will be back next year. mike A . holbrook ,long island, ny

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Town”
Reviews.Author: Biobrat
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Orleans is a no-brainer. We were there over July 4th week. The rate was $55. per night which included an upgrade to the 18th floor, overlooking the strip. It also included breakfast and dinner every day and a book of assorted freebies like drinks and other discounts. We rented a full-sized car for $30. per day. Parking at the Orleans and at every hotel in Vegas is free. No taxis, no shuttles, no waiting in line, valet parking anywhere we wanted to go. The rooms are oversized, clean and comfortable. The housekeeping staff is friendly and easily accommodated any requests. The pool was clean and large. The way we see it, the Bellagio costs $100. per day more than the Orleans INCLUDING a car. With that money we ate at the most expensive restaurants if we felt like it, we didn't take any hokey bus tours to Hoover Dam ...we got in our big air conditioned car and drove less than 30 minutes to tour it ourselves, stopped for a swim in Lake Mead and did some gambling in Henderson just for the fun of it. We love this hotel and will continue to spend our Las Vegas vacations there.

Reviews.Title: “Can't find fault with the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: annekr
Reviews.Content: We transferred from the Bellagio to the Orleans so that I could attend 2 Donny Osmond concerts being held there. I must admit I was a bit worried but needlessly so. The Orleans proved to be an extremely friendly, clean and high standard hotel. The room was a good size and the pool was large and comfortable. I was pleased to see that poolside marguaritas were half the price (and better) than the Bellagio ones. We ate at the Italian restaurant anf TGIF which were both fine. We also had room service breakfast. The funbook which you get on check in gives a number of welcome freebies. I wouldn't necessarily use the Orleans as a base for a first trip to Las Vegas but as a follow up trip it is definately good value and a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: goofy1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans for 5 nights during the week of Independence Day. Our room was fine. It was clean. The air conditioner made noises at times. I noticed the outside halls needed to be vacuumed. We were really glad that Orleans has a shuttle to the strip. We rode it everyday and it was so convenient. The buffet is good but go for lunch or dinner. We enjoyed our lunch buffets a lot more than the breakfast ones. Overall, we liked our experience here and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: mssocaljj
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is not bad, the rooms are nice and big. It is off the strip so there is not a party scene there, the one glitch is that you have to take a taxi or the shuttle to get to strip. I stayed in winter and did not check out the pool. The service is okay-could be better. -JJ

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Room; Good Price”
Reviews.Author: kabbagehead
Reviews.Content: In some ways, The Orleans is nearly impossible to beat; in others...well, not so much. It's tough to fault the Orleans, especially considering the price. I stayed on a Sunday and Monday night in July, and while I know that that is not a hot time (well, outside, it was a sauna) to stay in Vegas, $65 for TWO nights still seems like a bargain. The room was excellent, more like a mini-suite than anything else, and boasted expensive touches like new tiling in the large bathroom, good climate control, and comfortable beds. It also had a couch and loveseat! This room was easily as luxurious as the New York, New York I stayed in years ago, at a fraction of the price. In addition, they have a good exercise facility, 30 minutes of internet use per day (you pay a non-negotiable "resort fee" for those two), and gave a coupon book with plenty of useful discounts. And by booking through Expedia, I got two breakfast buffets, though they check-in guy didn't give it to me at first; I had to show him my receipt to get it. In addition, there is a movie theater, a bowling alley, a liquor store, and enough restaurants and bars to keep you full and wasted until it's time to go home. Overall, the staff was pleasant, though one particular bartender I encountered seemed a bit surly when I tried to redeem my free drink coupon. Otherwise, check-in was quick and everyone was friendly. The bargain room comes at the expense of some niggling details. First of all, the casino sometimes lacked cheap table games, which is something The Orleans - a "local" casino - is supposed to be known for. If you are looking for a $5 blackjack table, you might be out of luck, and because of The Orleans's isolated position, it means taking a shuttle to The Strip unless, of course, you have a rental car. (The shuttle is free.) That part was kind of a bummer. Next, because of its massive size, The Orleans always seems packed. In many way, I felt like I was wandering around an airport, and throngs of people moved about with their luggage. In addition, joining the players' club took a half-hour wait in line, something I had not experienced at other casinos. Also note this: If you consider yourself racist of prejudiced in any way, look elsewhere, as The Orleans is about the most diverse hotel and casino I've stayed at. Overall, The Orleans is a good bet. If you value the quality of a clean, almost suite-like room with expensive touches and don't mind the crowds and a relatively subpar gaming area, The Orleans will do you just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Lower Price, Have lower expectations”
Reviews.Author: calfly
Reviews.Content: We booked the Orleans for 2 nights - we didn't want to spend gobs of $$ on a room when all we required was a place to sleep & shower. We had read reviews by other travelers and thought the Orleans would be fine for our purposes. The "good" 1. Price, we were there Thurs & Fri evening - and it averaged about $105/night. Booked thru AAA. 2. Shuttle Service to/from hotel takes you to Strip for free. Convenient! 3. Hoover Dam Tour - a must see while you're in Vegas. 4. Double Room was comfortable for our purpose. 5. Cheaper than the Strip, you get what you pay for. The bad: 1. - Orleans needs to open the doors & air itself out. It had a very stale smell throughout. 2. - I felt like I was at a bowling alley, from walking through the casino to having breakfast in the Courtyard Cafe. When we were there, Courtyard Cafe had a water/flood problem & rather than rope off the area of the restaurant effected, they put us in a booth w/ a soggy carpet below our feet AND they proceeded to wet vac right next to us while we were eating. For a business that is open 24hrs they could have done this before peak breakfast hours. 3. - The staff all seem to be the castaways from the high end hotels of the Strip. Although they were all pleasant, their uniforms & their personal appearance make them candidates for "What Not to Wear". 4. - The Pool - nothing fancy, opened at 11am I think. Felt more like a community pool. Lacked "resort" qualities. 5. Room - we had view of parking lot. No room safe. Neighbors room service tray sat on floor outside their door for over 10hrs before being removed. 6. Bathroom - no separate shower/vanity area so 2 people can't get ready at once. Clothes closet is in bath. Had a "Motel 6" feel to it. No frills shampoo & bar of soap. Low power hairdryer. 7. Needs a major overhaul - dated throughout. 8. Hoover Dam tour - we booked thru the "concierge" - took almost 2hrs just to get on the bus at the tour operators depot. We were picked up at Orleans, drove to various hotels picking up others, eventually ended up at depot - where we waited again for other buses. We were then consolidated to one bus & on our merry way. Upside, bus driver was very knowledgeable. I'm heading back to Vegas next week and will stay at the Bellagio...I'll then be able to recommend going high end or low end & where it was really worth my money.

Reviews.Title: “Average but Okay”
Reviews.Author: cross_checked23
Reviews.Content: Like others have said, this hotel is decent, but not spectacular. It lives up to it's 3 star rating. We stayed June 24-27 and really don't have much to complain about. Check-in was late in the evening and we waited about 10 minutes. Our room was on the 12th floor facing the outside pool and could view moutains in the distance, not a bad view. The beds initially felt pretty cheap and thin but we actually slept pretty good. We didn't experience much noise, the room was fairly spacious, the bathroom was much larger than the average hotel and they use name-brand tissue...A small but nice little detail. The room had a digital thermostat and was easy to adjust room temperature. There are 6 elevators and our wait for one was always very short. The swimming pool is fairly large and is about 3.5 ft deep all the way around. We used the bowling center (very nice) and ate at TGI Friday's and it was okay. We did not use the casino because we don't gamble...But for a Casino hotel it's a pretty good place to stay for the family with the bowling center, movie theaters, swimming, ice cream store, Subway, etc. Although we rented a car, we took the shuttle to the strip our first time since it was our first trip to Vegas. The shuttle is quite small and you may be waiting a bit during busy times, especially towards evening. After that, we drove our car to the strip as we found out it's fairly easy to park free at many strip hotels, just look for the signs that say self parking. Getting in and out of The Orleans is quite easy, we just used the free self-parking. Overall, the hotel is okay, especially for the price...We had a pretty good deal. It could use a little renovation, new carpet, etc. but if budget is an issue I would recommend The Orleans. There are so many other places to stay and see so next time we will probably look for something a little nicer for a little more money.

Reviews.Title: “Update on the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: arnerator
Reviews.Content: I have reviewed this hotel in the past. It has always been a great place to stay, nice casino, discount liquor store, good restaurants, and best of all, just about all the items in the hotel stores are at about street price,,no heavy duty price inflation. In the last review I wrote I complained that they were charging for in room coffee. The hotel has corrected that, however, the coffee maker is very small and only makes one cup at a time. Not very practical for a couple. The other negative is that they have adopted the new practice of adding a $5.00 per day facility charge like some other hotels have started, This is regardless of whether you use the facilities or not. I hope that people will complain loudly about this practice as it is only a device to wring a few extra bucks from patrons. However, I would point out that the Orleans room rate is extremely low for a very nice room, and overall it is a great place to stay, despite these annoyances,

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed-still OK but not as good as previous stay”
Reviews.Author: kimandtim
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans for one night June 12 before leaving Vegas. Had stayed this time last year and was slightly disappointed. This hotel is still a good value for an offstrip property but having stayed at the Flamingo and South Point this same trip, I would say the Orleans is only a good value if you get an extremely good rate. My biggest complaint was the bed. The mattress was thin and uncomfortable and the sheets were two flat sheets that kept coming undone=yuck! I know this seems like a small detail, but I was tired by this point in our trip and needed a good nights sleep. Something about touching the mattress when the sheets messed up really grossed me out. Otherwise, the room was very clean. The breakfast buffet was pretty good, but I would recommend the $11.95 prime rib special instead of the dinner buffet. It was the worst food that I had on this trip. Overall, I would not recommend it wholeheartedly as I would have after last years stay, but I still think that it is a decent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: IMBigSister
Reviews.Content: Six of us just returned from our stay at the Orleans 6/10/07 - 6/14/07. We had 2 identical, standard rooms. Both rooms were very clean although one had some serious carpet stains. One had a nice view of the strip & mountains while the other faced a wall. The beds were very comfortable, but the pillows were worthless - so thin, but housekeeping was nice when called to bring up a couple more. All the staff we met were very nice and courteous with the exception of one person working at the bell desk . The others at the bell desk made up for him, fortunately. We ate at 5 of the hotel's restaurants. The buffet had a decent variety, but really great desserts. They even had a large variety of sugar free desserts. The food was great at Friday's, but the waiter was not very accommodating. Subway was good and the Courtyard Cafe had excellent food, but service during breakfast seemed slow although okay at other meal times. The Prime Rib Loft is excellent all the way around. We got in with no reservation and had delicious prime rib and the service and atmosphere were great. We went there 3 times and got a great meal each time for about $15.00. The shuttle to and from the strip was pretty dependable. We never waited very long for the bus either direction. The casino area is nice and large. We found it easy to get a roulette table and there were ample slot and poker machines. I was disappointed to see most of the "one-armed bandits" being replaced with the more complicated electronic games, but this is typical now of most casinos and just an era gone by. I can't appreciate the fake sound of coins being paid out of the machine. I did, however win $400 on one of the older machines and spent a couple of days giving it back before I left. I don't know much about getting comps, but read that you should just ask. I asked for one of the rooms I had to be upgraded, but was offered 1 bed when we had reserved 2, so had to decline the $50 upgrade they offered me. The gift shop was stocked with many necessities as well as gifts and I was quite thankful for that when I broke my reading glasses that I am very dependent on. The theatre was very large and very nice. We saw Shrek 3 there along with 4 other people in the same theatre. As expected, the concessions were expensive, but good. There was a smallish arcade near the theatre that was fun. The bowling alley looked fun, but we never found a time we could bowl due to a large bowling tournament going on there. I chose the Orleans Hotel because I thought it was a great theme, but it felt very little like New Orleans once inside. It was pretty and one of the few places in town not surrounded by construction. Overall, my group was satisfied with what our money paid for. The group consisted of my husband and myself, our adult kids, 21, 23 and my 32 year old handicapped daughter and a 21 year old friend of the family. We all felt we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: huskerdan25
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Orleans from 5/28 - 5/31 for another short getaway to Sin City and the great experience we had last year during the Memorial Day weekend was repeated. We got a great rate of just $25 a night from i4vegas which is incredible for the quality of the room and the hotel! The room was large with a comfortable King bed that was a bit softer than last time with a foam top on the mattress. The room was very clean and the only complaint I have is the loudness of the air conditioner in the room but it did work well and keep the room cool considering it was 100 degrees each day we were in Vegas. The cleaning crew did a wonderful job of keeping the room clean and not bothering us as long as we had the tag outside the door that we wanted privacy. We caught the Rick Thomas Magic show and it was a very entertaining time. The white tigers are absolutely beautiful and his female assistants were as well. Because the showroom was barely half filled, the show felt much more personal and a few times Rick came out into the crowd and he involved several members of the audience in his act. A great value for the normal $24.95 ticket price and even better with the 2 for 1 special we got for being guest at the hotel. We really enjoyed having a movie theatre at the hotel and we were able to get caught up on some good movies that came out in the month of May that we hadn't been able to get to at home. And it was never crowded. The buffet was very good for breakfast and that is the only time we ate at the buffet. We did eat at TGI Friday's late one night and enjoyed dessert there and we ate at the Courtyard Cafe after looking at the menu and seeing the chinese food selections. After we saw someone who had ordered the T-Bone steak get their dinner, we forgot about the chinese food selections and both ordered the T-Bone. Excellent quality for a very reasonable price! We ate at Cravings in the Mirage for dinner one night and were a bit disappointed overall for the cost of the buffet. My wife loved the salad bar where they made her salad fresh and I really enjoyed the prime rib but we were as impressed with the quality of the food compared to a couple other buffets we ate at. We ate at the Spice Market Buffet in Planet Hollywood and this buffet is worth every penny! We loved it last year and we were not disappointed this time. Great selection, great quality and it deserves it's reputation of being the best buffet in Vegas. We can't wait to eat there again on our next trip. One other place we ate that is worth every penny and deserves it's great reputation is Todai in Planet Hollywood. It is a japanese and seafood buffet and you can get such a wide variety of sushi as well as cooked japanese dishes. My wife does not eat sushi but there was more than enough non-sushi dishes to keep her pleased. We went for lunch and probably 80% of the clientele at the time we were there we Japanese, so you know it is authentic and good! One other thing we did that was not at the Orleans was catch the Jay White - Neil Diamond tribute show at the Riviera. I was skeptical but my wife and I are big Diamond fans and so we bought half-priced tickets at a half-price ticket outlet on the strip and went to see the show. Outstanding! Jay White made you forget that he wasn't really Neil Diamond and his act was very believable. I would highly recommend this show if you have never seen it before. One thing we really like about the Orleans is the casino. Unlike many casinos on the strip, it is not overly smokey and there are plenty of penny slots. We aren't big gamblers and usually just spend time on the penny slots. We really enjoyed the variety of penny slots available and they did pay well. We probably won around $600 in total though we ended up putting it all back along with about $300 of our own money, but it provided for a very enjoyable time playing the slots. They have improved the process of taking the shuttle to the strip and we were glad about that. Last year, it was a pushing and shoving match to get on the bus but this time they had a roped area that people had to line up in to get on the shuttle. Definitely made using the shuttle more pleasant this time. The shuttles run every 30 minuntes and we always seem to get out to the shuttles just as they were arriving. Each time I plan a trip to Vegas, I think about possibly staying at a hotel on the strip but then I realize that I get such a great value at the Orleans, why should I waste my money staying on the strip? We actually enjoy the fact that it is off the strip and not crowded and you really don't ever need to leave the hotel if you don't want to with the great eating establishments, casino, movie theatre and bowling alley all at your disposal. And the two shows we have caught at the Orleans, Air Supply and Rick Thomas were very enjoyable and reasonable in cost. So, we are already planning our next trip to Las Vegas and we will definitely stay at the Orleans again!

Reviews.Title: “Got Married In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MVRsVegasGirl
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I were married on Sunday, May 27th at the poolside gazebo at the Orleans. We had about 40 guests (all from out of town) who stayed at the Orleans for several days. The pool area was very attractive, and even though I personally did not go swimming, my friends and family loved it. The restaurants were very nice, and there was a ton of variety - a TGIF, a Subway, the Cafe, a Mexican restaurant, and more! We had our reception at Sazio, the Italian restaurant. The food was very tasty and the service was excellent - extremely attentive (but then, it was a wedding party!). I was very pleased. The breakfast buffet was also very good; my father had enough comps to treat five of us! The rooms were nice, but in need of some updating. However, the room service was good and the room was clean. We got new bottles of shampoo, conditioner, etc every day. There is also an iron, ironing board, and hair dryer. Check-in was pretty smooth and easy; we arrived way before check-in time (at about 11AM), but we were all allowed to check-in early without extra charges. The only complaint I have is that there is an extra $50 a day held on your card in case of room damage, I guess. However, this is not very convenient if you use your debit card. Check-out was also very quick and easy. We used the business center to ship some wedding items back home instead of taking them on the plane with us, and we received very friendly and helpful service. We did not have a UPS account, so the clerk told us she could ship our box out with DHL under the hotel's account. It arrived safely in our possession only two days after we got home (in upstate NY). I did not notice the casino being any smokier than other fancier strip casinos - and I am a non-smoker. There were lots of low-limit tables and many slot machines. My fiance won $400 on a slot the first day we were there and one of my friends won over $500 on her last day. The tables had very friendly dealers and they were fun to play at. It was pretty easy to get to the strip - we took the shuttle three times and never had a problem; even with the holiday weekend traffic. I would definately not try to walk it though - way too far. We did not rent a car, but it was still easy to get around - we went to Freemont Street for a day and it was only a few minutes away by taxi. If you don't mind being off-strip (it was never a problem for any of us), and you are looking for a great deal, the Orleans is the place. Overall, it was a super value and everyone had tons of fun over the week.

Reviews.Title: “Average experience”
Reviews.Author: fredorules
Reviews.Content: While this is not my first visit to the Orleans, it is the first time I've stayed there. Got a $56/2nd nite free deal from Travelworm, so the price was definitely right (stayed nites of 6/6 & 6/7). The room was on the 4th floor looking out towards the Palms/Rio direction, king bed. Will skip the details of the room as they've been written about in previous reviews. I do agree that the whole place is starting to show its age and Boyd needs to start upgrading. The Funbook they give you at check-in has some good stuff in it but if they really want to keep people in the hotel they need to add a coupon for the Prime Rib Loft and better coupons for the restaurants. I was able to find $5 bj in the evenings - beware of the 6/5 single deck bj. Stay away from video poker if you like favorable paytables. Ate at both the buffet and the coffee shop - both decent. The best meal, though, was at Terrible Mike's (the snack bar). Had their burger and fries and it was a hefty meal. They have a condiment bar with the works so you can load up your burger with as much lettuce, tomato, onions, pickles, jalapenos, etc as you want. One caveat: the little window above the shower is nice to let air in, but I left it open one night and was awakened by garbage trucks at 5 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience Off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Dawn52
Reviews.Content: Stayed June 3-8 and had a good time. First time I haven't stayed on the strip and I liked it. The shuttle was good. Had to wait, always seemed to have gotten to the waiting area just after it had left. The rooms were nice. I liked the colors they used it was different. Bathroom large. Window in the bathroom, as everyone has already said is a nice touch. Our room was in the back on floor 11 and it always seemed to be noisey with deliveries or loud car engines. It wasn't opened long. Air conditioner is noisey as it cycles on and off to temperature, but the alternative is a hot room. One problem was the light to the shower area was out, we hadn't noticed it right away but met the repairman who said it wasn't the light but a switch in the basement that needed to be turned on. Later the first day ,we got a call saying the repairman was waiting outside to see if the light worked. I turned it on and it worked so, the switch in the basement was turned on. How many Orleans employees does it take to change a light bulb, and how long does it take? Check in took about a half hour. Peak time for check in. Slots are very tight. The buffet was good. Had a breakfast and lunch there. Supper seemed to $ for what was there. The dessert area is behind glass, have to ask if you want those goodies. I guess when they left all of the desserts out they went through more. Guilty!!! Also ate at the Courtyard cafe, Seattle Coffee, good for a quick breakfast coffee and crouisants, Also another quick stand near cafe. Ate at Fridays. They seemed to be annoyed we were there. Had to ask for silverware, napkins. We split a dessert and asked for another plate. Boy, did that annoy them. Access to the hotel is easier then the hotels on the strip. Parking all around the hotel not just in one area. Found a shortcut to the parking area. Easier to tote the suitcases. Pool was cold, in and out quick. Jacuzzi was nice and warm. One small store for trinkets. Easy access to the strip. The area by Planet Hollywood is so jamed with construction and messed up. Nice inside sort of sterile. Take Koval it's easier after you've seen the strip you don't want to be in that mess again. Saw Stomp at Planet Hollywood and Howie Mandel at the MGM. Visited some hotels I hadn't seen before. Palms is a mess with construction. Not much to see inside. Barbary Coast is Bill's Gambling Hall?!?! I always like the name Barbary Coast. SAw Sams Club, nice atrium, sort of a forest area for those who don't like the city. Had a nice time at the Orleans. Don't like the extra $5 charge. Vegas seems to want to price out the average person. Are there that many high rollers in the world? I would stay here again, or off the strip. I like to try different hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Tremedous value, great accomodations, but needs new beds”
Reviews.Author: phazerbro
Reviews.Content: We got this room for 38$ a nite (2 night stay) by finding that price on one of the many Las Vegas room broker sites, then calling the hotel directly and seeing if they would match the price. They not only matched the price but upgraded us to a more desirable room on a higher floor since the original room would have been on one of the first 4 floors with no views at all. We absolutely lucked out and were given a room on the top floor, floor 21. Of the three wings off the elevator, two on floor 21 were gated and reserved for highrollers... our wing was upscale decor but still available to us poorer common folk I guess! lol .. It was fun riding the elevator with a few whales and talking with them! BUT ... when we walked into our room .. it was a disaster... it was not cleaned yet and obviously someone had thrown one raucous party based on the condition and the "bottles" & litter left everywhere. But we wanted that upper floor, so we waited while housekeeping did a great job and gave us a refreshed, cleaned, sparkling room in about 45-50 minutes. The rest of our stay was great. The Orleans has plenty of restaurants of all kinds, you never have to leave this place ...bowling, a movie theatre complex, showrooms, a smaller lounge show, bars everywhere, a liquor store, large gift shop with food & sundry supplies, and a coupon book when you check in that has several decent deals. The ONLY thing that bothered us was the mattress on the beds. They are the foam mattresses, and I don't think they are the high quality memory foam you often read about. But they did seem to memorize my body shape..and the ensuing hole was hard to roll out of during the night. However the rest of the room was great! They have an interesting floor plan with a very roomy bathroom at the back of the room rather than up near the door. I liked that, and the decor was very upscale, although I do not know if it was better than other floors (since we were up on the top floor). The AC worked great... there are not a lot of TV channels, but who watches TV here? And the unique design of the bathroom adds a small openable window in the tub!! What a view!! For the price this could not be beat, and we enjoyed the less hectic pace in their Casino. I just hope they do something about their beds soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed tight slots”
Reviews.Author: gr8lady
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze, the room nice, clean and large. I stayed for 4 nights at a very low rate $26 pn and that was basically the best part of the hotel. Ordered the graveyard steak breakfast the first morning and it was disgusting. It was cold, the eggs congeled and the so called toast had a blob of butter on it that just wouldn't melt . To top it off the coffee cost almost as much as the breakfast. I liked the buffet for breakfast, one lunch and that was enough for me. Lots of variety but quality so so. I was happy for the fruit and salad. I had a burger at Terrible Mikes and that was surprisingly good. No luck at the slots, very very tight and too many video poker slots. Went elsewhere to play. The shuttle bus was great, timely and orderly. Drink service was ok. The girls whipped past so fast that by the time you turned to order she was gone. Took me 2 hours to get my first drink. As far a the $5.00 resort fee, that didn't bother me, but when I made coffee there was scum floating in the cup. Went to Seattle's Best, very good coffee and muffins. etc. Went to the gift shop for water etc. and the ladies were friendly, helpful and a definite asset to the shop. Would I stay there again, probably not, will go to the strip and pay more. As the saying goes, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be . . . .”
Reviews.Author: luv2vacation0
Reviews.Content: I should start by saying we stayed here about a year ago and it was WONDERFUL!!!! It was such a good experience and value that we didn't even shop around this time, but we should have. Check in took over 30 min. The clerks were not trained and not happy. When we got to our room it was not the one that we had reserved. I called to see what happened and the only response that I got was that it was late and there were problems with "the system", so we spent 8 days in a room that was not what we reserved but paid the price for the room that we did reserve - no apology. There was an additional $5 fee for coffee, business center and spa (just sauna and hot tub, no services). Since it was not optional it should have been included in the rate - so add $5 per day to what ever rate you find online. I did try to use the business center twice, the first time it was full, the second time the clerk would not let me in because she was going to lunch in 15 min. After I begged and promised not to stay more than 15 min she did let me in. Also, since it is so hard to fly with liquids now I left shampoo & conditioner at home for the first time ever and they were only replaced every 3 days by housekeeping which wasn't enough (yes I did tip housekeeping). The room was clean, the bathroom is bigger than most. The casino seemed to be generous with comps but they were VERY difficult to redeem. I took one FOR the beauty salon TO the beauty salon and they told me I couldn't use it (because of "the system"), so I took it back to the poker room and the clerk wrote on it and said I could use it. I went back to the salon and they did let me use it but, they had no price list or menu of services, they told me that my service would be $35 up front (before I mentioned the comp). After I was finished I gave them my comp and at that time they told me the service was $75 and then they marked it down with the comp?!? Be careful there. I got another one for checkout (which took almost an hour) the clerk said I couldn't use it because I didn't have a balance that large. After I asked a few times for her to check again she did see her mistake and pulled the correct information up. Again, she didn't know how to check us out, we had to wait for a supervisor who still didn't seem sure how to do it. The did let me use the comp but I couldn't use the points from the machines because the "system was down". That coupled with the $5 per day fee (5x8 days = $40 EXTRA) really made me feel that I was beeing cheeted. Again, no apology, just an excuse about "the system" and "the new management". It took much longer than it should have and we almost missed our flight. The first time we ate at a resturant the employees had an argument in front of us while we were eating about how they couldn't clean because the hostess sat us in the wrong place. So, we did not do any of the other resturants at The Orleans this time, but we did go to the snack bar and it was still very good but again, when it came time to pay there were problems with "the system". I had a good experience in the casino. I did think the machines were a little tighter this time but the cocktail waitresses were great. They were very nice and attentive. Since we were there for 8 days they remembered us which was nice. I agree with people that say the casino is smokey and I'm a nonsmoker, but I expect for bars and casions to be smokey. This one is not nearly as bad as some. There was a part of the hotel, around the pool door and side parking lot that just smelled like sewage. This was troubeling. The pool is nice but it is just a pool. I don't have kids but this must be a pretty family friendly place because they were everywhere and looked to be having a great time. There were enough chairs every time I went out and towels were also pleantiful. Overall I guess you get what you pay for. It was a good value, but we weren't value shopping. We stayed there because it was so great last time and this time it just didn't meet our expectations and between the problems with the comps and the additional fees I just felt cheeted. I'd rather pay a little more up front. If you're value shopping there are lots of good values in Vegas, I regretfully, have to recommend that you look elsewhere. For us, we will probably pay a little more next time just to have a better experience, it is vacation after all. Aside from the casino, every time we tried to do something in the hotel there was some kind of problem. The employees were not happy, they didn't seem to care. We got excuses about "the new system" and "the new management" everytime something went awry but no one really cared and this was the most frusterating thing. Of course things go wrong from time to time but as long as the hotel is nice and really wants you to have a nice stay it is okay - The Orleans just didn't care this time. To their credit they did send a survey, while they didn't offer any kind of apology or "thanks for your business we are taking steps to ensure this doesn't happen again" hopefully they will listen. I wish them the best of luck.

Reviews.Title: “Orelans is Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Denise056
Reviews.Content: Orleans is a great hotel. The price is less than on the strip, but very close by the Orleans shuttle. The rooms are very large, we had 2 queens with a sitting area and a huge bathroom. The meals in the hotel are also very good and the prices in the liquor store are also good. The pool area is excellent. I can't think of any negative things to say about the Orleans. It's definitely worth checking out!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Orleans!!”
Reviews.Author: Allik
Reviews.Content: Although there have been a few negative reviews, I would have to disagree completly. We stayed at the Orleans for 2 nights at the end of May. It was an amazing experience. I've stayed in other hotels in vegas, on the strip, and I would much prefer to stay at the Orleans from now on. Contrary to the other review, the bed and matress was very comfortable, in both of our rooms. The buffet was very delicious, and had a wide variety of choices! Both Dinner, and Breakfast. The staff is wonderful, and very friendly, and the casino had lots of waitresses. The slot machines did pay out for us, a few times in our 2 day stay. I didn't have any problems with noise, even at night, and I just really had a wonderful time. The pool area was nice, and not overly crowded, although it does close at either 6 or 7 . Easy to find a stop to sit down, and the water was nice and warm. I wanted people to know that The Orleans is a very good option while in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Something is not going the right way”
Reviews.Author: andywa
Reviews.Content: My stay occurred May 21-24. I have stayed a The Orleans a few times before ( the last stay is about 18 months ago).I used to love it.Still, in my opinion the rooms are great: spacious and well furnished. For the price that you pay you do get still a bargain in my opinion. However, the atmosphere at the Hotel has changed considerably. They used to have very friendly and courteous staff, who were willing to go the extra mile.Now it is more or less a "I don't care" attitude that many of them project. For some reason the guest mix changed not to the better. It used to be mostly middle class families .While I would not go as far as "Canuckscout" in his/her review described the folks they encountered ( at least not during my stay),However, I also noticed a shift to a less desirable crowd. "Bigbeef56" review echoes many of my observations as well. Something has changed there ( maybe the management or the owner?) but it is not at all beneficial for The Orleans. My impression is, that they cut jobs and are now seriously understaffed in many areas. As others mentioned also, I found the slots to be much,much tighter than on previous visits. I still enjoy the location away from the strip, but the shuttle service is somehow very unorganized and the drivers used to be nice and helpful-not this time. The Buffet also used to be much more inspired but now it is quite ordinary and uninspired. Overall, I was disappointed a the down slide, but I hope enough people complain and they get the message.

Reviews.Title: “good, bad, & ugly may28th - june 1st”
Reviews.Author: wildbillTexas
Reviews.Content: the price was great and the hotel rooms was very clean. But they charge an extra $5.00 per day for in-room coffe(which is terrible)the fitness center (we do not use) and something else which we did not use. So this rip us off $20.00. Next the food which overall all was price to high and only had a couple good meals. The best is the breakfast buffet (great omelets). The prime rib loft is a joke do not waste your money. We went to eat and only had three tables full and was told due to lack of servers if we had no reservations it would be 1 hour wait. The pool spa was nice one day than the next it was dirty and pumps & heat not working. Plenty of slots, large poker room but during the day the locals are heavy and tight. Off the strip they have shuttle, but renting a car was better and not much more after you figure shuttle, taxi, etc..

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Lov2tvl
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Orleans this week from Monday to Thursday. We had a room on the 19th floor and were facing the pool. Everything was fine and we had a quick hamburger from Terrible's using our coupon book, and a dinner at the Prime Rib loft that was ok too. The room was large and clean although I didn't see too much vaccuuming being done, The beds were comfortable and the sheets were clean. I did manage to win a little on the penny machines too.
