We took the shuttle to Bill's on the strip and had no trouble getting one back around 10:00 pm. This is our third year at the Orleans and the price is always much lower then the ones of the strip and we will stay there again next year, I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: dsaavl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans from May 27th to May 29th and had a great time. Checkin was quick. It took no more than 5 minutes to check in. Room was clean. We had a King size bed with a sofa and bed was soft. Bathroom had a window and my friend really like that. My friend thought light in restroom was dim but didnt really matter as we didnt stay in room long. Room was for sleep and shower. Manager at registration gave us two coupon books which has some discounts. We ate at Terrible Mike's and used coupon to get free soda and fries. We both agree the hamburgers were great. We ate there 3 times during our visit. Slots were good to my friend. She won at least 400.00 on the nickel slots. Waitress were good in getting us drinks. Casino was not crowded like some of the other casinos on the strip. Best thing about the Orleans is that the casino was not full of smoke. We will be going back to Vegas in September and will definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Ducks
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a free compted week at the Orleans hotel...the rooms are very nice ..every convienience...coffee maker /coffee replenished every day...iron/board...in room safe..hair dryer..sitting area with couch/ chair and table...weird sliding door in bathroom was noisy and had to keep it closed at night as light came through the b/room window making it hard to sleep...good maid service although they dont understand english well. The restaurants are good..buffett had alot of choices something for every one..and very resonable in price...6.95$-b-8.95-L11.95d...less 1.00 off with your coast card.....Terrible Mikes had the best burger i have ever had started at 4.95....this is a fast food stand in casino with fries chicken fingers etc....also Subway/TGIF/and other restaurants as well as ice cream stand.. Slots were not paying off at all 4 of us could do nothing at any denomination.... There is a liquor store with good prices as well as a gift store ... prices in store were high for water/juices...so we found a convienience store across the street called Terribles it also has a gas station..they were quite resonable as we like to drink a lot of water..ther gallon jugs were only 1.39....which we took back to our room as well as snacks The pool area is really nice!!!! ..big...lots of seats around the pool as well as the hot tub .(not very hot)..and a kids pool...there is also a pool bar and you can order food if you want to eat...you also need a room key to get in pool area as it is fenced in (wrott iron)Only downer was shuttles and ambionce was not there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer service but horrible rooms”
Reviews.Author: TIALAURA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 05/26-05/28/2007.. My first room here was on the 5th floor and that night around 12 midnight they had kids running up and down the hallways, screaming, slamming doors and actually howling. I called security who actually came up and started pounding on their door screaming that they cant make so much noise. Went down to reception in the morning and was told I could switch rooms so I was bumped from the 5th to 20th floor which was nice but the mattress still was horrible on both floors. If you sit on the edge of the mattress it would slide over on its frame and you actually sink down when you lay down. I would have loved if they offered me a free meal for the lack of sleep and having security yelling at 1230 am but I wasnt going to ask for it. The customer service was excellant here and the rooms were clean but they need to update their bedding and buy new mattresses because my back still hurts from the 2 nights I slep there. I dont think I could recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans? Not sure anymore...”
Reviews.Author: Bigbeef56
Reviews.Content: After years of enjoying visits to the Orleans ,I doubt if we stay there again. Things that annoyed me were... 1) The lack of complimetary cocktails on the gaming floor. Was never an issue in the past. Sometimes waited for 25-30 mins. before I even saw a waitress come around. Then when you did order be prepared to wait another 20 mins. to get your drink! 2) So while your waiting and waiting for a drink you will lose even more money on some noticeably much tighter machines. 3) The buffet has reduced itself to serving generic, bland,same old, same old. The Prime Rib Loft was OK, decent food ,reasonably priced. 4) The pool was OK, looks like they eliminated the serving staff for drinks out there. None were ever seen. 5) We got the impression the employees were no longer happy with their employer. Service was OK for the most part, and the tips were greatly appreciated. Overall the stay was not a disaster but we left the place feeling like we lost an old friend. I just hope the " corporate culture" that seems to be taking over in Vegas learns from their mistakes.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed May 19-23/2007 You get what you pay for!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Canuckscout
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Orleans for 4 days I have to agree with both good and bad reviews. We rented a car knowing the location is 2 miles west of the strip. This was great since it allowed us more variety in our dining options and to take advantage of eight 2 for 1 meals using LAS VEGAS ADVISOR coupon book. See LASVEGASADVISOR.COM. We also could shoot north on hwy 15 and get downtown in minutes to see the freemont night shows. The Hotel is tired and in need of updating. The casino is the most smokey I have ever seen. Even at 7 in the morning the stale smoke still hung in the air from the previous night. We found small casinos downtown were better ventillated than this place. There was a constant stench of sewer around the elevators.The pool is small and run by a couple of teenagers who have no concept of customer service. They are logging time to collect minimum wage. Some of the patrons were definitly candidates for the Jerry springer show. Drunk, swearing, singing an mass to every song on the poolside system, covered in tattoos, missing teeth. And that was just the women! One great find is the liqour store that had the cheapest prices I have ever seen in Las Vegas. We went to Wal Mart (Charleston Ave.) to get 24 bottled water ($4.50) and a bag of fabulous oranges. The room style was a confused combination of motel 6 and a french brothel from the 70s. It had a musty smell of cleaner. The room was clean but desperatley in need of updating. The air conditioner sounds like a 747 idling on the runway. The sliding pocket door in the bathroom is louder that my overhead warehouse door. Not very nice when you have to go at 3:00 AM. The lighting was poor and not convenient. The closet is in the bathroom. We ate there only once at the buffet. It was the worst of the 8 we had in total. We are not fussy eaters sticking mostly to salad, veggies and fruit because of the heat. I would not stay there again. If you shop around you can much better for slightly more money. After all you are on holiday and want to feel like it is special. RIGHT!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: ydnicMichigan
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Orleans on May 19th from a 3 night stay. I have stayed at several hotels in Las Vegas and really enjoyed the Orleans. Our room had 2 very very comfortable double beds, couch , 2 chairs, coffee table, desk and combo T.V. center and dresser hidden below. The rooms have a safe, hair dryer, coffee maker, iron and board. Even a phone in the bathroom!! My son loved the large pool and huge hot tub area. I will stay at the Orleans on my next trip to Vegas. The only thing i can say bad is the slots seemed tight.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit”
Reviews.Author: thorno2
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Orleans. It is still a great place to stay and an excellent value at $80 including tax. If there are complaints in the other reviews I did not experience them during either stay. The room was large, clean, comfortable, and quiet. There are a variety of dining options which are reasonably priced. A free shuttle runs to the Gold Coast/Rio and the heart of the strip. I would recommend staying here to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: BlueandGoldhawaii
Reviews.Content: I was the guest of my general contractor who set us up at the Orleans. I was a little leery of an unknown hotel that was off the strip. But I was very pleasantly surprised at the Orleans. It was a very large property with one of the larger casinos (I was told) in Vegas. The staff was very pleasant, efficient and I felt taken care of. I know everyone can have a rotten day but for my seven day stay here I have nothing but excellent ratings for the front desk, bellmen, Frank the pit boss, my room maid, the spa staff, and the wait staff at the café and Mexican restaurant were wonderful. Oh, wait a minute, one bartender at one of the casino bars was a jerk and people in the box office were not exactly pleasant. Oh well, that’s life. But then again even the Orleans ever present security staff was really nice. Sure, the Orleans is not the Wynn, but for an economical hotel the property had a lot of amenities. I was surprised that they had lot of kid friendly entertainment (seventy bowling lanes, 18 movieplex, and a large video arcade). The spa and gym was better than most hotels in its price range and the pool area was nice, large and QUIET! Other casinos should take note that if we customers can get relaxation away from the noise and smoke of the casino we will be refreshed and ready for another session in the casino. Thank goodness it was not like other properties that have music blasting at poolside. The Orleans also had top acts in the showroom, football in a large indoor arena and a lot of restaurants. The buffet’s food was mediocre at best but the café and other restaurants were just fine. The wine and liquor shop had amazing prices for a hotel lobby. The rooms were more than adequate and smoke free. The window in the shower was nice and kept the bathroom feeling fresh. Oh, and the shuttle to the strip (every 15 mins) was great. Bravo Orleans, you won a new customer!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Majda
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is a wonderful place to stay! They offer free shuttle service to the Gold Coast and Bill's (on the strip), so it is possible to visit the strip without getting involved with the horrible traffic. The casino at the Orleans is huge. Plenty of slots and tables. We stayed 4 nights and, on the last day, discovered one whole section of machines near the poker room that we hadn't even seen before. The room and bed were very clean and comfortable, and the service was wonderful. In the future, I plan to split my week between here and the Golden Nugget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - good freebees!”
Reviews.Author: ToonTravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a total of 10 nights over a 14 day period in April 2007. Took advantage of their Mardi Gras package three times for $50 per night plus tax including 2 free breakfast buffets and 2 free dinner buffets. Fun books contained loads of freebees including drinks and discounts off the on-site restaurants and cafes. I've stayed here several times over the last few years and I've never been disappointed. Hotel rooms are spacious and I've always found them to be clean and well maintained. Used the shuttle bus to the strip once and found it a bit more organised than it used to be. Ate in TGI Fridays a couple of times and it was good, and had a few sandwiches from Subway which was also good. I wouldn't rate the dinner buffet, its OK (especially if you get it for free), but I couldn't fault the breakfast buffet, even if I was paying for it, its great value for money. Rented a car for 14 days, and found that the commute to the strip was no bother at all. Parking at this hotel is a dream compared with the strip hotels, not far to walk get into the casino or to the rooms. To sum up, this is a great hotel with great prices (if you can find a deal) the security at the hotel is good - you have to show your room key to take the elevator. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone wanting clean, affordable accommodation without the mayhem of being on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “All we needed and more”
Reviews.Author: ukdryver
Reviews.Content: Our 9 night stay at the Orleans was at the back-end of April 07. We had booked the room on their website 9 months in advance and got a rate of $87 per night. We arrived around 13.00 on Sunday 22nd April 07. There was a line of people waiting to check-in, but after only 10 to 15 minutes we were heading for our room. The check-in staff were polite and business-like. There was security checking your key card before you entered the lifts to your room. The room was spacious and clean. The bed was gigantic and comfortable. The room was slightly dark and needed the lights on most of the time. I was impressed with the excellent free safe. The one-cup coffee-maker was poor with weak coffee. Most of the time the room was quite enough, although on a couple of nights there was some noise from some other guests around 4.00 am. My only gripe was the loud climate control unit. It would kick-in every 25 minutes or so and the noise occasionally woke us up. We eventually turned it off on a night and was not too warm. Obviously this would not be an option in summer. The pool area was very nice and we always managed to get beds. The area was in the shade of the hotel until 12.00. We had a car so didnt use the free shuttle. The casino was a bit tacky but o.k. I didnt notice any smoke. Seattle Best Coffee offered a nice cup from $1.50. The buffet was excellent charging $6.95 for breakfast. They will make you an omelette with your chosen ingredients at no extra cost. The cinema was comfortable with a good choice at $9.95. The location of the hotel is not ideal. With a car it is not a problem. It took us 10 minutes to get to the strip. Overall, I would say that this is an excellent hotel for the price. I would give it 10/10 for value.

Reviews.Title: “Being Off-Strip Has Advantages”
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my second visit to The Orleans quite a bit. The room was spotless each day. Our rate was fantastic after I assembled a couple of packages from their Web site. Look under "Packages" for rates of $109 total for two nights, and two breakfast and dinner buffets. Those four buffets alone are worth more than $42. The hotel was full or nearly full each day, so planning saved me quite a bit. Gambling was good for me. I was patient, playing $10-20 a hand at a $5 table and walked away with double my buy in. Video poker was also rewarding overall with several winning hands, but none of the elusive royal flushes I envision. Only one would pay for my whole trip. The hotel was running a buffet promotion offering 75% off to people paying with their casino points, so we ate one night for only a $5 tip. That was a nice way to break in my companion, a Vegas first timer. I cannot call her a Vegas virgin since she is my mom and that makes me shudder to even think about. She was hooked after that, looking for all the free play and 2-1 deals she could find. Hearing her complain on the last day about the lack of luggage space for her freebies was funny. Before the trip, I had reserved an 80-minute massage at Spa Orleans for my mother. She appreciated the special attention the spa's staff gave her. This allowed her to keep up with me for several long days on the Strip. Returning to the late night specials in the Courtyard Cafe ($3.95 steak and eggs!) was a welcome way to end a day. We used the hotel shuttle several times. It still goes to the Strip (stopping outside Bill's Gamblin' Hall on the Flamingo Rd side). The free shuttle is much more organized now. There is a line for people to queue in and the driver drops off everyone before allowing new riders to board. If you have a rental car or can navigate an easy combination of the shuttle and the city bus ($5 all day), the hotel's location is no problem. In fact, I find it an asset to find a place not overrun with kids and people from other properties doing the walkthroughs seen so often on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: calgaryGirl25
Reviews.Content: Went to the Orleans April 15-17 tagging along with my boyfriend for his convention. This hotel was nice, didn't really smell like smoke and the room size was pretty decent in size. The walls were a bit thin and I could hear people yelling in the hallway early in the morning. I really liked that there was a window in the shower stall, it was refreshing. Didn't try the buffest but went to TGI Fridays - which was pretty good. I liked that there was a Subway in the hotel for an inexpensive lunch. The shuttle was great, it took about 5 minutes to get to the strip and it was frequent (every 15 min.). I would probably stay there again if there was a deal on or when I'm much older and want to stay away from the crowds on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: cuckoosnest2004
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is the best value in Las Vegas. We stayed there 4/15/2007 - 4/19/2007. I have prevously stayed at Luxor and Aladdin and it is just as nice as either of those. I am influenced by the fact I paid $51/night and received 4 free dinners and 4 free breakfasts as part of my package. My alternative was $179/night at a decent Strip hotel. The specifics: Larger than a basic Strip room, received a Strip view upon request, everything was well maintianed. Note., we leave the room at 8:00 AM and return after midnight, so I am not someone who is obsessed with a luxurious room Casino - great for a low-roller. Always able to play $5 BJ, $5 Craps, etc. Drink service is great, but the the drinks are weak. I won everyday at BJ, broke even on slots, and saw a few people win jackpots of over $1,000. However, my wife lost $600 on slots for the week, so it is no better, no worse than anywhere else. Food - very good for a moderately priced meal. We ate at aladdin's buffet (still the best IMO), and the Orleans can't compare, but it is not bad. Specifically, if you subsist on meat, chocolate cake, and ice cream as I do, you will enjoy it. If you are looking for great shrimp cocktail, crab legs, and seafood, head for Bellagio, Wynn, aladdin, etc. The Orleans is better than Harrahs, Luxor, IP, etc Staff - very friendly and attentive. Some people don't like the fact they require you to show your room key eveytime you get on an elevator, but I have no problem with that. Drinks - as mentioned, pretty weak. I include the drinks I bought at casino bars, not just the complementary drinks. What has happened to Las Vegas. I had drinks at Bellagio, Aladdin, Flamingo, NYNY, and TI this trip and only the Flamingo gave a decent drink - and it wasn't what I had ordered! Shuttle - I never rent a car in Vegas (because I drink) and - yes - the Orleans is not as convenient as being on the Strip, but the shuttles were doable. Essentially, we took them to the Strip once a day and then back again. We also used it to go to the gold Coast - the Orleans sister property. Shows - this time we saw Mystere. I booked online 4 months earlier and got front-row center seats. They involved a few guests in the show including my wife. She ended up dressed like a clown and riding around the stage in a clown car, so my experience was probably different than most people I think it is a very good show, but I wouldn't see more than one Circe De Soleil show because I think they are all similar. We have seen the Rick Thomas Magic Show at Orleans and it is a great way to kill an afternoon if you have kids or get cheap tickets. Overall - If you rent a car or don't care about not being on the Strip , the Orleans is a great value. It's certainly the equivalent of most Strip hotels. If you are a first-time visitor to Vegas, spend the extra $$$$ and stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “No bed bugs while I was there”
Reviews.Author: Randi59
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best off-strip hotel I've visited in Las Vegas. I was a little freaked about a previous review about bed bugs. I checked my bedding and awoke with no critter bites. My room was clean with a spacious bathrooms. And I appreciated the shower cap included with the toiletries. I did not smell any old smoke odors. I booked my room for Wednesday-Friday on Southwest Airlines website and paid $52/night. I ate at the French Market Buffet . Service was excellent and the food was surprisingly good for the $16 dinner price. For higher end cuisine go to the major hotels. Minor peeves: At check-in they hit you with an additional $5.00 convenience fee with does not include internet access in your room. You have to go downstairs to a business center for internet access. My window fan was noisy as all hell. I ended up keeping it on all night instead of having it cycle on and off with the heater. The salad bar at the French Market Buffet was below average. Areas of Improvement: If the bed linens at Orleans were like South Point this place would be off the charts!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: mdelam
Reviews.Content: Our room was spotless! It was much larger than a regular room almost a mini suite! Not even dirt behind the nightstand. You not only get the usual shampoo conditioner and lotion you also get a welcome bag with a razor, aftershave deoderant and gum! Plus you get a great coupon book for lots of free stuff and discounts. The hotel is not on the strip but they do have a shuttle service that will drop you off on Las Vegas BLVD. Even the casino is spotless. The staff is very freindly and helpful from check in to the restaurant and the housekeepers! I would recomend this to anyone who wants to go to Vegas and get the same if not better room and service for 1/2 the price of those on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Davylynne
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews on this hotel before going, and it lived up to my expectation. Its not an expensive flashy place, but really cheap and value for money. The rooms very lovely and big, nice comfy beds clean bathroom good air con. The casino was airy and un smelling of cigarettes which was great. Pool was nice, all in all a great place to stay for little money. Going back again this year

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay Off Strip”
Reviews.Author: myinfo
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay Date: Stayed the 2nd week of April 2007 (2 nights) Hotel: located about 1 to 2 miles from strrip. Theme: New Orleans. Mid-size Casino, with movie theater and a large bowling alley. Shuttle – they have a free shuttle that takes you to the strip or their sister property the Gold Coast Casino. I took this many times to the strip the Gold Coast. At the Gold Coast you can walk (a mean a short walk) to both the Palm and Rio. Check-in – check in was smooth. We checked-in at 12 noon and our room was ready. I asked for a strip view which was granted. Upon check-in we received 2 fun books which we used about 4 of the coupons. Example: free souvenir at gift shop (Mardi Gras beads), free fries and soda with purchase of hamburger at Terrible’s inside casino. Great burgers. Also used the free drink a bar coupons. Room – The room was very nice. 2 queen beds, large dresser, full length mirror, desk, couch, side chair and coffee table. (Regular standard room) Room was very clean. We had a view of the strip. The strip is in the distance, but you could see the strip from Bellagio to Mandalay Bay, beautiful at night. There is actually a window in the bathroom over the tub. Nice to get fresh air in the room. Luckily it was cool in the mornings and we wanted to open the window for fresh air, instead of the hot Vegas weather. Housekeeping was very good and the hotel staff were very friendly. Coffe Maker – you actually have a coffee maker in your room, which is rare in Vegas. But, they do have a $5.00 resort fee per day which includes all the coffee you can drink. Security – You must show your room key to access elevators to your room. I liked this. Food – the best. I ate at the lunch buffet twice, it was only $8.95. My husband must of ate 6 plates of crawfish. Terrible’s hamburger were also very good. Liquor store – the prices are no higher than your local liquor store and about half of what they charge on the strip. After always staying on the strip, it was nice to stay in a hotel that had reasonably priced food, etc. Slots – I finally won a few dollars here. I never bet big, but put in 20 cents, and hit the bonus round on some corny slot machine. The bonus round paid me $77.00. The next day I wasted $5.00 trying for another bonus round, but no luck, so I walked away. I enjoyed my stay, but if you are a first timer and can afford it, I would stay on the strip my first visit. I have no complaints and would stay at the Orleans again. If you want a clean and affordable place to stay I would recommend the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: vxssgurl
Reviews.Content: After travelling what seemed like forever to reach Vegas from Melbourne, Australia, we checked in to The Orleans without any bother at all. Bell service bought the bags to our room when we were ready for them - excellent, and very polite. We initially had a problem with our shower, and got it sorted. Yes, it took a little time, but we checked in Sunday afternoon, so I can understand the delay. Solved the issue by requesting (and receiving without any questions) a new room. Room was spotless, and spacious. Bathroom was divine. Shower recess included a window so you could still enjoy the view from the marble tiled enclosure whilst you washed away the dust of a day on the strip. Didn't use room service - there were far too many restaurants both within the casino itself, and on the strip, to warrant it. Check out was amazingly easy. Staff were always courteous and friendly - couldn't ask for more really. There is a free shuttle that takes you to the Barbary Coast - two minutes walk around the corner from the end of the strip (Paris end), so getting in and out of the Strip was simple. Would definitely stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - pool closed w/o 4/9”
Reviews.Author: francine
Reviews.Content: We were at the Orleans 4/9-4/12 with 2 kids (11,14) & uncle from Calif. - we had booked a few months back - asked specifically About the pool - YES - it would be open., When we arrived pool was closed for the week - my kids were so disappointed as well as us. They said we could use the pool at the Gold Coast. So we took the shuttle there & what a disappointment - pool was very small. Kids were bummed. The Orleans did give us a $25 COMP at either buffet or cafe - I ran into the Casino Mgr & he didn't even know the pool had been closed - he gave us 2 movie tickets. Our bathroom smelled like sewer, light bulb by bed broken & my uncle had to vacate his room at 4a.m. because there was some leak. Yes, it is a good price - but my philosphy is - YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR! vEGAS HAS CHANGED TREMENDOUSLY IN THE PAST 5 YEARS & WHEN I HAVE TO PAY $4 FOR A SMALL BOTTLE OF WATER AT THE BAR (THEY WOULDN'T GIVE ME A GLASS OF ICE WATER AT MIRAGE), I SAY THERE ARE ALOT MORE VACATIONS OUT THERE.

Reviews.Title: “Who needs the strip?”
Reviews.Author: lestoby
Reviews.Content: We go to Las Vegas once a year around Easter to meet friends and this is my preferred place to stay. We drive from San Diego, so we always have a car and our friends from Texas always rent a car for their 1 week stay. We stayed 5 nights the week after Easter and arrived at 9am on Sunday and they allowed us to check in to our room early (unlike the Tropicana and the LV Hilton). The price was $60 per night and a $5 resort fee per day - why not just call it $65 per night and remove the so called "fee". The Rooms: We requested a room near the elevator and were accomodated nicely. The rooms are large and have a nice sitting area which allowed us to visit our friends. The bathroom has a large dressing area by the sink and the toilet and tub (full size) are in another semi closed room (no absolute privacy between the two areas). There is no refrigerator, but we always bring an ice chest and fill up with the ice machine located by the elevators. Some rooms have safes and others do not. I quit smoking 9 months ago, so this is the first non-smoking room I have been in for this hotel, and I believe they are decorated better than the smoking rooms. Elevators: You better move pretty darn fast to catch them on the ground floor as the doors close pretty quickly. We never had to wait very long for an elevator from the room floor, but try to avoid during peak checkout times. You might have to let 3 elevators go before you get one that can take on more people, especially if you are on the lower level floors. So the key to reserving a room - Close to elevator, nonsmoking, and upper level floor. The Pool Area: Adequate and the jacuzzi is a large circle surrounding a rock formation. Some jets are powerful and others so so. The jacuzzi could be warmer, but they allow kids under 12 to be in the spa with adults, so they probably keep it cooler to avoid liability. Unfortunately, the closed the pool on the day that we chose to go for repaving, but they did keep the spa open. Casino: HUGE! and lots of penny slots. I do not play the tables, so I can't tell you much here. Pretty slutty costumes on the cocktail waitresses. Even my husband found this to be more offensive then I did. I thought about applying for a job as a cocktail waitress just for giggles. Oh, but I did win $80 playing Keno - Yeah! Restaurants and bars: Friday's is good, Canal street was good for the prime rib (overpriced), Cafe was extremely slow and turned out to be $30 for breakfast for two (outrageous), the buffet was disgusting for $6 for breakfast (avoid at all costs) and they do not serve tomato juice. Bloody Mary ordered while playing slots was pretty good! Rock/Pop band that was playing in the casino bar was entertaining, but not great. A couple of years back, we heard a great band in the Irish Pub. Elvis impersonator was more funny than talented. Showroom: We saw the Temptations (only Otis is original) and they were fantastic for a couple of old guys - way more energy than my 20 year old kids. I ordered the tix online before leaving home and the original cost was $60 for seats in the 5th row. They did allow me to use my 2 for 1 discount from my funbook (you get one with checkin) so that was really nice. The accoustics in the shworoom could use some improvement, but the seats were comfy and lots of leg room, plus they do provide drink holders - you just have to bring your drink in before the show starts.

Reviews.Title: “Not horrible but could make some changes”
Reviews.Author: RacyGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the hotel, late March through early April, 2007. Check in was a breeze (it was a Thursday) and no penalty for early check-in. We asked for a refrigerator which they said would be delivered very shortly but was being delivered by the time we reached the room. All the staff were kind and helpful with the exception of the Business Services person who was a bit short with me both times I spoke with her. Rooms were clean and in good shape with the exception of a couple of stains on the carpet and and sink stopper that was broken. My two real complaints would be the noise in the hallway. You can see light around the door from the hallway and therefore hear every little sound and being Vegas people are coming and going at all hours, and the bed, though firm had one side that sloped down so you felt as if you were sleeping on a hill. Made my back hurt.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans-A great off-strip value.”
Reviews.Author: Mike_48128
Reviews.Content: Great hotel value. Use the free shuttle to the strip. I noticed that a few visitors to The Orleans couldn't find the free shuttle. It is from the front of the hotel near the sign. Instead, they went to the rear exit, and paid $15 for a taxi. No one told them!!! Always ask at a hotel's front desk. Many properties in Vegas have free shuttles, but you sometimes have to ask (for directions) in order to find them. The Orleans has a decent buffet. Breakfast is very reasonable, and lunch and dinner are ever better. The rooms are large and clean. The pools are o.k. but the hot tub is great! The casino has a good variety of slots and sometimes they are loose. It seems to vary from day-to-day. Drinks are plentiful. It is a good property with a middle-class clientele, a lot of amenities, and (if you get offers) sometimes 1/2 the price of strip hotels. Since the free shuttle runs twice an hour to the strip until Midnight, it is a good value. The fun book, for hotel guests only, saved us a lot on money on shows at the hotel, and free wine with dinner! We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A+ all the way”
Reviews.Author: plymouthLVfan
Reviews.Content: Best trip to Vegas I ever had. Booked 3 rooms for 5 people. Got everything we asked for. Pool area was great. Rooms large and clean, not worn out. Hotel had everything and met all needs. Even the slots gave lots and play time and a win once in a while. Rick Thomas was great, got my brother up on stage. Had a 12 year old with she loved the hotel and had lots for her to do. I will stay here again!! Price was cheap compared to strip hotels that are in worse shape. Had a car travel was easy. Great job Orleans

Reviews.Title: “a bit away from the strip but .....”
Reviews.Author: memfizgirl
Reviews.Content: We didn't want the congestion and crowding of the strip, and were a little uncertain of the Freemont area - so we stayed at The Orleans. The location was fine for us as we had a rental car, but a good ways for those who plan on walking. Supposedly there is a shuttle but since we had no need for this, didn't get any further info. The rooms are HUGE! Very nice decor, clean, nicely done. We had a beautiful view of the mountains in the distance, and the small window in the bathroom that actually opened provided a nice breeze. The casino has a movie theater and bowling alley among other attractions, which is a nice break. The mexican restaurant (can't remember name) was spectacular with great margaritas! overall, we had good service, a good room at a good price. No complaints - at all.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel off the strip giving some hotels on the strip competion”
Reviews.Author: shakaalohagirl
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay @ this hotel despite some negative reviews of this hotel. This is a must for family friendly hotels off the strip with a variety of things to do. The swimming pools and jacuzzi are shallow-great for children & adults too, got a large bowling alley, & above average buffets. I throughly enjoyed my stay-5 nights and this hotel is HUGE and very nice for a moderate budget. Warm decor in the hotel rooms and even aromatherapy is pumped in the A/C- nice lime/lemon scent. I hardly noticed smoking in my hotel room. The clear disposable cups in the rooms didn't bother me & personally I think they're better than real glassware since they're disposable. I would recommend it to anyone looking to stay at a hotel/casino off the strip with almost the same amenities of a 5 star hotel on the strip. Shaka-aloha girl

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Experience”
Reviews.Author: mattdyl
Reviews.Content: I usually don't take the time to write reviews but, I just had to share my experience at The Orleans Hotel & Casino in Las Vegas. Not only was the price exceptionally low, but if this hotel was located on the strip, it would be right up there with some of the pricey ones. I've stayed before at the Mirage, Alladin, & Monte Carlo, which are about 3 times what The Orleans cost, and quite frankly the room at The Orleans was far bigger and nicer. The Hotel itself is huge, with so many attractions that you almost don't need to go anywhere else. I wouldn't recommend walking the streets around there at night but, they have courtesy shuttle service to the strip and back until midnight. We also rented a car at the airport with Budget, and that was wonderful! The service was phenominal and it only cost $196 for the 3 days with full insurance coverage. Getting around Las Vegas was very simple and all hotels have self parking & FREE valet service. I would highly recommend doing this. I'm only sorry I didn't do this the last 6 times I went there. So in conclusion, if you're looking for a great hotel & are, or aren't, on a budget, be sure to stay at The Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: helene308
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Orleans and were very happy with everything up until we discovered our room was literally infested with ants. Came back from the pool to discover them all over the night table, along baseboards, on couch, etc. Yuck! Called front desk and they had us moved to a room on the other side of the tower in less than 15 minutes so kudos for that. But that really took a shine off our stay! There also seemed to be a septic problem because there was an overwhelming stench on our floor for a while. Don't know that I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: alias2_u
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans hotel from Monday March 12 - Friday March 16. I purposely chose an off-strip hotel as we were staying with 3 kids. We had a car so it was not an issue for us. Check in: Very quick - maybe 10 minutes. Asked for strip view and got a room on the 18th floor. Asked for a crib and got it right when we got up to our room, very quick. Room: The rooms here are nice. We were in room 1808 which was a really long walk from the elevator, but didn't bother me. The room had 2 double beds that were really comfy and a sitting area with a couch, chair & coffee table. I was really surprised by the size of the room. Very nice. The bathroom was ok, just average with regular tub & shower. Didn't really dig the sliding door, but oh well. There was also a desk area with the internet connection that we didn't use. Entertainment: What we used was the arcade, which was adequate, but not fantastic. It had a really small one by the bowling alley and a little larger one by the movie theater. The bowling alley is really nice and big. We had 4 people bowling 2 games with shoes costed $17.50 (this was with a coupon from the book they give you at check in). Bowling is $1 between 12am & 8am though so if you are up...We did not see any movies, but the theater was really nice and huge. Pool: It was March so pool hours were only until 6pm. The big pool is nice and big. It is only about 3-4 feet everywhere. It was not heated, so it was a bit cooler. There were stairs all around the pool and kind of a ledge that kids could walk on in the pool around the edges as well. The kids pool was great. It was a small circle and was heated - this meant lots of adults hanging out in there as well. It was a wading pool around the edge and then the middle had some stairs and went a bit deeper. This pool is in the sun all day until about 4pm so put sunscreen on your young ones! The other pool had shade for more than half the day. The jacuzzi was really nice. It was a circle with a large tree and rock/fountains in the middle so you didn't see the people on the other side of you. Spa/Fitness: I only used the jacuzzi & steam room. I didn't have any services done. This is separated for men and women. Not many people in there when I was there. The steam room was really hot as was the jacuzzi. This was a free area. There were separate shower stalls and a nice dressing area with all the things you need. They have water bottles in there as well. The gym was really nice as well and didn't cost to use as I know some do. Business Center: It had an area for faxing, copying etc plus 4 computers with internet access if you weren't using a laptop. No charge for this. Restaurants: We only ate at the French Market Buffet. We were gone most of the time. Hubby and son ate breakfast once and really liked it and we also did lunch & dinner on 2 separate days. Lunch was similiar to dinner in my opinion, dinner just costed $5 more. $13.95 for dinner & $8.95 for lunch. I thought it was very good. Casino: I only play slots so not an expert. Lots of 1 & 5 cent slots though. More than I have seen at other places. I thought it was fine, not too smoky and the waitresses seem to come around fairly often. All in all I thought the Orleans was a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Deal, Sometimes You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: tbrowntx
Reviews.Content: Orleans is clean and the room deals are great. It's not on the strip but we already know that! The buffet is cheap and a great value. Lots of locals here. The service is unpredictable, there can be lines for any service here. If you book with an offer code, keep your confirm #s, a copy of your mailed or emailed offer, and ASK QUESTIONS - they don't always tell you how to redeem things. We got inconsistent information and I'm still not sure my $50 free food was free! Corporate needs to state everything in fine print if necessary when they send offers... Slots run hot and cold - there are plenty to try.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: Brookshall
Reviews.Content: I had to book 9 rooms for ourselves and our employees and after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, decided to book the Orleans. The staff was wonderful during the booking process as complicated as it turned out to be. Wanted all rooms together and they said they could accommodate us. The rooms were large (14 of us watched the super bowl in our room), extremely clean, beautiful views, and the beds were heavenly. We ate most of the restaurants and found all of them very good. (Loved the Mexican Restaurant.) Several people took the shuttle to the strip and others just grabbed a taxi. All in all, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans downhill.”
Reviews.Author: gigolo
Reviews.Content: Orleans has problems since it went corporate I have stayed there for 9 years, 2-3 times a year. Customer service manpower has been severely cut. several hundred people have been fired. Maintenance problems exceed the ability of limited manpower to correct same. Drink girls in casino have been reduced. 20-30 minute wait for a drink. Mixed drinks are watered down. Cashier cage manpower is a skeleton crew. 20 minutes to cash $500 worth of Trav checks. Reduced manpower at the registration desk. Bad decisions have been made in the name of profit for the stockholders.

Reviews.Title: “No Problems here Whatsoever!.... Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mlakeelmo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here March 2-5th. Flew Champion out of MPLS in a snowstorm and actually arrived early, got a rental at Alamo, and we were on our way.Arrived early at Orleans around 10 am on Friday, and wondered if we could check in early at the hotel. They said no problem, and I asked for Strip View, High, and they gave us the 17th Floor with a very nice view of the Strip. Room was clean, spacious, and was smoking, although I don't think you could tell. Overall, we really liked the Orleans. We had a car so there was no problem going where we wanted. Alamo gave us an upgrade at pickup, ( and this happens alot), all the smaller cars were out and they have done this before, just ask the guy in the lot to initial your papers for an upgrade and you are on your way. $100 for 4+ days, including taxes and fees. Back to the Hotel: CHECK-IN: No line, took maybe 5 minutes, checkout...no line took 2 minutes at most. ROOMS: Made up daily whenever we wanted an no issues. All have a couch, 2 chairs, and coffee table, in additon to the Bed, also, writing table. Bathroom pocket door a little cumbersome, but ok. CASINO: Lively, relatively smoke free, and smelled non casino like, if you know what I mean. Plenty of offers for drinks, although Fri and Sat nite are busier, we found it to be easy to get a drink. We play slots and they have plenty, along with a lot of penny slots, and some of the newer games. Overall they had more than most casinos as far as variety. We have a couple large casinos up here, that always have the newest games, so we know what to look for and what we like. We won and lost as much here as anywhere, and did not feel games were overly "Tight" FOOD: Buffet was okay, just had breakfast there once, not great but fine. Ate at TGIF in casino one night, and that was okay, waiter screwed up, but the food was good and convenient. Went to Ellis Island and had a 4.95 Steak Dinner one night and it was really good, mine was like a Filet Mignon. Tried a Metro Pizza just down past MGM a bit on Flamingo, and it was huge and fabulous. INTERNET: Only if you pay, I did not, even though I had my laptop. I think it was $10.99 for 24 hours, there is a cable in the room if you do not have wireless card Can't believe it will be much longer before wireless is everywhere, and free, it is almost like having a phone in room these days. That is one of my pet peeves. IN ROOM COFFEE: Only 2 paks of Regular Coffee and 2 DeCafs, each day, coffee maker makes 1 at at time. Suggest you bring some intstant or some packs if you want to make more without going down stairs to get it at Seattles Best in Casino. COUPON BOOK: A couple usable coupons, couple drinks, 5 bucks off at TGIF, and some fries and a drink at Terrible Mikes snack bar. Not great, but saved us a few bucks here and there. SECURITY / QUIETNESS : Always asked to show our card by gaurds as we got to elevators. Very Secure, and never heard a sound anytime at nite. Great for sleeping. PARKING: Parked our car right in front of Hotel everyday, never went to self park garage, had to search for a spot a few times, but never took very long, very convenient to hotel. WEATHER: Pleasant, Sunny days around 65 and cooler nights, around 45, bring a lite jacket or sweatshirt and maybe some shorts if you want for the days. This week is warmer and soon it will be hot. No Rain, just Partly Cloudy one day. PROXIMITY TO STRIP: A non-issue for us, maybe 5 minutes to the strip for us, and with the car, liked to come and go whenever. If you want to avoid the strip traffic, you can always head north on 15 and get off at whichever street is closest to where you want to go. PROXIMITY TO AIRPORT: Took us maybe 15 minutes from Alamo, which is just a couple minutes from Airport. When we left from Mandalay Bay, we dropped off car, and were on Alamo Shuttle within 15 minutes, this during rush hour. Very Easy to get there. OTHER: First time here and we would stay again, almost everyone was friendly and the hotel smelled fresher than most. Not ovely glamorous but very nice and comfortable. Paid $336 for 4 days with air from MPLS, so it was a really good deal I think. Flew Worry Free MLT. Sorry for the long review, hate em' but hate short ones too!....Overall, very satisfied and would go back again. Especially at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bargain in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Peup
Reviews.Content: This is the best kept secret in Las Vegas. We were there for a family winter retreat and there were 14 of us attending. Other than it being the same time as a cheerleading competition, I'd say everything was excellent. Okay, everyone knows it isn't on the strip BUT that is the nicest part. The strip lately has become one big zoo. If you've been to Vegas before and "have seen that, done that" on the strip then this is the hotel for you. Very easy getting in and out of the parking garage (ground floor) and accessible to the "back roads" to access other properties without having to do the strip route. Very spacious, rooms are big and spotless. I love the assortment of slot machines throughout the large casino.' The table games are good and we enjoy playing Pai Gaw poker here; especially when they have the $5 tables in the morning. The pit bosses are very friendly and nice too. The Courtyard Buffet is the biggest bargain of all! Always delicious food, good service and the variety of food at each meal is great!! We did have lunch at Terrible Mikes and I think that is way too expensive for what you get. You are better off just going to the buffet because you can eat as much or as little as you want and it includes your beverage as well. Comps are excellent and we will be returning in the summer since we have enjoyed staying here for several years now.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Brady
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Orleans hotel the weekend of the 24th and 25th... the hotel was nice, not the Bellagio but it was not bad.. rooms and bathroom were big, nice view of the strip or the mountains if you ask.. its a little far from the rest, but getting around wasn't a problem.. They have a shuttle at the hotel that takes you to the Barbary Coast, from there you can catch the Monorail which starts right inside the adjacent Flamingo hotel.. from there you can visit any casino you like.. At the Orleans, we ate breakfast at the French cafe.. lunch at the Courtyard.. TGIFridays for dinner ..all very good... sisters went bowling, and to a movie which are also in the casino.. the theater is very nice and the bowling alley is huge! good bands, nice atmosphere, staff was friendly.. the only bad was the sink was backed up and it had a smell coming from it, we called the front they sent up engineering to fix it and gave us a free breakfast... the smell went away and breakfast was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great off-strip experience!”
Reviews.Author: postlaurie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Las Vegas for New Year's and we stayed at the affordable Orleans Casino and hotel. Of course all prices are higher for the new years eve weekend but the Orleans was still very reasonable. Its a mile or two from the strip but a nice walk if it is warm out. Even though it's off the strip the Orleans is huge and has everything in there you might need. There are plenty of dining options from casual fast food style to the fancier Canal Street Market and our personal fave: the Prime Rib Loft You must try the Prime Rib Loft, its set above the hustle and bustle of the casino and the food is quite good. The staff is what really makes your experience though both in the restaurant and everywhere in the hotel. Staff treat you like gold they are so nice! I left a tip for the maid and it took 3 days for her to finally take it! So sweet. Also they treated everyone the same we noticed whether they looked like a high-roller or a penny slots player. The front desk upgraded our room to a strip view since it was our first time there. What a nice touch, I recommend a strip view room here because its far enough back you get a great view of the whole strip at night. My only complaint: is drunk people in the casino and at the table games. Not sure if this is an American thing but the sort of behaviour I saw would NOT fly here in Canada, as such I was offended at times. Men so drunk they couldn't stand let alone place bets and forget having your personal space! I suggest the pit bosses don't let this go on it may lead to trouble! In all a wonderful time and I will go back there soon!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice with few drawbacks.”
Reviews.Author: grg1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans for 5 nights in late January. This was a comp hotel stay from winning a spot to play in the Orleans World Championship Horserace Contest. The hotel room was very large for las vegas, and the beds were comfortable, and the room was very quiet. The food in the restaurants was reasonably priced and very good also. The only drawback is the location. We had 8 people along on the trip, and all the rest stayed on the strip. I would not stay at the Orleans again, but only because of the location. The shuttle service to and from the Orleans is quite good, and a taxi ride averaged out to 12.00 per way. I spent more money on taxi;s than in the slot machines. Overall it is a good hotel, just a bit too far for my liking.

Reviews.Title: “Access to occupied rooms!! ants and poor response”
Reviews.Author: ang066
Reviews.Content: Hotel is Ok but understaffed with no visible leadership we arrived Jan 3rd and were waiting 1 hr to register. Then we got sent to a room at 2300 that was occupied and the guest was naked and shocked at our intrusion! we were not to impressed either. next room was ok but we had to change rooms after being invaded by ants all over the dresser and in our belongings. So we were moved BUT not up graded we visited 2 rooms one occupied again! and one designed for W/c access. not fair to take this room as they are hard to find W/c rooms. The last room was OK. we complained about the problems but were unable to locate management no apology or compensation offered for our vacation interuption. BIG CONCERN!! was: I wonder too about giving access to occupied rooms is this how YOU and your valubles are cared for?? Boyd took over the orleans etc recently and they are not too great. I Also Iwould not stay there again as going and coming from the strip is a pain

Reviews.Title: “Still a Great Property, But....”
Reviews.Author: exsingldad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2/19 to 2/22/07 in Room 1702. (Smoking King Room with Strip View) Things have changed a little since we last stayed here in January 2004, but still a great property! There is now a "Resort Fee"of $5.99 per day for the 2 little cups of coffee you get in your room, and the Hi Speed Internet access is $10.99 a day per computer connected. The hotel expects you to be able to help yourself, but service is still first rate when a request is made. Casino slots are tight, buffet is still great for any meal, and an excellent value. Room was clean, well maintained, and had all the amenities one expects in Las Vegas. Noted that there is no longer any smoking allowed in the restaurants, but smoking is still allowed on the casino floor. Valet service OK, large parking lot always had room for the rental car. Courtyard Cafe still has great food and service for the money, a step up from Denny's. It's our favorite property, and we will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I always love the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: johnny_07656
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is considered a "locals" casino/hotel. In other words, supposedly it is more patronized by locals from Las Vegas. This is usually a good thing, and is definitely a good indicator in the case of the Orleans. It is one of the best values for the money. The rooms are beautiful, in a kind of French style, and they are pretty big, with a sitting area made up of a couch and coffee table. there is also a desk and chair in addition to the bed(s). The dining options and entertainment are very down-to-earth but not what I'd call "cheap" or "low-class". Very middle-class, actually. Good, reasonable restaurants. The buffet is very good and very inexpensive, quite possibly the best or one of the best buffet values in all of Vegas. They have a very nice bowling alley which is inexpensive and they typically give you a coupon for it in their Funbook. The Funbook coupons help you to save a few bucks in the various hotel establishments from the bars to the gift shop to the bowling alley. They have a coffee shop (Seattle's Best, I believe) and a few decent bars. The service at the gambling tables is great. The gambling itself is very good, with quality, experienced dealers and every gaming option, but low bet minimums compared to most casinos in Vegas. The biggest downside is the location, as the Orleans is located several blocks away from the strip on Tropicana Ave. To get anywhere else requires a taxi - nothing is "walkable" unless you don't mind walking for about an hour. However, they do supply a shuttle service for free which will take you to their sister hotels, including the Barbary Coast which is at center strip. Of course, you can also always get a taxi. It seems that most people who stay at the Orleans have a car (their own or rented). I have only stayed there when I have had a rental car. This hotel is very much like its sister hotel the Gold Coast, which is several blocks north on Flamingo Ave. The theme is a New Orleans theme, and this hotel is bigger than the Gold Coast, and has a little more entertainment (such as the bowling alley and a huge arena where events such as sporting events and rodeos take place). The rooms are a little nicer and bigger here also. The Gold Coast does have a better location, though, being right next to the Palms and Rio, and only a couple blocks (a short, cheap taxi ride) from center strip. If you have a car, the Orleans is one of the best deals you will find, they typically have among the lowest rates in all of Las Vegas. Don't let the cheap price fool you, this is a quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal on a great casino in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: hondotank
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in late January, '07 for $35 a night. I have gone to Vegas 2x a year for the last 12 years. This is my first stay at the Orleans and it was as good as I hoped. Check in was fast and efficient. I asked for a strip view and was told no problem. We had the 12th floor, great view, wide window. Rooms: nice and spacious. Very good mattresses and pillows. Also had a couch, coffee table and chair plus a desk. Bathroom was nice and clean. Decent tolietries. I liked the little push out window in the shower- allowed the fresh air in. Sliding door between the bath and bedroom was heavy to move. Not a problem to me but maybe to elderly visitors. They should work on the door tracts. Security: always someone there to flash your room card too. Housekeeping: willing to provide more coffee. Great job cleaning the rooms early in the day. The one cup coffeemaker was a bit primitive but hey, most casinos don't even provide one. Casino: very nice, fun atmosphere. Nice New Orleans feel about it. My buddy and I both seem to have great luck at video poker there. He got 2 royal flushes at 1 grand each. Seem to be many good machines there but I would like to see more 10-7 machines there. I like the $5 blackjack tables with good dealers and 2-1 blackjack payoffs - a vanishing feature. Good poker room. Very popular. We had a 1 hour wait till some room was available. Wish they had more dealers/tables. Eats: always like the Buffet, especially the stir-fry where you pile veggies on your plate, hand it to the chef and he cooks it on the big Mongolian grill with either beef or chicken. The Sushi place looked good but didn't go. I think there are at least 8 eateries there. Parking: I like being able to park out front. I made the mistake of using the valet the first day. I had to wait 15-20 minutes for someone to bring the car. Overall: for the money my favorite place in Vegas. I love the Golden Nugget as a hotel but the gambling just isn't as good as here. Yes the Orleans can be smokey but no worse than any other casino. A great value with a great atmosphere. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: deltarudy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Orleans in Las Vegas, I just wanted to say that the hotel was great. Clean room and great staff. My only complaint is the cigarette smoke on the gaming floor, however our room was on the 19th floor, so we could not smell it when we were in our room. The breakfast buffet was very good, the dinner was okay. Koji resturant was okay as well. The Orleans is on the top of my list the next time we are in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Coupons, Great Time”
Reviews.Author: lebowski2222
Reviews.Content: This place was great , since car rentals are so Cheap in Vegas, we decieded to stay here and just rent a car to go to the Strip,Downtown and other places. I thought this property had everything but it had the feel of a local casion which i loved, it wasn't all hyped up with Cirus Shows, Fancy Clubs and 4 Star Restuarants. It's a great place for the Average Joe and it's much better then the Strasosphere, or Sahara on the Strip I will definetly stay here next time

Reviews.Title: “Coupon Book was Awsome”
Reviews.Author: peggymalone
Reviews.Content: The extended family all stayed here. Everything we needed was right there. No need to go to the strip. My twenty-something son stayed with me and we enjoyed the comfortable room and the spa. The price was very reasonable and included free drinks, french fries, beads from the gift shop etc. Would stay again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “have yet to recieve room credit as of 01/28/07”
Reviews.Author: vicintexas07
Reviews.Content: this was my first trip to las vegas and decided to stay at this hotel because ann margaret was perfoming there which i also had a ticket to see her. after i checked in at the front desk and checked into my room. i went online and saw that the hotel had charged my credit card a room tax of $ 152.60 on 11/03/06. 11/03/06 was the day i made the reservation for a 3 day stay during thanksgiving weekend. when i saw this amount on 11/26/06 i went downstairs to the front desk and spoke with a blond haired woman about the problem and she indicated that when i checked out of the room and the room was clean is when i would recieve my room tax credit back to my credit card. here it is 01/28/07 and have yet to recieve the credit. i have sent the proper paper work to visa for a billing dispute. i will not never stay at this hotel again. be warned people.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Rick Thomas magic show!”
Reviews.Author: MrsPhim
Reviews.Content: I agree with all of the positive reviews! One thing I will say from the beginning since barely anyone mentions it (and probably didn't actually experience it), the Rick Thomas magic show was great! You get a Buy One, Get One free showroom ticket in the Fun Books that you get when you check in, and so the magic show was only $24.95 for two people. I felt bad because at the time that we went, the audience was so minimal but the show was SO GOOD (theater was only about a quarter full, don't know what was going on with Vegas then, but even the strip was empty in the afternoons). Anyway, the show is in the afternoons, when we went I think it was only on Mondays, Thursdays, and Saturdays at 2pm and 4pm because I think he did shows at the Gold Coast too. It was a great show for families, adults and kids, and when he gets audiences to participate it's pretty hilarious especially with the adults. The vanishing motorcycle illusion was astounding to me! And everyone loved the tigers. After the show, he and his team offer things for sale like DVDs-$10, a book, plush tigers-$10 for small, $20 for the big one (he's an animal activist), and he will sign autographs and take pictures outside after the show. We bought a tiger but I wish I also bought a DVD. Anyway, if you stay at the Orleans, definitely go see the show. =) The hotel was very nice, our rooms were great, and bigger than a normal hotel room and it did have nice touches like the southern/French Orleans decor. The air/heater was loud at night though! And fewer channels here (lots of horse racing channels though if that's your thing) but bring a DVD player if you have kids, the TV has AV hookups. You could also bring your own video game system and hook it up to the TV. Anyway, the buffet was good, all of the servers were very nice. Everyone had a nametag that stated their name and what country or state they were from, which was nice. My husband liked the poker room, it was non-smoking. The only thing we didn't like was that you had to go through the casino to get to everything - all of the restaurants, buffets, showroom, and even the things on the second floor (bowling alley, video game arcade, children's day care center, movie theatre, etc.) could only be accessed by going to the escalators right in the middle of the smoky casino. Overall, it was a great stay, and this hotel is close to the strip but still driving is recommended. It is family-friendly (except for the smoke), lots of kids around, but I think many of them were local families (there was a Disney on Ice show at the Orleans Arena during our stay). We will definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: holeinthehead
Reviews.Content: Reception: Got a cool reception on checking in, despite having paid in full we had to pay another $5 a night "resort fee" which gave us unlimited local and (get this) toll free telephone calls, access to the gym and coffee in our room. I would expect coffee in the room to be free in any case and I feel that while $5 isnt really a lot of money it seems to be a racket, as most out of tonwners wont be making may local calls or visiting the gym that much 5/10 Room: At the end of a long corridor, but was of exception size as was the bed. dated design considering its only 11 years open but the bed was very comfy and we were just using the room to keep our bags and lay our heads 8/10 Food: Courtyard cafe: reasonable service and reasonable food at a reasonable price 7/10 Terrible Mikes: Truly truly terrible, avoid 0/10 French Market Buffet: Had a poor lukewarm breakfast here 5/10 Drinks: Bars were well stocked and reasonable the cocktails at the bar were fine but it was obvious that the cocktails to the slots and pits were well under strength. Shuttle Bus: Handy to get the to strip to and thankfully not full, but i could see issues with it during peak seasons. Cabs from the strip are about €10 plus tip Casino: Very tight slots as others have stated, we did much better in other casinos than in the orleans. Found my particular blackjack dealer rude compared to some of the staff in other casinos Static Electricity: I must have been me but i was constantly shocked in the hotel, i think it was down to plastic carpets and my kinetic energy watch Cinema Nice 18 screen cinema with tickets costing 9.50 a head. a nice break from the casino The orleans is away from the bustle of the strip and the hustlers (who tried to hand me cards for escorts despite being arm in arm with my girlfriend) it was our first time to vegas and next time we will stay on the strip however, i would recommend on for a first time visit to stay on the strip first the orleans is for the experienced vegas visitor, also the age group of most guests ( in jan 2007) was mid 50 plus, something to bear in mind if you are younger Overall 6.5/10

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans is Declining Fast!”
Reviews.Author: Crocodile1
Reviews.Content: I've been a loyal fan of the Orleans for over 6 years; averaging at least 30 nights there for each of the past 2 years. They were purchased by Boyd Gaming Inc. and they took over as of 1/1/07 and the property is in fast decline. Most won't notice the changes right away, but they are coming fast and this once tremendous property is fading away thanks to the new owners. This hotel used to be one of the last great values in Vegas, but not anymore. First, they have added a $5.00 per night "resort fee", which was never there before. The prices on virtually everything in the hotel/casino have gone up; even (I laugh) the old 75 cent hotdogs have gone up to $1.50. The valet, which used to be one of the most efficient in Vegas, is now a 20 minute ordeal to pick up your car. And another example of the new owners making cuts which are not customer-friendly are that they have replaced the real glass glasses in the rooms with plastic Motel 6 disposable cups....classy touch.... Many of the employees and management of the property are complaining because of cuts of benefits and pay; along with a serious fear of layoffs. This is already resulting in an understandable lack of service quality from one of the formerly great understated service teams in the casino industry. I hate to have to write a negative review of a property that I used to love so much, but the place is declining fast and I wanted to warn other Vegas veterans that this is no longer the great place it used to be. They will not get a dime of my money again.

Reviews.Title: “thanks reviewers/writers and trip advisor”
Reviews.Author: dickdeeds
Reviews.Content: Thanks, to the writers of the good reviews to the Orleans and trip advisor, we wouldn't had known to stay there. We had previously stayed at the Rio and Bally's. Trusted the reviews, and everyone, all 5 people, were impressed. Loved all the restaurants, of which there are many. Canal Street and Pime Rib Loft are a must for a nice dinner. Exceptional casino food, on your break from the action, mornings and afternoons. Disappointed Brendan's Pub doesn't serve food anymore, was looking forward to fish and chips. Casino slots were fun and the attendants accommodated us over and above. Try the new pennie machines, lots of fun and laughs. I know people say, " I dont play pennies" but at $3 for max coins, it isn't a pennie machine at all. We had the most fun on these one day. Cocktail waitresses, muy bonita in their skimpy outfits, and many throughout . $5 blackjack was fun untill we ran into a hot dealer, but the dealers were very nice. Poker room and sports book on site are nice. I play poker, on-line, and never played in a casino. So i entered a daily tourney of 68 people for $40. finished 6th and in the money, heyhey. Took 5 hrs. ,learned a whole lot and won $265. The Poker room is non-smoking. I really didn't want to write this review. It's like a good restaurant, when you find one, the minute anyone raves about it, the line is out the door and down the street.

Reviews.Title: “A good buy but sort of far”
Reviews.Author: GoldnDogLover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans for 3 nights in January 2007. We had a room with 2 queen-sized beds. First the good things: the room was large, large enough for a sitting area by the windows with a loveseat, chair, coffee table, and end table, without feeling crowded. It was nice to be able to sit somewhere other than on the beds! The window in the bathroom opened so we could get some fresh air. The decor was modern, not a frill in sight. Our room and the hotel were very clean. The floor we were on was quiet, and even though there were people in the rooms on both sides of us, we didn't hear a thing. The beds were comfortable, some of the best we've had in LV. The staff was friendly and accommodating, and security was good. The not-so-good things: the restaurants were reasonably priced, but the food was not as good as at other LV hotels. We were particularly disappointed in the buffet. A couple of cab drivers had told us that the Orleans buffet was one of the best in LV. It's quite inexpensive, so for the money, I suppose it is. We also ate at the Courtyard Cafe and the Prime Rib Loft and the food was just okay in both places (other than the dinner salad in the Prime Rib Loft, which was large and delicious). The bathroom in our hotel room had a pocket door rather than a normal door, which would have been okay, except the closet and the vanity sink were inside the bathroom. If the pocket door had been installed to enclose the shower and toilet, with the vanity and closet outside, it would have been fine. The main drawback was the hotel location: it's about a mile and a half off the Strip. There is a shuttle but it seats only 18 people. We ended up taking cabs back and forth; with what we spent in cabs, we probably could have stayed on the Strip. If you're renting a car, the Orleans is a very good place to stay. Otherwise, spend a little more for a room on the Strip and save on cabs.

Reviews.Title: “no hesitation to return”
Reviews.Author: wilfj
Reviews.Content: just a fine hotel with excellent rooms and restaurants all at a reasonable price. The shuttle service is every half hour to the strip, about an 10 minute ride. This is a very clean establishment through out. They have their own theatre on site and the arena is right next door. On registration you receive 2 coupon booklets, which includes 2 for one tickets for several shows, free bar drinks and specials at several of the restaurants. We used the booklets almost every day. Unfortunately, like most of the casinos there is no area set aside for non smokers in the gaming area. .All the restaurants and several floors in the hotel are non smoking which real helps. we'll be back on our next visit !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: tromboner
Reviews.Content: Vert nice and spacious room, excellent price, convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: docozoo
Reviews.Content: Second time that we stayed there will be happy to stay there again. Corner room on the 12 floor,large well appointed room, clean, no smoke smells. Lifts worked well. Signed up for emails from hotel and was offered a room for $25 a night from this system. Off the strip but shuttle service is good but there are two shuttles so make certain that you get the right return shuttle that takes you back to the orleans. Ate at the buffet on steak night and was given wine with the meal and a full bottle to take away included in the price. Will eat there next time. Two poor points. Very RUDE woman in thier club room service and the charge for more that one coffee per stay using the coffee maker in the room is unfitting for a hotel of this quality.

Reviews.Title: “still a good value”
Reviews.Author: happytails
Reviews.Content: we rolled the dice and booked a priceline vacation about a month in advance. worked out to be an ok deal as rising air fare was offset by low hotel demand on what turned out to be a snowy MLK day weekend. checked in at 11pm on thursday. waited about 15 minutes and was given what i'd asked for: smoking king, high floor, "good view". we thought the spacious room was very clean, tv just ok, water pressure low. the non-locking bathroom door a little creepy, and the open-closet-in-bathroom was odd. room service quickly fixed a problem with breakfast, which was pretty good. the orleans charges $5 per guest a day for use of the spa whether you use it or not, so we did. we only used the hot-tub and sauna, but the facilities and staff were great. the valet got a little crowded when we were coming and going, so the self parking was nice. getting to and from the strip was easier than we had expected. if you prepare beforehand, using the back streets and freeway make zipping to the north strip a breeze. the subway restaurant inside the orleans was worse than in most gas stations, but we only tried it once. checkout was easy at 4am on a sunday! overall, a very good value, especially if you rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Doug_19
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans Oct 22 to 27th. This was my 6th visit to Vegas and first off the strip. Food: Wide variety and all very well priced. French Market Buffet has a good variety and very reasonably priced (less than $10 for lunch and dinner). I’ve not found a buffet on the strip for this price at this quality. Prime Rib Loft was excellent low prices and great food. Recently added a TGI Fridays to this hotel which was nice as well. Pool: The Pool looked nice although I did not spend a lot of time there. The problem being that at this time of the year (Oct) the pool does not get a lot of sun as the tower of the hotel blocks the sun. Only a small portion of the pool had sun late in the afternoon. Gambling: Always able to find a low limit game. They even had $3 Black jack and always $5 games. The poker room was always busy however lots of good players and lots of locals. Not a good poker room for a friendly tourist game. Cocktail service was good both at the tables and the slots. Never had problems getting a drink. Dealers at the low limit games were friendly but mostly had heavy accents as they were all imported Americans. Rooms: Rooms were very clean and very spacious. They had a small couch and chair and were very open. Beds were comfy and maid service was prompt. I did not like the heavy sliding door on the bathroom. It was hard to open and close. I was surprised that the shampoo and soap bottles were generic and not been labeled with the Orleans logo. I did like that a security guard was at the base of elevator to check for room keys before getting in the elevator. Entertainment: The lounge acts at the Orleans were disappointing. The main lounge had an Asian cover band which was not very good. Brennan’s Pub was ok with live music late at night. Drinks were reasonable though at the lounges in comparison to the strip properties. Shopping: The Orleans had a liquor store with unreal prices. A ’60 of rye, rum, or vodka for less than $15 and 18 packs of Budweiser for $9.99. For Canadians do your duty free shopping here! Overall the Orleans was great and I would definitely stay at this hotel again if it were on the strip. They do have a shuttle service which was very nice to get back and forth the Barbary Coast. The room rates were excellent but I would pay the premium to stay on the strip next time for convenience purposes. If you are looking a great value thought this hotel will more than do the trick.

Reviews.Title: “A Vegas steal of a deal!”
Reviews.Author: TxGrrl
Reviews.Content: Well after doing A LOT of research about Vegas (thanks to this site) I decided on this one because of their kid friendlyness and price. My family and I stayed here during Christmas of 2005. I originally reserved 3 rooms (for 8 people) thru the website for 50 dollars a night. After 2 weeks I found a cheaper rate on a travel website and called them back to see if they would match the rate. THEY DID! I got all three rooms for a week (Mon-thursday) for 18 dollars a night (per room)! The friday rate was 74 dollars. Just our bill (my husband and mine's) was 150 dollars for the entire week (with room service!) The hotel was gorgeous, an antebellum style New Orleans hotel with lots of amenities and things to do. A person could literally stay for 2 weeks and never have to leave the hotel. We had a great time, we stayed on Christmas Eve playing Black Jack till 3am! The only drawback is the amount of smoke in the casinos. My sister got pneumonia shortly after that and bronchitis. Yucky. That's anywhere in Vegas I guess though. For people with kids, we saw the Kids Daycare play area, it looked like fun. I think you can drop your kids off for a couple of hours for 6 bucks an hour or something while you go gamble. We had our daughter with us, but since we had so much family we opted out of leaving her in there by herself. We went and saw a movie, that was great too, the theater was lovely and big. The rooms in the hotel were huge! There was a cute little window in the bathroom where you can see the view of the strip. I am including some pictures of my sisters king bed room with bathroom. We all had rooms with a partial view of the strip. Choose the Orleans for your stay, its about 1 mile off the strip but if you have a car you will be so happy with your smart choice!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Value”
Reviews.Author: stl_cardinals
Reviews.Content: My "above average" rating is based on the cost of staying here. Compared to the bigger/nicer casinos...this place is okay. First, the good: 1. Rooms are big with a nice little sitting area and spacious bathroom. Although I'm not too fond of the closet space being in the bathroom. 2. The food choices are good and reasonably priced.
