Compared to prime rib, mexican, italian and buffet choices on the strip...this place matches quality while maintaining a good price. Buffet was especially good for the money. My dish at the Mexican place was okay, but I'm a Mexican junky that has pretty high standards in this cuisine. 3. Very attractive coctail waitresses with very nice outfits. 4. Great drink service both at the bar and on the floor. This place wants to keep you drinking on the cheap. A buzzed player makes more mistakes than then sober player. I can attest. 5. The liquor store was cheaper than most I've seen anywhere. This was great for me since I was here 5 nights and not a big gambler. The not-so-good: 1. The slots/VP were tight. I didn't gamble hours on end, so it could of just been bad timing. But most times I have lost money at the casino, I am able to do so at a comfortable place. I would go on horrible runs here, and it happened too frequently. I was always under the impression that off-the-strip equaled better odds. Didn't seem that way here. 2. The casino had a bit of a stale smoke smell. The newer casinos do a much better job at filtering out the smoke and pumping in a nice fragrance. 3. The new LV law doesn't allow smoking in eating establishments. The Irish bar chose the smoking over the eating, thus eliminating a menu. 4. No other casino to just walk over to. But this was known ahead of time, and was likely reflected in their low rates. 5. Lack of nightlife. The Irish Pub was practically empty. There was a band playing music in the casino but that was about it. The choices were to gamble or eat. ---Overall, a great place for a bargain. Especially on a long stay. But if just for a couple nights in LV, I would rather buck-up and stay at a nicer place with a better atmosphere. But I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Orleans was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: vegas_lover
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed there between X-mas and New Years. Our stay was great, check-in was quick and very helpful, the buffett was outstanding, and the customer service was outstanding. I have stayed there several times before and I will not go anywhere else. I have been completely happy with each stay. We have already booked a return trip in May.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: xant14
Reviews.Content: It's a little out of the way of the strip, about 1/2 hour walk, but there is a free bus that takes you to the sister hotel on the strip. Once your here though, there is nothing the hotel hasnt got, it has loads of dining places, the games and slots etc. And the rooms are great, massive rooms, a couple of queen sized beds, big bathroom, tastefull and clean. I recommend the $2.99 new york steak served between 1am and 7am, the graveyard shift. I enjoyed it that much at 1am, that i had it for breakfast at 6.30 the very next day (1st day there, bodyclock was screwed up!). I stayed at a few hotels in LV, and I know there are probably better, but this was the best one I stayed. And that includes Circus Circus on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans was just fine!”
Reviews.Author: teachrsue
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Orleans on an email offer for 50% off room rates. We were there from Dec. 21st-27th. There was no wait at check in and we were quickly in our 10th floor room with a view of the strip in the distance. Being on the 10th floor was great as it was the first and last stop for the elevators. Our room was near the elevators with no problem of traffic. The one side of our room was the storage for the maids and this presented no problem as we were usually up and out by the time they went on duty. Our room had a king size bed and a sitting area. Maid service was always completed before noon each day and they did a great job! The casino was always busy. There were low limit tables most of our stay, but no luck on BJ. Slots were up and down, a lot of play time, but no major wins. Lots of food choices available. We ate at the Prime Rib Loft, very good nice atmosphere, Don Miguels, good Mexican and great Margaritas, Terrible Mikes, good for a quick bite, Big Al's Oyster Bar, huge portions and great food, the Coffee shop, great graveyard specials, so with that and other choices, you won't go hungry. The buffet was okay, we only had breakfast one morning there. The shuttle is an easy ride to the strip or Gold Coast. We had a car and it was easy to navigate back roads to get wherever we wanted to go. Orleans will get our business again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: lookingforanswers
Reviews.Content: We were there for 4 nights over Christmas 2006. Arrived on Sunday night around 8 pm. No lineup at check-in. Asked if there were any upgrades available and the girl said she could give us a room with a strip view at no charge. Great! The room ( #1622) was quite large and had a great view of the strip. The windows were not very clean however and there was a 1 foot wide stain on the carpet. It had been clened but still. The room was very clean, I don't think they have cable TV because the choice of channels was limited. However, since we didn't spend much time in the room, it wasn't a major problem. Bathroom was fine, just a regular tub but good water pressure and I hated that wood sliding door they have separating the bathroom from the room. It was very annoying. Other than that, really can't complain. The hotel is very big and it took us a while to get acquainted with the layout. There are several restaurants in the hotel itself, an italian place called Sazio? where we had a very enjoyable meal the evening we got there. We also had a breakfast buffet ($6.95)that had a lot of choices for meatlovers however they mostly had canned fruit and the only fresh fruit available were overripe bananas. If you want regular or whole wheat toast, you still have to line up at the counter where people are ordering omelets etc.. and it can take a long time. I don't know why they just don't put in a toaster and people can help themselves. There are also several other restaurants including a Subway and Seattle Coffee and an ice cream place. When you check-in, you receive a coupon booklet with several discounts at the various restaurants in the Orleans and coupons to other restaurants & bars in the other Coast Hotels. About the service: Service at this hotel was great throughout. From the cleaning staff to the waiters at the buffet, everyone was very pleasant and helpful. About the shuttle: It is great that there is a free shuttle to Barbary Coast. That brings you smack in the middle of the strip. We never waited more that 10 to 15 minutes for the shuttle. It runs from 9:30 am to 12:30 PM. The only major problem with that is, like other people have said before, there is no designated line or bus stop, so that when the shuttle comes, he stops anywhere and people just start going in. Most tourists are respectful and will let you on before if you had been waiting before them, however, there are sometimes when people will just cut in and if you don't speak up, you may be left waiting for the next shuttle as there are only about 18 seats on the shuttle. There's a sign that says that you must show the room key in order to get on but we were only asked to produce the key once in the more than dozen times we took the shuttle. All in all, a very good experience and great value for the money, even though it is off the strip. We would usually leave the hotel around 9 am and spend the day on the strip before returning around 5 Pm to rest a little. Then we would go back to the strip to catch a show and if we didn't make it on time for the last shuttle, we would grab a cab. P.S.: You cannot hail a cab just by raising your arm in the air. They will not stop.The best way to get a cab is to go to a hotel and get one from there. We learned the hard way !!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Good But Beware the Slots”
Reviews.Author: tradermanny
Reviews.Content: There has been a change in ownership of The Orleans and it appears that the cost cutters are trying to squeeze a few pennies from as much of the operations as possible. First, we are like many Orleans regulars who travel here from out of town. Our first few times in Las Vegas, we stayed on the strip. Then we discovered th Orleans and we now use it as our primary resort when we travel to Las Vegas. We have stayed here 7 times now. This trip, we stayed several nights at the Orleans and a few on the strip. Here is my thoughts. First, the really bad... The SLOTS are TIGHTER than trying to get a raise from Ebeneezer Scrooge prior to Christmas eve! This observation was made after days of play and is not based on my viewpoint but practically EVRYONES viewpoint. It seems that the Slots have been severely tightened up. We also played at the strip at several properties there and the amazing thing is the much better payouts we experienced on the strip than compared to the Orleans. AGAIN, this observation is based on many hours over several days of play from not only myself but practically everyone we discussed this with who played around us. The Orleans Slots ARE TIGHT! We and others who have chosen to stay here in the past always felt that we were much smarter to stay and play at the Orleans rather than staying on the strip. But after this last experience we will reconsider staying here in the future. A message to the new owners...if you have tightened the slots up it will take other people a little longer to notice but they will. So your "Cost Cutters" always look smart in the short term but if they ruin the superior value expereince that made people choose the orleans in the first place....well long term people like us wll not choose to stay and CERTAINLY NOT play the slots here EVER again. I cannot believe I am saying this but if I stay here again, NEXT TIME I will play the slots OVER ON THE STRIP!! Another cheapy cost cutting move appears in the free drinks. VERY WEAK. Did I say VERY? Also, A waitress had to seek premission to get me a "Double"..... Good Grief. Again, when we compared the drink quality to the quality of drinks we got on the strip, THERE WAS NO COMPARISON. The Orleans drinks were terribly weak in quality. This never used to exist on the previous trips here. Also noted in the spa were other cost cutting moves including the hot tub where the temperature has been turned down a few degrees (it used to be blazing hot)...The timer on the hot tub only goes for 15 minutes (Used to go 45) so therefore the cost cutters made me get out of the tub several more times each trip than before. Furthermore the steam room......You used to open the door and steam would come roaring out....NOW I could barely see any steam and I did note some guy coming out and searching the walls trying to find something to turn up the steam. Other observations: Front Desk - Very good. Accomodating and reasonable with our request. Security - -excellent....Maybe the best in vegas as those guys in front of the elevators are fully engaged and making everyone show their keys to proceed further...24 hours a day. Good job. Dealers & Pit Bosses -- Very good again. Genuinely very friendly and had a couple engagements with Pit bosses who were very professional in their dealings. Excellent all around. Cocktail waitreesses - -Excellent!! There are a couple exceptions here and there but the majority of these girls hustle like crazy and work their tails off to keep me very well liquored! Maybe the greatest strength of the Orleans? Rooms - Very good. Clean. Housekeeping was excellent. Buffet and cafe were also both very good. Those people in the Buffet really hustled on the busy nights. The buffet is lucky to have employees like these who worked really hard to take care of the overwhelming crowds. Overall....The employees get an 8 out of 10 for service and most of them try really hard to take care of your needs. Finallly....Can you guys get the shuttle line situation resolved? It is always a free for all if there are more people than seats. It is ridicoulous that people who were waiting 25 minutes cannot get on because the shuttle driver stops in various places and poeple who showed up right before he arrives get on the shuttle before the people who were there for 25 minutes. This happens all the time and adds strees to what should be a strees free time. Why have you not (after all these years) fixed this situation with a white line on the curb or a simple sign that says "Shuttle lines starts here"? - This is so long overdue.

Reviews.Title: “TRANSPORT TO STRIP NOT A PROBLEM!”
Reviews.Author: pganfield
Reviews.Content: On reading previous reviews, one of our main concerns was with getting to the Strip. Having been to Las Vegas several times before, we decided to check out the bus timetables (CAT Transport) online, and found that buses ran regularly along Tropicana Avenue. There are bus stops right outside The Orleans Hotel costing only $1.25 one way, and stops at the MGM, and you can return on the bus at the New York New York Hotel. The bus ride takes about 5 mins. Can not be easier! If you wanted a cab, this costs approx $6 plus tip! to MGM. Once at the MGM, you can catch buses to take you up and down the strip once again $1.25 per trip. This was the first time that we hadnt stayed on the Strip, and we will never stay on the Strip again after staying in the Orleans Hotel. The atmosphere at the Hotel was so friendly and personal, the staff could not do enough for us and other guests were equally friendly. Food was great, especially the steaks at the Prime Rib Loft, we have smaller joints of beef for Sunday lunch!! We would definately stay here again, without hesitation. P. Ganfield - UK

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: ncford70
Reviews.Content: I got a hot fare alert from Travelocity stating that the Orleans had a special for $25 per night during the Christmas holiday. I immediately assumed that it was too good to be true. Much to my surprise and delight I was able to book a room for the dates that I wanted with no problem. I'm a skeptic by nature so I assumed that there would still be something wrong so I began reading the reviews to prepare myself for the worst. Again I was surprised by the number of good reviews. Check in was a breeze and the coupon book mentioned by other guests in the reviews came to be very helpful and saved me money. My room/suite was large and very clean, I requested a top floor with a view of the strip and was granted it without incident. All in all I can say that I was very pleased with the room, especially for the low low price of $25 per night. The only complaint that I do have is that the walls are thin and you can hear everything going on in the hallway, ie kids running in the hall, housekeeping knocking on other doors at 8 am and holding conversations with one another while cleaning (I recommend utilizing the do no disturb signs unless you want to be woke up at the crack of dawn). A few reviews mentioned that the casino was full of smoke but it was no worse than any of the other casinos on the strip. I took a shuttle to the hotel from the airport for a mere $10 for a round trip ticket. The complimentary hotel shuttle to and from the strip ran like clockwork and I was always able to get a seat but I can imagine it's worse during peak seasons. A cab ride to or from the strip will run about $10 with tip and a rental car was unnecessary unless you want to venture away from the strip, I suggest you save your money for gambling or shows. The food at the hotel was less than stellar, even the food at Fridays was sup par and the Italian restaurant was only so so, Terrible Mike's makes a great burger and is made to order so you know it's fresh. They also have a Subway on site for a quick bite. I would suggest eating at one of the nicer hotels on the strip if you want a really great meal. The Liquor store had great prices and a large selection. The bowling alley is HUGE with plenty of lanes and there is an arcade, daycare, and movie theater all on site and reasonably priced. . Great it you have kids in tow. Overall I was very pleased with the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “love the orleans”
Reviews.Author: smizo
Reviews.Content: heres my review of the wonderful orleans in las vegas CHECK-IN waited about 5 minutes were very couteous and obliged when i asked for room with strip view even though i had only paid $25 per night! ROOMS very clean,spacious comfy beds large bathroom wonderful view of strip FRENCH MARKET BUFFET excellent so much so that this is the only place we ate at in this hotel.our server was always attentive with plenty of refills and the food was excellent quality and at prices about half of those on the strip LIQUOR STORE this deserves a mention as it was so cheap!! a large vodka was about $15 for a huge bottle SHUTTLE we had no complaints about the shuttle the longest we waited was about 15 mins it drops you off right in the middle of the strip BOWLING we went bowling one night it was good value FUN BOOK some good coupons not just for the orleans but for other coast casinos all in all after staying in the jw marriott,venetian.carriage house,and paris i would highly recommend staying at the orleans especially if you get a fantastic rate as i did save your money for gambling or go and see LOVE which is fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “It's nearly a city..”
Reviews.Author: richbuck
Reviews.Content: Wife and I and youngest daughter spent 4 days at the Orleans. Had a wonderful time. We went bowling in the hotel.. they have over 60 lanes. We saw the magic show... very good.. We saw a couple movies in the hotel.. there is 18 movie theaters inside. My 11 year-ol daughter says that the arcade totally eclipses the Circus Circus facility. The rooms are spacious with a sitting area so you won't have to spend all your time laying down while in the room. There are 15 restaurants inside the hotel... we ate at 6.. All very good. Get up before 6am and you can get a great breakfast for $2.50 in the Courtyard Cafe. If you have the time, take the Grand Canyon Trip offered by Papillon. Very reasonable pricing if you look around and a super value for all they provide. And of course, great gambling... All and all, a totally great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain-Basement Price”
Reviews.Author: kacinhouston
Reviews.Content: My 4 friends and I stayed at the Orleans December 13-17. We had 3 rooms, 2 of which I booked through vegas.com for 4 nights back in August for $25/night and the 3rd I booked directly through the hotel in November for 3 nights at $110/night. At that time, I was told the 16th was sold out, but when I checked in, I would be able to extend my stay. I arrived at 11 p.m. No line at check-in, but it took about 20 minutes to check in because I needed to book the additional night. A supervisor had to complete the transaction because the person who waited on me had problems with the computer system. However, they were very courteous and apologized for the delay. The supervisor was able to give me a lower rate on that room than what I had booked for through the hotel, and the room rate averaged $50 a night for 4 nights. My room was on the 3rd floor with a view of the Strip. The room was clean. The mattress was very firm to me since I'm used to a plush pillow-top mattress at home. Three of my friends told me their mattresses were very plush, but one told me their mattress had a dent in it. The pillows were very flimsy. The bedspread and blanket on my bed each had a burn hole in it. Otherwise, the room was clean. My room was 275 steps from the elevator near the end of a long hallway, so I didn't hear any noise from any of the other guests during my stay. The carpet in the hallway had a few stains from what looked like what had been room service trays being placed on the floor outside the room doors. We ate at Fridays the first night, and it was your typical Fridays. Very pleasant waiter. We ate at the breakfast buffet on Thursday morning. Mostly canned or frozen fruit on the buffet, but for the price, it was expected. I couldn't get the waitress to refill my coffee cup. She was too busy chatting with another one of the waitresses to wait on the tables after she brought the coffee initially. One of my friends realized that the desserts were available during breakfast, so she had dessert instead of breakfast. Thursday night we ate dinner at the Prime Rib Loft around 10:30 p.m. The service was excellent, and the food was surprisingly good. The prime rib was $13.95 and came with a baked potato and salad. We ate off the property for all our other meals. I played the dollar slots for 10 minutes in the Orleans and came out ahead $107, so I cashed out. The casino was no smokier than any other casino I visited during this trip. Compared to the Vegas of long ago, it seemed nearly smoke-free. I've been going to Vegas since my college days in the 70s, and I've always stayed on the Strip previously. I rented a minivan on this trip, and we valet parked everywhere we went, which was very convenient. The traffic on the Strip was very minimal compared to previous trips, but I knew to drive on the streets that ran parallel to the Strip at night to avoid the traffic when driving to shows. We also drove out to Red Rock Canyon, which was one of the highlights of the trip. In the past 30 years, I've stayed at most every hotel on the Strip when they were fairly new. Unfortunately, most of the hotels don't maintain their rooms as they age in the same manner that they maintain their public areas, which is a shame. These days I'd sooner stay at the Orleans and tolerate their stained carpet and burn holes and spend my money on shows, good food, and gambling rather than staying at a hotel on the Strip that seems more like a shopping mall than a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My home in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Petertm
Reviews.Content: I've been to vegas 6 times in total and the last 2 times have been at the orleans, overall for what you get the orleans is fantastic value for money, I first started going out to the orleans from the strip for the better video poker and the $5 double deck blackjack in the casino, that pays 3 to 2, try finding that anywhere at Wynn! As a result I started getting cut price room offers from the hotel things like $25 a night and your 4th night free including weekends , I never got any comps or room discounts from any strip hotel. I was reluctant about staying off the strip but thanks to the room prices I can rent a car and still pay less than staying at somewhere like luxor the location doesn't turn out to be that much of a problem and there is always the shuttle to the Barbary Coast in the heart of the strip if you don't want to drive, I do agree that walking is not an option. OK the hotel it's not the Bellagio and it doesn't try to be but the rooms are big and comfortable with a proper sitting area though the hotel calling them mini suites is stretching it, some peple say they've had trouble getting a non smoking room or a king bed room but I've always got the that combination when asked for and I've not noticed any sign of smoking in my non smoking room. The hotel as it caters to locals as well as tourists has a good selection of value restaurants that may not have a celebrity name head chef but are dam side cheaper, especially good are the Mexican, Chinese and the coffee shop which has excellent value specials, some have said the buffett is good but I disagree for a no frlills meal the coffe shop is much better I had a comp once for it and I'd say free is about the right price! Now when offered meal comps I always ask for the coffee shop! On check in they give you a fun book with coupons you can actually use and the pool is good though not quite like the uber pool complexes that some of the strip hotels and shading is a bit of a problem. Finially some people complained of poor or rude service I not noticed this at all in fact I've found the service the best I've experienced in vegas I've stayed at the Tropicana(old) Luxor(really small rooms!) and New York New York(really dark and dingy small rooms!) unlike the strip dealers remembered me from previous visits and the maids always were helpful perhaps people who complained never heard of this thing called tipping remember everyone in vegas needs tips to turn their poverty pay into something that will pay the mortgage so it's case of if you look after them they will look after you, it's just the way it is! So in summery if you want blow your mind luxery stay at the Wynn or the Veniatian but if you want a comfortable room a good price thats still reasonable convient location you really can't do better in vegas! (and I'm going back in January!)

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravellerMan
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in The Orleans from Thurs., 12/7 - Monday, 12/11/2006. We paid an average of $120. per night, with a low of $40. for the Sunday night and $150. for the Saturday night. (The National Rodeo Finals were in town during our stay, so another winter weekend should be cheaper.) When we arrived, we were confused about the location of the parking garage and how to get to the registration area from the parking garage. Registration took about 10 minutes, and we were issued an Orleans Fun Book, which saved us about $15 overall during our visit. Our room, facing south on the 19th. floor, was clean and spacious. Both queen beds were pretty comfortable, and the bed linens were in good condition. The bathroom was clean and spacious. We asked the maid for more towels and were given a handful of them! The heating/ac unit was a bit noisy, but I normally wear earplugs in a hotel anyway. The room was also a bit dark at night - another light or two would have been useful. The Orleans buffet is very highly recommended for an inexpensive meal - esp. for the $6.45 weekday breakfast! We did find that the Coast slots were extremely tight! We lost money at the Orleans casino and at the nearly Gold Coast casino. In contrast, we both won money in the Flamingo and Bally's on the Strip!

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans is the bomb!”
Reviews.Author: azmetfan
Reviews.Content: First of all the room is at the price the best in Vegas. Just came frome a 5 day vacation with the first night in Laughlin, (Aquarius), and compared to that it's like; Wynn VS. Motel 6. The rooms were large and very clean. The maids very helpful and sweet. Been to Vegas at least 15 times and never had a better time losing money. The best part was the buffet, especially the BBQ (out of this world). Had lunch buffet which was excellent, but the best part was that we ate dinner an 9:15 pm, and they close at 10, and it was still 100% better than Green Valley Ranch. By the way GVR was a work of art but the food was crud! I Would defintly go back and back and back>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>Oh yeah the beds were great , even if you don't sleep much..............

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Lewis37
Reviews.Content: In a city full of great value options this one stands out. I know that in vegas you can stay at a hotel for $100 that would cost $400 elswhere. We stayed at the Orleans for $35 a night, the room would have cost $175 in another city. Great room, very clean with lots of extras. The casino and restaraunts were too smoky and overpriced, but it's only a mile from the strip so we didn't stay in the hotel outside of our room much.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel - I have no hesitations in recommending it”
Reviews.Author: DeeLittleHobo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans for 5 nights in Nov. 06 and had a very good stay. The hotel is easy to find and good access on W Tropicana Blvd. The surrounding area is a little bit on the seedy side as there seems to be an abundance of adult shops and a gentleman's club (think strippers) but this is Vegas after all and if you are too prudish, then obviously you're in the wrong place :-) The Orleans has loads of amenities, like several restaurants, bowling alley, cinema, child care area, Orleans Arena, large casino, bars and a nice gift shop. There is also a liquor store that has very competitive prices. The room was big and comfortable with a sofa and coffee table which was nice. The bed was comfortable and when we asked for extra pillows these were brought up straight away. All the staff we dealt with were friendly and polite, and I must especially commend the security guys who patrol the parking garage who came to our rescue when our car battery went flat. We explained we were tourists from England and were having problems with our rental car. Straight away the security guy radioed in his colleague who came with his pick up and jump-started our car in a matter of minutes. They seemed like real heros to us!! The drinks were much cheaper at the bar at the Orleans than at other hotels on the strip. Two mixed drinks at the Orleans = average $9.50; 2 mixed drinks at Mandalay Bay = average $18.00!!!! The only negative thing I can find to say about this hotel is that the slots seemed very tight, but then we played at other hotels too and cannot sincerely say any of them wanted to pay that much. I guess it is all down to luck. So i have no hesitations in recommending it to anyone thinking of going there.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: balletgirl1980
Reviews.Content: The Orleans was just ok. I went there for a National Beauty Pageant. The room was a good size but I overlooked a dumpster. The spa in the hotel was terrific. The prices were very reasonable for a hotel spa. The sushi restaurant and mexican restaurant were also very good. The front office staff and the convention room staff were very unhelpful. This hotel is off the strip by a lot. Their free shuttle rarely came. Not fun in August to stand outside and wait for it. If all you are looking for is a casino with a clean room this is a good place. If you want to experience Las Vegas and the strip, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Everyman's Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnMarieGrumm
Reviews.Content: The entire family loves this hotel. They have great buffets. They have a bowling alley and a movie theatre. I love the gift shop. The place is very clean. It is off the strip and we always seem to have a view of the city. It is completely reasonable. We always stay at this hotel when we go to Vegas. We go there often.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: bs4u2c
Reviews.Content: We spent one night on our way back from California. There were five of us: two adults and three children (under age 11). The check-in process was quick and efficient. The room was nicely decorated and spacious enough for all of us, with the couch doubling as a bed for our youngest child. We ate at the buffet on Sunday evening, which was approximately $13 per person with no breaks for children. The food was average, but the service was below average (which is rare compared to several past visits to this buffet). The location is about 1/2 mile off the strip with quick access to the airport. I would stay here again and would recommend it to family and friends if you are planning on staying off the strip or are bringing children. We had a special internet offer at 1/2 price, which ended up being approximately $28 per night. At that price, you can't beat the accomodations we had.

Reviews.Title: “6 night stay at Orleans”
Reviews.Author: mjb225
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at Orleans November 5th to the 11th. We had stayed once before for only one night as the previous trip we were unable to get into Mirage on a Saturday Night. The first trip we were pleasantly surprised with our Stripview room. Unless there is a huge variety in room size, those that post that the rooms are small are insane, they are quite large. Anyway, this trip we booked a suite, which was less than a standard room at Mirage during the same time frame. We checked in to Suite 2030 and were overall very satisfied. It had a huge living area with a large sectional, dining room table, and a large wet bar, granite counter, and four bar chairs. The view behind the bar was of the entire Strip that is similar to the view from Ghost Bar at Palms. The seperate bedroom was also huge. The bathroom was nice, though basic in our opinion for a suite. Access to the suites on the 20th floor was by room key only, which was very quiet, no kids wandering the hallways. Huge and only complaint...when we booked we called Olreans to verify that the pool would be open during our stay and were told that it was. Well, when we got there it wasn't, except on weekends. I have sent a letter to management regarding our stay and the disappointment that this caused. I have not heard back from them, tho they have my home and email address. The weather that week was perfect for sunbathing, 80+ degrees and cloudless skies. Further complaint was when I spoke to the front desk supervisor, she simply stated she got an email a couple of days ago that the pool would be closed during the week. What we later found from another couple that we were able to use the pools at the Suncoast or Gold Coast. Too bad we didn't find this out until several days into our stay. This is information that the front desk supervisor should have shared but didn't. Obviously we were not impressed with her after that. As far as the casino, we really liked it. Yes, people are smoking there, and we are non-smokers, but we find it no worse than the smoke at Mirage, TI etc. I just read another review that said it was unbearable. I guess a Vegas casino is not for that person!! Anyway, nice low table minimums, $5 BJ and $1 roulette. A nice change from Strip Casinos where you often are hard pressed to find $25 blackjack. Drink service was fast and friendly, we were playing video poker alot and always tipped $3 for two drinks. This is apparently a good tip there as we were offered refills faster than we could drink them. Nice bonus, I hit a royal flush. Restaurants: The Courtyard Cafe was excellent, food was good and very reasonable. Good service. Don Miguels- Very good Mexican food. The coupon book at check in gives you a free Margaritta with an entree. Canal Street- Excellent food, we had a veal dish and King Crab legs. Too bad the waitress was terrible. For their gourmet restaurant, they should not use a waitress that would have been Marginal for Denny's. Room Service- Only had breakfast, very good food and great room service personnel. TGIFridays- Good food, just like all the other ones. We had the buffet once for breakfast, good selection, good service. Sazio- Pretty good Italian food and found great service. We have been to Vegas at least 40 times, having stayed just about everywhere, from 4Queens to Four Seasons. For the money, we have found Orleans to be a real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the family”
Reviews.Author: juxie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans from Friday Nov 24 - Sunday the 26th. After checking online for the cheapest rate, I called the hotel directly and they matched the price. We arrived early and they checked us in. Unfortunately they did not have two queens available - only a king bed. They said we could get 2 roll away beds (we were traveling with our 8, 5 and 9 month old), but it would cost an extra $15 a night per bed. I wasn't happy about this but what could we do. They told us to check back later to see if anything opened up. Luckily when we checked back - they had a 2 queen room - so we switched without a problem. The second room was darker than the first room, but it was completely smoke free (unlike some other smoke free rooms we have stayed in in Vegas) and large. It was also clean. no complaints on the room (especially considering it was MUCH cheaper than hotels on the strip). Had the breakfast buffet - good food and selection for $6.95 (only $3.50 for the kids). We didn't eat anywhere else at the hotel, so no comments on the other food. The tables had low limits (surprising for a holiday weekend) and the dealers were friendly. Tables were crowded - but not impossible to get. My older two kids LOVED the Kids Thyme. We dropped them off for three hours on Saturday night and they didn't want to leave when we went to get them. A couple of tips if you are planning on using the kids club. Make reservations. They were turning people away as they were full both Friday and Saturday night. You need to bring a copy of your child's immunization records (this is stated on their website) and the kids must have socks. The kids wanted to go down and use the pool and jacuzzi Saturday night, unfortunately it closed at 5:00 pm (it was open later the night before - my fault for not checking). On check out, the had added the roll-away to the bill even though we ended up not needing them. We called down to the front desk and they removed them right away. Overall - we found the staff extremely friendly and helpful and the hotel was fine. It isn't 4stars - but then again - we paid less than $100/night on a holiday weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Too Far from the Strip, Stolen Laptop”
Reviews.Author: MikeTA
Reviews.Content: I was planning on giving this hotel a rating of 2 after being there about 15 minutes. The hallways are a little shabby, and the location is just too far from the Strip to walk. There is a shuttle that runs from Orleans to the Barbary Coast, center Strip, every hour, but I didn't want to have to rely on something like that to get me back to the Orleans at night. I set my suitcases in my room and went down to play in the poker room for about three hours. When I returned to my room, my laptop computer was stolen, right out of its bag. I spent a few hours with security, filling out forms and getting next to no information. I walked away with a phone number to call for updates on their investigation, though they promised they would call me as well. It's been two weeks now, and I haven't heard from them, despite leaving several messages on the answering machine of the number they gave me. The rooms are good-sized, but the location of the hotel is lacking. And while I can't completely blame the hotel for the missing laptop, they're disappointing in their pursuit of it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: slots4fun
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at The Orleans Nov. 8-13, and absolutely loved it. I have been to LV 6 to 7 times, and this was my first time staying at this hotel. The room was large and comfy, even had a small sofa, chair, and coffee table. Housekeeping was excellent. A "Do Not Disturb" Sign hung on the door avoided the early 8am knock on the door. I love the slots, and found the machines to be very generous, especially the quarter triple diamond machines, 2 coins. My son was very lucky on the video poker machine at the bar. We ate at the Prime Rib Steakhouse, which was outstanding. Good food and good service. The Sidewalk Cafe is nice also, and reasonable. First time ever that I came home with the money I left with, plus some. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “We have a winner...”
Reviews.Author: Pete B
Reviews.Content: Definitely a good choice. Luxurious: No; Extremely comfortable: Absolutely. I got a good rate, so booked a rental car w/ the savings and drove to the convention center & strip everyday. You can park just about everywhere for free so that turned out to be a zero hassle. Plus 10 miles outside of Vegas is the awesome Red Rocks Canyon. That is a very impressive 14 mile loop road w/ loads of great hiking. I booked the 10th floor with a strip view. The view was okay but what I really liked were the morning sunrises from behind the Luxor. I thought that the rooms were spacious. And I did like that little window that opens from the shower. The casino was a bit smokey but I'm not a big gambler, so really didn't care. Front desk was very friendly both ways. Housekeeping deserved their tip. Good security inside and out.in the parking lot. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Got what we paid for at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Riobill
Reviews.Content: Here's a little history if you will bear with me. Booked the room directly by phone after checking other websites. As prices lowered I called and the operators always met the lowest price available. Keep checking internet prices after booking, it's a volatile market. Paid $55 a night after initial booking at over $70 a night for three midweek nights Oct 23-26 We have been to Vegas over 25 times in the last 30 years. First visit was to the Sands (now the site of the Venetian) and the Castaways Motel (now the Mirage) during the Rat Pack's reign, on the cusp of Howard Hughes early remake of Vegas. Each visit saw amazing changes. We have stayed at the old MGM (now Bally's), Imperial Palace, the old Aladdin, the Jockey Club, the Maxim (now gone), Harrahs, The Riviera, Bally's, The Hilton, Mirage, Rio, Venetian, in Mesquite (about 75 miles North of LV), and now The Orleans. In other words, from de luxe (Venetian) to de worst (The Riviera.) The Orleans fits in neatly in the middle, good value, good accomodations, fair food at a fair price. Lots of (empty) poker tables, only two 3 card poker tables, no Spanish 21, which is our favorite table game. The pocket bathroom door is impossible to close without loud squeaks at 3 AM. At my age (70) late night visits are the norm . The coffee shop is well located and pretty good. Here's a tip, get your breakfast coffee at the lobby Starbucks and carry it to the coffee shop. The upstairs Prime Rib Room is so-so but the price is right. Chinese food pretty good. Other reviewers have covered all the other restaurants and other amenities. As others have noted the parking is far from the room elevators. Security is on hand in the main elevator lobby but is ineffectual. A scuzzy looking character in front of us didn't show his keycard one evening. So neither did I. Neither of us was challenged. He didn't choose a floor so I did and we and he got off the elevator at my NON-SMOKING floor. He immediately lit up and parked himself on the floor lobby's couch to continue his loud cell phone conversation. About 10 minutes later I went out for ice and he was still talking and smoking. I went out again for soda a little later with same results. This time I said "This is a non smoking floor", as any one with a room there would know. He said "I know" and kept flagrantly puffing away. Not one to be ignored, I said "So why are you still smoking?" in my sweetest manner. Perhaps he detected some sarcasm when he retorted in a series of oaths. I kept walking but reported him (and the lackadasical lobby guard) to Security from my room. I checked later and he was gone. The moral, security is to make us feel good and just maybe deter the bad guys. Keep your eyes open. All in all the Orleans is a good alternative to downtown or the older cheap strip hotels. But don't think it offers luxury on the cheap. Comps are very hard to come by here if you only play the table games. We visited The Wynn which is just out of sight. Also loved the new Red Rock Casino. Wow!!!! Watch for specials, The Venetian is offering selected weekdays for $119 and Wynn for about $149 during Nov and Dec. Enjoy, and Good Luck

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go again”
Reviews.Author: susbat
Reviews.Content: We were there for two nights. Our room was large and clean. The hotel hallways weren't noisy. Elevators were fast despite being there during the PBR Finals. Food was good. Casino was clean. Staff extremely friendly and efficient. Really can't say enough about the Orleans other than can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Oh the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Matters
Reviews.Content: I debated the cost (and time) difference between a mid-range Strip property and the Orleans. A nice rate found on the Internet, and matched by the Orleans with a few perks, decided the issue. It was a good decision. Easy street access, fast registration, security, clean (and big) rooms, nice service and wait staff, solid exercise facility, good restaurants ... Lots to like for not a lot of money. The only downsides? No other properties within walking distance, smoke in the elevators and a fairly small poker room.

Reviews.Title: “Great room”
Reviews.Author: PHLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in October 2006. Booked a strip view room and what a view - right from Wynn to Luxor! Room was large and beautifully decorated, very clean. Hotel public areas nothing special - everything is off the casino which is very noisy and smokey, as you would expect. But at $100 for the room we couldn't complain. Didn't use shuttle to strip, used cabs - was $10 each way (with tip). Food and drink we had in hotel was average.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TRIGGERETTE
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans for 5nights, 1-5 nov. Was pretty scared as it was off the strip and only a 3star. Usually we only do 5star and always move hotels if the standard isn't as we would expect. Have stayed at the luxor, bellagio and venetian before and this time had booked the Wynn which is probably the poshest hotel now on the strip but I thought it is crazy spending all this much money for a room which we will hardly be in and the orleans rated 6 on tripadvisor with good reviews so i thought lets go for it and save £700. I am so glad we did. The Orleans was probably the same standard as the luxor but for a much cheaper price and even though a 5min shuttle ride to the strip it drops you off in the best location, right in the middle of the strip. we never waited longer than 10mins for a bus. Don't walk it would take ages. We got the whole 5 nights for £330 where all the other hotels eg aladdin and luxor and paris where around £700. The orleans had sold out on every website i checked for our first night stay but found a company called shilo inns that did it cheaper than expedia and was available for our whole trip so check out this site and it is under "affliates". I booked over the phone as I live in the uk. When we arrived I was shocked to see such a big hotel just like those on the strip and how clean it was. The buffet breakfast was $6 (how cheap) and was no different from the aladdin buffet. We spent all day on the strip then at night if we didn't want to go out you have an irish bar, tgi's, bowling etc and it is cheap. The rooms were big and clean the bathroom plenty big enough with shower over bath, tv with movies etc. The pool area is really nice with hot tub but at this time of year was in the shade which was a shame as the temperatures were around 78. there are a few hotels on the strip though with the sun on that you could sneak in eg flamingo and the paris pool was lovely and they even offered us towels. The spa was nothing special but ok. If you have the money and want something really posh do the wynn or bellagio but otherwise spend the difference on yourselves in vegas and stay at the orleans as it has everything you could need and spend all day and night on the strip if you wish as all the hotels want you to spend your time and money in their hotels. All the reviews on here were right!

Reviews.Title: “Orleans quality off strip”
Reviews.Author: John&Jennifer
Reviews.Content: A few miles off the strip, has all the facilities of a large casino hotel. Booked after using tripadvisor and was not dissapointed. Instant check in, friendly very helpfull staff, clean large well maintained room. Used the free shuttle to the strip and used taxis back. The casino here has the usual problem of smoke as do all the casinos in Vegas we visited, so we chose to keep out of them. For the price cannot believe you will find better.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans Great Value”
Reviews.Author: princessdru76
Reviews.Content: This was my husband and my second trip to Vegas this year. We have been now a total of 6 times. This was the first time to stay off strip. We were very pleased with the Orleans. The food choices were great and affordable. Cheap liquor store on site. Shuttle service ran very regularly. Casino and hotel very easy to find your way around. Room very clean and large. Bathroom pretty average, great water pressure! The beds were average! The price and value is excellent for this off strip hotel. Would highly recommend over several strip hotels. We have previously stayed at Bally's, Treasure Island, Luxor, Paris (Don't waste your money) and now the wonderful Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Great value but some little annoyances”
Reviews.Author: barnowl54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a Coast Hotel last year and we have been offered amazing deals ever since via email. We were looking for a place to stay in LV and were offered a $35 a night deal for two adults and children. The deal included two free games of bowling and two buffet lunches. Be aware that the outside of the hotel can be very busy and it is hard to know where to pull up. The valets are quick to get to you though and they were always quick to retrieve our vehicle when we needed it. Check-in was fast and the young man on the desk was most cheerful and helpful. Getting to the rooms is through the gaming areas but the elevators were overseen by security and they checked our room keys each time. The elevators are divided into two sections, which service separate floors of the hotel so access is very quick. As a previous reviewer noted, the rooms are well appointed and very large. The added lounge area gave us a lot more room for our family of four. The beds were comfortable but very high in keeping with its decor/theme. We had a great view of the Strip even though we did not reqest it. What I really liked was that the hotel staff treated our children with great respect especially when they had to move through the gaming areas. So what didn't I like? Internet access was $10.00 a day and it really is necessary for us when we travel so far from home. The smoke really got to me this time. I expect it to be smoky in the gaming areas but unthinking people seemed to think it was fine to smoke in the elevators. We waited in line to catch the shuttle to the Strip. There was one other couple in front of us. When the bus pulled up, all lthe other people who had arrived later, surged forward and crowded onto the bus. The other couple and ourselves, who were first in line, had to catch a taxi as there was not enough room on the bus. But the really outrageous thing was that there was tea and coffee provided in the room as one would expect, but there was a sign informing us that the first cup was "on the house" and each cup after that would be added to our bill at a rate of $1.75 per cup! The other things I mentioned are neither here nor there, but this is really a bit rich. The hotel is well appointed, has great facilities and is excellent value for money if you don't want to stay on the Strip. With such a good deal we couldn't go wrong even if I do have a few whinges.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: sandyhandz
Reviews.Content: Booked here due to no rooms on the strip available during a large conference in town. Surprisingly, didn't take too long to drive from the strip. Self parking is adequate and not too far a walk. Free shuttle takes you only to other related hotels (Gold Coast, Barbary Coast...) We didn't use this service. Convenient restaurants within the hotel, although mediocre food. Courtyard Cafe tends to never charge for soft drinks. Room and bathroom were good size, although nothing spectacular. Long hallway corridors - ask for a room close to the elevator. Beds were comfortable enough, but no down pillows. Internet is $10.99/24hours, but with unpredictable service. Booked thru priceline and they still tried to charge us on arrival at the hotel. Would only stay here again if there was nothing else available at a cheap price.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Orleans”
Reviews.Author: ranchgal
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Orleans very much. We were in town for the National Drag Races and to visit our son, and have been to Vegas many times. Being near the Strip was not important to us this trip. Check-in was an absolute breeze! We checked in on Friday around 5 pm. No lines, and friendly staff. Our room was on the 5th floor, no view at all. Our view was a wall. I had not asked for a room with a view, and didn't really care. This room was very large for a standard room. Very roomy. The king bed was one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept on in a hotel. There was an armoire for the TV, a desk and chair, a sofa, coffee table, easy chair and 2 end tables beside the bed plus another by the sofa. The decor was muted gold and dark blue ~ not bad at all. The bathroom had nice tile floor, tile tub/shower. Plenty of counter space in the sink area. The tub had a nice wide ledge to put your shampoo, razor, etc. on. A pocket door between the living area and the bathroom. I don't usually like pocket doors, but this one was nice quality, very heavy duty and slid with ease. The Orleans has a movie theater and bowling center, both of which we used. Very nice amenities for those looking to stay on the property. We did not use or even go look at the pool. I ate lunch at TGI Friday's on the property ~ it was a typical TGI Friday's ~ good food, pretty standard. We ate dinner at Sazio Italian restaurant, which was just average. The coffee shop was good for breakfast. There is a Seattle's Best coffee shop, where we got great latte's in the morning. I am a slot player. The slots at this property were fine, but nothing too special. LOTS of video poker, which is not my game. I like slot machines that have a bonus game (like Wheel of Fortune, Top Dollar, etc.) This casino did have W of F, but not too many other choices of bonus-type slots. I would stay at this property again, because I think it is a very good value. If my main goal was to gamble, I would probably stay somewhere right on the Strip where you can go to different properties easily. Orleans does have a shuttle service to the Strip and back, but I'm not crazy about shuttles. Bottom line ~ this is a nice property. If you want to be in the heart of the action, it's probably not for you. But if you don't mind being a little off the Strip, it's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place Good Value!”
Reviews.Author: gary1954
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is an excellent place to stay and visit the strip from.If you like a large room, good food and a free shuttle to the LV strip this is the place to stay for you! I would suggest you do alot of sight seeing because the slots and whole gaming will leave you broke before you leave to go back home. Remember there is nothing free in LV! Theres alot of hype that only changes once you go for whatever there trying to sell you. Example at one hotel offered free $50.00 slot play. I stood in line only to find out that you can only use certain machines and you could not cash out if you wanted to! The only way you could win if the machine hit the JACKPOT! Just think your wasting your time playing free slots without a chance of winning nothing! The free shows were nice, Hover Dam, Grand Canyon Etc....So down get caught up in the hype of winning you'll understand once you see the "grand hotels" they built with "one quarter" at a time! Again, enjoy the Orleans it is the best bargain in LV!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value!”
Reviews.Author: AnnTee
Reviews.Content: Had a great five night stay - me and two friends in a terrific room, very clean and well-serviced. Helpful staff at every point. Good bars inside the hotel, lots of variety for food, nice pool although it was in shade for a large chunk of the day (well, mid-October - can't complain). Found the accomodation to be very good value indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Lif3ofRiley
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay at the Orleans was pleasant. Buffet was great, hotel clean, rooms are roomy and comfortable. My husband doesn't care much for gambling but Orleans has a bowling center which he loves. They also provide free shuttle services between their other properties like the Gold Coast and the Barbary Coast which is on the strip. The only complaint I have is with the hair salon. There was a woman, a stylist she called herself that was just lazy. Myself and other women asked if she could perform a particular service and she flat out said that it would cost us lots of money. Money for good service is not a bad deal for me but this woman did not want to blow dry and refused to flat iron which is what we asked from the beginning. Ladies, pamper yourselves at a real salon. If you could just avoid the salon all together, your stay at the Orleans will be a good one!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Girls Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Flipflops-and-fun
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three-night girls getaway. The Orleans was above what I expected. The room was large. Enough space for 4 women--2 Queen beds, couch, vanity, and large bathroom. The service was great throughout the entire hotel and casino. They have a very nice pool area with bar service. One large pool, a children's pool, and a big hottub. The coupon book that each person receives upon checking in was fabulous, lots of free drinks and discounts--Use it! The free shuttle to the strip was very convenient and easy to use. We never had to wait long to hop aboard. All the restaurants in the hotel had great food and service. The only one negative is if you drink more than one cup of coffee from your room coffee pot, they will charge you $1.75 per cup. No big deal, if you must have good coffee there is a Seattle's Best in the lobby. I would rate this hotel as a 3 star. It is very clean and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good money value”
Reviews.Author: doribd
Reviews.Content: We came there with a recommandation of our friends and also a good reviews in here in trip advisor site. The place is clean, has a free parking place and a shuttle to the strip in each 15 min, from 6am till midnight for free. Good restaurants and coffee places.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: deca76
Reviews.Content: I also chose The Orleans due to good reviews (and price) at TripAdvisor. And they weren't wrong. The hotel is excellent. Over 2,000 slot machines and a bunch of poker tables, as much as any Casino in Vegas. The only difference is really being off-Strip. Plenty of options for food and drinks inside property. There were also some concerts and shows going on (I just missed the Disney's show). If you have car, this is EXCELLENT choice, two minutes away from the strip. It's in the same avenue of NewYorkNewYork (Tropicana Av), but you cannot reach the Strip by foot... Only 7-10 minutes to airport by taxi or car. The rooms are large, air-conditioning is excellent (well, my trip included other US cities and none had a good air-conditioning as in Vegas, but I'm sure every Vegas hotel must have suberb air-conditioning), computer-controlled temperature, good beds, bathroom, bath supplies replaced everyday. Good room service. Iron and iron-boarding, coffee maker and hair dryer available. I didn't have a car, so I used the hotel shuttle to the strip, quite efficient. Clean rooms but with a slight odour of oldness. I thought The Orleans' location was still much better than Circus Circus, Saraha or Stratosphere. I got excellent rates by TripAdvisor affiliates, it was half the price than any Strip Hotel, below $50 (none of the TripAdvisor topTen Vegas hotel had this low price at the time except South Coast, #9 of the list, from the same group owner as The Orleans, but quite far from the strip). Last trip I stayed in Ballys, which has great location and nice rooms, but The Orleans rooms are better. If you are looking really for luxury, then stay in the Venetian, a speechless hotel. But I prefered to save some bucks to spend in other city attractions, so I stayed in The Orleans. Check-out was fast, but the TV check-out system was not working. They have Wi-fi but I suppose you need to pay for it. Hotel doesn't offer breakfast, you have to eat somewhere in the casino. Downstairs it has internet connection ($.25 cents a minute) and public phones. I guess The Orleans won't make such a memorable and unforgettable staying (which only very few Vegas hotels will offer, if you pay, as Venetian, Caesars, Belagio) but you will have a very confortable one.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: bigskytravelnut
Reviews.Content: We had three nights booked at the Orleans for a getaway vacation to Las Vegas. I was apprehensive about staying off the strip, but because of all the great reviews we decided to give the Orleans a try. The worst thing was mid morning, we stepped into the elevator to go down stairs and immediately smelled a foul smell. Well, there was human diarhea on the elevator floor. We alerted a janitor who didn't make a huge effort to clean it up. Discusting. This could have been a freak thing, but it was still gross. Well, we checked out after the first night and headed to NYNY on the strip(which was the perfect location.) If you have been to Vegas numerous times and are simply looking to gamble, not sight see, this is a good choice, But if you are a small town girl like me and looking for that great, wow, experience this hotel just didn't have it. The decor was bright, but looked a little cheezy. The room was larger than our room at the nyny but nothing special. We ate breakfast at the buffet which was alright, eggs were horrible though. It did have some wonderful french pastries and a little pastry counter to order from. We were disappointed at the amount of table games, they only had a couple of poker tables and no texas hold em which we won and had a blast playing at other hotels. We bowled and that was fun, but other than that, this hotel is far from the strip and that is really where you want to be on a vegas vacation. The shuttle did work for us, but in the end we regretted getting an off strip hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: AndyCFC
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending 12 nights at the Orleans and had a fantastic time. We have been to Las Vegas 5 times now and have previously stayed on the strip. The rooms a larger than you get from the hotels on the strip and are very comfortable and clean. The maid service was excellent. There is plenty to do at the hotel with a 70 lane bowling alley and a multi cinima complex on site. The casino area is huge with plenty of choices of machines and a good size poker room. The check-in and out process was very smooth and efficient. They give you a book of discount vouchers when you arrive which can save you a few dollars. We had a hire vehicle which I would recommend as it gives you more flexibility to get round. The hotel does provide a courtesy bus that takes you to the strip but we did not use this. A good tip is to drive into any of the main hotels on the strip and use the valet parking, for a couple of dollars it is well worth it and a lot less hassle. Another tip is the prices for the buffet breakfast dramatically increase on Sunday mornings so it is a lot cheaper to go to one of the local diners instead. Would recommend the Blue men show at the Venetian hotel, very different and very entertaining. Would definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Bang for your Buck, And Clean Too!!!”
Reviews.Author: ambulancegirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our stay at the orleans for out 17th anniversary, and we were impressed. I have been to vegas with my sister many times, and been spoiled at the Mandalay Bay, but my hubby has never been, and our budget is much smaller than my sisters. We chose the orleans after reading all the positive posts here, and took advantage of the fact that they will match any price that they can verify. They matched a price that we found on travelworm, and that saved us almost a $100!!! The rooms are huge!! Beds are comfy, showers are hot, everything was clean!!! We had a non-smoking room that truly smelled non-smoking. I was prepared with a candle, just in case. My biggest complaint would be that the doors are a little thin, and you can hear other peoples doors shutting down the hall, but it wasnt bad enoung to make me not want to go back. Staff was relatively friendly, but ladies in the gift shop were pretty cranky, and waitresses in the cafe not very attentive, but all in all our visit was a blast, and we would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Job”
Reviews.Author: julietravelut
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night and would recommend it. Off the strip but still a very nice casino. Very good price and there is a shuttle to Barbary Coast which is central strip if you don't have a car. Only downside is pool closes at 6pm so could not take advantage of it. Don Miguel's mexican restaurant is very good. The staff was also very accomodating and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans great hotel - Also Yavapie Lodge at Grand Canyon nice”
Reviews.Author: joseph26003
Reviews.Content: Our recent trip to Vegas was great. The Orleans was just as nice as others had said and you can't beat the price. The rooms were spacious and clean. The view of the city was exceptional especially at night. We liked the small window in the shower to let fresh air in and take out the humidity from the shower. The maid service cleaning the rooms was very good. They even made us check our key to prove it was our room when we came back and they were cleaning. We were very happy to see that because anyone could have been coming in our room. We liked the security downstairs where you had to show your room key to ride the elevators. Lots of places to eat. Buffet breakfasts at the French Market were great and for about $6.50 each you couldn't beat it. Breakfast at Courtyard cafe was more individually priced items and more expensive. Dinner at Sazio's was great. The lasagna dinner was hugh and delicious. It was about 1/2 of a 13 x 9 pan that I would make at home. Went to see the Blue Man Group and loved it. Just don't buy the drinks. $5 water, $6.50 Beer, $15 mixed drink. But the show was great. Didn't need the earplugs they were giving out. We stayed at the Orleans because of the price and since we are not big gamblers we were planning 2 side trips. One to Hoover Dam (after it reopened because of a crane falling) and an overnight trip to the Grand Canyon. Both were excellent. Since we rented a car we decided to drive and stay overnight at the Canyon. It took about 4 1/2 to 5 hrs. It was a very easy drive once you get out of Vegas. We stayed at the Yavapie Lodge. It reminded you of a dormitory. The rooms were really a lot nicer than we expected. Also very clean. You had to drive to the rim or take a shuttle, which was very conveniently located right outside. The food at the little food court by room registration was not very good, but we were starved. Anyone not visiting the canyon at least once in their life doesn't know what they are missing. It's breathtaking. We loved that it was not all commercialized with bill boards and signs, etc. Just natural and beautiful. It was extremely windy and chilly when we were there 9/20/06. The trails down are great, getting back up is another story. You just have to base your hiking on your physical ability. The wildlife we saw there and on our drive there was amazing. Prong horn sheep, elk, mule deer, squirrels, chipmunks, etc. As for Vegas it was great to see. Using the Orleans as our base camp worked out well. We will definitely go back. You can't beat the Orleans, but you must see Hoover Dam and the Grand Canyon.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: brucewlf
Reviews.Content: I love Las Vegas and try to visit several times a year; this summer I decided to try somewhere I hadn't stayed before, as well as an off strip location. After doing some research on the vegas themed sites, and of course, turning to the reviews here on Trip Advisor, I decided to try the Orleans. The only "con" that most people here listed, is, it is off the strip by a few minutes, but since I always drive to Vegas, I have my car. so I knew that woudln't be an issue. In fact, it's only about 5 minutes from the strip not that bad at all. This hotel was a great value--I stayed from 6/18-6/23-06. Sunday night was $45, and the rest of the week was, I believe about $65. The rooms are LARGE, very comfortable; I was given a "strip view" room on the 17th floor, out of a large window I could the see backs of NY NY and so forth, wonderful view, beautiful at night. (I'm fond of staying on upper floors for nice views). Rooms, as i said are large; either 2 queen or a King bed, dresser, desk, and an actual sitting area by the window' the bathroom is to the back of the room, with a door that slides shut (kind of unusual), and one thing I really liked that I had NEVER seen in a hotel bathroom before--there's a window in the shower! Everything was very clean and well kept up. I felt I was getting an excellent bargain, this class of room for these prices. Base rate for my room, for 5 full nights, came to $305; that will only buy you ONE night in many places on the strip now. The food was very good-I ate quite a bit in the "French Market Buffet," they also have a TGIF restaruant inside, a subway, a coffe shop, a "Terrible Mikes" which is sort of like a Fatburger, old school greasy diner type stuff, very good too. Another place I enjoyed I don't remember the name of, but it was both a sushi bar and chinese restaraunt! Now, besides all that the Orleans has a 70 lane bowling alley, a multiplex theatre, and an arena that hosts concerts, minor league hockey, WWE wrestling and all kinds of other events. You could actually spend your whole vacation without leaving the property--there is at least a weeks' worth of things to do (not counting the huge casino) and eating establishments to try. That brings me to the only "con" from my point of view--this place is big. Not big like the Hilton, or Tropicana, but pretty big. The halls are long (especially when you're tired, lol) and it has one of the largest casinos in town; it takes a few minutes to walk from one end of it to the other; in fact parking is about a half mile away from the room elevators if you go through the casino (seriously). Here's a tip I found out: when you come out of the parking structure, instead of walking into the casino (to your right) go to your left, through the double doors; you will go through a big courtyard, then into the area where the room elevators are. This saves a HUGE amount of walking when returning to the hotel to your room; otherwise you must walk ALL THE WAY through the casino. (Unless you LIKE all that walking-- I don't happen to :) ) I was pleased with everything about this hotel; from the courteous quick check in, the room, the food, the gaming (I won a bunch of money, by the way); service was excellent, it is an unbelievable value and I enjoyed it a lot. I would highly recommend the Orleans Hotel and Casino!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, just off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: gevaltech
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind being a bit off the main Strip, this is an excellent value. Rooms are large, clean and updated. The 3 pools are large and wonderful. Can get a great price by booking over the internet. For our large family, got 2 adjoining rooms with a door between them, for way less than a single room at other similar hotels on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic time at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: charliegirl_b
Reviews.Content: We have just returned froma 4 night stay at the Orleans. We had orginally booked at Circus Circus but changed due to the reviews on this site. The Orleans was fantastic. Check in was quick and easy and we were given a fun book each. The fun book has coupons for discounts for a variety of different resturants, bars and facilities such as bowling etc. The rooms were very large and comfortable. More importantly they were clean and the bed was extremely comfy. The facilities were great. The pool was large and clean and very cooling after the heat of the day. It does close at 6pm, but I soon found out that most vegas hotel pools do as they want you in the casinos not the pool. The hotel and casino is huge, with the outdoor pool area, movie theatre, bowling alley as well as the casino itself. We saw very few children and once the door was closed to your room it was quite. We ate at the buffet which was delicious and my partner won a dinner for 2 to the prime rib loft at the monday night football party in Brendans pub. The dinner was delicious but as most things in vegas there was way to much food. We used the shuttle bus to get to the strip and it drops you off outside the Barbarry Coast Casino which is across the road from the Bellagio. The shuttle bus back to the Orleans was a little trickier to catch as it is only a 20ish seater bus and there was always lots of people that came from no where to get on the bus. There was no line and people didnt care if you had been waiting longer, they just pushed their way on. After a couple of days we realised you could catch the public bus from the corner outside New York New York which dropped you off directly outside the Orleans. We would buy a Duece ticket for all day ($5) and you could get on and off the duece as you liked and it was also valid for the public transit system. A couple of times we caught cabs back and from the Luxor to the Orleans was less than $9. The cab drivers can be a bit nasty and we got abused for not giving a big enough tip so we stuck to the bus which didnt take much longer. Overall the Orleans is not as flashy or classy as the bellagio and the like BUT i think was just as nice as it was comfortable and i never felt out of place. The security was great (you had to show your room key at the elevator) and the price was excellent for what you got. We would definetly return only to stay and enjoy the orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Superb”
Reviews.Author: jaffakelv
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from 10 nights at the Orleans and it is everything we expected after reading the reviews on this website. The rooms are unbelievably big and spacious (in my opinion,streets ahead of the rooms at the Luxor,which were very disappointing),huge comfortable beds,a non-smoking room on a non-smoking floor (the 18th) which,for once in Vegas,didn't smell of smoke - terrific accomodation. It's a very quiet hotel in relation to the Strip but that's a big plus in my book - I love Vegas for the fact it's loud and "in your face" but it's lovely to escape from it to sleep,and there is no better place than the Orleans. The shuttle's a great idea but it's no big deal to get a cab to the strip - most evenings,after spending them on the strip,we just walked to New York,New York and got a cab from there;just over seven dollars (we always gave the driver ten!) to get back and no waiting for the shuttle - simple. I will stay here again without a shadow of a doubt next time we return to Vegas,and I recommend evryone else should try it too - you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the Price”
Reviews.Author: ang3ldu5t
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Orleans on 9/9-9/11/06. My sister and I are in our 20's and the rest of the family is around 50y/o. Our trip to Vegas was fast and furious and the Orleans fit our budget. We rented 2 rooms for the End of Summer price of $89/weekend and $55/weekday. It was the cheapest I could find for a decent hotel/casino. We actually had a great time staying here. The rooms are huge and the beds are comfortable. We mainly stayed in the casino area so I can't so much about the extra stuff they have there. We ate at the buffet for breakfast/brunch a couple of times. Pretty good selection and their brunch is fantastic. We had dinner one night at the Big Al's Oyster Bar. Really great food! We had comps for $80 and that was enough to feed 6 people! We had a rental car so the trip between the Orleans and the strip wasn't bad at all. It was easy to drive in Vegas. The best way to get to the strip from the orleans is to go west to Decatur and make a right then make a right on Spring Mountain Rd. There is plenty of free parking at the TI and Mirage lots. I didn't win at the Orleans, so I was kinda upset about that! We didn't really gamble anywhere else but at the Orleans. Overall, I think the Orleans is a great place if you want to save your money for gambling and other expensive things in Vegas. If you want a comfortable place for the price, this is a great pick. Also it's close to In-N-Out burger. It doesn't get any better. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Not for the young at heart”
Reviews.Author: 1place_at_a-time
Reviews.Content: My weekend vacation was alright. The Orleans did not have any broken pipes and everything did work. So what's my beef? The Orleans is a little off the strip, so let's say you can not walk to any other hotel very easily. In the hotel's defense, they do offer a complimentary shuttle to the Gold Coast (off the strip) and the Barbary coast (on the strip). Just FYI....although the Barbary Coast is very tiny and smoke filled, it was a very happening casino and the patrons were of varying ages (from 20's to 50's). Back to the hotel and casino at hand. The Orleans was clean and everything was in its place. I stayed on a non-smoking floor, however there were ashtrays at the elevators and throughout the floor you could smell light smoke. The room was completely smoke free. The water in the shower did not get very hot, so now chance of burning. The water in the pool are was a better temperature and the pool are is probably the hotels best attribute. If you are going to Las Vegas to relax, the Orleans could be a good bang for the buck. If you are going for the adventure of it all, stay on the strip. Overall, it just didn't have anything special.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Crashpro
Reviews.Content: We returned last week from a week in Las Vegas at the Orleans. I used travelaxe to find the best rate, then contacted the hotel directly, and they gladly matched the rate. They even took off the commission that the booking company would have received that is built into their price. Result: room was $5 per night cheaper than the lowest competitor's price. The Orleans was the best hotel in 7 trips that I have stayed in. Everyone from check in to check out was friendly and helpful. The room was a standard non-smoking room on the 10th floor. It also looked as though it had just been remodeled. EVERYTHING looked new. Very, very nice. It seemed roomier than when I stayed at the Golden Nugget. It is also the first trip that I've taken and come back with more money than I left with. Some was from blackjack, the rest from nickle video poker. Second day there, I hit a progressive royal flush for $432.10 (not bad for nickles) and must have had at least 30 sets of quads--all on the same machine all week. Food that we had was very good. We only ate at four of the 14 restaurants. My travel companion (younger brother) isn't much for diversity. We mixed up the menu items each meal, but ate at the pretty much the same restaurants. They also offer a free shuttle to the strip, which we took advantage of. The return trip however, found us with about 60 others waiting to ride a much smaller capacity shuttle back from their sister property, The Barbary Coast. We snatched onto another couple and split the cab fare back to The Orleans ($9.80 plus tip). We were back while I'm guessing the others will still waiting for a shuttle they may not all fit onto. Again, best trip ever. Food wise, gambling wise, room wise, hotel in general. You just can't miss with The Orleans. Make sure to get a rental car.
