Ya can't walk anywhere from here, but you may not want to with 14 restaurants, 18 screen movie theatre, and 70 lane bowling alley. The pool area is nice too. Well landscaped with lots of palm trees.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Calgary_Travellor
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews in Tripadvisor we stayed in the Orleans for three days. I would classify the hotel as a solid choice at good value. We did not find it to be run down in any way but that said it did not have the flair and glamour of other hotels such as the Rio and other strip hotels such as Mandalay Bay. However we were able to get a good price which made it great value for hotels in Vegas. This time to Vegas we were driving and that proved to be very beneficial for staying at this hotel. Given it is off strip it is a significant walk to get anywhere but if you have access to a vehicle then that takes away any off strip inconvenience. It is the way to go. We were amazed at how convenient Vegas was to get around in a vehicle and especially that all the major hotels have free parking. Pros at the Orleans: - Price deals - Large Poker room - Good recreation (Bowling alleys, nice pool area, Kids play area - you can leave your 3 - ? year olds for up to five hours I think) - Large casino - Good quality buffet at reasonable prices - Clean, reasonably quiet hotel rooms Cons - Slow front desk service - not enough personnel - No free internet, coffee, gym (usual for Vegas I guess) - If you are in a room above in the tower overlooking the main entrance then motorcycle and loud car noise will be very noticable (we were on the 10th floor) - Not as glitzy inside as many of the big hotels Hope this helps.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: West Coast National Park, South Africa
Reviews.Title: “Great quality and quiet off the strip”
Reviews.Author: MsAudubon
Reviews.Content: Our room was just as shown in the hotel photos. Very well-appointed, very clean, very comfortable. The service throughout (casino, front desk, restaurant) was exceptional. The shuttle runs frequently and is only 5 minutes to the strip, with its stop in the center of the action (Caesar's Palace, Bellagio, Paris). We asked for a view room and got wonderful night photos of the strip. The pool area was fabulous. Given that, that bowling alley, and the movie theatre, this is a great family location. Security was great--showing key card to get into elevator. The bathroom was a bit small. Only the first cup of coffee is free and internet is $10.99 a day. As my husband noted, "everything in Vegas costs extra. " Otherwise, no complaints. The best stay during our two-week road trip, at the lowest price too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Orleans!!”
Reviews.Author: DoubleG828
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Orleans. Fantastic, Fabulous, Fierce, and Fun! My family and I went for my cousin's 20th year wedding renewal. We all stayed there. Not one complaint. We plan on going back in August, 2007. I loved everything about the hotel. I have nothing negative to say. Everybody and Everything was Excellent!!! We didn't have to rent a car due to the shuttle bus to the strip. Very convenient. Food great!!! Room rates - you can't beat it. The fun book you receive helps out alot on savings. The pool was superb. If you drink cocktails - you must have their signature drink - The Alligator. I got bite and now I am hooked. But I will only have them there. I recommend this hotel to everyone. This is the only hotel I will stay at when visiting Las Vegas. When they made this hotel, they got it right!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: wan1559
Reviews.Content: fantastic value hotel. we had a room on the 20th floor which was fantastic. it was larger than average spotless and the most comfy bed we have slept in. the buffett was absolutely the best tastewise and value for money. we hired a car so it didn,t bother us that this hotel is not on the strip. we got a free funbook which was excellent. it has vouchers for free cocktails among other things. we just cannot fault this hotel and we will go back time and time again. this was our second stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the security”
Reviews.Author: SKILILLADY
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the hotel so much we are going back on September 27th, 2006. I loved how you had to show your key card everytime you had to get on the elevator. We discovered the pool area on the 3rd day and it looked like an oasis, but was unable to go swimming due to other festivities. You got great sleep because you are off the strip and the guest were not rowdy. We recommend this hotel to any patron traveling that wants quiet off the strip life.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas WOW”
Reviews.Author: G'day bill
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas what a place, the Orleans, a quality hotel off the strip, but we could have spent a week at the Orleans without going out of the hotel. The free shuttle runs regularly to the strip until late We stayed for two nights , primarily for our helicopter trip to the Grand Canyon. The 10 restaurants at the Orleans all had great food, and at a good price. Tourism works like a well oiled machine and service is the priority. We will return

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrier
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by this economical hotel. The room was large, very nice, and in good condition. There were numerous eateries as well as the movie theaters and a first class 2-for-one show. We had dinner at the French Market Buffet twice ($7 per person) and were given a free bottle of wine each time (part of the fun book). One possible drawback is that the hotel is located about 2 miles off the strip. You have to take the free hotel shuttle, a cab, or drive your own car. All in all we would strongly recommend the Orleans. We will probably stay here again when we return to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: jalf234
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to the Orleans previously just to go and gamble. Last year we decided to stay there. It was the best, from the time we arrive until we left , the staff was friendly and the service was great. The valet parking was fantastic, we never waited more than 5 mins. for our car. I was even impressed with the elevators as soon as I hit the button I always had the doors open. The room was comfortable and clean. I have stayed in various hotels over the years I have been going to Vegas. Which is about 25 yrs, I have to say I was very happy with the Orleans. We are going back in November and staying for 1 week. This hotel is great if you rent a car cause it is easy to access most of the main roads from the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel if you don't want to pay the high prices on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: cop1007
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here in August and will DEFINITELY stay here again! We got a outstanding rate on USAirways for the hotel and airfair from Cleveland, Ohio together and was not dissapointed. This was the first time ever staying there or even going into the Orleans and have been to Vegas several times. The rooms were very beautiful and quiet and beds very comfortable and clean, as was the rest of the hotel. We ate at the buffett for dinner once and breakfast and the food was very good. They even have the dinner buffett priced at $7.00 on certain days and WELL worth that price. There was even a coupon for a free bottle of wine with dinner purchase! The casino was great with most tables $5 min on black jack and were even a couple of $3 tables, as well as 1 and 5cent slots that seemed to let you play for a while. The pool area was very nice and spacious and all the staff was very accomadating and friendly. There is a shuttle to the strip area that went to the Barbary Coast and the other " Coast" hotels that ran pretty smoothly. We always rent a car, so we only used that service a couple of times. I would DEFINITELY recomend this motel to everyone and will DEFINITELY stay there again! Probably one of the best experiences Ive had in all the places that Ive stayed before.

Reviews.Title: “loved the orleans”
Reviews.Author: barkeep
Reviews.Content: our first visit to the orleans was this past august.all reservations were made on the internet. upon our arrival we were greeted by courteous, friendly valet who took care of our parking. we were allowed to check in early. the desk clerk was very friendly and efficient. it was necesary to show our room key to get on the elavator to go to our room. we liked the security measure. the elavator, the halls, and our room were very clean and well kept. the bed was comfortable and the room furnished nicely. the staff were friendly and honest. we stayed there 2 days then drove to kanab, utah on our way to the grand canyon. there we discovered we had left my husband's prescriptions in the room. when we called, we talked to head housekeeper delores who said she would try to find them, she said she would call us long distance in utah. she called in about 1/2 hour and saif she had them and would hold them for us since we were returning on thursday. great service!! we ate at 3 of the restaurants and liked all 3. there is shuttle service every 20 minutes to the strip. we will always stay at the orleans. we were very happy with the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Jitterrbbug
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Orleans the last 4 trips to Vegas. We have always had polite and courtious people to deal with. Food was good and they have a choice of smaller eateries other than the buffets. The only negative I have to say is with regards to their wheelchair availability, we couldn't take if off the premises. We fixed that problem by bringing one with us. You can also get lots of mardi gras beads.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans Hotel and Casino is Great!”
Reviews.Author: Trinity68
Reviews.Content: My husband, mother in law and I stayed at the Orleans for 2 nihgts September 5th to the 7th. As always the hotel was great! Check in was quick and the staff was very friendly. The room was clean and very comfortable with 2 queen beds, loveseat and a cute chair. We received 2 free buffets with our reservation and Wednesday night steak night was good. The only complaint that I have is that the pool area closes at 7 PM, but the pool area was very inviting and had many lounge chairs. You can rent floats even though the pool depth is only 3' 8". They have a huge jacuzzi area but with the temps being 100 I did not take a dip. They have a machine downstairs where you can print your boarding passes, so I did get "A" boarding passes with Southwest which was sweet. The casino staff and the waitresses were wonderful. Can't wait to return next year. Coast hotels are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Shuttle”
Reviews.Author: westyboy
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel....nice pool and the food is fair. Perhaps a bit too smokey. HOWEVER, I must advise all potential customers to be very careful when taking one of their shuttle buses to other casinos or back to the Orleans again........you need to ask the driver specifically where he is going ( even though it says " Orleans" right on the side of the bus) Our driver did not say a word. We were shuttled about 10 miles out of the city to another casino and had to take a 20 dollar cab ride back to the hotel. The management refused to reimburse us, even though they admitted this does happen fairly regularily !

Reviews.Title: “Best In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: watshea
Reviews.Content: Having been to Vegas many times I have to say that The Orleans is by far the best experience. {Previous stays Luxor, MGM Grand, Hilton} .Although the hotel is off strip this was in fact a bonus as we were not bothered by hundreds of tourists doing the usual 'themed hotel tour.' Access to the strip was easy via free shuttles at frequent intervals. Staff were very friendly and professional. Our room was more spacious and luxurious than any I had previously stayed in. Hygeine maintained to very high standards by maids. Great choice of eateries- we did not manage to use all restaraunts during our stay. Service was prompt and on the one occasion it was slower tthan normal we were given a bottle of red wine to compensate. Pool area nice and relaxing but would imagine it would be slightly overcrowded at peak season. We will definitely be returning to The Orleans and I have no hesitation in recomending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room for the price”
Reviews.Author: Shutterbug444
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is a very nice, budget hotel (for Vegas standards)west of the Strip. Although it's less expensive than other hotels in the area off the strip, the rooms do not say "budget". The rooms are very spacious and comfortable with a separate sitting area. Overall, the hotel is quite nice and I would recommend this to anyone who has a car to get around. I would not rely on the shuttle because returning to the hotel from the Strip can be frustrating at best. This hotel is too far from the Strip to walk unless a 1.5 - 2 mile walk to the Strip each way wouldn't bother you. The pool area is very nice but small for Vegas. The main drawback is that it's mostly in the shade until noon because the building blocks the east-facing side. When it is in the sun, there is very little shade because they do not have umbrellas to allow you to decide how much sun or shade you get. So, it's basically all sun or all shade. The music at the pool is lively and is neither a snooze nor head-banging. Just a word of advice. If you leave the pool area, even very briefly, you MUST leave some of your belongings or they will take your towels. I left to use the restroom and not 5 minutes later as I returned to the pool, I watched as the pool attendant removed not only my towels but also the magazines I'd left. I asked why he was taking my things and he said management requires them to do this unless shoes are left behind. Hmmm....so if you prefer to wear your flip flops to the restroom, be sure to leave something else that appears more valuable than a couple magazines or your lounger will be vacated for you. In this case, someone else had already taken my lounger (probably because it was in a really nice location and it was very crowded that day) but the female attendant with very long hair (wish I'd gotten her name) was very apologetic and later came by with a couple complimentary water bottles. As long as you don't plan on spending a day at the pool, I would definitely recommend this hotel. The rooms are very nice and there's a decent selection of restaurants for a late night bite and most of the staff is very helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Better then expected”
Reviews.Author: ariesfire
Reviews.Content: After reading the many positive reviews, we chose this hotel for our five-day trip. We booked three other hotels and The Orleans was used as our base, so we didn't have to keep packing and unpacking. For $33.00 a night, I didn't expect much. When we first booked, the Orleans price was higher. As our trip approached, we found lower rates on Travelosity. They matched the lower internet price twice. The hotel is away's off the strip. Walking is not an option. When we arrived, the lobby was LOADED with kids. A soccer championship was going on. People were lying everywhere in the lobby. Instead of suitcases, people stuffed their clothes in trash bags. The class of people were more along the lines of what you would find at Denny's. I did not think this would be a good experience or a quiet night. To my surprise, when we reached our room, we didn't hear a sound. I was truly shocked at how quiet it was in the room considering the hundreds of kids running around. We were even able to sleep in without being woken up by noise from slamming doors, people's voices, or cleaning staff. The rooms were also huge. The bed is not very comfortable, but everything else was fine. We ended up having a great time with the down to earth people we met. Everyone was very friendly and fun to gamble with. We did very well gambling here. The Big Wheel of Fortune was a blast. I won a few hundred, lost a few hundred. It was addicting. My husband plays Texas Hold'em. Wait time was usually around 20minutes. The people were friendly and he won three out of five days of playing. The Prime Rib was amazing. We eat out often and this was on of the best Prime Ribs we ever had. Loved the dark atmosphere. If you are expecting a high-class hotel, then stay elsewhere. If you are looking for a clean, quiet, place to lay your head at night, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “what a pit”
Reviews.Author: logicaldog
Reviews.Content: What a dump. Dirty, nasty,, old, rude, not to mention the usual, that you get in Las Vegas, smoky and disgusting, They got our room wrong, nasty about it. miserable

Reviews.Title: “Value fantastic, location could be a problem”
Reviews.Author: BLACKJACK49
Reviews.Content: All depends what you want from a hotel. This was my fifth time in Vegas, but my first staying off of the strip. I chose this hotel because of all the great reviews on here. The hotel was excellent value for money and exceptionally clean. The pool was lovely with sunloungers always available. I found the food to be only average, but good value. I was apprehensive about staying off of the strip, but read about the free strip shuttle so decided to give it a go. This is where it gets a bit negative! I don't drive, but am quite happy to walk quite long distances. This wasn't possible to the strip from this hotel. The distance wasn't the problem, there was no where to walk, quite often the case for the pedestrian in some parts of Vegas. The strip shuttle was reliable, but returning late at night became a bit of a free for all, with no real queing system. Therefore people tended to just push in. It's seating only, and as you can imagine this sometimes meant people not being able to get on. On the whole i missed being on the strip. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who drives or isn't worried about the location, because the value for money is fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Fitguy
Reviews.Content: Twice a year I go to Vegas and I like to stay at a couple different hotels as I am always there for at least a week. But each visit I always stay at least a couple of nights at the Orleans. This hotel has a great "feel" to it. The rooms are large and spotless, the restaurants decent, the casino bars are easily accessible, the staff friendly, the parking is easy, check in is always quick, etc, etc, etc, I am a fan of this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Showing some wear”
Reviews.Author: danny888
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel seeral times since it open. This last time I noticed some fraying on the towels and shower curtains and other signs of wear and tear. The food didn't seem up to previous standards. I think they are living on last years awards. Gambling here is a joke. The machines are so tight that when you put money in, they say "Thanks for the donations" Seriously this is no longer a place to gamble. They do have poker tournaments, but they are controlled by the locals who are allowed to play as a team against you. You don't have a chance Many of the players are employees of this hotel or other hotels from the same chain. I'm not an advocate of kids in casinos, but this hotel seems a good choice if you going with kids. The rooms sre big enough to hold a familey of five or six comfortably. They have cheap food, a food court, and a large pool. They even hae an upstairs kiddy playland and movey theaters. With internet booking as low as $30 during the week on some websights, it can be a good buy for large famileys. Oh ! They have always matched whatever internet price I came up with, and you do need a car to get anywhere or pay very high taxi prices..

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the Orleans for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Angelfan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Orleans. Found a great rate at expedia for $33 a night, and called the Orleans directly, and they matched it. Nothing in Vegas compared to that price, that I would want to stay at. Short drive to the strip, less than five minutes without traffic. If you do not have a car, I would think hard about staying on the strip, taxi fees add up, but Orleans does provide a shuttle to the strip, but only runs until midnight, so I did not use it. But, if you have your own transportation and want to save your money for entertainment, food, and gambling, then I highly recommend the Orleans. Great big rooms, convenient parking garage, great theme, and nice views of the strip. If this place was on the strip, the price would be 4 to 5 times the price, and probably still worth it. Did not use the pool, but it looked big and nice. I recommend the $3.45 steak and eggs special after 12am, delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: rwich
Reviews.Content: We picked the Orleans based on the fact that it had activities that families can do together. At check-in the desk staff were very friendly and took only 10 minutes. The room was spacious and very clean. During the stay we used the pool which was nice and had very cool refreshing water. The spa was spacious and very relaxing. Went bowling, no complaints there. Saw a movie. Theatre wasn't cleaned after the previous show. Arcade was okay. Restaurants that we went to including the buffet had average tasting food. Nothing special. If you gamble stick to the card games. The slots and video poker machines were very stingy. Very quiet casino. Sounds of hitting the jackpot were nonexistant. Actually left a day earlier as Vegas started to bore us with it being so hot and hard to walk around on the strip amongst the masses. Would recommend for those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Sully2
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a convention and didn't want to stay on the strip. The Orleans was perfect, especially since we had a car and we took the bypass right to the convention center, which is next to the Hilton. About 10 min. Room was great, lots of room and a great view of the strip. Fresh linens every day and no smokey smell at all. The casino wasn't too crowded until after 10. Any questions or directions were handled professionally by the staff. Security made sure people showed their room key before entering elevators. Liked that. Restaurants were okay. Terrible Mikes makes a good burger. Seafood buffet not too bad either. Would definitely recommend this place and would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: arferdaily
Reviews.Content: Simple and quick check in. We had a clean room with strip view for a reasonable price. We stayed there for two night with two teenage children. Bowling was good fun and an easy activity for the first night in town. Buffet was good value and service was good. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Cubsfan_1974
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a family reunion. Although I did not like how far away from the strip (not a reasonable walk in the 100 degree heat) this hotel was, my family choose to stay here because of it's much more reasonable cost and amenities for young children. The casino is large, as is the sports book (although the chairs are not very comfortable). There is a movie theater and bowling alley on the property--both plusses for our group. There is an extensive day care area to drop off children (and the kids loved it!) while the parents can gamble, etc. And there are many $5 min. tables in the casino. The rooms were very large and clean. The restaurants on the property were good. The buffet was above average; Sazio and The Prime Rib Loft were excellent. The pool was nothing to write home about. It was below average for Vegas and did not have servers offering drinks (although there is a walk-up bar). It's also in the shade for much of the day since it's surrounded by the hotel towers. Again, I wouldn't recommend this hotel for people who want to "be in the action" on the strip. Although there is a free shuttle running from the Orleans to the strip, it stops service at midnight and it only seats around 20 people so you can wait up to an hour for an available shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chipchip
Reviews.Content: Just returned from trip with kids 10 and 14 through Arizona and 3 nights Las Vegas. I had been hesitant to stay off the strip but after full exploration of hotels was so happy we chose the Orleans. Mind you, having a car made it quite easy to get everywhere. Very large comfortable room for 4, the pool was a pleasure despite lack of slides or waves, good hot tub/pool, friendly service throughout and the kids loved collecting the bead necklaces, the arcade. and daily bowling matches. Not as hectic and immense as some of the other hotels which was nice. Great price. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway at the Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: hfitzger
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a 3-night stay at the Orleans during the last week of July. As a NW Airlines vacation package, the Orleans was one of the cheapest hotel options, but I had read such glowing reviews on TripAdvisor that we gave it a try... From the moment we arrived, we loved this hotel/casino resort and felt like we had arrived "home" every time we came back to the Orleans after exploring the Strip, Fremont, and Area 51. Although we were unable to receive the king room we requested, the queen room we received was spotless and huge. Elevator service was always quick and the security requiring guests to show their room key before gaining access to elevators added a nice touch of safety. Room was quiet and we didn't hear noises from other guests in the halls or in nearby rooms. Housekeeping was very efficient and thorough. We enjoyed several of the resort's restaurants and found the prices to be very reasonable and the food quite good. As previous reviewers noted, the onsite liquor store had better prices than back home! The 'fun books' provided at check-in had great discounts on food, drink, and entertainment at the hotel (and some coupons for other Coast casinos like the Barbary on the strip). The bowling alley upstairs was a lot of fun and added a different type of activity to enjoy while on a Vegas vacation (Buy 1, get 1 coupon in fun book too). The only downside to our stay here involved the free shuttle to the Strip (Barbary Coast sister casino). We encountered some difficulties in leaving the Strip, especially at night, because large groups of people would be waiting approx. 30+ minutes for a shuttle, and when it would arrive it was a chaotic mess because people would storm the shuttle to get one of the limited number of seats available (no standing allowed, like on the Las Vegas transit bus, the Deuce). Consequently, it didn't matter whether you had been waiting the longest. The only way you could get on the bus is by pushing and shoving your way onto the bus, otherwise you waited for the next one with other rude people who would do the same again. We had a rental car anyway, so we abandoned the shuttle route and drove ourselves. Maybe a 'take a number' system like the Orleans bowling alley, might be able to alleviate the situation... We can't wait to go back to Vegas, and will definitely plan to return to the Orleans. The off-strip location didn't seem to be a problem because it is an easy drive to the action, but the resort is a self-contained oasis that provides everything you need in one place that you might not want to leave anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Off the strip but Really Nice”
Reviews.Author: lcamano
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Orleans late June 2006. We found this incredible special thru Travelzoo for 404.00 total for both which included: 3 nites plus RT airfare from Seattle. We usually stay on the strip and The Orleans always seems to be on the "specials" lists for cheap lodging so I was a little apprehensive. When we arrived I was delighted to find this huge, grand hotel casino. We loved it from the minute we arrived. It is a five minute or less drive to the strip, but is anything really within walking distance on the strip anyway :). The restaurants are great. We went to TGI Fridays one nite and the bartender put on a show, flipping and juggling bottles like the contests you see on TV, it was a blast. They also have the inexpensive food specials like we use to hear about in old Las Vegas (1.99 steak $ eggs-good too). The rooms were really big and CLEAN and really tastefully decorated, nicer that several we have had on the Strip. The pool was great too.The only negative I can think of was that the parking seemed so far from the rooms, but there could have been a shorter way and we just didn't find it. From check in to check out we were impressed and we will definately be back. The value for this place was incredible and all of their employees were super nice and helpful too

Reviews.Title: “All the necessary comforts at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: tigerb
Reviews.Content: Comfy hotel with nice variety of restaurants and things to do (bowling, movies) -- but their free shuttle to the strip puts the place over the top. I would recommend The Orleans to anybody who has already had "the Strip experience" and now wants to spend less money on their Las Vegas vacation. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, average foood”
Reviews.Author: Giardina47
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Orleans three times in the last year. I will go again, because you can't beat the quality for the price. The rooms are large and comfortable and the maid service is first rate. The food in the Courtyard Cafe and the Prime Rib Loft is a good deal for the money. Seatlle's Best coffee is truly average which makes it overpriced. The drinks are plentiful when you gamble, but make sure you tip the drink servers. I think everyone should tip the shuttle bus driver also. My biggest disappointment at The Orleans was the new TGIF restaurant. It may have been the worst meal I have ever had, along with truly horrible service. The place to eat while at The Orleans is McMillan's Irish pub next door to the casino. The food is excellent with a warm and friendly atmosphere. My wife and I ate most of our meals there and were never disappointed. The Orleans is one of the best buys in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans is great”
Reviews.Author: travkay
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip touring Vegas, the Grand Canyon, Bryce, Sequoia NP and LA and stayed at the Orleans at the beginning and end of our trip. We really loved this hotel, with its very clean, large rooms and little quirky window in the shower. Another reviewer says that the air conditioning broke down on the 29th July - we were there then but didn't notice anything wrong - perhaps the unit in their room was not working. The restaurants, particularly the Courtyard Cafe, was excellent and the portions in Terrible Mikes were so huge, we had to have one between the two of us!! The shuttle buses to the strip came along at very regular intervals so there was no problem about getting into the heart of Vegas. The pool is huge and very clean with lifeguards in attendance. The only negative comment is that we would have liked a fridge in the room, as the heat was horrendous! We didn't gamble, so can't comment on that side of things, but would definitely recommend the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: TripAdviserFan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orleans for a weekend in July. We had two adults, 2 teenage boys and 2 10 year old girls in our party, so we booked two rooms. Our experience was great. The girls swam everyday in the huge pool, while we adults sat poolside and enjoyed beverages from the poolside bar. The girls had hot dogs which were reasonably priced at the poolside snack bar. Meanwhile, the teenage boys spent time in the huge arcade and also saw a movie in the in-house movie theatre. All of the kids bowled a few games in the in-house bowling alley, which is as big as any bowling alley we've ever been, and extremely well maintained. They bowled on a Saturday night and we only had to wait about 20 minutes for a lane. We ate most of our meals in the Courtyard Cafe just due to convenience, but the food was excellent. We did eat dinner in the French Market Buffet one night, but I wouldn't necessarily recommend it. They did have a mongolian barbecue where they cooked your food fresh, and that was good, but the rest of the food was typical buffet food that was adequate, but not great. We didn't try TGI Fridays or any of the other restaurants, but they certainly have a lot to choose from. And I don't want to forget to mention the rooms, which were huge and immaculate. The kids especially loved the beds which definitely had above average mattresses. All this for $99 a night. We will definitely stay here again when we come back to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lafolet3
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Orleans twice now and really enjoy how the rooms are quiet, clean, and spacious. Plus, it is cheap...$35.00 for a king room with sitting area. On the down side it's not on the strip but we usually have a car, so that's not an issue. The clientele, well, let's be kind, it's not the Bellagio you are staying at, so, expect regular people.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff, but ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: yuibird
Reviews.Content: We had a three and half hour delay from my flight. So when we checked in at 3 am, we were exhausted and cranky. But the front desk girl made everything better. She gave us a nice room away from the construction area, and she was such a sweetheart. The hotel is ok, but it is not Westin or anything like that. I got a good deal on the stay for 3 nights. The only reason I would not stay here is because of the location. It is like 10 minutes ride depending on the traffic to the main strip. They do provide the shuttle for you, but it is still pain in a butt to just not be able to go back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quite impressed!”
Reviews.Author: airgirl6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel a few weeks ago and I have to say that we were pleasantly surprised at how nice it was for the money we paid. We got buy one night, get one free...we got two nights for $60! The room was clean and bright; the bathrooms nice and clean as well. There was a sitting area in our room. I would recommend this hotel to all, and even though it is not on the strip, it is a cheap cab ride to the strip. The casino tables are cheaper than the bigger casinos, which is also a plus!!! Will stay here again when we are on a budget and saving our money to gamble with!

Reviews.Title: “Hot as Hell at The Orleans Casino”
Reviews.Author: sweetspot31
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Airconditioning system malfunctioned on Saturday Night - July 29th,2006 and did not come back on until the morning. With 110+ heat in Las Vegas the hotel did not seem to have an emergency plan of action. My guess is that some preventative maintence could have fixed this problem. The hotel did not even offer a 1/2 comp or apology for this . With many seniors staying at this resort I think they should hire some qualified technical inhouse repair staff instead of calling a sub-contractor who benefits for taking a longer time to repair problems as they occur. This facility is old by Las Vegas standards and is in need of a major facelift.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: skoala
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans at the end of June. I booked the stay with the hotel after seeing Expedia had a rate of $35. When I called the hotel they matched the rate. Our first 2 nights had been at the Paris because they were free. We went to the Orleans on Tuesday. We were very pleased with our stay at the Orleans. We used their pool which I thought was great. I liked that the pool was close to the elevators and you didn't have to walk through the casino to get there. No problem finding a chair and the pool had a ledge where you could just sit in the water and keep cool. The temp was in the 100's. We also bowled 1 afternoon and that was fun. The room was big and very clean. The bathroom was really nice and big too. They have lots of dining options. We went to the buffet quite a bit(my mom loves buffets) and it was good but not great, but the price was reasonable. We also went to Terrible Mike's and that was good too especially with the coupon out of the fun book that they give you when you check in. Their casino is huge and I didn't find it any smokier than the others. I thought their slots were tight except I did win on VP. Since I made the reservations for the group I was a little nervous about the place but after reading all the reviews I decided to go with it and I'm glad I did. Everyone in our group really enjoyed our stay at the Orleans especially considering the price. The only downside is that it's off strip. We had a car so that wasn't a problem. I would highly recommend the Orleans but remember it's not 5 star but it is a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Gnomer
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Las Vegas and I was totally satisfied with the Orleans. The rooms were well kept, modern and roomy. The room included a sitting area with couch and chair, the bathroom was also roomy, nicely decorated and very clean. There were several very good restaurants in the casino area and an excellent buffet. The hallways were spacious and quiet. I believe it was a good value for the price. The shuttle was convenient to the Strip. The staff was friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience for the family”
Reviews.Author: mdstevens
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with how nice this hotel was. It is older, but very clean. The room was larger than average with a sofa. The pool was very nice and very clean (actually there are three pools). This hotel felt very family friendly, compared to the other Vegas hotel we'd stayed at. They do have an on-site day care type center. The pool had many families enjoying it. The Super Buffet was better than we expected too. We had an outstanding server who took very good care of us. We booked only a few days prior and got a very good rate. They have a shuttle that takes you to two of the other casinos, so we did not have to drive/park to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: EPT
Reviews.Content: First time to Vegas, and although we did initially want to stay on the Strip - we chose this hotel because of the good reviews at TA. Stayed here for 2 nights in May. No problems with parking, a nice pool area, the hotel room was of very good size, not the newest but very clean. We did play some poker in the casino and had a great time, everybody friendly and very welcoming for a newbie. We ate two dinners at the hotel, both times pleasantly surprised. For breakfast we ate at Subway, that was very convenient located close to the poker area. Would definitely stay here again. Did drive by many other hotel casinos, but did like The Orleans very much.

Reviews.Title: “Such A Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: debraacook
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to The Orleans, not so much because of its proximity to the Strip (it is several blocks away), but primarily because we always seem to enjoy the gaming there and the rooms have been consistantly nice for the price. I made this reservation via their website, using a discount coupon that The Orleans/Coast Casinos emailed to me. When we arrived, the woman at the desk issued our keys and we thought we were going to the room I reserved. Instead, we were given just the opposite of what I had requested. My reservation was for a room with a king sized bed, smoking, with a request for a refrigerator (for eyedrops for glaucoma that must be kept at a low temperature). I explained that the refrigerator was for medical purposes at the time of reservation. We were placed in a room with two queen sized beds, no refrigerator, non smoking, and I was told that was all they had. Our reservation was for a four day stay, and we arrived at 6:15 pm, shortly after check in time. After speaking with the hotel manager, a minifridge appeared in our room, but we were never placed in the room I requested, despite two inquiries over the next 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant bargain”
Reviews.Author: trvljunky
Reviews.Content: Huge room, we got a Strip view, very clean & comfortable. We booked 3 hours before arriving and got a great rate. We went off Tripadvisor's recommendation to book this and it was truly the Best Value hotel I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved it,”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We came for a wedding, held at another Hotel. Had family members at three other hotels, they all loved our hotel BEST. Best prices at Restaurants, best service in casino, also best food. Thanks, Plan to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Orleans”
Reviews.Author: jdkizer
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we have stayed at the Orleans, they have great rooms, big pool and hot tub, excellent resturants, coupon book and slots galore. The first visit 2003 the Bell staff was terrific helping us in anyway but in 2006 visit they were awful they could not answer our questions, they were smartalexy and argued when we told them what was on their web site. Manager totally backs them up too. We were treated very well at all the resturants and had great meals at all of them. Wait staff was excellent everywhere. Now that they are putting up condos people are hawking you to buy timeshares and its very annoying running into them everywhere. We however did not run into people on the strip passing out porno this time and we were thankful for that. We love staying at the Orleans but we felt a different attitude this time could have been Hotel was full and did not care or new corp attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Nice... but not the Strip”
Reviews.Author: mctravel
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews on this site we desided to stay in the Orleans, we weren't disappointed but also not really super-enthousiastic about this hotel... (besides it being cheap) The last time we went to Vegas we were staying in de Luxor hotel, and that hotel has a little more class, if you know what I mean. If you're going to vegas for the first time I would suggest a Strip-hotel because it is so much nicer to walk out of your hotel and be on the Strip, we really missed that feeling this time.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Orleans for a weekend getaway and were overall very satisfied. Except that they didn't give us the king bed room for which I had pre-paid, the room we did get was big, clean and comfortable. The free shuttle to the Strip drops people off right across from the Belagio, so we didn't miss anything by staying off-Strip. The money we saved on the room was enough to pay for prime tickets to Cirque-du-Soleil.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: feliciah7
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Vegas, and friends suggested this hotel. I was not disappointed. The hotel is massive! There is so much to do. During the hot summer days, the best thing to do is hang out at the hotel during the day, and go to the strip at night. The hotel is definitely kid-friend. The best for me is that although there were a lot of children there, I didn't hear them while I was in my room. I found the Orleans to have a fund and friendly environment. The French Market Buffet was the best. You can't go wrong here. Lunch was $8. The only down-side is that the shuttle only runs until 12:30 a.m. and there is only 1 bus. There should at least be two buses, because there are only about 15 seats on it. You have to be aggressive when traveling in groups, if you all want to get on the bus. As far as cable stations are concerned: Who goes to Vegas to watch TV? The hotel wants to be out and about, not cooped up in the room. During those rare instances that I was in my room, I had no problems finding something to watch. I would definitely stay here again. This is an excellent deal, which allows you have more money to have fun. As an aside, I highly recommend catching one of the Cirque shows while in Vegas. I saw "O" at the Bellagio, and it was worth the money. Purchase your tickets ahead of time to get the best seating choices.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds Expectations”
Reviews.Author: MTfamily
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at the Orleans. We traveled to Las Vegas for a family vacation. Our kids are ages 10 and 8. We had so much fun last year that we invited another family to join us. The entire group enjoyed the Orleans Hotel. Every single staff person we encountered was cheerful and kind. The rooms are designed so that we could visit in the sitting area and not feel cramped. The large bathroom area has a nice closet rod and space that allows travel items to be out of the main room. We had a perfect view of Las Vegas BLVD from the 14th floor. Many rooms on "the strip" can't offer that. We think the pool area at the Orelans is top rate. It has more of a resort feel than other pool areas in Vegas and was just what we wanted for family fun. The gift shop has some reasonable prices on snack items or things we may need when away from home. There is also a shop that sells beer for less than we pay in our home town. The guys played black jack and found the staff friendly. When we left the hotel to see the sights it was always a relief to return to the Orleans. There is plently of good food to purchase and we even went bowling. If you are looking for something in a hotel that is posh or "over the top" elaborate, then you might look elsewhere. If you want a safe, clean, less crowded,friendly and fun place that seems very "real" then the Orleans will meet you expectations. We figure there is no use buying a time share in Vegas when we can return to the Orelans Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: gannie0
Reviews.Content: Booked the Orleans based on reviews and glad I did so. We would go back. The staff was very accommodating when we arrived as well as throughout our stay. Our luggage was late arriving and we were given an extra bag of goodies (shampoo, razors, toothbrushes, etc.) to get us by. Was nice having the hotel in a less-busy part of the the city. Was easy to get in and out of with our rental car. The food in their buffet was excellent and by far the best we had in the city. Liked the easy accessibility to the pool. Got off the elevator and walked straight down the hall to it, unlike others where you have to go through the lobby to get to the pool. Only negative - the slots paid us nothing. All-in-all, we would return to the Orleans to stay, just not to gamble!

Reviews.Title: “Ultimately, loved it”
Reviews.Author: tbutterfly
Reviews.Content: After booking and paying for our stay months in advance, we were given a room with two double beds when a King bed was requested. Although no assurances are given at booking....we felt we should have received what we paid ahead to receive. Ultimately, the front desk complied to our request and located a king-size bed available on the same floor. Originally, we were told there were none. The new room was wonderful. The furnishings were elegant and classy. The room was very comfortable. One complaint is that there are no cable stations unless purchased. We loved the etched-glass window above the tub/shower. In the morning, the sound of birds could be heard while taking a relaxing bath. We enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it to others. Sign up for the Coast Club card for some added bonuses and be sure to receive a coupon book upon check-in for some additional souvenirs including a free bottle of wine at the buffet. The Sunday brunch had more food choices than anyone could possibly ask for. It was delicious and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the last night of our honeymoon-it was very clean, very nice and quiet rooms. Plus, I won $500.00 on the Wheel of Fortune penny machine. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: IowaLisa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Orleans from June 18-23, 2006. Very nice and clean. Just as nice, if not better, than many hotels on the strip. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Bargain-in-One!”
Reviews.Author: robertl53
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week's stay at the Orleans Hotel & Casino and was very pleased with the accommodations. Despite arriving two hours early, a room was made immediately available to me. My hotel room, which was located on the 9th floor, was spaciously designed with a sitting area containing a loveseat and chair combination, along with a desk situated next to a large screen TV which was housed inside a cabinet that contained three large dresser-drawers. The bathroom was also spacious and clean, with all amenities included, i.e., fresh soap, ample towels, beverage glasses (though small) with ice bucket, coffee maker with an assortment of packaged gourmet coffees (the first one was free), an ironing board with iron, and a shower-tub combination with a window that could be easily opened. The room's air conditioning system was very efficient (allowing for easy adjustment of the thermostat), if not at times even cold, which was a pleasant relief after touring the city all day in near 100F+ heat. The casino floor, adjacent to the hotel rooms (as is the typical layout for most Vegas hotels), was busy throughout the day and evening, though not overcrowded like some other hotels along the Strip. Compared to the most popular food buffets in Vegas, the Orleans "French Market" Dinner Buffet was adequate by all respects and was a good value for the price ($12.95), offering a selection of Italian, Mexican, Chinese, American BBQ and Mongolian dishes, all fresh and tasty and served from 4:00pm to 10:00pm daily. My only negative observations were (1) the collection of plates by the service personnel throughout the meal was a great distraction since they wheel carts around you while pushing chairs aside, sometimes haphazardly; and (2) the breakfast orange juice and coffee were rather bitter in taste. Overall, I would highly recommend a stay at the Orleans Hotel & Casino for anyone seeking great value for their money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Russnot
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week at The Orleans. I booked at the last minute based on the reviews here and was definitely not disappointed. I paid just over $500 for the week and everything was great. The room was big, clean and comfortable. The restaurants all had good food at a reasonable price with no queueing. The pool was very nice while not being too fancy and with life guards on duty. There were even some shady spots to stay out of the 107 degree heat. All the staff I came accross were friendly and helpful and the Shuttle bus to The Strip was never crowded. If you're on a budget like me, make sure you pick up your free voucher book at reception as it gives some good discounts for food and drinks. I also registered with the Club Coast Slots Club and got almost $150 back by the time I left. Even the gambling was good and I spent far less than I had planned for playing video poker. I've stayed at a few other mid price casinos in Las Vegas but if you don't mind not being on The Strip, The Orleans is a great choice and i'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: pete707
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on trip advisor me and a friend decided to stay in the orleans for a week and i was'nt disappointed.I've stayed on the strip numerous times over the years and at first was a little concered that it was off the strip but my fears was soon gone. Everything you need is here in the Orleans,a giant bowling alley,an 18 screen cinema,a decent children's arcade,a decent irish bar,subway,TGI'S Fridays,one of the best buffets i've eaten at and many more eating establishments that looked very good.Everything here was cheaper than the hotels on the strip too from the cocktails by the pool to even the children's arcade.Here they do a shuttle to the strip but i took taxi's instead which was only $6-$10 which was fine.The swimming pool area was excellent too. Im glad i listened to Trip advisor so if you're thinking of staying here do it,you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel..”
Reviews.Author: WorcesterLucy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Orleans for 10 days in June this year thanks to the reviews on this website and had a fabulous time. I cannot understand the negative comments that are made by some people, yes the hotel is off the strip but I think this is actually a positive thing as there seemed to be more resturants and the hotel seemed calmer.. Having visited some of the other hotels on the strip that were around the same price tag that were offered when we booked the hotel, we were very grateful that we had chosed The Orleans. The casino area was large and spacious, being an ex-smoker I was concerned about the possible smokiness but can honestly say it never smelt smokey unless someone lit up next to me.. The machines I thought paid out well and the tables were only ever rammed on the weekend as was everywhere else on the strip. Check in was easy and the lifts are protected by a security guard so you must show your room key. The rooms were decorated in line with the French/Orleans theme and were plenty big enough, nice and clean with comfy beds, bathroom was also clean and spacious. Ate in the Prime Rib loft, TGI's, Courtyard Cafe, The Buffet and the Mexican making use of the vouchers given at check in and each time the food was lovely and plentiful. Having had breakfast at the Aladdin made us realise that our hotel was offering the same as those on the strip at half the price.. Cannot comment on the shuttle as we had our own vehicle but we did use the taxi service from outside of the hotel entrance which averaged around $10 to the strip. The staff were generally helpful but various individuals as with anywhere were not so hot on Customer Service. The pool area was lovely and the staff friendly. The voucher book that you are given at check in contains drink vouchers for the sister hotels but you can use them in The Orleans at any of the bars for free drinks. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Nice Accomadations!”
Reviews.Author: midnt911op
Reviews.Content: We spent June 1st-5th at the Orleans and had a very nice stay. We took my step-daughter and her best friend for their 21st birthdays and we all had a great time. We thought since it was their first time there, we would splurge and stay on the strip...I am glad we didn't. The prices of strip hotels were about triple what we paid at the Orleans. Granted, there were several conventions in town, but none were that big or well known. I would think places would have lower prices in summer (it was 105 during the day our whole stay!). So for what we paid at the Orleans, we were able to have our own room and the girls had their own room, which made it nice AND affordable. (We were able to spend the extra on tickets to go see "Mystere" by Cirque du Soleil at TI-definately worth the money!!) When we arrived (earlier than normal check-in time) I was told that one room was ready and the other would be shortly. It was no problem to take all our suitcases to one room to change and freshen up. We had requested (when we made reservation) to have rooms close to each other, and were pleased to find we had rooms right next to each other. I thought the check-in staff to be courteous and helpful. We received coupon books for discounts at the coffee stand, ice cream shop, Subway & for free drinks. There were so many coupons that we couldn't use them all! Rooms are large with and separate sitting area. Bathroom is well sized and clean. Never had a problem with water or fresh supply of towels. Vending machines had water & soft drinks. There were irons & ironing boards in the rooms alond with small hair dryers. There was a small coffee maker, although you have to pay after the first packet. There were several restaurants there along with a Subway, TGI Friday's (just opened in April). We also ate at the Courtyard Cafe-large portions, but fairly average breakfast. I wish I would have checked out the breakfast buffet. As far as restaurants we ate at (at other hotels) we really liked Sao Paolo Cafe at the Rio (breakfast & lunch during the week, 24 hrs on Fri & Sat.), the buffet at Mandalay Bay, the Rainforest Cafe at MGM. The portions are large at all the sit-down places we went-several times we split meals. We also ate at the Spice Market Buffet at the Alladin which was pretty good, but still liked Mandalay Bay's better. Nice PF Changs at the Alladin as well. The last night we were there we even took advantage of the bowling alley upstairs from the casino as something different to do! That was really fun and much bigger than I would have thought! (There was coupons for that in our "Fun Book" too.) We rented a car, so getting anywhere we wanted was never an issue. The covered parking lot/garage was popular since it was so hot out, but we were always able to find a spot. The pool was a great afternoon break from the casinos & sightseeing...lots of chairs/space and nice decor. They have towels available there so you don't have to bring your own. Also there were drinks and snacks available by the pool which was nice. (We only had drinks.) We drove out to Hoover Dam, took the tour, and enjoyed that as well. Don't waste your time waiting to see the "pirate" show at TI (Tresure Island) ...boring and cheesy. The fountain show at Bellagio was much better. Make sure if this is your first visit that you sign up for the various "slot clubs." We got bonus sign-up points, and even a free t-shirt (NIce!) at the Rio. The magazine "What's On" is the best source of info on happenings in Vegas. We found them free at several places. Also we went to Madame Tousseau's Wax Museum at the Venetian...really cool! (Watch for coupons in the vaious magazines!) Overall, would ABSOLUTELY stay at the Orleans again, no questions asked!

Reviews.Title: “Great room on the 20th floor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Orleans for 4 nights last June with my girlfriend. First, the valet service was excellent, never waited more than 2 minutes for service. Check in was a breeze, the coupon book was great. We stayed in the tower on the 20th floor for a bargain. We spent a lot of time at the Hotel rather than venturing off to the Strip or other places. We were quite pleased with the experience there that there wasn't much urge to always leave the hotel. The slots were pretty good to us, the cocktail waitress were always around, and we enjoyed the buffett there. We even took in a couple games of bowling during our stay. And the room we got was huge. Very clean, tidy, everything was nice. The bathroom was quite large. We had a room not facing the strip, so the view wasn't great, but there are rooms with views facing the strip. We returned to Vegas last month and wanted to try a different place. We wished we would have stayed here instead. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel/Casino”
Reviews.Author: staunchsteve
Reviews.Content: IF you are taking kids to Las Vegas, Orleans Hotel/Casino would be a good choice IF you want to stay in a Hotel/Casino. When room rates are around $50 a night, that is a GREAT value. There are a number of "family friendly" activities available at Orleans including a family oriented pool, bowling center, and movie theatres. They also have a day-care center on site, but you cannot leave the property when using it. Dining choices are good as Buffet is reasonable (use the 241 coupon), Prime Rib Loft serves good PR at CHEAP prices and Big Al's Oyster Bar is casual and good grub. The hotel rooms are larger than nearly all "standard" rooms in Las Vegas as they have two double beds or king bed and a sofa/sitting area in every room. Also, unlike nearly all of the large Vegas hotels with central heating/cooling that can't get the room cool, Orleans' rooms have nice, new, window units that BLAST cold air into the rooms. This is REALLY nice when its 100+ outside. It was 105 the day we checked in and the room temp was 68 degrees, awesome. Beds are comfortable, shower and bath area is fine and customer service throughout the hotel was efficient and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Solidly Average”
Reviews.Author: stpauligirlmn
Reviews.Content: Stayed June 7-10 2006. This hotel is solidly average. Decent, clean rooms. Average price/taste restaurants. Average staff/customer service. Nothing special, nothing horrible. The pool area is a little above average. It is lovely and the pool staff was very good. The bathroom door is a pocket door that is heavy and difficult to pull shut. Probably wouldn't work well for someone without much upperbody strength (elderly, wheelchair, etc). We enjoyed our stay and I would stay again. The most memorable thing was the price. Look for the really good mid-week specials. We got our room on Wednesday and Thursday night for $52. Friday jumped to $110. I would not pay more than $110/night for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Magnolia2
Reviews.Content: I paid 135 British pounds for 3 nights; a bargain. The room was clean and spacious , the decor grew on you. The staff were pleasant and helpful. We did not use the casino or pool, although it did look very attractive. We ate at the fish buffet which my husband thought was as good as the Bellagio. The use of shuttles was slightly inconvenient, but well worth the savings. I would definately go again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “One Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ken/Wen
Reviews.Content: Stayed from the 7th-12th May, 2006, and the following week, from the 15th to the 18th, and thoroughly enjoyed our time there. We requested a higher room and got the 13th floor first, and the 19th floor for our second stay. The beds were fine, we didn't find them uncomfortable at all. The rooms were large, with a small sitting area near the window. The bathroom was also fine, and quite large. The door to the bathroom is quite heavy, and it would be nice to have it situated between the toilet and sink area, but that would be a major reno, and actually the door style fit into the decor. The casino is fine, but coming from a Province where smoking is banned in most public places, and as we aren't smokers, it was difficult to get used to. But all the casinos are like that, so if you can't take the smoke, we suppose you shouldn't go to Las Vegas. The restaurants in the Orleans range from poor to excellent. The Court Yard Cafe was our worst experience. We went for breakfast, and had cold, thin toast, and poorly prepared eggs. (How do you botch up scrambled eggs?) We never went back. And for the price, you can eat at the Buffet, and get basic eggs, or omelets prepared as you like. And the price was almost the same. The Buffet was also great for dinner, with a wide selection, and a coupon for a cheap bottle of wine was also nice. The Italian restaurant was fabulous, with quality food, and large portions. And Don Miquels, the Mexican restaurant, was also very tasty on the one occassion we tried it. Terribles was also fast food, but was fine, expecially with the use of the coupon the hotel gives you. There is also Seattles Best Coffee, and a pastry location for a change of pace. The Pool was great, roomy and clean. And it stayed open until 7:00 PM. We rented a car for this trip, as in between visits at the Orleans, we drove to the Grand Canyon, so kept the car the entire time. So we never used the shuttle to get to the strip, but others did, and there wasn't any complaining that we heard of. And finally, Security was great. They were regularly in the parking lot, and were outside the elavator area, checking for room keys. Had a great experience there, and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Five of us (friends/couples age range 30-52) reserved two rooms at the Orleans from the 3rd to the 6th. We stayed on the 5th floor of the renovated tower which had updated amenities and a great bathroom. [Thanks to all of you for the reviews!] Took us about 24 hours to regulate the A/C so that we didn't freeze or blow hot air on ourselves. My husband brought a pillow based on some past reviews of this place, but I used them and they were fine - about what you would expect. We rented a car and used the covered parking garage in the back, which helped keep the car cool despite the 105+ degree heat we had every day. We ate only at the Courtyard Cafe at the Orleans (mostly for breakfast/brunch) while we spent the day sightseeing at other casinos. Food was fine, waitstaff great. In fact, everyone there on our stay ws gracious. Room keys tend to de-magentize sometimes - I had to re-key mine. We ate out at other places during the day (Bellagio buffet - always consistently great. Alladin Spice Market - good variety but very unevenly done food) and here's a tip: if you're like us we ended up eating more and richer foods than we usually do in our non-vacation time. One of our party suffered cramps but someone had brought along Immodium AD and things got better a lot faster. It probably doesn't help as effectively or quickly if you get food poisoning but if you're getting ready to indulge (food or drink), do you and your fellow travelers a favor and tuck a few medications in your suitcase! Here's what we liked the best: 1) Renting a car gave us the freedom to explore different parts of the Strip and Henderson. Since it was hot no one wanted to walk far. Even though we knew about the shuttle, we didn't use it, but we saw it in action. We didn't get downtown this trip. We've used public transportation on past trips here and have had surly, crabby drivers, and while it's not a bad way to get to where you need to go we much preferred the relatively stressless freedom of the car. (We did not drive on the Strip much but found all the back ways to get everywhere when possible). 2) We visited other casinos, from the Casino Royale, Alladin, Bellagio, Wynn, and the Palms, and even the Skyline Restaurant and Casino in Henderson (the restaurant apparently is a local favorite so on a whim we took a trip out there. It's the only place we gambled at that still takes coins). While we didn't expect all the same payouts or level of service, time and again we came back to the Orleans to gamble because the payouts seemed better, the cocktail waitresses were ALWAYS coming around (god bless 'em, and please tip them), and it was convenient and not pretentious. I won jackpot on the 5 cent video poker for about $265 and never quite won as much again, but more importantly, when I lost, I didn't lose big. At the end of trip we had breakfast in the Courtyard Cafe and used my Club Card slot points towards the bill - cut the bill in half and was a good way to redeem the points. 3) We saw "O" and scored first row balcony ticketsfor $99 by reserving 120 days in advance. It was the highlight of our trip. Face it, you can gamble that away and have no memory of what happened. Ask my husband. 4) Overall we had a great experience. We had stayed in the Luxor before this in April 2004 and found the Orleans to score consistently higher in value for the price. Before that we had stayed at the Golden Nugget and although we liked it alot, esp for the location, it was 110 degrees (August) and we didn't do a whole lot overall. We agreed that even though the hotel rates are attractive in the summer, we would rather come another time of year and get out of the city and explore Hoover Dam, Red Rock Canyon, Valley of Fire, Lake Mead, etc. It just didn't seem like a great idea on this trip. Next time, we will come another time of year, and get to Rio this time for the buffet. But, we'll definitely stay at the Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “a great time!”
Reviews.Author: doughboy97
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Orleans from may 29-june1. overall, we had a great time. check-in - we arrived on monday afternoon at 3:45pm and found the line rather long. however, the check-in counter was working to full capacity so the wait was rather short. food - big al's oyster bar - a great place for a simple lunch. try the boston clam chowder. meals come with bread service so this makes for a full meal at around $5-6. courtyard cafe - we tried the player's specials for steaks - prime rib was decent (although a bit bland) but the graveyard specials are definitely worth your money. don miguel's - we used a 2for1 for the fajitas - definitely get the steak, but the chicken was bland. buffet - another 2 for 1 coupon used here. the food is okay overall - nothing that really excels....with the possible exception being dessert. they had great dessert selection. (my recommendation for a budget buffet is the green valley ranch!!! it's the best!!!). pool - fairly spacious. we like to swim during twilight hours when the sun is about to set and it's less hot outside....there were plenty of lawn chairs available. spa - take advantage of the fun book and use the free spa admittance! it's a great way to start off the day or cap off an evening. gaming - it's huge. smoky? yes, but every casino in vegas is smoky. my advice is to bring some visine for your eyes and blow your nose every now and then. overall: all of the employees we interacted with were friendly and helpful. take advantage of the free cocktail coupons you'll get in the fun book...and know that you don't have to get liquor but juices and sodas as well. (we don't drink much so we enjoyed our fair share of pineapple juices!). all in all, the orleans is a great hotel at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, terrible casino”
Reviews.Author: Jeff42
Reviews.Content: Loved the room, room service and low price. Hated the casino payout. Great selection of machines but very tight. I will stay here again for the hotel value but play elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went in Orleans at May 20 to May 24, and I loved this hotel. The roons are very big and lovely, the bedroons are too. I asked about one roon with view, and received it, but in 5o. floor, where the view isn't very good, because it isn't high enough. I think this hotel is better than many hotels in Strip, but the location is not that good. But it isn't one problem , if you have a car. If you don't want stay in the Strip, it's a great option. I haved just one problem. The staff (one women) isn't very friendly on the check-in. Another problem: I saw the price is about U$ 60,00, and I payed U$ 129,00 per day. Probably because in the 20 to 23 May there was a convetion about Shopping Mall? I don't Know. I went to Paris one year ago, and payed the double, and stayed in a horror roon, in Champs Elysées. I and my husband, dinner in oyster restaurant in hotel, and liked very much, the meal is great, and the staff is very friendly. I loved the soup and my husband the oysters. Excuse my english, because I am brazilian women. Claudia Carvalho - São Paulo.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans is good,,but........”
Reviews.Author: theOLDFRED
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week (5/15-5/19, 2006) The rooms were nice, quite large and comfortable. Good large bathroom with a window in the shower. The Casino was really good with Friendly dealers and a good selection of machines. The Gambling floor seems to be somewhat quiter than alot of other casinos. We ate at the buffet on Wednesday evening about 6:00 pm. at 10:00 My wife had to go to the room with stomach cramps, about an hour later my daughter (grown) had to go to her room also. (we had two rooms). I did not have any problem since I had not eaten the same selection of food that they had. BOTH of them had severe diahrea and vomiting from Wednesday night till Friday morning when we had to catch a plane home. They stayed in the bed for Two nights and days. The hotel had NO support or assistance AT ALL ! all they suggested was for us to leave the hotel and go to a local clinic (Not possible when you have to go to lthe toilet every 5 minutes.) They did not have any doctor to call even to get advice and seemed not to care that we were having problems. They only suggested that we could get the phone book and see if we could find a doctor to come to the room but of course we would have to pay him. The only thing they did was to send security up to the room to fill out an "incidence report" without any offer of help or assistance of any kind. We visit Vegas a couple of times a year and try to stay in a different hotel each time. This was our first try in the ORLEANS and will probably be our last. They tore down our favorite place to stay....The Boardwalk

Reviews.Title: “unreponsive management”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we had no electricity or lights in bathroom, When called in to report was told maintenance would be right up. waited and finally went down to dinner, When we returned everything still the same and we called in again. We then went to casino and returned to find no electric again and called again. In the am we heard from front desk and we told them still no electric and we said not to send up anyone as we were not dressed. I asked about discount at check out and was told they sent up repair and reset electric so no discount. I paid full fare for bad room

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: davidd33
Reviews.Content: For the money, you can't beat this hotel. I believe it has the 2nd largest casino in town, and the hotel isn't enormous by strip standards. The staff I encountered were pleasant and helpful. The room was comfortable and spacious. I wasn't crazy about the mattress, but I slept just fine. Water pressure was just fine - but the water - in general - smelled and tasted kind of funny. Buy the bottled water in the gift shop - the big bottle was only $1.79. I tried to buy the exact same bottle on the strip - $3.50! Yikes! Now, I do have something to say - but it's just a general comment after reading ALL the reivews. Please do NOT bring your children to Vegas. I know this can be a challenge - but leaving them with the Grandparents is far better - for you AND your kids. I was privy to eating in the Cafe around 11:00pm with screaming children - very young kids - and who could blame them? They just can't process that must visual/audio input. Don't get me wrong. I love kids - but Vegas isn't the place for them - on ANY level. My other comment is about smoking. It's everywhere in Vegas - and it's LEGAL - everywhere in Vegas. If you have extremely strong feelings on the subject - don't go to Vegas. You'll make yourself miserable. I did notice The Orleans has a decent filtration system - so unless you're sitting next to a major puffer - you really don't notice it. Bottom Line: I have nothing bad to say about my trip and my stay at The Orleans - we'll be staying there - again - next year. Thanks, Orleans, for a great time. You may keep my losses - until next time.....Ha!Ha!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for its price”
Reviews.Author: lvpool
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this hotel during the 2006 Memorial Day weekend. Good: The room is very spacious. The pool is adquately spacious. There are ample parking spaces. All the hotel employees were very friendly. Nothing stands out as an outstanding, but everything was very good. Can't beat the price. Bad: We are from CA and we are not used people smoking. So we had some problem adjusting to the smoking environment. We went to the Cafe and it was kind of greasy for our taste. Being off strip, driving was inconvenient. Ugly: The corridor that leads from the parking lot to the hotel is not very well maintained. All the pools are 3.5" deep at most. So for those of us who have children, it is great. But for singles, I can imagine this being a problem. I had a view of dessert. Overall, nothing stands out for this hotel, but it is a very good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Cheap Prices”
Reviews.Author: rubtub
Reviews.Content: Stayed here May 2006, from Saturday to Wednesday. Had a great time. Orleans is an excellent resort for downright silly prices. Really nothing bad to say: - Big rooms. Choose the king bed. - My wife, not a gambler, loved the penny slots. - Their fancy restaurant, Canal Street, was delicious gluttonous fun. - Cheap buffet, Only had the breakfast, but for $6.45, huge selection. Mexican eggs benedict and chorizo sausage on the menu! - Fast casino waitresses don't let you go dry - and hey, nice outfits. - Frequent free shuttle (don't forget to tip the guy) to the fabulous Barbary location. Barbary is at the Bellagio/Caesar/Ballys Paris corner. - Cheap! Coast hotel promo, $49 for our Sunday and Monday nights. - Nice pool area. Nice pool area jacuzzi. Ok, ok, ok. One bad thing. No history list at the roulette wheel. What the heck. Orleans is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Maeve1
Reviews.Content: One reviewer said "old rooms"? You've got to be kidding! Our room was the largest and nicest room we've stayed at in Vegas. It was well appointed, with beautiful bathroom fixtures and an added loveseat for comfort. The hotel is new, and the decor is really pretty. There was nothing "old and worn" about the Orleans. We thought the staff was very courteous, and the slots were pretty swinging. BTW, we just returned today (May 27), and I can honestly say we'd stay there again if we could. The Orleans is close to the Excalibur and is not that far from the strip. Parking is no trouble and I would definitely recommend the Orleans to anyone looking for a wonderful hotel stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fligster
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orleans from May 14, 2006 until May 20,2006. We were traveling with our 19 month old, so we booked a 1 bedroom suite. It was a little pricey, but hard to find suites with a physically separate bedroom, that is the main reason we chose the Orleans, also that it had a Movie Theater on site. The Suite was a little dated, but very large. There is a living room area with a full size wet bar with stools etc, also a dining room type table. The bedroom was quite large and had a small desk. The bathroom is very LITTLE. Barely big enough for the toilet and shower/tub. The sink is outside the bathroom in the bedroom area. The tub has a very high ledge you need to step into, which was annoying, especially since room was tight. The suite was on the 20th floor that you needed to use your room key in the elevator and at a gate on the floor. There were consistently problems with the key working in elevators and the gate. I heard the same from others staying on the floor. Maid service was great. We were up early because of our kid, we would leave and come back around 10am, and the room was always cleaned. All of the staff we encountered were helpful and extremely nice, we didn't have any issues with service.
