We arrived around 1pm on a Saturday, checkin was a little slow, they only had 3 people at the desk. The buffet was pretty good for the price, as well as the courtyard cafe (open 24 hours). TGI Fridays and Subway are in the hotel as well. Seatles Best is a good place to get coffee and muffins etc (no doughnuts). They open at 5 am. There is a KidsTyme childcare on site. We didn't use it because of our childs age, but wanted to clear up some stuff. There is various amounts of info on different web sites and books. They take children from 3-9 years of age, they must be potty trained. Also, you have to have immunization records. The facility looked like it would be really cool. We didn't have any issues with walking through the casino (here or anywhere else in Vegas) with our 19 month old. As long as you keep moving and don't loiter or try to gamble. The Casino is ok, not a great selection of newer slot machines. Table games are cheap most of the time. My luckiest machines were the hot shots progressive machines. The comp system is pretty stingy, compared to other casinos in Las Vegas and Atlantic City. Get the free coupon book when you check in, there are percent off coupons for subway, gift shop, seatles best etc. The pool area is pretty basic, but was a good place to hang out, especially since it was 100 degrees while we were there. We parked outside once, there were grasshoppers all over the car in the morning. Park in the garage behind the hotel by the orleans arena. When you come out of the elevators from the garage, it is a long walk through the casino around to the rooms. There are unmarked exit doors in the large hallway at the end, if you walk through them, you cut through a courtyard and end up by the gift shop.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoCalTrekker
Reviews.Content: I am quite surprised at the good reviews posted on this site about the Orleans. My wife and I stayed at the Orleans last year based on the price offered ($100/weekend night) and the good ratings from this site. Thought we were getting a good deal until we got to Vegas Location: The Orleans is way off the Strip. It was not a problem for us because we had a car. Since the Tram not up in July 2005, I don't know if it goes to the Orleans. The location is a little hard to get to if you're not familar with Vegas. Hotel: The Exterior: Very dated. It has very little of the glamour and lights that I associate with Vegas. Felt like I was pulling up to a Convention Center. The Interior: Ironically, the inside of the Orleans is gawdy and loud (both in sound and in color). Best described as Mardi Gras gone wrong (very wrong). The interior felt dated and old. Check-In: Standard check-in, no problems. Room: Probably the worst part of the Hotel. The rooms are extremely old and looks like a room at Motel 6. The bathroom was also old with a old-style tub and antiquated fixture. I understand that some of that is due to the hotel's motiff but still look tacky. Our room overlook the service entrance. Casino: Didn't gamble here, too much smoke. Overall, the Orleans was drabby and old. While I understand if college students like it for the price, my recommendation is to pay a little more and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Management needs customer service training!”
Reviews.Author: jscs
Reviews.Content: After a 5 hour trip, I arrived at the Orleans with my confirmation information in hand and was told that ALL of our reservations had been cancelled. I had to wait over one hour before the mixup was straightened out. I know these things happen sometime but what I did not like about the staff at Orleans is that they did not make any moves to assist me in facilitating the problem but made me do all the legwork and would only accept a fax from the internet travel agent as confirmation that I had made these reservations. They made ME do all the calling on my cellphone and did not offer a phone for me to use. I was not given any compensation for the inconvenience that all 8 in my party suffered. I reserved 4 rooms. My friends and I (8 persons) waited over one hour at the reservation guest, were made to verify with my cellphone that indeed I did have 4 reservations and yet I was treated as if this was a normal way that business was done at that hotel. Definitely not a customer friendly atmosphere. The rooms were nice but the inconvenience of having to take a tram back and forth to the strip, the waiting time that was involved, and the bad customer service are not worth the slightly cheaper prices. I will not be spending my money at the Orleans in the future and would advise others not to stay there either. Management and Reservations has a lot of improvements to make in customer service and relations.

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel off the strip”
Reviews.Author: mccorky
Reviews.Content: Stayed May 6th-10. This was our second stay. Very good food and low limit tables. Loved the pool and room was clean. Security everywhere, so no safety concerns. Make sure you visit Kojo for Chinese food. It is fantastic with excellent service. Miguels and the buffet were also very good. We will be staying here for future stays. Oh and the shuttle service is very reliable. A long wait is 15 minutes, but if you time it right, it is sometimes only a few minutes. A great place overall.

Reviews.Title: “What Fun”
Reviews.Author: pris63
Reviews.Content: The Orleans provides a fairly inexpensive place to stay and yet it is close to the strip. You can catch the shuttle and ride to the BC and visit all of the casinos. The rooms are spacious, clean and with the window in your shower you can see the strip lit up at night. There are some situations with cleaning (ash trays full) and just cleaning in general in the gambling area and there are not enough people to assist you with any problems you have while using the machines. The staff was very helpful in making reservations for dinner and providing information. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it all!!”
Reviews.Author: SoriaRae
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because of the price. Coming back in a week to get married-staying again. Hotel was super. All was super. Easy check-in-friendly staff, GREAT slots.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, enjoyed every minute of the Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: T00nTravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights at the beginning of May 2006. We've stayed here before a couple of times and never been disappointed. Check in and check out was speedy. Room was clean and tidy with a pool view. Coupon books issued at check in were great for free cocktails, beers and such and for discounts at the on-site restaurants and coffee shop. Used the shuttle bus to the Barbary Coast a few times and didn't have to wait more than 5 minutes at either end. Played the slots in the casino a little and found them to be quite "loose". Got free show tickets to see Gordon Lightfoot in the Orleans Showroom. Ate in Don Miguels Mexican restaurant, was OK but not brilliant. TGI Fridays on the other hand was great, ate there three or four times, food was excellent. The Lounge bands were very good and the Cocktail waitresses were swift with the free drinks whilst gambling. To sum up, a great stay, enjoyed it thoroughly and wouldn't hesitate to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the price, the Orleans Hotel was a great deal. Not far from the strip at all. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Staff on hand were pleasant. Casino was fun to play in - never played anywhere else. Won enough to be able to have fun and just keep playing. Would definitely stay at the Orleans again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 2 night stay at the Orleans. Paid $10 extra for a room with a great view of the mountains. The room was very clean. The pool and jacuzzi were fantastic and also very clean. Had fun seeing a movie at their movie theater and going bowling twice. The bowling lanes are open 24 hours! Took advantage of the free shuttle bus ride over to the Barbary Coast on the strip. It's right across from Caesar's Palace. The graveyard specials in the cafe are an excellent deal. Had steak and eggs for $3.45 and it was one of the best steaks I've had in a long time. Everyone that worked there that I talked to was very pleasant and helpful. I'll look forward to staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best little deal in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Gourmand
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orleans May 4-8, 2006. This is a budget hotel but I was nicely surprised. First of all the room was very clean. Nicely decorated. Every room has a nice view of Vegas. Elevators are quick and there is great security - no one gets on an elevator unless they have a room key. As a woman alone I greatly appreciated this aspect. I had a room with 2 double beds. Crisp sheets. My only complaint was the mushy bed. But I slept fine every night. Skimpy pillows, but they didn't bother me. Superb working air conditioner. It was extremely quiet. I could not even hear my friends in the room next door at all! Never heard anyone below or above me. This is all important to me when traveling. The room was spacious and included a cute living area with couch and coffee table, lamps, etc. Bathroom included dressing area. All very clean. Cable TV and web hook ups. I ordered up a refrigerator (also very clean) for $15 extra per night. Room had iron and board. There is a TGIF restaurant downstairs, a bowling alley, movie theaters, and an adequate cafe and buffet. Although I liked the cafe much better than the buffet, the breakfast buffet was only $6.99 and had everything from biscuits and gravy to eggs benedict to pancakes and waffles and chinese and mexican food too! Parking was free except for the tips. Bellmen were quick and efficient and friendly. I tried room service once and it was fast and server was very nice. Found out later from taxi drivers that all the "Coast Hotels" (Orleans, South Coast, Barbary Coast and Gold Goast) have the best gambling. I believe it. I gambled every night and won more than I played every time. Loved those Monopoly games! There is a shuttle between the coast hotels for free every 30 minutes. For the price and cleanliness and safety - I highly recommend. Only a short drive to the strip. One block from the Rio.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: Here There and Everywhere
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans for just one night before a circle tour around the Grand Canyon, but it was a winner! The woman at the front desk upgraded us to a suite, which was great (hey, 5 phones, 4 tvs, a wet bar, a dining room, and a great view!) We enjoyed the "graveyard special" in the 24/7 restaurant (full breakfast for $2.45 ... but watch out for the coffee and juice prices...). We also got a little lucky at the slots. We would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans Was Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Orleans from May 4 through May 6. Our Rooms were good...beds were a little hard, but the rooms were clean and the maids did a good job. The slots are not that loose, but I played Craps mostly. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at The Orleans. Positive - Check-In was quick - Hotel restaurants are very good Negatives - The lights they have setup that highlight the Exterior of the Hotel...they completely brighten up your room at night. - Smokey...but what casino isn't.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to stay at in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: rranger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans from March 19 to the 23rd, 2006 at a price of around $67 per night + tax, from a i4vegas--- website. The rooms were big...like a suite...very clean. Depending on where your room is, you may have to walk a bit to get there, as the property is huge. We enjoyed a movie at their own movie theater, and bowled one evening at their huge bowling alley. My son & nephews (ages 9 to 21) enjoyed the facilities. They also have several places to eat...from coffee at Seattle's Best...to a Subway...to their buffets at their own restaurants. Parking was free, and they have a shuttle that takes down to the strip & drops you off / picks you up at their sister Barbary Coast hotel. All in all...a very good hotel. We would stay here again on a future Vegas visit. :)

Reviews.Title: “Don't know why this ranked so high...”
Reviews.Author: mrsfig
Reviews.Content: Let me just give you a short and sweet review...check-in was fairly quick, the room was nicely decorated and roomy, the casino is very smoky. The night entertainment was pathetic, the pool was cold but the spa is nice and has shade. This might be a good place if you take kids because then you could go bowling, see a flick or take them to the day care. We didn't eat there at all because we prefer the buffet at Rio and other local places. We paid $130 a night and I can't say I will return. We drive to Vegas so distance is not an issue. We stayed at The Golden Nugget last summer which I much prefer. Overall, an ok hotel but only if you get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite”
Reviews.Author: 2b
Reviews.Content: We are Orleans lovers. It has everything we are looking for while being in Las Vegas. The staff is wonderful, food is above average and the layout is easy to feel comfortable with. As we always rent a car the location is not an issue. We spend time exploring the area and come back for a soak in the pool. We just came back and while we didn't have a room in the new wing our re-furbished room had a beautiful strip view which we gazed on on each day while lounging in the sitting alcove. I recommend this hotel to friends coming to LV - they are telling others.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanadianPhotographer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderfull stay at The Orleans Hotel, The room was very clean and tidy, & had nice decor, the service was outstanding! The Casino downstairs is very large and convenient with a whole bunch of restaurants, the pool area was fabulous. lots of free parking. One thing I didn't care for was the foam mattress (memory foam?) beds, I found them too warm and uncomfortable to get a good nights sleep on.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views of the entire strip”
Reviews.Author: youngerbrother
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans one night 4/25 after deciding to add a night to our visit and our other hotel was booked full. We had a strip view room and the view is something special you really can't get staying on the strip. We were beat after flying in and and sat in the room eating excellent take out sushi from downstairs and watched the city come alive as the lights came on. Room, food, service all great for the price. Only thing is, the Orleans is not on the strip, so its just not the same atmosphere as other places we have stayed. To me Vegas is the strip and so would never want to stay at the Orleans very long and only if also had a few nights on the strip. Did not use the pool area, although it looked nice enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great priced hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: 600wkm
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on previous reviews, & we were definately not disappointed. Our room was on the 17th floor (non smoking) and overlooked the strip, & what a view we had. The room was very spacious, with a decent sized bathroom & power shower. The beds were very comfortable, however the making of the bed left alot to be desired. We remade it ourselves eash night. There was no fridge in the room which was disappointing, but one of those things. The Reception & casino were very smokey in comparriosn to other hotels on the strip, but this has been pointed out in many of the other reviews, so it did not come as a shock. The Reception staff were very attentive, & i never waited in line more then 3 minutes to see anyone. The pool was of a very good size, & there was plenty of lounges & chairs avaliable. The one critisism i do have is the shuttle bus waiting area outside the hotel. There is NO queing system. So, on several occassions after waiting for the shuttle for 10 mins, people who had just arrived would push in & jump on the shuttle before us, leaving us stranded for the nxt bus to arrive. Saying that though, the shuttles were very frequent. I would suggest that The Orleans consider a queing system similar to Disney attraction rides, so there can be no pushing in & people can ride the shuttle on first come first serve basis. I would definately stay here again & would not hesitate in recommending it to anyone else. Well done The Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Orleans and found it to be a wonderful value for Las Vegas. While the Strip hotels are nice they are way over-priced for the size of the rooms. I am a travel agent and I chose the Orleans from a friends reccommendation who had stayed there before. She was right. The rooms are extra large compared to the Strip hotels and the price was incredibly reasonable. They had excellent food and if anything the portions were too big for one person. We split out entrees and still got plenty to eat. The beds were comfortable and the hotel was very clean. Being off the strip was not a problem as they provide a free shuttle service to their other properties one of which is right in the middle of everything on the Strip. So we were able to get around for free. They have a bowling alley for families that are tired of the expensive shows and a movie theatre showing first run movies. I would definetly reccommend it to my clients who want to save money on their rooms in order to have more to spend in the casino and on the very varied shows in Las Vegas. I also reccommend the Cirque Du Soliel "O" and "Tony & Tina's Wedding". I didn't know bargains like the Orleans still existed in Las Vegas, but I will stay there again. Excellent service as well. I only had one problem and that was the room next door had a late night and very loud argument one night and when I called hotel security they were right on it and it was dealt with immediately. I heard them tell the occupants that they were bieng asked to quiet down and if they had to come back up there they would be evicted. The problem stopped immediately. Great place to stay and eat.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation review”
Reviews.Author: usna81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on the good reviews on Tripadvisor. Would not stay there again however. My review is slanted toward a family spring break vacation, which is probably different than most visitors to LV. We were not there to gamble. We visited Hoover Dam, hiked at Red Rocks, drove the strip, and saw a show. The casino area, which also housed all restaurants and the front desk, was very stale smelling. The hotel itself, was okay, but since it was less costly, there tended to be a few too many cutoff shorts and tattoos for our liking. The pool was big and heated, so we enjoyed that. But in the future, we'd probably pay the extra dollars and stay somewhere nicer and closer to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “beds like rocks”
Reviews.Author: RochesterNewYorkMay
Reviews.Content: We decided to try a hotel off the strip since we had stayed on the strip so many times. The price was right, a Thursday for $39.00 and Friday for $120.00. The check-in went fine but it is a long walk to the elevator if you don't come in the front door. The room was not as fancy as some Las Vegas hotels but not at all bad. There was a love seat in the room with a coffee table and desk. The bathroom was fairly large with the sink and shower all in one room. If you like a hard bed , this is the place for you! Also, note exactly where you parked your car because the spaces are not marked in any way, shape or form or you will end up riding around with the security guard tyring to make your car alarm go off....Staying off the stip was not a problem at all since we had a car and it was just a couple of minutes drive to the strip. Well, except coming back from the strip at rush hour. We always like the buffet at the hotel and actually for the price, find it better than the one at the Aladdin. The quality of the food at the Aladdin may be just a bit better but not for double the price. All in all, if the price were right I would stay again, if not, I like the Monte Carlo better.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, a terrific value”
Reviews.Author: PromoTheRobot
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is exactly what everyone says it is. A great hotel at a great price. It's not The Wynn or Bellagio, but you get an awful lot for the price you pay. Many nice restaurants. (I loved Terrible Mike's...great burgers!) Lovely pool area, bowling alley, 18 screen movie theatre, name entertainment, spa and workout room, all for about what you'd pay to stay at a Days Inn in Peoria. They have a free shuttle that runs to the Barbary Coast Casino right in the heart of the Strip. Here one thing I loved that no one ever talks about: the elevators. I stayed here 4 nights, and I never had to wait more than 6 seconds for an elevator, either on the ground floor or on the eighth floor! When you are on a 10min break in a poker tourney, you can get to your room and back in plenty of time. If you are a hockey fan, the minor league Vegas Wrangler play at the 8,000-seat arena attatched to the hotel. The only knock, and it's a knock on any casino, is the faint odor of cigarette smoke. It's everywhere. The Orleans is not smokey by any means, but you just can't get away from the scent of burned tobacco. But that's true of any casino, and most of Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 day stay @ The Orleans. Okay, I frequent Vegas quite a bit because I have family that have moved out there. I have tried to stay off the strip and in "express"-type hotels and it's always more per nite than staying in a casino. So my wife and I thought we would take a chance on The Orleans after the reading the reviews on TripAdvisor. I'm very well-traveled and have stayed in everything from tents in Alaska, youth hostels in remote parts of Eastern Europe, local hotels in Mexico, and luxury suites in London, etc... We've been to Vegas about 15 times now all together and I have to say, staying at The Orleans was the best experience we've ever had. Truly and overall. Extremely clean and spacious rooms. Nice pool with bar. Affordable spa packs. Friendly, eager-to-please staff, gracious hospitality, killer buffet and food (Monday is seafood nite and Wednesday is steak nite!). Awesome black jack tables and beautiful and friendly cocktail servers (quick too, if you tip well!). They have a 70 lane bowling alley, movie theater and ice hockey rink. We actually saw a Steven Wright comdy show there and bumped in to him while bowling a couple of hours before the show. Funny guy. What a great time! This is the real deal. The local flavor. I will never stay anywhere else when I visit Vegas. The strip is for amateurs, The Orleans is for regulars. Done!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, out of Strip”
Reviews.Author: HubertW
Reviews.Content: A very big hotel with very big, but cosy rooms. Good service, great buffet. Sometimes it is hard to park a car... You can get a free shuttle to the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful large rooms with a spectacular view”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Vegas before but my brothers and parents had dozens of times! So I figured they knew all the best places to stay. We agreed to meet in Vegas and I booked our rooms at The Orleans. We were all blown away on how nice the hotel was! My brothers compared The Orleans to all the places they stayed at before and they say they will always stay at The Orleans for on now! The rooms are huge and we each had a spectacular view of Las Vegas (We reserved 8 rooms)! The kids loved the pool area and so did we! I'm so glad we didn't get a place on the strip! There was a mass of people on the 4th of July celebration and we couldn't have got out of our motel if we had been on the strip! When you have kids, you always have to get more diapers and juice! Anyway, the place is really nice and clean and worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: texasyellowrose
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days in April, 2006. I was kind of leary of the hotel because a lot of the reviews I had read were over a year old and I know a lot can happen in a year. We had an awesome room rate (AARP) and the hotel and rooms were everything they were said to be. I had seen pictures on the net, but I figured those great rooms were for the 'high rollers'---of which we are not. But we got a room that looked just like one of the pictures. We had a king size bed, with a 25" TV (not a big choice in TV channels, but hey--did I go there to watch TV??? NOT!!) Several people commented about the doors into the bathroom and I didn't quite understand what they meant, but after seeing it, I do. You have a door that goes into a room that has the sink/counter, place to put your suitcases and hang clothes, then you have another room off that with the toilet and shower/tub. There is no door separating the 'sink room' from the 'shower room'. There is also no hot lamp or any way to heat that room (other than turning on the room heat) unless you turn on the blow dryer and lay it on the floor. As it is everywhere, there is a long walk from where you park inside to your room. Someone else mentioned parking in the parking garage which is a good idea--you don't have to walk all the way through the casino that way.. The parking garage is around back behind the arena. They gave us a fun book on checkin (which was smooth at 3 PM) and in there was a coupon for french fries and a Pepsi (Pepsi owns that town by the way---not a Coke or Dr Pepper in site)with the purchase of a sandwich at Terrible Mikes, which is in the casino. So that was our dinner. We each ordered a hamburger for about $3.69 I think and used the coupon---well unless you are really hungry, skip using the coupon and just order the burger and a drink--that thing was HUGE and for us, we could have ordered 1 and split it and it would have been enough. But it was so good!!! And the fries??? They were huge too--they are in a little cardboard box and it was full to overflowing--there was enough FF in 2 orders for 4 hungry teenagers. Be sure whereever you go, get the players cards, earn your points---if you get enough, you can cash in the points for your meals and other things. We actually only bought at full price about 3 meals the whole time we were there--the rest were comped 100% or a couple we had 2 for 1 on the buffet. Oh yeah, the Courtyard Cafe--for breakfast, they bring you little squares of coffee cake-like an appetizer-it is really delicious. This Hotel is about 3 miles off the strip, it is well decorated in the Mardi Gras theme and we would consider staying there again. On the way in--the highway that is going through/over/around Hoover Dam is under construction until 2008---you can still get through on the crowded 2 lane road as before, but they are building a highway that will bypass the Hoover Dam. I saw a sign somewhere that said no trucks or buses allowed--they have to go down another highway out of Kingman and pass Laughlin to get into Vegas--but I did see some trucks and a bus going through there--but it didn't take too long to get through all that.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Boztel
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Orleans (second visit here) on 16 Apr. Found the room to be clean with an excellent view of the strip. Utilized the coupon book to maximum advantage receiving free drinks and discounts in the resturants and food courts. The great availability of five dollar BJ tables is a plus for an occasional gambler like myself. Used the hotel shuttle to go to the strip and returned via cab ($12). The room savings (as compared to Strip hotels) allowed us to have an excellent dinner while in town. Highly recommend using this hotel/casino if room cost is a factor in your decision on where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing bad to report about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Honey11
Reviews.Content: We(hubby and two kids ages 12 and 9) stayed at the Orleans 4/10 - 4/14 based on the reviews from others on Tripadvisor. Like the majority wrote,this is an excellent place to stay. It has everything you would need in a hotel. We checked in around noon and I requested a room in the newer towers near the elevator and got it. I have high standards when it comes to hotel rooms and the Orleans met them. Very clean, spacious and comfortable. Nice size hotel, the mega hotels on the strip are much too big and a chore to get around in, especially with kids. Only warning, if paying with cash, the coffee pot is not available to you. First cup free, after that, at a fee if you paid for the room by credit card. Pool nice, resturants average and reasonable. Kids enjoyed the arcade upstairs. Massage at spa was good. Security was nice to see. If we are ever in Vegas again, would not hesitate to stay at the Orleans. Nice escape from the hustle bustle of the crowd and traffic on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Overrated and Do Not Expect Comps”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've read the reviews and noticed that they fall under two categories: Either it's a glowing endorsement; or a horrific pan. After staying there for a couple of nights during a weeklong Vegas trip, I think I may understand why. And that's why this review falls under the category of horrific pan. I've been going to Vegas regularly for the past 7 years and have stayed at Excalibur, MGM Grand, Paris, Aladdin, Circus Circus, and now The Orleans; and The Orleans is the most disappointing by far. The Strip hotels compete ferociously for your dollar and will most definitely reward a good player with generous comps including room, food, and show tickets. The Orleans is off-strip and is apparently targeted to locals and those who may not be "serious players." For example, during our stay at The Orleans, we played as consistently as we have at the above-mentioned Strip hotels and whereas we would get rooms comped and food comped at these hotels (for example, at the Aladdin, we were given show tickets that had a total face value of over $350), The Orleans would only offer us a grand total of $36 off of our bill; they wouldn't even comp our room after we had put in several thousand dollars of play in their very smoky casino (and no, we didn't walk away with any winnings). So basically, our experience was that we got a much better value staying at the "more expensive" hotels on the Strip, than the more "value-conscious" Orleans. Ironic, huh? What's also odd about the reviews is that if you're visiting Vegas from out of town, then why wouldn't you stay at the Strip? After all, that's where the "Vegas" attractions are. Sure you can get a bowling alley and a movie theater in the hotel with the Orleans; but you don't get the Bellagio fountains; the Eiffel Tower with the breathtaking views from the top; the roller coaster at NYNY; the amazing shops at Caesars Palace and Aladdin's Desert Passage; the pirate show at TI; the Dolphin Habitat and White Tigers at the Mirage; the Shark Reef at Mandalay Bay; and not to mention the four- and five-star restaurants to choose from. I mean, I'm sorry but I've got a movie theater and a bowling alley where I live. Why would I fly to Vegas just to go bowling and see a movie there? Again, where's the value for the Vegas vacationer? If you're going to Vegas to see how human ingenuity and drive could create such an amazing metropolis of light and sound in the middle of the desert, then you need to pay a little extra (and probably not even that much extra) and find a place to stay on the Strip. If you just want a cheap place to stay where your kids can be amused so that you can do a little gambling without having to be inconvenienced by the fact that you need to go outside, then the Orleans is for you. And if you're going to be doing any gambling at all, then make sure to sign up for those casino players cards. All the casinos keep track of every penny you play and whether you win or lose, as long as you show a willingness to play, you will get rewarded. With all the consolidation going on, there aren't that many cards that you have to sign up for. For example, the Mandalay Group owns Mandalay Bay, Excalibur, Luxor and CircusCircus. So if you sign up for their One card, you get rewards that can be used in any of their hotels. Depending on your level of play, you may not be able to get comps for their top-level property of Mandalay Bay, but you may find you can easily get nights and/or food at Excalibur, CircusCircus or Luxor. The group that the Orleans belongs to has only one property on the Strip, The Barbary Coast. You should go and read the reviews for them and see how they're rated to get a truer, apples-to-apples comparison of the Coast properties and other Las Vegas hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and casino - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Loll
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in April (me, husband and son). The location is off-strip - so to get the best out of your stay you need a car. They do run a shuttle bus which takes you to the Strip but this is very popular. The hotel is a great place to stay. The rooms are large and comfortable. Check in was quick and efficient. There is security at the elevators which means that only hotel guest can get to the floors with rooms, swimming pool etc which give a feeling of extra security. Our room was spotlessly clean and housekeeping did an excellent job each day and were very helpful when we asked for extra's for our room. There is a 18 screen cinema, 70 lane bowling alley, games rooms, lovely swimming pool etc - so there was plenty to keep our teenager occupied, which can be a problem in some of other Vegas hotels due to the 21 age limit in the casinos (under 21's can't "loiter or linger" in casino or bar areas!). Take advantage of the book of coupons you get on arrival - free cocktails, discounts on some of the restaurants and a $1 bet at Keno (I won $160 on my first bet). If it's your first time gambling - go down in the morning when it's quiet and the staff are quite happy to take you through the ropes on whatever game takes your fancy, but don't do this on a busy night when the serious gamblers are around! If it's your first time to Vegas and you want to be in the thick of it, or you don't want to hire a car, then probably you'd be better off on the Strip. But, if you want a good value hotel, with very comfortable rooms and excellent facilities - which is a little less frantic as it's away from the Strip - then this would be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Customer for life of the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: mfalv
Reviews.Content: My wife booked this hotel and I must say, the hotel was GREAT! It seems this hotel really goes out of the way to offer something special since it is not on the strip. They convinced me. We arrived at 11 pm, exhusted from a Grand Canyon trip. My wife checked in and the desk person, Marc from Toronto, upgraded us to a suite. When we got to the room with the two kids... WOW! Two bedrooms, two baths, view of the mountains (who cares about looking at the strip). This outstanding employee did something nice to persons he did not know and made a customer for life. Also they gave us a coupon book loaded with comps and discounts. Want to go to the strip, take the free shuttle to the sister property, Barbary Coast, and back. It located across from Bellagio. Wait times 20 minutes. Everyone was friendly, food was real good everywhere (Terrible Mikes was yum). Pool was good; no special frills but nice. To sum up... Great service, clean rooms, great value and HIGHLY RECOMMENDED by a family of four from New Jersey. Believe me, if I found something that was bad, I would be writing this whole article about it... but I could not complain about one thing.

Reviews.Title: “First time at the Orleans but many times in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Lernie
Reviews.Content: I live in Southern California and have been going at least once a year to Vegas for the last 25 years. I have always stayed at hotels in the Strip; from Circus Circus to Mandalay Bay. I recently started using Tripadvisor for my other trips and found it to be accurate and helpful so I decided to use it this time for my trip to LV and found out about the Orleans being ranked #2 at the time. I booked two nights during the busy Springbreak weekend and got rates of 120 a night for Friday and Saturday through Orbitz. I had an open mind but was hoping to be surprised. Firsthand I liked the parking being in front of the hotel (plus covered parking on back). Check-in was a breeze and got a nice room with a King in a non-smoking floor (floor 19). I also got two coupon books at check-in that included two free beers and a cocktail plus other freebies and discounts. There is also a liquor store inside with reasonable priced beer and booze. They had just opened a TGI Fridays and ate there twice. They have happy hour prices for appetizers daily and domestic drafts are 2.50 all day. There was also a leaflet in my room offering 2 free tickets (regularly 39.00) for their headliner that night (Rich Little). I went to sleep that first night a very happy guest. Next day I tried their free shuttle to the strip and took it back to my nice room for a nap with no problems. Later that night I drove my own car to see a concert (less than five minutes away) at the Mandaly Bay. Overall, I loved the stay and will recommend this place to anyone who'll listen. Definitively worth giving it a shot.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans is a Good Choice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First I picked The Orleans based on this web site's writeups, so thank you to everyone for taking the time. My family (10yr. and 14yr. old girls) and I checked in on Sunday (4/9) and stayed through Friday (4/14). Check in was a breeze, we were even let in to our room 2 hours ahead of their posted check-in time of 3pm. Their standard room is over sized with sitting area and had an excellent pool view. We all thought the beds were comfortable, even though there were too few pillows (good thing the kids brought their own). The room was clean and maid service was consistent. One note is that there is not an in-room safe which I always appreciate. Ironing board, hair dryer, etc. were there. This is your standard hotel room, not a 5 star resort - so make sure your expectations are realistic. Property overall was nice. The pool area was fantastic - nice spa, warm pool, good mix of shade and sun, nice people. Dennis, at the pool bar, was an awesome bartender. Valet was packed and very slow, so I self parked in the garage which was always empty and closer to the hotel elevators than valet anyways. We took advantage of the movie theater, arcade and bowling alley - which made this a nice 'family' spot. Still had time to hit the tables after the kids went to sleep. The French Market Buffet had the best breakfast buffet I have ever had. Lunch and Brunch were mediocre at best. The smoked/BBQ pork ribs on Sunday were excellent and then on Friday they were so-so. About the only complaint I had was that on Friday we showed up at 10:05 AM ready to eat that awesome breakfast buffet (joe's special eggs if you like spinach) and found the buffet closed until the lunch seating at 11 AM. Sazio was the only other restaurant we tried and it was reasonably priced and good, but nothing special. Check out was easy. I used the business center for printing boarding passes a day ahead of time which was convenient too.

Reviews.Title: “Best Secret In Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Nanatraveler
Reviews.Content: I returned from a stay at the Venetian yesterday and I have discovered an interesting observation. The rooms and the hallways and the security all are very similar to the rooms at the Orleans!!!!!! Imagine a $20.00 room versus a $199.00 room and the similarities are amazing. Orleans has beautiful bathrooms, a nice sitting area and great beds. Orleans is a destination hotel. the restaurants are great. Each day you decide a sepeality-and there it is. You have a movie theatre, a bowling alley, terrific liquior store and all you could want. A shuttle is available day and night if a strip experience is wanted. I will certainly weigh my travel dollars for my next Vegas visit. Orleans Hotel is a superior value.

Reviews.Title: “we wouldn't return to the Orleans!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cali2
Reviews.Content: We had high hopes of liking the Orleans but were sadly disappointed. We used their website and selected and paid for a King Non Smoking room. No where did it say this was just a request. But when we checked in a few minutes after 3 PM on 4/4/06 they said we could only have a double as there were no Kings available. I kind of doubt that, as many people were behind us checking in and I doubt that they all had picked doubles. The staff was not friendly and mostly said "this is the way it is so accept it". After we got to our room, we asked for extra pillows as they only had 2 very flat pillows on the bed and we have bad backs and I have asthma so need my head raised when I sleep. They said they don't give extra pillows and were ready to just hang up but my husband was not happy at this point and reminded them that we also didn't get the room we chose and paid for (according to their website) and they said they would see if they could get us some pillows. They did call back and said we could have some extra pillows but nothing else. Where is the customer service here? The beds have mattresses which are about 3-4" thick and look like a mattress for a fold out couch. Very cheap. They also had sheets that were too short for both beds and a mattress pad that was about 1/3 too small for the whole bed. All this was miserable when sleeping as they got all bunched up. All in all, this is not a great place to stay in our opinion. We will never stay there again. Many other older strip hotels which are much nicer. Location is not good either but we knew that.

Reviews.Title: “I was prepared for the worst..”
Reviews.Author: notparishilton
Reviews.Content: Prior to our stay, we were convinced that these Trip Advisor reviews were written by the Orleans staff. Everything seemed too good to be true. We were very skeptical that this hotel could live up to the 4+ star Trip Advisor rating. But we were proven wrong and pleasantly surprised. The Orleans is a great value. The ONLY negative is that it’s located approx 2 miles from the south end of the Strip. Bottom line, what we spent for 3 nights at The Orleans we would have spent for one night on the Strip. I would definitely stay again and will be recommending to friends and family. Price: $33/night, they matched (-) rate. Check-in: took 2 minutes and were given a room on 21st floor with partial strip view. The room: Comparable to many rooms I've stayed in on the Strip for triple the price (Luxor, MGM, Treasure Island). Non-smoking room smelled smoky, but that's not unheard of for Vegas. Quiet. Clean. Comfortable. Great view. Nice bathrooms. Excellent maid service. Casino: Typical casino. Lots of video poker. Pool: Nice. Getting around: Used the shuttle once--no problems. Taxi to Excalibur = approx $7 + tip. From Caesars to the Orleans = $12. Airport = $14. Approx 20 minute walk to the Palms. Food: above average and priced right. Buffet breakfast was $6.49. Coffee shop was also affordable and good. Food was as good as the Strip for 1/3 the price. (By the way--The Palms buffet was terrible). Draft beer at the bar = $2.50 (compare w/ $6.00 at Harrah's) I hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat The Deal!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Orleans over a dozen times in the past 3 years. I can't remember my first stay, but I always remember my last. The casino experience starts at check-in. The staff is always friendly and it literally takes minutes and you have a key and are walking to your room. The next stop is a no-brainer - Alligator Bar! The drinks flow freely as long as you are playing $.25 video poker, and I swear the bartenders are there quicker than you can drink em'! Next stop, the tables. They always have $1 roulette and sometimes you might even find a $3 blackjack table, but always $5 tables. The Pool is a lot of fun - very mello and low-key with a great big hot tub in the back. They even take the FunBook Drink Coupons at the Pool, for any Coast Casino! The French Market Buffet isn't top-shelf, but for the money it's awesome. It's a great buffet for the price! And if you want something a little nicer, you can always check out Sazio or Koji. Oh, and I've even had a couple nice jackpots at the Alligator, to top the trip off! Orleans - There is no reason to stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “You can not beat the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay. Can not find one thing to complain about. (Except did not win) Check-in was quick an easy. Never waited in line for anything. From Check-in, food, Sports Book, to checkout. There were 4 conventions in town with the hotel being full for all 4 nights. The strip was 5min away if you hit the shuttle just right, so it actually better than staying on the strip. Went to the strip eveyday and really looked foward to getting back to the Orlean (quiet and peaceful compared to the strip). Ate all meals there. The seafood buffet was excellent, and it was are Aniversary so we ate at Canel Street instead of Michaels at the Barbary Coast an excellent choice. Michaels would have been 4 times more. The service, food, desert, atmosphere was excellent. You get what you pay for is understated we got more than we expected for dinner. The dealers really helped you out as well as the cashiers at the sport book. The place was clean and not smokey. Give me a room at the Orleans, MGM, NYNY or any other on the strip for the same price and I will return to the Orleans. You have everthing but not the crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed there for 2 nights last month. We requested a room facing the strip on a high floor & that’s exactly what we got. Our room was clean & spacious with a very comfortable bed. Every employee we talked to was both friendly and helpful. The staff at the Orleans is very customer oriented. There was no waiting to check in. I also highly recommend having a meal at Big Al’s Oyster Bar. Excellent gumbo & jubalaya!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Took my son to Las Vegas for his 21st birthday and we spent 3 nights at The Orleans in a double room. I have stayed at other hotels in Vegas, both on and off the strip, and The Orleans is comperable. My main reason for staying there this trip was the price - The Orleans was cheaper than anywhere else. The rooms were good size and included a sitting area - couch, chair, table with lamp, and coffee table. The bathroom was good size as well but prefer that hotels have the toilet and tub/shower in a seperate room as the sinks and vanity area (the Rio is set up like that and it is great, especially when sharing the room with non-family). The rooms were VERY CLEAN - the housekeeping staff does an excellent job both inside the rooms and in the halls (in other hotels would see room service dishes sitting on the hall floor outside doors for several days, but not the case at The Orleans). I can vouch for the cleanliness of the bathroom - the first morning I forgot to put the shower curtain inside the tub, so there was a small pond that I mopped up with the white towels - there was not one speck of dirt on the towels when I finished (was VERY impressed!). The Orleans has a nice pool area, although we did not have oppurtunity to use it. Parking was easy - we rented a car - whether parking in the lot out front or in the garage. If parking in the garage, however, remember to ask the shortcut way between the room elevators and the garage so you don't walk all the way through the casino (did that once and thought there had to be a better way!). The Orleans has lots of restaurants to choose from and we ate at 3, but I was not all that impressed. The only one I would eat at again would be the Courtyard Cafe - the food was good but I thought it was a little pricey. I did not like the French Market buffet at all - have eaten at way better buffets for less money. A few thing about The Orleans I did not care for - the casino was smokey, not as good of ventilation as other places. They also charge for extras that I feel should be included with your stay, such as, charging to use the fitness center and for the in-room coffee (the first single cup filter pack is free but they charge $1.75 for each one after that). The room we stayed in was on the east side so we had a view of the strip, but it was also the side with the delivery docks so it was loud in the morning. Should we stay there again I will just remember to ask for a pool side room, if available. All in all, The Orleans suited our purposes for our trip and I would stay there again, but I will probably eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Solid pick but no #2 for fans of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Makai
Reviews.Content: With kids in tow, we appreciated the many non-gambling options at the Orleans. The pool, movie theater, bowling alley and child facility were huge successes with our kids. We also appreciated the clean rooms, helpful staff and prices at the tables, restaurants and bars. Our only complaints were the constant smell of smoke and the feeling of isolation from the Strip. We really missed being on the Strip and probably won't return to the Orleans but would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a solid value off the Strip and who is not allergic to smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: afrizz1
Reviews.Content: First time in Las Vegas. LOVED The Orleans. Off the strip but not to far off. Free shuttle to the strip. Lose slots great food and a very nice room. Great for the money. Felt at home there unlike some of the hotels on the strip. If in Vegas take the time to take 15 north and see the Valley of Fire......by far one of the best things I had seen while in the southwest. Will be going out to the southwest again and the Orleans will be on my to do list. Have fun...save money have a great time stay at The Orleans. Best bang for the buck :). Art

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans Hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My hubby & I stayed there at the Oleans, & I couldn't believe how stinky & smelly the lobby of the hotel is!! It reaked & it stenched with cigarette odor!! I wouldn't want to go back there ever again!!. I had hard time bing inside their casino in the Orleans!!. I almost gaged & hyperventilated!! They need to clear the air!! I hated it!! It should be made to be a NON Smoking environment!!

Reviews.Title: “Glad we stayed”
Reviews.Author: gnomehome
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Orleans mid March (during spring break). We picked the Orleans because of the Trip Advisor rating of being number 2 and curiosity as to why people were giving such high reviews, also because we were going to rent a car to do some site seeing and could easily get to the strip. Well to our pleasure the reviews were correct and all was well for us at this hotel. We had two rooms on the 4th floor. From check in to check out everyone we dealt with was very friendly and helpful. There was no wait to check in and the person helping us at check in arranged it so that our two rooms were on the same floor same wing with out even asking. (To compare, Last year at the NYNY we were placed miles apart in rooms with views of brick walls. We could not even tell if it was daylight.) The first evening their we signed up for their players’ card, later when my husband put his card in the poker machine it did not work. Almost immediately someone noticed our distress came over took the card some where to be fixed and brought it back to us within 5 min. Wow they seem to really be on top of things. The casino did not appear to be any smokier than any of the other casinos on the strip. (I personally wish all casinos were non-smoking but this is only a dream) We ate at the French market buffet twice for breakfast and once for lunch. Excellent selections each time excellent service and the price was incredible. Also ate at the Courtyard café for the midnight breakfast, very inexpensive and very good. Our rooms both had great views one of the pool area and one of the strip. The rooms were very clean and the beds were very comfortable. (We are use to sleeping on a very comfortable ‘firm’ pillow top mattress at home.) These are large, well appointed, spacious, clean and comfortable rooms. More like a mini suite. Our only complaint was pretty much the same as others have mentioned. The lack of an in-room safe and the challenging design of the bathroom/ closet/ heavy sliding bathroom door. That being said the bathroom is large, bright, clean and well stocked with towels etc. Parking is a breeze and the lots have very close access to the elevators so not as much walking to get back to the room as other casinos. Comparing this hotel to the many hotels we have stayed at in Vegas, usually of the 4 star variety, this one certainly stands up well to them and in many cases is far above standard. All and all we were very happy with this hotel and would highly recommend it to any one. Glad we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Throw your money away here---”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Mice in the rooms, low paying slots, terrible food and service. It looks like I am the only one who got a raw deal, but I'm reporting it anyway. The slots are supposed to be the best for locals, but maybe the locals like chucking away money real fast. You decide...

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: SimiRob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live in southern California and we visit Las Vegas 3-5 times each year. We have been visiting LV since 1990 and have stayed at almost all of the hotels at one time or another. In 2000, by a fluke, we were not able to find a room, so we decided to stay at the Orleans Hotel and Casino. To say the least, we were pleasantly suprised. The entire staff were very friendly and the rooms were well decorated, clean and spacious. Since 2000, we have stayed at the Orleans approximatley 15 times. I am now to the point where I get comped meals, shows and rooms and also receive specials in the mail all the time. I can't say enough good things about this place. About once a year, my wife and I will bring our kids with us, and they abolutely rave about the Kid center (day care) at the Orleans. We are both very protective of our children (ages 8-13) and we were both very pleased with the day care center. It is very secure (no strangers can enter) and it has a multitude of fun things that our daughters enjoy (painting, playing video games, watching dvd's, making new friends and it also has a snack bar that the kids can use). We will be going to Vegas in April 2006 and we will be brining our kids with us. Even though we will be staying at the Excalibur this time (special rate for our One Card- 39 a night) our girls have already told us they want to go to the Orleans kids center for the three hours. I alos enjoy the Orleans sports book. They always have a really nice lady that sells hot dogs (seen her since 2000..each and every time) so I always get at least one hot dog and enjoy wagering on a sporting event. We also like to catch a movie at the Orleans movie theatre and afterwards get a giant ice cream cone. We are treated so well at the Orleans, that we will continue to come back again and again...

Reviews.Title: “Business Person Friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three night business trip to Las Vegas and a wonderful experience at The Orleans. Upon check in I was lucky enough to be checked in by the front desk manager and just happened to mention that I was in Las Vegas strictly on business. I asked if she could do her best to see if she could put me in the quietest part of the Hotel and I must say she outdid herself. I was put on the very top floor and as I tell people it was quieter then a Kona mouse throughtout my entire stay. She turned me into a fan for life and I only hope I can be so accomodated in the future. I suggest any future travelers mention your situation, particularly the business part of it and hope you can be as lucky as I was. I suspect this was more a policy though since as I checked out I mentioned my appreciation at the desk and they indicated that they tried to keep the business types off by themselves and away from the partiers and family groups. I highly recommend The Orleans for anyone who travels to Las Vegas on business and I look forward to my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: NewToChicago
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Orleans. The breakfast buffet was great and Sazio's restaurant was very nice. The room was big and nicely decorated. The mattress, while thin, was comfortable. We loved the pool area, very big and beautifully landscaped. The staff at the Orleans were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The shuttle was prompt, no long waits.

Reviews.Title: “quite enjoyable, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just in from a 6 nite stay (3-21 thru 3-27) at The Orleans, booked room thru Tripres.com and was pleasantly pleased as my request for a king size , non smoking was met, requested a quiet room and was placed in room at end of hallway, very quite. The rooms themselves at The Orleans are quite unique in their lay out, bathroom is in back of room, and as a nice side touch there is a window in the shower for a nice view of the Vegas strip (the view was neat in room 1097 anyway ). Maid service was prompt and efficent, leave do not disturb of course if you want to sleep late as they begin their rounds at end of hall about 8 a.m. The dining was delicious at all stops , the Courtyard Cafe was always good for breakfast and they feature some nice overnite specails. The Prime Rib loft was excellent and thier top shelf stop --Canal Street was outstanding, try the lamb chops, and shrimp cocktail- jumbo sized and cooked to perfection. The casino was nice and had a high ceiling but seemed to be very smoky the entire time, as a non smoker this left me smelling of cig's after every visit, yuck, but the winnings from both the casino and nearby sportsbook helped to make me feel a bit better about that, overall, very satisfied with everything during visit, including the Spa and pool area , both very relaxing as pool in quite big and Spa is very nicely appointed, steam room and whirlpool both were very powerful, the only drawback was the smoky casino but I would stay in The Orelans again and may even make it my hotel of choice during my semi-annual visits to Vegas, Nate in NC- don't forget to use your fun book--full of great money saving coupons-

Reviews.Title: “Booked another stay. . . and the Spa too!”
Reviews.Author: boomer281
Reviews.Content: We return to the Orleans again and again. It has nice-sized rooms, personable staff and is just the right size. Walking to your room doesn't take all day, and yet there is variety in dining and plenty of casino action. We rent a car becasue we like to visit lots of places, and we find the Orleans easy to get in and out of. And the Spa may be the best-kept secret in town. The prices are a bit less than on the strip, and the services are wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been to Las vegas 2 times and each time i've stayed at the orleans. This is one of the best hotels in Las Vegas!!! The flight was ok to vegas depending on which airline you choose, we got a limo from the airport to the hotel and the bellman took our bags inside. We cheaked in and the staff were friendly and helpful. They gave us our key and the bellman took our bags to the room. The room is big and the bathroom is very clean. The beds are really comfortable.Inside the hotel the restaurants are very nice and you have alot to choose from.Las Vegas Is EXELLENT for kids as there is alot to do in the hotel like bowling, cinema, arcade, kids tymee and there is lots to do outside the hotel on the strip. The staff are very friendly and they clean your room very well. You can get a shuttle bus that comes every 15-20 mins to the hotel that takes you to the strip. The hotels on the strip are very nice and not boring.Every hotel you see there is plenty of things to do.The pool is lovely. Im going back in July 2006 and can't wait to see Las vegas again and i would recommend this hotel to anyone who is coming to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place; Great Value”
Reviews.Author: OldVegasFan
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a three night midweek stay. The Hotel - Very nice rooms (for the price). Good security. Excellent service on checkin/checkout. Great maid service. Excellent liquor store with great prices. Business center lets you print boarding passes for your (Southwest) flight for $1. Pool was nice looking, but outside temperature was too cold to go for a swim. Casino - Due to the midweek visit, it wasn't that crowded in the day, but got busy at night. They have low limits $5 BJ/Craps and $1 roullette. They have a ton of video poker, but I couldn't locate any full pay jacks or better machines, but they have all the deuces wild, bonus, double bonus, etc. that someone could want. They also had a ton of $.05/$.10/$.25 machines as well as the $.25/$.50/$1 machines. I am not a slot player, so I don't have much to offer there. The cocktail waitresses were attentive and were always coming around - even through "cheaptown" ($.05/$.01 area). Food - I ate at the buffet for breakfast and dinner. Breakfast was good with an omelette station. Dinner was "par for the course". Nothing special, but much variety and decent food. Noticed that they had graveyard specials in their cafe (something I love about Vegas), but never ate them due to still being full from the buffet. All in all, the Orleans was a great surprise for me. I expected decent, but found Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at The Orleans. We've stayed there several times and this place seems to get better and better. We LOVE IT. The rooms are huge, and well appointed. Ours was newly redecorated. The hallways are very brightly lit; and there is a security man stationed at the base of each elevator--no one gets up without showing a room key. They just added a TGI Fridays restaurant to the several they already had. Try the chinese food in the coffee shop--it's really surprisingly very, very good. I love the fact that I can play $1 table games. Roulette is a lot more fun when you don't have to bet $5 a spin. There is an 18 screen movie theater on the premises as well as a 70 lane bowling alley and a sports area center, a gorgeous pool area and a nice spa. (Book early at the spa, it can be a major hassle trying to coordinate spa reservations--especially if you are planning to attend with more than one friend. Spa appointments fill up very quickly by mid morning for the same day and even trying to get reservations for one or two days out can be difficult. I got so frustrated getting jacked around by the people at the spa desk, that I just gave up and cancelled the idea altogether.) It's great being off the strip--no traffic jams. They have a free shuttle to the strip if you don't have a car.

Reviews.Title: “great value great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked through Travel worm and stayed in a great, clean, spacious room for 17.00 a night + tax. the beds were comfortable, the food was great! employees were a bit on the rude side but the stay was pleasent and comortable. If you are flying in there is no bus to pick you up so you must rent a car or take a 35.00 per person to the hotel and back to the airport. check around for the best rates ...

Reviews.Title: “great value, food and rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: larry13413
Reviews.Content: We came from Vancouver and stayed 2 nights here and found it to be a great value. Pool was nice, buffet lunch and midnight steak and egg special were really cheap and very good. Best lunch buffet for the price I have ever seen. Room was huge and shuttle to strip was always there within 10 minutes.We had to change our reservation back a day at the last minute and they did not charge us extra. Friendly service everywhere here. We would highly recommend this hotel and we stayed here mostly because of reading all the good reviews and high rating on tripadvisor. We can see why they were #2 in all of Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Another great Orleans Stay”
Reviews.Author: burger1
Reviews.Content: Another great stay at the Orleans!! The Prime Rib Loft is an excellent place for dinner. The rooms are large and clean. I have no complaints about the Orleans. This is the only place that we stay when we are in Vegas. You can't beat the value, excellent service, and great hospitality at the Orleans. I like the fact that it is off the strip after a while I like to get away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. I'll be back next time I'm in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “best kept secret in vegas”
Reviews.Author: lovetogamble
Reviews.Content: I took my mom to LV for her 75th birthday. Had a wonderful time and loved the hotel. Everything was great, except I was a little ticked at the $1.75 coffee in the room charge. We stayed the week and it would have been cheaper to buy a coffee pot and coffee. Oh well. I did not find the casino smoky but I found the girls a little slow with the drinks, even after making sure to tip each time. Maybe short staffed. The room was made up every day and that was a nice gesture, they were very clean and roomy. All in all, nothing to complain about. Would I stay there again, you bet!

Reviews.Title: “When The Smoke Gets In Your Eyes”
Reviews.Author: Lumberg21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to take a trip to Vegas for our anniversary, and after reviewing the hotels on this site for price and customer rating, chose the Orleans. The first thing we both noticed upon entering was the amount of smoke in the air of the lobby/casino. We booked our room and made our way to the elevators and our room as fast as possible. Thankfully, the hotel has "No Smoking" floors not just rooms. Our room on the 19th floor had a wonderful view of the strip, the Stratosphere and Rio Hotels in particular. My wife loved the little operable window in the bathroom. The room did have problems, though, as we discovered during the first night there. The toilet wouldn't flush (no water to the tank), and the cold water faucet did not work at the hand sink. We called the front desk before leaving for the strip that night, and when we got back, all was working. However, while taking a shower, it became quickly evident that the shower drain was very, very slow. We called the front desk the following day before leaving for Red Rock Park, and a maintenance man was at the door within 5 minutes, before we had even left. Our second night at the hotel we decided to order room serice. That was a mistake. The menu in our room wasn't current. The lady with room service said that she would send a current menu up immediately, which evidently meant 40 minutes (quite a difference from maintenance). Then it took another 50 minutes to receive the food despite a promise of 40 minutes or less. The food itself was average. Our third night we ended up getting a burger at Terrible Mike's in the Casino. It was a build your own burger set up where you put the toppings on the burger yourself. This was one of the best burgers I have had in a long time. I highly recommend Terrible Mike's if you eat at the Orleans. We did not try any of the other on-site dining. Also, the on-site liqour store has an adequate selection with prices much lower than I expected to see at a hotel. In summary, though the room had many problems, they were fixed immediately. We had a great view from the 19th floor, and Terrible Mike's offers a great burger. The drawbacks were the amount of smoke in the casino (more than any of the strip casinos that we entered), the initial problems with our room, and the room service. I would still recommend this hotel if you don't have to be on the "Strip" and if smoke doesn't bother you.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: gipsyqueen
Reviews.Content: We frequently attend conventions & trade shows in Las Vegas and have stayed at many different hotels and time share condos. In town for a trade show this week we stayed at the Orleans for the first time. Our room (2 queens) was comfortably large, clean and relatively quiet. The room decor was reminiscent of a French Quarter hotel, but without the 12' ceilings! We were there on a Monday night - Seafood night at the buffet - lots of great seafood dishes, and at $15.95, much less expensive than many other buffets of similar quality. Everyone we saw was casually dressed, most people seemed relaxed and happy, the casino, bars and restaurants were all full - and it looked like everyone was having as good a time as we were! The hotel is lower priced, it's not on the strip, but there's lots going on. Plus, there's a free shuttle to the strip! We enjoyed our stay, and will definitely return! (The Orleans Arena is connected to the hotel, and the atmosphere of the hotel, casino & restaurants might be different when a sporting event is in the arena.)

Reviews.Title: “Not a gambler”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Orleans was good for us for the following reasons: I like value for my money, and what I wanted was a pleasant room for sleeping. We had a rented car for day trips hiking, hoover dam, and golfing. The parking was very easy and they provided a good shuttle service to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans Hotel and Casino is absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Orleans Hotel and Casino from March 1 to March 5, 2006. This hotel is absolutely wonderful for the money. You can't beat it. In the past I have stayed at the MGM Grand, but the Orleans Hotel and Casino is my recommendation to anyone who wants to visit Las Vegas if you don't mind catching a shuttle to the strip. The rooms were extremely clean. For the most part, the staff was very friendly and helpful. You can not beat the amenities. You can stay in this place for a couple of days and still not get to do everything. I do not recommend, however, eating the cheap breakfast at the International Cafe ($3.45 and below). I will just say that you get what you pay for. But the buffet was great. The Orleans Hotel and Casino is not on the strip, but they provide a shuttle every 20 to 30 minutes. The shuttle only holds 24 passengers, (no standing allowed) so catch it early so that you will be on time if you are heading out to see a show.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here, eat here, but don't gamble here”
Reviews.Author: coloradoferns
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Orleans March 3-6th 2005. We loved the room, everything was wonderful (except the $1.75 coffee how silly to pay for coffee in the room!) All the restaraunts were wonderful. Especially Don Miguels. The slots however, --! We blew a ton of money and never hit more than 10 quarters at a time. We had a much better time gambling downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Way too many kids!”
Reviews.Author: buttercup742
Reviews.Content: Great resort for families with kids, but if you are not a kid person, stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: AKfun
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Orleans for a week. It is a good value for the money. Rooms are large and quiet. Casino seems to always be smokey and the food good. Highly recommend the Prime Rib Loft and a super value there. Gambling was not our main focus but the payouts were fair. Watch out for the coffee makers! We were happy to see they had small coffee pots in the rooms however read the info carefully. Your first cup of coffee or tea is free HOWEVER every cup after that is $1.75. This is not per day but per STAY! I always travel with my favorite brand of instant coffee and tea and therefor did not buy theirs but did use the machine for heating water. After the second day when they realized we were not using their coffee they refused to leave more styrofoam cups. This seems rather petty and I wonder if this is not the first step in nickel and dimeing guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great! Except for...”
Reviews.Author: silver8828
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans at the end of February, I initially booked our room directly with the hotel but then after searching the web I found a better rate thru another site, but it wasn't a problem since the Orleans will price match whatever you find. Rooms were nice & big, bed was definitely the most comfortable hotel bed I have slept in. The waitresses at the casino were very good, they were around alot more than the waitresses at the strip casinos. Good buffet also. Only had one complaint and that was the free shuttle service - the bus is too small for the amount of people that want to take it. On the very first day we were there, there were about 40 people who wanted to take it in the morning, it only holds approx. 20 people. It doesn't matter if you are there first or not because there are different bus drivers so they stop at different spots at the pick-up area. We saw a number of upset people because they had been standing there for a half hour and weren't able to get on the bus, and someone who just got there was able to get on because they happen to be standing in the right spot. We were lucky because we managed to get on each time we wanted but only because we knew how this worked so we "strategially" placed ourselves somewhere in the middle and close to the curb. That would be the only reason we would not stay at this hotel again & would stay on the strip simply for the convenience of location.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: golfer1117
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an 8-day visit at The Orleans - After 3 visits it's still our favorite place to stay and play. We just want to warn those who are coffee or tea drinkers. The hotel has finally provided coffeemakers in the rooms. However, only the first cup of your stay is free. After that your room is charged $1.75 per cup for coffee and $1.25 for tea. Suggest you either bring with you or buy your own pods and tea bags and beat them at their own game. Otherwise this hotel is the best value, most low-limit tables, great restaurants, easy comps and roomy and comfortable accomodations. Their price matching policy is also great - was able to save a bundle on rooms rates by checking other sites.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: mersimbo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another great stay at the Orleans-2/25 thru 3/1. Had a family get-together for the three days with my brother and sister-in-law staying at Paris and my son and niece staying at Flamingo. Some comments in the forum were about the Saturday night check-in and whether the lines would be long. We arrived about 8PM and there was no line at all so check-in was a breeze. Rooms were in the new wing with good, not great views, of the strip at night. Breakfast was in the Cafe' and food was excellent with BIG portions. Shuttle to the strip was consistent and convenient. Did have to take a cab periodically though. This was our fifth stay and we have always been pleased with the people and services. Brought my mother-in-law with us for a return visit, gets around okay but uses a wheel chair for the distances associated with getting around in Vegas, she's 87. Its not Bellagio but we enjoy Orleans' atmosphere, casino and limits. My son and I also gambled at Imperial Palace, Ellis Island,Flamingo, Tropicana, Bally's, and Aladdin. The only place that disappointed us was Ellis Island because they didn't have "THE" craps table open and we had to play black jack since we had walked about a half-a-mile to get there from Bally's. Ate one night's meal at the Prime Rib Loft and had the best prime rib cut(Orleans' cut)of beef that I've had in years. All who got the prime rib agreed. We also had an excellent meal at the Au Sin(spelling?) restaurant in Paris and excellent heavy appetizers in the Forum(?) Restaurant near the lobby of Caesars' Palace prior to Celine Dion's show. All-in-all we all had a great time and I'm trying to convince my wife to take advantage of the room offer after Labor Day. Maybe there's hope!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: corkdeb
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Las Vegas and stayed at the Orleans Hotel. This hotel is located off the strip, so it is necessary to take a $5.00 cab ride to the strip, or wait for their free shuttle. We were very pleasantly surprised by the hotel itself. The rooms were very clean and LARGE!!! The restaurants we tried there were all very good. The casino was as big as any on the strip...just not as fancy. However, it was a comfortable casino and if you are new to gambling, was unpretentious. I had one of the best deep-tissue massages I have ever had in their spa. The only downside I could tell is that it is not as fancy as your more upscale hotels, but it is great for the price and nice to have somewhere quiet to go back too after a day or night spent on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: chatterbox092
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our vacation in Las Vegas and we stayed at The Orleans. It wasn't far from the strip and very easy to get to. The rooms were beautiful and very clean. Probably the best hotel I've ever stayed at. I would definitely go back there again and highly recommend it to anyone going to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans was Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What can I say, I was a little wary of The Orleans becasue of some of the reviews I had read. It was absolutely great! Everybody there was sooo friendly. The rooms were quite roomy, and the beds were some of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. The restaurants had great food and service. We have been to Vegas several times, and stayed at a number of places, and we will definitely be back to stay at The Orleans. We had absolutely no complaints about anything at all there. Keep up the good work Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans is a great alternative to hotels on the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I and our son & his fiancee just returned from a business trip to Las Vegas on 02/14/06. In the past we have stayed at a variety of big hotels located on Las Vegas Blvd., but with rising airline costs we were looking for a less expensive alternative.
