Based on the large number of positive reviews here and the affordable cost I booked 2 rooms for 6 nights from Feb. 8 to 14th and passed on hotels like the MGM, Riviera, Luxor, Imperial Palace, Bally's...... Early check-in (late morning) was a breeze with at least 3 hotel staff members at the Registration counter. Both rooms were large & well decorated. We had asked before arrival for a small refrigerator which was delivered a short time after our arrival. Both rooms had 2 queen sized beds and the hotel was happy to provide us with additional pillows in a prompt fashion. We had no problems with room cleanliness. New personal care products (shampoo, shower gel, conditioner & lotion) were delivered daily, along with sufficient towels. The room had a great view of the Last Vegas Strip which was even better at night. With a small sofa and comfy chair, we had room to relax somewhere other than on the bed. We used the hotel's internet access for $10.99 in order to keep up with business emails. Access was easy although it did "time out" occasionally. Breakfast at the hotel's cafe was great. With a piece of great chocolate chip coffee cake for an "appetizer", breakfast was delightful. The cafe offers a Chinese menu as well as traditional American selections. I strongly suggest that you avoid the Chinese selections in favor of the traditional menu. The hotel's Canal Street Grill is wonderful. We ate there twice. We received great food & wonderful service both times. My son swore by the sushi at the sushi restaurant, and made special trips downstairs several evenings for it. Gambling was marred only by the warm casino. In all fairness, the weather was unusually warm for February (around 70 degrees daily) and the slot machines & gambling "bodies" do throw off a great deal of heat. I won a little & lost a little. My son's fiancee, however, won several jackpots of $250 and up, and happily regained all of the money she'd left home with. The hotel's showroom was fine and we enjoyed the featured comedian, Paul Rodriquez. My son enjoyed the free drink coupons we received as a bonus for seeing the show. Would we stay again? A B S O L U T E L Y!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: sweetsherry
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed here for 5 nights. The check in was swift and very informative. The fun books we rec'd were chock full of great coupons. We asked for a room near the elevator. We were the 2nd door away from them. Excellent. The couch had a bad broken spring, so i told them at the front desk. By the time we walked back up to the room, maintenance was already there taking away the couch and replacing it with a new one! Gotta love the window in the shower. Sounds silly, but it really is nice. Feel the vibrance of the Vegas air while getting ready in the morning. Seattle's Best for coffee in the morning. Took total of 5 minutes to leave room, get coffee, and back to the room. Not bad. I also like the fact that you had to show your hotel room key to get past the guard to use the elevators. Nice, safe feeling. The prices in their gift shop were good, and the prices in their liquor store were so much better than in New York, that we bought some good stuff to take home. Can't wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas and Kids”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiianwahines
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans for 3 days in December with my 9 year old triplets. We had a good time there. They have a large bowling alley that can be set up for kids. The kids bowled for hours! (With the coupon book they give at check in - it becomes a good deal.) There is also a pool, movie theatre complex and child care - play ground for children 9 and under for a small fee. They have several restaurants, coffee place, ice cream parlor, Subways for meals and snacks. Food at the buffet was only mediocre. Free shuttle to the strip if you want to see the lights. The room was large and clean. I asked for extra towels and ammenities. There was a lot of security around the elevators to the guests' rooms and through out the casino. Overall we had a good stay and we would go there again if we were passing through.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service”
Reviews.Author: Steve5757
Reviews.Content: When you walk into the Orleans it is a bit of a throwback to an earlier casino. Certainly you do not see the latest gizmos of the newer "strip hotels". However, everything else is just genuine good value and service. The room was large and spotless, the restuatants were well above average and the wait staff friendly and efficient. This is not the place to "wow" someone, but if you want a very nice experience without feeling ripped off then the Olreans fits the bill. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: carolina4me
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is a great value. My room was comfortable and the maid service was very good. Although the hotel is aging a bit, it is clean and well maintained. I also recommend their restaurant Canal Street- great food, service and reasonably priced wine list.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans Treats Patrons The Way Vegas Used To!”
Reviews.Author: BruceCaplan
Reviews.Content: My name is Bruce M. Caplan and I've been at the Orleans three times during the past two months. Although I was doing a book signing at a hotel on the Strip, I found the Orleans a wonderful place to stay! The rooms are gorgeous and very spacious. The hotel staff is the friendliest in Vegas. One feature I especially enjoyed about this vacation spot was the equal treatment of all guests! I could actually go to the coffee shop without someone charging ahead of me because they were a VIP gambler. The Orleans has wonderful restaurants, over a dozen motion picture screens and even 70 bowling lanes. The pool area was spotless. Gambling too, so unless you have to, why go anywhere else? During my most recent visit, I took my wife. She had great luck on their poker machine. The strip hotels seem to rip the customers off on bottled water and cokes. The Orleans 24 hour gift shop sold 20 ounce bottles of water and soda for $1.35 per container. So many wonderful restaurants, but what really impressed me was the specials in the coffee shop. About ten dollars for a steak or prime rib meal including a huge wonderful salad. That was not a late hour price, but available at all times. Oh and don't forget the plump hot dogs at 75 cents! If you're a senior you can buy a bus pass for 24 hours for $1.25. The buses run every 15 minutes and will get you to the Strip in a very short time. This hotel also has their own shuttle which will take you to the Strip. I've been coming to Vegas for over 30 years. In the 1970's Vegas was a generous place where the consumer really got value for their dollar. Today most of the hotels in Vegas charge an arm-and-a-leg and really rip-off the consumer. The Orleans is a wonderful exception where the customer is treated with the respect and dignity that the consumer deserves. I Shall Return!

Reviews.Title: “not like it used to be”
Reviews.Author: deb_ocon
Reviews.Content: this was our third time staying at the orleans and we were disappointed. We have given it rave reviews before but cannot this time. It is starting to show its wear and tear. We were given a room at the furthest end of a wing which overlooked the area where the cabs line up. Windows were dirty and the furniture had seen better days. Bed was comfortable until the mattress pad (those flat ones that don't tuck under the mattress )started to bunch up. There were plenty of pillows which was good because they were very flat. Bathroom was adequate but I think we had a bigger one last time.I had forgotten to take shampoo and figured oh well they always have shampoo in the rooms...no shampoo and no time to call housekeeping as we were flying out.The cute little window in the shower looked out at at the cab line. Lo and behold for the first time in Vegas there was a coffee maker in the room. There was a sign next to it that said you were allowed one cup and if you desired a second then it would be $1.75. There was one paper cup and a one serving coffee and 1 tea bag. OK coin toss as to who gets the coffee (neither of us wanted it). Ate breakfast at the Buffet in the french market for $6.95. You get what you pay for. My meal was so cold I thought it might be frozen. Stick to the cereals, fruits and the yummy desserts and it is worth it. Casino was not too smoky (we are non-smokers) but there seemed to be way too many nickel machines and way too many smokers near them. Drinks were very small and watered down. We try to stay at different hotels when in Vegas and have always liked the orleans but we will not be returning here even if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Has its merits, but overall disappointing”
Reviews.Author: SFcatamount
Reviews.Content: I agree with the earlier poster who argued that there's no way Orleans should be TripAdvisor's #2 rated hotel in Vegas. Having visited the city several times and stayed in everything from the Motel 6 to the Luxor, I'd rate the Orleans right about in the middle even though its rates are more comparable to the latter. I was particularly disappointed to find that I could have stayed at the MGM or Luxor for actually LESS than here at this specific time of year. Here are the highs and lows in a nutshell: Positives: Rooms are a little larger than most other hotels and are tastefully furnished. French Market Buffet is very good for all meals and a good value. The Fun Book they provide to each guest at check-in has a lot of good deals in it, including several free drinks at the various bars in the casino. Shuttle to Barbary Coast is convenient if you lack your own transportation. (Note: A taxi from the airport runs about $20.) Despite earlier reviews about the smoke in the casino, I found it about average for Vegas. Overall, the building feels fairly well-kept and safe. Negatives: You get the feeling that the management cuts corners in obvious ways. There actually are coffee makers in the rooms now, but they will charge you $1.75 per cup after you use the initial day's allotment of coffee (this is regardless of whether you're staying one night or a week). There is high-speed internet in the rooms, but it'll run you $10.99 a day. Housekeeping often skimps on the bathroom goodies, such as new soap each day, missing conditioner on the first day, etc. The player's club comps are not nearly as generous or enticing as some of the strip casinos. Our non-smoking room, located on a "non-smoking" floor, was quite smoky-smelling, although a friend's room a few floors higher did not have this problem. The Orleans seems to cater to large groups and conventions, especially those that involve youths since its location away from the strip makes it a little harder for them to get into trouble, I guess. Because of this, it's sometimes mega-crowded when other places aren't. Unfortunately, our stay was during one of those times and we experienced long waits for elevators and noisy groups of kids without chaperones clogging up walkways. A note about its supposedly "away-from-trouble" location though. There's a new topless strip club right across the street now and an adult video/toy store diagonally across from the main entrance. Guess those could be a positive or negative depending upon your tastes! In general, I just didn't have as much "fun" at the Orleans as I'd experienced at other hotels closer to the strip or on Fremont Street. Unless you are able to find a really great rate here (which they sometimes do have, as I understand), you will likely be able to find a better value and experience on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Got the scabies in the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: yoh972
Reviews.Content: No doubt the orleans is a good value hotel, but this is also the catch. Due to those very low rates, among the hotel clients, and I don't mean to offend, there are some people with less than adequate hygiene habits and awareness. I got infected with scabies in the orleans (started on my right arm), and I learned my lesson -- cleanliness is mostly invisible. Clean rooms do not mean that bed covers, linen and blankets are sanitized, and cheap rooms are necessarily more bio-hazardous than more expensive ones. In the future, I will not save a few dollars and take the risk of infection. In addition, the lobby stinks beyond belief. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly to families -- even large ones!”
Reviews.Author: jolinegk
Reviews.Content: This was the only hotel that didn't scream and slam its doors in my face when I told them I was booking a reservation for me and six kids ages 8-12. It was also the best value at $150 a night (weekends) compared to everywhere else I looked. (We were there for my niece's wedding.) As it turns out, I only brought four kids, leaving two behind with the ex. Be that as it may, the Orleans was the perfect place for both mother and child to co-exist. The rooms were spacious with two queen beds and a couch in an adjoining area. We asked for a view of the strip and got it easily. While I shuffled along gambling and using my coupons from the neat coupon book I received upon checking in, two of my kids went to the movies in the inhouse theater and two went bowling in the inhouse bowling alley. Later, they went to the huge arcade and had a grand time. The buffet was marvelous. I couldn't imagine anything more they could have served us. It included everything from shrimp (my fave) to barbecue to lo mein to pasta to tacos to crawfish (didn't eat those) and the most decadent desserts. With the coupon book, I also got a free bottle of wine with dinner. One more thing not to miss, and this is for adults only, is the spa. My feet were killing me from too much walking and driving the day before and I headed down there in the morning and had the luxurious accomodations all to myself. New Age music and bubbles in a huge jacuzzi big enough for me, my family and eight other families, lulled me into such nirvana. Massages and other treats are also available at reasonable prices. The pool looked very nice and tropical, but it was only open from 10 to 5 and we were always out somewhere at that time so we didn't get to try it. It was a bit nippy out anyway. The Orleans is off the strip but not too far. You're on the side of the Luxor and the MGM, but I would not advise walking there, especially with kids. We noticed quite a lot of kids at this hotel, including what seemed like a whole slow-pitch convention, which I suppose puts off some folks. But the combo worked for us, and we will gladly come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the kids, but thin and uncomfortable beds!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans Hotel for 2 nights. The hotel is great for kids. There is an arcade, bowling and babysitting for the kids while you gamble. The rooms are old and the carpet and furniture did not appear to be clean. The beds are very thin and uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans - I'll be back!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean, spacious room, excellent service, easy (and early) check-in, lots of shuttles to Orleans-Barbary Coast-Orleans anytime of day or night (before midnight), excellent food at Courtyard cafe, Asian restaurant and Canal St., we had tickets for Etta James and she was fantastic. Never a problem getting a drink while gambling - loved the funbooks, great deals. We won money (about $500.00 in slots and VP). (We saw two people hit Royal Flush Jackpots in VP while we were gambling - and we didn't gamble that much!) Top notch service from beginning to end. I found this hotel by reading Trip Advisor, and believe me, it is true what they say. Staff is friendly and I appreciated the Security at the elevators who required that people show their room keys. Very safe and secure. This is a wonderful hotel for very short money. Use what you save to do what we did - see five excellent shows (Cirque's Mystere, Salute to Rat Pack, Rick Thomas Magic, Etta James, and Folies Bergere) and do a helicopter ride into Grand Canyon! We were in LV January 15-21, 2006. Coast Hotels - truly winners in my book. Two thumbs WAY up from hubby and me! Thank you, Orleans and Trip Advisor!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay, another good one.”
Reviews.Author: canoe86
Reviews.Content: Second time I have stayed at the Orleans. This time in Vegas I did get to see many more of the Strip hotels. Although the Orleans is not the fanciest of the bunch, overall it is a good place to stay. Middle age crowd for the most part. Rooms were very quiet. Rooms are like a mini suite. I stayed in the new tower. No problems with the room and maid service was very good. Asked for extra towels and had them everday for the rest of the stay. Ordered room serice a number of times and food was always hot and brought in a timely manner. ALL employees of this casino were great. Never had an attitude problem or bad service from the moment I stepped into the hotel. Took the shuttle a couple times, no wait, albeit during off hours. Nice service. If I had one complaint, it would be the charge for internet service. Each day was 11 bucks. I understand they want people in the casino but the reality of today is people also need to stay connected. Sort of had the feel of a nickel and dime move. Also, 75 cents per local call. Again, nickel and dime feel. Overall, I would highly recommend the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Mac9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Orleans Jan 14-20/06. Rooms in the renovated tower are clean and attractive, with an excellent view of the vegas skyline. The hotel reservations will match any online rate that you find and they can confirm, so good hunting. The hotel offers good value and a convenient location if you rent a vehicle. Parking is adequate. The buffet is very good value and quality. The Canal Street restaurant was excellen t(particularly for meat lovers). The only negative is the high level of smoke in the casino. Although this is true of most Vegas casinos, I found the Orleans to be one of the worst. Overall good value and location for the price. As an aside we also visited the new Suncoast Hotel on LV Blvd, south of the airport. Enjoyed the excellent seafood buffet on Wed evenings(appox $16/person).

Reviews.Title: “Clean, close, and economical”
Reviews.Author: tallguy65
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in The Orleans Hotel 1-9-06 to 1-12-06 on a special offer found at Travelzoo (rooms for $18/night). Place was clean, staff was friendly, and buffet was very good. Is located about 3/4 to 1 mile off the strip with great views of the strip lights, less noise, and easy and close access. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Go for upper floors”
Reviews.Author: rubytue
Reviews.Content: We checked in late on a Sunday night, and despite reserving a king room and trying the $20 trick, we were given a double room on the 2nd floor, apparently they were all out of any king room. It appears they are refurbishing rooms from the top down. The TV did not work at all. The mattresses were literally 4 inches thick. It was not nice at all. A trip to the front desk in the morning, and we were moved to a 17th floor, strip view room. Much nicer. King bed with a real matteress. Working TV. Much improved. I did not, however, like the room layout. The door opens straight into the "bedroom" area, such that if you are laying in bed and someone opens the door, anyone in the hallway could see. Seeing as my husband stayed downstairs in the casino later than I, I made sure to have the covers pulled all the way up all night. The security to keep non-guests out of the hotel portion was nice, but there was still an incident on our floor with a young man who was passed out in our elevator lobby. Security got there quickly and appeared to take care of it. The food was so-so. We had breakfast in the cafe - the skillet breakfast was quite yummy. The chinese resturaunt was pricey, and not nearly as good as the take-out place at home. We did not try bowling or the movie theater, and unfortunatly, there was no hockey game while we were there. Also, the casino dealers were boring and/or rude. The slot club on rewards you on wins (if I win, I don't need a reward, give me something for just giving you my money please). We had no problems with the shuttle at all. In fact, we loved the shuttle. Over all, it was ok. We got a great rate, so I can't complain too much. But, when we go back, we will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Deal in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is a great 3 star plus hotel. I stayed at the Orleans for six nights from January 8th-15th, 2006 (One night stayed at Farmer's Daughter in Los Angeles when I was on The Price Is Right game show). There is a reason why this hotel received the Trip Advisor award for best bargain-because it is! I only paid $50 per night for five night and $120 for another and I heard from other patrons that they paid even less booking through other websites. The hotel is close to the strip but you probably won't want to walk because the city blocks are huge. I rented a car at the airport and drove everywhere easily. Las Vegas is very easy to navigate around and the strip is very busy so I suggest to bypass the strip on a parallel street once you drive up and down the strip a few times to soak in the experience. If you are going for a week, I suggest you drive to the Hoover Dam which is an easy 30 minute drive and to Los Angeles which is a long 3-4 hour drive but the scenary is excellent-and you get to see rams! The hotel itself is on par with all the other 3-4 star hotels on the strip and has most amenities that one could ask for. Check-in was easy and you can check out using the tv in your bedroom. The evevators are fast and are split up so certain ones only cover certain floors-for added speed. The hallways are very long so I suggest you ask for a room near the elevators. Even being close to the elevators, there wasn't a lot of noise. The rooms are larger than average with a couch and armchair and the bathroom is large granite countertops. The shower is excellent and the water pressure was great. I suggest that anyone who blowdrys their hair to bring your own blowdryer as the one that is supplied is insufficient. My girlfriend told me this as my head is shaved and I didn't use it. The bed is comfortable and the room is clean and in good repair. I used the gym everyday and it was good. The cost is $10/day or $25/3 days but you get two days for free using the coupon inside the "Fun Book" they give you. This is a deal as most other 4-5 star places charge $25-$30/day for their respective gyms. The Orleans has many restarants and I ate at a few of them. Get to the breakfast buffet before 10am because that's when it ends. It's only $6.45 and it's the best in vegas. Sunday brunch is $12.95 and has food from all three meals. The cafe's food was good and everynight (Monday to Thursday) after midnight, there are 4-5 specials that are great such as steak and eggs for $2.99. I didn't eat in any of the higher end restarants but they looked excellent. The casino is large and up to date but I found it smokier than other casions and getting a drink from the waitresses was hard to do. The staff was polite and housekeeping was there quickly when I called them. The Orleans also has an ice rink, 18-screen movie theatre, arcade, and excellent parking (both valet and self-serve). If you have a rental car, the strip is only a two minute drive from the Orleans. If you chose not to get a rental car, the Orleans has a free shuttle to their sister hotels and the Barbary Coast is located right in the middle of the strip. In conclusion, I highly recommend the Orleans and everything else that all the other reviews say is true. The Orleans is great-just a little smoky in the casino. But if you're a smoker, then it's not smoky at all. Have a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans from Jan 7-14, 2006. The main purpose of our trip was to get married. We stayed at the Orleans, based on the reviews from this web-site. We were a little unsure of what to expect because of the great price, but what a nice suprise. The rooms are a nice size and clean. We don't smoke, and found the casino smokey. We soon found out that every casino in Vegas is smokey! The restaurants in this hotel are great, and not expensive. The cocktail waitresses are very attractive, and the guys will like their uniforms. You want for nothing in this hotel, from shoeshines, a spa, and a well priced liqour store. The bowling is fun, and if you're looking to lay low one night there are the movie theatres. The bigger strip casinos are flashier....It depends what you are looking for. We rented a car all week so the strip is only a few minutes away. We recommend Red Rock Caynon and Valley of Fire state park. Hoover Damn is good to see as well. If you are getting married, we narrowed it down to the Chapel of the Bells, and were pleasantly suprised. We had our room upgraded for the last 2 nights as a wedding treat and they were very reasonable about the price, and the room was unbelievable. My only complaints are they don't leave the big outdoor hot-tub open past 5pm (gotta change that), and they didn't replace our water glasses one morning. (We called and had glasses in 2 minutes) If we ever make it back to Vegas we will be staying at the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Rates”
Reviews.Author: riotgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans Hotel for 5 days after Thanksgiving. The service was excellent! The rooms are huge! There is alot of walking from the rooms to the parking lot, but it's good exercise. The theatre is nice and clean, prices are great. This was our 4th time staying at the Orleans, and i'd stay there everytime. Because of the time of year, we got an EXCELLENT rate. keep checking all search engines, you'll eventually find a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Free Shuttle Service, But at What Price???”
Reviews.Author: boomer93
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans Jan. 8-13. The room was nice, larger than most, with comfy queen beds and a separate sitting area. I would have preferred a fan in the bathroom over the window in the shower. My main complaint was with their much advertised free shuttle service to their other properties, the Gold Coast and the Barbary Coast. Although it was fairly easy to catch a shuttle in the morning, getting a ride back to the hotel was next to impossible. Shuttles are supposed to leave on the half hour, but we waited over an hour to leave the Gold Coast from 4-5 pm. Watched five shuttles come and go, one was reserved for drivers only (it was shift change), one only had room for 4 people (and about 30 were in line), the other three were bound for the Barbary Coast only (even though one was tagged "Gold Coast to Orleans"). We ended up getting a cab, which cost $9 including tip. Shuttle drivers were rude. Hotel would not reimburse us for the cab fare. Sure would have been nice if they would have offered us something. Drink service was OK in the casino, but the mixed drinks were watered down (tipped $1 per drink per round). OK place to stay if you're brave enough to rent a car and drive. I'll probably stay on the strip next time. Cab fare from the strip and to downtown was pricey, and the ride during heavy traffic was scary--I didn't know which to do first after exiting the cab: kiss the ground or hurl.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Veags 01/15/06. Very happy with the hotel. Rooms were clean and spacious. Front desk check- in was a breeze (walked right up). Requested a King non- smoking and ended up with 2 queen non-smoking. Was offered to to move for the second night but once settled in all was fine and stayed with the queen room. Food at italian place was decent but slow. Should of stayed away from the slots! Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Met my best friend in Vegas Dec. 4 - 9. She drove from San Diego and picked me up at airport. No problems getting to The Orleans. Valet and bellmen were great! Check-in was a breeze! Room was just as we requested. Of course it was Rodeo week, but thats okay because I love cowboys! Liked the security before going up to room! Loved the casino! (Won big!) Had a car, so getting to strip was no problem. Would definently stay there again. This was our 3rd trip and this was the best. Food that we tried was great! We even went bowling. Only complaint, asked for extra towels, but received 5 extra pillows instead. No big deal though. We had a great time and will definently stay there again! Saving the money on the hotel gave us more to gamble with!

Reviews.Title: “$avings Add Up”
Reviews.Author: SLOMIKE
Reviews.Content: Tremendous rate between holidays, $25 a night on Expedia. Liked room size, bed comfort and close ground level open air parking. With valet parking on Strip only a tip, it paid to stay at Orleans. Got to take in extras like Red Rock etc.

Reviews.Title: “What a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Paul14
Reviews.Content: Spent the week between Xmas and New Year's at the Orleans. Absolutely loved it! Large, clean rooms with efficient housekeeping....in fact, friendly and efficient describes the entire staff. Our first night the room was a bit noisy because we were on the 3rd floor near the loading dock. Heard a few "beep, beeps" from trucks backing in with their early morning deliveries. One call and we were on the 7th floor the next day. Excellent restaurants throughout and at fair prices. After a day on the strip it was a real pleasure to return to the Orleans and a seafood pan roast at Al's, sushi or Mexican...topped off with some Guinness and live music at Brendan's Irish Pub. Also...I read about people saying this casino is "loose" or "tight"...probably just depends on how they did personally. In reality, they had just about the only "full-pay" (99%+) paying Video Poker machines that I found anywhere. Check the odds...Double Bonus with a 10/7 payout is the best you'll find anywhere and the Orleans has lots of them..even at the bars and in the pub. It's as "loose" as you'll find. Enjoy the Orleans for what it is....$49 a night, good food, fair odds, a great poker room...I'm coming back!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis from the bustle of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: sbulldog
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans from 12/22 to 12/26. Although I had read the Strip was supposed to be "quiet" at Christmastime, we found it insane and crowded. It was so nice to be able to grab the shuttle back and forth to the Orleans. They seemed to have them running every ten minutes. I will agree that the casino is smoky, but we stopped at several hotels on the strip which were equally smoky--in particular T.I. The rooms at the Orleans are large and fairly well kept--the service staff were all very nice. We felt safe there because of all the security--in fact, I went jogging around the hotel every day, and noted numerous security staff on the grounds. For you athletes--it's a mile around the perimeter of the hotel and the hockey arena. Our daughters (21 and 16) had a great time going to the movies and bowling, and we had great meals at the Italian restaurant and the Prime Rib Loft. Overall, a great value, and nice to be a little distance from the huge crowds on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: nichpr
Reviews.Content: We moved to the Orleans after 3 nights at the Luxor. The differences were immediately telling. While priced much lower than the Luxor, the smokey casino air made me question whether it was worth it. Few of the other casinos we visited had as bad air as the Orleans. On the other hand the table minimums were lower and the food was much more reasonably priced than in the hotels on "the strip" and we could always retreat to our "no smoking" floor to catch our breath.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights at end of Oct 2005 with hubby, daughter (aged 15) and daughter's friend (14). Booked direct with hotel, great rate $60 per night per room. Asked for 2 adjoining rooms on high floor, which we got, no problem. Rooms are generously sized, clean & well equipped. As we prefer to eat out we only ate in the buffet restaurant once (using the buy 1 -get 1 free voucher provided to us at check in); loads of choice and very tasty. (It's worth using the vouchers - you can get free drinks too!) It was warm enough to sit by the pool; this was very clean and not many other guests so easy to find a sun lounger. We're not gamblers so can't comment on those facilities but as the gaming floor is smaller than the strip casinos, it wasn't as noisy when walking through, which was better. My husband and I have stayed at the Luxor previously, (and still would if the price was right) but our budget was more limited on this stay, which meant that we would have to stay 'off strip'. That, and the previous reviews on this site for The Orleans were the main reasons for chosing this hotel. However, being off the strip isn't too much of a problem if you've a car (and most people do) as it's free parking here and at all the other hotels, Overall, we were very impressed and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel and Casino!”
Reviews.Author: JstLv2Crz
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a place to stay for three nights in Vegas between Christmas and New Years that didn't cost me an arm and a leg. I read reviews here about the Orleans Hotel and how nice it was. So I did some searching on the internet and found a web site that was listing rooms for less $ than the Orleans web site itself I called the hotel and told them what I had found and they said that they will match any rate you find else where and beat it by 5%. So I had a room for 3 nights for $24 a night. We checked into the hotel on Christmas day, and found our room very large, clean and with a king size bed! The bed though was very very hard and made for a very uncomfortable nights sleep. So the next morning I went to the front desk and asked if they had any softer beds, and they said that they have upgraded rooms, with very comfortable beds, a coffee maker and view of the Vegas strip for $10 more per night. Sounded like a good deal, so we changed rooms for the extra two nights. What a view from the hotel room! Because of where the hotel sits, you have a full view of all of the Vegas Strip with all of its lights! The Bed was very comfortable, and every shower in the hotel has a little window that you can open, or just look through while you are showering!! Food was very good and very reasonable. Casino was nice and clean, and there is plenty to do. There is a pool, bowling alley, movie theater, arcade area and more. Parking was easy with no hassel too.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans is still a great value”
Reviews.Author: Lee H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans for the second time over Christmas. The good. Large, clean rooms at unbelievable prices (as low as $18/night for certain nights). Bed very good. Easy to park, quick access to the rooms. Security restricts access to rooms to guests only. Near, but not on, the strip, so it's easy to get to the highway, city streets by car. Free shuttle to the Barbary Coast, which is centrally located on the strip. Staff is courteous and helpful. Hotel matches the best price you can find on the internet. The not so good. Very, very, smokey casino (which you have to walk through to get to the rooms). Hotel is starting to show it's age - most obvious sign is dirty and worn carpets in the hallways. Bathroom sink didn't drain properly, which the hotel did not fix despite two calls. Air conditioning was difficult to adjust properly. Bathroom is separated from the room by a non-lockable sliding door.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: iluvvegas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night after finding a rate of $18 on [----------]. Called the Orleans and they matched the price. Arrived around midnight on 12/22. Two people were working, and there were about 8 people waiting in line. Check-in took about 15 minutes. A couple in line ahead of us gave us a coupon for a free night! Awesome! Got a room on the 4th floor in the newer tower near the registration desk. Hotel security near the elevators made you show your key, which was nice. The room was clean and spacious, and looked just like the picture on the website. It was a little odd having a pocket door to the bathroom, and it was a little hard to get it to stay closed. The bed was firm, but wasn't uncomfortable. We didn't have a view, but it was only 1 night so we didn't care. Used the funbook coupons for free beads and a discount on a sweatshirt in the gift shop. Had the buffet for breakfast at $6.50 each. Great selection and everything seemed to be fresh and tasty! Won $20 in the casino. Overall, we loved this hotel and will probably stay here next time we visit Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “The best of Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: WhoGirl16
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Orleans this past May for my 21st birthday weekend. I was so surprsed that this hidden beauty was the best hotel I've ever stayed at. Upon arriving there were a lot of people there that particular weekend but we were promptly taken care of. Our bags were sent up to my room as soon I got to my room, and the room itself was beautiful! I had a lovely view at night. Another reason why I love this hotel is how fast and friendly the service was. The air conditioner was busted in my room and I called the front desk and in no more than 10 minutes the service men were there to fix it! They had to replace the whole unit and it took no more than 20 minutes to fix. There is plenty to do here at this hotel. There is a bowling alley on the top level,arcade, a movie theatre with 18 screens, spa, salon, workout room and a lovely pool. The restaurants are fabulous, I recomend Sazio for dinner and the Courtyard Cafe has a wonderful breakfast. The main reason why I stayed here at this particular hotel/casino was for the entertainment, Burt Bacharach was playing (yes, 21 and I like Burt Bacharach!) there that weekend and the deal I got for the show and the hotel was a steal, I highly recomend getting a show/room package if there's someone performing when you go for your stay. All in all I HIGHLY recomend this hotel when visiting Las Vegas! Beautiful (and clean!) rooms, delicious food, great entertainment, a great staff and just a hop, skip and a jump away from the strip. For what you get for a great value you won't be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Good place with low price”
Reviews.Author: shedcat2
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Orleans from 12/18 to 12/23. I booked the hotel form a third-party website four months ago with a price of $25/nt. As I found out later, in Oct. and Nov., you can get a cheaper price of $18/nt from another third-party website. I checked in at noon. The line was 50-60 people long and only 6 out 12 check-in windows were open. I waited for more than half an hour to check in. The casino was very smoky, and you have to walk through the big casino to get in your room. This really bothered me as a non-smoker. The room I had was on 12th floor with a great view of the strip. It was big enough, my only complain was the sliding door instead of conventional door in the bathroom, and lack of the door in the lavatory. Even though it's not on strip, with a rental car, you can easily get to any hotels you want. The check-out process was a breeze, no waiting at all. Overall, it is not a fancy hotel. But it is the a quality hotel with a very low price. And with a rental car, the off-strip location shouldn't be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “orleans”
Reviews.Author: billkuy
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the Orleans,due to the reviews it received on this site.I stayed in room 1926 the floor below the suites. The view towards the strip was pleasant and the room was at least as good if not better than the Mirage where I have always stayed (3 times) before.The rooms were very large and clean, the staff was always friendly, and though we found the buffet average,our lunch at the Sazios was excellent, and our dinner at Canal Street(their fine dining) was also outstanding. Remember, the prices here are about half of what you will pay on the strip.That made the meals a huge bargain. Unless you are extremely picky, these restaurants compare very favorably with most on the strip. The main drawbacks were the fact that you are over a mile from the strip. The walk would be tough since there did not appear to be a very good or easy route to the strip. We rented a car and it afforded us freedom to move easily around Vegas.I did not use the shuttle and cannot comment on that. We also had the unfortunate room next to 3 young "men" who were in their last night in town and the walls were not thick enough to drown out all the noise going on from about 2:30 am until they left. After that, we had normal neighbors and we slept well. Also the water pressure varied during the shower, but was not horrible, just occasionally annoying. The casino was fair and the VP and slot machines paid off enough to keep us happy.As with any thing, it was not perfect, but well worth the money and a better overall stay than the Mirage.Also they were better with their comps to a small roller like myself than the Mirage.I preferred the Orleans to the Mirage, but the location was the drawback. I will however, try it again and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: algomagirl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Orleans each year for the past two years, and will be again in January. This is THE only place I will ever want to stay! And not even for the price (which is great!), but for everything else. The rooms were exceptionally clean, spacious and comfortable. We usually take a room closer to the elevator and I have no complaints about noise. As a matter of fact, this is one of the quietest hotels I have stayed in anywhere. Security checks for room keys before you even get onto the elevators, which is a huge plus. I've been to other Vegas hotels in the past, and although they (sometimes) have security posted near the elevators, most would let you through without asking any questions. (Rio was always a good one for that). Plenty of places to eat at the Orleans and easy access to the Strip. One thing I really like about the Orleans is that you don't have the loud, crowded 'party' atmosphere that you sometimes find in the other hotels. It's fun, without being obnoxious. I read several reviews that it was smoky, and I'd have to disagree with that. Sure, there is some smoke in the air, but it's not stifling in the least. And I've never had a problem with it making my clothes smell. A couple other reviews said that the slots were tight. I've actually never had that problem. This past January, I stuck $20 into a slot machine and played on that money for almost 3 full days. I guess it depends what machines you play and how wisely you play them. If you're not winning - just stop playing, don't blame a casino for being tight. This is also a hotel where I felt completely safe, and didn't worry at all if I wanted to wander around the casino alone at 2am. Besides the security near the elevators, there is a strong presence of them throughout the casino. The cocktail waitresses were always around and it was never a problem to get a drink or a soda. The staff were all very courteous, accomodating and polite. One year we had a problem with our room and were quickly given another. Unfortunately that room had a very leaky faucet, which was fixed within a matter of 10-15 minutes. There is no hotel that is 100% perfect, and you have to expect problems sometimes. What makes the difference, though, is how quickly the problems are addressed. With the Orleans - I'd have to say their customer service.....in all areas.....is exceptional. I've never stayed in one of the suites, but had family members who did. They are WONDERFUL! If you don't mind shoveling out a few extra bucks, it's well worth it. If you're unsure about where you want to stay, try the Orleans. I'm sure you won't be disappointed. This is the only place I will stay, and will even pass up free rooms to do so. That's how good it is!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than Strip !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ronaldo09
Reviews.Content: I live in Brazil and I love to go to Vegas. I´ve been there 3 times. Out of all hotels i´ve stayed at in Vegas: Caeser´s, Mirage, Bally´s, Aladdin with no doubt ORLEANS is the BEST FOR THE MONEY !!!! Very cheap compared to the strip hotels and the rooms are just as good. I found the access to the hotel and to the rooms very easy. You don´t have to walk around for hours before you get to the elevatoror anything like this. Just perfect, very very pleasant stay !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic time at the Orleans!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pookaloki
Reviews.Content: We arrived tuesday November 29 and left Friday Dec 2, Check In was easy , there was a short line, but it moved quick. We received our king room as requested. the room was large and the cleanest I have ever has in Las Vegas. We lost a little gambling but the comps rolled in quickly. Use the fun book given at check it they sved us a little bundle.. it included free drinks cheap food, mardi gras beads and discouts for entertainment. We were able to see the Las vegas Wrangler (minor league hockey) for free we went to one of the Orleans Arena managers and since the 2nd period had just ended he let us in. Awesome game btw they won in a shoot out!! All the staff members were very helpful and nice ... except for one of the cashiers... but one in thebuch is pretty good. House keeping was perfect they never once forgot anything. We ate at the terrable hamburgers... very yummy, sub-way was a expected (we ate there for free with comp $). The best Dining we had was the Asian place.. It was delicious Sushi.. It was too cold for the pool but it looked nice.. I have stayed at 6 other hotels in town and this one is the best by far... I wold definatly recomend this to ANYONE!!! Enjoy, Cathy

Reviews.Title: “Good Resturants”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed Nov. 3rd thru the 6th Great food. Security a little tight getting to your room, but can understand that. Really enjoyed the Englebert Humperdinck show. It was fabulous and the seats were outstanding. The Main Strip is to fast and furious for we older people and will stay at the Orleans again. Especially if Humperdinck is there.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans Lacks Nothing”
Reviews.Author: vegasvarment
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to Vegas and The Orleans but my first review. I chose this hotel by the internet ratings back in July and was surprisingly shocked at how wonderful this hotel is at such a budget price! That's the reason why I couldn't wait to stay there again Thanksgiving week. To me it's a huge hotel and casino with 13 eating establishments. You don't really need to leave this hotel except to say you visited other hotels on the strip. Besides the casino, there's bowling, an arcade and plenty of movies showing. I don't play the tables but the variety of slots is great! The rooms are very spacious, more like mini suites and spotless. They offer plenty of room amenities, fragrant soaps, shampoo, conditioner, mouth wash, shower caps, iron and ironing board. What more could you ask for. This is Las Vegas's best kept secret, you've got to try it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, convinient and Low Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I saw the prices for this hotel for the weekend of November 18, 2005 and could not believe it. I researched and read the reviews and I was convinced to book. Believe me, this is my fifth visit to Vegas in 2005 and have stayed at many other high end hotels. My first experience at the Orleans was great! WINTER ROOM RATE SPECIAL: First, the hotel rate that I got was amazing for three nights; the price per my whole stay was less than half the normal rate. To upgrade to a suite it would have cost me $50 extra a night but decided to stay at the standard room. Check in was fast and the live was very long. The valet parking is next to the hotel and is very convenient since is next to registration and main entrances to the towers are contiguous. In order to get access to the tower, you will have to show your room key to the security guard….very secured. I would also recommend taking advantage of the coupon book or asking for one. They gave us two coupon books that included six free drinks (in total) at the hotel, two drinks at the Barbary Coast and two at the Gold Coast. These two casinos are just a shuttle or car trip away. The book also contained discount for the bowling, free food, souvenirs and various discounts. ROOMS: The rooms are really big as described by other reviewers. They include a private sitting area with a coffee table next to a big window facing the south, strip or the mountains. If you are staying here and would line a view, I recommend staying above the 6th or 7th floors. The front of the casino blocks the view towards the south of the strip and Vegas from the 5th floor. The room service and maid service were very responsive and quick. Overall the rooms were very clean. Once again, the rooms are bigger than other standard rooms like the…..would not mention but you get the picture. You or your guest would enjoy the couch, chair and table room when relaxing instead of standing up or on top of your bed. ENTERTAINMENT: The bowling alley was great, cheap and spacious. The movie theaters were great and inexpensive for the early part of the day. For those beer drinkers or just want to have chill quiet time drinking a brew, I recommend the Irish Pub. The pub is very decent in size and is clean and well attended. Just put at least 10 dollar in the bar machines and get comp for drinks and make sure you ask for a chicken tender plate for $5 to munch on. POOL: The pool and a medium size pool between the towers and parking lots (4 ft maximum I think). They also have a small pool for kids and a nice Jacuzzi/sauna. It was winter therefore we could not experience it fully. The feeling of being in between the nice looking towers and in the open inside the pool makes me think I will book my room for early summer 2006. LOCATION: Like I said, I have stayed at many hotel and casinos in Vegas and are use to rent or bring my own car. The Orleans is off strip on Tropicana and has access to all major streets that can take to any other casino in the strip without traffic. You should take advantage of the shuttle. I did not use since I had a car but I would recommend you want to go to the strip. The shuttle would taka you to the Barbary Coast in the middle of the strip. From there you can was up or down to the major casinos on the strip. Do not forget to bring your coupons for free drinks at the Barbary Coast when you visit. I come to Vegas at least three to five times a year for pleasure only. I would recommend this hotel if you want to pay less money for a good room, stay in nice quiet environment and have access to various activities within the hotel at low price.

Reviews.Title: “Everything cracked up to be.”
Reviews.Author: macheri
Reviews.Content: Checked trip advisor before selecting a hotel in Las Vegas and was a little nervous about staying at the Orleans (due to the low price). But would gladly return again. Room was clean, very large (suite), well appointed and very reasonably priced. Hotel contained several eateries and a well stocked buffet restaurant. Only real complaint concerned the casino. Like several, but not all, it was pretty smokey, so if you're sensitive to smoke, stay at Orleans but gamble at Caesar's or another higher-end casino. Apparently Orleans has a no-smoking card room, but we never saw it. Another possible draw-back was the shuttle to the strip. It stops running at 12/12:30 a.m., so it's sometimes difficult to get back to the hotel after a show (taxi is roughly $10 - but hey, it adds up, esp. if you're losing). Overall, a terrific value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice trip but a little to far from the strip”
Reviews.Author: Mageeclan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans after reading many reviews and 99% of them were good. We LOVED the rooms. They were very big and comfortable and the bathroom was nice and seperated so that one could shower while the other was getting ready. The little window in the shower is nice for some fresh air. We had a view of the stip so we kept our curtains open most of the time. The casino was nice, we didn't win much, slots seemed to be a little tight. The only downfall was being so far from the strip. The shuttle took so long once we ended up paying $20 for a cab. We had breakfast at the Cafe at 3am $1.95 and I couldn't eat all of it, best value the whole trip! If you want to spend alot of time on the strip I would suggest you stay on the stip. But if you just want to relax, gamble, in a pleasant atmoshpere the Orleans was a nice place and a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprse!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending a night at the Orleans...what a pleasant surprise!...I was able to book a room for $26 because the hotel matches any web price plus gives you an extra 5% off...the room was big and clean...I liked that they had security checking keys before letting people onto the elevators...check in was a breeze...I had no problem with the shuttle going back and forth to the strip...I do think they could use a couple more shuttles would be helpful as I did see some folks get left behind...although I didn't gamble or eat at any of the restaurants I will next time...overall it was a good eperience.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans is a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: cimel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a two-day stay at the Orleans and I have to agree with the other reviews. It is a great value and the rooms are very comfortable. The shuttle is a good thing, but as mentioned before, it would be nice if there were more of them. We saw Engelbert in the showroom and that was fabulous. There's not a bad seat in the house. We bought our tickets as a package and I'm not quite sure why the tickets you purchase that way are so far back. You'd think getting them through the hotel you'd get close-up seats. But like I said, they weren't bad seats. For 2 nights, 2 show tickets and 2 buffet dinners it only cost $169. You can't beat that!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good, clean room with prompt housekeeping; better than most "upscale" places we've stayed. Easy access to 24 hour restaurant with good food at reasonable prices. Off the strip is plus (without crowds of people just wandering through) and minus (off the strip) and plus (a free shuttle). Several times we tired of waiting for the shuttle and enlisted another couple to get a cab, making it cheap for both of you to get to the strip more quickly. We also took a cab when we wanted to get to shows quickly - expensive? at $15 usually with tip, but if you pick up with another couple it's half price and since your wallet is always open in Las Vegas, it's just another cost. Staff was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good for families, otherwise nothing too special”
Reviews.Author: kbp619
Reviews.Content: Families with children will especially like the fact they can put their kids in day care or the movie theatre or even keep em busy with some bowling. Otherwise, this place isn't as great as everyone else claims. The buffet was mediocre and service wasn't all that great. I was given a smoking room despite requesting non-smoking 2 weeks prior when I booked this. They said they would move me the next day but never did, despite me asking. I liked the shuttle that took me to Barabary Coast but wish it ran later than midnight, as I wound up spending $15 to get back later on.

Reviews.Title: “Best Buy Value + Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Las Vegas and the Conference Hotel was already booked - after reading reviews on this site I decided to take a chance on cheap and cheerful. Was I ever glad I did! The ten minute trip by cab to the stip averaged $11.00 and I never had to wait for a cab. The food in the three restaurants I tried was good quality for pricing and the buffet was everything you could wish for and more - at least 10 selections of cake, pie and other desserts were sugar free. My room was spotless, the bed comfortable, and although I was by the elevator I never heard it once! Lots of families with babies and toddlers - great daycare on the 2nd floor. Only downside was all the smoke on the casino floor, but that was the case in all the hotels, if this is a problem best choose a hotel without a casino. I would not hesitate to go back or to send friends there.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: beachluver
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a week at the Orleans. We read a lot of reviews on the hotel and some friends recommended it as well and since the rates were cheap compared to the strip we decided to try it. We were not disappointed one bit. The rooms were huge, clean and comfortable. The staff were all very friendly and willing to help if needed. The casino was a bit smoky at times however it wasn't that bad. There were tons of slots which seemed to pay good over the week we were there and the poker room was excellent. The buffet was excellent as well. The breakfast buffet was $6.45 per person and included coffee, juice etc and you had dozens of items to choose - from regular eggs, omelets, bacon etc to mexican, to chinese to italian etc etc. plus all the fresh fruits, salads etc. They even had desserts at breakfast. The buffet for lunch and dinner was awesome as well. Steak night on Wednesday was excellent and you could eat as much steak and shrimp as you want. Absolutely everything you could think of. If a person couldn't find something they liked, then there was definitely something wrong. The Prime Rib Loft was very good as well as the Japanese, Italian and the Pub. All were very good so a person could eat every meal at the Orleans and have quite a variety and the prices were very reasonable. The security guard checking for room keys before you reached the elevator was a nice touch and a good feeling. The shuttle to and from the strip was okay. We never had a problem and never had to wait more than 20 minutes. They do need to have more shuttles running since some only go to the Gold Coast and the Sun Coast. They could have more shuttles and a better system that would alleviate some of the wait time since there are only 19 seats on the shuttle and there is no standing. Some people did complain however it wasn't that bad and they are looking into getting a better service. Also you can take the bus (201) which stops across the street for $1.25 and it takes you to the strip by the Tropicana/New York New York so that's another option. If your walking the strip and looking at hotels etc be prepared top walk because you will be doing a lot of it. We stopped and took a lot of "breaks" which definitely helped so make sure you have comfortable shoes. We took the monorail one day to try it. What a mistake. The monorail is located behind the properties which didn't seem too bad at first however they are a looooonnnnnggggg way back there. It took us an hour to go from the Luxor to MGM and we could have walked it in 20 minutes. So in other words we walked an extra 40 minutes just to take the monorail. I would recommend taking The Deuce (bus) for $2.00 as it will take you up and down the strip. The Orleans also gives you a Funbook when you check in which has 2 for 1 dinner buffets, free drinks ( even though the coupon says Gold Coast, you can use it The Orleans, plus other coupons that will save you money. We didn't go bowling or see a movie in their theatres but we talked to people that did and they said both were very good. If you are looking for a friendly place to stay, with all the conveniences of a Strip hotel but at third the price, then this is a great hotel. We are planning a return visit in the spring. If you have any questions, just ask and I will answer the best I can.

Reviews.Title: “Want a break from the chaos on the strip? Try The Orleans Hotel & Casino!”
Reviews.Author: golf_hawaii
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at The Orleans last week from Tuesday to Friday. Due to the unusually warm November weather, we were able to enjoy the beautiful outdoor pool area along with the rest of this hotel's many amenities! We enjoyed lounging in the bright sunshine and plunging into the cool pools after being in the warm island style (complete with waterfalls) Jacuzzi! Upon our arrival at 11am on Tuesday, we were welcomed promptly at the front desk and were afforded an early check in. We were assigned to room 924. This room is a standard non-smoking room with two queen beds. Unlike the rooms above the 12th floor, it has not yet been renovated. Because of the extreme cleanliness of the room, and the tasteful (but admittedly outdated) decor, we still found it to be a very tasteful, spacious room and a fantastic value for the money! Our room was appointed with a hairdryer & ironing board, but lacked an in-room coffee pot or safe. There is an area in the bathroom to hang clothes in lieu of a "closet" (which is great for steaming wrinkles)! There were no major signs of wear in the room. One could potentially be disappointed by this "strip view" room because it also overlooks an parking lot with huge lights, which are directed upward toward the hotel. This makes it somewhat difficult at night to actually see the strip because of the bright lights shining into your eyes. For us it was fine, but might be nice to know if you are making a specific room request. The rooms here are unique for Las Vegas, in that there is actually a window that opens (in the shower)! The pocket door entrance to the bathroom is located next to the sitting area which includes a couch, end table, lamp and chair. This area is in the rear of the room, instead of the front, which I found to be a refreshing change from a standard hotel room layout. The overall layout of the hotel is nice. You are able to get to both the pool and the parking garage without even entering the casino! There is a spa, a movie theatre, an arcade, a bowling alley and a daycare here in addition to the numerous coffee shops, bars and restaurants. Because we had a rental car, we did not use the complimentary shuttle to & from the strip. For me, I think the shuttle would be a fine substitution for a rental car during a short stay since I don't usually spend a great deal of time on the strip. Overall, I was very impressed with The Orleans. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating. The rooms were large and clean. There is plenty to do without ever leaving the hotel and sometimes it's nice to get away from the crowded hotels on the strip. I will definitely stay here again and would recommend it to family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “Orleans met expectations”
Reviews.Author: RobBflo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Orleans for three nights, Oct 21-24th. All in all it was fine, check in was quick. The first room we were given had a pretty bad odor about it, so we called down for a room change, bellman came up with key to new room, which was fine. He even exclaimed when he opened the door that the smell was awful. The rooms we saw were pretty average, but the price is reasonable. The casino was good, dealers were friendly, rules were fair. Used the gym once, OK, a little above average for the price the hotel charges for rooms. The gym was free with a fun coupon. The distance to the strip was never an issue, we never even went to a strip casino, went Downtown, to Green Valley, Mesquite, and The Palms. The Palms seems like it may be a nice place to try out, the steakhouse was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/Casino”
Reviews.Author: Tippet
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Orleans Hotel/Casino from November 3-6, 2005 with an airline package plan through Allegiant Airlines. The hotel/casino was excellent. I had requested and received a very nice large room on the top(21st) floor. It had a seperate sitting area which we always appreciate. The hotel/casino has four movie theaters and bowling if you tire of the gambling. It is not far from the strip. You can drive over to the strip or use the hotels shuttle van. The staff was friendly and helpful. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Off Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Connie41
Reviews.Content: First timers in Las Vegas and stayed at several properties and found The Orleans rated right up there and offered good value for money. We were given a lovely room on the 16th floor with great views to strip, which was a bit wasted for the little time we spent in the room! Check in was straight up and helpful. Generally we found the dealers to be one of the most friendliest we came across, the waitresses quick with the drinks, however, the slots were extremely tight. Won a little on keno and broke even on the tables. Buffet ordinary (we dined late and it didn't look fresh). Steakhouse was one of the best meals we had. Courtesy bus was convenient to get back from strip in evening (we walked to the strip during the day!). Generous comps for a few days stay at checkout! You won't find much to complain about here!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Place to Stay Off Strip!!”
Reviews.Author: westcoastd
Reviews.Content: I booked myself into the Orleans via Vegas.com. After a flight delay, and a hour and half wait for a cab at the airport. I arrived at the hotel. The checkin process was very smooth, and very accommodating . I was checked into room 1496. The room was very nice, and quiet with a king size bed. I really enjoyed the casino, and the hotel in general, however the buffet was nothing to write home about, but it was a nice place to stay off of the strip, and since the traffic in Las Vegas seems to be getting worse, as I was told by a number of cab drivers, an off strip hotel provides a quick trip from the airport. Any questions feel free to e-mail me.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Las Vegas and we are glad we chose the Orleans to stay at. The oversize rooms were great and service was excellant. This place has it all including family fun, bowling, movie theatres, gameworks, and absolutely the best buffet in Las Vegas. The casino and joining areas are exceptionally clean in comparison with the strip casinos and All the staff treat you like they really appreciate you being there. They have the best poker room of all the casinos

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: ricku1u
Reviews.Content: Our second trip to Vegas-We were very impressed with the quality of this "off strip" hotel. Read the reviews before we booked our stay and it was everything we expected and more. The staff is friendly, courteous, and accomodating. We would definately recommend this hotel to our friends and will stay here again. It is a very clean hotel with large rooms and reasonable rates (if you look for them). You will probable need a car unless you don't mind waiting for a shuttle bus.

Reviews.Title: “Off Strip Gem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Visited from Nov.1st to 4th. Check-in was slow due to a computer problem. We got in under the wire, as guests behind us had to come back in 1/2 hour, while the staff corrected the problem. Room was ready at 12:30 for us. Fair view of the pool and mountains. Room was spotless, and the housekeeping was great everyday. Only played slots with some luck on video poker. But after all was said and done, we made our usual deposit to the casino. Food was good, from terrible Mikes burgers, to canal street. There was nothing bad to report about this casino. Very good hotel for the price. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Players comps are better than most, with a nice cash-back to their guests. New players cards were issued to us, and can be used at the new South Coast Casino opening in Jan-06. Check-out was a breeze. The casino offers you a variety of acitivites for you to enjoy. Pool, Bowling, Movies, Shows, Events, and the large arena always has something going on. Shuttle to the strip if you don't rent a car. Parking garage is available for you if you rent a car. Overall just a great place to stay. Would recommend Orlean's to everyone. Can't wait to go back. A&G

Reviews.Title: “The New Orleans in Vegas a Fabulous place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kinatlanta
Reviews.Content: Just got home from a fabulous stay at the New Orleans in Vegas. We were there from 10/16-10/19. I had stayed at this hotel before and was so impressed by the size of the rooms that when we planned a return trip with some friends that I chose this one again. I was not sorry! Our friends just loved it. The rooms were nice and so so clean, we got placed in the new tower and though the rooms did not seem quite as large, and we were given queens instead of our requested kings, it was so nice that it did not even matter! I did not book thru the hotel but another travel site I found a great deal on, $59 a night and we got coupon books for food and drinks at all the Coast Casino's, However, after I had already booked it I found on the New Orleans website that they will match any other offer so will go directly thru them next stay. We were also impressed with the music of the house bands, the gambling was as good as anywhere we played and the restaurants were excellent. If that had been the only place we stayed we would have been quite content. We also went downtown and stayed a few nights in an upscale place but our hearts remained at the New Orleans! Try it! From Atlanta Vegas Lovers

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: dacarr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the orleans late october 05 because we got an excellent deal on airfare/4nights/rental car for 2 people from seattle for less than $500 from AmericaWestVacations. Check in was quick/smooth. Tried the $20 trick to upgrade room-was politely turned down,but was still upgaded to one of the newer rooms on the top floor. Large room with a seperate seating area with loveseat & chair/table. Bathroom was large, mable tile and a window in the shower that opens. PROS: Larger rooms than most rooms on the strip,rooms for a whole lot less $ than on the strip,9 restaurants,a 70 lane bowling center,multi screen movie theater,ok swimming pool.great service by staff. If you have a rental car,an advantage for not staying on the strip is that you avoid the awful traffic and the sometimes careless pedestrians that are on the strip. CONS: Not on the strip( 1.5 miles off?) they have free shuttle though. swimming pool closes too early at 5pm(We like to go to the hot tubs after dinner sometimes.) The bed seemed hard, and the pillows flat(some people may like this)the toilet/shower/sink-vanity/clothes closet are all in the same room-toilet does not close off seperate-this was a slight problem as we had friends to our room throughout our stay and my wife had to leave the vanity a few time while she was trying to get ready to go out so someone could use the bathroom. We would consider staying here again if we were offered another attractive deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed with Orleans”
Reviews.Author: wild1cats
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans from Fri. Oct 21st till Wed Oct. 26th. The rooms, personnel, and casino were 1st rate from one couple who have been to LV many times and our friends who were visiting for the 1st time. Orleans accommidated our 1st timer friends with a strip view room on the 16th floor. We all had some luck in casino at VP and Wheel of Fortune $1 machines. Food was fine at French Market Buffet. Looking forward to staying at this fine location once more in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “First Stay Here--Good value”
Reviews.Author: ANNIEPG
Reviews.Content: We visit Vegas often but this was our first stay at the Orleans. Previous reviews assured that I had no surprises. Positives: Value, clean & spacious room, good service, strong security and a fun atmosphere. The show (Frankie Avalon and Bobby Rydell) was fun and inexpensive. Various casino bands were very good also. Negatives: Buffet food was bland to the point that we did not go back for a second meal despite having a free coupon for it. The shuttle service was disappointing. Catching the shuttle was a "free for all" with no designated place at the main entrance for it. Hence, a crowd just milled around for quite awhile. When the bus finally did show up, the people who just happened to be closer to where the bus stopped got on. The people who had waited the longest did not get seats. It seems that a simple "line starts here" sign would have helped immensely. One other thing that I am not quite sure how to classify. While I certainly do not expect to win, I do expect to buy some playing time with my money. It seems that every machine I played there just sucked up my money with no give backs. When I visited other casinos I could play for hours with the same amount of money that lasted only minutes at the Orleans. No wonder I did not see any signs for "98% paybacks" or any similar advertisements there. All in all, I would consider staying there again because of the clean room for a decent price. Since we always rent a car anyhow, the distance from the strip and shuttle problems will not keep me away.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you like that sort of thing”
Reviews.Author: CatsWhiskars
Reviews.Content: Rooms were big and we did get a fairly cheap rate- however the hotel itself was depressing. The casino is run down and smokey. I have a theory that the more the waitresses wear in a casino the classier it is and I could see bum cheeks at the Orleans. None of the staff seem very happy- the dealers all looked particularly miserable. Some of the staff were also quite rude- maybe it's not worth trying for tips in a down market casino. The book of coupons you get when you check in has a lot of vouchers but most of them are buy X get a free Y. The free cocktail vouchers are a joke- after going through a list of (well known easy to make) cocktails they didn't do I gave up and got a beer. I don't know if all hotels in Vegas are like this but once inside it was like the rest of Vegas didn't exist- no maps, no brochures nothing- it took us quite a while to find the small descrete sign for the shuttle bus. The shuttle bus is OK but not particularly convenient- often there are more people waiting than seats and there is quite a long wait between buses. The pool was always shut when we tried to use it. We didn't use the gym but it looked small but OK.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans Hotel, a good value”
Reviews.Author: colotrvlr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans Hotel for four days, generally a good experience Pros-Room was clean and in good shape, housekeeping was very good. Cons- The room had an older style window type air conditioner that was somewhat noisy. What worked the best is to cool the room off a few extra degrees, then turn off the unit. The t.v. would sometimes turn off immediately after you turned it on. Solved this problem by unplugging then plugging t.v. back in. Had to run shower several minutes for the water to heat up, a waste. The buffet was very good, the v.p. payoffs very bad. Did not gamble there much. Good drinks, bartenders know how to make a mai-tai. Shuttle service was very iffy, often there were more people waiting than the shuttle could hold, especially on the way back to the Orleans. A rental is necessary. Pool is nice, but chilly. All employees encounter were helpful and polite. Good room security. Probably wouldn't stay their again since adding a rental car negates the cheaper room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: MS8688
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the Orleans in the past few years. I highly recommend this hotel. The Orleans offers a wide variety of eating options, and the rooms are large and clean. I took the shuttle to the strip two evenings and it was no problem at all. Free valet parking, very reasonable rates, and easy to find. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sheavesey
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Orleans and couldn't fault it. The rooms were large, comfortable and spotless. There is a courtesy bus service every 15 minutes to and from the strip so it was no hardship being a mile away. Don't try and walk it. We did and it didn't take long but you can't get across the road to the strip itself as it is fenced off. We had to go into a hotel and get a taxi!!! Our only complaint was with the hotel pool as it didn't open until 10am and it closed at 6pm. The weather was very hot during our stay and it would have been nice if the opening hours were longer. The buffet breakfast was excellent and terrific value.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Walking”
Reviews.Author: HamTex
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Orleans. First and foremost... it's huge. Wear very comfy shoes or none at all. The room was good but no coffee maker. The iron leaked everytime I used it. And the sliding door into the bath was off the runner and was a -----. They did get it fixed on the second call. The food we had there was subpar and expensive. And the BED!!! It's one of the best we've had anywhere. We're in our 60s so the bed was used primarily for sleep but it was good. Penny slots have made a comback in Vegas and the Orleans has scads of them. Sportsbook was good. Dealers are a bit snooty for some reason, maybe English is a second language and they don't know how to loosen up and joke a bit. We won't be rebooking at the Orleans simply because of the size. But if you do go just valet park everytime and let the bellman do his thing with the bags.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent "Off the Strip" casino/hotel”
Reviews.Author: CB-Mokey
Reviews.Content: We visit Las Vegas each year for 7 days during the last week of September and had usually stayed on the Strip at the Flamingo. In 2004 the prices of the Strip hotels were simply out of our budget. We decided to try the Orleans having gambled there previously. We were very pleasantly surprised to find a beautiful spacious room, great restaurants (loved Sazio's), excellent gaming options, and very friendly staff. Having to present your room key to security to access the hotel tower might seem to be a pain to some, but gave us an added level of security. (Some of the high class hotels on the Strip don't even have that service.) Even though we had a car rental, the shuttle service was excellent, and brings you right to the heart of the Strip across from Caesars, Bellagio, and Bally's. Perhaps the only minor drawbacks were that the pool was fairly standard (and gets shade in the afternoon), and it can be a bit of a walk from the parking lot to the hotel.
