After having such a great time in 2004 we didn't even think twice about where we would stay in 2005, and this year (since we had signed up for their Player's Card the year before) we received a great reduced rate on our room. Being in an "off Strip" location we found that things were a bit more relaxed and low key. If you enjoy the energy and the crowds of people on the Strip you may feel a little out of place here. Personally, we enjoy the relaxed pace and lower gaming limits (and generally higher video poker and slot payouts) of the "local" casinos so the Orleans was great for us. We are already looking forward to returning in 2006.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit”
Reviews.Author: kawinki
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to The Orleans and once again, I was happy with my choice. There are so many great hotels to choose from in Vegas and I have stayed at many of the really fancy hotels on the Strip but this is the first hotel I have returned to. I love it because the rooms are clean and quiet, it has a great inexpensive breakfast buffet ($6.45) and really low rates. The security is impressive and check in and out was very fast. I wish the parking was more conveniently located by the room entrance but I don't mind the walk. Also, it helps if you have a car even though they do have a shuttle. I highly recommend this hotel for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place at a great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A few friends and I just stayed for a long weekend at the Orleans Oct. 7 - 9th. The only bad thing I can say about this hotel/casino is that it is not on the strip. Well, the buffet isn't the greatest in the world either, but I didn't really care too much about that. We were looking for an affordable place over the weekend, which is always waaaay more expensive than Sunday - Thursday, so we decided on the Orleans even though it was off the strip. The casino is huge, and I had no problems with dealers or waitresses. The outfits the waitresses wear are among the best in Vegas! The rooms are larger than average at 450 sq. feet. Everything was very clean and the furniture in great shape. Check in (around midnight on a Friday) was about 5 minutes. They had cabs outside whenever I needed one. I don't think it was more than $15 in the cab to go anywhere we went (strip, Hard Rock casino, par 3 golf course), so the fact that it was off the strip wasn't a big deal, and we paid $119/night plus tax on a Friday and a Saturday night!!! To get the quality of the Orleans right on the strip, you would pay at least twice that on a weekend. All in all, a great spot, and I will probably stay there again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice place”
Reviews.Author: Kevel
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time in 3 years that we've stayed at the Orleans, and it still remains an exceptional value, especially when you are able to go during one of their special rate time periods. The rooms are elegant and clean, the staff is courteous and helpful. The only caveat would be, that, because it is located away from the Strip (which isn't a bad idea), I feel it is pretty important to have your car or a rental car to be able to enjoy Vegas properly. Cabs work fine, I guess, and there's plenty of them there at all times, so I guess that works out for some people as well. Also.....the buffet is outrageous! And the Casino itself is pretty good too.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another recommendation for the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Part_time_traveller
Reviews.Content: We had read plenty of good reviews of the Orleans, and guess what, here comes another. Our rooms were huge (by European standards), clean, quiet and extremely good value, booked direct via the hotel website. Used the buffet at both breakfast and dinner, good value for money, tried the Luxor buffet one night which was a higher standard, but more expensive. Fun books gave us plenty of good value drinks. Didn't worry about being off the strip, after all, Ceasars Palace is as far from the Luxor as it is from the Orleans! We had no real delays with the shuttle to the strip, and could always get a seat, but did tend to take a cab if in a hurry. Can't comment on gambling, we're definitely not high rollers! Pool was good, but a lack of shade chased us in later in the afternoon. Check in was quick, efficient and the staff were friendly, although the layout with regard to parking garage and access to rooms took some working out. Would recommend Orleans to anyone looking for good value, good standard accomodation in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great child care center frees parents”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Unlike most Casino Hotels in Las Vegas, this one is kid friendly. There's an hourly child care center inside that our child age eight just loved. We had to drag him out of there. The staff seemed attentive and responsible. Their security system was impressive. We tried using them five years earlier, when our son was only three, and he loved it then too. This is a place where kids can meet friends, and adults can enjoy a little break. We'll go there again next time we visit Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “A great Stay at The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to Las Vegas but the first to The Orleans. Most impressed with the quality and cleanliness of the room, very quiet too. Another plus was the security including the checking of room keys before going to the guest room. We found the staff both helpful and friendly. Casino area was a little smokey but bearable. A good selection of restaurants at which the quality of food and the service were both good. We liked the swimming pools and the availability of sunbeds but we were disappointed that the pools were only open from Monday to Thursday, perhaps due to the time of year. Courtesy buses were efficient and always on time. All in all very pleased with our stay and would definitely stay here again and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Better every time”
Reviews.Author: crupiea
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Orleans and we had a great time!! I asked for a high floor when we checked in and were given the 21st/Top floor. It is very nice. Much better carpetting then the lower floors and very quiet. This is a great place for being off the strip and getting away from the hustle and bustle. It is like coming home at the end of the evening. We take cabs everywhere because we are usually drinking and should not be driving anyway. This is a very relaxing place to stay and the staff are very nice. No matter how you calcuate it. It is still abetter deal then the strip and it just feels a lot safer.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay...”
Reviews.Author: susie_vegas_addict
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the end of a US holiday at the Orleans. We mainly booked because reviews told us it was good quality and value for money. However a few minus points - although the casino floor didn't appear as smokey as I expected after reading earlier reviews, it did affect my eyes (contact lens wearer) and our clothes always smelt smokey. Major problem with noise from the corridor - we would have liked to sleep in late, however were always woken up from 7am onwards due to other residents or the previously mentioned housekeeping. We asked to move, which they did arrange (up to 20th floor) but this was no better. I think the layout of the rooms (bathroom on the window side, rather than the corridor side) didn't help. Room itself was fine with comfortable beds, good sized tv, sofa and arm chair. Bathroom also fine, with a hanging rail for your clothes, and the 'opening' window. Whilst in the shower we could see the strip! All of the restaurants that we ate in (Prime Rib Loft, Don Miguels, the Chinese / sushi bar, Terrible Mikes) were great and very reasonably priced. Good value fun book also with good offers and freebies. Shuttle service was ok, but problems with waiting (anything from 15 minutes) in the blazing sun, with no shelter or seating area. Also other customers did not seem to understand the courtesy of queueing so sometimes it was a bit of a free for all to get on! On the few occasions that we did use it, we always got a seat, however we had a hire car so did not need to rely on it all of the time. It does drop you right in the centre of things at the Barbary Coast, opposite the Bellagio and Ballys. Only used the pool area once, which was fine, easy enough to find a sunbed, nice pools and decks. Security check your keys before you can get in the lifts, which is reassuring. Overall, I would recommend this hotel, if you don't want to sleep in late, or are sensitive to cigarette smoke. We did also stay in the Venetian during our holiday, so we were probably spoiled!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Member From Shellharbour Australia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Flamingo in 2002 but as the price had increased greatly this time thought we would try the Orleans as we got a very good deal compared to most places. The rooms are comfortable,very nice and large. The people at reception were friendly and efficient. The pool was a bit crowded at times but OK. We ate at the buffett once which was not too expensive and had relatively normal fare (Ie not too fancy but substantial) The casino is not very flashy compared to most other Las Vegas Hotels and didnt really conjure up the feeling of being in New Orleans. It appears they have not invested the same time or money into the decor that other hotels have and as a result looks a bit simple compared to others. While some people would welcome a pleasant but simpler place, I feel they could have done a better job with the theme decor. The energy and excitement level seems to be lower than on most strip locations. We did not have a car during our stay so were reliant on public transportation and the shuttle bus. The main problem was that it was not uncommon for us to wait 10 to 20 minutes outside in 100 degree weather for a shuttle or public bus which were occasionally full. A more frequent service or larger bus would help to reduce waiting times. Cant comment on the gambling as we dont gamble. Overall the Orleans is a pleasant hotel casino with nice rooms, reasonable food and service and somewhat simpler decor than many strip locations. I think it represents very good value for money. While a shuttle bus does take guests to the strip and back, with the present level of service I found the location a disadvantage without a vehicle. Although I liked the Orleans I probably would not stay here again unless the shuttle service was improved.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Bring your Brain to the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Orleans, took my whole family there last summer and that went great. This year just I and the wife went for our anniversary. I am down playing BJ at a $5 table to kill some time before dinner and I am asked to leave by the floor manager. At this point I have lost around $50 and I am confused. I ask him why he has embarrassed me in front of everyone at the table and within earshot. He says I was making bets that were an advantage to me. Again im confused im just in town for my anniversary playing some BJ. I say to him I don’t understand and he states I was betting more money when it was to my advantage. I said im watching and when I see that the last hand had lots of small cards and not many big ones odds are next hand might be more likely to get 2 face cards so im more likely to win I thought so I bet some more money. This to me seemed like common sense. I was even using one of those BJ strategy cards to help remember the right time to hit etc. He said that betting more when I think I might win isn’t allowed. So I left and canceled all my reservations at that hotel for the evening and we checked out the next day. I wrote a letter to their management but never got a response so im just letting everyone else know how they treat you. I played the exact same way when I was there the summer before and had no issues; I think I even won a couple hundred bucks that time so this seems as a selective and stupid way to treat paying customers for no reason. I am not some high roller card counter taking them for thousands of dollars im playing $5 table. Well just thought everyone should be aware, don’t go there and use your brain, just and them your money and leave. thx Vince

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at The Orleans from 9/4 thru 9/9. We booked the hotel back in March of this year. I checked online at other travel sites and found a really great deal, so i called the resort and they matched it and beat it by 5%!!!! A few weeks later i received an email from The Orleans and they had a special going on for 9/5 thru 9/8. It was 2 free nights stay!!! I then called them and split up my reservation into 2. We paid $100 for 9/4 and then the rest of the trip was free!!!!!! CANT BEAT THAT!!! From what i have read in the past, everything seems to be the truth. The rooms are very nice and clean. No problems with the check in or check out. The coupon books are nice, they offer free drinks!!!!! I have read in prior reviews about the bathrooms being dirty, nothing like that here. Our only problem during our trip was that when we were at the pool, the drink girls were never around, and when they were, it seemed like the never came to our side of the pool. We ate at the buffet 2 times and the cafe 2 times as well, the food was very good. We have stayed on the strip before (The Monte Carlo), and probably would stay at The Orleans again (if we get a good deal again). A rental car is a must though!!!!! We had a car and I timed our ride to The Flamingo Hilton (8 minutes) and that was with hitting a red light or 2. All in all i would give The Orleans a THUMBS UP!!!!

Reviews.Title: “just a real nice place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the orleans from aug. 28 to sept. 2. this was our 2nd time and we just love it there. checking in was fast and easy. we ate at the prime rib loft twice this time, very good. the french market buffet is very good for the price's , cheap. we spent alot of time at the pool and hot tub very nice and the waitresses in the casino well just see for yourself and enjoy your stay at the orleans. see you next year and thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I arrived at the Orleans on August 29, mid morning and check-in was quick and easy. Our rooms were ready despite the 4:00pm check-in. Staff was very friendly. The room was clean and the decor was ok. Our biggest complaints would have to be the door and slow drainage in the bathroom. The door is a big wooden sliding door that is extremely loud. I usually like to sleep in a little longer than my boyfriend and it was very difficult not waking up to the loud sliding door. If you like to play to the late hours in the casinos and think you are going to sleep in late, think again, housekeeping starts about 8:00-8:30am and can be heard clearly throughout the corridors. The atmosphere in the casino is definitely not your average casino on the strip. Two years ago we stayed at Treasure Island and enjoyed the classy atmosphere. We also visited most of the hotels on the strip. If you want a quiet, less crowded casino, The Orleans is the way to go. It is definitely kid friendly. They have a very large bowling alley and an arcade room for the children. They also have a great movie cinema which we utlized when we needed a break from gambling. As far as gambling goes, we played roulette and slot machines. It was amazing to find roulette tables at $1.00 minimum bets. The catch is the tables don't have the number displays, but overall, not bad. The first night my boyfriend played the $1 Wheel of Fortune slot machine and after a few spins, hit for $1,500 which was great! As far as the food is concerned, we really enjoyed the buffet. The food and desserts were pretty good. The price for the food was excellent. If you don't like being confined to the hotel you can take a 10 min cab ride to the strip for about $10.00. The hotel also has a free shuttle to the strip which we tried once. Not a bad ride, you get let off at the Barbary Coast Hotel. Overall, The Orleans was a great bargain. We decided we wanted a change in scenery and wanted to be on the strip so we checked out of The Orleans on the 3rd day and decided to return to Treasure Island since we had a special rate we received in the mail from our stay at the hotel 2 years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: gilboman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orleans from Sept 6 -9 and found the rooms to be very clean and hotel area easy to navigate. Only negative was they didnt have the King room i requested when i made the reservation few months ago and the beds were not the most comfortable. possibly due to my stay at hotels prior to orleans all had pillowtop mattresses and duvets. but the location was not bad at all for I had a rental car and was only a 2-3min drive to the strip and parking was close to the hotel as well. valet was quick also.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I recently stayed at The Orleans in Las Vegas and loved it. The rooms were spacious, updated and clean. Security was at the elevators at all times. Beautiful pool area. San Miguel's restaurant had the best Mexican food. Everything was so fresh. Service was great. Also, the rates were reasonable, and just a short drive to the strip. We usually stay at the Flamingo.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: shelleyc
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Orleans was, ironically, during Hurricane Katrina, 8/28-8/30. I chose the Orleans because of the excellent rates and the great reviews on TripAdvisor. Also, I'm from NO, and I was interested in the NO themed decorations. I wasn't disappointed. PROS 1) The standard room was quite large, and very clean, with a small, separate sitting area. 2) The A/C worked very well, and we like it COLD for sleeping (went as low as 60F.) 3) The pool area was clean and well supervised by the life guards. There's a seperate kiddie pool, which my 7 yr old loved. The large hot tub is landscaped beautifully. The pool remains completely in the shade for most of the morning, which not everyone will like, but was great to me. Even after the sun finally makes it over the side of the tall hotel, a corner of the pool remains shaded. No sunburn! 4) The buffet (breakfast & dinner) is only of average quality, but the price made it worth our while. $6.45 breakfast/$12.95 dinner (No discount for kids, though.) 5) I didn't use the childcare facility, but another mother said she (and her daughter) were quite happy with it. 6) We enjoyed the bowling alley, as a family, and used coupons from the Orleans Funbook for free games. 7) The New Orleans themed, lighted decorations in the casino were great! 8) Security guards were very good about checking room cards for those going up in elevators. I'm sure a pro could have slipped past, but your casual thief probably would have been stymied. CONS (Only minor complaints.) 1) We were given a room right next to the elevator, but it was immediately changed without comment when I asked for another room. 2) Also, we had a coupon for 20% off merchandise in the gift shop, but it was for a minimum $25 purchase. We weren't allowed to combine receipts for items purchased literally 3 minutes apart that added up to more than $25, so we could get the 20% off. Not a big deal, but irritating. 3) Also, had a coupon for a free bottle of wine with purchase of 2 dinner buffets. But we got to the buffet late, and I didn't think to ask about the wine until the end of the meal. By then, there were few staff members around, and the 2 I asked could not (would not) help me, so another useless coupon. 4) The "free" shuttle only goes between the Orleans, the Gold Coast, and the Barbary Coast (on the strip) -- sister properties of the Orleans. It's not on a set schedule and stops at midnight. If you intend to travel much, a car would probably be desirable. 5) NO kiddie channels on TV! Overall, I would stay at the Orleans again.

Reviews.Title: “Coming back home and Loved it”
Reviews.Author: pharaoh526
Reviews.Content: I'm originally from Las Vegas, and brought my wife to my "home" for her birthday. We stayed on the 18th and 19th of Aug and we must say that it exceeded our expectations. The check-in was very fast, the staff was extremely friendly, and our room was clean. The coupon books the check-in clerk gave us was very helpful: from the free drinks at any bar; 20% off entire dinner bill at the italian restaurant, and much more. There are many things to do without leaving the hotel, from watching movies in the cinema to bowling in the 70 lane alley, to watching the lounge shows in the theater. Here are a couple of recommendations and a few complaints I did have about the hotel though. 1) Make sure that you either rent a car or are capable of waiting for a shuttle. I was fully aware of the 30-1 hour waiting period for a shuttle to take you to the strip, so I definetly recommend a rental to come and go as you please. 2) The layout of the hotel is not exactly navigation friendly: The parking garage is a bit of a walk to the hotel rooms, and can be confusing if you don't have a map of the hotel layout. Expect a 5-10 min walk from Room to elevator to parking garage; the security guard at the elevator lobby should help you in finding the parking garage. 3) We stayed in room 632 and I really only have 2 complaints. The first is that the water temperature of the showers was not hot enough; lukewarm at best. I know i may sound petty, but after being in the Vegas heat all day, you would like to have a hot shower or bath and relax for a bit before a night on the town. The second complaint (again about the bathtub) is that the shower drains very slowly, so that you are standing in a pond when you are taking a shower, and it was more annoying than bad, so take it with a grain of salt. 4) The gym is small,so either arrive very early to use the treadmills or go late a night. It's is not busy at any other times it just that there aren't enough machines to go around. 3 treadmills and 2 stairmasters; with a small assortment of free weights. When you do decide to go, make sure you bring your coupon for free admission to the spa, the staff person will ask you for that coupon as proof that you're a hotel guest, and you won't have to pay for that day, but you only get one day free, I believe it's $10 a day after the intial use. I hope you are able to enjoy yourself as my wife and I did, and make sure to take advantage of the free souvenir coupon when you check-in. Enjoy your stay

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ncbenson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Orleans this weekend for the 3rd time. We are always thrilled with the great service and happy employees. When we first got there, they upgraded our room at no charge for an unknown reason. The suite was fantastic. The rooms we normally stay in are also exceptionally clean and well cared for. But, this suite was incredible. As always, from the time we walked in until we left, all the employees are extremely friendly and go out of their way to ensure that you have a great time. This time, we never even left the hotel / casino. Orleans has everything to offer that the strip does, but they offer it in a cheerful friendly manner. If the dealers in Vegas are going to separate you from your money, they can at least be friendly while doing so. I'll pay them to provide entertainment and a smile, they don't have to treat you like you owe them. The Prime Rib Loft was excellent as always as was the buffet. The movie theatres are extremely clean and well kept. The sound system in the theatres is great. We find the Orleans has great all around enjoyment AND (sorry to all you animal lovers) they don't allow pets! I find it wonderful that I can go to sleep knowing that I have not shared a bed with someone else's dog! The only complaint is that they cannot magically make more time for us to enjoy their facility. It is by far the best value in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The orleans Just my kind of Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Orleans and for the price this place is off the hook great clean rooms bathroom has a window that opens the bed is very comfortable, I usually I stay at the golden nugget. but now this is my place alot to do there, foods great prices steaks and eggs potatoes 1.95 Ill will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “what a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been to Vegas a few times and I must say, this is by far the best experience I have had. First I'll address the "distance from the strip" issue. Yes, it is a bit of a distance from the strip. My companion had never been to Vegas before so of course we had to make the trip to the main strip area. While the shuttle is free, we weren't really into meeting a schedule so we ended up taking a taxi each time. Not free - but cheaper than renting a car. What we found was that other than the obligatory "we saw the strip" - there was no reason to leave the Orleans. After visiting the strip hotels, we found that being away from the masses of people meant that the staff was friendlier, the casino was less crowded, and drinks were easier to get. Most of the hotels on the strip have "minimum gambling dollar" amounts for free cocktails. If you don't have at least $20 in a slot machine, for example, they charge you for the cocktail. We found this to be true in several of the major hotels. The Orleans was an absolute jewel. The rooms are huge and exceptionally clean. Room service is fast and very, very good. We tried each restaurant in the hotel except for the Mexican restaurant and found them to be top notch. As a matter of fact, I would venture to say that the dinner we had at Canal Street was one of the better dining experiences I have ever had. Tables in the casino are abundant and I never once had to look for a $5 blackjack table - and we were there on a weekend. Do yourself a favor and actually explore the whole casino floor when you get there. There were two or three sections I never evn knew about until later in the trip. We also hit the bowling alley and found it to be in very good shape. The place wasn't crowded (go during the morning or afternoon) and we had a great time. If you want to have a great couple of days in Vegas and don't want to have to deal with huge crowds of people, you owe it to yourself to try this hotel. I bet you won't even leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and great for kids”
Reviews.Author: podonn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in August with my husband and two children aged 9 &11 before flying to New York. It is excellent. Rooms are large (we had two doubles and a sofa area) and very clean, as is the bathroom which houses the iron and ironing board. We had previously spent four nights at the Paris before heading off to explore California and I must say the rooms at the Orleans are much larger but unfortunately do not have the magnificent views of the strip. If you do not mind being off the strip then the Orleans is for you! When you check in each is adult provided with a booklet offering discounts and freebies to use at the hotel. Such as free bottle of wine when ordering a meal at the Buffet Resteraunt, free games of bowling in their own alley, free drinks at the casino etc. Whilst this is an incentive to keep you at the hotel if you work it right it is a good idea for keeping holiday spending down. The pool is large and clean with plenty of loungers, the hot tub is huge roughly the size of a small swimming pool. The pool bar staff are friendly and it is well run with waitress service around the pool. My boys adored the pool but unfortunately due to a fast approaching thunderstorm the pool was swiftly closed for obvious safety reasons. This then gave us the opportunity to explore the hotel and have a couple of games of bowling. The bowling alley is again well run and has about 78 lanes it wasn't expensive either as we utilised the discount coupons. I thinks it cost us about $20 for two games each including shoe rental. The hotel also has its own Cinema showing the latest movies and also a kids club for when you need an hours piece from the little darllings. Whilst my children did not use it, it appeared well run and very safe with lots of things for kids upto the age of 12 to do. Numerous places to eat at reasonable prices, we chose to eat in the buffet and it was plentiful and varied and very good value. The casino is massive with many slots and gaming tables. Whilst I cant understand the slots I did have lots of fun on the roulette and Blackjack tables. All in all an excellent place to stay. You will need a car if you wish to explore the strip and you must go in and have look around the other hotels they are amazing with numerous shops and things to do for the non gambler. My children loved Las Vegas the weather, the people, the hotels, the shopping and of course the Bellagio Fountain Show. As a couple or as a family Las Vegas is a great place to explore. The Premium Outlet mall is also worth checking out for some great bargains featuring Nike, FCUK, Reebok, Tommy Hilfiger worth the short drive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed a night here on Aug 15 and have to say that I was very impressed with this place. Very good value, paid under $50 for the room, hotel staff was very friendly and helpful as well. Rooms were very nice, clean, and comfortable. The pool is very nice, not huge, but laid out very nice in a tropical setting. Had no problems with the shuttle that takes you to the strip. Casino is nice, they have a lot of lower limit tables so it's a very relaxed atmosphere. The bowling alley on the 2nd floor is enormous and just makes this place more attractive. One last thing, the french market buffet is excellent and a very good value, paid $8 for a lunch buffet and was simply amazed at the selection of food. This place really has something for just about anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us first timers, but we're coming back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an amazing time in Las Vegas, and most of that was due to our stay at the Orleans. The food was great (there's enough variety in the 13 restaurants, you'll find something you like), there was plenty of space at the huge pool, gaming tables and video poker/slot machines, that we never felt crowded. The pace was great for first-timers like us, but we saw many seasoned vets enjoying themselves too, so when we come back to Vegas, we're definately staying here. The reviewers are right, the rooms are clean and fantastic. The pool is huge (and in the shade until about 11:00) I also have to point out how helpful the staff was. From the table attendants to the cocktail waitresses to the bar tenders to the food servers, everyone made us feel like a valued guest, and that's more important than anything else. Tip: Check their web site for movie deals before you go, we entered and won a contest for a sneak preview.

Reviews.Title: “Great midweek rate at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: llgee
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for one night at a midweek rate of $49. Room was large, clean, and comfortable, except for the occasional smell of cigarette smoke - great water pressure in the shower! Didn't use any of the facilities or restaurants. Went to strip and out-of town restaurant using our rental car, very easy to do. I don't know if we'd stay here again due to the permeating smell of cigarette smoke almost everywhere you are in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans has everything!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was not my first visit to Las Vegas, but it was my first time to stay at The Orleans. The Orleans will be the only place I will stay on any future visits. The rooms are "roomy", very clean and pleasant. I especially enjoyed the peace and serenity of my sitting area when I would, from time to time, feel the need to escape the hustle and bustle. All of the hotel staff was pleasant and quick to accommodate my needs. Being a 70+ year old female, I was delighted to see that no one could approach the elevators without showing a room card. The security was very apparent all over the casino and more than willing to offer assistance. It would be impossible to not find a meal to your liking. There were six grandchildren in my group, ranging in age from six to 15, and they always found something they liked and wanted. The variety of eateries is fanastic! We rented a car and I would advise the same. Even though there were some days when we didn't use it, it was a convenience and the valet parking was great although many times there were parking places very near the entrance. I would never stay on the strip again and as I said in the beginning, will only consider The Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, but RENT A CAR!!!”
Reviews.Author: nupe357
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (both in our early 30s) stayed at the Orleans during our very first trip to Vegas in August 2002. The hotel room was very nice and extremely spacious. We paid approximately $59/night which I think was an outstanding price given the quality of the hotel. The bowling alley and movie theater were great touches that helped make our first Vegas experience fun. However, like most first time visitors we wanted to spend a lot of time on the strip and this is difficult to do from the Orleans UNLESS you rent a car. On subsequent trips we rented a car and found it a MUST for enjoying Vegas (even if you are staying on the strip). After all, we go during the Summer months and most compact rental cars run only about $17/day. The only other downside to the Orleans is the Buffet. I'm the first to admit that things may have changed since we visited three years ago. At that time, we saw good reviews of the buffet and figured that we should try it since the price was great. All in all I found the food to be barely mediocre at best (and I'm not that picky). My advice is to pay more and go to one of the downtown buffets (Golden Nugget or Main Street) or hit of the more expensive ones buffets on the strip (like Alladin or the Flamingo). Better yet, visit the resturant at Ellis Island for the $4.99 24hour a day steak special! In summary, this is a GREAT inexpensive yet very nice hotel located off of the Vegas strip. If you're on a fairly tight budge this may be the best place for you. But remember, RENT A CAR and be wary of the buffet!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!! Excellent Value for $$$”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_Traveller_2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Orleans from August 9th to August 12th. Very satisifed with facilities and service provided. Hotel rooms very spacious (see photos) with supplies (shampoo, conditioner, bath gel, body lotion, mouthwash, and soap). Pool area nice size (see photo) with kid's pool and whirlpool. Restaurants are good (buffet is good value, Courtyard Cafe is excellent value, and Prime Rib Loft serves excellent food). Spa has numerous choices and quality is first rate. Casino is good size with standard games (Blackjack - $5 minimum, Craps, Roulette, and slots). Showroom is good size. Shuttle to the strip (Barbary Coast) is a definite plus. Runs every 30 minutes from Orleans. Would definitely consider resort for subsequent vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights. Check in was easy. Used shuttle to get to strip every day; good service and never waited long. Room was large, clean and comfortable. Pool was great; only complaint was it closed at 8 p.m.-including hot tub area. Amenities great. Will return and hope to do better in the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Market Place Restuarante-Buffets Out of Sight 10+”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wonderful rooms. CLEAN CLEAN hotel and lobby. Pool very nice (Maybe a bit small for size of hotel). The breakfast buffet and dinner buffet at the Market Place was excellant. We had breakfast one morning over at the Luxor and paid $4.75 MORE per person and food was fair (not many choices). Our package included breakfest for 2 days mornings on our 5 night visit. The shuttle could run a little later than midnight. Coupon book was a good deal that you get upon checkin. Next time this is where we will stay. Too crowded on the strip for us.

Reviews.Title: “The best value in town!”
Reviews.Author: MAD&Dib
Reviews.Content: My familly and I stayed at The Orleans on the week of Aug 7 to 12, 2005. We found the rooms to be very clean and comfortable. We found it relatively easy to park near the hotel. There is a shuttle that takes you to the strip if needed. It departs from the main entrance every 20 minutes. and the slots to be relatively loose. The pool area is quite nice. 2 pools and one big world pool. For the price we paid ($59 weekdays-$110 on week-ends), I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My huband and I traveled with our 7 year old and chose the Orleans because it was kid friendly. Our son loved the day care facility, movies and bowling alley. My husband and I enjoyed all the hotel had to offer. The room was spacious and the service staff in the hotel were friendly. We had a rental car so therefore didn't deal with the shuttle bus issues. The slot machines paid off for us and the food was okay. The only thing that surprised me about the Orleans was the cable line up. Being such a kid friendly hotel I was suprised that there was nothing on the cable line up for young children such as Cartoon Network or Nick Jr. When your going all day long and want some down time to rest it would have been nice to have something on TV for the children. All in all a great stay and we would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its Top 10 rating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got a fantastic deal at the Orleans: $109 for the room,dinner for two and two tickets for the Donny Osmond show. Our kids joined us for dinner and the hotel comped those meals too (which was a nice surprise). The Orleans is a great choice for people who want a clean,comfortable quiet room,and outstanding service,but don't feel the need to stay right on the Strip. I really like the layout of the rooms here,and wish other hotels would adopt this idea. Unlike most hotels,the bathroom is located at the rear,with a large sitting area next to it. It makes the room seem larger,more like a suite. The room was spotless and extremely quiet. We heard no noise at all except an occaisonal door slamming down the hall. The service here is friendly and fast,unlike the mega hotels on the Strip. Pool is large and nicely landscaped. Lots of activities for families: movie theater,bowling, "Kids Tyme" daycare facility. We enjoyed the Irish pub. Drinks were generous and relatively cheap. Atmosphere in the casino was pleasant, unlike most of the casinos in Vegas. Contrary to some of the other reviews, we didn't find it to be very smoky at all. I would recommend the Orleans,or any of the other Coast hotels,to anybody looking for a nice place to stay at a reasonable rate. The big hotels and gourmet restaurants are just a few minutes away. We're looking forward to staying at the new South Coast hotel when it opens next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Orleans is a great place to stay. We go to Vegas several times a year and usually stay on the strip, but due to conventions decided to look elsewhere. The Orleans is clean, not overcrowded, great choice of restaurants. Rooms were nicer than some on the strip at less the cost. All in all I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: Whatacountry!
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here two nights and were satisfied, but not thrilled with the Orleans. The rooms are dated, but decent. The strip is 3 miles away, but close enough to drive to. The amenties, such as movies, gameroom, bowling, etc. are awesome, but you have to go through the smoke filled casino to get to them. Also, if you don't choose to use valet parking, you are going to have a long walk from the parking garage to your room.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustcrazy
Reviews.Content: After five stays at Strip hotels, we decided to try one off strip for a weekend stay on the last weekend in July. We picked the Orleans because of all the positive reviews we've read. Well, the positive reviews were correct. From the moment we checked in until we departed, we had no negative experience. The room was clean and large with a sofa area. Each room had its own thermostat so you can set your air conditioning to the temperature you wanted, not just low, medium, and high like most places. It was the only hotel we've been in with a window that actually opens in the bathroom. When I first heard about the window, I pictured an old place, but these windows are actually nice with flowers etched in them and you can get fresh air (when it's not too hot) and air out the place. The only thing that was missing when comparing to the strip hotels was an in room safe. But the guard downstairs was very vigilant in checking room keys before letting you go on the elevator. The buffet was ok and an improvement from our meal here 3 years ago. Nothing fancy, and for the price it was good. The meal we had at the Courtyard Cafe was very tasty. Katie's ice cream store was good for a late night snack (after a show) and with the coupon from the book they give you at check-in, you can get a good deal on the ice cream. Also, from the coupon book, we got half price tickets to the show and great seats. Gift shop was impressive for an off strip hotel and you get free beads with your coupon as well. If you want to start playing table games, this is a good place since they have low minimums. The shuttle runs regularly to the strip and the other Coast casinos and your player's card is linked to the others too. We even got some money deducted from our bill at checkout based on our play which was a real pleasant surprise since we have spent much more on the strip in the past and gotten nothing deducted. The locals sure know where to go to have fun. All in all, no complaints and I would definitely return. I'd be happy to answer any questions about hotels or Las Vegas in general.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money, loved it...”
Reviews.Author: smartgirl247
Reviews.Content: It was our second stay at The Orleans. No luck at the games this time, but the hotel was just perferct. Large clean rooms, friendly staff, good buffet. For me it's the best choice for Las Vegas if your are on a budget. If not, ok then there are some fancier choices on the STRIP.

Reviews.Title: “surprise,surprise surprised!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the New Orleans hotel, and were presently surprised at the ammenities, great food,very nice hotel rooms, professional staff a beautiful hotel exprience by all accounts and not to mention the coupon book we received! thank you New Orleans, we'll be back and we'll pass the word along! Bobby and Kelly

Reviews.Title: “great find!”
Reviews.Author: jmichael-6
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Orleans, and I am convinced that it is the best deal in the town for someone looking for something in the $39-$100 range. Our room was clean, spacious, had a terrific view of the Strip, easy parking close to the hotel (rare in this town) and relatively loose slots. The two "fun books" we rec'd contained enough free drinks to pay for the room! Remember, the hotel will beat any advertised price on the internet by 5%. We got our room with a king bed for $47.50 when we quoted Travelocity's price of $50, but only if you ask. We will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: walker04
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans for one night, but had arrived at noon,on a Thursday, and were able to get both rooms right away. That was nice, as we didn't want to have to go back out and come back to unload our car in 3 hours. The staff there was great. There was a huge amount of kids there for a huge basketball tourney, all over town. The kids were in the casino, which seemed strange. The pool was alot nicer and bigger than we expected. Security guards check your key every time you walk near the elevators. Alot of food places to choose from, we didn't leave until we headed to the airport at 8 AM the next day. Room was very comfortable and clean. Little bottles of stuff in bathroom were very nice as well. Thankyou Orleans for a great stay, we will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Still Excellent”
Reviews.Author: icema196
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd time we stayed at the Orleans and the 1st place i'll go when I go back to Vegas. Only minor complaints i have would be the service and quality of their Cafe (diner) is average at best, though the pre-7am steak and eggs for 2.99 is an excellent value. They also could use a little made shade near the pool . But It was not their fault it was 118 degrees. Overall this is a great place to stay at a fair price. First time in Vegas stay on the strip, after that go to the Orleans .

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, but watch out for TV-charges and unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ToneOslo_Norway
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans early July 2005 for 2 nights. Very nice recreation area with nice pools, enough sunbeds and towels - a must when you visit Vegas during boiling hot summer months. Restaurants working fine, food ok. Very large and nice rooms compared to European standards, clean and well equipped. Reception-staff ok (not more), check-in and -out efficient. We had some problems connecting our laptop to internet and mixed up the TV channel search with this. Was charged for video-rent on the bill because of this, even if we could not recall to have confirmed any of the 7! steps the receptionist claimed we had to go to get to a video. Information about this video-charge system was not to be seen in the room nor anywhere else. Recommend you to be careful with the video/TV-channel search as it seems very easy to slip into a pay-video by accident. The hotel had suprisingly few TV-channels. The shuttle to the strip works fine, getting taxi's back from other parts of the strip (the shuttle stops only at one hotel at the strip) was more of a hazzle. Could not try the casino-facilities as I had my under-aged daugther with me. Tried to use my credit card to buy some stuff from the hotel-shop, our credit cards have ID with picture on the back and they work fine everywhere else in the US. But in this shop I had to give it up due to a stubborn attendant who insisted that I had to present a drivers licence with a certain numeric ID-code to be able to use credit cards in Nevada....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Las Vegas. Reading all the reviews, we selected the Orleans. Our family, including 2 boys, stayed 3 nights for $50 per night. The rooms are huge with 2 queen beds, our room anyway, a loveseat and huge window. The room was VERY clean and filled with amenities. Our room overlooked the pool. The location is not on the strip, but a free shuttle runs to and from the strip every 30 minutes or so. The casino was fabulous, lot's of slots and video games. A good selection of table games also. The ONLY thing that was not excellent was the mexican restaurant. It was not very good at all. It cost 4 of us over $40 to eat there and it was marginal at best. HUGE arcade for the kids, a bowling alley and 18 screen theater all in the same building. We WILL stay at The Oreans again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: prachu
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just got back from a 3 day stay at The Orleans and I can only say good things about it. Check in went smooth and the front desk clerk, Veronica, was very helpful. I requested a room near my friend and in the new tower which Veronica found for us right away. The only negative thing was there wasn't a view (the room looked out at a wall, there was a great view of the Luxor in the shower though!) but it actually made the room feel more cozy. Housekeeping does an amazing job - each day I'd come back from breakfast at 8:30 and my room would already be clean! Some people who sleep late might get disturbed by this but I found it very impressive. The best slot machine I played while in Vegas (we visited a few other casinos) was the Silver Strike machine at the Orleans. I love the six different silver coins you can win. My original hotel choice was Circus Circus but after reading the TripAdvisor reviews I decided to switch to The Orleans. Am I glad I did! For $52.00 per night, the Orleans is the best value in Vegas. Other people can stay on the crowded, noisy Strip but I'll be happily returning to the Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: patmed
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans for a week from 17 July 2005 until the 24 July. Good clean, spacious room, with snowy white thick sheets. (Have stayed in some hotels where the sheets where paper thin!). Value is excellent (we paid £19 per night). Food in Restaurants is good and excellent value. Buffet is especially good. Security in this hotel is good. To get into the elevators to reach the guest rooms, you first have to show your door key. I agree with a previous reviewer that the casino floor is a bit Smokey, the ventilation could be better. Also the shuttle bus was very busy some days; perhaps they need to think about buying more/larger shuttle buses? We have stayed in other Vegas hotels, but this is by far the best.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans Resort. Excellent Value.”
Reviews.Author: dblead
Reviews.Content: We loved the Orleans Resort. Off the maddning path but close by everything due to free shuttles. Rooms much larger than normal, almost a Jr Suite. Only resort I know of that has a window in the bathroom. LOTS of amenities! Paid less than 60.00 a night & that included a "Discount Fun Book" that was worth 200.00 (if you used all of the coupons). Also the only resort that has it's own liquor store. Prices were comprable & cheaper than Texas. Only drawback was the quality of food in it's Buffet's. Food was O.K. but not great. Great Prime Rib's in it's Prime Rib Loft though. Very friendly & helpfull staff. If your looking for a LOT of penny & nickle slots they have them! Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Reviews were right, Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyMom
Reviews.Content: I chose this Hotel to stay in Vegas July 4-8 based on Tripadvisor Reviews. My husband and I are late 30's and were traveling without our children. We were not disappointed! The location is great. We used our rental car and had no problem getting around (mid-week) although we were aware of the shuttle option. The service was great all over the hotel. Front desk, housekeeping, restaurants. No complaints at all. We were given a "view" room at no extra charge. We decided to stay an extra night and it was not a problem. Our room was spacious, clean, quiet, comfortable and arranged perfectly. We loved the "Prime Rib Loft", "Miguels", "Brendans Irish Pub", "Courtyard Cafe" and the Buffet for breakfast was great. Can't beat the price for The Orleans. We paid $59 a night for Mon-Friday. I've stayed at many upscale hotels in Vegas and after staying at the Orleans, I wouldn't stay anywhere else. The Casino is fun and just the right size. There is also a bowling alley and movie theater upstairs from the casino. We enjoyed the pool one afternoon (it was very hot in July). The service and cleanliness was terrific. Towels and drinks were very convienient to obtain. We used the "business Center" for internet access and it was very friendly, convienient and reasonable. $5 for a half-hour. We also enjoyed the "Rio" Casino which is close by and off the strip as well. Caught a great show there and played a little at the casino. We had a great time and definately recommend staying at The Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Super Value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Orleans from 7/12-7/18/05. It was truly a great stay and a great value. Our room was spacious and spotless, the staff was friendly and helpful. We didn't eat at all the restaurants there, but those we did were excellent. The only gripe we had with the place is that it needs better ventilation in the casino. The Orleans seems to attract a lot of smokers, and the casino was smokier than others I've been in. It's not on 'The Strip', but they have a shuttle bus that takes you to the Barbary Coast. From there, you can go next door to Bally's/Paris and get on the monorail. This place is truly a Vegas gem. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel with loads to do”
Reviews.Author: raygem
Reviews.Content: we stayed from 21st june - 30th june. check in took 1 minute, which was great. we had requested a strip view, and got it at no extra cost. we had a 2 queen room (2 queen beds). very spacious. maids came around everyday, and were really great. on the forst few days we went to the courtyard place for our breakfast because we were up early trying to adjust to the 8 hours time difference. til 7am i think the breakfasts were really cheap. bowling was great. we went through the night a few times and it was only around $12 for the two of us having 3 games with shoe hire. i would highly recommend katies corner? (the ice cream parlour). what a bargain. we got 3 scoops of ice cream in a tub nearly everyday and it was huge and really cheap. by the end of the holiday we were having more time on our hands as we'd seen what we wanted (sad i know) so we went to the cinema a few times. the seats were really comfy and it was a quite reasonable before 6pm. the popcorn was awful though. i dont know if it is the norm for popcorn in america, but i like sweet popcorn, but the stuff there was slighty salted, slightly sweet. it wasnt nice at all. the shuttle was great aswell. there was no kind of queue to be honest so if you stood by the front you always got on. we never missed one shuttle and we used it everyday. they run every 15 minutes or so. taxi cost around $12-$15 to bottom/middle of strip. around $18-$20 to downtown. by far the best placxe in teh orleans was TERRIBLE MIKES. the burgers are to die for. i'd walk back to vegas for one of those babies. they were gorgeous and really, really cheap aswell. we never used the pool so cant comment. as we were thirsty all the time we bought a cooler box from walgreens on teh strip. it was a huge one for around $15 and we used to just get ice from near the elevator each night. to be honest i though vegas would be the best holiday ever, but it wasnt as it wasnt nearly as good as we expected. however, if i did ever return i would stay at the orleans, or one of their sister hotels. the best hotel ive stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans is a great play.”
Reviews.Author: ValueDriven
Reviews.Content: The Orleans has proven itself over and over again. This hotel is a no-brainer for value. My wife and I favor the Orleans over the Strip hotels because of good parking, clean rooms, and a solid pool area. The fun book provides use of the fitness room and offers many free drink coupons.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, great rates, great people - and the machines paid!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days at The Orleans. As I said, in the caption - great rates, great people and the machines paid! Our room was very nice - kept up well , very comfortable bedding, and plenty of towels. The restaurants were very good - fairly priced with a super special from Midnight to 7 A.M. - we took advantage of that a few times. The wait staff seems to care about you and their co-workers. The service they give is unbelievable - shuttle service to the strip etc, Got to speak to the Slot manager - told him we were back for the second year in a row . Living in Florida, we have to budget our time and money for the plane fares,- our daughter joined us ( we were there for a wedding at the Excalibur) - after visiting several casinos - we were more than happy to return to The Orleans. Like Arnold says - " We'll be back!"

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel!! I layed by the pool and went to the movies while my husband played poker. They also have a great bowling alley. They had a shuttle to the strip and their other casinos. It was so great staying off the strip because when you stay on the strip you are worn out from walking. We rented a car for the week (around $100) and darted over to the strip whenever we wanted. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The only downside was that the pool closed at 7pm and the Hot tub is in the pool area. Food: We ate Subway every day for breakfast. Its one of the best Subways I ever ate at because the bread was so fresh and they just made things really nice. Italian restaurant, forgot the name... Eat the Strawberry Walnut Salad... This is the best Salad I have ever eaten. European lettuces with halved strawberries, candied walnuts and bread crumbed chicken on top. I was afraid to try it but I am so glad I did. Cafe - Cafe is open from about 10 pm to 7 am or something. Everything I ate in here was wonderful. I ate a seafood Chinese dish at 2 am and it was the best. They also have breakfast specials $1.99 Be prepared, it stays packed. Buffet: It was okay but nothing to write home about. Also, have deals for shows at other Casinos. Buy the Package Deal for dinner and show at the GoldCoast. I saw forever plaid and had a gourmet dinner in the Gold Coast Italian restaurant for $25. Show and dinner were great.

Reviews.Title: “Just one thing”
Reviews.Author: Chiguy15
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7/8-7/11, as reported by others here - rooms spacious and clean, no surprises. One minor thing though - anybody looking for coca cola products (I'm a diet coke fanatic) will be in trouble, as the entire property seems to only carry Pepsi products, even in the gift shop, had to run to convenience store to stock up. Good selection of slots/video poker. All in all, very pleased and would stay again. One other thing, we had a late flight out and after asking about late checkout, was offered a half day rate good until 6PM, worked well for us.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Orleans but.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've just about always stay at The Orleans -- we're in Vegas about three times a year -- definitely twice for business. But since they've installed heavy doors that make a very loud noise if one of us gets up in the middle of the night and open bathrooms without doors, so if my husband is in the bathroom, I can't get my makeup on. And many times we have to rush to get to our conventions because of this. We were told this is because disabled people can use them -- which I totally agree with -- but they should have some floors with regular bathrooms, like they have for smoking and non-smoking. So, unfortunately this trip we had to book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Orelans... for the money, better than the Venetian”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed over a Saturday and Sunday (paying $80 and $60 respectively), and -- for the quality of the rooms -- the Orleans was a real bargain. Getting a lot of bang for my buck makes for the start of a good vacation. Rooms were very clean, bed comfortable, and bathroom luxurious. We stayed at the Venetian a couple months ago (when someone else was footin' the tab), and I thought the Orleans held its own and was a whole lot cheaper. Room highlight: great shower with a little window with a view of the Strip... nice way to start the day! The shuttles to and from the Strip were often crowded. Instead of waiting, we would usually ask another couple waiting if they wanted to split a cab. At $6 each ($12 including tip was the full fare), we were at the Strip in a couple minutes. The shuttles sounded fine until I saw how crowded they were... if there were more running, it'd be a great system. I did have my car with me and shaded parking was no problem, though I opted to park near the casino instead of near the check-in desk which could appear somewhat chaotic. Driving down to the Strip was easy and parking on the Strip is plentiful as all the casinos have free self-park. The Orleans also has lots of restaurants and conveniences located nearby... easily within walking distance but seconds away with a car. That is most certainly NOT the case when I've felt "captive" on the Strip. All in all, a very enjoyable experience. Thumbs for the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place”
Reviews.Author: ark1
Reviews.Content: TOTALLY enjoyed my stay at the orleans and think they do a great job. the rooms are large,clean,well-appointed.tasteful and reasonably priced. the restaurant i ate at big al's oyster house was very good. the pool was large and nice tho cant do laps in it/too crowded/ the place is not near as plastic as some casinos can be. the staff is friendly and i recommend this hotel casino highly

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: sunburst
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans for Four days and three nights and then for 2 days and nites. Check in was a breeze both times. The rooms were plenty big enough with a good sized bathroom and nice views. Beds were comfy and the whole hotel from the casino, to the pool, to the food joints and the staff all had had an atmosphere that made us feel very comfortable. We are by no means high rollers just a middle clas family looking for a good hotel at a fair price. We found a great hotel at a great price. We had a car so the off strip location was not really an issue. We liked ot so much we cancelled our reservation at a strip hotel to go back to the Orleans. The pool was great and Terrible Mikes had great burgers. The buffet was not great just ok and it had plenty of fruit and veggies so it worked for us. Coupon book was worthwhile with free drinks and food discounts and more. I would highly reccomend the Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “bad check-in experience”
Reviews.Author: werecat
Reviews.Content: We had reserved a room in January to stay the first week of June at the Orleans. It was our 3rd visit so we were looking forward to it for months. When we tried to check-in the desk clerk said he would have a room for us in 2 hours so we said fine. 2 hours later the room wasn't ready as the people decided to stay. Ok, we said. We just want a king room. Oh no he said. I have this other room reserved for you so come back in an hour. We said we just wanted a king room but he wouldn't let us have it. Others around us were checking in with no problems. When we came back we had another desk clerk with a serious attitude problem. She said we were lucky to get a king room at all and that there weren't that many of them??? As I said we saw others checking in no problem and we had made the reservations in January. When we checked out the service was just as rude. We wrote a letter to the Orleans management and got a form reply. Just a basic we're sorry and looking forward to seeing you again. As if! We tried to complain while we were there but no one would talk to us. We are low rollers so my husband was right when he said they don't care as the place is full of other suckers.

Reviews.Title: “It was o.k., but rent a car!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jenn1130
Reviews.Content: We stayed there the weekend of July 4th. Due to an early flight we tried to check in early. We were able to get our two rooms at 10am but they were next to the elevators. I suggetst getting as far away as possible for the elevators, it was very noisey. We were able to change later that day. After resting for a short time we ate downstairs at Terrible Mike's. For $20 for each couple it left a lot to be desired. The buffet on Monday night was seafood and it was wonderful!!! The casino was nice with alot of low limit slots and a few $3 BJ tables. The only frustrating part is that after our third day there they never told the husbands that they had to have a special card for the tables. They presented the card everytime they would buy in and not one person told them they had the wrong card. We only played in the one casino to try and build up comps but it never happended because we lost the first 3 days. The rooms are fine. Large with sitting area. The bathroom was fine, I wish there was a door that seperated the shower area from them vanity area, but otherwise is was good. The shuttle to and from the strip is a whole different situation. There is no sign that says form line here. So there is a large group of people standing there waiting. When the shuttle pulls up the people who have been waiting the longest have now ended up in the back of the line. There was another family and the 4 of us that had been waiting for over 45 minutes and when the shuttle pulled up it looked like we were not going to get on again. The father of the other family pushed his way up to the front and blocked everyone else so we could all get on. The next day we went across the street to budget and rented a car! The hotel was fine, my kids loved the kids tyme area, the casino was fine. I might stay there again if the price is right again, but I would rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at Orleans, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at The Orleans. The hotel is in great condition and you can tell they care about the upkeep. If you stay there, you'll need to keep a few things in mind. First, the location. The Orleans is well beyond walking distance to anything else including the Strip. Coast Hotels provides a shuttle between The Orleans, Gold Coast and Barbary Coast Hotels. The shuttles to the Barbary Coast are often full and don't run as often as the one to the Gold Coast so it's hard to get to the strip. Second, the machines. Staying at The Orleans, I was disappointed in the Slot Gaming. The machines appeared to be set very tightly and I never experienced any decent payoffs. The table gaming was fine. I had great slot playing at Bally's and Palace Station but they are a long way from The Orleans. The staff was relatively friendly at The Orleans. The desk clerk had a bit of a chip on her shoulder but the bellman, Chase, was awesome. He was friendly and helpful. One nice thing that The Orleans does is check room keys before allowing people on the elevator. This really keeps people without a purpose on the guestroom floors. The security staff actually comes by and chit chats. The pool at The Orleans is huge and very nice. If you are going to Vegas to hang out, very few pools can beat this one. I don't think I'll stay there again because of the location. That is no fault of the hotel. In the past, I have stayed at Aladin and Bally's for a similar price and was able to move from casino to casino at will.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans good... but not great”
Reviews.Author: chipster45
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four days 20 -24 June 2005. Check in was easy enough, but when I asked the quickest way to get to the room they told me to walk through the Casino. I only found out later there was a parking garage out back with much quicker access to the elevators and without having to haul all of your luggage through the casino. Nice room on the 19th floor overlooking a parking lot, the mountains, and the north end of the strip. Very large room with, a sofa, easy chair, a very comfortable bed, and a big bathroom. Coupon book was okay, free fries and a small drink at terrible mikes hamburger joint (made the price about what you would pay at a regular hamburger joint), some free cocktail coupons and Gold and Barbary Coast (couldn't make a pina colada at either). The Market buffet disappointed; while there were a lot of different types of food, there wasn't a lot of flavor in any of it. Housekeeping was usually very good, but on our last night, they didn't change out our towels, or restock amenities, the later I can live without, but the former, I need. Overall a nice stay, but next time I'll spend a bit more and stay on the strip, or downtown.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel with a Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Hollyspop
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans from Sunday, June 19 thru Thursday June 23. Upon check I asked the lovely young lady at the desk if there we any upgrades available for two old folks celebrating their 45th wedding anniversery. She proceeded to give us a beautiful strip view room on the top floor of the hotel. Everyone we encountered was wonderful and the dinner on our a anniversary in the Prime Rib Lounge was one of the best we have ever had. Parking is a snap also once we figured out to go out the exit next to the shoe shine stand to the garage. Entertainment in the Irish pub was great as was the performance by Giovani in the Showroom. This is a great hotel and is very well managed with super employees.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: jcoghlan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a 3 night stay at the Orleans Hotel/Casino in Las Vegas. It was great! The room was spacious, modern and clean. The staff was very polite and gracious. They have a shuttle service every 15-20 min. to the strip and it runs until 12:30 am. We booked our room through their web site and only paid $60.00 a night. It was a wonderful place and we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcl456789
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans from Saturday, June 11th - Tuesday, June 14th. Our rate for Saturday was $130 and for Sunday and Monday was $65. We enjoyed our stay. Our room was great on the 8th floor, however our view was of the parking lot. We were there for a high school graduation. Our room was great!!!! We loved the sitting area and the privacy of the closing bathroom door. I have read reviews where the rate was $70 or less - what a deal!!!! If this is your first time to Vegas I would not recommend staying at this hotel. You need to stay on the strip. We went to the pool many times and it was great. We went to the fitness center once. I think it is crazy to charge $10.00 go to there. We had one $10 coupon, so we paid $10 for us both to go. I feel if you are a hotel guest this should be included. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Vonnydee
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two weeks (06/04 to 06/18) in Las Vegas at the Orleans Hotel & Casino. It was a trip to celebrate our silver wedding and both we and our friends had a wonderful time there. We reviewed the hotel on this site and because of the positive feedback the choice was made. May I say what a fantastic choice it was. We arrived several hours late due to bad weather at Chicago and delayed flights. We had a deluxe suite (at no extra charge) until our allocated rooms were ready. The rooms we had for the rest of our stay overlooked the strip, we were on the 19th floor. It was lovely both day and night to have such a panoramic view. The room was spacious and comfortable and kept very clean by the housekeeping staff. It had two comfy queen beds with a separate seating area. The bathroom was also large with sink and closet area separate from the bath/shower and toilet. The room also had a hairdryer, iron and ironing board. The bathroom was full of clean fluffy towels, shampoos, conditioners, etc. which were replenished daily. Security is good as only guest can access rooms as you have to show your room key to the security guards to use the lifts. In fact all of the staff were very friendly and helpful and we can only praise them and thank them for making our stay even more enjoyable. We used some of the coupons out of the booklet that we were given and used Seattle’s coffee shop almost daily (great coffee). We also ate at Subway, Teribble Mike’s, French Buffet, and the graveyard special at the Courtyard Café was excellent value. Our last night visit to the Prime Rib Loft left us wishing we had gone there earlier during our stay as it was a meal to remember, boy was that rib meal yummy, I wish we could get that over here in the UK. We would wholeheartedly recommend the Orleans to anyone. Although it is off the strip it was great for us as we had a hire car and visited several surrounding areas such as outlets, national parks etc and it was easy to get to the freeways from the hotel. Give the Orleans a try, we were not disappointed and I’m sure you wont be either, we will certainly book again for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Definatley a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weeks stay at The ORLEANS and WOW what a wonderful time was had. The rooms are spacious and very well maintained. The security to access the rooms was very comforting and the guards were very courtious. One day of the stay the power was out for over half the casino and restaurant area for what seems to be 12 hours or so. This was not a problem that could be handled quickly but it did not cause us to want to leave. The pub was cool with air conditioning and wonderful bartenders helped the time go by quickly until the power was restored. That day ended up being our most memorable day and night for that matter. The employees were all so very helpful and we were never denied any request. The ORLEANS will definatley be my return place to stay and i recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: PeteG129
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to Vegas (06/04-06/18) to celebrate our friends 25th wedding anniversary. We based our choice mainly on the reviews on this site, and also on the fact that we didn't have a bottomless bank account. If money is not a problem, then you'll be staying at the Bellagio etc, and you probably won't be viewing this site anyway! However, if you live in the real world and money is a consideration, then I strongly recommend you give the Orleans a look. Due to problems with the weather at Chicago and the subsequent backlog of flights, we arrived at the Orleans some four hours later than scheduled at 02:30am, at least there was no queue at check-in! We were told that the rooms we thought we had booked were not available, but that we would be upgraded to a suite, (free of charge) until our rooms were ready later that day. This might seem normal and routine to those of you in the US reading this, but we're from the UK and it was a very pleasant surprise indeed! We also asked if we could have rooms overlooking the Strip, as it was a silver wedding trip, which we got ( no extra charge). Many thanks to the lovely Vanessa on reception for her help. And this was how our stay continued, the rooms ( apart from the suite, which was something else!) were clean and comfortable. The staff, wherever we came into contact with them, were polite, efficient and very, very friendly. On our last night, we ate in the Prime Rib Loft in the casino, whatevever they're paying the Chef in there, it isn't enough! Excellent. When I go back to Vegas, the Orleans will be top of the list, and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “my kind of place”
Reviews.Author: jackpot99
Reviews.Content: Second trip this year to Orleans. Going again in September. Hotel room was as expected, no complaints. Casino, as expected. Crap table employees need to loosen up. too stiff lipped. need more customer interaction. Drink girls were good to me. too bad im so old. Slots were easy on the pocket book. in an out makes it easier to play more. on the strip its always in and nothing comes back to you. Terribles is over priced on their food. The mexican, Italian and chinese leave a lot to be desired. Both beef house are very good. The cafe provides a decent meal at a reasonable price. Buffet is Buffet. Im easy to please and enjoyed the trip. was comped for 2 nites for table play. that was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfy in Vegas!!! Imagine that?”
Reviews.Author: cbcolin
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed at the Orleans two times in the last month. It was very clean and very comfortable. We "use" Las Vegas as a starting out point for trips a couple of times a year because it is easy and inexpensive to get to Vegas from Chicago. We have stayed at many hotels in Las Vegas and the Orleans is BY FAR the cleanest, most comfortable AND the least of a hassle to deal with. It is simple to make a reservation on the phone or internet. It is simple to check in to the hotel. It is simple to find FREE parking which is close and accessible to your hotel room. The rooms are inexpensive and extremely large - they are also very very clean and do not smell like stale cigarette smoke. The casino area is not cramped nor was it creepy - as some of them in vegas seem to be. The casino area must have a great exhaust system, because it was not smoky. There are many choices for food at the Orleans. There is also a nice little gift shop which has loads of snacks and other things. My husband and I have been to Las Vegas many times and we are so glad that we read about the Orleans on Trip Advisor before this last trip. We will definately stay at the Orleans in the future!!! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price, but very smoky”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 night stay here and for $50 a night, it was really nice. We chose this hotel based off of other reviews. The only complaint I have, is that if you're not a smoker, be ready to be submerged in it. Out of all the hotels we visited, this was definetly one of the most smoky. Our room was very clean and there was plenty of room for the 5 of us. The pool is fairly large, but closes at 7pm. If your planning to fly, you might want to rent a car, otherwise, you'll be dependent on the shuttle that runs every 20-30 min. Also, if you'll be traveling with children and don't want to spend $40 on each meal, there are quite a few places to eat off the strip that are fairly close by.

Reviews.Title: “More Than Expected!”
Reviews.Author: mastertraveler73
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Orleans the night before our convention started. All we were looking for was a clean, quiet room for the night. The Orleans exceeded our expectations amazingly! My husband and I were upgraded to a suite upon check-in (without even asking)! The room featured a spacious bar/kitchen, dining area for six, wrap-around couch in the living area. The bedroom was larger than a standard room with a lovely glass shower. The staff was friendly and accomodating. The room was clean, not fancy but terribly comfortable.
