The French Quarter Brunch was an amazing value! $13.95 and so very much to choose from. We also stayed at Cesars Palace (dissapointing) and the Paris (outstanding). We would place the Orleans as an excellent place for families looking for a clean, comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Casino, Fantastic Bargain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the second trip to Vegas my wife and I had ever taken, our first being at the Bellagio. While the Orleans' bathrooms might not be made from marble and their lobby might not contain millions of dollars of blown glass - I actually prefered The Orleans, as it was comfortable, enjoyable and left money in our pockets to enjoy the rest of Vegas with. The only critical thing I would share would be the distance between the parking garage for guests and where check-in and guest elevators are located. If you overpacked, definitely invest a few tip dollars in having your luggage carried by their bellboys (if they are still called that). They are right inside the main doors. Onto the good stuff. You'll get a funbook or coupon book at check-in, one per person I think. These were great - plenty of free drinks and discounts at virtually every restaurant in the casino. We used quite a few of them. Dinner at the Prime Rib Loft, lunch at Terrible Mike's & a late night meal at the Courtyard Cafe were all excellent. The buffet was okay - we hit it at "brunch" and the breakfast items didn't look that great. The pizza was good though. I highly recommend Brendan's Irish Pub on Sunday's - they have a great Irish singer (John Windsor) who drank Guiness on stage and did a toast after every song. He was a riot. Our room was great - on the 10th floor overlooking the pool. The elevators up to the rooms were super quick and secure, as I was asked for my room key every single time by a security guard. Our room was clean and spacious - very comfortable bed and nice entertainment cabinet & TV. They gave you everything (shampoo, conditioner, lotion, bath gel mouthwash). Check the desk for a great lookin' postcard of the casino to send home. Maid service was stellar - they come kind of early, so just use the do not disturb tag if you don't want to be. We called househkeeping each day around 11 and asked for our room to be cleaned and they had no problem with that. The pool was nice - I especially enjoyed the hot tub or spa, as it had an island in the middle of it with a palm tree. I wish the pool was open later, but quite a few rooms faced it, so I can understand why they wouldn't want to keep it open into the wee hours of the night. We had great luck on the casino floor. I won about $60 on slots the first day, then lost a little on day 2 and won $270 on day 3 (also on slots). Overall we left up about $200. My wife played video poker mainly and broke even. When we did leave The Orleans, we had no prob catching their free shuttle. I don't think they had one directly from The Orleans to the Barbary Coast (on the strip). instead you had to catch a second shuttle at Gold Coast to Barbary Coast. But trust me - it's still a bargain compared to a cab and far less stressful than driving yourself. Just realize that The Orleans isn't walking distance from the strip. I knew this going in, so it wasn't a big deal - the $1 tip I gave the shuttle driver more than makes up for the extra $100 a night I would have been paying for a strip room. It amazed me that The Orleans was as reasonable as it was, price-wise. If you're looking for a casino that offers nice rooms, some bonus freebies and some ammenities not found in other places (we didn't use, but were amazed to learn there was a bowling alley, movie theatre and liquor store in The Orleans)....then this is your casino. If you can get over not being on the strip, you'll find this casino to be pretty worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: At $23.00 a night during the week night, this place can't be beat. I have stayed in the Gold Cost (sister property) and the rooms are the same size and shape, only decorated a little nicer here. I liked the digital thermostat for the a/c. Garage was a little walk but eliminated tipping the parking attendants. Beds were very comfortable and rooms were very quiet. I would have no complaints about staying here again. Bowling lanes were top of the line.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans-It's all Everyone says it is-A Very Good Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Orleans from May 1st through May 3rd (3 nights ) and had a great time. It was our first trip to Vegas. Had read all the reviews and wanted to try staying there. For the initial booking, I looked at different websites to find the "best deals". I found the lowest price on 4Vegas. The Orleans website offers a "lowest price guarantee"...when I booked with The Orleans, I told them about the other price. They verified it and said they would match it. Plus they give back a percentage at check-out, because they did not have the lowest price. We got the room for $55. When we checked out they gave us $9.00 back. Not bad. The hotel is very nice. The rooms were exactly as described in other reviews. Big rooms, big bathrooms, clean, an excellent deal. We checked in at 10:00 A.M and were able to go right to the room, which had an amazing STRIP VIEW (no extra charge)! The staff were very nice and helpful. The Marketplace Buffet and the (Corner?) Cafe were very good. The Casino is huge and the slots were generous. We won $200-250 several times, lower numbers many times and $1,500.00 on the morning (1:00 A.M.) that we left. The Shuttle was so helpful (no rental car). There were no problems going to or from the Strip. The Shuttle does not go to the airport. We took an airport shuttle from the airport to the hotel, but used a taxi for the trip back. As I had read in other sources-the prices are virtually the same for both. The FUN Book has some good coupons (but we did not take complete advantage of them, because we didn't look at them soon enough to really plan how to use them) Although the sign on the Gift Shop says that they close at midnite, it is actually open 24 hours. (We didn't know that initially-so if you go to your room, decide you want something-you can go down-they have a variety of things). Thanks to all who went to The Orleans before and paved the way with their good reviews. They truly helped me make the decision on where to stay and we were very happy with that decision (especially after the $1,500.00). We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to get back..............”
Reviews.Author: a12barblues
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our semi annual trip to LV. Stayed at the Orleans 5/31-6/2. Service was excellent as usual, but the rooms are starting to look there age. Although we spend very little time in our rooms we still like to feel comfortable when we are there. Shower , sink and toilet all in same room with a 50 pound pocket door which slams very loudly every time it's shut. But again since they were comped rooms I shouldn't look a gift horse in the mouth. Only ate there once for breakfest buffet it was ok. After the Orleans we stayed at a sister property the Suncoast. Very large comfortable rooms , but the drive out to Summerlin was very long due to traffic problems that seem to enveloped LV. If you get a chance and are fans of either Queen or just rock n roll in general go see "We Will Rock You" at the Paris. excellent . and unless you must see the faces of the actors don't bother with the expensive tickets as the theater is small with no real bad seat in the house. Also if you love mexican food especialy tamales go to Dona Maria's on LV Blvd /Charleston , been eating tamales all my life and these are in at least the top 5. Save room for a sweet tamale. And as usaul we can't wait to get back to LV, only 6 more months!

Reviews.Title: “we stayed for free and it still wasn't worth it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had read all the nice reviews here on TripAdvisor about the Orleans and we were looking forward to a nice stay... Our trip was "free" (but really was paid for in the league fees) as part of our bowling league and part of the Miller Lite / Brunwick Fun Time Tournament. We arrived Friday afternoon around 4:30pm via taxi and there wasn't a bellman anywhere so we ended up having to haul our bags to the desk and then on up to our rooms (strike one). We were assigned a room in the "new section" that opened last November. The room was fine for size and cleanliness. But it overlooked the main drive and we ended up hearing the traffic and noise all night long. Also, the air conditioner was so loud when it would come on that it would wake you up. The next day I went down to the front desk and stated that I was an unhappy hotel guest and would like to speak with someone who could remedy my complaints. After calmly explaining the issues and stating that I wanted a different room in a quiet location, the manager began to chide me for not having called the front desk (excuse me, but I came down here directly to solve this... I know that I want a different room and that will require new room keys so I'd have to come down anyway). So we received our new room and it was quiet with a virtually silent a/c unit. The maids were excellent in their cleaning and always pleasant to speak with; only issue is that you certainly heard them coming when they wheel down the hallways to get started in the mornings. During our four days we gambled and had the customary "free" drinks for players. But the bartenders and cocktail waitresses were the rudest we encountered anywhere in Vegas. We tipped $1 for each drink served when served... and still we couldn't get serviced. Even when sitting at the bar and playing on the machines right there, getting a bartender to even look your direction was nearly impossible. The bartenders and cocktail waitresses would rather talk with each other than do anything else. The bowling alley has newer equipment and a nice layout, but the people who work there are idots and they don't care at all about service. We bowled 3x while there and every experience was bad. One night our lane had something sticky on the approach so I walked up to the desk and stated that we needed "someone to bring some cleaner and get some sticky stuff off our lane". The guy rolls his eyes and then takes his dear sweet time to come to our lane without any cleaner. He looks at the lane and then looks at us and shrugs like "there's nothing wrong here" and goes to leave. We stop him and have to walk him out to the approach and physically point out all of the gunk spots. So he goes back to the desk and comes back with a metal ruler and scrapes at the gunk for a few minutes. Of course he can't get it clean with simply a ruler for scraping so he disappears again and finally comes back with a bottle of cleaner and a rag (didn't I tell him that in the first place?) and finally cleans up the stuff. It took a good 20 minutes from when I asked to when he finished. Also, on the lane next to us, an older lady (50+) went to slide and stuck and literally fell forward onto the lane in the oil and everything. Nobody working there even noticed. We had to help her up and assist her in cleaning up. Sure enough the gunk that had been on our lane was on hers too... not that the idiot who cleaned up our lane bothered to look for any more mess in the area. The only people who would really enjoy the bowling experience here are drunks, kids, and the same crowd that only bowls "cosmic". Restaurants... the French Market Buffet food was average buffet food (nothing great), but the servers were great. The food and service were both great at Koji. The food was okay and service was great at the Courtyard Cafe. We didn't care much for the beverages at Seattle's Best Coffee. Terrible Mike's was merely okay... the food was decent enough but we sure had to wait a long time to receive it (and there was only 3 orders ahead of us). Table gaming... the dealers were less than amiable and certainly did not provide a fun spirit for gaming. The atttitude seemed very similar to that of the bartenders and cocktail waitresses. We did visit the sister properties of the Gold Coast and the Barbary Coast (as well as other strip and downtown properties). We enjoyed the atmosphere and pleasant attitudes at the Barbary Coast, but found the Gold Coast disappointingly similar to the Orleans. The one pleasant highlight of our Orleans visit actually came from the bellman who serviced us at checkout. He was a most congenial young man who very pleasantly went about his job and just seemed to radiate happiness. At checkout we had no issues, all the financial transactions were in good order and there was adequate staffing (at noon). All in all, we won't be back to the Orleans. Even if the food/beverage and rooms pricing is a bargain by Vegas standards, the attitudes of the gaming floor staff were enough to ruin things. Sad but true.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room and cheerful service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We flew in and out of Vegas for a week at the Grand Canyon. We stayed at the Orleans on Memorial Day weekend and found the room to be very nice and very clean. The bathroom has a window that opens so you can get fresh air in your room which was a nice feature. The rooms are large and comfortable and very quiet. We liked the hotel so much that we booked it again the following weekend before returning home. The second weekend, our room was smokey after requesting a non-smoking room, but we were quickly and cheerfully given a different room which happened to be in their newer tower which was very nice. Security officers required show of room key to board the elevators to the rooms making it a safe environment. I highly recommend the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great value !!!!”
Reviews.Author: alstergirl
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze and earlier then recommended. Received coupon book with lots of free stuff, however free coctails had no noticable alcohol. Friendly stuff. Absolutely loved the room, I doubt you get anything better for 30$. Spacious room on high floor, but only view to mountains. Liked the window in the bathroom. Location is great, just a view blocks off the strip on Tropicana. We booked the hotel for the room only. Spent time on the strip. Lots of locals playing the slots, very noticable. The coupon contains a free day at the spa. Pass up on it. Would not recommend, spa is very old and contains icky chlorine smell. Almost got sick from it. Sauna is very bare, only one wet room. Again chlorine smell. Base my review on the hotel room. Would stay again for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Motel”
Reviews.Author: conkay
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the orleans from May 30-june 3rd and I wanted to say it was a really nice and clean motel for the money, it is close to everything and the rooms are big and the pool area is really nice, we went bowling there and they have a nice big bowling alley and we ate breakfast at the buffet there and it was really good

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: escapade4
Reviews.Content: We spent Memorial Day Weekend in Vegas and stayed at The Orleans. The room was significantly cheaper than strip hotels at $90/night. The room was actually quite large, nicely decorated, and very clean. We had a great view of the mountains from our window. The casino was large, and had a fun theme, although we did not gamble here. We had breakfast at the Courtyard Cafe, and it was quite good and inexpensive. They also offer "Graveyard Specials" from Midnight to 7am, which are incredibly cheap. Eggs, bacon, hash browns and toast for $1.95!! If you're a midnight snacker, it's quite the deal. The pool was very nice, including the landscaping, and availability of chairs. There was also a large hot tub and a pool for kids. The pool was not overly-crowded, which was a big plus. While the shuttle service to the Barbary Coast on the Strip is reliable; my only complaint is that it does not run later. Vegas is 24 hours after all. The last trip back to the hotel from the Strip is at 12:30am. Needless to say, we had to pay for a cab back to the hotel every night. It was totally worth it, when you consider the deal we got on the hotel though. We didn't get a chance to check out the bowling alley or movie theaters, unfortunately. Overall, I thought the Orleans was an excellent deal for the money, and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Smoky Casino...Very Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from visiting Las Vegas and staying 5 nights at The Orleans Hotel & Casino. I had previously read excellent reviews about it, so that is why we made the choice to stay off of the strip. When we arrived, we walked through the front doors into a smoke filled casino, we walked all the way through the casino before we realized that the front desk was at the very front. There were no signs telling us where to check in and the casino seems to go on and on into several different directions and is very confusing. Our check in was very smooth and our room was very clean and smelled very fresh. I would highly recommend this place if you like to stay in your room a lot! We spent lots of time downstairs in the casino area and I must say that the smell of smoke is with you wherever you are--shopping, eating, etc. Most of the restaurants are located right on the casino floor, and it is very difficult to get away from the smoke. I wear contacts and by the end of each night my eyes were red and watery and my clothes smelled like smoke, just to give you an example. I also read some reviews that this place is close enough to the strip to walk to. Do not be fooled! The Orleans is located more than a mile away and a walk to the strip would take you over an interstate highway and through a more industrial part of town. I even asked my shuttle driver if it was close enough to walk and he said NO WAY! We did not rent a car, and therefore depended on the shuttle to the Barbary Coast the entire time. We waited 10-30 minutes for the shuttle, which was not bad at The Orleans, but waiting on a street corner at Barbary Coast in 108 degree heat for 20 minutes can be a nightmare! I would definitely rent a car next time to have that option to drive around town and go back to the hotel when I felt like it. Overall, the Orleans is a nice place to stay--it had a nice pool area and not too crowded (although it closed at 7!), nice room, and very nice fun book with coupons to many different attractions within the hotel. The movie theatre and bowling alley are awesome, but pricey! My complaints would be no clear aisles or signs in the casino, smoky casino, too far from the strip, and slow shuttle (they should have more than one). Slots were not that loose, they were looser at Barbary Coast. Next time I will try staying on the strip, because even if the room is inferior, I will not have to wait on the shuttle every time I want to go to the strip!

Reviews.Title: “orleans was the best”
Reviews.Author: Hauan123
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to las vegas for 25 years . this was the first time i stayed at the orleans Hotel. I have stayed all over the strip and down town and of all the places i stayed i like our stay at the orleans the best. the hotel was not to big or to small. Rooms were large, quite, smoke free, and the two queen beds were very comfortable. The staff was friendly and fun. The pool and hot tub area exellent. The free book with coupons we recieved at check in, were loaded with free drink coupons. The free shuttle bus was nice if you wanted to go to the strip, it is only a 5 minute ride. Plus as a bonus i won money at blackjack and keno. there keno pays out more for a win than any other casino i have played and there slots are generous. This is the place i have been searching for in vegas. I will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Orleans for five nights at the end of May 2005 - fairly confident, after reading the mostly positive reviews, that our stay would not be disappointing. The casino was much larger than we originally thought, and not too smokey. Tried the French Quarter buffet - good value for the price, with standard buffet offerings. The Courtyard Cafe has good breakfast deals Monday thru Thursday, from midnight to 7 a.m. Koji's had very good sashimi and Chinese food. Hotel provides good security at the elevators, requiring all guests to show room card before accessing elevators. The fitness center is a bit outdated, but serves its purpose for those wanting to maintain a fitness routine during their stay. Fitness center looks out at pool area, which is nice. Movie theaters were nice. Shuttle service was reliable and easy to use in getting to and from the strip. All hotel staff encountered were very pleasant. Only real complaint is that the bathroom sink area had an unpleasant odor while water was running (sewer gas?) and the sink and tub drains were slow at times.

Reviews.Title: “Keep this a secret folks”
Reviews.Author: Turfite
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here for one night on a trip from SanDiego to Grand Canyon but what a great night it was. After spending some time in motels it seemed like luxury at The Orleans and at such a cheap price too. The weather could have been better with only 10 minutes sun down at the pool when we got there but we cannot blame that on the hotel. Checking in was a breeze and the room large and luxurious. Staff we saw and asked questions of to find our way round were very friendly. Bus to the strip and back was no problem with one leaving every 20 mins. Great hotel at an even greater price!! Tell no-one and keep it just for us.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As budget travelers, we chose to stay off the strip and save some money. At $60/night (midweek)we thought we'd be staying at some cheesy 1970's motel. Instead, the Orleans offers everything the strip hotels offer with slightly less glitz, but all the glamour. The rooms are big, clean, and very pretty. The pool was amazing and we even overheard another guest say it was better than the Monte Carlo. Getting to the strip was a breeze as the Orleans offers a free shuttle. We were very impressed with everything and would highly recommend The Orleans to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Travel to Vegas about every 60 days and like trying different Hotels. We where very happy with the Orleans. Very nice room, large Bath and always clean. This is truly a bargain. Played alot at the Casino and found staff to be friendly and helpful. First time we stayed off of the strip. not a problem here. Shuttle was always there without much of a wait. Youll enjoy your stay.....Joe V from Pittsburgh Pa. pumpkinjoe@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “the orleans”
Reviews.Author: stepkatie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the orleans casino hotel for 3 days in may. I have to say I was impressed with the room itself. I was very nice clean and the bathroom was huge . Nicely decorated and very eye appealing , for 60 dollars a night midweek i was impressed. The buffet at the orleans for the price was one of the best with a great selection of foods from around the world. The casino is nice, although I prefer smaller darker more old vegas style, it was very bright and very big and did not hold the casino ambience I like. Lots of great time wasters like the bowling alley, theatre, and video game room. The one downside is the travel too and from the strip. Kind of a pain in the butt with shuttles and or cabs. But overall a nice place to stay for the next generation of vegas vacationers who are looking for value for their money. Worth a look.

Reviews.Title: “Buffet Rocks!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I live in Las Vegas - and my son and I usually do a different buffet every Saturday morning. Today we did the buffet at the Orleans. Only $6.93 - how cool is that?!?!? The food was awesome - blintzes, crepes, even sweet potato pancakes!! My son is 2, and he's a picky eater, but he loved everything - especially the chocolate waffles. The food was far better than some of the other buffets in town that charge four times as much as this ones. I highly suggest this to anyone looking for some good food to eat when they come visit the city that I call home - plus it's cheap - that should make you feel a heck of a lot better considering you just shelled out probably over $300 for a hotel room that you'll hardly be in. Have fun!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: peterc
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights as part of a touring holiday. This hotel was great value at $70 a night. The room was large and had a great view of the strip (we paid an extra $10 for the view). Room was clean and the furniture was fine (if a bit chintzy for our liking). There was no fridge and the bathroom was a bit small. Also the cloths hanging rail was in the bathroom next to the basin - could have been better designed. Plenty of places to eat and things to do at the hotel even if you are not a gambler (we aren't). The buffet was good and so was the wine considering it was only $5 a bottle (free with the coupon in the gift book). The breakfast was also very good. This hotel is off the strip (about a mile away) which has both upside (quieter area) and downside (quieter area). We had no problems because we had a car (and there was plenty of free parking at the hotels on the strip) but I understand taxis can be a problem and are expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a lot of hotels and I'm pretty picky. The Orleans was fantastic. It has so much to offer, my husband and I didn't leave the hotel for two days. The only thing I didn't like was being charged to use the gym. You get a free pass in your "fun book" which you receive on arrival. The pass is good for one day. Apart from that, the hotel is super. It's a little off the strip, but there are free shuttles that will take you there. The rooms are large and quiet. Security is good, and the casino is pretty nice. There is a theatre with live shows (we saw Gordon Lightfoot). It's a nice size with no bad seats. There is a also a movie theatre and a bowling alley in the hotel. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend The Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans Hotel Good Value For The Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Orleans on 5/8-5/13. The rooms were very largeand the beds were very comfortable. The only complaints on the room was the sliding wooden door on the bathroom which was very noisy and hard to closeYou could hear the doors to other rooms being shut also.Although the housekeeping was very good they started very early in the morning around 8 and the vaccuming and loud talking often woke us up.The pool area was very nice and clean even though the pool was very cold and the whirlpool was shut down for a couple of days.The shuttle bus to the strip was very handy but they could have used a few extra trips during peak hours becasuse the bus was often full.The resturants in the hotel were very good with the exception of the Irish Pub the staff was very rude and didn't seem to care if they got your business or not. Not much luck at the casino we did better on the strip even though we only played slots. The wheel of fortune was ok. Overall the Orleans was a good value for the 60$ a night we spent.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very Nice. Couldn't beat the quality provided for the price. Nice big rooms. Cleanest bathroom I've ever had at a hotel. Nice Employees. Mexican restaurant was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Luv2garden
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Vegas. Got the room for $56/night. Great value for the money. Check in was very quick and everyone was very courteous. Anytime I asked any of the staff a questions, they were very helpful. Room very nice and spacious. Only thing I didn't like about the room was the bed was very hard so I had a hard time sleeping. The casino was very nice and spacious. I didn't find it too smokey as some of the other reviewers reported. Discount coupon book was great. The dinner buffet was pretty good, but wasn't too crazy about the breakfast buffet. We had breakfast at the Courtyard Cafe and that was real good. They have a shuttle that takes you to the strip but only stops at the Barbery Coast. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun at The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: homerkimpson
Reviews.Content: We recently enjoyed a weekend stay in Las Vegas. I went there on the premise that I was seeing my cousin off for her bachelorette party, but I brought my boyfriend along also so that we could get a little R&R after the familial festivities were over. We stayed at the Orleans on Sunday night. For the price that we payed, (about 75 dollars; I booked on hotwire) we got much more than we expected. The fun book they gave us was pure gold. It included free drink tickets at the Orleans, Suncoast and Goldcoast hotels, a free order of french fries and a Pepsi with the purchase of what we came to know as the BEST burger we've ever eaten and lots more. There was also a free spa admission that we never used and a free game of bowling to boot. Anyway, back to the important stuff: back to The Burger. My boyfriend and I split the double cheeseburger twice, on different days, because it was so good. There is a burger/hot dog bar there where you can design your ultimate burger. That we did. Onions, juicy red tomatoes, fresh lettuce and the crispiest little pickles....I've never had it so good at Terrible Mike's! Big Al's Oyster Bar was also a treat. I recommend the Russian Roulette- a sampling of 5 different oyster shots and a shot of chilled vodka- Belvedere, I think. My favorite oyster shot, though I detest tequila, was the Cajun shot- cocktail sauce, a little hot sauce and, well, tequila. I recommend that if you do try these shots that you don't plan on driving afterwards. Though the main ingredient is an oyster, the rest is pretty much liquor. We didn't think we'd get so sauced. Not for the weak of heart! Their bread is baked on the spot, served warm and sliced to order. I learned from the chef that day that the oysters actually ceom from a farm in Louisiana, which added to the authenticity of the whole "Orleans" theme. Such attention to detail! The room we stayed in was fabulous. I was pleased to find that the bathroom door opened at an angle that faced away from the bed and therefore did not shed any light on the bed. Great for an insomniac like me! I heard a little commotion on the one side of the wall, but I don't know how loud the neighbors were being so that I could hear it. The decor was kind of french, though I don't know enough to say for sure. Every piece of furniture and the wallpaper was mismatched and yet coordinated in a lovely, busy kind of way. Though some might scoff at the lack of matching objects, and some have, I knew that going in and found a way to delight in it! We arrived ahead of schedule. WAY ahead of schedule. Actual check in time was somewhere closer to 3pm but they allowed us to check in at 10 am instead. We could've kissed them for that, since we young, but weary travellers had driven up from California and had stayed up all night. We checked out as easily as we had checked in and not a thing went wrong with the staff, the food, the service or anything else that we experienced there. The bartender, name unknown, was especially helpful in giving us information and when we saw him the next day as we were passing through, he waved at us. All in all, the only thing that would've made this place better was a free foot rub at the end of the day after walking around this super-huge place. You will definitely do a lot of walking if you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely theatre”
Reviews.Author: mrsjb
Reviews.Content: Went to see Englebert Humperdinck at the Orleans. The show was fabulous and the theatre gave good seats to all, The only trouble is that the hotel is quite a way from the strip and you would need to taxi/bus to main strip. It was not easy to get taxis of an evening from there. The hotel itself is okay, but there are so many to choose from that the location is not favourable.

Reviews.Title: “Trip 4/25-5/1”
Reviews.Author: NEPATraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans for the third year in a row. Everything was great as always. Weather was iffy a couple of days, but did get to use the pool a couple of days. Service and staff were great as always. Broke even on the slots, have always won in the past. Went to the theater for the first time and it was great. Had a strip view and that was nice as well. Would highly recommend the Orleans to anyone who does not have their heart set on staying on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Safe, Friendly... and a BARGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Orleans was really wonderful considering the price. I found a special on the Vegas centennial web site -- $125 for two nights, plus breakfast and dinner for two at their buffet. The buffet was pretty darned good (especially since it was free!) Breakfast was wonderful with lots of choices. As if that wasn't good enough, they gave us "fun books" as we checked in that had coupons for free drinks, buy one, get one free bowling, all sorts of other discounts. What a deal! The rooms were clean and spacious. This is not a five star hotel, but it was very nice. Everyone who worked there was friendly, as were the other guests we met. We enjoyed the pool. It's large and has a separate kids pool and a large hot tub/pool. The bowling alley was great fun. A nice escape from the usual Vegas stuff. We don't really gamble, but everyone seemed to be enjoying the casino. The only down side for some people is that is is a distance from the Strip (although that has an up side as well -- it's calmer as a result.) We had a car so it didn't matter to us. Also, if you get tired of the buffet there is a great Irish pub across the street called McMullans. The food was reasonable, very good, and we had wonderful service. Overall, if you aren't looking for luxury, but want a clean, safe,friendly BARGAIN, look no further!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Rowie
Reviews.Content: First time to Vegas, stayed at the Orleans April 26th to 29th. Got there about an hour before official check-in time and got our room, no problem. Only 2 people ahead of us in line, took about 5 minutes. Took a couple of minutes of checking the hotel map to get oriented, but once we did, never had a problem finding our way around. There is a security guard stationed at the elevators at all times & you have to show your room key. My husband had forgotten his in the room one evening & I had to come down from the room with it so they would let him up! So, very impressed with security. Room was great... lots of room. We had 2 queen beds, a hutch with TV & drawers, a small desk & chair & near the window a small sofa & chair & coffee table. Loved the opening window in the bathroom. Fresh air! And the gold colored faucets & other accents were a nice touch. I liked the place to hang clothes in the bathroom. Lots of room. And there's an iron & ironing board & hairdryer. Was very quiet. The AC unit was comparable to other hotels I have stayed in... its normal for it to be a little noisy... but that can be a good thing as it will mask any traffic noise from the hallway. But there was none in our case... we were 4 doors down from the elevators & it was not noisy at all! Asked for extra pillows & towels & got them within 5 minutes. Couldn't access the "menu" on the TV, they sent someone & again they arrived within 5 minutes & had it fixed. Beds were comfy, although it was a smoking room, it didn't smell smoky (and I'm a non-smoker, so I notice smoke smell!). Loved the casino... nice mix of table games & mixed denomination slots. And it was roomy... lots of room in the aisles, so you are not squeezing between seated slot players to get through. And again, not smoky at all! The bowling alley was nice, but not in the best shape. Needs some renovations. But there were a lot of people there bowling at 1am on a Thursday! Saw 1 movie at the theatre, had the place to ourselves! Very comfy seats! Arcade was fun for my son... he ended up with a couple of prizes from redeeming tickets he had won on the games. He also used the Kid's Tyme Center & LOVED it. He was begging us to let him go back! The staff there were great with the kids and there was lots to keep them busy! And again, very secure, no one can just wander in there. Loved the 75 cent hotdogs near the sportsbook area for lunch! Didn't like Terrible Mikes too much, but good prices. Had an ice cream at Kates Corner, which was nice. Buffet was great. Had breakfast at the Courtyard Cafe one morning, food was cold. That was my only complaint about our whole stay there! Used the shuttle to go to the strip... very convenient & hardly any wait going either way. Walked to the Walgreens from the hotel which is about 2 blocks away. A little bit of a hike, but not too bad. Liked the gift shop in the hotel. Bought a couple of souvenirs... good prices. Check out was quick & easy, everything was in order. I will definitely be staying here again, might be going back in late summer. Staff was really friendly. Came out ahead from the slots. All in all, we loved it, it was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “The Best bed I've evern slept in!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans as a 'cheaper' alternative to one of the luxory resorts on the strip. We thought it was excellent value for money. The room was brilliant and the bed was the best I've ever slept in. We found the staff helpful and knowledgeable about the area. The rooms were clean and tidy. The hotel had a huge selection of restaurants - we don't recomend Big Al's Oyster Bar as we found the service bad and the oysters not that fresh but all the other restaurants were good. The hotel also has a sport complex attached and we went to an icehockey game which was an unexpected bonus. Overall would recomend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but you need a car”
Reviews.Author: BootyYorkshireUK
Reviews.Content: Booked the Orleans after leaving it too late to get in at most strip hotels, got a great price, booked direct on line. 2 adults and 4 kids, we had two rooms across the corridor. Nice clean rooms, good maid service. The buffet here was amazing and half the price of other hotels on the strip the breakfast is a must! Did not gamble so can not comment on the casino. Security was very good you can not get up to the rooms unless you are a guest. Went to Vegas for a family wedding and visited some of the better known strip hotels but this one was equal to them all. It is a little way from the strip but if you have a hire car as we did it is only 2 mins away. Most of the staff were very friendly. When you come to Vegas there is so much to see and do that you do not spend much time in your hotel, for the price this one takes some beating, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: waynay6405
Reviews.Content: We just returned from five nights at the Orleans and enjoyed it as much as we did last May. The very large modern rooms have space for two queen beds, a large sitting area, and a large dresser. The rooms are comfy and quiet; we never heard a sound from the adjoining rooms. Internet access is via a small business center next to the casino, and not busy at all. The late night specials in the Courtyard Cafe are great, a New York steak and eggs for $2.95. The Prime Rib Loft is a hidden jewel with top quality prime rib (generous portion) for about $14 with salad and baked potato. Terrible Mike's has great burgers and fries. The breakfast buffet is top notch for less than $7. The casino is huge, with a good variety of slots and video poker for us low rollers. Good waitress service and cocktails. Be sure to use all the free cocktail tickets and other coupons in the funbooks. I can't comment on the pool since it was too cold for me. Frequent shuttle service to the Gold Coast (adjacent to Palms and Rio), and also to the Strip (across from Bellagio). If traveling with teens or children, there is a 70-lane bowling center with buck-a-game after midnight, 18 movie screens, a large arcade. I found the reception desk to be friendly. The maid service was maybe a little pesty, knocking on the door at 9 A.M., but they did a good job at housekeeping. The 24-hour gift shop/party store was convenient near the elevators, with reasonable prices. Also the liquor store had a good selection of beer, wine and liquor at good prices. If not renting a car, I would take the Shuttle Bus to/from the airport at $5 a head instead of a $20 taxi ride.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay but not play here again”
Reviews.Author: Debelli
Reviews.Content: We found this website as well as others give the ORLEANS good reviews. We had 2 nights free at THE PALMS and needed 1 night elsewhere, so after seeing others mention a MASTERCARD RATE of $30, we called, got that rate and went to stay at the ORLEANS. The rooms surprisingly nice. We both slept better here at the ORLEANS than we did at THE PALMS. The beds were very comfortable, and it makes one wonder when you see how thin the mattresses are - we couldn't understand it. I liked the pillows here a LOT better than the soft ones at the PALMS, not as hard as I like them normally, but a lot better than THE PALMS. The rooms are spacious. We had 2 queen size beds, a desk with chair, a couch, a chair and a coffee table in the room. The design of the room is what I believe is like the French Quarters in NO (never been, so just my assumption) They also have an iron and ironing board - which is nice to press out those creases your clothes seem to develop in route. The only problem I had with the room was the shower head was not forceful at all and it seemed to take double time to take a shower - but if that's the worst thing about room, that's not bad at all. The casino I didn't like at all. I didn't like any of their machines and they sure weren't paying out for anyone it seemed. The table games were busy, but that's not my forte - OH played roulette, were they had .50cent tables. We left to go back and play at THE PALMS. I would have absolutely NO qualms about staying here once again if the rate was about the same.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel off the strip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The reviews were dead on about this hotel. This was my 1st Time staying in an off strip hotel. I booked it for $65 during a convention week. I would stay here again. The rooms are very large for a standard room. Much bigger than your standard rooms on the strip. The shuttle to the strip is very convenient. It does stop at 12:30 at night, the only downfall.Take advantage of the free shuttle when you can. Taxi trips are anywhere from 10 to 20 dollars per trip depending on where you're going, it adds up fast. If you rent a car even better and cheaper. The casino was nice, with good payouts, not a lot of smoke. The restaurants are good. Overall it's worth your time and $$$ to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitly stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Vegas, so we weren't sure what we wanted. The Orleans was perfect for us. The staff was all very friendly and helpful. Our room was very clean. It was quite a way from the elevator, but it was worth not having to listen to it at all hours. The food was good and not as expensive as it is right on the strip. The slots were quite loose for us. Actually came out ahead. We didn't use the spa or pool, so can't comment on those. It was nice having a shuttle(or taxi, if preferred) right there when we wanted to go to the strip. Had to wait for a short period of time, but not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently found this site and many reviews have been helpful for me, so I thought I owed it to The Orleans to share what a great experience I had. I work in the hospitality industry with a four star hotel company and I am used to staying at the finest hotels. Unfortunetly all of my hotels in Vegas were booked the week I went so I decided to save money and stay at the Orleans for about $40.00 a night through travelocity. I must say that I was presently surprised. When we got there we were there two hours prior to check in but the front desk was very friendly and got us in after a call to housekeeping. Our King room was a little "old" in its decoration but was in good repair and was larger than a normal hotel room. Most importantly our room was very clean and our housekeeper was wonderful. My Father and Mother in law got a much newer room which looked to be very recently restored. The Casino is a little cheesy, but great for the novice gambler like myself. I enjoyed the blackjack tables and the friendly vibe I got from playing there which I never experienced anywhere on the strip. I also found that it was easier to get comps and cocktail waitresses were much more attentive here. The restauraunts were all OK and adequate. I would highly recommend the japanese restaurant there, the food is excellent. I also liked the coffee shop, kind of a Starbucks knockoff and just as good. The pool is not a typical Vegas pool that is very flashy, but it is nice and spread out enough that it never feels crowded. Towels at the pool are always in abundance and they have a great little bar there that never seems to get real busy. There is also a nice bowling alley upstairs. We did not use the shuttle to the strip while I was there, but I did see it quite often. The hardest workers in the hotel is the Valet staff. Valet parking is free here and well worth it. We never waited more than 5 minutes for our rental car the whole time we were there. All in all, although this hotel doesn't compete in appearance with the Strip hotels, but it is close enough and affordable enough to definitely be an option. If customer service and affordablility is important to you, your dollar won't go further than at the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Hey...what do you expect?”
Reviews.Author: MicheleNC
Reviews.Content: Sigh...apologies on the delay on the review. Went to Las Vegas from 4/15 to 4/18. Stayed at the Orleans....here are some thoughts. Check-in...very late. Around 1 am local time. Not a long wait at all. Front desk clerk was quite nice and did offer a small fridge at no charge. Of course, said fridge did not get there until the next morning when I called asking about it. My son was hungry so we went to the late night cafe. No specials since it was Friday night. Service was pretty slow and food was so-so. I was hungry and super tired so I did not care much. The room was clean but a little threadbare. Beds and pillows were comfy. Could not hear neighbors like some have had problems with. Maid service was not really that good. They knocked even though I had the 'do not disturb' sign on every morning. Specifically left a tip each morning, but the room was not really straightened up. My son's 'blankie' was left in the middle of the floor when it had been in his bed. Did a whole lot of room service there. Could not deal with hiking thru the casino with my son all that much. Yes, I know Vegas is not for kids, but he did have a wedding to attend. Room service was reasonable, food was plentiful and still at the proper temp. If there was a problem it was fixed promptly. Also brought food up from Terrible Mike's on night. Chicken nuggets were huge and there were lots of them. They say they do not offer to-go containers, but the nice lady at the pick up counter covered it all in plastic wrap for me. Had some pool time solo and the next day with my son. Lots of fun at the pool bar. Used the free drink coupons that we got. Love a pina coloda in the sun with a good book. The pool area was nice, lots of towels if you need them, floats and water noodles to rent (or are just left around later in the day to use). The kiddie pool was great. Round and goes from about 1 ft to about 3 ft. I could sit at the side and not have to be in the water with my son. Biggest problem with the pool was the hours. 10 am to 6 pm is just not really good if you have kids. We are up at 7 am could have used it earlier and even later before bathtime. Another heads up for those of you that travel with kids. There are no 'kids' channels. Not a Disney Channel, a Nickelodeon or a Cartoon Network type channel to be had. We ended up renting a movie on pay-per-view. Kind of pricey, but necessary. At least there were lots of pay choices. The gift shop was pretty great. Snacks, water and drinks all at reasonable prices. $1.59 for a liter of soda. Heck, who needs to walk all the way to a convenience store. And nice prices on singles of beer, wine or little mixed drinks. Check out was pretty smooth. They were even nice enough to refund me my money that was lost in the soda machines on the weekend. All in all...it is a 3 star hotel. No more and barely that. If you can get the $25 pricing and you are on a budget. Go for it. The strip is not far at all. About $5 to the MGM in a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is a good hotel. Big but not too big, so walks to your room aren't exhausting. Check in and check out was fast with no lines. The rooms were quiet, and we slept great: No traffic noise or other guests slamming doors. The staff was great, very friendly and helpful. The shower was hot and strong. The location is about 1.5 to 2 miles from the strip. You can walk to the strip but given the amount of walking you will do on the strip it just doesn't make any sense. The shuttle runs every 30 minutes or so. But this is not clockwork so If you are going to a show, give yourself some extra time to get there. The breakfast at the buffet is good, and the price is right. The lunch and dinner meals are more cafeteria quality food and you can do better somewhere else. The room was large and clean. The sheets were clean and had a good clean smell. We did not gamble at the hotel or use the pool as we were on the move constantly. This is a good hotel and great for families that want to stay in Vegas for a good price. I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: capecodhunts
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night at the Orleans Casino and enjoyed it very much. We checked in very early (11:00 a.m.) with no wait and no problems. Upon check in we each received a coupon book for businesses located within the casino. Our room was large, clean with a comfortable bed and had a view of the strip. We enjoyed free margaritas with our lunch, got a discount off ice cream, and had free beer and saki. There was a shuttle available to take you to the strip. (We had a rental car and did not use this amenity.) We booked the room on line at aaa and got a discount. Overall we found the Orleans a fun place to start our Grand Canyon vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: casabear
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you first that you should check out all the fine print on this hotel before you decide to stay here. The fitness room is NOT free (which for the price you pay for a room I thought was really crappy). The swimming pool closes at 6pm (who in the heck stops swimming at 6??) The rooms are so far away from the elevators you have to walk a mile to get to your room. I think they should have built the elevators in the middle of the hallways. The rooms were clean, but kinda old fashioned. Nothing matched anything...(the curtains didn't match the bedspread which didn't match the wallpaper, which didn't match the carpet). I wasn't there to gamble so it was frustrating to have to walk through the miles of slot machines and tables to get to the elevators. The walls are as thin as paper so I could hear every grunt and moan that my neighbors uttered. The water pressure was very unpredictable - it was high, then it would go down, then shoot out fast again. The food at every resturant there was actually very good. I especialy enjoyed the mexican resturant. The pictures I saw online for this hotel were very misleading. The people were freindly though, which was nice. There is nothing to do near this hotel however, if you want a candy bar and soda or maybe just need some magazines...you'll have to walk a ways to get to a convenience store. I wish I would have stayed down town.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location & Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: Shaney G
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 8:00AM, after a five hour red eye from Honolulu. Front desk allowed us to check-in early and go to our 5th floor room in the new wing immediately. Service was excellent from Bell Desk, Valet, Front Desk, Security, Doorman to Maid Service. Very casual friendly service without being arrogant and pretentious. Rooms were spacious, clean and nicely decorated. Would stay at this property with Family again, when visiting Las Vegas. As a reminder to visitors not familiar with Las Vegas. This property is about a couple of miles west from the corner of New York/New York Hotel/Casino. A car is a neccessary if you plan on visiting attractions, shopping etc. Hotel shuttle stops at Barbary Coast, across Caesars and Gold Coast, next to the Rio Hotel/Casino.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading such great reviews I booked for my family to stay at the Orleans for 3 nights - we were sceptical because the price was so competitive - we expected the worse - WHAT A GREAT SURPRISE - the room was more than large enough for 2 adults and 2 children - there was no smokey smell as we had been expecting in Vegas and security up to the hotel floors was always present. As for your earlier reviewer about the pool closing at 5 p.m. - we were there late March and it was too cold to go in after that time anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal - came here from MGM Grand!”
Reviews.Author: VisitingfromBoston
Reviews.Content: Spent several days at the MGM Grand for a conference, then switched to the Orleans for r&r, having chosen it from this site. While it's nowhere as grand as the MGM, The Orleans has everything you need and the price can't be beat. It's clean and safe (important for a woman traveling alone, as I was). The pools (which close at 6, not 5pm as reported by another posting, but ALL Vegas hotels seem to close their pools early except in summer) are a quick 5 mins from your room, as opposed to the MGM's 20 minutes through the smoky lobby and a shopping mall. (If you're a non-smoker, be prepared for LOTS of smoke everywhere you go in Las Vegas.) You get a coupon book good for free drinks, etc. And while the Orleans IS off the beaten track (nowhere to walk to), a free shuttle bus runs frequently until just after midnight. If you're into casinos and shows, you've got that too (Bobby Vinton, while I was there). All in all, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans was great for the 2nd year running”
Reviews.Author: ms_eaglette
Reviews.Content: This is the second year in a row we have stayed at the Orleans. Just as last time, our room was incredibly spacious, clean, comfortable and quiet. The place was booked solid, but it was library quiet up and down the hall. We had the kids with us this time. One thing I really noticed is that even when they were tramping around, heavy-footed as they are, I didn't have to contantly tell them to walk lighter. The floors (and walls) are good and solid and you don't hear the room above, below, next door or across the hall from you. The only time I noticed any other patron noise is when someone above us ran water. We called down to housekeeping for an extra blanket and a couple pillows and they were delivered within 20 minutes of the call by a friendly, smiling staff person. The pool area was quite nice, even though we didn't make use of it. Most days the weather didn't quite cooperate, and the days it did, we were out and about anyway. However, it did look quite inviting. The nice thing I noticed was a shallow wading pool for the young ones. I'd have loved that if traveling with smaller children. We also managed to catch a Las Vegas Wranglers hockey game in the Orleans arena. Let me tell you, NO ONE introduces the home team like they do in Vegas. LOL! The arena seats are quite comfortable and we all got free travel mugs to take home. Anyway, we will definitely be back to the Orleans again.

Reviews.Title: “Pool closes at 5:00pm”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Family couldn't believe that the pool, and hot tub area closed at 5 pm. The bowling alley was great after midnight at 1 dollar a game. Hotel was clean, not smokey, rooms were great.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Time at the Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: coalcracker
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my 1st trip to Vegas. Stayed at the Orleans and it was terrific!. The rooms are large and clean. Housekeeping did a wonderful job. The low limit games were just my style and there was always at least 1 $3 BJ table available. Cocktail service was brisk as long as you remember to tip a buck every time they serve you. Dealers were all friendly and patient with gambling questions from myself and others. If I ever get the chance to go back, this is where I'm staying.

Reviews.Title: “Everything it's cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Orleans 4/3 - 4/8. Just so you get a true feel for reference, wife and I are 49 years old and have stayed at most of the popular strip hotels, MGM, Venetian, Mirage, Mandalay Bay, Monte Carlo, Paris etc. Orleans was just as nice all around. All staff very friendly. Had couples massage at the spa and that was excellent. Only ate breakfast buffet there and it was so good we ate there every morning. We usually bop around trying different ones in the other hotels, but this was well worth the price. Gambling wise it is video poker heaven. I would say 70% of their machines are video poker which my wife and I really enjoy playing. Stayed in the newer wing of the hotel and the room was clean and spacious and the maid service was perfection. Oh and a large bottle of water cost $1.67. If you've ever stayed at the above mentioned places then you know the same bottle can be $3 to $4. So if your looking to have a nice home base so to speak and pump your money into gambling, strip shows, the better restaurants on the strip etc., as we did then I would highly recommend staying at the Orleans. We will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place.....I'll be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: gelo7
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms for April 5-7 and April 8th 2005. We checked in at 1am after flight delays and an awful long wait at Alamo car rental. So technically we checked in on the 6th. I hate cigarette smoke with a passion, so I wasn't happy having to walk through a smoky casino to get to the registration desk. There were about 6 or 7 clerks at the desk when we checked in and out and back again on the 8th and I was helped by the same unfriendly but not rude young lady each time. We requested one room with a king and one room with two queens and a crib on an upper floor next to or across from each other (non smoking). Well our room was on the 16th floor and my mother-in-law's room was on the 6th floor sans the king bed. We were told that we could request a change later in the morning, but my mother-in-law decided to stay put :). We did get rooms on the 12th floor next to each other when we checked back in on the 8th. We learned that if you park in the parking deck you can get to the elevators without walking through the smoky casino to get to your room. Showing your room card to the security guard to get on the elevator was reassuring. I've read here over and over again that the rooms are large and clean. Well, they are LARGE and CLEAN. Our bed linings and shower curtains were obviously brand new because the fold creases were clearly visible. We were very pleased with our rooms. The bath rooms were very large, which is were we stowed our luggage. Because we were too busy going to places like the Fiesta Henderson for their awesome $1.49 breakfast and the truckstop like Wild Wild West for their $2.69 half pound hamburger or $4.99 buffalo burger, we only had one meal at the Orleans buffet $12.99 dinner, there were lots of variety, my favorite was the fried oysters. There's also a hotdog stand in the casino were you can get hotdogs for .75. We didn't get a chance to use the bowling alley or the movie theater although we had free tickets to preview the movie Sahara. Our kids loved the resort like pool and hot tub area. We booked our rooms through Hotwire for $58.00 a night and I wouldn't have blinked at 3 or 4 times that rate, well maybe I would have since I'm such a frugal guy, but it would be worth it. I wouldn't hesitate to book at the Orleans Hotel & Casino again

Reviews.Title: “this place is so great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is great! Period! I've stayed at the Venetian and New York New York.......forget it, give me the Orleans. There are zero negatives. The people are great, the rooms are big and clean, the casino is big, bars are plentiful and friendly, restaurants are all fine (not cream of the crop but way beyond average), buffet is dynamite, the movie theatre, bowling alley and liquor store don't hurt a thing.....and there's a WINDOW IN THE SHOWER!! Transportation to the strip is east and often. Coupon book is really worth paying attention to. To sum it up, the Orleans strikes me as a place that has staff & enthusiasm meetings 3 times a day....every employee you run into has an "opening day" sort of attitude. Try to find that at the Venetian! I won't risk my precious vacations on any other hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Cloudripper
Reviews.Content: Didn't expect much for the relatively low price - $69/night. Just got back yesterday - April 7, 2005, from a one-night stay at the Orleans. Rooms were clean and spacious, bed was firm, and the rooms were QUIET. Very nice. Nothing fancy, but that's not why we were there. Casino was clean and not smoky (as some previous reviews have noted, and I'm very smoke averse), had 2 deck blackjack, but they didn't go too far past one deck dealing. Brendan's was a very pleasant surprise. We each got two comp books when we arrived, which equated to 8 free beers and Brendan's, and the zydeco band there was fabulous! The spa and workout room were very nice, much much higher quality than expected. Overall excellent experience - off the strip, which was ok by us. I'd go again.

Reviews.Title: “We Will never stay at the Orleans again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had heard and read a lot of good things about the Oleans in Las Vegas Nevada. We decided to stay at the hotel on our vacation. Boy, what a mistake that turned out to be. We booked a room in Jan. for March of 2005. We had paid with a credit card believing that the room we booked would be held for us. This turned out to be far from the truth. We booked a no smoking room. We don't really mind everyone smoking in the casinos otherwise we wouldn't go to Vegas. But we really don't want to sleep in a room that smells like a used ash tray. Sadly, that is just what was waiting for us at the Orleans. When we arrived at the hotel to check in we were told that all that was left were smoking rooms. We explained to the clerk that we had booked a no smoking room clear back in January and had already paid for the room. She said that they can't guarentee the room you get. I must, however say that we did get in to Vegas late because our flight had been delayed. We arrived at about 11:00pm. The clerk was very rude to us and plainly did not care about our problem. We were given a choice to either take a smoking room or not have a room. I asked if it would be possible to get a no smoking room that next day. The clerk said she would put in a request for it and asked if we still wanted the room. Needless to say that at 11:00 at night we did not have to much of a choice. We spent a very sleepless night in the smoking room. The next morning we went down to have breakfast and check on the status of our already paid for room that we did not get. To make a long story short we were told to keep checking back three times . We got the room but wasted a whole day. We got the room at 3:00pm. We found the service bad and will not stay at the Orleans again. We contacted the Coast Casinos and didn't any answer back from them for two weeks. They just said that they hoped our next stay would be better. We decided to not spend any more money at the Orleans or gamble there . We had a bad vacation due to a bad hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted ~ We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Desert Family
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at The Orleans April 2-3! We arrived at 11:00 a.m. and had no probably with checking in early; in fact, we were given a free upgrade to the executive king suite as the hotel was overbooked. We had our daughter with us so a roll-away bed was provided and was in our room before we walked in just a few minutes after check-in. The room was spacious and clean and the king bed was very comfortable; my daughter said the roll-away bed was much better than the queen bed she'd slept in the night before at a different hotel! Everyone we met on the staff was friendly and helpful; from the front desk staff to the security officers stationed near the elevators, to the servers in the various restaurants, clerks in the gift shops and even the maids. We had lunch in the Courtyard Cafe and it was very good, my husband especially enjoyed the Chinese Lunch special. We also had snacks in the ice cream cafe and coffee at Seattle's Best. The reviewer who commented on the registration area and the rest of the casino being too smoky must have had bad luck ~ we actually found the whole casino and registration area to be virtually smoke free which we were also pleased about since we had our daughter with us. While our suite was not 'non-smoking' the air was fresh and clean and didn't smell like stale smoke/cigarrettes. If it wasn't for the ashtrays located throughout the rooms, we wouldn't have known it was a smoking room! We were in Vegas for a family wedding and after visiting them at a couple of the other hotel/casinos located on the strip, we were even more pleased with The Orleans ~ our relatives were wishing they'd booked at The Orleans also! We would recommend this hotel to anyone and plan to be back on our next trip to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans delivers”
Reviews.Author: OhioEd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans March 28-31. Check-in was quick and easy but the young woman that checked us in was not very friendly. She was not rude just not friendly. Our room was large and very clean. The decore is nothing fancy but it is nice and appeared rather new. The hotel seemed busy but we never waited more than 35 or 40 seconds for an elevator. The buffets are reasonably priced and the food was good. At breakfast they prepare eggs "to order". Terrible Mikes has great burgers and fries. We purchased a few drinks at the bars and found the prices to be very reasonable and they did not skimp on the liquor. The casino was large but is very smokey. There is too much video poker for my taste and I was disappointed that they have no "Let it ride" tables. Other than that no complaints. We attended a hockey game at the arena which is an excellent facility. Overall I would rate this property very good to excellent and an exceptional value for the price. We will stay here again for certain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: annacd
Reviews.Content: We booked the Orleans Hotel based on feedback on this sight, and we were very pleased. The room was clean, spacious, light and totally great. The shuttles were very frequent, and we just caught one to the 'Gold Coast', then caught the one from there to the Barbary Coast, which is right on the Strip. The buffet meal at the Orleans was $12.95 for as much as you could eat, and it was superb. All meats, great range of Fish, including shrimps, crawfish etc. The dessert selection was awesome. The foods were well presented and very fresh, and we only has to wait for 5 minutes, and that was at the easter weekend. All staff were friendly, polite and very helpful. The slot machines were very kind as well. There were free drinks the whole time we were at the 'machines'. There is a shuttle from the airport, threre were two of us and as we were wanting to have a speedy return to the airport on the day of our departure, we caught a taxi, and that cost the same for the two of us as we had paid for the Shuttle, and was 10 times faster. We recommend this hotel, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “better than average”
Reviews.Author: cran
Reviews.Content: We got a very reasonable deal, and even got a 19th floor nonsmoking room for the regular room rate. The view from the room was industrial South Las Vegas, and through the one square foot bathroom window we had a view of Mandalay Bay resort and Luxor. The room was clean and nicely furnished, but the mattress was of medium density foam and too soft. The pillow was equally annoying as being too springy. The air conditioner compressor was very loud which made it very difficult to sleep the first night. For nonsmokers, its not good, but it could be worse. We were concerned about not getting a nonsmoking room which is not guaranteed. The check-in area was too smoky and you have to go through a smoky area to reach the elevators to the rooms. Even if you go through the short cut to the parking garage, you still have to go through some smoky areas. If you eat there you have to go through the heavy smoke in the casino which is poorly ventilated. While the food at the buffet on Sunday was very good, the seafood buffet on Monday was overpriced at $17 for its weak and mostly frozen food selection. There was no problem with elevator wait. Parking was okay once we figured to park in the garage to avoid going through more smoke. Distance to the strip is too far to walk, and driving to the strip is very inconvenient with heavy traffic, difficult parking and the almost constant wail of emergency vehicle sirens.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-not so great location”
Reviews.Author: dremind1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans Hotel from 3/13/05 to 3/16/05. There was no waiting for check in and a request for a refrigerator was immediately granted. (within 15 minutes). Refrigerator was an extra $15.00 a night but worth it. The room was very comfortable and well stocked with every possible nicety. Beds were very comfortable and the maid service kept the room immaculate. We ate at the Buffet several nights and the Cafe most mornings. The food was good and there were a lot of choices. I lost my walking cane in the casino the second night we were there so we were very limited to how much we could see and do in the rest of the town. No one ever turned it in. I don't know what someone would do with an old lady's cane but it was gone. The hotel is located quite a way from the strip and taxi fare to anywhere was around $20.00 a trip. The taxi drivers were extremely helpful and gave us some good tips includiing telling us to be sure to go to Fremont Street which we did and had an absolutely wonderful time listening to the music and watching the light show. Also gambled at Binnions and the Golden Nugget and were pretty lucky at both places. The casino at The Orleans is very big but most of it is video poker and nickle machines which we don't play. Quarter slots were very limited. The casino itself is beautiful and the staff there is very gracious. The location is a bit of a problem as it is far away from everything. We never did get to see the strip. I guess we will just have to back again. Darn!

Reviews.Title: “Some good and some bad”
Reviews.Author: SLOJen
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 night stay at the Orleans, and I was fairly satisfied. We had a view of the parking lot (cool!) from our 7th floor room, but what can be expected during Spring Break when pretty much everything else in Vegas is booked? I found the layout of the hotel lobby/casino very disorienting and confusing--more so than most Vegas hotels. Parking was a nightmare--but again, I can't complain because I knew it would be crazy! The food at the 24-hour cafe (I already forget the name)was average but VERY salty. The waitstaff were friendly enough but they looked drained and a little beaten down, which was slightly depressing. The shuttle service was great and the drivers had a good attitude and seemed to enjoy interacting with the travelers. I thought our room was quite clean and nicely decorated for the price. What's up with the sliding bathroom doors though?? There's no lock on them and they don't quite shut all the way (or maybe it was just ours) which is slightly annoying when you're in a room with 3 other people...We sat out in the pool area for awhile and I was pretty impressed with the size and the "look" of it all. I'm sure it will be a lot more enjoyable once the winds die down and the temp. goes up 10 degrees. Overall, I would probably stay here again but wouldn't want to pay more than $70-80 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All the other positive reviews on the Orleans are unbelievably true! This place is great. Checkin was a breeze. Front desk people actually had a personality. I had made some changes to my reservation prior to checkin, and all changes were made without any problems. The rooms were clean and spacious. I don't know why other hotels can't match the Orleans in price and quality. For a regular price of $60 then discounted 50% through a Mastercard promotion, you can't beat this hotel for $30 a night. The buffet was great and the casino was not crowded at all. The Coast hotels seems to have its act together. We also visited the Suncoast hotel and casino in Summerlin and it was also as good as the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms/Lousy Craps Tables/OK penny slots/Mexican Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: yo/ace/deuce
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Orleans March 21st and 22nd and though the hotel rooms were their usual satisfactory quality, the craps tables for the three days and two nights were awful. Ask for a strip view without the $20 trick and they will accomodate you easily if available. We stayed on the 19th? floor--one below the top two executive floors--and the view of the strip was awesome. You could see from the shimmering Mandalay Bay on the right all the way to the Luxor Pyramid on the left. There was a problem with an odor that emanated from the sink and it was a sewer smell that we notice outside when we turned from Arville street into the parking lot was the same in the bathroom, so everytime we used the sink, you just have to keep the drain closed. This was the second time the minimum on the craps tables were $5. I'm more of a low roller so this kept me off the tables during my stay there except when they lowered one of the tables to $3. Charting/watching the tables it didn't appear that anyone was winning. I could feel an air of desparation among the players that was quite noticeable and a lot of people chasing numbers with their bets and losing big. Most of the time, I played outside the hotel. Penny slots.....Try the Men In Black machines on lyour way to the poker room. There are 6 machines next to each other and when they're hitting, players are walking away with 20, 30 , 50 $$$ at a time. You must play 20 lines a sping to get into bonus rounds. I did OK, my wife did better. She has more guts with the penny machines, while I'm more of a grinder--1,3, & 5 lines at a time till I see a pattern then maybe an 11 line and an occasional 20 line bet. Mexican restaurant...Try Don Miguels Restaurant....My wife had the fish tacos which was breaded and fried, I had the steak/grilled and chopped both on corn tortillas. Both dishes were very good. We wanted to try something other than the buffet. Use your free strawberry margarita coupon in your funbook that they give you at check-in. This will save you $6 on cocktails. Don't order an appetizer because they give you not just chips and salsa, but they give you a three cup dipping tray with: refried beans, fresh guacamole and fresh salsa. I've never received this at any Mexican restaurant in California.

Reviews.Title: “I'm hard to please, but they did everything right!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Checked in on Monday 3/21 for a 3 night package. Check in staff were trainees, but did a great job. They did give me a smoking room even though I had reserved non-smoking. When I objected, they searched and made a few calls and switched me to non-smoking. Rooms are large, comfortable, and average in decor, but real clean. We ate at the Canal Street Grill (4 people for under $100 for a great meal) -and the Prime Rib Loft and Sazio's. All their restaurants were really nice and reasonably priced. I did not like the coffee shop - too smoky for a non-smoker like me. It's open to the casino. Their casino bars were also very nice. Valet staff were fast, efficient and very friendly. I used their shuttle bus to the strip twice and it ran on time. The pool was open and though there wasn't a lot of sun, it was a beautiful afternoon - lots of service at the pool and the pool area was spotless. The spa is basic - it could have been nicer. I think their spa services are priced much too high for this level of hotel. All in all, it 's a very nice hotel for the $$. I'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Las Vegas, and I chose the Orleans as our hotel because of the reviews at Trip Advisor. I was a bit nervous about it because I was also making plans for friends who went with us, and wanted them to be happy with their trip. I must say we were all pleasantly surprised. I found out later that the other couple was not looking forward to staying off the strip. They thought they would miss out on a lot. But after a couple of days they were as happy with the Orleans as we were. The restaurants there are wonderful, and the breakfast buffet is terrific. I couldn't believe how much freshly prepared food was served every morning. The hotel is very clean, and our room was larger than most rooms we have stayed in. One minor problem is that the shuttle to the strip runs every 20 minutes, but sometimes that schedule gets backed up because of traffic and the wait is a bit longer. We had rented a car and mostly used the valet parking. It's much easier. Thank you Orleans for our best ever trip to Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Orleans is a best kept secret!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
