Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 night stay at the Orleans Resort and Casino. We have been to Vegas twice before and thought we might enjoy staying off the strip this time. The Orleans was a perfect fit for our needs. It was clean, well-run and very affordable. We had no wait at check-in. We recieved the non-smoking room we requested and had a room in the tower with a lovely view. The rooms themselves were very nice, not deluxe, but comfortable and spacious. I thought it was particularly nice to see all 12 x 12 marble tiles in the bathroom with heavy brass hardware for the tub and sinks. The vanity was a lovely solid slab of marble and you had a telephone in the bathroom too! We arrived late our first night and were too tired to want to mess with finding a restaurant and waiting to eat, so we called room service while we unpacked. The food arrived promplty, was freshly made, and was delicious. I also liked the fact that they didn't tack on a huge 18% service fee in addition to delivery charges and tax. The security was good. You were asked to show your room key each and every time you went to your room. I have to admitt that we didn't eat at many of the restaurants because we were exploring other casinos and chose other places instead, but the 24 hour cafe served a decent breakfast. I would rate the Orleans a 3 and 1/2 out of 5 stars overall. It does lack some deluxe features that other casinos have, but it is mainly its overall appearance that gives it to me a 3 and 1/2 rating. It is not designed for the customer that wants the hottest trendy spot on the strip. It is not designed for the customer who wants a more formal upscale casino experience. The majority of customers during our stay were middle class folks that were friendly and wanted to and have a nice time. The Orleans does a fantastic job at catering to their core demographic group, which was great for us! The value for the dollar at this resort was very high. We had a wonderful room rate and felt the resort and casino amenities exceeded our expectations when we compared to the price we paid. So we felt we got a tremendous value for what we paid, which always makes you feel good when you travel!

Reviews.Title: “What a great find! (learn the shortcut around the casino!)”
Reviews.Author: disco_than
Reviews.Content: General: Lots of good places to eat. The multi-cultural buffet was delicious and very inexpensive. I only was able to have lunch there. Their 24 hour cafe was awesome (also used for room service!), I ate off their 'American' menu as well as their chinese menu. Their War Wonton Soup and Hong Kong noodles were awesome. Drinks were delicious. Wait staff are very very sexy in their revealing but tasteful outfits. General staff were pleasing to deal with. 4 of 5 (only because $$$$ can buy you the Bellagio or Venetian). Security was tight going up to the rooms. Valet was quick and friendly. I didn't use the shuttle service but it seemed to be picking up and dropping off all the time. The coupon book has lots of very usable coupons. There is a huge movie theater as well as a 70 lane bowling alley. In addition a big arcade area and day care! We didn't stay long enough to do movies and 24/7 bowling. Next time! Rooms: with the Master Card special rate, we booked a deluxe room with a pool/mountain side view. Gorgeous view, ultra clean rooms and lots of toiletries. Ask for a room as far from the elevator for the best views! It was spring break when I went, and we were making more noise than whatever was happening in the hall. The A/C thermostat was a bit messed up and the pocket bathroom door was different, but it didn't take away from the room at all (cant beat $70 night suite with 2 queen beds). No fridge or microwave, but I called down for a small fridge and they had one brought up. LOTS OF TOILETRIES. Room service was prompt and yummie and inexpensive for all that we ordered..two coctails, two entrees and two appetizers for about $60 + tip!! They decor was a bit dated, but I didn't care. The beds were comfortable, cable channels a bit lacking, but I'm not in Vegas to stay camped out in the room and watch tv! Spa/Pool: It wasn't super sunny weather, but I must say I was very impressed with the pool area. There is an outside bar next to the pool and lots of loungers around the pool area. I'm going to bet when its hot hot hot in the following months, this will be very ideal to hang out and relax there. It just wasn't happening because of the overcast weather. The wife used the spa facilities for a full sweedish massage as well as the 'Queen Facial'. She said it was one of the best massages she had ever gotten and the facial was soo relaxing and very complete that she fell asleep. She rates the service 5 of 5 but the facilities, having painted concrete walls recieve only 3 of 5. The spa area includes sauna, jacuzzi and lots of excercise equipment. Use the coupon in the book for a free day at the spa! Casino: Join the comps program! They have 3 different systems for table/slots/poker room. Slots and Table play add points together and with the very loose slots (at least on the video poker machines) it comps you on your wins per hand played! Poker room pays a monetary amount but I'm not sure of all the details. I only played a total of 6 hours in the poker room. I must say that this casino is very nicely set up. They have bunches and bunches of video poker machines everywhere and many of them progressives! They also have regular slots as well as video slots. What I really liked was the spacing between the rows/groups of machines. I never was ever bumped or run into or ever felt clausterphobic while playing slots. The cocktail waitresses were very timely with drinks and refills. Their table games were always populated. And they had more lower limit tables than higher limit tables, but their min/max limits seemed to be very friendly. The poker room was HUGE! Wonderful floor staff for reservations for the different type of limits as well as a tournament always happening. check the schedule, I didn't get up in time to enter their morning tournament $100 buyin and 1 rebuy, but on a Sunday they got close to 200+ players. YES LOTS OF LOCALS, so be prepared to be playing your best game of Hold 'Em. LOCALS are very nice. They are friendly and explain new things to the visitors and give good advice to novices about how to play and even where to go eat! I felt very at home playing poker there. Next time I'll play in the tournament. You know, I feel a lot more confident in my poker play after playing with those veteran wise men. I got spanked on some very notable strong hands at a 4/8 table. Capped on pocket aces only to be beat on the river by a set of Q's; set of Qs to be beat by river set of Ks. THE ONLY COMPLAINT: The table game dealers seemed fresh out of dealing school...this is both on poker and casino table games. What I ended up finding out was there was a mass exodus of dealers because the MGM is opening up a new poker room this coming Monday as well as the new Wynn is opening up a totally new casino (HEH). The locals said this was to be expected with new openings. So hopefully when I return in May, the new dealers will have had some good experience! I did look into the Sport Books area and the sense I got from it was that it was big and less crowded than the other strip casinos. They had MORE plasma TV's than any of the other strip casinos (Mirage has terrible video displays). The sitting area in the Sport Books area were tailored to people wanting to sit at a desk and not lounge in a comfy chair. I must say, it wasn't as crazy as the Mirage was during the NCAA tournament games. 5 of 5 Conclusion: If you don't like crowds or don't care for walking up and down the strip, this place is for you. If you know what you want to do in Vegas and don't care if you are not on the strip, this place is perfect for you. If you have children, The Orleans has lots of things for them to do! The Orleans has everything a Strip hotel would have, just not at the price of some Strip hotels or located on the Strip! But that's ok...take a shuttle or rent a car or pay for a cab! The Orleans is really one of those Most Bang for your Buck places! ONE LAST THING! The layout of the hotel is massive and you will be walking A LOT if you don't ask about the short cut through the grassy area in the middle of their property! Man...it will save you time and wear and tear on your feet! ASK THE SECURITY PEOPLE! 4 out of 5, only because you can pay a lot more for luxury, and sometimes you want that!

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Room is spacious Price is very competitive (not great but good for the room size) Asked for non-smoking while reserving and check in, but when I went to the room, it was a smoking room. Called front desk and got the "sorry we are all sold out, we will call you when we have an opening". Casino games were average. French Village Buffet is to be avoided. Food is too salty, ribs were very rubbery, selection was weak. Better try Sazio's (their Italian restaurant) or Don Miguel's - their Mexican fare.

Reviews.Title: “Best slots in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were at the Orleans for March Madness. It is much easier to find a place to watch the games there (versus other Strip properties). Drinks are cheaper and the casino is very large so you do not feel boxed in or crowded, even on a popular weekend. More locals and less tourists, if you like that. The restaurants are great - Mexican & Chinese places are our favorites. The big draw are the large variety and number of slot machines - we did not get bored after playing there for 3 straight days. The rooms are cheaper than on the strip, and it's only a short cab ride away if you want to zip on down to the south end of the strip for a change. The rooms themselves are small suites with a sitting/eating space -- not the Venetian but larger than your standard 400-sq-ft room. This is our favorite place to stay in Vegas and although we switch around to keep things fresh, we keep coming back to the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Misled at check-in (big time)”
Reviews.Author: CAhiker09
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two-night stay at the Orleans with my family (incl. toddler). Reserved and asked for a non-smoking room, thought we had been given a non-smoking room until all the ashtrays around and my allergic sneezing tipped me off. I called and the staff person's answer was that they were sold out. She said they'd call us back if there were any n.s. rooms available the next day. All our clothes, including the ones left in the bags, smell of smoke and I feel so bad for my kid. I just wish they had at least cared to call back. That spoiled the whole experience that otherwise could have been very nice. Make sure you get what you're asking for at check-in, don't get ripped off like we did.

Reviews.Title: “What a Bargain”
Reviews.Author: slobowty
Reviews.Content: For the money, I don't know any better deal in Vegas. The rooms, although a little worn, are roomy and comfortable. There are a host of activities other than gambling including a multi-plex theater (I think it has 16 screens) and a bowling alley. The shows tend to be oldies but goodies. (We saw Little Richard and loved it.) The showroom theater is very nice but I wish they would have stagger the seats to enchance site-lines. All in all, I was a little wary because of the price, but had a good stay. (It is a ways off the strip but we didn't find that a significant problem given the availability of the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms and Lots of Entertainment Options”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Orleans are on a par with the Paris Hotel on the strip, but at 1/5th the price. I stayed for five days and asked for a higher floor at check-in. I was given a room on the top floor of the tower. Access to the top two floors of the tower are restricted by room key, so it was very private. I loved the size of the room and the interesting layout, with the bathroom in the back corner of the room as you enter. It was also nice to have something to do besides gambling. I saw two movies while I was there in the Century 18 theater. I liked the stadium-style seats, no worries about tall guys sitting in front of me blocking the view there! It was also nice to have so many options for meals. I got a sandwich at the Subways counter and a hot fudge sundae at the ice cream parlor and took them up to my room. Also, the prices in the gifts and sundries shop just downstairs from the guest room elevators had very reasonable prices. I paid the same price for a bottle of diet Coke and chips as I do at my local grocery store. That's unheard of in the Strip hotels! It rained heavily while I was there, and my new shoes got soaked one night. I left them with the shoe shine man overnight and when I picked them up, they looked just like new. He was very nice also. The place seems to be very popular with the locals. Next time I come to Las Vegas, I'll stay here again. I like all the options for entertainment, dining, gambling, and shows.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Stay Anywhere Else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I simply love this hotel. There's so much to do (watching movies, bowling, eating, drinking, gambling, lounging, swimming, any other -ing), that you really don't have to leave the hotel. Even if you choose to do so, they have a free shuttle that takes you to the Gold Coast (across from The Rio) or the Barbary Coast (right in the middle of the strip). It was running late enough that I could use it to get back to the hotel after seeing Ka at MGM or the fountains at Bellagio. (Last shuttle leaving Barbary Coast is approx. 12:30AM) The coupon book was wonderful. Loved the free bottle of wine. Gorged myself during Monday's Seafood Night (mmmmm oysters). Terrible’s Liquor Store is half the price of my neighborhood store, and room service is about 30% cheaper than other hotels I’ve visited. I did have to show my key in order to reach the tower elevators, which is a wonderful bit of extra security. I only had 3 issues with this trip: The window in the shower - Nice touch, great to remove steam, but shouldn't be clear. The pattern they have isn't enough for us modest types. Etching would be nice. Let's in light but doesn't allow sight. No "chain" lock on the door - There was only the deadbolt lock, no security latch. Power Outage - We lost most lights, and television service for a few hours. Kept coming on and off. I don't believe the hotel was at fault though. As long as the slots still work, I'm good. Overall, it’s a wonderful hotel. I’m already booking my New Year’s visit here.

Reviews.Title: “Got everything right there, great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2/23 to 2/27. This hotel has everything you need right there. 24 hr resturant, several bars, casino with nice poker room, spa, ect. If you book on-line, you may not get request for King bed, but they moved me to strip view on 2nd night at no charge. Ask for a room at the end of the hall as you will avoid noise from people talking around elevator. If you ask for things that this hotel, they will give them to you. They will valet your car for free, but parking area is not too big, and I did not want to wait. Service here is good, specially the cocktail waitresses. The craps dealers were not very lively. Casino is not smokey as some indicate in other reviews. Only ate at Cafe, Deli, and Buffet. I would say only a little higher than avg. They have shuttle and they run 20-30 min. Shuttle takes little time to getto strip. You can walk to palms, but strip would be a hike. Stay here, rent a car for $17 at payless rental co, and drive anywhere. NYNY/MGM only 5 min to get to. I got comped meals for only playing craps for 1/2 hr, but they want you to play for at least 1 hr. Would stay here again for value of room ($60 weekday/120 weekend)

Reviews.Title: “A friendly place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious and nicely furnished. My only gripes as far as the rooms go is that the bathroom is on an exterior wall which dosen't provide a sound buffer from the hallway like you find in most hotel floorplans. The other gripe is there is a pocket door to the bathroom. Pocket doors are noisy to open and close, thus we woke each other when using the bathroom in the middle of the night. The casino is big and fun. Nice multiplex theater and 70 lane bowling alley on premises. The Orleans arena also host performers and sports. It was a nice hotel. I go to Vegas two or three times a year. I will stay here again if the price is right. If you do not have a car they offer a shuttle to a sister property mid-strip.

Reviews.Title: “hands down a winner”
Reviews.Author: twins&kas..gran
Reviews.Content: stayed at the orleans on March 9 2005. Not a bad thing to say. The room was clean and a good size. Loved the little window in the shower and fresh air was great as i had nice view. Machines were generous and buffet excellent. highly recommend this property for freindly staff... lots to do...good food..and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Visit!”
Reviews.Author: Tarey
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Orleans (March 1-4, 2005) - booked the Mardi Gras Package on their website. Two nights, two breakfast and two dinner buffets, for $109! Excellent room with a view of the strip, the buffets were wonderful and I appreciated the security. Pool was nice in the afternoon - as was the jacuzzi. Cocktail waitresses in the casino were a bit slow. This is my place to stay in LV - off the strip is much less stress!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayted at the Orleans March 1-5, 2005 and couldn't have asked for a better experience. Arrived at 12:30PM on March 1st and our 2 rooms were ready and just as requested (King, Non-Smoking and across the hall from each other). Rooms are large and include a desk and sofa. They do have window air conditioning which was a little noisy but kept the room comfortable. Housekeeping was prompt and rooms were cleaned by 1:00 each day. Great off-strip location. Easy to get around on backstreets to get to and from just about anywhere. Was a little disappointed in the coffee shop service (30 minutes from being seated to breakfast on the table) but the buffet was great. Rate was $60 per night booked on line. This will be our new Las Vegas home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: HonestJohn
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Orleans several times now, my last stay being Feb 2005. While all the other strip hotels jacked up the rates due to conventions, I got the Orleans at a very reasonable $65/night, which represents excellent value in LV. Check in was OK - the front desk staff is efficient but very lackluster. Security is EXCELLENT, you can't get to the elevators without showing your room key. THe bonus coup Fun Book actually has good values. Food in the buffet is great and is one of the very best deals in Vegas for the price. Maid service is EXCELLENT, room is a good size and very very clean. Overal the property is nice, has lots of food and shops and there is a free shuttle to the Strip. Across the street is the CAT bus stop, to the Strip is only $1.25. Been there before and will return when I have to. Casino staff is decent

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed only for 1 night at the Orleans 1/23/05. I was a little leary walking in because of the smell of smoke in the casino but once we got off the elevator it was fine. The room was very clean and spacious. We had a room on the 12th floor and the view was fantastic. It's a very short ride to the strip. Would definately stay again.....

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel found reviews on this site”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans February 21st to the 23rd. Checked in at eleven a.m. room was ready check in only took ten minutes. Room was spacious and clean. Hotel has alot of entertaining options including bowling alley and movie theatre. Staff was pleasant and accommodating. The French Market buffet was excellent. Ate at The Prime Rib Loft it was great. Free shuttle to the strip.Cocktail waitresses were very fast. We were very pleased with the Orleans All and all this hotel is definetely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: mbefc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans from Feb 12th to Feb 19th and don't have one complaint. The room was very spacious and was always kept immaculately clean by the maid. Plenty of options when it came to eating and we found the dinner buffet to be very nice ( much better than the one at TI which was a lot pricier ). The coupon book was very useful as we managed to get 2 tickets for the price of 1 for a concert so saving $70, bargain. We are looking to go back again later this year and I would stay at the Orleans again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a merry xmas at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Orleans over 10 times before we checked in on the 23rd for 2 rooms, the rooms we asked for (2-King) were not ready so we ended up with queen beds the lady checking out next to us said the same about her check in. Xmas dinner at the Prime Rib Loft was so bad the food was fair the service was very bad. Now about the Coffee Shop we out at another hotel playing when came back to the Orleans at 3:00 A.M. for breakfast after waiting for 20 minutes in line when there maybe 10 tables full we order food about 40 minutes later the servers was coming out with the order, a lady at the table got sick all over herself and the table and the smell was so bad, we asked to be moved to another table we the moved to a table in the back corner, the hostess told we could not sit their the server told her the the story after the food was on the table the hostess came back and told to us move again, when we said no she said was call security to throw us out. I talked to the casino manager he said there was nothing he could do about the coffee shop but he would give a comp for the the next day after talking the him for 20 minutes we so upset we check-out at 4:30A.M. in the morning and drove 4 hours home ( 1 day early) even the hotel manager said that he should have done something about the rude service. The Orleans was so disapointing not to mention the amount of money i spent the casino i could have stayed a much better hotel, this is sad i have been a customer since the hotel opened never again!!

Reviews.Title: “Orleans the way to go”
Reviews.Author: possumgirl
Reviews.Content: Split 7 days in Vegas...3 at the Orleans and 4 at the MGM (due to family obligation). Wish I had remained at Orleans. Even after transfer to MGM, drove back to the Orleans several times. Very Convenient, close parking, multiple entrances. Kids play area was a big hit w/ our 5 yr old. Brendan's Pub very nice and food was good at most of the restaurants. Bang for the buck was outstanding and w/ child, being off the beaten path was ok w/ us. Will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from the Orleans and can't say enough! The service was very good. We got to the hotel and was able to check in at 11:30 a.m. they didn't have a king bed available as we requested, however, they did make sure we had an awesome view of the strip from the 19th floor. We took advantage of the theater 2x, and took in a hockey game one night too! We didn't get a chance to bowl but did go check out the alley, very large and open 24hrs. We did get a message at the spa...HEAVENLY! make sure to treat yourself!! The food was good. We ate at the buffet & Sazio's. Both good and no lines for either. Wheel of fortune $1 slots pay pretty good~not much of a variety of slot machines unless you like the video Poker. Had more fun gambling on the strip. Take advantage of the free shuttle to Barbary and Gold coast. Don't forget the monorail from Harrahs/Ballys will take you as far south as the MGM for $3 a ride or get a day-3 day pass. We took the taxi several times when we didnt want to waste an hour here or there waiting for transportation. Even a taxi fare was reasonable and you can split the cost with all who ride. The Orleans is a great stay off the strip and very accomodating if you want to be away from the crowds. Would recommend this bargain to anyone who would rather save thier money for shows and gambling rather than on the glitz and glamour of the strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience for our first time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mom, sister and myself stayed at the Orleans the last weekend in January. We enjoyed the clean rooms, and friendly service. We didn't wait in line for anything, checking in, cabs, checkout; the service was really quick. The casino is really smoky and has a low ceiling with poor ventilation, not like Caesars, or Alaadins, but there were a ton of things to do there. We recommend going to the Irish pub, and to the Mexican restaurant for strawberry margaritas. We never waited more than 10 minutes for the shuttle, and enjoyed staying away from the strip where there weren't as many people. The Orleans it seems also caters to the locals, so there were not as many tourists. They supplied us with an awesome coupon book, so for the bargain hunters, you can get discounts on practically everything. The clientele ranged from some young people, to lots of seniors. We got a great deal on our package, and so it was definitely worthwhile. Our only complaint was that the housekeeping staff came and knocked on our door every morning at 8:00 and woke us up! It was a great experience for our first stay in Vegas, next time we'll stay closer to all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans is Great”
Reviews.Author: scheif
Reviews.Content: A great place. Stayed by myself and felt very comfortable. Spacious room with nice view. Loved all the bath toilitries. Enjoyed my meal at Don Miguels, coupon for free margarita in fun book.Loved buying a bottle of wine at the wine shoppe for $2.99. Cocktail service was a bit slow. Liked the free shuttle service. It starts at 9:30 but you might want to go a little later and there's not a line. Hate to say too much good about the place I might have to pay more than $18.00 a nite the next time!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Value, Even for the Picky Ones”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4-night stay at the Orleans. I am traditionally very particular about accommodations and I can say with 100% confidence that this was a great hotel for the price. We booked two rooms for four nights and spent a grand total of $202. We were a little leary, having stayed strictly on the strip for the past 10 years but we were pleasently surprised by the whole experience. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. We stayed on the 16th floor in one of the older wings, facing the mountains. We tried to hold out for a strip view but, when your plane arrives at 8:00 a.m. on a Sunday morning, you can only hold out for so long. Be aware that the beds are very firm. I loved this but my husband was a little bit stiff after a couple of nights. We requested extra pillows and returned with a bed full of them so that helps if you need a little extra cushioning. The liquor store has great prices, including water for $1.65 versus the $3.50 gouge at the strip properties. This is the first trip that we have taken where we actually ate on site several times. Overall, good food and service, as well as very reasonable prices. My favorite was Don Miguels. Great Rellenos! As with all casinos, it was smokey and they took our money, but we enjoyed the conversations we had with the locals. Definitely check out the Orleans. I would pay twice what we paid to stay there without batting an eye. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans Was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans from Jan 21-24. It was amazing! On the weekend nights, the room was $89, and on the weekday it was $50! A great value! The rooms are easily worth $150-$200. They are beautifully decorated, spacious, have great views (we had the pool view) and we had a great sleep in the wonderful beds. The houskeeping was wonderful, and in the bathroom they give you so many toilitrees! The casino had great odds, (my wife won $900 on a 25 cent machine!) The cocktail waitresses were great. The restaurants were great, we ate at Canal Street (the best food in Vegas!), the buffet (great for breakfast), The Courtyard Cafe (GREAT VALUE especially for lunch), Seattle's Best Coffee (Great Coffee, and outstanding muffins), and Subway sandwhiches (very tasty!) You should take advantage of the coupon book also-great value! The shuttle bus to the Barbary Coast was very good also, we rented a car, and we shouldn't have. The Club Coast card was great for comps also. The business center is good for those of you who need to use a computer, but who don't have a laptop. I had a shoeshine at the Orleans (only $4!), and my wife had a massage and she said it was the best she's ever had. The gift shop was also amazing. (You even get a coupon in the fun book for a free gift at the gift shop!) I have no complaints, and there is NO reason not to stay at the Orleans! Orleans, keep up the good work! A++

Reviews.Title: “great price”
Reviews.Author: elleebug
Reviews.Content: we checked in for a several days stay at 3:30pm, and our room was still dirty. we informed the front desk and it took the housekeeper until 5:30pm to finish it, then our keys wouldn't work. The price was perfect for what we got. I recommend everyone try the Silver Strike machine, we were constantly winning on this machine, but had no real major luck on any other machine, just a little here, & a little there. Their Market Buffet was good priced for all the choices too. We would definately go back if we return to Vegas. The staff was all so friendly, and you felt like you were treated as if you were family.

Reviews.Title: “yuck”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: horrible place to stay in las vegas. I'm perplexed about why all others gave it such a high rating. Is this just a place for cheapskates or people with bad taste or both ? First off, there are so many nice hotels in vegas, why go to this place? The location isn't great...its about a 10 minute drive away from the vegas strip. It took us about 45 minutes, maybe an hour to check in because the staff lady was confused. The rooms are not all that great either....just a standard room you expect at any hotel . I actually got locked inside the bathroom because they don't have regular doors to the bathroom...its got a hidden sliding door with a latch lock... luckily I was not alone in my room and my friend called for help.

Reviews.Title: “the orleans was a nice place to stay except for the kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We planned a birthday trip for my mother and had booked a total of 3 rooms. The front desk was very accomodating when we requested that all 3 rooms be on the same floor even though the other 2 parties were not going to check in until later that evening. The only problem was that one of the rooms they had reserved for us obviously had some type of water damage because the door was still propped open with a towel and there were two blowers going to try and dry out the carpet. The room also had a very musty smell. They ended up putting our third party on a separate floor. Otherwise the rooms were very clean. My only complaint about the amenities is that the iron is bolted to one end of the ironing board so it is difficult to use. The valet was very prompt and courteous. The chinese food at the 24 hour cafe was delicious and of course the buffet was great...especially the price. The only major problem I saw with this hotel was the number of unattended kids that were running around. I have stayed in several other hotels in Vegas and they have strict policies that the kids must stay on the main pathway & not hang around the games. Unfortunately that was not the case at The Orleans. Kids were seen unsupervised hanging around the slots and game tables not to mention the ones that ran up and down the halls on a nightly basis. Two of us had families staying in the rooms next to us and you could tell when the parents left the kids alone in the room because of all the noise. If you don't mind the kids running around unattended, The Orleans is a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans Hotel for 4 nights in January from the 9-13, 2005. This was our third trip to Vegas. In the past we've stayed at 5 star hotels on the strip. Before I booked this time, I read information about the Orleans, and various others, from the "tripadvisor" forum. The value was great @ $49/N, the rooms large and clean, the service friendly, we felt safe and secure, and the gambling wasn't bad either. We were equally pleased with our Oleans room as our more expensive rooms in the past. From now on, we will always go back to the Orleans. Freezing in Wisconsin P.S. If you plan on a renting a car, just a note of caution; drive defensivly! The traffic in Vegas is becoming alarmingly congested (day and night) and fast paced. Drivers are often rude, with fender-benders around almost every corner. We are used to city driving ... but were stressed out! We logged on more than 600 miles on our trip within the city and in the outlying areas.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: steviemagid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans Jan.13-16,2005 and were pleasantly surprised at how convenient it was to be at a hotel that offers everything under one roof. It is not the most elegant of hotels, but certainly roomy enough and clean and well kept. We were three ladies so it was nice that there was security checking room cards near the elevators. We used the spa and would recommend getting a massage while you are there. The spa was very nice.The hotel is huge and offers a very large selection of slots with variable play amounts to suit any gambler. The buffet was very reasonable and had a large selection. We went for both dinner and breakfast and had plenty to choose from. We had a couple of small issues with our room and service showed up within 5 minutes of our call to fix everything. The hotel corridors were very quiet and people were respectful of the odd hours that are kept in LV. We valeted our rental car and that was great and very easy to do. All in all, we had a wonderful time and would certainly recommend it to others. It is probably the best deal in Las Vegas as we paid considerably less than had we stayed any place else of this caliber in LV.

Reviews.Title: “Orlean Trip Report”
Reviews.Author: sstudier
Reviews.Content: Really liked the room. It was the size of a suite with a rather large sitting area with a sofa, chair, and table. Rates were GREAT! One night on our internet special was only $20. But expect weekend nights to be 5x as much. Food was really quite good at the coffee shop for breakfast. Most days included free coffee cake with your breakfast purchase. The Mexican restuarant was a nice surprise. Being from South Texas we went in with low expectations but were really pleased. Ordered fajitas and the entire meal was EXCELLENT! The buffet was very good but the Cannery really was much better. Walked away winners on video poker. My wife hit a royal for over $1000. I hit for 400 and 200 and a number of payouts in the $80 range. Will stay at the Orleans again on my next visit! Not only a great value but good for twice the price!

Reviews.Title: “I Loved The Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything about my trip Jan. 16-18 was perfect! The hotel rooms are big and wonderful, the buffet and snack bar excellent, and the casino huge. An email from a travel site offered unheard of $17 rooms, and I'd have had very low expectations except for the great reviews thanks to this tripadvisor site. Check-in was super quick. A couple of big coupon books came with check-in. A real bonus the second night was getting a royal flush on a quarter video poker machine! If you like video poker, they're loaded with video poker machines of every type. The comp system's a little different, in that you accumulate comps based on your winnings, not money put through the machine, but it sure worked for me. They even had 2x comps on MLK, Jr. holiday. I never had to pay for a meal the comps racked up so fast. The buffet was delicious with a huge variety. The entire staff was friendly, the cocktail waitresses everywhere. You'd never have to go thirsty for a minute! One of their free shuttles goes to the nearby Gold Coast (across the street from The Palms) and another goes to the strip (Barbary Coast). I can't say enough good things about The Orleans, and can't wait to go back. Thanks Tripadvisor for helping make this an easy decision to choose The Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “hard not to love”
Reviews.Author: ltlbudahs
Reviews.Content: I had recieved a great deal of 17 dollars a night for a sunday thru thursday stay so decided to give it a shot. The place is very nice and comfortable if you do go do the valet parking and tip well and you will be taken cared of. This is much easier than regular parking and is cheap a few bucks is not much on vegas. The rooms are nice and the restaurants are fun. The canal street has a better prime rib than the loft. It cost me about 30 bucks for myself with tip to eat there. any questions you have email me and I'll be happy to answer them all. I loved the place and it's so close to new york new york it is perfect.have a great stay. chris

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DelawareGary
Reviews.Content: Great place rooms are good and large I agree that the only issue I had was the smoke. I guess its no worst than any other place in Vegas. I have been to vegas several times and stayed on the strip. I will stay here from now on. If you have kids they have a movie theater and a bowling alley in the hotel as well as a day care with jungle jim ect. food was good we ate at the buffet for breakfeast it was good. staff was fine to deal with. room was cleaned everyday very nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: mackeminafrica
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans for 3 nights from 29th Dec to 1st Jan and it was excellent value for money. Decent sized room which was clean, comfortable and well looked after. Coupon book was useful with free drinks, bowling, entry to spa and wine at the buffet. Indeed the breafast and dinner buffets were terrific value at $5.99 and $12.99. As it was New Year the shuttle bus was busy but even so it worked ok. I would definitely recommend this hotel as it has a 70 lane bowling alley and an 18 screen cinema for when you tire of the casino and plenty of reasonably priced eating places.

Reviews.Title: “not so great”
Reviews.Author: belilkana
Reviews.Content: They gave us a smoking room though we really wanted a non-smoking one. They offered to spray the room. A man next to me checking in was quite upset about the same problem so I accepted the room. It was really smelly. The air conditioner controls were broken and we couldn't adjust the air flow in the room at all. Then about 6 am the air condtioner started screeching this horrible noise that woke us up. Since we had stayed out till four am we weren't ready to wake up quite yet. Then to top it off at ten am a man starts pounding on the door yelling security. Foolishly I opened up. They wanted to convert a tv outlet to internet or something. They woke me up for this? As we left actual security was talking to another customer complaining about this man yelling security to gain access to the rooms. The pool was completely closed. I was fooled by all the good ratings this place received but I will never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay at The Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading numerous positive reviews and wanting to stay off Strip on this trip to Vegas, I decided to see for myself and booked a room at The Orleans. My boyfriend and I spent a week there (Dec. 22 - 29, 2004) and found it to be an excellent hotel! Check-in was easy, quick, hassle-free and friendly. The room was much larger than we expected. It gave us both space to move around without bumping into one another or being in each other's way. We inadvertantly discovered that the walls really are made out of concrete when I started bouncing a small rubber ball I'd won against the walls and the ball made no sound when it hit the wall. We usually didn't start our day until after 1pm or 2pm and had "brunch" at the Courtyard Cafe. We didn't get to eat at the buffet during our stay, but I'm sure we will next time we visit Vegas! The restaurants we tried were Don Miguels (nice, big margaritas and great food), Sazio's (gigantic meatballs on the twice baked lasagna!), Terrible Mike's (big burgers), The Prime Rib Loft (we ate there Christmas and could only choose from a set menu, the prime rib was tasty and the eggnog cream pie was actually very, very good!), Big Al's Oyster Bar (bring a huge appetite with you if you order any of the Pan Roasts), Koji (mmm, hot saki) and, of course, The Courtyard Cafe (great for "breakfast" food anytime of the day or night). As far as gambling goes I'm not much of a gambler, but my boyfriend won $400 playing video poker and another $300 playing blackjack at The Orleans. All in all, we had a marvelous time and are planning on visiting Vegas and staying at The Orleans again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great rates”
Reviews.Author: ademarco6
Reviews.Content: I used vegas to book a 3 night stay at the Orleans and it only cost $90. I liked the hotel so much that I decided to stay another night (Friday which was $139). It didn't bother me since I got such a good deal during my stay. They give you a coupon book that can only be used at their hotel and it has lots of freebies. The first night we ate at the buffet which was decent for the price, then my wife wanted to see a movie. So we went upstairs and some lady just walked up to us and gave us this free movie promo to see Coach Carter which was one of the better movies that I have seen lately. We then went up to the bowling alley and my wife got her shoes for free and I used a coupon to buy one and get one free games. So I took avantage of that deal and bowled like 4 games. We left the housekeepers $2-3 a night and asked for extra pillows and soap/shampoo. Upon return to our room we found a mountain of pillows on our bed and enough soap for the rest of our trip. I used their high-speed internet twice and didn't get charged. The only complaint is that to make any phone call they charge $.75 for every call. But next time I'll bring a cellphone. The people were all very nice and hospitable. We even ate at the 24hr. cafe for their graveyard specials. The casino/hotel is only a 10-15min. drive to the strip and it felt safer being away from all that mess. The only complaint is that it is very hard to find parking when the lcoals all come out to play and have fun since they have everything under one roof. I enjoyed my stay and would come back again. Make sure you ask for a room in the new tower that is close to the elevator or you are going to have a long hike to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible time at The Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: dresser79
Reviews.Content: Heard about fantastic prices at The Orleans in December, and yes, the rooms were going for $20 a night! Since we're not huge gamblers with comps, we jumped at it and booked four rooms for two nights for our entire family. Couldn't belive the rooms for that price! Each were junior suites--huge for hotel rooms, with granite bathrooms, sofas and chairs, desks, wonderfully decorated! Views of the Strip, or pool. Also came with discount booklets that seemed like they were paying us to stay there. Only complaint--the strong smoke smell from the casino hits you the minute you enter, completely taking my voice--couldn't communicate with check-in! When are these places going to fix this problem? We've stayed on the Strip for much more money, and found that we drove everywhere anyway, so staying off the Strip was no problem. This hotel is a steal, even at current $69/night prices. And they've got the best breakfast buffet--for $5.99--incredible buy!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday stay at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans from Dec 24th to the 31st , 2004.The Hotel was very accomodating on check-in , even changing our room to a strip view. The rate was great and they even threw in two buffets. The shuttle was a great convenience, and the restaurants were very good. Our son and his family joined us during the week and the Hotel did what they could to put them next to us but I guess with the crush of visitors during the week we were just glad we had booked their room in advance. This was our only disappointment. The rooms were generous as advertised , and service was very good. All in all a great stay. Would come back again to stay. PS. We also booked a 4 night stay at the Embassy Suites at the Airport (on Swenson) from the 31st to the 4th of Jan. Should have stayed at the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend you stay here!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Orleans Dec 30-Jan 3, 2005 had a great experience. The Rooms are beautifully decorated and very clean. The maid service was excellent. The casino was great and wasn't as crowded as those you find on the strip. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: GaGaGirl
Reviews.Content: Just got back from The Orleans. We stayed in the newly built rooms. It was fantastic for $21.00 a night special. Room was very clean. The coupon booklet was a great value. The breakfast buffet was, in my opinion, as good as the buffet at The Mirage and at a much cheaper price of $5.99. Don Miguel's was a typical Mexican style restaurant, but good. We grabbed lunch at Terrible Mike's and used one of our coupons (buy a burger and get fries and drink free) and spent about $10.00. The Orleans has various things to do for all ages. We had a great time. The shuttle service to the strip worked well for us, but I did hear a lot of complaints about having to wait a long time from other guest. I guess we were in the right place at the right time. The one thing I would like to see changed is the slot club. You only get points for dollars won instead of time played. Hopefully that will change. One suggestion is to check out ------------- for discount coupons to some vegas restaurants. We ate dinner at a restaurant in the Desert Passage. And a meal originally for $40.00 cost only $11.00. Just a suggestion. Stay at The Orleans you will not be dissappointed. We plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Had A great stay at The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Iowa48
Reviews.Content: After lots of research on a hotel in Las Vegas, the hubby and I decided on The Orleans. We stayed 12-24-12-28. We had a wonderful time the room was good size with a view of the strip. We also had one of the rooms were in the bathroom you had a window looking out to the Plams hotel. Enjoyed the buffet one morning and the cafe another, I enjoyed the cafe more. Also took advantage of the spa, there was a coupon in the book they gave you for one free day. We also used the shuttle alot. When you were ready to return the line at Barbary Coast could get long and sometimes people would want to cut in front. Had a great time in the casino, played mostly nickels and pennys. We will stay there again. Iowa48

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at the Orleans Dec 27 - 30. Staff were great, rooms were excellent. The only down side was having to wait at the Barbary Coast for up to twenty minutes for the shuttle bus. On the other hand a cab ride in is under $10 if you don't want to wait. We intend to go back to the hotel in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Just be careful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Orleans was in 03/2004. Everything was great until the last day! We had a red eye flight out and they had actually allowed us a late check out. We slept in and then went down to the buffet for a late lunch. To my misfortune I got REALLY bad food poisoning!! We contacted the front desk and asked if we could stay in the room a wjhile longer due to my misfortune and they said no. As we proceeded down to the casino I was so ill I needed to seek refuge somwehere. I went to the spa area where they were very kind and agreed to accomodate me for a while. Then security came and rudely told me I had to get out of there. My only option was to now sit in the main lobby. As I sat on the couch in the smoke filled lobby, running back and forth to the restrooms, security again approached and told my boyfriend that I couldn't sleep on their couch because I was sitting with my eyes closed. Believe me I wasn't sleeping! Because of the rudeness and basic lack of cooperation I will never return there. Go and enjoy your stay, but don't eat the buffet!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in L.V>”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Slightly smoky, but the rooms are large, tastefully furniched. The buffet is top quality and moderatly priced. Actually a great value. Top entertainment, and always a lounge show.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Renny
Reviews.Content: I was more than pleasantly surprised at the quality of hotel for the money. $ 20/night. I know it's low season, but this was a very decent place. Clean, friendly staff, decent food and a nice lay out. The mattress was great. I enjoyed the spa facilities. These people really work hard to give you a family like atmosphere. I would certainly stay here again and highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: With an internet deal of $20.00/night we arrived at the Orleans Nov 21st and stayed until the 25th. Checkin was very quick and our room was lovely with a sitting area. (loveseat, chair and table) Housekeeping was above average. We found the bed very comfortable and the washroom was a good size. We were meeting relatives (4) from England and when they saw our room they said they would be staying at the Orleans on their next visit. We were in Las Vegas for two weddings - our's (after 26 years living together and our neice's. Our neice got married on Tuesday and we ate in the courtyard restaurant which was very nice. I had the prime rib dinner for $10.95 (excellent) We got married on Wednesday and ate at the buffet restaurant. At checkin... we received a voucher for 2 free buffets. Our coupon books also had vouchers for a free bottle of wine. WE found the casino comfortable - not as big as most of the casino's on the strip. My husband won and I spent his winnings - (he ended up winning about $150.00. We used the shuttle bus several times and did not have to wait more than 10 minutes. Our favorite casino is the Barbary Coast from previous visits so being dropped off there was an added bonus. We will definitely be staying at the Orleans in the future!

Reviews.Title: “I love the Orleans Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Orleans hotel and casino from Dec. 19th to Dec. 23rd. Received a great rate on Travelocity for $19 per night. This is the 3rd time that we have stayed there and we are never disappointed. The rooms are well maintained and are very clean. All that space which included 2 queen beds a sitting area with a nice chair and sofa, a separate bathroom with a bathtub and a small window that looked out into the pool area. There are several dining experiences to choose from, the cafe has wonderful specials for $0.99 to $2.99 from midnight to about 7am. The Monday night seafood buffet was great! There is a 18 movie theater complex upstairs and a nice bowling alley that offers $1.00 games after midnight. The only complaint that i have is that some of the pit bosses could be a little nicer and it is incontinent that the pool area closes at 5pm. Other than that we had a wonderful stay and can't wait to go back in 2005.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: dslovesvegas
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Orleans during Thanksgiving week for a four night stay. I got an internet deal for $20 per night. Well let me just say "What a deal!" Everything you have read about this hotel is true. The rooms are very large. Nice sized bathrooms and a nice sitting area with a love seat and armchair. I have noticed on this website that some people have complained about the mattresses. I will agree that the mattress is not really a mattress per se. It is more of a three/four inch thick foam covering over a box spring. Very strange. However, it did not bother me as I had feared it might. I will say that if you are someone who is particular about their mattress, you might have problems with their "bedding." Also, after you get to your room, you might want to call Housekeeping and have some extra pillows delivered as their pillows are not very thick. Speaking of Housekeeping, anytime I needed anything at all such as extra pillows, towels, etc., they were always very quick to arrive. Within five minutes. Also, the room was cleaned thoroughly everyday. In a city where one hotel can have 2000-3000 rooms, I know from previous experiences in Las Vegas that housekeeping can be very spotty, but they kept my room immaculate. Kudos to the Housekeeping Department. As for the casino itself, I did not find it to be smokey at all, as compared to other casinos. The casino is a nice size and very easy to maneuver through. I did not use the self-parking. In fact, I did have a rental car and found the valet parking to be most convenient. In fact, if you valet park, you have a very short walk (as compared to most other mega-casinos) to the guest room elevators. I did not eat in any of the restaurants at the hotel, so I cannot comment on them. The cocktail waitresses, however, were very attentive whether you were playing a penny slot machine or a five dollar slot machine. Also, the front desk staff were very friendly and check-in was very quick. As for the gambling, I did O.K. here. Won some and lost some. However, I hate their slot club. You only receive points for winning not for how much money you put into the machine. So needless to say, I did not spend a lot of money on the slots here. Hopefully they will address this issue, but don't count on it. As you have probably read in previous reviews, the hotel is not located near the strip. One to two miles away. They do have a free shuttle to the Strip, but I did not use it as I had a rental car. I have been to Las Vegas before and had never rented a car until this stay. Let me just say this, if you will be staying off of the strip or even in downtown, it is well worth it to rent a car. I had no trouble with the traffic and found having the car allowed me the freedom to explore other aspects of Las Vegas other than the strip. I was able to rent a mid-size car from Dollar for $17 a day. Think of it this way, if you take a taxi twice in one day, you will spend more on the taxi, depending on where you go, than what it would cost to rent the car for the day. Also, when you rent a car, just use the valet parking at the hotels. It's free, save for the one to two dollar tip when you retrieve your car. Of course, if you are only going to be staying on the Strip or just in downtown, then it would not be cost effective to rent a car unless you plan to do some sightseeing. So I guess the final analysis is this, would I stay at the Orleans Hotel again? You bet. Even if I had to pay 80-90 dollars per night, it is well worth it. Great hotel, great staff and great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “1/8 the price of the MGM, yet bigger room and just as nice!”
Reviews.Author: fredandkell
Reviews.Content: I was so pleasantly surprised by the Orleans. Got a $19/night internet special. Check-in line was long, but moved quickly. Asked for a high floor and got the 20th floor. The 20th and 21st floor have key-only acess on the elevator and rooms are bigger with higher ceilings, so try to get up there if you can. Hubby and I had massages in their spa - very reasonably priced and a first-class facility. Wonderful locker rooms and jacuzzi and sauna. The casino was fun. It's a low-limit player's paradise (but does one really need $.50 roulette?). $3 blackjack and craps and very patient dealers who explained a lot about the games' rules. Loosest Wheel of Fortune I have ever seen. Around 8:00 pm we were eating at the Japanese restaurant beside the $.25 machines, and we saw peope winning over and over. One lady won $1,000 right in front of us. We probably won about $50 or so and got to spin the wheel a lot! Great drinks service, and I didn't find it that smoky. The smokiest casino we encountered was the MGM (stayed there last visit for $160/night, ouch). The MGM is a great casino, full of excitement, but has high-limit tables and lots of smoke. Anyway, back to the Orleans.... The food was OK. Ate at Terrible Mike's a couple of times for convenience sake....they had good burgers and fries. Ate at the buffet for breakfast....it was OK, you get what you pay for at $5.99/pop. Eat at the Bellagio for breakfast; we did one morning and it was wonderful for $13.99/person. The shuttle was OK. It only runs 9:30 am to midnight, which is a disadvantage to early birds and night owls, so we took a cab about 1/2 the time ($10 with tip to/from strip, $14 with tip to/from airport). It does drop you off in a great spot right across from the Bellagio. Overall we loved the Orleans and would stay there again. It caters mostly to families and older people (we are in our 20s and 30s), so if you're the party type, you probably won't like it, but personally we loved the laid-back feel, the quiet rooms, and the great prices! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: blb421
Reviews.Content: we just got back from our stay at the orleans hotel dec.15-18. it was really great. it is my second stay there. we got a non-smoking room in the new tower. as soon as you get off the elevator you can smell the new smell. the room was just like the older ones, only newer. i really liked the shower, the pressure was perfect. housekeeping did a super job every day. on wed. and thurs. it was pretty slow there and the cocktail waitress' were everywhere. even before the first drink was gone they were back asking if you wanted another. we ate breakfast at the buffet there twice and it was good. we went to red rock canyon and that was very pretty. ate at magnolias in the 4 queens downtown and that was good as well. the non smoking section was its own room so that was nice. one funny thing was, we are used to seeing deer on the side of the road, but on the way back from red rock canyon we saw donkeys. there are even signs on the road to warn of donkeys crossing the road. we did go see the show "jubilee" at balleys. it was your typical las vegas show, kind of cheesy, but that is to be expected. it was fun to see tho. all in all we had a great time, and again we loved the orleans hotel. being off the strip was not a problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved it!!! The large room was beautifully decorated and had a lovely feel about it. Houskeeping were spot on with everything. Others have complained about the distance from the carpark to the hotel but we didnt have a problem. We had a hire car so getting to the strip was easy peasy. Would have no hesitation staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Orleans just before Thanksgiving. We found an Internet rate of $20.00 a night and just had to check it out. The place is amazing for the price. Super clean, quiet, the friendliest employees and best service I think we've ever had. We asked for a non-smoking floor with a view of the strip away from the elevators. No problem! The coupon book was excellent. We actually used it. A nice plus was being able to see Bill Medlley of the Righteous Brothers the night we arrived. He was performing at the showroom in the Orleans that night. It was his last performance ever. Excellent show! Very emotional. It was one of the highlights of the trip. I'm not a gambler, but my husband is. He did very well at blackjack. In fact he did well enough to pay for our entire trip with a little left over when we got home. We even got a complimentary meal at the Prime Rib Loft in the hotel. Very exciting! We went over to the Strip several times while we were there. There is a shuttle that leaves the hotel every 30 minutes or so. It goes to the Barbary Coast which is right in the middle of the Strip. It was not that inconvenient being off the Strip, especially for the price we paid. We are planning another trip to the Orleans after Christmas. Our entire family is going. There will be 9 of us. Look out Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans delivers once again !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife checked in for a stay November 21st thru the 24th over my birthday. First of all, I guess I should mention that I got the rooms for $19.50 per night. "Wow, what a deal !" With that being said, everything was perfect, from the room to the casino. We always rent a car, so visiting the strip properties is not a hassle either. For anyone considering the Orleans, I would definitley reccomend. You can't beat the service, price and always attentive staff. I also wanted to mention that I have read a lot about the excessive smoke in and around the casino. When we were there, I didn't even notice a problem. Anyhow, if you're going to vegas, "Go Orleans" !!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Value In Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Las Vegas the weekend before Thanksgiving and thought we would try a hotel off-strip. Our first surprise was arriving in Las Vegas to find that it was 60 degrees with threats of snow flurries. Who says that Vegas is warm year round? After a 10 minutes/$20 taxi ride from the airport we were surprised to size the size and glamor of the Orleans as we arrived at the hotel. Check in-in was fast and friendly. Of course we needed to navigate through part of the casino to get to the room. We requested a standard room with a king bed and were assigned to the 21st floor. We were surprised at the size and comfort of the Jr. suite we were assigned. We later discovered that all rooms are over-sized, Jr. suites. The room was very clean and nicely decorated with a view of the city and the mountains in the distance. (I found out that the mountains were 30 minutes from the strip and had several ski resorts that just opened for the season). We were mazed at the quiet in the hallways. I was glad to see that high-speed Internet access was available for $9.95 per 24 hours. We took a quick tour of the hotel and found a a number of restaurants, a spa, bowling alley, movie theater and sports arena in addition to the casino. During our two day stay we ate at Big Alls Oyster Bar, Sazio, The Prime Rib Loft and the Courtyard Café and found the food to be very good and reasonably priced. We played the slots and found them to be generous. The cocktail waitress seemed to be around every 10 minutes. Although the Orleans is only a few miles from the strip it's a bit too far to walk. A shuttle is provided but seems to run very infrequently. We choose to use a taxi which cost $10 with tip. I suggest you help support the taxi drivers instead of waiting for the shuttle. Overall we were very pleased with the Orleans and will be back. We will recommend to our friends as the best value in Las Vegas. Bill Johnson Linda Johnson

Reviews.Title: “nice time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans Hotel & Casino from the 15th of November thru the 19th. We were first givin a room next to the elevators and the constant bing-bong was very irritating,we requested a different room on the same wing ( newly opened)and floor, which was cheerfully done. The food was above average in the several places we ate in the hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only negative (minor) was on the morning we left we went to the cafe (5:00am) and ordered the graveyard special--steak & eggs. The service was quick but the steak was terrible.It must have been some kind of very low grade steak. All in all I would recommend staying at the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Reall Good!!”
Reviews.Author: jungle
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Orleans...Had a great time...check-in was great, friendly people.one view of the bar-girls made the whole trip worthwhile....the room was wonderful, very large with a sofa, desk, nice size bath...stayed in 1209 with a great view of the strip...very easy ride on a shuttle to the strip...buffet lunch was very good for 6.99...slots were much better than the strip...security very good, have to show room key to access elevators......very clean facilities...they give a 2 night free stay coupon on check-out.

Reviews.Title: “You have got to be kidding!”
Reviews.Author: italianchick163
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orleans last year, and the value really was not bad, but my room was not clean and it just wasn't what I was used too. It does not deserve a 4 or 5 rating, compared to other hotels, if you ask me. The bathroom needed revamped, it was old. The room itself was not perfectly clean, but OK. It did need an update though. Bulbs were burned out. Our room was next to the pool, which when I was there was open 24 hours, so there were people screaming (kids) at 2 AM, with no supervision or security telling them to leave. I also ate at the Buffet, which was not that bad, but there are better ones...esp. down at the Golden Nugget where I was surprised was excellent. Only stay if your on a budget...you won't get the true vegas experience if you don't stay on the strip or downtown.

Reviews.Title: “I'm A Believer!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Orleans 11/19-11/21. It was great. The satff was very friendly and courteous. We arrived in the city at 9:30 am and the room was ready! We were allowed to check in immediately, no waiting around until three o'clock. The room was about one hundred square feet larger than the average hotel room. It was immaculate and well maintained. We loved the coupon book. The bar allows you to get top shelf liquor with the coupon from the book. Being removed from the strip was great. No undo hustle and no fighting traffic forever just to return to your hotel. When we checked out the hotel gave us a voucher for two free nights during our next stay! We will be returning in February and getting a suite at the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Orlean's is the Best!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the orlean's two and three times a year and it always amazes me that each time i stay it is better then the last time. The people that work there are very helpful and really go out of there way to help you with what ever your problem might be. The rooms are really new clean and beautiful, and i can say that i have made a lot of really good friends over the years and look forward to visiting again and again. The food is the best in town and that goes for any resturant you eat at and they have anything that you could think of. The orlean's is my first choice every time!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We love the Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: marriedinhawaii-7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved staying at the Orleans last month! We were in Las Vegas for a family reunion and enjoyed the hotel very much. The room was quiet and comfortable, the exercise room was great, and the buffet was enjoyable. We appreciated the fun book and used some of the coupons. We visited the Strip and enjoyed returning to the relaxed atmosphere or the Orleans. The Orleans offers a variety of activities and restaurants. The employees were very helpful and friendly. We will stay at the Orleans again!

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a very memorable stay at the Orleans. It was a couple of years ago, but I found the accomidations a little larger than an average room. They were, however, having trouble with the hot tub, with a promise of a quick fix. The pool area was very nice, with cabanas, and a bar area. It even had live nightime entertainment poolside. Inside, a beautiful mardi gras theme, with good coffee shops, food court, and from what the locals say to be one of the best buffets in town.I received a pretty nice coupon book upon check-in, which I did use to get a couple of nice souvineers to take home. There were free buses to take you to sister casinos, which you could walk to many other casinos. There was a full theater, arcade for the kiddies, day-care, and a full size bowling alley. What else could you want? Gambling All the good stuff, and my favorate slot Haywire, a hard one to find, but they had it.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Again !”
Reviews.Author: wolfdnce
Reviews.Content: After researching hotels and reading reviews, we decided on The Orleans for our first visit, as we weren't sure about staying on the strip. We were NOT disappointed in the least. Check in was fast with a very pleasant desk clerk. We had been assigned a room on the seventh floor, I asked for a room higher up and was given a room with a great view of the strip. Not only did she accomodate us but my sister in law and her hubby as well who were arriving later. Gave then a roon right across from us. Room was spacious as advertised and clean. Loved the window in the shower, looked right across to the Palms and Rio. We arrived at around 2:30 and were able to check in and go right up to our room. Any and all employees were polite, cheerful and helpful. We took advantage of the Fun Books provided and ate most of our meals at the various eateries located within The Orleans. All of our meals were plentiful in quantity and delicious. Tried the buffet and were pleasantly surprised at the variety. Had coupons in Funbooks for drinks at all bars as well as other properties, Barbary Coast and Gold Coast. The drinks at The Orleans were reasonable anyway, $2.50 for a mixed drink. Now that ain't bad !! Casino was not at all smokey, and easy to navigate. Gambling on the Strip I lost 99% of the time. Did well at The Orleans, infact the last night we were there I hit on a nickel machine big time and won all of my money back ! Shuttles took us to the strip and the Gold Coast which are free. Nice not to have to fight traffic. All in all we were really happy in choosing The Orleans, away from the noise, yet easy to get to the Strip. We will probably be going back to LV next year to see the things we missed and we will be staying at The Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon/Wedding in Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: vivalasvegas11-7
Reviews.Content: Well, after arriving at the Orleans(via the valet, it is worth the couple of bucks you tip) I was impressed with the funky atmosphere and how large and clean the rooms were. We even had a window that opened off the shower. Very cool!! We had a party of 15 stay there during our wedding trip and everyone seemed to have had a good time. The Big Al's Oyster restaraunt was very disappointing...I was expecting great Cajun food and it tasted more like bad Chinese. Vey icky. The Mexican restaurant was great! Loved the salsa! The breakfasts were good at the Cafe and the buffet. Very yummy and reasonable. I did have a few issues with the staff initialing not being very helpful during the planning stages of our wedding, but once we got there it was fine. The bartenders are VERY slow at all the casino bars, so order two right away!! The drinks were also very week. We also found that if you need to use an ATM, there is a ATM machine a 1/2 block away that only charges 2 dollars; the casino-hotel ones cost from $9-$35, PLUS a percentage of what you take out. Big rip off! The Rite Aid on Rainbow also has disposable cameras for $9 versus $20 every where else we went(mini marts, etc..). The coupon book they give you on check in is very nice and we used that a lot. Don't plan on bringing any children near you or the casino. My 12 year old son could not even stand by me in the Irish pub after our wedding ceremony. Just an added tip for all parents that are thinking your kids can hang out with you whereeer you are. They CAN'T. They can in the bowling alley and the kiddie area. That's it. A shuttle will take you to the Suncoast and Barbary Coast casinos for free. They leave every 20 minutes. I highly recommend a restaraunt called Hush Puppy (located about 2 miles from Orleans; (off of Rainbow and West Chester?)) and the Fritz at the Fitzgerald Casino downtown. Loved both very much! Best food we had in the whole week we were there! We are planning on coming back to vegas in 5 years and will definitely stay there again. Loved it!! Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “The Worst”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spits in door. Bathroom, walls and carpet absolutely dirty... Bad service. They don´t really care about your complains or your experiences.

Reviews.Title: “As good as the reviews except.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a three night stay, two of them booked through the Mardi Gras package. Great deal....two free dinner buffets and two free breakfast buffets included. Can honestly say that the hotel itself is very nice for the price, several restaurants, fairly large, easy access to the strip via the shuttle. Everything we've read about the Orleans came true. I must, however, be honest about the cons. The pool really is only open from noon until 5pm. And yes, this includes the hot tub. What a shame. It was almost 70 degrees and sunny the whole time we were there, but the hotel blocks the sun from the pool area and makes it feel like 50. I went down at noon one day and there wasn't a soul around...I don't blame them. The hotel reservation system only allows you to "request" a type of room, and they state loud and clear once you arrive that room types are just that...not a guarantee. Thank god it wasn't busy because our smoking king room with a view turned into a nonsmoking double room without. We ended up having to cart our luggage all the way back down to front desk and wait in line again to get a new room. They actually have it programmed into their answering service to select "2" if you'd like to request a room change. Must be a common occurance. If you're not picky and don't mind the average service and food you'll be okay. But if you're looking for a better experience there are other places to try. We stayed at the Golden Nugget in January and trust me...the four star rating really does make a difference, and the price is almost the same. In all fairness to the Orleans I will conclude that it is a great deal but you really do get what you pay for. That and the waitresses wear basically nothing. Literally. If I were a guy I would have been in heaven. And I won $1800 on a dollar slot on my second day. So I'll stop complaining now.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2004 after I read all the great reviews here on tripadvisor.com... And I am happy to say it was great! Pros: CLEAN and NEW!, CHEEEEP!, rooms are really cute and well designed, no old smoke smell, free shuttle to strip but still far enough away from strip to relax a little when you feel like it. Cons: Food at the hotel is just okay, casino is small if that's important to you, definitely too far to walk to strip. Next time we go to Vegas I'll be staying here. Unless I could afford the Bellagio.... Seriously though this is a great place. You know how after a few days in Vegas you get a little sick of the strip? This is the perfect compromise: you can have fun on the strip and then say bye! at the end of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another happy Orleans customer”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans 10/31 - 11/4/04 using the Mardi Gras package. Everything was very nice. The room was clean and beds comfortable. Food at the buffet - we used the coupons included in the package - was not as fantastic as can be found elsewhere, but was good and variety was acceptable. The staff was uniformly helpful and attentive. The slot machines were kind, especially the video poker. One oddity we found was that careful observation of the pay tables is necessary, especially on multi-denomination machines. The pay table on nickel-dime-quarter deuces wild machines, for example, is less generous on nickel and dime play that it is on quarter play. A particularly nice point was that upon checkout a run on the buffet we charged to our room was, without asking, waived. For that and many other reasons we will definitely stay there again next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we came !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked online and came for a few days. Just as expected, everything was good and the ' dine around ' restaurants value for money. Can't praise the staff too much. After we had checked out , we found we had left all cash,credit cards and travellers cheques in the room. Housekeeper Linda organised delivery back to us prior to leaving Boston Ma. for UK. Fantastic service can't praise her enough. Anyway, room spacious,clean & tidy and our stay was thoroughly pleasant. Shuttle to & from The Strip well organised. Can recommend it all.

Reviews.Title: “plesantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Bendaire
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orleans 11/03. I was plesantly suprised by the spacious room. It had 2 double beds and a very large bathroom with his and her sinks. Security was very nice had to display a room key to get to the elevators. The spa was very nice. A very nice birthday present to myself although I didn't win on the slots. They came around for cocktails more than I could handle. Very enjoyable and highly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Las Vegas. The hotel is great. Spacious and clean rooms, very friendly staff on check-in. We loved it and will definitly return to the hotel. At the moment there is some construction work in the hotel. But normaly you will not be disturbed from that. The only thing I missed was a Let it ride table in the casino :-)

Reviews.Title: “A solid 'B+' overall; A solid 'A+' for value”
Reviews.Author: DavidScott
Reviews.Content: The opinions you have read here are pretty much right on. The Orleans is a great value, but the casino is smokey.
