The staff is not the least bit snooty, the food is good, the spa is very nice, (but sex segregated), and yes, the bowling alleys are fun. I stayed in the new wing and the layout was fine, and the bathroom with marble sink with a real showerhead that actually gives a good shower was very nice, but the air conditioning blower unit seemed to have only two settings, off and hi! I just turned it off at night so as not to be disturbed by the noise. The Bellagio, it's not.....but that's not necessarily bad! With all the money you save from staying there, you can rent a car, (always use the valet parking service, those guys and gals are great).....and not only will you be able to get over to the Strip any time you want, you can drive out to Red Rock Canyon one morning or up to Boulder Dam, and see some wonders other than those on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Much to do, cold pool.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Orleans has more activities than any other hotel we've ever stayed at in Las Vegas. We stayed there while doing a trade show as well as seeing our son get married. If you don't like crowds and a lot of walking, it's a great place to stay. You never have to leave the hotel to see numerous movie theaters, many first rate restaurants with affordable prices, a bowling alley upstairs, a spa with a private jacuzzi (great spa), and every type of gambling machine and game you can imagine. On the down side, the pool is not heated and it's only open from 9:00 - 5:00. This was extremely disappointing, as during the days we were there, we couldn't take advantage of the pool or the large tropical jacuzzi, as we were working during the day. My husband and I were so looking forward to soaking in the jacuzzi after a long day at the convention center. Our room was very clean and nice. However, it faced the new tower and every morning very early, we heard trucks backing up with that loud back up horn noise they make. So, if you get a room that doesn't face construction and don't mind a colder pool, this hotel is otherwise great. I won't stay again as I love swimming and the pool is not heated nor available early a.m. or p.m. A shame and a waste...it looked so inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Orleans”
Reviews.Author: texas twostepper
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 4 nights (Oct.17-21) at the Orleans Hotel & Casino (my 1st stay here) and had a wonderful time. The casino was easy to find your way around, but still large enough to not feel crowded. Check-in was very prompt and no hassle.I had a rent car and it was very easy to get in and out of - valets were great, very prompt with the car and polite. Movie theatre was great as were the restaurants I ate in. I enjoyed the coffe bar at the front of the casino. Felt very comfortable in the hotel, like I was returning home after a day out and about Las Vegas. I will DEFINITELY stay at the ORLEANS on my next trip to Vegas. I have stayed at other, fancier hotels on the Strip (Bellagio, Mandalay Bay) and I much prefer the less crowded Orleans with their friendly employees.

Reviews.Title: “Nice October visit”
Reviews.Author: arhieatt
Reviews.Content: Arrived at The Orleans and immediately was waited on by Valet. Registration was extremely quick. The one and only bad thing we noticed was that the casino was extremely warm. Unsure if the airconditioner was not working correctly, but it was never cool compared to the other casinos we visited, therefore, the smoke lingered just a little. The mountain view we had was nice. Clean rooms and nice bed. Nothing extravagant. The fun book would have been more helpful if we had stayed longer, we could have used more coupons. The 30 minute wait for the shuttle over to the strip was nice. It helped since parking was at a premium as we found out on the second day we visited the strip. The slots that my wife played were extremely loose. She probably won $200 during the 2 days we were there and the blackjack was giving as well as I too won around $150. The buffet was not much to talk about. No better or worse than any other buffet in any other city. Finally, check-out was just as easy. For the price we paid (avg. $85), I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans -Nice Staff and Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: More Pros than Cons! -Very nice staff throughout the hotel, restaurants and casino. -Rooms are very clean....and very basic, nothing fancy.. Did not like the decor and the mattress was terrible! Got stuck with 2 Queen Beds, requested a king. ***Did have an excellent view room of the strip. Best view we have ever had. We always stay on the strip and we have never had a view this awesome! We have never stayed off the strip before. Room was serviced quickly. It was always cleaned we we returned from breakfast each morning. Can not stress enough how nice the staff was! Great breakfast food in the 24 hour restaurant and good prices. Good payouts on Video Poker! We play a lot of video poker. Best payouts, had a great time in the casino. Drinks were good and had a constant waitress every night in the casino, very nice and kept checking with us on our need of more drinks. We will return! The place had a great atmosphere. I will make sure I have a newer room since they have added on a new tower opening next month. Our room was a basic clean room, bad bed but really for the price its a great value at the Orleans! We always rent a car and this is the first time we didn't. The shuttle runs to the strip every 30 min, and to the Gold Coast every 15 min till midnight. We were able to do this every day to get to the strip . One night we took the shuttle to the Gold Coast when we ate dinner at the Palms across the street.l.. The Shuttle is very nice! This really did work oiut well and we saved money, its free!

Reviews.Title: “The truth about the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Gale63
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to Vegas on Oct. 11th. I had done a lot of research before I chose a place to stay and I kept coming back to info and reviews of the Orleans so we decided to try it. First of all you can not beat the price. The rooms are large, a little bit worn, but very clean. I had no complaints with the rooms. We enjoyed all of the meals we had at the hotel, especially the breakfast buffet! It was also convenient having a theater and bowling ally. We did not find staying off the strip to be much of a problem. We had rented a car, so we would just drive down one of the side roads going to the strip and park. A lot of my friends said it was a better to stay on the strip, but I think getting around would be even worse without a car. We found transportation on the strip inconvenient. The monorail did not work and we never could find a trolly. Bus lines were long. We tried the hotel bus once, but found out you spend a lot of time waiting. Now the downside of the Orleans. For us the biggest issue was the smoke in the casino. It was absolutely horrible and we found our hotel to be worse than others. Other places seem to have better ventilation. Also, we were really disappointed that the pool closed at 5:00p.m. each day. We really wanted to enjoy the hot tub. On the last night we discovered that the spa has an indoor jacuzzi and you can use you coupon for one visit. The only thing was my husband and I could not go together because it had separate facilities. The spa is really nice and I wished I had used it more. We really liked the Orleans because it was not so huge and easy to get around. I don't know if we will stay again because of the smoke.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans is the Best!”
Reviews.Author: missriceandbeans
Reviews.Content: Knowing that we would be passing thru Las Vegas on our huge move from San Diego to Maine, we decided that we would spend the night and planned accordingly before departing from San Deigo. We choose the Oreleans after reading many great reviews here on Trip Advisor. When we arrived I was a little concerned that it was off "the Strip", but I quickly realized that this was a plus not a minus! First off the Orleans is just the kind of place you would want for your first Las Vegas experiance. My sister had never been to Vegas before and as we entered the ORleans she was instantly excited! We got a VERY resonable rate for 3 people from the casino's website before arriving. Then upon checking in, we were instantly (without asking) upgraded to a HUGE suite! That was it , we were sold. We are not huge gamblers, so I can't really comment on the Casino itself, other than we had a lot of fun there. The free shuttle takes you to the strip all day and until a good hour at night, so you don't feel like you're missing out on the Las Vegas experiance. Do note that if you are into the clubbing party scene you might want to stay somewhere else, the Orleans is more for the older and laid back crowd. I would definately stay at the Orleans again. Check it out!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked 4 nights for $15 per night. What can you expect for this kind of rate. Well I was pleasantly surprised. Excellent service at the check in desk, good security, large room, friendly staff and a very beautiful pool. last year I stayed at the Tropicana and other than the location everything else is better in the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: ghostgal
Reviews.Content: Went to Las Vegas to get married on October 10th, and chose The Orleans hotel & casino after reading the Trip Advisor reviews! Got a great deal, and the room was clean and quite nice. Took a late flight from Portland, Oregon on Alaska Airlines, but was an hour late due to some security check in Mexico or something, but finally got to LV around 2:30 in the morning. Upon arrival at The Orleans, tried the 20$ trick at check in, but she apologized saying that they were swamped during the time we were there, and that the best she could do was upgrade us to a suite but we'd have to pay (like 200$ or something) which we declined. I still offered to give her the money, but she smiled and passed it back to me saying she wouldn't feel right taking it since she couldn't do anything for us. They give you a coupon book and we got our little casino comp cards- the coupon book was pretty cool! You got free drinks in their bars, and % off things you buy in their gift shop. Plus, during the week, the casino was handing out free buffet coupons for the French Market Buffet. Nickel slots were pretty loose- we didn't WIN alot, but we were able to play for looooong periods of time. Saw quite a few people winning some big jackpots, especially on Monday night, which was fun. We enjoyed the nickel slots- as a newly married couple we could find 2 slots and sit next to each other, having a drink and playing for hours at a time on 20$ each. Not a bad form of entertainment. :) Played a little BJ, but I didn't have a good table- and I didn't enjoy either one of the dealers we had. However, my 20$ lasted for 2 hours playing BJ and when I left the table, I still had 10$ so I did okay. Waitresses comping you cocktails while you were playing were very attentive and friendly. Ate at the Courtyard Cafe at the Orleans which was pretty good. Seafood Buffet on Monday night at the French Market Buffet was actually a heckuva lot better! Plus, we had gotten comped for free so that made it even tastier! That night, we also used our coupon-book to get a FREE bottle of wine. We went to the strip for one whole day, and I took 100$ spending money with us. We ate at the Aladdin's Spice Market Buffet- now THAT was really good. Spent almost more than half of the money we brought for that day gambling at Paris, Aladdin, and The Mirage. Didn't too bad at the Mirage, but had to wait to go back to The Orleans to win it all back! Recommend The Orleans to anyone! Great place to play & stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Oct 10-15, 2004”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 4th visit to Vegas, first time staying off strip. We enjoyed the Orleans. We preferred the laid back atmosphere. We found it to be much less crowded and much easier to get around than most of the huge hotels. We stayed at the Mirage last visit and it seemed like it took forever to get from your room to anywhere else. No line for check in. We ate at the breakfast buffet each morning for 5.99 each. That price includes your beverages as well. Not fancy, but many choices and served us well. We did try the evening buffet once and did not like it as well. We did rent a car and I think that is a must. I never really feel comfortable without my own wheels. We did try the free shuttle once and I would not recommend it. I also did try the strip bus one afternoon to get from mid-strip back to the south end and I would not recommend that either. I waited 35 minutes for the bus and I was one of the lucky dozen or so that made it on. All the rest were told to wait for the next bus. Others standing in line said they had waited 40 minutes for the bus the day before. The new monorail is still broken but I would still think you would be doing a lot of walking just to get to and from the monorail stations. I would recommend the Orleans as easy to get around, great value, clean, safe, tons of slots and low table minimums. Great valet service as well. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Review 10/7/04-10/10/04”
Reviews.Author: travelstovegas
Reviews.Content: Hi! I took my third trip to Vegas for a birthday celebration with my mom & sister. It was their first trip, and we celebrated my mom's 50th, my sister's 25th, and my 29th. We surprised our mom with the tickets and had a fantastic time! Since I got some useful info from the forums here, I thought I'd add my own two cents and hopefully help someone else out. First, we stayed at the Orleans. After reading multiple positive reviews and not being too concerned with staying off strip, I thought it was a great bargain. Since I found an internet rate lower than the rate I was quoted by the Orleans, they matched the lower rate minus an additional 5% (it pays to research!). The room was great! We had a nice view of the hotel pool, and the room elevators were not miles away from the casino entrance. There was a sitting area, a desk and comfortable beds. Also, security checks your hotel key card before they allow you into the elevators, so that did allow for a little extra peace of mind. There was some construction at the opposite end of our floor, but we were never bothered by it. The maid service was reliable and at our request, provided extra free postcards. The coupon book they give you is really good - lots of free perks/upgrades, etc. I would say that the only issue we had with the hotel at all was related to the shuttle. We regularly used the free shuttle from the Orleans to the Barbary Coast (on the strip) and back again. We didn't have trouble with the wait, although sometimes there was a lot of traffic and the shuttle was delayed longer than usual, but it would be the same with a rental car or cab. Our problem was that when people lined up for the shuttle, they would line up at both ends, making a true line impossible. Plus, when the shuttle pulled up to let people off and pick more up, whoever happened to be closest to the doors got on, regardless of who was waiting longest. We got lucky in that we always managed to get onto the shuttle, but I would have been very upset if there wasn't room for the three of us but others who had waited less time got on without a problem. I think this could be solved with a posted sign saying "shuttle line begins here", and making the shuttle pull as close as possible to the front of the line every time. I did write this suggestion on the hotel card. Otherwise, no problems at all with the hotel, and I would definitely stay here again. Next time, I'll try to take advantage of the spa options and check out the pool area! We did see the Cirque du Soleil show "O" at the Bellagio (my favorite hotel), and it was fantastic! If you've never seen one of their shows before, there's really no way to explain it other than a weird, somewhat psychedelic dream sensation, but as always, it's extremely visual. "O" was all about water and the stage was amazing. We purchased the 'cheapest' (still expensive!) tickets and were seated in what the theatre considers a limited view section. This was because there was a railing within our sight, but it was easy to ignore, in my opinion, and it certainly did not keep us from enjoying the show. Plus, being a bit higher up allowed us to really see formations in the water that we might have missed being down low. My favorite part was the section with all the crazy diving....wow! We managed to go to quite a few hotels to see the sights - Siren Battle @ TI, Volcano & white tigers @ Mirage, rainstorm @ Aladdin, fountains @ Bellagio (our favorite!), watched the lions & got our pictures taken with 5 week old lion cubs @ MGM (!!), all three of us rode the Big Shot @ Stratosphere (my 2nd time), saw Mandalay Bay, Luxor, Excalibur, Tropicana, NYNY, Ceasars Palace, Bellagio, Paris, Hard Rock (got to unexpectedly see Blink 182 unveil their display of instruments and get their autographs, wow!), looked inside the Hofbrau House/Beer Garden, went to Freemont St & saw the light show as well as a free concert by Eddie Money (mom wanted to see him!)......too much to name! Although the monorail wasn't working (bummer), we manged to drag ourselves all over the place. Definitely wear good shoes! As far as eating is concerned, my favorite breakfast buffet is Le Village Buffet @ Paris. The food is so fantastic that I actually dream about it! Fresh crepes, tons of fruit, good service, delicious cheeses...Yum! You MUST get here early on weekends especially if you expect to eat breakfast. Lunch starts at 11am and if you are not in line by 930, you might be out of luck. We also had a very nice late lunch at Olives @ the Bellagio. You can sit outside and watch the fountains or sit inside in a cozy atmosphere. Service was of course excellent and you definitely feel pampered. Since we are not huge gamblers, we did splurge more on dining and shopping, which was fine by us. To wrap up, go see Vegas and try to see & do as much as you can. There is no place in the world like it. My mom & sister are now hooked and we may make a multi-birthday trip a yearly event. Definitely take advantage of coupon books & magazines in the cabs or your hotel room. Hard Rock had a free $5 play if you sign up for their players card, which is neat by itself since it prints your name on it and makes a good souvenir. We wimped out and played slots instead of upping a blackjack bet, but we each ended up making about $10, which was free money, which we used to buy a Starbucks coffee there since they had a coupon for a larger size drink upgrade! So, free huge coffee, free shuttle ride from the strip to the Hard Rock, free five bucks, free souvenir from the gift shop, and to top it off, we lucked out and got free Blink 182 autographs! Woo-hoo! Use those coupons! Enjoy your trip, and feel free to ask questions - I feel like a Vegas diva! Jennifer

Reviews.Title: “Video poker den - I wish I had been warned!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When you stay off the strip, this is what you get. This place does not look or feel like a Vegas casino. You won't be seeing any brides here. It's really nothing more than a large, smokey, neighborhood video poker den. I've never seen so many poker machines in one building. Slot machines are of the old fashion variety, no interactive games on top (except for a few Wheel of Fortunes) There are no flashy new cars to win here. No crab legs at the buffet. No two-for-one buffet offers. No free slot pulls. No match plays. They do have a few table games and some nice restaurants, a nice bowling alley, movie theatre and arcade. Don't bother taking your quarters here, it's cash only. Not one quarter machine in the whole place. The room was very large; however the sink was clogged, the toilet bowl kept flushing by itself and the air conditioner's compressor kept banging all night, (despite attempts to change the setting). Lesson learned. Never book a room off the strip. Also stayed at Mandalay Bay and Stratoshere in the same week - now those were casinos!

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Orleans was okay for the money. My husband and I stayed from Sept. 30 - Oct. 3, 2004. We chose the hotel because of the good reviews from this site. The hotel has great curb appeal, however when you walk in the Casino the impression is lost due to the horrible smoke smell. The hotel should invest in a better filtration system like some of the hotels on the Strip. We are non-smokers so it may have bothered us more than someone who is a smoker. Check-in was easy and fast, we even asked for a room with a view of the strip and our request was granted. The coupon books that they give you help save on meals and enterainment in the hotel. We ate at the French Market Buffet for Breakfast. It was excellent especially considering the price. The rooms were large and very clean. The room service was very prompt each day. Everytime we came back from the strip our room had already been cleaned. We never had to call down to the front desk to request anything for our room. Plenty of towels, soap etc. was provided. The shuttle service was very disorganized. At The Orleans and Barbary Coast there was no seating provided nor was there anywhere for people to form a line. This caused a mad rush to board the shuttle when it did arrive leaving those who had already been waiting 30 min. to wait additional time to catch another shuttle because individuals who just walked up would hop on the shuttle first. It was very tiring fighting for a seat just to get back and fourth. The shuttles did not always stay on schedule and several times the shuttle drivers pulled up, cut the shuttle off and went into the Casino for a break. If you are looking to save money and gamble while in Vegas this would be a great hotel. However, we like to walk the strip, try different restaurants and see shows so this hotel was just too inconvenient from the strip for us. Our next stay in Vegas will not be at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: remo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans In Sept. and everything was great. The rooms , pool , bars and restaurants were fantastic! Check-in was a breeze and employees were super. Stayed in many hotels in Las Vegas,but fom now on the Orleans will be my only choice. P.S. Going back in November for Two free nights thanks to the Orlean !!

Reviews.Title: “Orleans good not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Orleans are very nice...the staff very friendly..the food exceptionally good for a lower priced buffet...the comps TERRIBLE! or should I say non existent...My wife usually gamble each 8 hours a day average..for that kind of play the Orleans gives you NOTHING...not even a meal...and the machines do pay out for squat. tight as heck...if you want good food and a nice room at a reasonable price stay at the orleans..if you want comps and fair machines stay and play someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Great for us!”
Reviews.Author: ham28
Reviews.Content: I booked The Orleans on the advice of a friend who has stayed here before for my husband's 40th birthday party. Had several friends meet us at the hotel for fun and sun. The rates were a plus for us as we cannot justify spending $200/night and not even be in the room. The other spendy hotels are truly impressive and are fun to walk through. The Orleans is huge and really had everything we needed right there. If it wasn't for our friends, we probably would have never left to see any sights! We spent most of the time by the pool and playing craps and roulette. The rollercoaster at New York, New York was very scary but fun as was the Big Shot at the top of the Stratosphere. We would rather spend our money on fun than on a room we are never in! See for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Afford a Lifeguard”
Reviews.Author: JanesvilleEd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans in September 2004. The room was clean and the food reasonable. Our biggest complaint was the pool and hot tub closed by 5PM due to a management decisions. Usually folks complain about the employees but our problem is with management. They said the lifeguard was off duty so the area had to close. That is pretty thin since they have so many low wage employees. What difference would one more make. We also disliked the bathroom design. The stool/shower area didn't have a door between it and the sink area. That causes privacy problems for a family.

Reviews.Title: “trip completed (for this year)”
Reviews.Author: 4patty
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Orleans Hotel & Casino on Sept. 13, had to wait until 3 p.m. before I was able to check in. To kill time, I visited RED ROCK CANYON; which was a real AWESOME sight. The hotel was wonderful. I only had two (2) problems: 1) while waiting for the Shuttle to the Barbary Coast, there was no place to sit inside (like a bench) to keep out of the heat/sun, or outside. and 2) I had my nephew (6 yrs old, he had to be there because he was in a wedding) there was no place for us to sit, besides the area near the Registration desk. There should be a bench here and there where one can sit and wait with a child. Other wise I had a great time and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Kids and Adults!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Orleans was fantastic. We traveled to Las Vegas on a Sunday and checked out the following Saturday. The room was large with a nice sitting area. Our 7 year old son loved the amenities. He insisted that we return from our daily outings by 5:30pm so that he could be checked in for 5 hours of supervised play at Kid's Tyme Child Care Center. My husband and I had a blast in the casino while he played his little heart out…. GREAT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and food... TOO FAR FROM ALL THE FUN”
Reviews.Author: RobbyM
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Vegas and our first visit to The Orleans. First impressions as the cab pulled up and we entered the casino: "This place is huge"... then, "This place is tacky". Check-in was fast and easy and the coupon books were full of good freebies. Our room was very nice, clean and large with a nice view of the strip. Positives: 1. Great Room! 2. Great service and nice employees. 3. Coupon book. 4. Restaurants have good food and are inexpensive. Even the dumpy and and dirty looking fast food place was good. The $1.95 graveyard special was excellent, but the coffee cost more than the meal. 5. Very nice pool and large hot tub area. 6. Very sexy outfits on cocktail waitresses. 7. Always an open table Negatives: 1. Way too far from all of the action on the strip. The closest casino (The Palms) was about a mile away. The shuttle was good, but a hassle compared to just walking from place to place as you can elsewhere. 2. Don't play blackjack here if you know what you're doing. Lots of continous shuffle and they have most of the "unfavorable" rules which give the house a larger than normal advantage. 3. The bright green gators and horrid decor made me almost embarrassed to be there. I think The Orleans would best appeal to those over 60 (much of the clientele) or those that just play slots and eat. We will definitely be staying mid-strip on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fell In Love with The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Vegas and the trip was given to us as a gift from my Brother. We stayed at the Orleans . Never was not one employee rude or unhelpful, the rooms were the cleanest, the resturants were full of anything you wanted to eat. and the shows were fantastic. Honestly you would never have to leave the hotel it has everything.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place that acts like they want you back!”
Reviews.Author: mollydog13
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 days at the Monte Carlo, 2 nights at the Flamingo and 2 nights at The Orleans-- we went this trip mainly for relaxing in the sun and lounging by the pool -- of course we did take in alot of the other Las Vegas highlights. We chose 3 different hotels mainly to compare the pools for our future trips. Each was very nice and each had its own high and low points. The Flamingo was the best concept -- lots of activity, layout was great, lots of access to the water and the landscaping won out overall -- but there was not one day that we were able to find a place to sit. Our personal belongings ended up stuffed up in the bushes (the only somewhat dry spot) and we sat on the edge of the pool. The Monte Carlo was somewhat less crowded -- spots were available to sit in a lounge chair as long as you didn't care if you were by any water, as they had a section off and behind the pool that had lots of space but no water. Their lazy river was nice although busy and crowded. The Orleans was less "tropical " and more conventional from a visual standpoint but it was so laid back and relaxed and was exactly what we had been looking for. I could lay back, read and sip a drink with out having someone step over my chair or splash water all over me. The pool was within a couple steps for cooling off. The Casino, bars, resturants, etc. really made me feel that they cared if I ever came back -- IWILL!! They have a good thing going for those of us who have out grown the "club scene" but still like to go out and have fun.

Reviews.Title: “We have a new home !!”
Reviews.Author: vkqueen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the Orleans Aug 28-31. We take a trip to Las Vegas every year, and with few exceptions, almost always stay at the Rio. We love the Rio, but at the time that we were making reservations, the rates quoted were sky high. Since we always rent a car, staying at the Orleans was not a concern. We were hesitant to book our entire stay at the Orleans because the price just seemed too good to be true, so we reserved at Mandalay Bay for the second half of our stay. We were thrilled with the Orleans, and if it wasn't for the fact that our Mandalay Bay stay was prepaid, we would have spent our whole time there. The rooms were great. Housekeeping was right on. Although we didn't win big in the casino, we didn't lose much either. We enjoyed the $5 black jack tables. We felt less intimidated in this casino than in some of the fancier places. Once we moved to Mandalay Bay, we found ourselves returning to play at the Orleans. Loved Terrible Mike's. The buffet was pretty good as well. Prime Rib Loft is ok but nothing to write home about. We enjoyed the pool area being less hectic, quieter, more relaxed than Mandalay Bay. Also loved the SHORT walk to the pool, and the fact that you didn't have to walk through the casino to get there. Maybe we're in the minority, but we also liked the fact that you could find some shade and didn't need to bake in the heat if that is a problem for you. The only suggestion that I would like to make is that the rooms should have personal safes. Even though we don't carry large sums of cash, being able to lock up your items in the convenience of your room is wonderful. We will definately return to the Orleans. It is now our new home while in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “"The Orleans is great for those on a budget!"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Orleans 9/1-9/6 based on the positive reviews from this site. We have been traveling to Vegas the past 10 years and have typically stayed on the Strip; usually The Mirage (our fav!), Monte Carlo, MGM or Treasure Island. For those on a budget, and looking to vacation in Vegas longer than a few days, The Orleans is a true gem! We stayed 6 evenings and paid a total of $350. It would have cost us at least 4x times that on the Strip - we were on a tight budget this year. For those 5-star hotel snobs out there, this will not be the place for you. However, for those of us who come to Vegas and need a room to "sleep and shower" in, you must check out The Orleans! Here are my overall thoughts: Check-in/Maid Service - TERRIFIC! Room was always clean by 9am. Casino - large, but personable. Won $3k playing BJ the very first day! Pool - the other reviewer was WRONG! The sun does shine at the pool, however, it usually hits the pool around 10:30. This was GREAT because as those of us Strip visitors know, you have to get in line almost a 1/2hr before most pools open to get a decent seat and, if you happen to hit the pool late, you NEVER find a seat. The pool is not as spectacular as the Mirage or Monte Carlo, BUT I was always able to find a chair without having to trip over everyone to get it. Hmmmm, for the previous review, I laid out everyday for six days came home VERY tan! I guess I wrote a lot here because the pool is a very important part of our hotel decision! Rooms: Very spacious and well appointed. Again, you are not going to get the marble floors and big fluffy bath towels or AVEDA skin products, but what you do get is a huge and very clean bathroom with an area large enough to hang all your clothes! Remember, the room, on average, is $70/night, not $250 like the Bellagio! Restaurants: Ok, here is where you might want to go elsewhere. The restaurants are just mediocore - the only downside to staying at The Orleans. I suggest visiting some of the restaurants at Bellagio or Mirage, i.e. Prime, Kokomos, etc. One positive about The Prime Rib Loft here; the prime rib is terrific and the martini's were only $2.95 - no joke and they were great! Spa - FANTASTIC! The services are moderatly priced and absolutely incredible -- you must ask for Craig - he's awesome!!! Oh yea, only $10 to use gym (free w/ spa treatment)...not $25-30 like other Strip hotels. The entire Spa is less than 2 years old and is beautiful! Sorry for the long review, but I have been waiting months to write it! Very glad I am able to write a positive one :) Again, if you are on a budget, or you just want to try a nice modern resort off the Strip, you must try this place! Have fun! PS - TIP:use the coupon books provided at check-in. Lot's of useful coupons. There are at least 4 free drink coupons - which can be used at the pool! PSS - for those who complain about the parking lots in Vegas hotels - PLEASE READ....USE VALET, IT'S FREE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Orleans lived up to its good reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas for the first time September 4-8. I went on-line several months ago to determine best place for the best price. The reviews on this site is what made me look at the Orleans. I went through Orbitz to find a good price, then the Orleans matched the price and actually gave me a lower rate for two of the days we were there. The room was as big as the other reviewers have said, and it was clean. Even the hallways were kept clean. We had a view over the pool area. The pool area was nice and had plenty of chairs for the number of people using the area. Check in and out was very quick and the registration people were very friendly and helpful. The only complaint I have was a rude waiter at the Prime Rib Loft. If we ever return to Vegas, The Orleans is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Popular Hotel??”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Aside from the price what is good about the Orleans? The rooms are nice, fairly large. The Casino is a good size. So what is bad? everything else. The location, the food, the pool area with Bimbos in thongs serving drinks in the shade.. yes SHADE -- the Hotel blocks all of the sun so the pool area is completely shaded. You are going to need a car if you stay here. It is way off the strip. Also good luck driving down Las Vegas Blvd. it will take you 30 minutes to move one block ( you can walk it in 5 minutes)

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but decor theme is sorta old.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly but the rooms have decoration that was not my style. It maybe fine for others but it made me feel as though the hotel was older than it actually is. I don't know if the new tower will be decorated differently. The closets are inside the bathrooms! The bathrooms don't have normal doors, they are more like a sliding wood panel. Not very private. Location is fairly convenient if you have a car. But the Taxi is not too costly. I don't think the shuttle runs as frequent as you want. I would not recommend the Loft for prime rib. It was disappointing. The casino waitresses were HOT in their sexy outfits!

Reviews.Title: “Always a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: murdocksgranny
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Orleans three times so far, and are getting ready for our fourth stay. We have always found the rooms clean and well maintained. The buffet is awesome for any meal, and the late night coffee shop is always a hit. We usually head over there for at least one meal even if we aren't staying there. The staff has always been polite and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms! (Apr 1 - 4, 2004)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Orleans April 1 -4, 2004 and had my parents' 50th Anniversary party there. First off, the staff, especially BJ, was terrific taking care of all the details as we set up the banquet room. I was quite pleased with the quality of the "banquet" food and the very friendly bartender. It was a perfect celebration. We chose Orleans because we knew many people would be on a limited budget. The rooms were large, clean, comfortable and affordable. Just a few months earlier, we stayed at Caesars Palace for a wedding. Our rooms at Orleans was *much* more spacious and comfortable, and significantly less expensive. For the kids, we wanted to go bowling, although each time we went, we had to wait for over 1 hour, and we decided to pass. We could never figure out the best time to go and left a bit disappointed. We did go to the movies (on-site). That was fun and convenient. I think the pool was still under construction, but it was too cold - so we didn't miss it at all. Overall - we had a great time. I don't gamble, so can't comment that. Would definitely go back and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Debi276
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 week tour of Nevada, California and Utah. I choose The Orleans because of the reviews and we were traveling with 2 children. Check in started out smoothly but only one room was ready not both. I inquired about the rooms to make sure I had what I had reserved. I was told there were not guarantees and we had 2 rooms with 2 queens. I had called prior to our stay to make sure we had the right rooms and no one told us we would not be guaranteed a king. I told them we would wait and she seemed a little irritated that she had to search for the room we requested. We waited 2 1/2 more hours and went back to recheck in. This time the girl was very nice but again only one room was ready, we deceided to take the one and wait for the other. The rooms ended up being very nice and clean. The pool was great, I would say one of the better features of the hotel, but the drinks were really weak. I was disappointed that there was not any complimentary coffee and that you had to pay to use the fitness room. They did give you a coupon book for 1 free visit to the fitness room. We went to the buffet and all of us were alittle disappointed, it looked appealing but was average at best. The smoke in the casino & main hotel was bad and this was mid week and not even crowded, the hotel could use a better filtering system. The slots didn't seem to pay off very often but we didn't stay too long because of the smoke. Overall, I probably would not choose to stay there again even though it was a reasonable price, it was just OK.

Reviews.Title: “cleaned out at the orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel 8th - 11th Aug 04. Had trouble finding where to park car and check in but when i found it I also found I'd lost all money, c cards, ID, etc etc. Just 5 dollars in my pocket to feed a family of 5. Cleaned out in vegas before I'd visited the casino! To cut a long story short i got it all back a few days later (at previous hotel in barstow but they took 4 days to find it) but in between national car rental took my car away 'cos i had no license - thanks national, unhelpful is too kind a word for you. Hotel were symapthetic to my plight but wanted coverage before they would let me eat at the house restaurants (my sister sent her c card details). Hotel v good, rooms excellent, restaurants not bad, casino friendly. Shuttle to the strip worked well and kids enjoyed the pool but the lack of a 'deep end' for jumping/diving was a minus. Definitely recommended but get a pool facing room as they are building a new block on the other side.

Reviews.Title: “We moved around and loved it all!!”
Reviews.Author: vjfelton
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent 2 nights at the Orleans (Sat. and Sun.) and were very pleased with the price and the room!!! We weren't by the construction, we were next to top floor, little window in bathroom really is neat!!! The fun book they gave out was useful, not filled with just junk coupons. The slots were tighter than anyother casino we visited, and I think we visited them all! Liked the fact that they had security by the elevators at night. We had a rental car, but took their shuttle anyhow, very convenient. Best gourmet meal I have ever eaten anywhere was at Hugo's Cellar in the 4 Queen's casino on Fremont. You would not expect such fine dining hidden away--fantastic!!!!! Don't be thrown by the outside look of the casino, Hugo's Cellar is amazing!! Loved the roses they give the women and the individual salad preparer was the best!!! We also stayed two days at the Monte Carlo which was also good, loved the lazy river and the slot tournament and drawings! Location was great and staff very polite! Rented a car and drove up to the Grand Canyon, very nice drive, and spent a night up there. Vegas' night lights are great, but nothing beats Mother Nature.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans from Aug. 1 to Aug 6, 2004. The Orleans provided a great hotel for a minimal cost. The rooms were large, very clean and nicely furnished. The hotel staff was friendly. The pool facilities were great...orderly and not very crowded. The prices in all the hotel businesses were very reasonable. The shuttle service was adequate but not always convienant. At times it looked like there might not be enough seats for everyone on the shuttle rides. The only "complaint" that I had about the Orleans was the bed.....while it was clean, it was not very comfortable. The mattresses were very thin and this made for a sore back in the morning. During our trip we ate at the Courtyard Cafe, Sazio's and the Prime Rib Loft. The restaurants were decent and the prices were reasonable considering the prices on the strip. I would defiately recommend the Orleans to my friends and family as a great place to stay to get away from the crowds of the Strip! Look in to getting some new mattresses though....

Reviews.Title: “Middle aged couple found the Orleans all we hoped for!”
Reviews.Author: Hoosierhoolikesvegas
Reviews.Content: For our 23rd anniversary, without our teenagers, my husband and I decided on the Orleans based on the reviews, and it was all we could have hoped for. We stayed Aug 4-8th and since we'd always stayed on the strip, we tried something new. We really liked the off strip location, the new pool improvements, and the casino was not all that busy or smoky except for Saturday night when it was really crowded. We rented a car and parking in the Orleans garage was an easy walk, every day we'd drive to the MGM and took the monorail everywhere-it was a breeze! The check-in was fast, the maid service good (we tipped $2 a day and got extra towels and more shampoo than we ever needed) The big bathroom was very nice to have and the room being oversized was appreciated. The remodeling caused a few hours on one day of elevator waiting/crowding due to three of them being closed for but other than that, it was no hassle for us on the 19th floor. We drove out to the Red Rock Canyon one morning- took the 13 mile drive, which was well worth the trip to see. We also took in the Mac King Comedy Magic Show at Harrah's-the best daytime entertainment at a cheap price. Great for young and old alike. We also took in V the Variety show at the Aladdin- it's sad to see the variety shows heading out- this one was very good but in such a small venue, we felt very crowded. If you want a romantic meal with a view, try the Eiffel Tower at Paris right at sundown- we had a view of the Bellagio fountains (you may have to wait for a window table but it is worth it) We also took a helicopter tour of the strip using the Las Vegas helicopter booth located right across the Aladdin- for $79 a person,I thought it was pricey- it went really fast, and did not cover the south end of the strip, so I'd reccommend using one of the other services that do cover that end for more value-but since we were back walking the strip in 20 minutes it was best for us. Super smooth ride and the pilot gives a good speech/tour. Great buffet at the Spice Market Buffet at Aladdin-good selection, if somewhat overpriced. Thanks to all who recommended the Orleans- we sure appreciated knowing what we'd find in advance!

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans Hotel is Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend The Orleans. We stayed here when we got married. The rooms are very large, tastefully decorated and a very good off-value. The Casino is wonderful, and Customer Service was prompt. The only glitch we had was that I forgot the marriage license and when my husband when back to get it out of my room, they wouldn't allow him into the room without talking to me on my cell phone first, even though we were on all the rooms we booked. However irritating it was at that moment, I respect the fact that they were protecting my security. This is a wonderful hotel, with Strip quality at an off-Strip value.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans was Great”
Reviews.Author: MaryLynnMontreal
Reviews.Content: My husband & I with our 16-yr old twins stayed at the Orleans for 3 nights in July. We had a Strip-view room on the 11th floor which was very nicely appointed and well located. The construction noise for the new tower never really bothered us. We found all staff to be very courteous & helpful - check-in was a breeze. We ate every morning in the Courtyard Café which was very quick & very good. Highly recommend Sazio for great Italian food [use the coupon for a 20% discount] & Terrible Mike’s for fast food. As is typical with Vegas the self-park lot is well-removed from the hotel rooms, but we parked near the Orleans Arena ticket office & via a back route [behind the pool area] entered the building very close to the room elevators. The pool area is very nice with water that’s actually refreshing in the 106 deg heat with a great jacuzzi & plenty of lounge chairs. My husband’s only complaint re the Orleans was it’s distance from the Strip as he likes to take morning walks & it’s just too far. As much as we enjoyed the hotel & it’s amenities our next trip to Vegas will most likely be on the Strip [Too Bad !!!].

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Will Come Again”
Reviews.Author: cherylann911
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 days and we had a great time. The rooms were large and clean. The hotel staff was very courteous and friendly. The casino was great - not too jampacked. The drink prices were fantastic - the restaurants were very good (especially Don Miguel's). It was nice getting off the Strip when it got very crowded on the weekend. We are already planning our next trip to the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. I took my girlfriend to Vegas for her birthday, I wanted to stay on the Strip to make it special but I couldn't find a rate on the strip that was reasonable. I then found the Orleans, 59.00 a night. I was so suspicious so I read up about the hotel. Every review that was positive was 100% correct. Didn't rent a car, it isn't a must have but does make things easier. Cab from the airport cost me 21.00 including tip. Check-in was about 50 seconds long and the room was huge. Nice furnishings, and great service. Shuttle runs to the strip about every 20 minutes although boarding is a bit unorganized as there is no line and a limited amount of seats on the bus. So even though you may be waiting longer than others if the bus stops in front of someone else they're getting in first. Not really fair just speak up and don't get taken advantage of. Buffet was good, clean and tasty. Casino is stingy don't gamble here, i guess that is why the rooms are so cheap they hit you on the slots. At check-out they gave me a coupon for 2 free nights I will gladly use them. Great hotel will never stay anywhere else in Vegas unless the room is free.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in a city of excess”
Reviews.Author: Paulette60
Reviews.Content: It's been 25 years since we had been to Las Vegas and what a shock. The strip was so crowded, the hotels HUGE and it was generally just overwhelming. It was a joy after a hectic day to come back to the Orleans which is just a quick shuttle ride from the strip. Although I would call it a small hotel (compared to the huge excesses on the strip) it offered everything we needed. Nice pool, decent restaurants, and the rooms are a steal for the price. Security was excellent and I just liked the fact that you could find your way around with no trouble. We even bowled a few games. I requested a fridge in the room and we had one within 10 minutes. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to Vegas but avoid the summer months - just too many people!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Large Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For a change, we decided to stay in The Orleans which is off Las Vegas strip. The hotel room is huge and clean. The check in is amazingly fast and they give you these coupons with a lot of freebees. The swimming pool is alright, I mean it is not fancy, it does not decorated with faux waterfaulls but if you're purpose is just to cool down, the swimming pool will suffice. I am not going to suggest to gamble here, the slot machines are pretty stingy. Always valet your car, it is long walk from the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “very common”
Reviews.Author: vvmt20
Reviews.Content: This was the third hotel/casino we stayed during 7/26-8/3. Good atmosphere Not many kids average food dirty buffet dirty coffee shop good pool area good service at check-in good bar tenders best cocktail waitresses good rooms/service friendly dealers/pit bosses (my wife loves Doug) equal to Bally's not as nice as TI

Reviews.Title: “Solid Value.”
Reviews.Author: grram1
Reviews.Content: Overall we were pleased with our stay at the Orleans. The room was large, clean and pretty comfortable (could have used better pillows, but otherwise it was fine). The staff was very efficient and quick at check-in. The buffet was great for dinner, but breakfast was average at best. There's a lot to do (movie theater, bowling alley, sports arena, multiple bars and lounges, and... of course a huge casino with the largest number of table games and video poker I've ever seen). The pool area is nice and well kept (doesn't compare to some of the strip properties... but for the price you can't complain). The only draw-backs for me were that the casino is espeically smoky and at times we could hear a lot of hall way noise from the room. We wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans---DO believe the hype”
Reviews.Author: JRSwift
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans for two nights (July 19 &20) at the start of my recent 6 day visit to Las Vegas. I was a bit suspicious of all the great reviews this place seems to receive online but they are true. I must say that I have visited LV about a dozen times and, while I still enjoy experiencing the Strip, I increasingly find it too expensive and too hectic. A few hours is fine...all the time is exhausting. The Orleans is such a nice change. The rooms are great and reasonably priced. Had a huge King bed and a wonderful Strip view. There was also a nice sitting area with a big sofa and two chairs and bathroom was just fine. Received a nice little funbook and also some free buffet coupons upon checkin. The buffet is good, not great, but is very inexpensive and a great value. Also had the $1.99 Steak n Eggs late night special in the cafe one night and it was outstanding. My friends (who were staying at the Luxor) were amazed at the quality and value. The casino is huge with plenty of low limit slots and games and this hotel has (believe it or not) the most beautiful, scantily clad and friendly cocktail waitresses I've seen anywhere in town. Only a couple of little negatives. The climate control in the room was confusing and a little hard to operate and the video poker in the casino is not very good. Still, I really enjoyed the Orleans and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans was fabulous”
Reviews.Author: poppies
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights (5th and 6th July). Having arrived from The Howard Johnson in Anaheim where everything was excellent, we were delighted to have another great hotel experience. Only problem was trying to find out where to park at check-in, and walking all the way through the casino to the covered car-park, to discover on the last morning that there was a short cut! If you don't mind being off the strip, and paying a lot less to do so - stay here. I too give The Orleans a 10/10.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to the reviews”
Reviews.Author: SuperDad63
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in July 2004. Hotel lived up to the billing. Check-in was fast, room was clean and comfortable, and it had a nice view of the pool. Enjoyed the pool. Valet parking was very efficient. Italian restaurant was good, but would probably avoid going back to the French Market buffet. Line was very long and the atmosphere was too hectic. Even though you had to walk through the casino to get anywhere, it was easier to navigate than most of the Vegas casinos we visited on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “the orleans a great place to stay with a few exceptions”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed at the orleans from 7/9/04 to7/15/04 with my wife and 21yr. old son we found the lowest price online then called the hotel directly and they beat it 10%.check in was fast and easy.they didn,t have the room we had requested months in advance. good hotel security you need to show your room key to get on the elevators.great elevators really fast.rooms are really nice,large and clean we never heard any noise from the other rooms great beds really comfortable mattress.if you stay at the orlean's try the mexican restaurant don miguel's excellent food courtyard cafe was just o.k. if you rent a car use the valet service because the self park garage is a long walk to your room.almost all of hotel staff were helpful and pleasant except for one old blackjack dealer with an attitudeand one rude bartender.the gambling wasn't all that great it seemed almost impossible to win any money at the blackjack tables and also very little full pay video poker.we had much better luck downtown where we won alot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent a week here and we found it to be one of the best! Check-in was quick and friendly. The rooms were actually mini-suites and pleasantly decorated. (The window in the shower is a nice touch!) Restaurants and bars all offered good food and great service. In fact, the service and service personnel were among the friendliest I've met anywhere. The pool area is nice and has access that doesn't require traipsing through the hotel lobby. The coupon books presented offered the standard food and drink, but also 2 for 1 tickets for the Showroom. A nice surprise! I would stay again and would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel: Great room. VERY clean, well furnished, everything looks brand new. Food: the lunch buffet was cheap and excellent (one of the best in Vegas). The $ 1.99 eggs and steak is just lovely (served late night, after 12:00 am) Pool: enjoyable, large, nice jacuzzi. Fun book: plenty of free drinks. Casino: slots do not pay well... Overall: excellent value

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: USA1775
Reviews.Content: I wont take long. There is no way this hotels ranks only 4th. For us it is #1. Great rooms, service, and food, and great gambling. Spent 3 nights here, check in was smooth even at noon on a Sunday. We will be back, Oh Yeah.

Reviews.Title: “a bit disapointed”
Reviews.Author: Mist59
Reviews.Content: After reading all the excellent reviews on this site, we decided to give The Orleans a try. I have to admit that the rooms are clean and large and the bathroom is very nice. On the other hand, I found the beds a bit too soft and the decoration of the rooms and the rest of the hotel is just as you see on their site (poor taste). I think that this hotel is probably excellent for gamblers since there was a lot of them in the casino (more then the other casinos we've seen) Another disapointment is the distance between the rooms and the garage (about 10 min. walk) and you must walk thru the smokey casino to get there. On the other hand, the pool area is very nice. Not as nice as the Flamingo's but nice enough. We paid $36 a night for this room and it was worth that price

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a good stay here. Room was very large, clean, and nicely equipped. Kids loved the pools and spa. Complaints would be not enough channels on the TV and just the general casino atmosphere. Once we found a detour between the parking garage and elevators that allowed us to bypass the casino, we enjoyed it even more. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans Casino #1”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay @ the Orleans was 6-14/6-21.Check-in took only minutes. The fun book you receive @ check-in is loaded with useful savings for free cocktails at any of their casino bars,buy-one/ get-one for food items! The Keno Lounge is quite large,cocktail waitresses every 15 minutes and a bathroom 30 feet away!! Who could ask for more.They have a LARGE selection of video poker and video BJ. I`ve been going to Vegas the last 15 yrs. and I will be staying at the Orleans from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: hester186
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is the best kept secret in Las Vegas. I normally stay somewhere on the strip, however, the price was right for the Orleans, so I gave it a try, and what a nice surprise! The rooms were clean and spacious, the restaurants were great and the whole experience was A++++ The gambling was good too. The machines didn't seem as tight as on the strip and the craps tables $2 and $3 minimums) were lots of fun, along with the low limit blackjack. Overall, a great time! Try it!

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED THE ORLEANS!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas with my husband and best friend (6/6 -6/11) and our stay at the Orleans was SUPER!!! The staff was very friendly and helpful. The fun book that you receive at check in was great, we used quite a bit of the coupons (the hamburger at Terribles was very good)! The rooms were overly large and very clean (Loved the window in the shower!). The grave yard specals were very tasty! The pool area was very nice. The bowling alley and movie theatre looked like it was lots of fun. We took the shuttle and also drove to the strip and both weren't bad at all. We did not think the casino was as smokey as reviewed by others (which was a big concern for us). The slots paid off quite a bit. Our only complaint was the breakfast buffet, it was kind of yucky! All in all it is a GREAT place to stay and we will be staying there on our future trips! F.Y.I. The breakfast buffet at Buffalo Bills was Excellent!!! The roller coaster at Buffalo Bills was AWESOME!!! The Freemont Street Exprience is a MUST SEE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brillant!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Orleans was a pleasant experience for me and my girlfriend. Rooms was big and clean and well worth the price. We paid only £94 for 4 nights!!! Although its off the strip, its less than a 10 min drive. Transportation is not a problem, they offer a free shuttle service to and from the strip which runs about every 30 mins. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The buffet was nice. Steak and eggs for only $1.99! you cant beat that. DEFINITELY RECOMMENDED :)

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: lovnlivnnalaska
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Orleans 11-21 June 2004. This is our 3rd trip to the Orleans. We are very likely to return and stay at the Orleans. The front desk staff was very curtious and helpful, we inquired about refrigerators in the room and were told that it would be an extra $15/per day, but after explaining that it was for medical purposes, they had one sent to our room without extra charge. Our room was cleaned daily, with ample towels, shampoo, etc in the room. We play Blackjack most of the time and found it quite easy to get comps for the buffet or Cafe any time we requested them. The food was great at both and you can't beat the late night/early morning breakfast specials at the Cafe. Also, we used quite a few of the coupons from the fun book given to us at checkin. We also used the free shuttle to get us to the Strip and also to the Rio, right next to the Orleans sister casino (Gold Coast). Our only complaint was the pool/jacuzzi. On our previous stay, the jacuzzi stayed open 24/7...it now closes at 8pm, when the pool closes. We were told that this was done for legal reasons...no lifegaurds on duty. This is very unfortunate...it is too hot to go into the jacuzzi until after 8pm. All in all though, we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK, Nothing Fancy”
Reviews.Author: CarlosFR
Reviews.Content: Got a good on-line rate and stayed 2 nights in mid-June. Check-in was simple and relatively fast. Room was nothing fancy, but everything was in really good shape and clean. Overall service was good and the casino wasn’t too crowded Thurs night, though things picked up Fri and Sat. Place is off the strip in more of a business / industrial area. There's a free shuttle to the strip ending up at the Barbary Coast where we had to wait a few minutes at the shuttle stop outside, which probably wouldn’t be a problem except it was summer in Vegas and over 100F! Overall, it wasn't too bad for the rate I got, though I'll probably stay at a nicer place on the strip next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at MGM and Alladin but I did enjoy the Orleans just as much or mabey even more. The only drawback is the location not being on the strip but I had a car so that didn't matter to me. Check was easy, no line and I was able to check in at 1:00 p.m. I asked for a high room with strip view and got just what I asked for without the $20 trick, I also asked for a refridge and one was sent to my room even before I could get there. The beds are fine, I slept great! Also, I don't smoke and I am allergic to it, but I was not bothered at all with smoke in the casino, I did not think it was smoky at all. The fun book you get at check in is great. The spa is really nice as well and you will get a free pass in your funbook. The only thing I hoped to be a little better was the buffet, it was just o.k. I would not hesitate to stay at the Orleans anytime, best value in town without a dought.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Orleans was a welcome relief from the Excalibur. The Excalibur was a great disappointment, dirty and crowded. We went to the Orleans for better prices, and we found a clean beautiful hotel. The rooms are small and beautiful. The baths are great. The pool is huge, and the jacuzzi is wonderful. We had a MUCH better time at the Orleans than at the Excalibur or MGM, and we even got a beautiful pool view for no extra charge. The Orleans is where we stay when we go to Vegas. The prices are right, the rooms very comfortable, and we love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Buffet!”
Reviews.Author: vsikes
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay at the Orleans, but their buffet was great. Just $6.95 and the food was delicious. I will definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Las Vegas 6 nights in June 2004. We found The Orleans to be a great place to stay. The rooms were spacious and clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The food was good. It was wonderful having the bowling alley and movie theater as an alternative to gambling. Since we had a car (Valets are the best) the location off strip was fine, however I can see it could be a problem if you don't have transportation. Our only complaint is the smoking. It's overwhelming. It would be a good idea to have non-smoking areas in the casino. Smokers aren't the only people who like to visit Las Vegas. The buffet at the Rio is a must, but be prepared to wait in line (it's worth it). La Cage is one the the best shows we've seen. Stay away from the Excalibur King of Tournaments show. The food is barely adequate and the service we experienced was the worst we've ever received. Plus the gratuity is included so you have no recourse. Excalibur needs to take a lesson from Florida's Dixie Stampede, Medieval Times, and Arabian Nights. Here's a tip, unless there is a show that you have to see wait and get your tickets when you get there. Tix4 Tonight offers 1/2 price tickets for shows that night. Sometimes they have tickets for the big shows, but you have to decide whether you want to take the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans was great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans in March during Spring Break. The hotel was great fun, clean and very inexpensive. The slots were not paying well at all with very few winners, but the table games were fine. The bowling, child care and food were all excellent. The room was nice and large, very clean and comfortable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is on a budget, likes bright and clean rooms, and enjoys reasonably priced entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: pstmn326
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Orleans again on trip first week of June. Everything but the Casino was great. Paybacks have gone down some but hotel and service are still best in LV.

Reviews.Title: “Big Rooms Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms were big and roomy the staff friendly and the slots were even good to us

Reviews.Title: “Very good deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As I had a rented car, I choosed an off-Strip hotel and I find Orleans very satisfactory. It was quite cheap at $68 for a very large and beautiful room with 2 queen beds. Nice furniture, no smell, very clean. Big bathroom. The free parking is about 300ft from main lobby entrance. The hotel is BIG and has looooooong corridors like all other big hotels I visited in Las Vegas. The reception staff was very friendly, fast, efficient and helpful. No complaints at all. No waiting in line more than 1 minute. The location is little bit far from the Strip but if you have a rented car it's not a problem. You can park freely your car at Bellagio or Alladin in the middle of the Strip and walk around all the night. The French Farm Market restaurant in the hotel is very large, clean and cheap: $5.75 for breakfast buffet $6.75 for lunch and dinner buffet and the food is excellent and has all the choices including american, seafood, chinese, italian, mexican etc. But not much choices if you want to eat after midnight as only 2 small fastfood restaurants are open 24hrs. You have an Internet choice in every room but it's not friendly and is expensive. While the reception staff was very friendly, I can't say it about the bussiness center clerk. The Internet prices there were outreageous at $1 per minute with at least $15 payement !! The Casino was less fancy than others from the Strip and is less populated. No problem with smoke or noise from Casino. I was mainly interested in seeing shows and did it. I suggest you to go a day before or in the morning at the Box Office of every hotel hosting the show. The so-called 50% off tickets booth on the Strip offers good prices for less interesting shows. But for Cirque de Soleil at Bellaggio, Celine Dion at Caesar's Palace or Mamma Mia at Mandalay resort, go straight to the hotel box office. I stayed twice at orleans 6 nights then I went to Grand Canyon then back for another night at Orleans. Highly recommended hotel. Good and cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, so-so location”
Reviews.Author: Roseann S.
Reviews.Content: I liked the Orleans a lot. They gave good value for the money. No problems with noise though there is still a lot of construction going on. The Casino is one large room that you can quickly learn to navigate. Food was good and a variety of restaurants available on premises. The movie theater and bowling alley are a welcome addition. Surprised that there were no shops other than the one usual gift and sundries store. My only complaint was the location off the Strip which is what made this review a 4 star rather than 5. Although their shuttle service to the Barbary Coast which is on the Strip (about midway) was reliable every half hour I still found it inconvenient. If you come by car and have your own transportation then it isn't a problem but having to walk the Strip from the Barbary in 104 degree heat was not pleasant and to get a cab from the Orleans to any Strip hotel would be a $10 or more cab fare.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great Place. We have stayed there many times, we are treated very good. We like the idea of showing room key to security before getting to elevator. We stayed in Vegas for 4 months this winter and spent a lot of time at the Orleans. We machine are good. My husband plays live poker and likes the tournaments they have. We have never had any trouble with maids, waitress, etc. I take the shuttle to play bingo at the Gold Coast have never had to wait in line.

Reviews.Title: “Good alternative to the strip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mother and I recently stayed at the Orleans for 3 nights the middle of May and were very happy with the size of the room, the comfortable beds, the cleanliness, and the view of the strip. (Mom was especially impressed with the little window in the bathroom that lets in fresh air.) Very good deal for the money. The free shuttle was quite convienient and took us directly to the strip right across from the Bellagio. One drawback - if you have never been to Vegas before and don't know about free Valet parking, it can be quite confusing to find out where to park to register for the hotel. There are no signs outside the hotel that tell you where registration is. We finally figured it out, but it wasn't a good start. The casino was huge and very smoky, the staff friendly, especially the little man that polices the hotel rooms with the stuffed animals and toys. All in all, we really liked the Orleans and would definately go back there. And of course, you get free Mardi Gras beads!

Reviews.Title: “As Promised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Orleans was excellent. Friendly staff, no hurly-burly Strip noise, asked for and received an honest-to-God very clean non-smoking room. Maid service very good. Nice casino. My room was bigger and nicer than my friends' room at the Stardust. The price wasn't bad, avg of $120/night, Thurs thru Sat nights (Thursday night, $55). Two connecting shuttles to the Barbary Coast on the Strip, the wait wasn't too bad. Nice pool area. Food was good in the coffee shop. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a bit quieter atmosphere than the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great room at a great price!!!! The room was huge, with 2 huge kingsize beds, a sofa and table. Excellent view of the strip. Graveyard breakfasts a bargain at $0.99c or $1.99. Be aware though that the East Facing side of the hotel is having an additional wing built and may be be noisy. We were up on the 19th floor, low room number, and only heard the occasional noise.

Reviews.Title: “Off-strip success!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Orleans in April 2004 because honestly it was the cheapest package rate I could get through Orbitz, and boy was I glad I did. I've stayed at many hotels on the Strip in Vegas, and always told myself that I would never stay "off-strip" because it couldn't possibly have been fun. But because I was in town for only 2 nights and on business, I thought what the hell. I am very glad I stayed there. Although off-strip, they have shuttle busses running to their sister-hotel in the middle of the strip most hours of the day so you can get there without having to use the bus or a cab, and the hotel itself was gorgeous. The rooms, top notch, with a living room area with couch and chair, the bathroom was HUGE with marble countertops and the towels were to die for...very thick and soft (wished I could've taken some home but they guarded them well while cleaning in the hallways haha!). The buffet was pretty good, they have a 10+ screen movie theatre on the second floor of the casino. Only two things I was unimpressed with, first was that the slots there didn't pay out as well as the ones on the strip, and you had to walk what felt like at least a mile to get from the room tower to the casino floor, and another mile to the parking area to get to your car if you rented one. They did have moving sidewalks near the Orleans arena where you park at, but they were almost always turned off so you had to do all that walking without assistance. Otherwise, the hotel was great, wonderful service, and a great price. I look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Go There”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We would never recommend The Orleans to anyone who planned to visit Las Vegas. We had made a reservation for a room with a king size bed several months ahead of our arrival. We were given a room with two regular beds. After going to the front desk, we were told that we could get a king size bed the next day (Sunday). The Front Desk told us that people who had made their reservations several months in advance had gotten all the king size bedrooms....we had also made reservations in advance. Our blind daughter accidently dropped her cane down the elevator shaft while getting off the elevator. We immediately went to the Front Desk to ask for someone to retrieve the cane...since this was her independence. Only the clerk that night seemed interested in getting her cane back. But maintainence told her that it was not possible because the Otis Elevator Co would have to come out and retrieve the cane. They promised to place a call on Sunday A.M. to Otis. When we returned late Sunday night after a trip to the Grand Canyon, we spoke to Jeff at the Desk....a front desk manager. He stated he had placed two calls to Otis and that they had never returned his call..but they would try again on Monday AM. We asked if he thought if we placed a call to Otis to explain the urgency of a blind person getting her cane back if they would move faster. He said he did not think so. When my husband returned to the room, he found the number for Otis Elevator and called it. Since it was late Sunday P.M. he got the national answering service for Otis. The gentleman from Otis told my husband that he did not have a record of The Orleans calling for assistance over the weekend and that he would have it IF they had called. Jeff lied to us when he said he had called. The man from Otis told my husband that when he hung up that he was going to call The Orleans. Monday morning, the Otis Elevator Co. retrieved my daughters cane from the elevator shaft. The hotel staff had even told him the incorrect shaft where the cane was supposed to be. When you stay in a hotel room, you have to have trust that the maids can be trusted. We had bought several souvenirs while we were at the Grand Canyon. We had all of them in the same shopping bag. I put the bag intact in my suitcase when I packed to come home. You can imagine my surprise when two of the cutest souvenirs were gone from the bag. The only people in our room besides me and my husband were the maids. I know I had the souvenirs when I got back to my hotel room but I did not have them when I returned home. So based on the in action of the Front Desk staff, the lies that they told us about the room and the Otis elevator, and the dishonesty of the maid staff, I cannot give any kind of positive review of The Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great value. Large, clean rooms. Not on the strip, but easy access. We stayed two weeks ago and would surely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Orleans and everything was great as it has been on my last three visits. I find this hotel clean, friendly, economical and more comfortable to call "home" for a few days than some of the bigger more hectic hotels on the strip. The restaurants have always had great food, especially Canal Street, and while I'm not a big buffet fan theirs is definitely the best I've been to. The Orleans' rooms are among the biggest in Vegas and if you ask they are happy to give accomodate any requests you have. While some people think that being off-strip won't give you an authentic "Vegas experience" I think that the Orleans is big and flashy enough to make you feel like you're in Vegas, not at the Motel 6 in Omaha. The shuttle to the strip is easy to use and free, but I prefer renting a car and using valet parking everywhere I go. When I've chosen to self-park at Orleans I've always found a space close to the door. I guess you can have a negative experience anywhere, so it's too bad that some posters left the Orleans with bad feelings. However I've never had a single complaint there and will continue to stay there whenever I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: 123xyz<>
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Vegas April 9-11th at the Orleans based on previous tripadvisor reviews. It was my first time in Vegas.
