After walking the strip and casino hopping there, I greatly appreciated the lack of lines and small size of the Orleans. The hotel itself was decent. The room was adequate for the price. The only downsides were 1) the free shuttle line, which always seemed longer than the space available (we just took taxis); and 2) the service was lackluster. Waitresses were slow to bring drinks to the tables and happy, helpful dealers were rare. Just as you found a table where people were having fun, the dealer would go on break. But, on the positive side, there were plenty of $5 and $10 tables all day and night.

Reviews.Title: “Pay A Little More & Stay At the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: BUSULIM
Reviews.Content: This time around, most of the reviews we read before booking The Orleans, were off the mark. Last week (May 2004), when we arrived at the hotel, the check-in was a breeze and we thought we were off to a good start. To park our car, we had to drive all around the hotel to a multi story lot and take the parking elevator, walk another round about in the casino to get to the hotel elevators! It sure was confusing and absolutely poor design. Before getting to the hotel elevators, we had to show our room cards (keys) - of course for security reasons! On the contrary, we're utterly surprised. Never in our entire travel experience did we encounter such a thing which startled us abit about the security of the hotel! We had an immediate insecure feeling. Got to our room and they were slightly above par - as AAA rated them 3 stars, but we would rate it 2 stars. The decor couldn't be more gaudy, sink was choked and shower knobs wobbly which was about to fall off. The room was a decent size but the furniture and carpeting made it look more of a motel feel. During the 2 nights we were there, the constructions when on till midnight!!! (The hotel is expanding to inculde more "deluxe" rooms - don't bother) Furthermore, way past midnight there were noisy guests talking on the hallway to their rooms and you could hear every word! Such thin paper walls.One bright spot is the great buffet (and cheap!) that the hotel offer. Super spread for the price you pay and the variety was excellent. Then again, you will be seated at coffee-shop style booth which sinks you so low that its hard for you to eat and get up. The staff at the buffet was very helpful and friendly. Overall, the buffet was a plus but the rest of the hotel was not what we expected when we read the reviews and thought the off-strip feeling would be better. We were wrong! We would highly recommend spend a few more bucks and stay at one of the better and nicer hotels on the strip - which we did at the Paris Las Vegas and loved every minute of it!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Cruiserfish
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to celebrate New Years eve in Las Vegas for the very first time last year. We waited really late (already September) to try and book a reservation and almost everything was already completely booked. We found The Orleans on one of the "Vegas" websites and since we were desperate we decided to try it out even though we didn't know anything about it. Let me tell you. We hit the jackpot with the Orleans. It is a fun place with a beautiful decor and great food. Although we traveled all around the strip and downtown during our stay, we just ended up right back at the Orleans. We really had no reason to leave there. They've got all the latest slots and everything. We loved it so much that we just booked it again for this coming New Years celebration. I would recommend The Orleans to anyone. You just can't go wrong at The Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Return visit to a GREAT hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned to stay at the Orleans for our 1 year wedding anniversary. We stayed here when we got married in May 2003 at the Little Church of the West. Again, the Orleans was great! We were mailed in advance to our 5/10 - 5/14 trip a 'special' for $49 a night for the dates we went! You CAN'T beat that. The casino is HUGE and the Orleans has 9 restaurants, beautiful pool, big gift shop, etc.! And only 5 min. from the strip in our car! The rooms are clean and nice size, bigger than your average hotel room. My only complaint is the way all the guest room doors slam and can be heard in your room, but I have to wear earplugs anyway because of my snoring hubby (he-he) so didn't hear the doors slamming once the earplugs were in! On a score of 1 - 10 (10 being the best) I would give the Orleans a 9 and 1/2 !!! We will definetly stay here when we return for our 2nd year wedding anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Orleans the best and most fun to stay”
Reviews.Author: Cobra99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Orleans Hotel in Las Vegas having stayed there from May 9 through May 14,2004. We had a wonderful time at the hotel and found the hotel staff to be very friendly and the service excellent. The rooms were very clean and pleasant and the beds very comfortable.The food was very good, we ate mostly at the cafe for breakfast and dinner. The Rodeo arrived at the Orleans on May 13th and we enjoyed all fun that it brought with it. We played the slots for the most part and found a lot of fun machines that we enjoyed. We would encourage family and friends to stay at the Orleans and plan to make this hotel our favorite place to stay on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, close to the strip!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel, very close to the strip, but without the strip prices. We went with friends at the end of the summer and picked the Orleans do to location and price. The place is huge, lil slow on check in, but understandable. The food was great, we ate at the buffet a lot, plus the spirit store there inside the casino was wonderful. best prices in Vegas, and saved us from having to go out to buy drinks, as we had a one year old with us. I'm staying there again as I go back for a wedding and plan to stay another time this summer for a vacation! I plan on checking out more of the facilites this time around, like the spa and will happily post my results from this trip after I return!

Reviews.Title: “the best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed May 4th for one night and then 2 nights at the Las Vegas Hilton. We wished we were still at the Orleans our entire time at the Hilton and we loved the Hilton. At the Orleans everyting is just a little bit more fun. Rooms are beautiful. Casino,lobbies, pool, restaurants, are all wonderful. They have a movie theater, an arcade and a daycare for children. Who needs the strip? This place is a destination in itself. There is a free shuttle service for people who absolutely have to fight the crowds on the strip. Will never stay anywhere else when in Vegas. The cocktail waitresses oh so skimpy outfits are worth the room rate alone.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined our 10th Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: Bulldogin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to spend our 10th Wedding Anniversary in Vegas since we hadn't visited Vegas in 9 years on our 1st Anniversary (nor had any vacation in 4 1/2 years...kids). We decided to stay at The Orleans as a few people we know had recommended them. I looked them up on the internet before making our reservations and noticed that there pool was only open until 7:00 PM and that they did not say if they had a jacuzzi. We very much enjoy ending our fun filled days by relaxing in the jacuzzi while on vacation. So, before making our reservations, I called and was told they had a pool/jacuzzi and that we could use it anytime but that there was no Lifeguard after 7 PM. So I went ahead and made our reservations. Well, our experience of The Orleans was that the facilities are beautiful and very clean and everyone if very friendly there, BUT it was SOOO COLD in the casino I could hardly stand it and even heard several other guests complaining of the temperature. We ate at Don Miguels (Mexican food) which was terrible aside from the chips and dips. We were charged for drinks while sitting at the bar PLAYING video poker....AND at about 9 PM we decided to go to the jacuzzi to thaw out and when we got there the security guard tells us that the pool area is closed and that the "Health Dept." came in last week and fined them for having people in the pool/jacuzzi without a Lifeguard on duty! My husband called to speak to the manager of the hotel about this since I had specifically asked about this prior to making my reservations and the manager acted put out that he had to listen to this complaint and told my husband that he should write it on a suggestion/comment card.....HOW RUDE!!! In my opinion the manager should have at least apologized or perhaps even offered us an upgrade to a room with a jacuzzi tub (if they even have one). So neadless to say we checked out of that hotel the next morning (all of which wasted about a day of our already short vacation) and moved to the Tropicana for the same price and had great access to a variety of casinos and a FABULOUS variety of pools and jacuzzis, some of which are open 24/7. We will NEVER STAY AT THE ORLEANS AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Orleans!!!Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from 4/27-5/1/04. We chose this hotel because of the bowling alley. My hubby is an avid bowler and I am an avid gambler so we figured we would both win/win with this hotel. We arrived at the hotel early (11:30am) but was able to check in right away despite the posted 3:00 check in. We stayed on the 11th floor with only a view of the hotel lighted sign (no problem though). We had asked for a king non smoking room but got a double queen non-smoking room. We called downstairs to be moved but they didn't have a king available until the next day. (---) The rooms are very spacious, bathrooms huge, and tv size is average for a hotel. Room remained clean throughout stay (despite the dirty linen). The spa area is absolutely beautiful with his and hers relaxation areas and a coed workout room. The prices are a little steep for some of the spa services though.Restaurants:Terrible Mikes- our sandwiches (corn beef and fish) were TERRIBLE!Courtyard Cafe - excellent breakfast (food and service)....HORRIBLE dinner (food AND service)Buffet - very good for both beakfast and lunch (ate at Alladin's Spice Market buffet for dinner (excellent!!)Games:Slots - Wild Bear Run - great penny slot Super Cherry - another great penny slot Cops n Donuts - another penny slot Wheel of Fortune - great payoff, nickel slotBowling Alley- Lanes are pretty oily otherwise greatMovie Theater - 18 screen theater is AWESOME. very clean, great atmosphereGaming Area- VERY SMOKEY, but with excellent fast waitress serviceLiquor Store- Cheap (at least cheaper than Pa.)Shuttle Bus - comes about every 30 minutes until 12:30pm. It's free so no complaints from me.Overall great trip, and I would definitely recommend this hotel to other return visitors. First-timers should stay on the strip though not at The Orleans.WE RECEIVED A COUPON FOR TWO FREE NIGHTS UPON CHECKOUT!!!! We will be using them in Spetember.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay here on Trip advisor and stayed from 4/20 - 4/24 and it was great. The beds were comfortable, the rooms clean, the showers were awesome. The location is far from the strip but we won more in the casino here than we did in any strip casino. The staff was very friendly and the low minimums on the tables let us try games we hadn't tried before. The shuttles could run a little more frequently between the hotel and the Barbary Coast but taxi's are always there and fairly cheap for 4 people. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Orleans lives up to the positive reviews on the website...beautiful spacious rooms, great value, great buffet, good service, low table limits, friendly and helpful staff. Our only problem was trying to get a good night's sleep. The housekeeping staff would knock on our door at 8am! I know it's a large hotel and there are alot of rooms to clean, but guests should be allowed to sleep to at least checkout time! We would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Value”
Reviews.Author: DevonOfficer
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Vegas this past week was our first, and we stayed here at the Orleans. I expected a lot, after rreadnig other user reveiws here on this site. I feel as though I got my money's worth form this hotel. It was inexpensive (relatively), but still managed to be above par. One or two complaints; the floor in the spacious room was not vacuumed either before our stay or during. It was a tad icky. The casino itself had a very bad ventilation system, and the smell of smoke was quite overpowering. The Courtyard Cafe was an absolute madhouse, and the waiter was beyond rude. Edgar, no tip for you! But even with all that, the new pool area was beautiful, with attentive servers...and liberal bartenders! The casino staff was extremely friendly. The slots were loose...play "My Rich Uncle" slot, it's a hoot! Check-in and out was super speedy. The shuttle was great...free every 15-20 minutes or so to two different sister hotels. The Barbary Coast is one, and they are just a friendly there. Enjoy your valuable coupon book upon check-in, and play the slots at the bar...drinks are free as long as your quarters are going in! Have a super trip. And make sure to see as much as you can!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is clean, friendly and off the beaten path. If you haven't been to Vegas, then this isn't the hotel for you. Instead, first timers really should stay along the Main Strip where hotels such as the MGM Grand, Bellagio, Mirage, Flamingo, etc. are located. Staying on the main strip will allow first timers to experience walking from casino to casino and enjoying all the attractions and sights. Be sure to wear comfortable shoes. So, ladies, leave the heels at homes or you'll have blisters - guaranteed - which can really ruin your trip. Staying at the Orleans is nice for return visitors to Vegas because it isn't downtown and yet it isn't on the main strip either. Be prepared for an older crowd. This isn't a sleek trendy place like The Palms or The Hard Rock where the 20 year old wannabees hang out. The Orleans caters to a bit slower crowd, but it's worth it. I was surprised at the cleanliness of the rooms and the decor was fairly modern and new. I didn't notice any faded carpeting or torn upholstery. Very new and very nice. I would definitely recommend staying here to any return visitor. The value is phenomenal, especially during the week. Also, The Orleans has some great restaurants. Breakfast at one of the small cafes was excellent. Worth waiting in line for (the line moves fast). Oh and the pool area.....not bad. Quiet when we were there. So enjoy and spend the money you save in the casino! And if you are a first timer - you will need a rental car or you'll have to take taxis/shuttles to visit other casinos. They are definitely not within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room, but location was inconvenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during an extended weekend with my wife. My parents and sibs stayed at Harrahs. My room was cheaper and definitely nicer. It was more spacious and just felt more comfortable. At check-in, I told the desk that this was my first time in Vegas and he gave me a courtesy upgrade to a room with a view of the Strip. Even though they offer a shuttle service to their partner hotel on the strip, I still would say that having a car is a must. Since the casino doesn't see the same kind of traffic that the other hotels do, they have lower minimums at the Blackjack tables. However, beware to the hardcore BJ players: lower minimums usually mean sloppier play (e.g. splitting tens, hitting 16s against a 5, etc.). I would consider staying there again, but am more likely to try a hotel on the strip next time.

Reviews.Title: “Was a wonderful Clean Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Vegas the days of April 11 to the 15th. This hotel was great. The rooms were immaculate, as most other people have said. The employees were all very friendly. For example: We walked into the Flamigo, on the strip, to put our money in a few slots. I needed to break down a twenty real quick, so I walked up to the bar tender, she was very rude and said she couldn't do it for me, I had to walk clear across the room, just to get two tens for my twenty. Now, when I did this at The Orleans, the bartender was more than happy to do this for me. The only bummer on our trip had nothing to do with the hotel. We were there to witeness the infamous Bellagio Blackout. Apparently, some construction workers cut cables (who knows what the real story may be) and the hotel was completely blacked out from Early Sunday morning till wed afternoon. Overall we had a fabulous trip, and even won some money. WE would stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Buffet!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to The Orleans buffet for lunch because we read about it on tripadvisor. It was every bit the best that we had in Las Vegas. We will definitely go back and stay at the hotel as well. Now we know why it is rated as high as it is.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Vegas in the past three years, the last two at strip hotels. This was our best stay yet. We had taken our two daughters and son-in-law with us and had reserved two rooms. Upon check-in I asked if they could give us rooms close together. They said if we didn't mind a short delay they could give us side by side rooms away from the construction. Within an hour we were settled into their spacious and comfortable rooms. This was just a sample of the friendly service we receivd during our five night stay. Although we had a rental car we found it was easier to take the quick and easy shuttle service to the strip. Even though this hotel is a little off the strip, I would highly reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel/casino, not so great location”
Reviews.Author: kimpete8
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Orleans was great. Friendly, helpful service, great rooms, one of the nicer casinos that we visited, and a terrific variety of excellent, affordable restaurants. The only problem is the location. The Orleans is located almost 1 mile from the strip in a light industrial area, and this is a substantial drawback. There is a free shuttle provided to the Barbary Coast, in the heart of the strip, but this is not a great substitute for being right there. One day we walked from the strip to the Orleans along Tropicana Ave., and discovered just what a disgusting city Las Vegas is as soon as you get more than 1 block a major casino. We enjoyed our time at the Orleans, but next time, we'll stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice. Not perfect, but nice”
Reviews.Author: poppy_popster
Reviews.Content: The Bad: We stayed at the Orleans from 04/04 thru 04/08. When we arrived around midnight, our previous request for 2 adjoining (one king for wife/me and two queens for mom/child) non-smoking rooms could not be fufilled. In fact, both rooms would end up being smoking rooms and one was on the 2nd floor and the other was on the 18th. The hotel promised we would be moved to non-smoking rooms the next day. I was not happy, but I understood that these things sometimes happen so it was not a huge issue. I did angle for some type of "compensation" but no to no avail. After we trudged our way all the down the looooong hall on the 19th floor, the room key wouldn't work....because the room was still occupied! We hiked back down the looong hall and back to the registration desk. The hotel apologized for the mixup and found us another room on the 2nd floor. The 2nd floor hall was very smokey, but luckily the rooms were not too bad smokewise. Both rooms had two queens, so my wife and I had to sleep in separate beds. My bed and pillow was not comfortable. The Good: By 3pm the next day we eventually got moved to adjoining non-smoking rooms on the 19th floor (loooong walk, but that ended up being a good thing) with the proper bedding arrangements. The view of the strip was great and the rooms were nicely sized and seemed very clean. The TV's have built in Internet service (5.99 for 2 hours). I suspect that is a good deal, but I resisted. The bed was more comfortable and we asked for 3 extra pillows (and got 2 due to short supply) and also requested and received a small refrigerator. The casino was fine, but a little smokey. I only realized this after side trips to other casinos that maybe had better ventilation. Or perhaps because this is a popular locals casino, and the locals seem to smoke like crazy. Since we sometimes smoke ourselves while drinking/gambling it was not that big of a deal to us. Slots and drink service were fine (even in the nickel slots). The cocktail waitresses are very fine. The coffee shop (steak and eggs for 1.99 after midnight!) and Don Miguels were also fine. We had breakfast at the French Quarter buffet, and thought it was a good value, but didn't get to try the lunch or dinner buffet. Terrible Mikes, Subway, Kate's Corner and Seattles Best all met expectations. We didn't get to try Sazio and the Prime Rib Loft, but all restaurnt prices were reasonable I wish we stayed longer so we could have tried thm all. We played in the video arcade, went bowling and my mom and my daughter went to the movies. The shuttle to the strip was very convenient and we saw no need to rent a car. "Rock This Town" appearing on Tuesday nights at Brendans Irish Pub was a GREAT and friendly band with a very good Elvis impersonator appearing later in the show. The keyboard player was fantastic. We had an excellent time and stayed there all night. It was so much fun we didn't even gamble that night. Odds n Ends: The loong walk to our room ended up being a blessing because the hotel was doing renovations with jackhammering next to the elevators during, so we ended up far away and insulated from the terrible racket. We felt sorry for those rooms closer to the elevators. The bathrooms were nicely sized. No vent, but there is a window that opens in the hot and powerful shower/tub. Also, no closet in the room, just a big clothes rod and shelf in the bathroom. Maid service was fine. 75 cents per local phone call. The funbook is a great value. The pool and pool area seemed very nice, but we didn't try it due to my daughter's slight cold. And a Walgreens is within walking distance so we were able to buy sundries and cough medicine at a decent price. The hotel gift shop was standard, but I did notice reasonable prices on bottles of soda/water etc. price. All gambling machines appeared to be "voucher payout" and accept dollar bills and couchers only which can be a plus or a minus depending on your POV..

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Vegas numerous times over the past 10 years, and have stayed at a variety of hotels. The Orleans is an excellent hotel and casino. Service is excellent, the rooms are terrific, and even the slots were kind to us. Don't be put off by the foam mattresses in the rooms. They are very comfortable. The restaurants are not the fanciest, but the food is good. Nothing to write home about, but good, hot food none the less. We will be staying here again on our next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great service at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: April 11 .... Just got back from the Orleans. The staff was friendly, the heated pools are open, the hotel is clean and the food is good and reasonable (cheap). The shuttles to the Strip run every 15 minutes. I wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “The Orleans Is A Winner!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at the Orleans ending 4/2 and I must say everything was great. The room was large, clean, and from the 11th floor we could see the entire strip from the Luxor to the Stratosphere. Check-in was a breeze...no haggling or $20 deals needed. Everybody was friendly,and getting extra pillows sent to room only took about 10 mins. The king size bed was comfy, water pressure was great to shower and toilet...no probs there. You can't get a better room for the price. Be warned, there is construction going on, and the pool and spa are closed, but I wasn't there for that anyway. Our room was down the hall from where the work was going on and we couldn't hear a thing unless we were walking near the elevators. The hotel has many types of restaurants to choose from with good reasonably priced items (including a full breakfast for .99 and strip steak and eggs for 1.99 after midnite!!). There is a free shuttle to take you to the strip (it goes to the Barbary Coast) about every 30 mins. We used this every day as it puts you in the middle of a lot of activity ( near Caesar's,Bally's, Mirage, Imp. Palace,etc.) About the only negative thing about the Orleans is the comp system which rewards you only on your winnings, not time or money played. It needs a system like the Tropicana where after only about 3 hrs. of play you'll end up with 2 t-shirts,2 tix to a great magic show, 2 tix to the Follies Bergere, cash in hand, discounts on their buffet, and a check to spend at any bar or food place in the hotel! We did do some gambling at the Orleans simply out of convience sake (when very late at nite) it was just the thing when almost sleepy enough to go to bed. All in all, iI would come back here in a heartbeat, the price, value, and quality make it more than worthwhile!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another happy guest of The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Libra
Reviews.Content: Add me to the long list of satisfied Orleans customers. I was there from 3/28 - 4/02 this year and had stayed there in January of 2003. I really enjoy having a spacious comfortable room that doesnt have that motel room feel. It was really clean, housekeeping does an awesome job every day! I find the beds really comfortable and love being able to open the little window in the bathtub. The buffet was really very good and so was the food in the coffee shop. Everyone is always very friendly and helpful. Was dissappointed that the pool and spa area didnt open until April 1st, our last full day there, but it looks great after all the work has been done and they did inform me that it wouldnt be open until April 1st when I made the reservations. I also have mixed feelings about the construction, more people will discover what I have felt for the last year, that The Orleans is quite a treasure to be found in Las Vegas....especially for the price. I would reccomend to anyone that they try staying there just once, even if they think the strip is the only place to stay! I think theyll change their minds!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay was from Sunday, 3/21 thru Thursday, 3/26. The 18th floor room was wonderful: clean, spacious. Loved the view of Las Vegas through the etched glass window in the tub area. We liked it so much we never went to the Strip. This was our fifth trip to Las Vegas, and the best ever. The 'perks', which included the buffet, were terrific, the slots were loose, and my wife remarked that we'll definitely do the 'Orleans' again. Bravo!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place...if pool was open”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the price ($56 on Travelocity). We were in Vegas with our kids this time for their spring break vacation. Unfortunately, the pool was closed for repairs (will not reopen for at least 3 more weeks). We were shuttled to the Gold Coast for swimming. The pool was small and the landscape fountain pumps were making a loud grinding noise.....so not very relaxing for resting or reading. By the middle of April the new pool at the Orleans will be open and it looks very nice. The price for the food at the buffet was fair but the food was only average. The beds were very comfortable (my husband did not end up sleeping on the floor as he usually does when we travel).

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: cathmurray
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the orleans for 5 nights from 1st march to 5th march.we chose this hotel after a lot of research and mainly because of it,s exellent reviews on this site.we booked on line direct with the hotel and paid 65 dollars per night for a room with 2 queen beds.the room was very clean and very large.we found everyone to be very helpfull and the food at the market streett buffet and the courtyard cafe was second to none and so reasonable.we don't really gamble so we can't help much regarding the tables.the free shuttle bus was running every 15 mins or so to the strip[the last one back is at 12.30 a.m though].the only downfall i had with las vegas[it was our first time]was that there was virtually no lager on draught and if there was any it was awfull,so we mainly had to drink bottles.we found a nice irish pub just at the side of the hotel and we got a very refreshing pint of 'carlesberg,lager there.Brendans bar,which is in the hotel serves draught beer but it isn,t good.the hotel had no tea/coffee making facilities so we bought a little kettle from ,wallgreens, for 10 dollars as room service can workout very expensive.all in all this is a loveley hotel and well worth the money catherine, england

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with the Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: Jim_Julie
Reviews.Content: WOW! This place was everything it was supposed to be. We stayed Feb 29th thru March 4th and was very happy with our stay. When we arrived, there was no line at the desk. We were quickly checked in and on our way to our rooms. My group had 3 rooms and 2 should have been kings but were doubles. They quickly had us king rooms a few doors apart on a high floor (we requested a high floor). They did not ask us if we wanted a strip view room like I expected from the other reviews I had read. I had planned to turn it down anyway because I've had strip view rooms elsewhere and actually wanted a view of the mountains. The room was quite spacious and clean like I had hoped. I like large rooms and it was very comfortable. It was just as the other reviews described with the little dressing area in with the bathroom and the little window. The bed was GREAT! VERY comfortable! They should put in another pillow or two. This place has everything! It may be off the strip but you really don't need to leave. All types of restaurants. They had alot of $5 Blackjack tables and $2 Craps if you like Craps but want to play cheap. The bowling alley was nice but when we went to bowl, all 70 lanes were being used by local leagues. That kind of sucked. You would think they would have a bowling alley somewhere else or they would at least keep some lanes for the people staying at the property. Sazios, the Italian restaurant was excellent. The French Quarter Buffet was very good. The Oyster bar was good also but I thought the best buy was the Courtyard Cafe'. Not a buffet (I don't care for buffets much) and reasonably priced. Especially the Graveyard Specials after midnight. $.99 eggs, bacon... and $1.99 steak and eggs. We all felt like the Casino was pretty easy to get around in. It was a big place but it never seemed to take long to get where you wanted to go. They had a little lounge area with free entertainment and the in house liquor store had prices that cannot be beat. Everyone was friendly and the waitresses outfits are pretty skimpy. What didn't I like? ............... Just a few things. None of the slot machines took or dispenced coins. Most casinos seem to be going to this. I have always liked walking into a casino and hearing the coin hitting the tray. Things are alot quieter this way. The slots were very tight although one of our party hit for $160.00 once. The slots seemed pretty tight everywhere we went. (2) Their comp system sucks. Even though I won a little at the tables I played quite a bit and couldn't even get 2 small meals amounting to $30 comped. A couple of guys with us spent a total of about 23 hours at the Black Jack tables in 3 days and got offered a free buffet. I was VERY unimpressed. (3) The poker room was locals. Always pretty full and no-one was having fun. It was all business. I would recommend finding a different place to play poker. I could go on and on but bottom line is that The Orleans is a great place to stay. Getting to the strip was easy enough on the shuttles. The biggest surprise was that contrary to most reviews, the casino was not smokey at all. I am an ex-smoker and really don't like it, but I had no problems with the air quality in the Orleans. We all agreed we would recommend this place to others and we will probably stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Mark at PRN radio”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are huge Nascar fans. We have gone to Las Vegas every year since the race inception in 1997 and have always enjoyed the hospitality at the Orleans Hotel and Casino. However Mark's treatment of my wife this year crossed the line of good taste and light humor and was completely demeaning. My wife always enjoyed the fact that she was remembered, but this year she was mocked and completely embarassed. If Mark and PRN Radio as well as the Orleans Casino do not want people from Idaho to stay there, their wish will be granted. We will not return to the hotel for next years show. I am extremely sorry this had to happen. We are still huge Brendan fans and are very hopeful his jump to the Nextel cup will be successfull.

Reviews.Title: “The Very Best for the Money! and more”
Reviews.Author: Silverado
Reviews.Content: My husband, my best friend, and I, all stayed at The Orleans from February 16th thru the 19th, and my thanks to all the reviews I've read here, as I'm sure we couldn't have stayed at a better place! I was looking for a Hotel that was affordable, but also classy, and The Orleans was just fantastic in every way. We stayed on the 19th floor, after doing the upgrade at check-in, for an extra $10 a night, and it was a wonderful room. Great view of the strip, the room was spotless, smelled great, and the beds were very comfortable. I was really concerned about the beds, after reading some of the reviews, but no problem for us. We did ask for 2 extra pillows, as there were 3 of us, and also gave a 2 dollar tip with the request. The staff was extremely friendly, always lots of smiles, but it wasn't on a busy weekend, so that may have made a difference. Security is really good, and easy to just wave your room card as you head to the elevator. Our room was very quiet, hardly heard a sound from anywhere. The French Market buffet was excellent, so much food, and good quality too. I really didn't notice the casino being as smokey as so many other reviews have stated, and all three of us are non-smokers, and one with asthma. We played only the penny and 2 cent slots, and there are a lot of them! They paid off real well for me, not huge amounts, but enough to keep me playing for 4 days! The only complaint I have is that the comp card I got was defective, and I didn't realize it until the second day, and I had already lost so many points. So make sure you pay attention if you play the slots with your cards. The shuttle service runs almost continuously, and it is so very easy to get back and forth to the strip, and we always felt like we had "come home" when getting off the shuttle and walking into the Orleans. We tried a lot of the slots on the strip, and what a waste of time!!! The big casinos are so tight, hardly worth the time, but fun to walk through. So in our opinion, it is the best value in Las Vegas, with lovely rooms, great food, and lots of fun gambling!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: nolagroup
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Feb 20-25, 2004 and found it an excellent location. The standard rooms are very nice. The staff was quite friendly and accommodating. We stayed there with our teenage daughter who loved the bowling alley and the arcades. It was easy and convenient to get to the strip, when you wanted to go there, by taking the back roads and cutting over to your destination and not having to deal with all the traffic on Las Vegas Blvd. Tried two of the restaurants including the buffet, which had a very large selection of food from which to choose. The only thing that would have made it better would have been winning more in the casino. Oh well! Next time! Our family highly recommends staying at the Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Confirmed but no room”
Reviews.Author: jdrags
Reviews.Content: I logged on to LastMinute Travel and got a confirmed reservation for the Orleans. When I arrived they had no record of the reservation and kept me waiting 90 minutes before denying me a room.I believe that LastMinute Travel may have been in error but the wait and the attitude of the desk supervisor will keep me away in the future.I have been received a refund from Last Minute Travel but have not had a response yet from the CEO of Coast Casinos, parent compnay of The Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: RTGeorgia
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Orleans last October for my daughter's wedding. There were several children and they had a great time going to the arcade, movies and pool. The pool was great, the rooms were nice and the casino and casino bars are wonderful. I have been to Las Vegas several times and stayed at several different hotels, but I will make The Orleans my hotel from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orleans and was surprised by the size and elegance of the room. The only thing I did not like was a strong sewage smell on the parking lot! I have been at at other hotels that the rooms were smaller and more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans Hotel Casino”
Reviews.Author: oldjerseycity
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Orleans in the spring of 2003 and enjoyed our stay there. We really enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi area. Taking in the sunshine around the pool/jacuzzi was among the high points of our stay at the Orleans. The buffet was very good and a good value. We enjoyed the table games, which had reasonable minimun betting (compared with the strip) and courteous gambling staff. We stayed in the tower with the spa on the lower floors and found our room comparable to places we have stayed at on the strip but at a better price---we liked it. The package goods store had the best prices we have found in LV. Their "Fun Book" was had some good usable stuff. Generally, we really liked The Orleans and thought it was a great "bang for the buck". We plan to go to LV and stay again at the Orleans the last week or April/first week of May, BUT we have heard that there is construction affecting the pool/jacuzzi area. I believe any users of this web site considering a stay at the Orleans would appreciate any information on the pool area from anybody who has recently been there; i.e. pool opening? reduced pool/jacuzzi facilities space? exposure to sunshine ? (building obstruction) etc.

Reviews.Title: “the inly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had my 50th birthday at the Orleans. So all of my gamily came to stay there too. The place was busy with many things from bowling to a concert but everyone may my group feel like they were the onlly guest. Up-graded rooms to free meals. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in town.

Reviews.Title: “VERY, VERY IMPRESSED! (read on...)”
Reviews.Author: VacayAddictDotCom
Reviews.Content: WOWZERS...I've been to Las Vegas before, and I must say...STAY AT THE ORLEANS...OFF THE STRIP! It has everything you need and MORE! Just driving up to the place...my hubby and I thought...WHOA....THAT'S ONE HUGE HOTEL! There were thee nicest vehicles parked by the entrance, hummers, mercedes, vipers, and even a maybach...THAT'S RIGHT I SAID A MAYBACH....AHHHH! Then, we got our room and it was everything everyone was saying it would be...CLEAN AND SPACIOUS...like a mini-suite! I wish we could spend more time our room, but we only had 3 full days to check out the strip. FREE SHUTTLE TO THE STRIP! The Casino@ the Orleans is way smokier than the other strip hotels...I can vouch for that b/c of my allergies, but the room I requested was far from the casino and not smoky at all! The Bellagio's Casino did not have a hint of smoke, unless the person was right beside you. Anyway, THE ORLEANS BUFFET WAS THE BEST IN ALL OF VEGAS for the price...LUNCH 6.95 AND DINNER 11.95! You must go there for lunch or dinner! Food Galore and DESSERTS, DESSERTS, DESSERTS...can u say selection??? Take advantage of the FREE SPA DAY! Watch a movie, go bowling (but check w/them re: leagues or tournaments first, this was my only complaint!). Courtyard Cafe was perfect for breakfast...OMG...we will be back...no matter what! Can't wait to use their renovated pool area in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Orleans from Jan. 15th through Jan. 18th ,2004. We found it to be very clean and roomy. The valet personnel were very nice and polite. The woman in the gift shop on Sunday, the day we left was very nice as well. We would stay here again! S. Robinson

Reviews.Title: “luved the orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: had a great time at the orleans. the seafoodfoodbuffet was excellant and the food at the other places i ate at was also excellant.the dealers were also very friendly and also the staff i encountered was very helpful and friendly. i am now planning a return trip in april so i could bring my wife for our wedding anniversory. i liked using the shuttles to get around. the machines were very cooperative to me and i have to give the orleans a 5 star rating

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a trip to Vegas and Tahoe. We stayed at the Orleans and I find it to be the best value I have found in Vegas. The only negative that could be said is its proximity to the strip (if that is a priority, for us it was not) but there is a shuttle that runs until midnight to the strip. The rooms were very spacious, the bathroom large and clean, the restaurants very good, and a friendly atmosphere. I encountered one review that said the hotel reaked of cig. smoke but I am very sensitive to that smell and never noticed it. I booked this hotel with some reservation but I now have no problem giving them the highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Adored The Orleans Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel room, friendly feeling throughout, precious little window in the bathroom for fresh air, great view of the strip, great soft decor. Friendly check-in staff. I will go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fine if you like sleeping on a Pilates mat!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you plan on sleeping, go elsewhere!!! By far the most uncomfortable bed....the mattress is only 3-4 inches thick. Too far from the strip for my liking. And the valets here are out of control!!! (I would self park if you value your car!!) I was almost run over by one of them! The restaurants were alright... Definitely use the coupons!! Surprisingly, one thing that was good was the market/liquer store. Well stocked and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans is a great deal”
Reviews.Author: roscoetalk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans from Jan. 16th until the 20th. This is the second time I have used Trip Advisors recommendations and once again I was not disappointed. The rooms are beautiful and roomy. The casino is never overly crowded and "WOW" 50 cent Roulette tables and penny slots. I can't say I ever seen that in Atlantic City. Although the hotel is about a mile or less from the strip, there is a shuttle that comes about every 15 minutes or so that takes you to their sister casino, the Barbary Coast (center strip) which is convenient to everything. The restaurants were good and my White Russian drink was $2.50 compared to the strip where it was $8.50. Orleans is such a bargain, I would never think to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Orleans on December 26. The rate was very reasonable for a Friday night (70.00). The bed was very uncomfortable, but it was the cleanest room I have ever seen. So many times hotel rooms have mold somewhere in the bathroom, however, this bathroom was very clean. There was 3 adults in our room and it was very spacious. We would stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel from Thurs-Mon and got a good price through trip reservations. The room was spacious and pretty clean with a large bathroom. Hairdryer, toiletries included. I did not however, like the layout of the floor leading into the rooms (when you get off the elevator). We had a room all the way at the end of the hallway and it felt like we were walking a mile before we got there. If you are handicapped, or "physically challenged", make sure you request a room closest to the elevator. The crowd in this hotel/casino is pretty middle of the road people plus freaks (it's not at all a great place for young singles). Overall it seemed pretty mixed, not pretentious-just down to earth. I did not find the casino floor here any more smoke filled than other casinos. Some of the reviewers commented on that issue but I have asthma and was not bothered by it. My hotel room smelled clean and fresh-no smoke there. I was happy with the cocktail waitresses-they asked frequently if we wanted drinks-that was cool. I LOVED the sushi restaurant-(Koji's) even though it was SO overpriced. But if you go there get "Sex on a roll". It was KILLER!!!! My boyfriend ate at Don Miguels (Mexican) and he said it was pretty average. I had a Margarita there (3.75) but chips and salsa were extra. The Courtyard Cafe offered some decent breakfast which was reasonable. DON'T, DO NOT eat at Sazio's. It is equivalent to Olive Garden with infinitely worse service. We walked in without knowing how bad the quality of the food was going to be. We ordered a salad first. We also ordered drinks (average at best) The drinks came but the salad didnt and neither did any bread. We got our entrees but the waitress didnt deliver them. We told the guy who gave us our food about not getting our salad and he said he'd take it off the bill. The waitress didnt come by until AFTER we were done eating and said "You didnt get your salad?" She was clueless and inattentive. I was hoping the food would make up for the poor service. The food was atrocious. Barilla dried pasta (or its equivalent) with DRIED basil mixed in the sauce and NO fresh parmesan cheese. This is a DISASTER for Italian restaurants that are more expensive than average. My dish was not "Affordable" like they say about the restaurant, and at 13.50 for pasta-it should be fresh pasta with fresh basil, and they should ask me if I want parmesan cheese grated on top. Instead, they had Kraft Parmesan cheese sitting on the table which was meant for the pizza. I don't know who Gustav Mauler is, but he is "supposed" to be the "Master Chef" of the restaurant. No Master chef would serve the crap we ate. Aside form the food I think that if you want to stay at a reasonable hotel that is off the strip this is a good place to go. They also have a shuttle to go to/from their other 2 casinos (none to the airport). It was also close to the strip. I don't think I would stay there again b/c I want to check out other hotels-but I definitely recommend it if you don't want to be around the insanity of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Beds bad, spa fab!”
Reviews.Author: gcat
Reviews.Content: Loved everything but the beds... really uncomfortable mattress like that you would find in a camper (Cheap) and pancake pillows ( if you know what I mean). Shame so much work was put into such nice rooms but when it comes to the thing that matters most in a hotel. The Orleans fell short. However, the spa is fab!! And the buffet is one of the top 3 in town for the price. I'll definatley visit but don't think I would sleep there again though

Reviews.Title: “Many Options”
Reviews.Author: JPearl
Reviews.Content: There are many things to do at The Orleans besides gamble, making it an excellent hotel for families. On site activities include bowling, movie theatres, arcade games, a separate sports and concert arena besides the showroom in the casino. A variety of restaurants in all price ranges are available, ranging from fast food to gourmet-style. The rooms are spacious and clean, tastefully decorated in true New Orleans style, with a lot of little extras provided. I could not have been more pleased with every aspect of my stay at The Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “All in one Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An all in one hotel where you can find everything under one roof and not have to rub shoulders with thousands of people on the noisy busy strip. Food and service are excellent in all of the many restaurants. Spacious and immaculate rooms are comfortable and large enough for a big family. Everyone can enjoy the Multi movie complex, bowling, arcade, pool..etc. A pleasant surprise was the availability of internet surfing right from the privacy of your room. The spa is fabulous and very well maintained. A shuttle runs back and forth from the hotel to the strip if you want to venture out. My family and I have been staying at this hotel for years.. We've watched it grow.. Why stay anywhere else. ^5 and kudos to The Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Kudos for The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Orleans for several days over the Christmas holidays and came away VERY impressed. Good location, nice surroundings, a clean tidy building, great room prices and...here's the best part...every single employee I encountered was friendly, knowledgable and courteous. And I do mean EVERY single one. The spa is really quite nice if a bit smaller than most people may be used to but it's kept very clean. The only spa service I utilized was massage therapy but it was a very good massage. The outdoor pool and jacuzzi are temporarily closed for renovation and expansion but the hotel automatically moved me to a higher room floor, at no extra charge, so I wouldn't be disturbed by the workers or their equipment. Why would I want to stay anywhere else? A

Reviews.Title: “Twide Satisfied at The Orleans”
Reviews.Author: patti-anns-place
Reviews.Content: My first visit to The Orleans was in March 2003. A group of my friends go to Las Vegas for an annual get together, and I joined them for the first time. Actually, I wanted to stay at one of the big name strip hotels, but when I checked into The Orleans, I was taken by surprise. My room was very large with a sofa, chair, and coffee table; this was a surprise to me. There was a dressing room where the sink, blow dryer, closet, and ironing board was located, and the room had a door that could be closed for privacy from the sitting and sleeping area, and it had a door that closed in order to give privacy to someone who may be showering or using the facilities. This made it nice too in case you had other people in your room, and you wanted extra privacy for using the facilities. There was a desk against a wall that could be used for business and/or another vanity area. I used it to study and to style my hair (I know, who goes to Vegas to study? I had mid-terms coming up.) Comfortable bed too, and extra pillows in the dressing room. The only thing that I disliked about the room was the distance from the elevator; I felt like there should have been a shuttle service from my room to the elevator; however, I am a smoker, and I know that we aliens have to be housed in outer space to accommodate our habits :-). The Mexican restuarant was okay, but nothing special. The buffet was a hit with all of the different choices to pick from: Italian, Mexican, Chineese, Southwestern, and plenty more. I missed going to a show, but there is a theatre and a bowling alley, but I did catch a Blues show in the pub; it was fantastic. Didn't win any money, but I had a great time. I returned in October, and the only difference was the room, which was a disability friendly room, because my best friend who is a stroke survivor needed these accommodations. Everything was nice, and they had biggest roll in shower that I have seen. I loved the shower so much that I would reserve one of these rooms for myself if I wasn't an alien smoker. In the past, I have stayed at Circus Circus (never again; I don't have kids), Flamingo Hilton, Primm Valley, and Whiskey Pete. And, I have had friends who have stayed at the Boardwalk, Stratosphere, and the Bellagio, and we all agree that the rooms at The Orleans are nicer than any of the above. Most importantly, the place was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay at The Orleans was just peachy!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Las Vegas 15 times, we have stayed at a variety of Casino's from The Mirage to the Rio and now The Orelans. I would rank the Orleans as above average when it comes to the price of the room. The rooms are clean and spacious. We had a nice view of the Strip. The only disappointment I had was that it was hard to get on the table games and the Casino is really smokey. The Buffet was good, but by far the best was Al's Oyster Bar and the HUGE bowl of Clam Chowder for $4.95 that's a meal in itself!! It helped out to have that comfort food due to the cold and windy weather. The walls are a bit thin so you hear the doors slamming, daytime sleepers may have a hard time here. All in all it was a nice time and someday we will go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: jbradleyco
Reviews.Content: Just returned after 8 days during the xmas break. The Orleans was a very nice hotel. Everyone I encountered there was friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean. I'd definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Ellis40
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 5 nights at the Orleans, and I have to say it's an excellent hotel. The rooms are large and clean and the staff are very polite and helpful, especially if like us you are from a foreign land and don't understand some of the American Systems! The shuttle buses to the other hotels are a bonus and one bit of advice, if you want to get to the strip and the Barbary Coast shuttle is full then get on the Gold Coast shuttle and the swap at the Gold Coast as this one is more regular. The Buffet is excellent and actulally seems as though you are eating in a restaurant, unlike others we tried that were more like eating school dinners. The Courtyard Buffet does excellent breakfasts and if you can get up before 7 then there are some excellent bargains to be had. I would highly reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best gaming, rooms, food and drink in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is far and beyond the best bang for the buck in Las Vegas. From the spacious 450 sf room to the outstanding dinning choices, the Orleans has more to offer, at lower costs, than any strip hotel/casino. Dinning is vast and varied, with $1.99 steak and eggs, excellent buffet, great prime rip in the Loft, chinese/japanese, italian, cajan, and much more. You'll see your cocktail waitress every 10-15 minutes while you're gambling. Shuttle service takes you to the strip or Gold Coast (across from the Palms) from 9:30am - 12:30am. This is a great, great, great place. They're going to add a third tower in 2004. That shows you how popular this place has become, not only with locals, but also with the frequent LV tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-has sooo much you don't have to leave”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. Booked it through Expedia because price was good and had many amenities plus transport to the strip. We went in January of this year. It was a beautiful hotel with plenty of gaming and dining options right in the hotel. Staff was really nice. We had a view of the mountains. Used the transport to the strip many times with great success. Will probably stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Other than the watered down drinks(which you'll find in most of the hotels on the strip anyway)this hotel was well worth the money, very nice, clean, spacious rooms, great pool and hot tub. Convenient shuttle to the strip. Well pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Orleans”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Orleans over Thanksgiving vacation. Brought my two boys (7 and 11 years old). Kids loved the arcade, bowling center, daycare, and movie theatres. The rooms were fine - I don't understand all the feedback about the beds - they were fine. Pretty good hamburgers at Terrible Mike's, also. Nice nickel slots.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Bargain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just honeymooned in Vegas, and stayed at The Orleans. It was our first time in Las Vegas, and the trip was fantastic. We chose The Orleans based on positve reviews, and we weren't disappointed. The rooms are quite large, and we had a nice view of the mountains. Great bathrooms, and the window in the shower was a nice touch. We read some reviewers complain about the beds, but we found them to be very comfortable, nice down pillows too. We didn't rent a car, but found transportation to be no problem. They offer free shuttles to the strip, and another to the Gold Coast, which is walking distance from The Rio and The Palms. Also, try the city bus to get up and down the Strip, only two dollars a person and they announce all of the major hotels/attractions. We liked the casino at The Orleans more than the larger casinos we visited, they have slots from a penny to five dollars, and you can actually find a seat at five dollar pai gow or three dollar blackjack. Fifty cent roulette all the time, too. The bowling alley and movie theater were great. The Courtyard Cafe is a good choice for breakfast, stay away from the buffet. Sazio's and Don Miguels are excellent, and reasonably priced. Make sure to get the coupon book when you check in, there are some great deals. The liquor store is not actually open 24 hours, but that is my only gripe. Overall, great place, friendly service. We will be staying there again. Justin, Milwaukee, WI

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms were above average , we stayed 9 days , but they offered me no upgrade (i asked)and no free buffets or such , which most hotels I have stayed at on the strip did , the Casino was good but the resturants were too pricey for my taste , the buffet there seems average to above average the price was good to but the waitresswe not friendly at all, we will not stay there again but we like to try a new place each time we visit

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great place for a great price! Stayed Nov.7-11. Rooms were just like a suite. Upgrade for 10 bucks a night for a strip view from the 14th floor. Foam top matress bed was actually comfy. Bathroom sparkled clean everyday, great hot pressure. Shuttle was just a short wait. Dinner at Miguel's for cheap, look at the board for specials. 99 cent breakfast M-Th before 7 am if your up at French cafe. Everything you want right there. No coffee maker, but coffee shop suited just fine. Can't say enough, will go back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family reunion”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Las Vegas on Oct. 24-28 and met my entire family from all over the U.S. at the Orleans. We celebrated my 40th birthday and had a wonderful time! The hotel was very clean and rooms were spacious as all have described. We are not big gamblers, so my sisters and I spent afternoons at the pool and hot tub and loved the spa, beauty salon (for manicures) and the workout facility. We especially enjoyed the spa because we could spend a very long time in the steam room, indoor jacuzzi and all the ammenities like a day spa (without children running around us). It was heavenly! Each morning we met for the $4.99 breakfast buffet and requested the same friendly waitress each day. The food was wonderful and great variety (hence, we needed the fitness facility to work off the extra calories). One evening we ate at the Japanese restaurant, then went to the 60 lane bowling alley for a rip-roaring time at bowling (after a few beers, it was hilarious!) We all tried our luck briefly at the slots, but the biggest payoff seemed to be the poker tables. We took the shuttle everywhere and it was convenient and easy to get around the Las Vegas strip. With the money we saved at the Orleans, all ten of us enjoyed the wonderful Lance Burton show at the Monte Carlo. The Orleans, although it is not opulent like the Bellagio, is a great value and very nice alternative to strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans - best value in LV”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is a winner. Everything aspect of this hotel can be rated at a level of above average to outstanding. The room is outstanding for the price. The inexpensive food of any eatery is outstanding. Cocktail service is outstanding. Video pocker payouts are the best in town. Table games have low minimums, if wanted. The shuttle service is dependable and quick. You cannot find another hotel in LV that offers as much as the Orleans at such low prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Vegas and our first stay at the Orleans. The rooms were large and clean. A nice bonus was a small window inside the shower area. We had a mountain view room (18th floor) which was great. If you stay here, make sure you book a strip view or mountain view room-otherwise you'll be staring at an airconditioning unit. A rental car is a must even though the hotel is only 1.5 mile away from the strip. Who could beat the .99 cent breakfast specials at the Courtyard Cafe (available 12am-7am). I would not recommend the dinner buffet. The food there was not worth the $12 price per person. We visited a number of other hotels while in Vegas and noticed the Orleans had them beat when it came to the 'free drinks' service by the waitresses. We never had to wait long before someone was asking us if we needed a cocktail. The slots seemed a bit 'tight'. We would highly recommend anyone wishing for a great bang for your buck at a friendly and clean hotel to stay at the Orleans...we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Room!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Vegas and I wanted to add my 2 cents. Everything was just as people here said it would be. Our room was very spacious, clean, and nicely decorated. The shower was really nice, great water pressure. The bathroom was very large. Once there, you kind of forget how far off the strip it is, which is why they so cleverly have everything you need right there. We wanted to eat in our room without paying for room service (although the prices were reasonable) but were told there was no take out in the hotel. For this, you can go to Terrible Mike's (hamburgers served cafeteria style) or subway and just take it back to your room. Anyway, we frequent Vegas and would definitely stay there again. Thanks for the great advice everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly stay with great spa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: October 23 -28 found us in Las Vegas for a family wedding. Expedia's rates and TripAdvisor's reviews convinced me this was the place to stay. Unlike the big box megaresorts, Orleans was uniformly friendly and manageable. We used some of the fun tickets offered with player signup. Recommend you follow suit, so to speak in LV terms, even if you don't gamble. The best was the complimentary day of spa and workout facilities. Breakfast buffet was fully acceptable. We upgraded, as suggested by other reviewers, to the 19th floor overlooking the strip. The Orleans extra square footage was nice. It's probably best to have a car to stay here, unless you enjoy meeting shuttle schedules. As all the major venues have ample parking, getting around LV is quite easy. Orleans is easy access to the strip, downtown, and freeway. Pool was blissfully quiet -- only noise was the breeze through the leaves, not rock and roll beat. Moved to TI for Sunday and Monday. Petite Suite was a wonderful room but everything else but a nice check in was frenetic. An interesting surprise was the Fashion Mall next to TI. Great goods in quality shops and a break from the noise of the casino floor. We gathered some ideas for Xmas decorating while there. Las Vegas--not no where else on the planet.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has it's ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have been visitors of Las Vegas for at least 10 years now and this was the first time we decided to stay off the strip. We visited 10/16 thru 10/23/03. We have constantly kept track of the reviews regarding the Orleans, and that is what inspired us to stay there. While the hotel staff is nice, the rooms are large and clean, and the food is not a bad bang for the buck, I was not impressed with the hotel itself. First of all, the ventilation is horrific. The smell of smoke permiates everything from your clothes to your sinuses and is the first thing that hits you when you enter the casino. They definitely need to do something to freshen the air. Also the casino itself is a bit rundown and has very tight machines. I am not a video poker player but a slot player, but the slots were far and few. Everywhere you looked there were video poker machines and I can truly say they were not impressive or hitting at all. We did most of our gambling on the strip. The hotel is a bit remote from the strip and even though it is approximately 5 minutes away, the shuttle service leaves a lot to be desired as you feel like all you do is wait for the bus to arrive. I will give kudo's to the housekeeping staff as our room was well maintained, the beds comfortable and the halls quiet. The security was a nice added feature as well. The pool area is small and underused. The cost for the week was terrific, but I would rather stay on the strip closer to the action. If you hate smoking, this is not the place to stay. If you like a lot of action the Orleans is not the place to find it. While my stay was not completely unpleasant, we will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alaypath
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans on October 16, 2003 based on the reviews we read on this site. We considered the Tropicana and the Stratosphere, which were less expensive, but the reviews were less consistent for those hotels, so we opted for The Orleans even though it cost a little more. We (my husband and I) don't visit Vegas often, so I can't say if it is really #1, but we were satisfied with our stay and with the price we paid, which was $66.30 through Expedia. We waited a few minutes to check-in, but we seemed to hit a rush. The desk was empty ten minutes later. Our room was comfortable, with a view overlooking the pool. The bed was OK, but we are used to budget motels, so we're not picky. We ate at the French Market Buffet for dinner and breakfast and found it to be good, but not exceptional. We're not gamblers, but we occasionally entertain ourselves at the cheap slots. The casino was large with lots of penny, nickel, and quarter slots, but none of them took coins. The machines required us to insert bills and if we cashed out, returned tickets. That was annoying. We used the free shuttle to The Strip and found it to be convenient. The last shuttle returns to the hotel at 12:30 am, which might be early for some. The pool area was nice, but the fall hours were limited and the sun was not shining on the pool while we were there so it was a little chilly to lounge in wet bathing suits during the late morning/early afternoon. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at The Orleans and would stay there again, but we would have no problem trying another hotel of comparable quality if it were offering an equal or better rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice off-strip joint”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had fun here for long weekend. Location no problem - bus to Barbary runs every 15 minutes to midnight. Rooms are nice and large. Bathrooms are nice and window opens. Sports/Race book is good and races are on room TV. Booze store on premises.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our vacation in Vegas. We were there from Oct. 11 thru Oct. 16th, weather was good. Based on reviews from this site, we stayed at The Orleans. Everything was wonderful! Our room was HUGE (had a view of the strip), the staff was courteous and what food we ate there was great. It's true about the mattress being only about 4 inches thick, but we didn't have any trouble sleeping. I was impressed with the bathroom too. It was spacious, clean and LOVED the window in the shower. The thermostat though was an enigma! We did manage to keep the room temperature comfortable despite the baffling control. All in all we had a fantastic time. We will definitely stay at The Orleans again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel but not Number One!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Orleans to avoid the mess of the Strip, but the time it took us to drive to the strip (despite being only a mile away) made us decide that the Strip is better because you can walk everywhere. At times it took us over a half hour and sometimes the valets were full and we were constantly frustrated. The self parking at the Orleans was great, free and close to the door and I am sure we saved some money that way, but overall the hotel was just okay in my opinion. The one thing that really stood out was the Spa however. It looked like it was recently renovated or built and had a whole different look than the rest of the hotel, which was on the tacky side. The spa was very classy and a really nice break the day I used my coupon to go. I suggest to all the ladies: USE YOUR SPA COUPON!!! It is beautiful! The excersize room looks out at the pool area, there are urns with chilled bottled water everywhere, new age music playing, and the free locker has slippers, etc. for you to use. I didn't purchase any of the spa services but really enjoyed the time there to use their equipment. I guess I am writing alot about the spa because it was the one highlight of the hotel. The buffet was a good value compared to other buffets, but had a run down, nothing special atmosphere. The beds I have to agree with the lady who wrote on this site are VERY hard because they are just a 4" piece of foam over the box spring. Not a real mattress. I was okay with it but like a real mattress much better. I wouldn't stay there again I'm afraid. We did call one night to housekeeping for extra pillows and they never came. Then I left a note for the maid for extra pillows the next day and still nothing. . .In summary, the money you save staying here isn't worth the aggravation to get to the Strip each day/night. I will stay on the Strip next time. Thanks for reading my review. Holly

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: annmike
Reviews.Content: We just got back we had a wonderful time. We stayed Oct.12 to 16 2003. Just like everyone said it is a great place. Large rooms King bed nice seating area. Yes the mattress is foam but it was comfortable. This place is clean and good service. The buffet was good but we didn't like any of the meat on both the breakfast and the dinner. They have alot of other choices, the chinese and pizza was good. They will cook up stir fry for you chicken or beef, the chicken was good. If you are looking for sugar free desserts this is the place. All the desserts are great. The small bus takes you to the stip in 10 minutes, a 15 minute wait. We will be back. We stayed in Las Vegas 15 times. This is a Great Place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Amunhotep
Reviews.Content: The Orleans is a good value for a Las Vegas property. It is NOT opulent, or ultra-luxurious, but it is clean, well appointed and comfortable. Our room was larger than most standard hotel rooms. It had a writing desk and chair, king bed, small sofa and plush chair and an enclosed TV and chest of drawers combo. The bathroom was very bright and clean, with tiled floor, bath/shower with gold-tone fixtures. The hotel has free valet parking, and self-park areas. The registration area is on the east side, not in the front along Tropicana blvd. Our check-in went smooth and we were in our room within 7 minutes. The thermostat for the airconditioner/heater is a bit strange, and my wife started the heater by mistake, causing dust on the heater coils to burn off, which set the smoke alarm off for a few seconds. We called the front desk and had a maintainance crew there within 4 minutes to check it out. The main pool is shaded most of the day the water was cool but to be expected in October, but there is a nice hot-tub area with strong jets. We seldom had to wait for an elevator, and the security staff was very friendly. In fact, all of the staff was helpful and friendly. Several resturants and bars, typical casino types. Although the theme of the property is New Orelans Mardi Gras, they do not stress it. Perhaps a stroling dixieland band might get it going better. The Garden Market Cafe offers late night/early morning breakfast specials Monday-Friday, and our $1.99 ham-steak and eggs was huge. The burgers at Terrible Mikes are also large and good. The shuttle to the Barbary Coast property is helpful if you want to visit some of the strip on the south end. All in all, we found the experience to be pleasant and an excellent value for Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as rated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews in Trip Advisor and noting that the Orleans was rated either No 1 or No 2 hotel in Las Vegas and the prices being reasonable, I booked this hotel for myself and two sisters as our headquarters for a SW Tour. We stayed there a total of 9 nights in October '03. The rooms were as advertised, very nice, large, with two Queens beds and a sofa and small sitting area. Bathroom was large and very adequate although not as luxurious as expected. Also the rooms did not smell of smoke and were very quiet, which we appreciated. But Number one in Las Vegas, no way.Our main complaint was the smoky casino, which was almost unbearable. The ventilation system must be very poor, as we were in many other hotels in the course of our stay and was never as aware of smoke as in the Orleans. This is definitely not a hotel for non-smokers. The restaurants were average and their theater was very nice as were the 16-18 movie theaters in the hotel. The carpets were rather dirty in many places. The pool area was nice and very underused. We noticed a couple actually smoking while seated in the spa, which otherwise was very nice. The exercise room and indoor spa was lovely and again underused. The staff were fairly helpful and pleasant, but again not what I expected for "no. 1 in Las Vegas". We also did not care for the difficulty of getting around without a car. Yes there is a shuttle, but only to their other properties, The Gold Coast and the Barbary Coast one on the strip, one off. We spent a lot of money on taxis. They have no shuttle to the airport as is available at most strip hotels. All in all I would not stay there again and would opt for a strip hotel - the price difference was made up in costs of getting around.I would recommend that you stop touting this as no 1. It is certainly not.

Reviews.Title: “Orleans if it were only on the strip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If this place was on the strip they could charge more for the rooms. stayed in room 1812 had a wonderful vie of the strip only ate in the cafe but very good for breakfast. Casino nice size and good table mins. Didn't get a chance to use the pool but was nice size for the property. Would definitely stay at the Orleans again.

Reviews.Title: “First time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our first time to Vegas. The Orleans room was very nice, clean and good sized. All staff was friendly. Buffet was ok, Big Als was quite good. Waited a while for supper at 8;30, but breakfast was super fast. My brothers family has been to Vegas many times, and were impressed. Would stay again. MGM was neat to watch the lions, Bellagio fountain at night was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Try the Spa! You'll Love It!!”
Reviews.Author: LtinVanLV
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Orleans Sept 1-4 partly using a "two free nights"coupon I had received on a previous visit. I regularly stay at this hotel and if you do, they give you some great deals and discounts. I am always surprised when I read negative reviews about this place. I suppose on any given day things can go wrong but they always seem to go well for me when I 'm there. I do admit that the staff seemed a little unprepared that week, I don't think they were expecting as much of a crowd as they got in the Buffet and the casino but they handled it gracefully. I still had my usual VERY clean , quiet room with an awesome pool view, nearly instantanious check -in, always an available elevator and great food. I can afford to stay elsewhere and choose not to because I like this place that much. That being said I enjoy a good value as much as anyone and one of the great values at this hotel is not being mentioned, their Spa Orleans. I have have had treatments here on two occasions and the therapists easily rival any I have had in the past at much more expensive facilities. The spa itself is quite attractive inside and the treatments are about one third of the price that they are in any of the other hotel spas in town. Try the Fiji Stone Therapy Massage and you will come out a new person. Don't forget to tip them well. As for those negative reviewers with the incidental bad experiences, I'm sorry you did not get to enjoy what the rest of us did. However, I suppose if you do not come back, that will just make more room for those of us that have written in to make this place #1 on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Applejax
